title: EY embraces Azure SQL Managed Instance and unlocks scalability and cost efficiency
executive_summary: Ernst & Young LLP (EY), a globally recognized professional services firm, stands at the forefront of delivering excellence in assurance, advisory, tax, and transaction advisory services. With a commitment to building a better working world, they help clients navigate today's complex business landscape with clarity and confidence.

title: DMK reduces IT administrative effort by 50% and optimizes operations with ITProCloud Hydra for Microsoft Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: With an annual turnover of 5.5 billion Euros, DMK Deutsches Milchkontor GmbH (DMK) is a leading player in the dairy industry and one of the largest suppliers to German food retailers. DMK wanted a comprehensive solution for managing Microsoft Azure Virtual Desktop to allow the company to focus on its core business of processing milk products of the highest quality. DMK chose ITProCloud GmbH, a Microsoft partner with expertise in building and deploying solutions on Microsoft Azure such as ITProCloud’s Hydra management software for Azure Virtual Desktop. By deploying Hydra, DMK significantly reduced administrative efforts by 50 percent and Azure costs by 20 percent.

title: NSW Ports shaves up to 80% off its invoice approval time using Dynamics 365
executive_summary: NSW Ports, a key player in Australia’s trade ecosystem, streamlined its finance operations by replacing its existing enterprise resource planning platform with Microsoft Dynamics 365. Leveraging the expertise of Microsoft partner Professional Advantage, NSW Ports transitioned to Dynamics 365 through an agile reimplementation strategy. This shift led to a significant reduction in invoice approval lead times for the organisation, boosting productivity and accuracy in financial transactions.

title: Gramedia turns the page with integrative technology in Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Gramedia began its journey in 1970 as a bookstore chain and is now the largest and most integrated retail and online bookstore in Indonesia. With more than 126 bookstores in 65 cities in 34 provinces and a workforce of more than 1,000—Gramedia promotes literacy, community, and education throughout the region. Gramedia is committed to providing superior customer service, which means meeting its customers wherever they are and creating community wherever it can, both online and in its bookstores.

title: Microsoft Teams lays the foundation for Globo content management and production
executive_summary: Using Microsoft Teams and Together Mode (Custom Scenes), Globo was able to leverage its internal communication with more users and video conferencing, in addition to its valuable tool that has been increasingly used by journalism, sports, and entertainment. Pursuing security and robustness, the platform continues to be improved but is already bringing interesting results to the company.

title: C&A implements Power BI and enhances data experience with BI self-service model
executive_summary: C&A, one of the largest retail networks in the world and with a strong presence in Brazil, relied on the support of partner company Iteris to build a BI system with three levels of execution and, thus, give autonomy for different areas to build their own reports—from the board to the store floor, with a modern and robust platform.

title: Deutsche Bahn’s community of citizen developers drives innovation at scale with Power Platform
executive_summary: Deutsche Bahn (DB) Group operates the largest rail infrastructure in Europe and provides both rail freight and passenger transport services. The company has found a way to accelerate innovation across the company—by empowering every employee with a premium Power Platform license to build low-code business applications. Their apps are saving time and reducing costs, with the potential to scale that impact across the world’s largest railway company.

title: PA Consulting saves hours a week with Copilot for Microsoft 365 and Copilot for Sales
executive_summary: As an early adopter of Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365 and Copilot for Sales, PA Consulting treated itself as “customer zero,” using the lessons it learned to support clients on their own AI journeys. Employees who used Microsoft Copilot saw immediate time-savings of three hours per week on average. But more importantly, PA Consulting wanted to know how that time could be repurposed. PA has since transformed its sales operations, making them more streamlined and unified—meaning that its people can invest more time on the activities that have the biggest impact for clients, and maximize the strategic value they provide.

title: Elderly healthcare nonprofit Joris Zorg guards against cyberattacks with Microsoft Defender
executive_summary: Dutch elder healthcare nonprofit Joris Zorg experienced a hack of an on-premise server in 2022. The attack accelerated its ongoing move to the cloud and led the organization to work with Microsoft partner Wortell to strengthen its security stance. Now, Wortell’s managed detection and response services with Microsoft Defender repel cyberattacks and protect personally identifiable information.
products: Microsoft Defender, Microsoft Entra

title: The Home Care Program in Panama helped more than 17,000 people with the power of Microsoft Power Automate
executive_summary: Thanks to Power Automate Desktop, the Home Care Program managed to serve nearly five times the projected number of COVID-19 patients, making an essential contribution to the fight against the pandemic in Panama.

title: Enhanced call quality, simpler system: University of Cyprus improves telephony with Microsoft Teams Phone
executive_summary: University of Cyprus struggled with poor audio quality, maintenance issues, and lack of collaboration features in its old telephony system.

title: City FM scales up its presence and transforms service with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The world’s top retail, grocery, and convenience store chains partner with City Facilities Management (City) for comprehensive, integrated facilities management, building and engineering, and sustainability solutions. City’s unique end-to-end self-performing model is rooted in tailored solutions to fit its partners’ plans for growth. City’s own growth necessitated a move away from its legacy on-premises enterprise resource planning (ERP) system and disconnected service solutions to Dynamics 365 Finance, Supply Chain Management, and Field Service to streamline workflows and optimize operations and service delivery in its US market.

title: Mantrac halves IT costs and enhances agility with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Mantrac faced rising costs, limited scalability, and inflexibility with its on-premises IT infrastructure. Their outdated disaster recovery setup further complicated operations, causing delays and increasing errors when transferring services between global data centers.

title: Lexmark makes lasting impressions with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Lexmark’s places a premium on customer engagement but its legacy solutions were disparate, making tracking customer journeys complex and inefficient.

title: How Hellmann Worldwide Logistics transformed its global operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Hellmann Worldwide Logistics (Hellmann) sought to replace its legacy ERP with a scalable solution that increases transparency, productivity, and efficiency.

title: Consulting firm speedily solves space issues with innovative workspace scheduling app, enhances its culture
executive_summary: Armanino faces the same gnarly office space issues that plague other large professional services companies: finding space for a mobile workforce without overcommitting and overspending on pricey building leases. What’s different is the way it solved those issues while also deepening the firm’s culture of cooperation and collaboration. An Armanino Power Apps expert and some committed testers created a simple but high-value solution with Microsoft Power Apps, flipping occupancy ratios right-side up. Most importantly to community-focused Armanino—its mobile workers love the new Workspace Scheduler app.

title: Volkswagen Financial Services transforms development practice, delivers more value with Azure Stack Hub
executive_summary: With 80 web applications powering several brands across about 10 countries, Volkswagen Financial Services manages a complex IT estate. To achieve its digital transformation goals, it needed to modernize its apps—and its development approach. By supporting its DevOps practices with Microsoft Azure Stack Hub, VW Financial Services AG combined cloud speed and scale with on-premises data privacy and compliance. Now it can deliver applications and services faster at lower cost and drive innovation with a modern DevOps platform. VW Financial Services migrated its first application to Azure in May 2020, with more applications to follow.

title: How Hellmann Worldwide Logistics transformed its global operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Hellmann Worldwide Logistics (Hellmann) sought to replace its legacy ERP with a scalable solution that increases transparency, productivity, and efficiency.

title: Surface, Microsoft 365 and Teams transform the way healthcare teams work
executive_summary: Cumbria, Northumberland, Tyne and Wear NHS Foundation Trust is one of the largest mental health and disability Trusts in England. It employs more than 7,000 staff, who provide services across an area totalling 4,800 square miles and a population of approximately 1.7 million.

title: Willis Towers Watson centralizes sales data, improves governance and predictability with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Insurance brokerage and advisory company Willis Towers Watson wanted to get greater strategic value from the client sales data dispersed across its large organization. It adopted Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales to centralize all engagement into one platform and Power BI to add powerful analytics capabilities. After a rapid, successful deployment, Willis Towers Watson achieved nearly 90 percent adoption in just six months. The company gained visibility into its data, increased actionable insights, and personalized its services, which has led to a significant boost in sales leads.

title: Nestlé innove dans ses stratégies de croissance grâce à Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Founded in Lausanne, Switzerland, in 1866, as the Anglo-Swiss Condensed Milk Company, today Nestlé is the world’s largest consumer packaged goods and retail multinational, employing more than 275,000 people. From originally providing milk and infant food products, the company now has more than 2,000 brands in 188 countries. Nestlé products include frozen and prepared foods, beverages, sweets, supplements, and pet foods.

title: Gjensidige builds on GitHub and Azure to put security front-and-center in new application platform
executive_summary: Gjensidige, the largest insurance company in Norway, must do all that it can to keep customer data secure. To achieve this, the company built on the combined capabilities of GitHub Enterprise and Microsoft Azure to deliver a modern ‘DevSecOps’ environment that puts security front-and-center at all times. Developer-first security tooling integrates seamlessly into existing development workflows, helping developers to write more secure code, embrace security best practices, and respond quickly to software supply chain vulnerabilities. All stakeholders can collaborate on security as a shared responsibility, enabled by policy automation and deep, real-time visibility into the company’s security posture.

title: Enabling Remote Learning During the Pandemic
executive_summary: Established in 2009, IGA is a Tunisia-based software company that specializes in insurance solutions. Its existing IT infrastructure was not giving the results and performance it was looking for, impacting its customers’ business. The company upgraded and modernized its solutions by moving its applications to the Azure cloud. With the switch to Microsoft, IGA ensured the scalability of applications, making it affordable for all. It also minimized downtime for its customers.

title: ADvTECH Digital Journey – The goal is uninterrupted learning
executive_summary: As we reflect over the last 2 years and the Covid-19 pandemic, it is surreal to see how far we have come and how resilient we have become. It is perhaps even stranger to suggest that the Covid-19 pandemic has become the catalyst to even better teacher and student engagement and innovation.

title: Finance House offers much needed support to small & medium sized businesses with cloud-based app
executive_summary: Many communities across the UAE lack access to affordable financial products and services. Finance House (FH) acts as an economic engine for these unserved or underserved communities, facilitating an environment for them to thrive. While smaller financial service companies often find it challenging to compete against mega financial corporations with large reach, Finance House is an exception. Driven by a goal to provide exceptional service to its customers, FH is on its way to provide services as advanced as those offered by larger financial institutions—competing in the same market space through quality service and affordable pricing. Its soon-to-launch fully digital financial services will provide apps for corporate and consumer banking clients on Microsoft Azure.

title: Grupo Bimbo accelerates its sustainability journey with Microsoft Cloud for Sustainability
executive_summary: Sustainability has always been an essential part of everyday business at Grupo Bimbo, the Mexico-based international producer of baked goods and snack foods. To help the company achieve its ambitious sustainability goals, Grupo Bimbo is deploying Microsoft Cloud for Sustainability, which helps businesses collect, track, and analyze all the strategic metrics of their sustainability strategy. Grupo Bimbo has a comprehensive strategy encompassing nutrition, social impact, waste, and water, and the company is beginning with tracking emissions in Canada, Mexico, and the United States. Grupo Bimbo is rolling out Microsoft Cloud for Sustainability to all its global operations, and the company has appreciated its ease of use and its ability to connect to multiple data sources, including external repositories and Internet of Things sensors, to automate data collection.

title: Mattress Firm partners with Microsoft to transform customer experiences
executive_summary: Mattress Firm, America’s largest specialty mattress retailer, wants to stay ahead in the rapidly changing retail industry. That means transforming their business – from their customers’ shopping experience all the way through to the warehouse and delivery management. Moving to the Microsoft Cloud helps Mattress Firm put experiences and data together to revolutionize their ability to match customers with the right mattress and sleep systems and quickly pivot to anticipate the industry's next challenge. Now customers have a scientific approach to sleep better which the company hopes will help its customers live longer, better lives.

title: Jotun modernizes key business apps to run on Azure
executive_summary: The Jotun Group is a global supplier of decorative paints and marine, protective, and powder coatings. As part of its strategy to migrate on-premises applications to the cloud, the company recently modernized nine key business apps to run in a platform as a service environment on Microsoft Azure. Jotun completed the project in less than a year with help from the Azure Migration and Modernization Program and development partner Infosys—from project kickoff and landing zone build-out through modernization and deployment of all nine apps. Today, those apps perform better, experience less downtime, and cost less to operate. Software releases have accelerated from two to three per year to every two to three weeks, and a single team now owns each application end to end—with deeper insights and new tools for optimizing application performance, security, and costs.

title: INTRALOT ignites industry-leading innovation with Azure employee upskilling initiative
executive_summary: With a global workforce of more than 2,000 employees, a global lottery solutions leader INTRALOT is transforming players’ gaming experiences with flexible, intelligent and innovative high-tech solutions. To support an organization-wide migration to Microsoft cloud, INTRALOT partnered with Microsoft to receive Azure training and certification to upskill its people. The learning program received an overwhelmingly positive response from employees, enabling INTRALOT to extract maximum value from its cloud technology. Technical employees were enthusiastically engaged and remained on the cutting edge of their fields.

title: Consumer Direct Care Network transforms medical claims with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Consumer Direct Care Network (CDCN) engaged Microsoft Consulting Services to rewrite CDCN’s existing Claim Processing System and move the system to the cloud. This was urgently necessary for CDCN to keep up with its exponentially increasing user base and support the increasing volume of transactions and people it serves. Turning to Microsoft Azure capabilities of scalability and flexibility, CDCN transformed its claims platform, which allowed it to expand annual claims processing capacity from 3 million items to over 20 million items—with optimized cost and performance.

title: Campari Group personalizes customer experiences and builds brand awareness with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Camparistas, the 4,000 passionate employees of Campari Group, share a common motto: toasting life together. Offering more than 50 premium and super premium spirits brands in 190 countries, the company honors tradition with a twist of innovation. Building exclusive, quality consumer relationships that last well beyond the first sip, the company accelerated its digital journey to rise to the challenge of portfolio expansion, industry fluctuations, and consumer consumption shifts.

title: Czech e-grocer meets expansion goals with Azure’s cloud technology
executive_summary: Košík is an e-grocery company currently serving the Czech and Bulgarian markets. Its mission is to feed people in a digital way. With a strategy focused on growth, Košík needed the right flexibility and readiness to scale up its operations, access new markets, and deal with a rapidly changing environment. Košík turned to Microsoft Azure, implementing a cloud-based strategy that allowed the company to save time and operational costs, all while meeting unexpected demand and further expanding its business.

title: Leading South African law firm embodies trusted advisor status with a modern security and data governance platform
executive_summary: Webber Wentzel provides legal services, expert advice, and representation to clients across Africa. To meet Protection of Personal Information Act (PoPIA) standards and uphold its mission to be transformative in its work while implementing actions with sustainable outcomes, the firm built a comprehensive information security and data governance platform. Webber Wentzel deployed the Microsoft 365 E5 security suite, Microsoft Purview Compliance Manager, Microsoft Purview Data Loss Prevention, Microsoft Sentinel, and Microsoft Secure Score to enhance visibility, implement real-time controls, and reinforce its award-winning position as a trusted advisor and coveted data compliance counselor.

title: Delhaize Serbia digitizes its customers’ in-store shopping experience with an app based on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Operating through more than 480 stores across the country, Delhaize Serbia is the largest retail chain in Serbia and a member of the international retail chain Ahold Delhaize. As a market leader, the company is strategically committed to being an innovator that always brings customers a modern shopping experience. With an omnichannel approach to business and a desire to provide customers with innovative benefits that match their personal shopping habits, Delhaize Serbia decided to develop a loyalty application called "My Maxi", based on Microsoft Azure.

title: Vodafone uses Azure DevOps to power agile transformation
executive_summary: “Your ability to respond, react, to stay relevant, to innovate and to compete comes down to your ability to release value to your customers as frequently as possible. That’s why Azure DevOps is such an important underpinning for business success and for cultural change,” says Ben Connolly, Global Head of Cloud Engineering & Head of Digital Engineering UK at Vodafone. “It really has revolutionised how we work.”

title: AG Insurance gets closer to its customers by modernizing on Azure Synapse Analytics
executive_summary: For nearly 200 years, AG Insurance has been providing a wide range of insurance products to its customers across Belgium. As insurance customers have become more digitally savvy, companies have started to capitalize on data to provide personalized products and reduce friction, for instance, during the claims process. As AG Insurance moved in the same direction, its on-premises solution became strained from the sheer volume of data it was processing. To revitalize its platform and offer more scalability and elasticity, the organization partnered with Microsoft and Hexaware to design an intelligent data platform that allows AG Insurance to utilize accurate and timely data to enhance customer service. AG Insurance now has the tools to effectively harness customer data and build solutions that provide an improved, personalized experience to keep it at the forefront of the insurance industry.

title: STOPWATCH leverages Azure, Visual Studio, and .NET Core to Deliver an Omni-Commerce Solution
executive_summary: Upon its founding, STOPWATCH needed a platform and toolset that would enable it to go cloud-native from day one—so that it could quickly and efficiently deliver a solution to help consumer packaged goods companies understand how their products are being sold across every channel, from every perspective, in real time. The company chose Microsoft Azure, .NET, and Visual Studio, giving it everything it needed: fully managed services that let developers stay focused on meeting customer needs instead of managing infrastructure; a programming framework optimized for harnessing the power of both Azure services and open source; and a toolkit for pulling all of the different pieces of its solution together as a highly collaborative team.

title: VeriPark transforms fintech through apps built on Microsoft Cloud for Financial Services
executive_summary: VeriPark is a global solutions provider enabling financial institutions to become digital leaders with its Intelligent Customer Experience suite. With significant changes happening in banking, capital markets, and insurance, the way people bank has changed massively. VeriPark worked with Microsoft Azure to deploy solutions in Power Platform that enable the company to deliver business applications that help its clients meet the changes in the industry.

title: Confused.com uses Microsoft Azure to halve analytics lead times
executive_summary: Confused.com is the UK’s longest running comparison service. With a team of 300, it serves a customer base of 15 million UK consumers. To stay ahead in a competitive marketplace, Confused.com chose to update its infrastructure by moving to Microsoft Azure and using Azure AI. Confused.com has improved marketing ROI by 10 percent, reduced the analytics lead time by 50 percent and is opening up new B2B channels to deliver its services as a service.

title: Al-Futtaim Group gears up for hyper-personalized customer experiences with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Al-Futtaim Group is a leading family-owned business conglomerate operating across the regional automotive, financial services, real estate, retail, and health markets, representing over 200 brands and services to customers across Asia and Africa. The company has been updating its infrastructure and migrating to the cloud in the last four years. Himanshu Shrivastava, Al-Futtaim Group’s Chief Technology Officer, believes this will enable the company to leverage data analytics across all its business lines, further fulfilling its mission of enriching people’s lives through quality services.

title: Signly builds with Microsoft Azure for a more inclusive future in tech innovation
executive_summary: Signly is a technology-driven startup that aims to address communication barriers faced by the Deaf community. Despite ongoing efforts to enhance accessibility, the Deaf community continues to grapple with significant challenges. Signly recognises the unique nature of sign language, asserting that it deserves recognition and promotion Signly recognizes the distinctive nature of sign language, asserting it deserves both acknowledgment and to be part of the mainstream. To address this critical need, Signly is creating revolutionary technology that assists hearing individuals in communicating with sign language users.

title: Accenture encourages a culture of innovation, empowering citizen developers with Power Platform
executive_summary: Accenture is a global professional services and consulting agency helping customers across 40 industries in more than 120 countries. Like many organizations, it had more demand than could be met by central IT, so Accenture decided to democratize and evangelize a low-code platform to empower citizen developers to solve their own problems. Recognizing the value that Power Platform had to offer, Accenture has continued to grow its Center of Excellence, and is offering all five Microsoft Power Platform products at scale. Now, Accenture sees significant savings each year with its new model, has more than 50k newly skilled citizen developers, and has reduced IT demand for short-term applications by 30 percent, giving professional developers the ability to focus on more complex projects.

title: MTN South Africa harnesses Microsoft Power Platform to slash fraud risk
executive_summary: Launched in 1994, MTN South Africa is a subsidiary of MTN Group, a leading emerging market operator with a clear vision to lead the delivery of a bold new digital world to our customers. We are inspired by our belief that everyone deserves the benefits of a modern connected life. The MTN Group is listed on the JSE Securities Exchange in South Africa under the share code ‘MTN’. Our strategy, Ambition 2025, is anchored on building the largest and most valuable platform business, with a clear focus on Africa. Visit www.mtn.com or www.mtn.co.za for more information.

title: Sidra Medicine and its digital transformation journey with the cloud
executive_summary: Sidra Medicine, a research and medical facility in Qatar, provides specialist healthcare services for women and children. Its research team built an Azure-powered centralized data warehouse to enable easier cross-border research collaboration and achieve its digital transformation goals. With world-class data privacy and security standards, the healthcare facility empowered medical and research professionals to freely and securely exchange data, analyze results, and compare findings.

title: Land O’Lakes uses Azure Data Manager for Agriculture to support more efficient, sustainable farming
executive_summary: Land O’Lakes is one of the largest farmer-owned cooperatives and touches half the harvested acres in the United States.  Farmers are integral to all its businesses including WinField United crop inputs and insights, Animal Nutrition, Dairy Foods and Truterra.  Land O’Lakes turned to Azure Data Manager for Agriculture to provide growers with data-driven insights that make them more efficient, profitable, and sustainable in their practices.

title: TKC uses Windows 11 and Dynabook to help protect PCs from cyber-attacks
executive_summary: TKC has developed specialized information systems and services dedicated to accounting firms and local governments. These systems are required to adapt quickly to changes and to have high social responsibility standards. Together, Windows 11 and Dynabook help protect PCs from cyber-attacks by detecting and recovering attacks to the BIOS and preventing the spread of infection. These security advancements enable TKC to provide support through information and communication technology (or “ICT”), making broad contributions to the development of the Japanese economy and local communities.

title: The Caribbean Development Bank built a new platform uniting their client processes in a secure and modern way with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: With the support of Microsoft Partner COREFIN and their solution for Lending and Banking, the CDB faced a digital transformation demanded by a broad strategic decision. With a full Microsoft stack, the Bank was able to fully automate processes, reduce costs, have a fully integrated platform, and perform real time data analysis.

title: Aker BP transforms its data and operations with Microsoft Azure Data Manager for Energy
executive_summary: One of the largest independent energy companies in Europe, Aker BP is engaged in the exploration, field development, and production of oil and gas on the Norwegian continental shelf. As an energy industry leader, the company places operational excellence at the core of all its endeavors, recognizing that a robust operational framework lays the foundation for growth and empowers employees to do their best work. To improve processes and develop digital tools, Aker BP chose to work with Microsoft to reach the full potential of its data to meet its operational excellence goals, facilitate informed decision-making, and experience transformative impact. In harnessing the power of Azure Data Manager for Energy to analyze vast amounts of energy-related datasets, applications, and cloud services, Aker BP will gain valuable business insights to increase operational efficiency and reduce data evaluation time.

title: One NZ democratizes data access, enabling instant customer support with Microsoft Fabric Real-Time Analytics
executive_summary: New Zealand’s largest mobile carrier, One NZ, adheres to its central value—customers. To give nearly 1,000 users a real-time, tailored view of customer data, it upgraded to Microsoft Fabric Real-Time Analytics (RTA) within less than two weeks. The new platform elevated One NZ’s customer service and added depth to its analytics, transforming raw data into actionable insights. Empowered teams can now make accurate, data-driven decisions and respond to customer inquiries nearly twice as fast as before.

title: Kronos and Microsoft Azure deliver a holistic sporting software experience
executive_summary: Every sporting event depends on technology to make it run smoothly. However, the technology used in some international sporting events is old-fashioned and requires an upgrade and more user-centric features. Event delivery entities have been looking for a system that could offer data quality and maintenance services to integrate custom cloud services with their chosen technologies and tools. Kronos, a software company and supplier of events management technology, built a cloud-based platform to deliver successful events while being able to meet the specific requirements of its customers and ever evolving technological demands in the sports world.

title: Joos uses Copilot for Microsoft 365 to grow its brand with worldwide collaboration
executive_summary: Joos, a supplier of mobile charging stations, is expanding beyond the UK and must communicate and collaborate efficiently across time zones. Using Copilot for Microsoft 365, Joos has streamlined meetings, optimized presentations, and improved communication. Joos plans to use Copilot for Microsoft 365 as it expands in North America and Europe.

title: BDO unifies tax and accounting services with Dynamics 365 Project Operations and Copilot
executive_summary: BDO USA has ignited a revolution in project management with its groundbreaking BDO Tax UserVerse on Microsoft Dynamics 365, uniting data and streamlining processes to fuel unparalleled efficiency. This game-changing platform raises the bar for the accounting industry by integrating service lines, maximizing scalability, and refining the client service experience. With the synergy of Microsoft Copilot and SharePoint, BDO unlocks a world of real-time insights and cohesive data management, propelling productivity and fostering innovation. The system’s AI and analytics fortify BDO’s market prominence.

title: Lumen Technologies accelerates dev productivity, sees financial gains with GitHub Copilot, Azure DevOps, and Visual Studio
executive_summary: For Lumen Technologies, customer demands catalyzed a need to streamline developer workflows, accelerate problem solving and defect management, and increase developer productivity to build customized solutions quickly and seamlessly. Working with Microsoft, Lumen sponsored a full developer population trial program for GitHub Copilot at its location in Bangalore, India, with nearly 600 engineers. Lumen saw that the developers gained efficiency, flexibility, and security while delivering great code faster. The success of the India pilot prompted Lumen to globally scale the solution to all of its 2,400 engineers. In addition to significant productivity gains, Copilot is supporting greater democratization of technology across Lumen and supporting potential financial benefits between $95 million and $300 million.

title: Libertad Soluciones de Vida enables new market spheres by digitizing its operations with Dynamics 365 and Azure Synapse Analytics
executive_summary: By delineating a strategic technology plan that consisted of moving its customer database to Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Azure Synapse Analytics, assembling processes and migrating to Microsoft Azure, Sociedad Financiera Popular was able to reach users throughout Mexico—including those who were abroad. Credit services that previously took 48 hours can now be provided in 30 minutes.

title: One of the world’s largest data teams, Microsoft IDEAS uses Fabric to usher in new era of AI
executive_summary: In today’s era of AI, brands that don’t invest in cloud and data infrastructures designed to support robust analytics may hinder their innovation and growth. Microsoft itself took action to fortify its future growth and innovation.

title: Localiza saves up to 19 hours of work with Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: Localiza needed to increase employee productivity and optimize repetitive manual tasks.

title: Cemig reduced human error rates from 20% to 1.82% using Power Platform
executive_summary: Cemig was looking for solutions to improve efficiency and productivity, facing challenges with manual processes.

title: IU personalizes learning with Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: IU International University of Applied Sciences faced the challenge of balancing personalized education with outdated technology, budget constraints, and the need to ensure AI use complied with strict regulations like GDPR.

title: J.D. Irving, Limited’s Kent Building Supplies constructs modern retail experiences with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Kent Building Supplies (Kent) faced issues with an outdated homegrown system, including maintenance risks, an antiquated POS, manual processes, and limited data usability. Kent wanted to transform digitally, modernize its technology, improve customer experience, and streamline business processes.

title: Brisa upskills employees with Power Automate, unlocking creativity and time savings
executive_summary: Brisa wanted to accelerate business outcomes and streamline processes by ensuring that employees have the skills they need to contribute meaningfully to the company’s ongoing history of innovation.

title: BarmeniaGothaer migrates 200 billion data records to the cloud with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: With rapid changes in the technology landscape and the need to meet ever-changing security and compliance requirements, BarmeniaGothaer wanted to migrate its IT infrastructure to the cloud.

title: Chipotle builds new website with .NET Core, Visual Studio Code, and Azure
executive_summary: Chipotle Mexican Grill is a longtime leader and innovator in the food industry. The company is committed to cultivating a better world by serving responsibly sourced, classically cooked, real food with wholesome ingredients—and without artificial colors, flavors, or preservatives. As of September 30, 2019, Chipotle had more than 2,500 restaurants in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, France, and Germany, all of which are company owned and operated.

title: Online retailer uses cloud database to deliver world-class shopping experiences
executive_summary: London-based ASOS is an online fashion retailer on a mission to be the world’s number-one fashion destination for twentysomethings. To support its digital offering, ASOS uses Microsoft Azure Cosmos DB, a scalable, managed database that makes possible such innovations as real-time product recommendations and instant order updates for 15.4 million customers.

title: Grant Thornton looks to the AI-powered capabilities of Dynamics 365 Sales Insights to close new opportunities faster and win more deals
executive_summary: To best serve its clients, Grant Thornton must tie its extensive knowledge of macro-level economic and industry trends to the micro-level business needs, motivations, and challenges faced by individual executives within its client base. The assurance, tax, and advisory firm does this by using Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales, Microsoft Azure, and LinkedIn Sales Navigator to “connect the macro with the micro” and deliver that information quickly and accurately to geographically distributed team members. Now Grant Thornton is beginning to use AI-powered Dynamics 365 Sales Insights to help take things to the next level. With it, team members can continuously analyze the data they already have to understand the health of client relationships and where new opportunities may lie, take actions based on those insights, close new opportunities faster, and win more deals.

title: BaptistCare supports aging Australians and tackles workforce shortages through Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: BaptistCare supports aging Australians as well as other vulnerable people in difficult circumstances, but the nonprofit anticipates that workforce shortages will make it more difficult to hire employees. BaptistCare has adopted Microsoft 365 Copilot to maximize efficiencies and empower staff. The AI solution is helping the nonprofit save time and focus on spending time with clients and residents, securely.

title: Four Agency innovates with Microsoft 365 Copilot to deliver better work faster
executive_summary: Four Agency is an independent media, marketing, and communications agency with hubs in the UK and UAE offering a full spectrum of marketing services.

title: Avanade equips 10,000 employees with Microsoft Fabric skills to help customers become AI-driven and future-ready
executive_summary: Avanade aimed to improve employee analytics and reporting skills. It sought to enhance strategic decision making and strengthen data security and governance. It saw an opportunity to better support customer adoption of AI technologies.

title: Digital innovation helps to save lives
executive_summary: Alder Hey Children’s Hospital is one of Europe’s biggest and busiest children’s hospitals. Every year, it cares for over 330,000 children, young people and their families for everything from common illnesses to highly complex and specialist conditions.

title: Oppimisen ja hyvinvoinnin tukeminen Helsingin kaupungissa datan ja tekoälyn avulla
executive_summary: “In Finland, we want every child to reach their full potential,” says Pasi Silander, Head of ICT Development Programs in the City of Helsinki Education Division. “Finland isn’t a country rich in oil or other natural resources, so we have to focus on human capital by building knowledge capital and providing excellent learning possibilities for every student.”

title: Hisar Schools Include Artificial Intelligence in Education with Microsoft!
executive_summary: Hisar Schools, which has been raising researchers, self-confident and high-aware individuals for 25 years, reflects its modern and future-oriented vision to all its students.

title: Dinçer Lojistik provide uninterrupted, high-quality, fast logistic services through a fully integrated infrastructure & application platform
executive_summary: Dinçer Lojistik provides its customers with a timely, error-free, and excellent service in domestic distribution services with 8000 vehicles registered in its system, 130 self-owned fleet, 54,500 voyages per year and 25,000 call points. They adopted a service platform that can be accessed from anywhere with smart systems, mobility, and reporting structures. Microsoft Azure, Microsoft Office 365, Dynamics 365 CRM, and PowerBI contributed to Dinçer Lojistik success allowing better collaboration and boosting productivity. Looking to the future, the company is planning to adopt Microsoft Azure globally, not only in Türkiye. Dinçer Lojistik , founded in 2003, provides contract logistics services to leading companies in the Mineral Oil, Packaging, Paper, Industrial Product, and Paint & Chemistry sectors. Dinçer Lojistik, with its vehicle fleet and expert staff in accordance with ADR standards, offers its customers a safe service at international standards in the transportation of packaged chemicals. It offers storage and value-added services as well as distribution services to its customers and plays an active role in all processes from the raw material procurement stage to the delivery of the product to the final consumer. Dinçer Lojistik provides its customers with a timely, error-free, and excellent service in domestic distribution services with 8000 vehicles registered in its system, 130 self-owned fleet, 54,500 voyages per year and 25,000 call points. Dinçer Lojistik provides storage and distribution services in accordance with the needs of its customers in a strategically designed 70,000 m2 storage area, including 1 central and 8 regional warehouses

title: The knowledge from 1997 to the present goes to the cloud with the International Payment solution
executive_summary: Meet DePauli Systems, brought to life by e-commerce pioneer DePauli AG, founded by Renata DePauli.

title: Colin’s till application scores a modernization story in retail digitalization
executive_summary: Colin's, part of Eroğlu Holding, is a Jean-focused fashion retailer operating at 600 points of sale in 38 countries. A prominent name in business since its establishment in 1983, it has proved itself as a popular brand: In Russia, where it has 190 stores, one of every two jeans sold has Colin’s tag on it. Colin's long-established cooperation with Microsoft is going to new heights recently with the onboarding of a pioneering project set off in 2021. Have a look at the specifics of this one-of-a-kind thinking and explore what Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)`s centralized and scalable solutions can offer for fashion retail going forward.

title: Fannie Mae builds productivity and data safety with Microsoft security and data protection solutions
executive_summary: Fannie Mae is a leading source of mortgage financing in all markets and at all times, making sustainable homeownership and workforce rental housing a reality for millions of people. And Fannie Mae relies on data. It needed a solution that both helps protect data and creates efficiencies for the data scientists who must analyze vast troves of complex data. It turned to Microsoft Security solutions, underwriting data transfer with Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps. It uses Microsoft Purview Data Loss Prevention to prevent sensitive data exfiltration while also lifting effectiveness for its IT teams and data scientists.

title: Magicrete gains a competitive edge by optimizing operations across departments using Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: Magicrete Building Solutions (Magicrete) is India's frontline manufacturer of lightweight concrete (AAC) blocks. The organization was founded in 2008 with the vision of helping build better, faster and cheaper homes through innovative construction technologies. It provides a wide range of construction solutions including AAC wall panels, construction chemicals and precast solutions. Over the last decade, Magicrete’s products have been used to build over half a million homes.

title: Storebrand ASA transforms asset management with unified, cloud-based identity governance
executive_summary: Storebrand is a Nordic financial group, delivering increased security and financial wellness for people and companies. Storebrand has about 40.000 corporate customers, 2 million individual customers and manages NOK 1.009 billion. As Storebrand’s cloud footprint expanded, it needed to improve access to cloud resources with adequate controls and monitoring without affecting productivity. And because of the inherent complexity of its hyperconnected digital workspace, managing multiple user access rights as various applications enter its environment was a challenge. It deployed Microsoft Azure Active Directory Identity Governance to enable identity and access management capabilities that also enhanced productivity. As a result, the company reduced the identity and access auditing cycle from months to days for the currently onboarded applications and created more user-friendly self-service access reviews and entitlement management capabilities with cloud-based applications.

title: Golden State Foods modernizes manufacturing and operations with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: A core line of business for food industry leader Golden State Foods (GSF) is the production of liquid products like sauces, dressings, and condiments. GSF needed to modernize a 25-year-old legacy ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) system that ran the Liquid Products division at two existing plants and set it up for a new plant to manage the business across the division locations seamlessly. To create a common modern platform with shared data, centralized reporting, and standardized processes GSF turned to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management.

title: Sutherland builds a data-driven culture with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Sutherland is an experience-led digital transformation company. Its mission is to deliver exceptionally designed and engineered experiences for customers and employees. Their proprietary, AI-based products and platforms are built using robust IP and automation. They are a team of global professionals, operationally effective, culturally meshed, and committed to their clients and to one another; they call it One Sutherland.

title: TMI Systems’ Verto 365 harnesses the power of the commercial marketplace to scale and reach new markets
executive_summary: Verto 365 is a collaborative workplace management solution from TMI Systems. This nimble UK-based company of 20 is using the Microsoft commercial marketplace and ISV Success to make huge strides in expanding transactable offers, increasing scalability, and reaching new geographies. By taking advantage of specific ISV Success benefits and working closely with Bytes, a UK-based cloud service provider, the team behind Verto 365 has accelerated its Microsoft Teams integration and time to market.

title: Arkas Holding achieves 99.58% carbon savings by migrating to Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Arkas Holding, which carries out end-to-end logistics with 61 companies, 59 offices and 7300 employees in 23 countries, puts sustainability at the center of its operational and technological infrastructure investments. By migrating to the Microsoft Azure Cloud in 2018, Arkas Holding achieved 99.58% carbon savings, with 62% coming from operational, equipment, and datacenter infrastructure efficiencies, and 38% from renewable energy purchases.

title: Microsoft Project helps Danish skylight manufacturer unify data systems and remote employees while improving processes
executive_summary: Roof window and skylight innovator VELUX was seeking a project portfolio management solution that would unify company data, create efficiencies, provide a robust yet easy-to-use interface, and allow for scalability. After careful consideration, the company selected Microsoft Project. Today, user satisfaction has risen dramatically—survey respondents report being satisfied and highly satisfied with the usability of the new system—and time to market has improved. VELUX has therefore decided on Project as the standard enterprise solution for PPM company-wide.

title: Blockchain innovator Fireblocks successfully processes more than $4 trillion in digital assets with Azure confidential computing
executive_summary: Blockchain infrastructure provider Fireblocks wanted to create a proprietary ecosystem to remove the complexity of working with digital assets and cryptocurrencies and provide a higher level of security than ever achieved. Using Microsoft Azure confidential computing and Intel® Software Guard Extensions, the company collaborated with Microsoft to develop its innovative technology launched in 2018. Fireblocks has since helped redefine the digital assets industry, processing more than $4 trillion in assets while achieving the highest international security certifications and creating new opportunities on the blockchain for organizations of all types.

title: Blockchain innovator Fireblocks successfully processes more than $4 trillion in digital assets with Azure confidential computing
executive_summary: Blockchain infrastructure provider Fireblocks wanted to create a proprietary ecosystem to remove the complexity of working with digital assets and cryptocurrencies and provide a higher level of security than ever achieved. Using Microsoft Azure confidential computing and Intel® Software Guard Extensions, the company collaborated with Microsoft to develop its innovative technology launched in 2018. Fireblocks has since helped redefine the digital assets industry, processing more than $4 trillion in assets while achieving the highest international security certifications and creating new opportunities on the blockchain for organizations of all types.

title: Pangaea Data builds novel AI with Azure to foster collaboration and improve patient outcomes while saving UK NHS £1 billion
executive_summary: Pangaea Data offers a product platform that combines artificial intelligence (AI) and medical guidelines to characterize patients across 7,000 hard-to-diagnose conditions. The platform mimics the manual review process used by clinicians within the context of the whole patient record—not just symptoms and keywords—without transacting patient data. This empowers clinicians in the pharmaceutical and healthcare industries to find and connect to more undiagnosed, misdiagnosed, and miscoded patients across hard-to-diagnose conditions for monitoring, screening, therapies, and trials. Using this approach improves patient outcomes in a financially sustainable, scalable, and privacy-preserving manner, fostering mutually beneficial collaborations between both industries.
products: Azure, Azure Marketplace, Azure Resource Manager, Azure Virtual Network

title: De Heus elevates animal feed quality and streamlines operations with Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations
executive_summary: For over a century, De Heus, a global animal feed producer, has been at the forefront of sustainable and healthy animal nutrition. Operating more than 90 factories worldwide came with its own set of challenges: fragmented enterprise resource planning systems and a lack of standardization. The solution? A shift to Microsoft Azure, Dynamics 365 Finance, and Dynamic 365 Operations, which allowed the company to collect and analyze data in real time. The move drove informed decisions and better operational control to truly revamp customer experience. With Power BI, the company can even share data and collaborate with external stakeholders like universities and genetics providers to improve the efficiency of main meat production processes.

title: Marlo Farma makes pet care and veterinary pharmaceuticals distribution a walk in the park with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: For three decades, Marlo Farma, Serbia's top distributor of pet food and veterinary pharmaceuticals, has been innovating and growing. But its previous ERP system struggled to keep pace, causing purchase inaccuracies and decreasing customer satisfaction. Working with Microsoft partner GoPro, Marlo Farma migrated to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central. The result: a 30 percent rise in logistics and warehouse efficiency, real-time insights supporting decision-making, and most importantly, happier customers and healthier pets.

title: Endo optimizes technology adoption and innovation with Microsoft 365 and “Digital Ask Me Anything” program
executive_summary: Specialty pharmaceutical company Endo is using education sessions on Microsoft technology to empower its team members and modernize work practices. A longtime Microsoft customer, Endo wanted to use Microsoft 365 capabilities to streamline business processes and improve collaboration across departments. In 2023, Endo’s IT department began a series of open training sessions for all its team members, including its senior executives, to discover more productive ways to accomplish tasks. About 75% of Endo’s office-based workforce participated in these sessions, gaining new skills and confidence in their technical acumen, fostering a culture of experimentation, and laying the foundation for ongoing innovation.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive for Business, SharePoint

title: How Dynamics 365 supports Wilo’s path to become the solution leader for a smart and resource efficient world
executive_summary: The Wilo Group (Wilo) is one of the world’s leading premium suppliers of pumps and pump systems for building services, water management, and industry. More than 9,000 Wilo employees in 90 offices create, deliver, and support innovative, smart, eco-friendly products and services to move water intelligently. From water heating and cooling to complex distribution and critical wastewater treatment solutions, Wilo has supplied the world with high-quality, hard-working systems since 1872.

title: Xyngular saves hours by automating with Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: N/A
products: Dynamics 365 Business Central, Excel

title: Peace Parks Foundation rebuilds park ecosystems and technology environments with Azure
executive_summary: In its efforts to support the preservation and enhancement of protected areas and ecosystems in partnership with local authorities and communities, Peace Parks Foundation uses technology to overcome unique challenges and achieve vital conservation goals. It wanted to make its technology environment more current and comprehensive to best support field and office staff.

title: Venchi transforms the shopper journey with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Venchi expanded rapidly with the support of Microsoft Dynamics 365. To continue to share Italian allegria (joy) with customers worldwide, Venchi needed to build a personalized omnichannel retail program.

title: PIMCO boosts client service with an AI-powered search platform built on Azure AI
executive_summary: The client-facing teams at PIMCO serve hundreds of thousands of clients around the world, all of whom need accurate, up-to-date information on the products they hold. To boost the client experience, PIMCO wanted to help its associates spend less time aggregating data and more time engaging with clients.
products: Azure OpenAI Service, SharePoint, Azure AI Search, Azure AI Document Intelligence, Azure Logic Apps

title: NBA transforms basketball fandom with Azure OpenAI Service giving game insights
executive_summary: Focused on its fans, the NBA began exploring new technologies to enhance the fan experience, wanting to harness data to provide insights behind all the great moments in every game.
products: Azure OpenAI Service

title: Stantec utilise Azure pour créer une plateforme d’innovation numérique ayant une réelle incidence
executive_summary: Stantec is a global leader in sustainable design and engineering with an impressive track record of success in large-scale infrastructure and facilities projects. Supplementing its expertise in real-world projects, the company is charting an innovative path into the future, focusing on digital transformation, technology services, and data built on Microsoft Azure.

title: Nagel-Group embraces a data-driven culture with Microsoft Data, Analytics, and AI solutions
executive_summary: Nagel-Group is one of the leading food logistics companies in Europe. With a unique network, the company creates competitive advantages for its customers, from reliable transport planning to innovative supply chain services in complex warehouse solutions. With many years of experience and innovative thinking, the company of 11,500 employees manages 7,000 trucks, 130 locations, 30 destination countries, and 100,000 shipments daily.

title: Marks & Spencer enhances its customer loyalty program with Azure Machine Learning
executive_summary: Marks & Spencer is a leading British retailer bringing high-quality food, clothing, and homeware to millions of customers around the world at great value. With 959 stores across the UK and 100+ websites serving customers in the UK and abroad, the company generates and is trusted with a vast amount of data. Its customer loyalty program, Sparks, has more than 17 million members in the UK and Ireland. Marks & Spencer uses machine learning and data science workloads to gain customer insights and take actions to build brand loyalty, like recommending products based on past purchases, sending loyalty emails to rewards members, and creating targeted campaigns. The previous solution for data science workloads relied on many manual processes, and Marks & Spencer wanted a faster, less labor-intensive way to get models into production. The company turned to Azure MLOps v2 Accelerator to speed up development and deployment time, reduce manual processes, and improve the continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) process. This also helped reduce errors and failures in machine learning model production that will ultimately lead to better customer experiences.
products: Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Machine Learning

title: INSPIRE Environmental uses Azure AI to improve efficiency and streamline data analysis to meet the pace of offshore wind development
executive_summary: INSPIRE Environmental (INSPIRE), a Venterra Group company and team of marine scientists focused on seafloor health, used Microsoft Azure solutions to streamline the analysis of complex ocean data. INSPIRE, which collects large volumes of data to help energy companies and government agencies understand the potential for their projects to impact seafloor health, was increasingly challenged in processing and analyzing the data. With exponential growth in offshore wind and other projects affecting undersea environments, INSPIRE created a solution allowing it to analyze and interpret seafloor images more quickly and efficiently. INSPIRE used AI for image analysis and improved business by lowering costs and reducing turnaround times for clients.

title: Commerce.AI delivers up to 50 percent increases in productivity with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Commerce.AI started looking into the power of AI data insights in 2018. In the last two years, the software company’s solutions have exploded in utility, in no small part due to its adoption of Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service and Azure Cognitive Services. Layering its own technology on top of these, Commerce.AI unearths new kinds of customer feedback from unstructured video, audio, and photographic data. The company’s technology has already begun driving 30 to 50 percent increases in productivity for its customers, with even greater benefits yet to come.
products: Azure AI Services, Azure Operator Call Protection

title: LALIGA delivers next-generation fan experiences by reimagining data and AI at scale
executive_summary: As one of the world’s largest sports leagues, LALIGA is a familiar name to soccer enthusiasts. To meet the ever-evolving demands of a content-driven entertainment enterprise, LALIGA puts fans first when developing new initiatives. In support of its over 2.8 billion soccer fans worldwide and more than 200 million followers in social media, LALIGA set strategic goals to continually evolve its digital ecosystem, creating an infrastructure to support the organization's growth. LALIGA’s partnership and move to Azure has transformed fan engagement, driven revenue growth, and created new opportunities for sports clubs, leagues, and federations.
products: Azure, Azure AI and Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, Azure Machine Learning, Power BI

title: Lexmark digitally transforms its service organization and creates new IoT and cloud-powered offerings with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Lexmark, a global provider of printing and imaging solutions, created new IoT offerings that brought its enterprise capabilities to new small and medium-sized business customers with Microsoft Azure services. These same services powered Lexmark’s own digital transformation, driving substantial customer experience improvements, new predictive service capabilities, and support center efficiency. The company wanted to integrate all data repositories and digital workflows into one cloud-based system encompassing the entire business. The solution created a true 360-degree view of customers and facilitates real-time data analysis for immediate decision-making, transparency, and long-term success for customers, partners, and Lexmark.

title: Pearson empowers language students to learn faster in a natural way with Azure AI capabilities
executive_summary: Pearson helps people around the globe learn foreign languages so that they can advance in academics and careers. When primary school students learn English, they often need more practice and feedback from teachers and parents than they can get. Pearson worked closely with Microsoft to help address this need, providing input on Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services capabilities in development such as pronunciation assessment. Pearson then added multiple AI-based services to its Longman Welcome to English program, offering interactive instruction for students, support for teachers, affordability for parents, and a digital learning option during COVID-19.

title: Telecom operator A1 Hrvatska builds sustainable work culture with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: A1 Hrvatska, one of the leading telecom operators in Croatia, is determined to streamline its work processes and services through digital solutions. The company built no-code apps using Microsoft Power Platform solutions and is exploring Azure Machine Learning capabilities for employees across the company to save time with automation and gain greater process visibility. It reduced the time needed to manage employee onboarding by 85 percent, and helped the IT support team save more than 70 hours per month in the ticket assignment process.
products: Power Apps, Power BI, Azure Machine Learning

title: Old Mutual Applied Intelligence team led with technology to achieve the ultimate customer experience
executive_summary: Old Mutual is a leading African financial services group with a comprehensive range of investment capabilities. They are the industry leader in retirement fund solutions, investments, asset management, group risk benefits, insurance, and multi-fund management. The best way to describe Old Mutual is to say it is a 177-year-old business that operates like a 24-month-old start-up. This approach has been the catalyst to it being an increasingly relevant financial partner to customers.

title: Powering Speech-to-Text AI that iterates at the speed of business
executive_summary: Helping quality content reach the linguistically diverse global market is a challenge that Vitra.ai decided to solve using AI. Co-founder Satvik Jagannath saw that businesses often had great content—videos, images, podcasts, and text—but what they needed was more reach, a way to break into global markets, expand their presence and increase their revenue using content they already had, instead of reinventing the wheel.

title: Wichita Public Schools personalized learning for students using Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: Wichita Public Schools does not shy away from change. The school district frequently embraces technologies that it deems beneficial to the education of its nearly 50,000 students and to the working lives of its 5,600 teachers and administrators. Because no two students learn in precisely the same way, Wichita Public Schools started looking into the many ways Microsoft Copilot with data protection can help educators bring a greater diversity of tailored learning experiences into the classroom.

title: DICK’S Sporting Goods creates an omnichannel athlete experience using Azure Arc and AKS
executive_summary: DICK’S Sporting Goods set out to create even more consistency across its 850 stores and its online retail experience by connecting with its athletes, which is what it calls its customers, in more personalized ways. The DICK’S technology team envisioned creating a “one store” technology strategy that would give the ability to write, deploy, manage, and monitor its own software across all locations nationwide—and reflect those same experiences through its eCommerce site. DICK’S needed a new level of modularity, integration, and simplicity to seamlessly connect its public cloud environment with its computing systems at the edge.

title: Stantec utilise Azure pour créer une plateforme d’innovation numérique ayant une réelle incidence
executive_summary: Stantec is a global leader in sustainable design and engineering with an impressive track record of success in large-scale infrastructure and facilities projects.
