title: The University of South Florida drives innovation and acceleration with Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: The University of South Florida (USF), known for fostering innovation and student success, recognized the potential of AI to transform its academic and operational efficiency but faced challenges in its adoption across its campuses. This challenge underscored the need for a strategic approach that would not only address uncertainties but also foster an environment of innovation.

title: Canary Speech analyzes conversational speech in near real time, innovating healthcare with Azure
executive_summary: N/A
products: Azure, Azure AI Services, Azure AI Speech, Azure Application Gateway, Azure Front Door, Azure Web Application Firewall, Microsoft Fabric, Microsoft Sentinel, Microsoft Defender, Microsoft Teams

title: Cassidy and Azure OpenAI Service: Making AI simple for all
executive_summary: N/A

title: KMS Lighthouse brings AI-powered knowledge management solution to Azure Marketplace, gains $1M in new business
executive_summary: KMS Lighthouse helps companies retrieve and share enterprise knowledge. Always seeking innovation, it aimed to enhance its knowledge management platform to provide more efficient content creation and advanced AI capabilities for its global clientele across various industries.

title: Modern workplace for USM: the successful switchover while employees worked from home
executive_summary: Migrating an international company to the cloud and modernizing its workplaces was a major project undertaking. The two teams from USM and Experts Inside proved with a lot of creativity and motivation how this could be done even in challenging times. While the employees were all working from home, the IT infrastructure was converted to Microsoft 365, the data was migrated to the cloud, and the various applications were successfully connected. Detailed and transparent information about the progress of the project was provided on the intranet through videos, FAQs, Quick Guides, planning boards, and various other tools. Employees are delighted at how fast and uncomplicated communication has become, and the newly gained flexibility makes everyday work much easier.

title: Revolutionizing workflow: Omega achieves up to 50% time savings with Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: Omega Industries (Omega) realized that it needed to update its project management and finance data systems to avoid delays and remain competitive in the railroad supply industry.

title: PKO Leasing saves 550 hours each month with Dynamics 365 Contact Center, an AI tool for customer support
executive_summary: PKO Leasing, serving 150,000 businesses daily with car, equipment, or capital investment leasing, had an outdated call center platform. Manual processes and difficulty in retrieving insights kept IT busy and slowed agents, impacting efficiency.

title: Data is at the heart of FLO operations, while Azure Synapse runs the core of the data
executive_summary: Moving beyond retail with a multi-channel and multi-brand business model, FLO set precedent in scale by migrating its data warehouse to the cloud, opting for Azure Synapse.

title: La Ville de Laval accélère les systèmes de réponse aux citoyens grâce à une solution Azure AI
executive_summary: One of the largest cities in Quebec, Ville de Laval, is focused on developing smart city initiatives. One such project is the infusion of AI and machine learning into its 311 non-emergency hotline. The system, which fields nearly 200,000 inquiries a year, has begun using a virtual agent to both speed citizen–agent interactions and answer the more basic inquiries on its own. Built with capabilities in Microsoft Azure AI and Microsoft Power Platform, the system was also recently used to conduct citizen consultations, and it may soon be expanded to the city’s 911 emergency response system. Ville de Laval expects that it will pay for itself within its first year of operation.

title: Power Central and Ingram Micro Cloud use Dynamics 365 Business Central to scale food industry small businesses
executive_summary: Pack’n Fresh, a food packaging small business, experienced rapid growth in 2020 at the start of the COVID-19 pandemic. But with information scattered across multiple data sources and spreadsheets, and inconsistent data clogging their systems, Pack’n Fresh leaders struggled to make timely inventory and ordering decisions to scale with the rising demand. To solve this challenge, Pack’n Fresh sought the help of Microsoft partners Power Central and Ingram Micro Cloud to deploy a unified enterprise resource planning (ERP) system that would allow it to seamlessly manage all its business functions from a single platform.

title: New York City Department of Environmental Protection pioneers chatbot innovation improving employee experiences and operational efficiency
executive_summary: As the largest city in the US, New York City is home to 8.3 million residents, the nation’s highest population density, and 325,000 government employees – more than any other US city and most states. The NYC Department of Environmental Protection is committed to the quality of life of the city’s residents, providing safe, clean drinking water and wastewater treatment. Their digital transformation, which began 14 years ago and continues with ongoing modernization efforts, is helping drive a sustainable future for all New Yorkers.

title: Microsoft Azure Blob Storage provides flexible, economical storage for GE Healthcare’s medical imaging team
executive_summary: GE Healthcare’s imaging services provide state-of-the-art diagnostic tools to healthcare providers across the United States and around the world. These tools range from handheld ultrasound systems to cardiovascular imaging to AI-guided algorithms that help radiologists detect lung problems.

title: Accela uses Microsoft Azure to help build and deliver its suite of modern, digital government services solutions
executive_summary: Government agencies seeking to increase efficiency, save costs, and provide even better customer citizen service turn to digital government service provider Accela for its open, extensible, Microsoft Azure–based software as a service (SaaS) platform. The solution provides out-of-the-box improvements to customer interfaces and enhanced, modernized workflows that speed internal government processes. Citizens gain simpler, more efficient access, while government agencies can provide those improved experiences without additional investments in IT infrastructure.

title: Dynamics 365 helps Desmond Tutu Health Foundation deal with the new age of health challenges.
executive_summary: The Desmond Tutu Health Foundation (DTHF) is a registered non-profit company established in association with the Desmond Tutu HIV Centre, an accredited research centre within the Faculty of Health Sciences, University of Cape Town (UCT).

title: Startup chooses Blazor and Xamarin for full-stack development using C#
executive_summary: The Postage is a startup that helps people plan for end-of-life, so that they can live fully now. Through the company’s use of .NET, including Blazor and Xamarin, its technical team was able to do full-stack development across the web, back-end services, and mobile applications—all using C#. In turn, this has resulted in rapid time to market, a rich user experience, and the ability to continue moving quickly as the company continues to grow.

title: Towards a fair, healthy, inclusive and sustainable city
executive_summary: Bristol City Council serves the population of the eighth-largest city in England, totalling more than 400,000 people. Social care plays a huge role in Bristol City Council’s plans and ability to fulfil its objective to ensure Bristol is a fair, healthy, inclusive and sustainable city in which to live.

title: University of North Carolina at Charlotte uses Azure PaaS to bootstrap an EV charging solution
executive_summary: Electric vehicles (EVs) are growing in popularity, but the lack of charging stations on public streets is a hurdle to widespread adoption. Installing new charging stations can be costly and disruptive. To meet this need, a team at the Energy Production and Infrastructure Center (EPIC) at the University of North Carolina (UNC) at Charlotte developed a solution to retrofit existing streetlights for use as multi-vehicle smart charging stations. Alex Miller, a sophomore undergraduate with no previous Microsoft Azure experience, served as the team’s developer. Learning as he went along, he used Azure platform as a service (PaaS) and Internet of Things (IoT) technology to bring the project to life in less than six months.

title: Wildlife Protection Solutions helps protect the wildest places with Microsoft AI for Earth
executive_summary: Wildlife Protection Solutions (WPS) sits in the nexus between the most remote places in the world and burgeoning animal conservation science. It provides the monitoring technology that conservation groups need to keep watch over wild places and protect wildlife. Conservationists use remote cameras to gather image data about the status of the species they protect, but the number of images that must be analyzed before action can be taken is overwhelming. WPS overcomes this barrier in collaboration with Microsoft AI for Earth, supported by Azure technologies for a species-preserving solution.

title: Sheba Medical Center uses Microsoft’s HoloLens for ventilators training
executive_summary: The Sheba Medical Center at Tel Hashomer is a university-affiliated hospital that serves as Israel's national medical center in many fields. It is the most comprehensive medical center in the Middle East, renowned for its quality care and leading-edge medicine. It is also a major medical-scientific research powerhouse that collaborates internationally with the biotech and pharmaceutical industries to develop new drugs, treatments and technologies, and a foremost global center for medical education. The medical center’s mission is to deliver excellent, highly innovative, and comprehensive care to all patients without distinction.

title: Kimberly-Clark Professional champions innovative IoT restroom servicing solution on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Kimberly-Clark Professional upgraded to Microsoft Azure to help it service the rapidly evolving connected facilities management sector. In a post-COVID-19 world, Kimberly-Clark Professional’s Onvation smart-restroom solution empowers facility managers to proactively control and optimize restroom servicing. It is positioned to provide winning services to customers through flexible, scalable, and secure data management delivered via connected software, world class dispensers and partnerships. The relationship developed with a trusted partner like Microsoft helps expand the capability to constantly drive new and improved services.

title: Keurig brews a more perfect cup of coffee with Azure IoT Central
executive_summary: Keurig Dr Pepper is a beverage company built for modern life. It has created a broad collection of refreshing, iconic brands to meet the varied tastes of today’s consumers. More than 35 million US households have a Keurig coffee brewer, making it the leading single-cup brewing system in North America. Now Keurig is launching connected brewers to revolutionize the coffee experience for consumers and simplify fleet management and maintenance for commercial partners. Based on the Azure IoT Central app platform, this connected solution allows users to activate and customize their brews through mobile and smart-home devices. The solution also drives a continuous improvement loop for customer support and enables faster decisions for product development.

title: Turning gas into cash: N-ERGIE’s virtual power plant based on Azure helps market electricity made from biogas
executive_summary: When cattle eat grass, they produce organic material: manure. And when this ferments, you get biogas. Burning biogas in a combined heat and power (CHP) plant is a way to generate clean electricity. For a long time, Germany’s farmers could turn a profit by producing electricity this way because for over 20 years the country’s Renewable Energy Sources Act (EEG) guaranteed them stable sales prices for it. But with the phasing out of this remuneration, the job of marketing electricity is once again falling to the plant operations. A complex undertaking. To ensure incentives to operate such plants remain, N-ERGIE Aktiengesellschaft developed a virtual power plant based on the Azure cloud platform. This allows decentralized management of CHP plants to keep them running at maximum efficiency. It also means operators get the best possible market price.

title: Air passengers on cloud nine: Lufthansa Group relies on Microsoft Azure for personalized customer journey
executive_summary: Air traffic is precision work. Every second counts. This comes as no surprise to anyone who’s ever watched planes take off and land at a major airport—it’s as if they’re being pulled along by an invisible thread. Every second of the day, airlines such as Lufthansa fly passengers all around the world. In the future, precision work will also be a hallmark of customer service at Germany’s largest airline. Lufthansa Group has already got the ball rolling by setting up a one data platform (ODP) based on Microsoft Azure, which will enable it to assist passengers with personalized services before, during, and after their flight.

title: Infobip makes hospital check-ins faster and safer with Azure Bot Service (AI)
executive_summary: When the COVID-19 pandemic hit, international hospital group Mediclinic needed a fast and safe way to give patients, staff and visitors access to clinics. For this, it turned to technology partner company Infobip, a global omnichannel communications leader. By combining Azure Bot Service (AI) and its Azure-based WhatsApp Business platform, Infobip delivered an effective health screening service for mobile devices. Today, the bot-driven solution is helping health-care staff and visitors access Mediclinic’s facilities safely.

title: Tristel builds a global business using SAP Business One on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Tristel is a manufacturer of infection-prevention and contamination-control products.

title: La Ville de Laval accélère les systèmes de réponse aux citoyens grâce à une solution Azure AI
executive_summary: One of the largest cities in Quebec, Ville de Laval, is focused on developing smart city initiatives. One such project is the infusion of AI and machine learning into its 311 non-emergency hotline. The system, which fields nearly 200,000 inquiries a year, has begun using a virtual agent to both speed citizen–agent interactions and answer the more basic inquiries on its own. Built with capabilities in Microsoft Azure AI and Microsoft Power Platform, the system was also recently used to conduct citizen consultations, and it may soon be expanded to the city’s 911 emergency response system. Ville de Laval expects that it will pay for itself within its first year of operation.

title: Improving farm productivity using data-driven agriculture
executive_summary: Farmbeats is an end-to-end AI and IoT system for agriculture that enable precision agriculture techniques. In particular, Azure Farmbeats gathers data from sensors, cameras, and drones, to produce actionable insights for farmers. It can extend Internet coverage to the farm and is resilient towards weather related outages or power variability. Thus, Farmbeats system has been deployed at Stewart Dairylands in New Zealand as one generating precision sensor maps of crop fields, animal monitoring, and much more.

title: A chatbot learns to speak thanks to Azure Cognitive Services: Claims reporting just got easier with bot Claimens at DOMCURA AG
executive_summary: When storm front “Bernd” swept over Germany in summer 2021, it didn’t just leave flooding and toppled trees in its wake; it also damaged countless buildings and temporarily forced thousands of people out of their homes. To make sure it could receive claims as quickly as possible and provide rapid assistance, insurance specialist DOMCURA decided to introduce a chatbot. Its name: Claimens. Its technology basis: Azure Cognitive Services.

title: Mechanical moles, digitally tweaked: TRACTO uses telemetry data in Azure to offer customers real advantages
executive_summary: How do pipelines for water and gas, or indeed fiber optic cables, get under the ground? The obvious way is by digging a trench. But TRACTO-TECHNIK GmbH & Co. KG offers a different solution—using equipment for trenchless pipe laying that doesn’t require tearing up streets and sidewalks. TRACTO has continuously refined this technology. Today, the company takes advantage of big data to offer innovative, digital solutions to customers around the world, to increase reliability, and to optimize drilling processes.

title: When industrial ventilators learn to text: ZIEHL-ABEGG’s IoT platform monitors devices via Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: ZIEHL-ABEGG brand ventilators can be found in ventilation and climate control systems used in everything from industrial and medical applications to server farms and agriculture. The family-owned company, which is based in the southern German town of Künzelsau, also makes drive technology, including elevator motors. In collaboration with T-Systems MMS, ZIEHL-ABEGG developed the ZAbluegalaxy IoT platform to monitor its own devices as well as those of third parties. Microsoft’s Azure Cloud Services collects and processes data on device status and performance in order to enhance operation and maintenance. In the future, this data should also spark inspiration for developing new devices and services.

title: FastTrack prepares Hive Streaming for global co-sell accessibility
executive_summary: People use videos to communicate in many parts of life. Thankfully, companies like Hive Streaming help customers—like Bayer and Chevron—drive employee engagement through powerful video experiences that are both stable and highly secure. This technology became paramount during COVID-19 when many enterprises shifted to remote work.

title: City government powers customer-centric transformation with Microsoft Purview Records Management
executive_summary: Providing residents with government services generates a lot of information in the form of records. Conventional records management practices at City of Marion in South Australia needed an upgrade. Corporate Services General Manager Sorana Dinmore and Records and Information Management Team Leader Karlheins Sohl deployed Microsoft Purview Records Management (previously known as Records Management in Microsoft 365), a breakthrough technology that transforms record management practices with a more efficient and effective solution that works seamlessly with their Microsoft 365 communications and collaboration infrastructure.

title: Bekaert migrates virtual desktops to Azure, builds highly secure, agile, connected workplace
executive_summary: From twenty-first-century office towers to car tires and champagne corks, steel wire holds the modern world together. To help the world work, travel, play, and meet the opportunities of the future, Bekaert, a global leader in steel wire transformation and coating technologies, wanted to modernize its technology infrastructure by moving to the cloud from on-premises datacenters.

title: Fujitsu delivers sustainable innovation and customer success with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: Fujitsu is a leading information and technology full-service provider that helps its enterprise customers build the type of lasting, sustainable change that drives business success. Fujitsu connects people, ideas, expertise, and support capabilities with leading-edge technologies, like SAP, to provide its clients with game-changing solutions.

title: Wüstenrot & Württembergische reduces patching time by 35 percent, leans into hybrid cloud management with Azure Arc
executive_summary: Starting small and extending rapidly, W&W is moving toward an open cloud approach, managing its on-premises workloads and servers in Azure and reducing operational costs and complexity with Azure Arc. With Azure Arc fully part of its infrastructure, W&W enjoys more efficiency and flexibility, and employees have more time for strategic work, among other benefits that cascade down to customers.

title: Government of Nunavut promotes Indigenous languages with groundbreaking Microsoft machine translation
executive_summary: Canada’s northernmost and largest territory is also its most sparsely populated area. As one of the four Inuit homelands in Canada, Nunavut is home to those who speak the Inuktut family of languages. Concerned by the dwindling use of Inuktut in the territory compared to English and French, the Government of Nunavut collaborated with Microsoft, using Microsoft Translator, part of Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services, to help strengthen connections between Inuktut speakers with those speaking the official languages in the rest of Canada, English, and French.

title: Vietnamese food and beverage company improves system safety and speed
executive_summary: With its headquarters in Thuan An City, URC Vietnam is part of Universal Robina Corporation (URC). It has 60 years of experience across the ASEAN and Oceania regions is a pioneer in the food and beverage industry. The company aims to create “the perfect products for the consumer’s absolute satisfaction”. So, when the time came to make some digital improvements, URC Vietnam decided that for the safety of its partner and customer data, moving its Virtual WAN and Distributor Management System (DMS) to the Microsoft Azure cloud was the natural next step. All their digital operations are now faster and more secure.

title: Insurance titan AIA embraces a cloud-based future to boost cost savings, sustainability while improving customer experience for millions
executive_summary: Even in the realm of corporations reaching global scale, AIA is a colossus. The multinational insurance and financial services provider is the largest Hong Kong–headquartered company listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange. AIA’s business units serve 18 markets and more than 17 million group insurance members, and they provide more than 40 million individual insurance policies. It’s no surprise that in an increasingly complex digital marketplace, the corresponding IT challenges and goals for AIA are numerous and urgent.

title: The power of partnerships: How Calcasieu Parish School Board has turned tragedy into an opportunity for a twenty-first century education
executive_summary: Calcasieu Parish School Board sits on the border with Texas in the southwest corner of Louisiana. The school district includes approximately 29,000 students spread over 100 square miles, making it the fifth largest in the state. Recently, the pandemic plus a series of natural disasters tested the limits of Calcasieu Parish as a community. Rather than passing the burden along to individual families to navigate the tumultuous situation, Calcasieu Parish emphasized the power of partnerships with government, local industry, administrators, educators, and families. For that, they relied upon the capabilities of Microsoft 365 education solutions. The results have been astounding as this once devastated parish is now utilizing educational technologies to provide a path to recovery for its students and its community.

title: Animal Supply Company modernizes invoice processing with Neudesic’s Document Intelligence Platform, powered by Microsoft analytics and AI
executive_summary: Animal Supply Company (ASC), a leading wholesale pet product distributor, transformed its invoicing process with data and AI solutions from Neudesic, a 20-year Microsoft partner. ASC’s manual systems were occupying valuable employees with tedious work. After transitioning to Microsoft Azure, the team decided to accelerate its business transformation by processing invoices through the Document Intelligence Platform (DIP), powered by analytics and AI from Azure. Just 12 months in, ASC has already exceeded the return on investment with help from Neudesic. Now, ASC is looking to bring automation to its largest distribution centers.

title: International CRO ClinChoice dramatically improves finance processes with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: ClinChoice is a global contract research organization (CRO) with prominent presences in China, the United States, Armenia, India, and over 20 other countries around the world. It provides clinical development services to biotech, pharmaceutical, and medical device companies. ClinChoice offers a wide spectrum of solutions for clinical development, biometrics, drug safety, medical affairs, regulatory consulting, and more. With an international client base, numerous contracts, and the complexities involved in any clinical research project, ClinChoice faced difficulties managing time, scope, and labor costs, as well as ensuring every project meets regulatory compliance in the countries it operates in. To help manage these challenges across the lifecycle of its projects, the company chose Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Dynamics 365 Project Operations to consolidate its ERP systems. With this new system, ClinChoice has a clearer picture of costs, regulatory requirements, and timelines, improving efficiency and coordination throughout their CRO projects.

title: Revolutionizing census: Serbia's Statistical Office collects and publishes results in record time using Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: 18 months. That’s how long it took the Statistical Office of Republic of Serbia to publish its official census results before. This time, it delivered preliminary census results in just one month, and official results in six months. This was made possible thanks to the team adopting Microsoft solutions such as Azure, SQL Server, and Power BI. Not only did it help the Office conduct a paperless and efficient census process; it also ensured top data security, enabled real-time monitoring, and improved data quality.

title: National Housing Company offers fully automated smart customer journey with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The National Housing Company (NHC), a state-owned Saudi company, leads the way in real estate development with More than 7 projects and more than 20,000 housing units. NHC decided to bring efficiency and visibility to internal processes to improve its customer experience. Digital Solutions and Products Manager at NHC Munira Altamimi’s mission was to automate the entire customer journey from registration to project handover with the use of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service and Sales. By bringing more visibility and efficiency to the process, NHC has improved customer satisfaction by 95 percent and enhanced its capacity for scale.

title: Providence Swedish makes medical advancements with Mixed Reality
executive_summary: For 112 years Providence Swedish’s focus has been improving the health and well-being of each person they serve. Since 1910 they have been recognized as one of the Seattle area’s best hospitals with the best doctors, nurses, and overall care in a variety of specialty areas.

title: Türkiye’s largest private bank İşbank deploys new bank apps faster and reduces time to market by 27%
executive_summary: İşbank, the largest private bank in Türkiye, strives to become the bank of the future, creating sustainable value with an inclusive and participatory approach. To bring that vision to life, İşbank Unit Manager İlker Anaç decided to enhance developer productivity. With his teams’ help, Anaç transformed the entire software delivery process of mainframe with Azure. Now, the bank has faster onboarding for newcomers and a better time-to-market for its apps.

title: Vattenfall Streamlines sales and service, scales for sustainability and growth with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Vattenfall AB is a European energy company that has electrified industries and supplied energy to people's homes for more than 100 years. With a commitment to modernizing the way people live through innovation and cooperation, the company is determined to enable fossil free living within one generation. To provide a fully connected customer experience across its different lines of business and increase customer engagement in the company’s sustainability efforts, Vattenfall needed a way to better streamline its sales and service operations. Using Microsoft Dynamics 365 Marketing, Sales, and Service, the company created a cohesive customer relationship (CRM) system—helping employees become more efficient and improving customer engagement.

title: The Société du Canal de Provence relies on data to optimize the management of water supply networks and the use of this resource in the face of climate change
executive_summary: As historic droughts recur in France, the urgent issues of water stress and of the sustainable use of this resource are becoming permanent fixtures in political debates and public concerns. How to optimize the management and distribution of raw water? How can we spare this resource while guaranteeing a service for all uses? Let’s have a look at the ambitious project implemented by the Société Canal de Provence, which places data at the heart of its activity.

title: La ville de Kelowna améliore et optimise l’accès à ses services grâce à Azure AI
executive_summary: The forward-thinking City of Kelowna always looks for ways to deliver greater benefits to its citizens without increasing costs for them. Now that cognitive search technology and conversational AI are available, the city aims to use them in support of its 311 non-emergency municipal services help line. Sourcing real-time data and existing documentation, the solution can efficiently answer a wide range of questions. The City of Kelowna expects the solution to soon help translate complex legal documents, walk people through permitting processes, and reduce the need for repetitive work for citizens and governmental employees alike.

title: WTW accelerates delivery time with Azure migration and analytics
executive_summary: Willis Towers Watson (WTW) is a global advisory, broking, and solutions company that provides data-driven solutions in the areas of people, risk, and capital. WTW wanted to update its LoyaltyAdvisor platform, which enables WTW to manage loyalty program data and analyze point redemption for its global clients. WTW equipped its team with a deeply interoperable and intuitive platform through a Microsoft Azure solution that includes Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2, and Azure Databricks. As a result, WTW has accelerated its agility and innovation and boosted employee productivity. And thanks to the collaboration between WTW and Microsoft, WTW was able to provide a seamless transition to the new Azure-based platform without interruption to its clients.

title: Nevada Department of Transportation buckles up with Azure, joint BCDR solutions to enhance public safety
executive_summary: At the heart of the Nevada Department of Transportation is being a leader and provider of effective transportation solutions for a safe, connected, and innovative Nevada. The department is responsible for planning, constructing, and operating the more than 5,400 miles of highway and 1,000 bridges that make up Nevada’s highway system, which is used daily by residents and tourists alike. It’s also charged with supporting its internal employees, contractors, and civil engineers in maintaining the flow of movement throughout the state. To make things easier and more efficient for its workforce and greater community, the department recently adopted a cloud-first mindset and moved critical systems to Microsoft Azure, gaining agility, resiliency, and an improved position for the future.

title: INDEP and Microsoft Azure: An unprecedented success story in Mexico’s public sector
executive_summary: Following the Agreement by which policies and provisions are issued to promote the use and exploitation of information and communication technologies within the Mexican Federal Public Administration, INDEP was able to efficiently adapt its IPv4 protocol telecommunications to IPv6, through a strategic alliance with Microsoft and its cloud solutions.

title: Sogei transforms its culture and achieves 1,100 return on investment with Microsoft Adoption and Change Management services
executive_summary: Sogei, the IT company fully owned by the Italian Ministry of Economy and Finance, had to address low adoption of Microsoft 365 tools so its employees could work from anywhere with high productivity. But its initiative was reactive, lacking identity and roadmap clarity. Sogei commissioned Microsoft to help transform its working culture from the ground up with a Microsoft 365 adoption program and Center of Excellence. The unique solution developed by the Adoption and Change Management (ACM) services team has saved the typical user an average of 4.5 hours per week that has been reinvested into productive time, personal wellbeing, and upskilling. The program also introduced a 194 percent increase in collaboration with Microsoft Teams, 60 percent reduction in email volume, and provided a 1,100 percent return on investment for Microsoft 365 E3 licenses.

title: Boost leads by 10x: Virbe’s Azure OpenAI Service avatars revolutionize customer engagement
executive_summary: Virbe, a Polish startup that automates communication and sales activities, wanted to enable businesses to interact with customers through AI-powered avatars.

title: KPMG streamlines tax compliance services with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: KPMG in the US needed a modernized customer engagement system to align its business processes to file taxes and serve clients faster. Its homegrown legacy solution didn’t provide standardization or automation and left tax preparers working in different tools.

title: Esri helps cities gain key climate science insights using geospatial data, AI, Azure
executive_summary: Cities can use the ArcGIS geospatial platform to create environmental digital twins that simulate heavy rainfall and apply hot spot analysis to highlight flooding. These insights help local government and public safety staff better understand potential community impacts.

title: Raiffeisen Bank International launches its own ChatGPT using Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: RBI wanted to use AI to automate repetitive tasks like documenting intelligence and more rapidly summarizing legal, regulation, and banking documents.

title: V-ICT-OR delivers innovative Flemish government services with Azure Container Apps
executive_summary: V-ICT-OR, a consortium of municipalities in Belgium’s Flanders Region, provides digital technologies to its member agencies. The organization decided to containerize its monolithic app infrastructure to increase agility and enable growth.

title: Syneos Health reduces time for clinical trial site activation by about 10% with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Syneos Health wanted to streamline the complex data and documentation demands of biopharmaceutical development to get lifesaving therapies to patients faster.

title: The City of Everett, Washington, serves its community with municipal innovation by adopting Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: The City of Everett, Washington, home to more than 115,000 people, transformed its municipal operations by empowering employees to develop customized applications. In 2019, the City grappled with disconnected, manual processes that limited the reach of its departments and slowed data reporting for grant-funded initiatives. Building on existing Microsoft 365 licenses, the City of Everett used Microsoft Power Platform to revolutionize its operations. City employees used this low-code/no-code solution to build tailored applications, transforming staff into a proficient team of developers who also serve as municipal leaders. The result is an innovative, cost-effective approach to meeting the needs of the community.

title: IFAD enhances food systems and agriculture opportunities in fragile rural communities with help from Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: With a global mission to eradicate poverty and hunger in some of the world’s most fragile rural communities in developing countries, IFAD (International Fund for Agricultural Development) works hand in hand with governments to fund projects and innovative practices that enable small-scale producers to develop sustainable agricultural practices, transform food systems, and build resilience in the face of some of the biggest global challenges. IFAD needed a better way for its global teams and partners to access and share critical information from and to the remote locations they work in. It wanted a solution that could support seamless configuration and security management, along with the equitable adoption of new tools. Using Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service, Azure AI Search, and Power BI, the organization built Omnidata, a centralized analytics platform that connects data, dashboards, visualizations, and analytics powered by machine learning and AI. The solution gives all personnel fast, direct access to critical data in every region IFAD serves, plus training in analytics and machine learning so they can actively create new tools to address specific day-to-day challenges.

title: Bahrain’s Information & eGovernment Authority sets example of future-facing business continuity with Microsoft 365 and Azure
executive_summary: The Kingdom of Bahrain’s Information & eGovernment Authority (iGA) is on a mission to redefine public service. From struggling with on-premises infrastructure to achieving nearly 100% information availability with Azure Backup, the authority has been leading transformation in the Gulf region. iGA’s Cloud First policy and adoption of cloud solutions—the first in the Middle East—streamlined operations and saved thousands of work hours, setting a new standard in digital transformation.

title: Fater adopts Microsoft Sustainability Manager for efficient carbon footprint tracking and ESG reporting
executive_summary: Fater needed a solution to digitize carbon footprint calculations by automatically acquiring data from dispersed sources, validating it, and fulfil reporting requirements. Key factors included traceability, auditability, and creating what-if scenarios to support sustainable business decisions.

title: Quilter achieves fastest-ever tech ROI with Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: Leading UK financial services provider Quilter innovates to drive performance improvements, enhance customer experience, and deliver on ambitious efficiency targets while sustaining growth.

title: Auquan helps financial institutions save 50,000+ hours with Microsoft Azure OpenAI
executive_summary: Finance industry professionals spend most of their time manually processing unstructured data and writing reports, greatly limiting the scale and speed of what they can accomplish.

title: University of Leicester transforms student services with Microsoft Dynamics 365, AI Agents and Microsoft Unified
executive_summary: The University of Leicester, a leading institution in education and research, sought to modernise student interactions, improve administrative efficiency and enhance staff productivity.

title: E.ON UK powers transition to renewable energy with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Before Dynamics 365, E.ON UK used a homegrown legacy solution integrating internally built applications to manage customers, field employees, and products. IT teams spent much time on software maintenance.

title: Fukuoka SoftBank HAWKS create a new way of watching baseball with Azure AI Services
executive_summary: The Fukuoka SoftBank HAWKS, a professional baseball team in Japan, tried many initiatives to digitally transform its home stadium but couldn’t find a solution that sparked delight. The answer was an AI avatar that leverages Microsoft AI services.

title: Ricoh Japan drives digital transformation with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Ricoh Japan collaborated with Microsoft and Accenture Japan Ltd. to design and implement a new sales solution based on Dynamics 365 Sales, migrating close to 300 million records.

title: Glidewell collaborates with Avantiico to increase sales order processing by 12% with the same workforce using Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Glidewell Dental (Glidewell) relied on multiple siloed systems for its operations, including paper-based and manual processes. A gap analysis showed the company needed a new ERP system and helped it identify the required features.

title: Bartlett Regional Hospital enhances care for rural communities with PowerShare Image Sharing and mPower Clinical Analytics
executive_summary: Bartlett Regional Hospital needed to scale image sharing capabilities and harness clinical analytics to deliver more efficient and connected healthcare services for rural communities and tourists.

title: Assembly Software saves law firms up to 25 hours per case with Azure
executive_summary: Law firms face challenges in efficiency, limiting the amount of time attorneys and staff can spend with clients. A leading provider of legal software, Assembly Software set out to simplify caseload workflow and redefine how legal professionals work.

title: Accenture champions responsible AI, gains faster time to market with Azure AI Foundry
executive_summary: Accenture needed to move beyond generative AI demos to deploy real, enterprise-grade applications that were scalable, explainable, and compliant—capable of meeting strict governance, safety, and performance demands across diverse client use cases.

title: The ODP Corporation transforms HR, sales, and retail workflows with Azure AI app platform
executive_summary: Tight margins, rising costs, and fierce competition pushed The ODP Corporation to find a smarter way to serve customers, support employees, and stay competitive.

title: Infosys uses Microsoft Purview SDK to strengthen GenAI data security and compliance
executive_summary: Infosys wanted to accelerate GenAI adoption without compromising data security, violating enterprise policies, or increasing regulatory risk. It needed built-in controls to protect sensitive information and ensure compliant AI use across industries.

title: Volkswagen enhances engineering efficiency with Microsoft Copilot and PTC
executive_summary: Volkswagen faces escalating challenges in product development as complexity is anticipated to grow over time, making efficient application lifecycle management (ALM) tools crucial.

title: Schur drives packaging innovation, automation, and efficiency with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Schur sought to streamline, standardize, and optimize core processes across all business units. They needed to support integrations with state-of-the art CAD, material handling, and robotic systems while providing world-class reporting and analytics.

title: Edison on Microsoft Azure gives BKW a platform for hands-on AI
executive_summary: BKW was looking for a secure, scalable solution to embed AI systematically, tap effectively into internal data and responsibly introduce staff to new technologies.

title: Ai Workforce built on Azure helps LayerX client save 570 hours of processing docs
executive_summary: LayerX sought an AI-powered cloud infrastructure for its AI document processing platform—one that could help customers in document-heavy industries automate manual, error-prone tasks, reduce inefficiencies, and free up time for higher-value work.

title: ASTEC engineers run computer simulations up to 9x faster with Ansys Access on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: ASTEC Industries (ASTEC) wanted to empower its engineers to run complex particle and fluid-dynamic simulations. Capacity constraints from on-premises storage and computing capabilities were contributing to long simulation runtimes.
products: Azure HPC, Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Files, Azure

title: Sandia saves employees countless hours a month with a secure AI chat tool built on Azure OpenAI in Foundry Models
executive_summary: To improve efficiency across its organization, Sandia National Laboratories (Sandia) wanted to develop an AI solution that would help ensure security and could be smoothly incorporated into existing security protocols.
products: Azure, Power BI, Azure OpenAI

title: The Salvation Army UK embraces data-driven decisions with Microsoft Fabric
executive_summary: The Salvation Army UK helps vulnerable people through homeless shelters, employment centers, and more. Yet siloed data and a property management system without a reporting function blocked insights of how to best manage their 2,700 properties.

title: The Supreme Court of Buenos Aires renews its credentials with Entra Verified ID
executive_summary: The Supreme Court of Buenos Aires (SCBA) needed to renew its entire credential system. Its old system relied on physical credentials, which increased expenses, required a lengthy approval time, and lacked adequate security and user acceptance.
customer: Suprema Corte de Justicia de la Provincia de Buenos Aires
products: Microsoft Entra Verified ID, Microsoft Entra ID

title: E-discovery company uses serverless computing to speed internal development of its SaaS solution
executive_summary: Based in Chicago, Illinois, Relativity wanted to improve the customer experience of its RelativityOne cloud-based e-discovery platform. The company decided to create a monitoring solution based on a serverless architecture powered by Microsoft Azure Functions that proactively identifies and resolves performance issues. Now, developers have more time to apply their talent to writing task specific code and enhancing functionality, without worrying about underlying systems and servers. Some projects that used to require a few months can now be completed in a few days.
products: Azure, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Functions, Azure SQL Database, Azure Service Bus

title: Solving global water challenges with Microsoft cloud technologies
executive_summary: We’ve been warned for decades to improve water management, and recent events such as the California drought are currently keeping the issue in the news. We take action at home by not watering our lawns and spending less time in the shower. But although personal conservation is a step forward, it’s only part of the solution. The morning cup of coffee after your three-minute shower took 55 gallons of water to produce. The shirt you’re wearing commanded another 700 gallons of water to create, and the car you drove to work required a staggering 39,090 gallons to build. Fortunately, Ecolab—a leading global provider of water, hygiene, and energy technologies and services—is on a mission to make changes that enable the goods and services we rely on every day to be produced and delivered with a lot less water.
products: Azure IoT Hub, Azure Internet of Things, Dynamics 365 Field Service, Dynamics 365 Sales, Power BI, Azure Machine Learning

title: Boost leads by 10x: Virbe’s Azure OpenAI Service avatars revolutionize customer engagement
executive_summary: Virbe, a Polish startup that automates communication and sales activities, wanted to enable businesses to interact with customers through AI-powered avatars.

title: Volkswagen enhances engineering efficiency with Microsoft Copilot and PTC
executive_summary: Volkswagen faces escalating challenges in product development as complexity is anticipated to grow over time, making efficient application lifecycle management (ALM) tools crucial.

title: Schur drives packaging innovation, automation, and efficiency with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Schur sought to streamline, standardize, and optimize core processes across all business units. They needed to support integrations with state-of-the art CAD, material handling, and robotic systems while providing world-class reporting and analytics.

title: Edison on Microsoft Azure gives BKW a platform for hands-on AI
executive_summary: BKW was looking for a secure, scalable solution to embed AI systematically, tap effectively into internal data and responsibly introduce staff to new technologies.

title: Ai Workforce built on Azure helps LayerX client save 570 hours of processing docs
executive_summary: LayerX sought an AI-powered cloud infrastructure for its AI document processing platform—one that could help customers in document-heavy industries automate manual, error-prone tasks, reduce inefficiencies, and free up time for higher-value work.

title: ASTEC engineers run computer simulations up to 9x faster with Ansys Access on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: ASTEC Industries (ASTEC) wanted to empower its engineers to run complex particle and fluid-dynamic simulations. Capacity constraints from on-premises storage and computing capabilities were contributing to long simulation runtimes.

title: Sandia saves employees countless hours a month with a secure AI chat tool built on Azure OpenAI in Foundry Models
executive_summary: To improve efficiency across its organization, Sandia National Laboratories (Sandia) wanted to develop an AI solution that would help ensure security and could be smoothly incorporated into existing security protocols.

title: The Salvation Army UK embraces data-driven decisions with Microsoft Fabric
executive_summary: The Salvation Army UK helps vulnerable people through homeless shelters, employment centers, and more. Yet siloed data and a property management system without a reporting function blocked insights of how to best manage their 2,700 properties.

title: The Supreme Court of Buenos Aires renews its credentials with Entra Verified ID
executive_summary: The Supreme Court of Buenos Aires (SCBA) needed to renew its entire credential system. Its old system relied on physical credentials, which increased expenses, required a lengthy approval time, and lacked adequate security and user acceptance.

title: E-discovery company uses serverless computing to speed internal development of its SaaS solution
executive_summary: Based in Chicago, Illinois, Relativity wanted to improve the customer experience of its RelativityOne cloud-based e-discovery platform. The company decided to create a monitoring solution based on a serverless architecture powered by Microsoft Azure Functions that proactively identifies and resolves performance issues. Now, developers have more time to apply their talent to writing task specific code and enhancing functionality, without worrying about underlying systems and servers. Some projects that used to require a few months can now be completed in a few days.

title: Solving global water challenges with Microsoft cloud technologies
executive_summary: We’ve been warned for decades to improve water management, and recent events such as the California drought are currently keeping the issue in the news. We take action at home by not watering our lawns and spending less time in the shower. But although personal conservation is a step forward, it’s only part of the solution. The morning cup of coffee after your three-minute shower took 55 gallons of water to produce. The shirt you’re wearing commanded another 700 gallons of water to create, and the car you drove to work required a staggering 39,090 gallons to build. Fortunately, Ecolab—a leading global provider of water, hygiene, and energy technologies and services—is on a mission to make changes that enable the goods and services we rely on every day to be produced and delivered with a lot less water.

title: Romanian farmers better supported thanks to artificial intelligence
executive_summary: The Rural Investments Financing Agency (AFIR) is the main government agency supporting Romanian farmers and companies to access grants and an average of 2 billion euros yearly of European Union (EU) funding for rural development projects. It is the government agency with the highest absorption rate of EU funds. A vital internal forecasting task to help manage grant projects used to require a lot of manual intervention by AFIR’s employees, which was slow and inaccurate. However, the situation completely changed once AFIR started using artificial intelligence (AI) powered by Microsoft Azure.
products: Azure, Azure Machine Learning, Azure SQL, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

title: Kennametal pushes manufacturing into the future with IoT and Microsoft cloud solutions
executive_summary: Kennametal delivers industrial parts and services to global customers in industries from aerospace to energy. As part of its multiple-year modernization strategy, the company migrated IT resources to Microsoft Azure and invested heavily in factory upgrades. Recognizing the importance of data in modern business, Kennametal uses performance insights uncovered with Microsoft Power BI to optimize its sophisticated machinery. Kennametal’s initial efforts to drive a data culture have resulted in significant impacts. In certain areas of production, the first upgraded factory has improved machine setup times by almost 50 percent, increased press availability by 50 percent, and seen the most productive month ever in terms of pieces per day through certain departments.

title: Using artificial intelligence to improve air quality
executive_summary: Air quality is something that concerns us all – cities, companies, and citizens alike. Since 2015, Hamburg-based Breeze Technologies has been working to make a difference to the air we breathe by deploying state-of-the-art sensors to measure all the major pollutants in the air. Right from the outset, they’ve been using Microsoft’s Azure cloud platform to collect and evaluate data. The simple scalability to handle constantly increasing volumes of data and the high level of data protection that Azure offers made the decision easy for Breeze Technologies. Now the company is taking the next step and introducing artificial intelligence (AI) to improve data evaluation and add even more value for customers.
products: Azure, Azure Functions

title: Instead of building infrastructure, focus engineering effort on delighting customers
executive_summary: With 130 years of specialist commodity expertise, Fastmarkets serves up market pricing, data and insights to customers in Metals & Mining, Agriculture and Forest Products. To enhance its customers’ experience, this global data provider built a new integrated data platform. Fastmarkets has gained greater agility, scalability and visibility over customer behaviour. Customers now enjoy a new, seamless experience across multiple digital delivery channels.

title: Dairy company centralizes its data in Azure, gains flexibility and productivity
executive_summary: Arla Foods needed to create one source for all its data. Arla wanted one vendor for the data foundation services, and Azure provided every tool necessary for a complete solution, eliminating the need for any third-party tools. Arla Foods now transforms data in Azure and makes it available through semantic models in Power BI.
products: Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Databricks, Azure SQL Database, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI, SQL Server

title: AA Service Co. uses CiraSync on Azure to centrally manage smartphone contact lists
executive_summary: AA Service Co. is a large-scale HVAC service provider in Chicago. The company has been modernizing its IT structure since adopting smartphones as its main tool to communicate with colleagues, suppliers, and technical resources in 2013. As employees inevitably came and went, the IT staff at AA Service Co. had to manually update a constantly changing employee directory of employee smartphones.

title: The Wonderful Company, a health food company, implements Power BI for low total cost of ownership, AI capabilities, and flexibility to utilize company data in business units such as finance, farming, and manufacturing
executive_summary: Headquartered in Los Angeles, The Wonderful Company is a privately held $5 billion global company dedicated to harvesting health and happiness around the world through its iconic consumer brands. Its 10,000 employees worldwide are dedicated to bringing consumers everywhere the freshest pistachios, citrus, and pomegranates; bottling the finest water and wines; and creating colorful floral bouquets.

title: Leading construction software ISV shifts 900 customers to Azure in record time
executive_summary: Construction companies around the globe depend on Viewpoint for the enterprise resource planning software that helps manage their projects, processes, and people so they can deliver on-time, on-budget projects. When Viewpoint decided to simplify its cloud footprint, it embarked on a plan to move 900 software as a service (SaaS) customers to Microsoft Azure, the business-critical platform the company turns to for its highly regarded software. The company successfully completed the migration in just seven months. Now that it’s moved to Azure, Viewpoint is better positioned to grow, using Microsoft technology. It enjoys the scalability, reliability, performance, and cost optimization it desired while helping keep customers with stringent compliance requirements secure.

title: Chill Passion boosts employee attendance and confidence with Healthper’s Return to Work program on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Chill Passion, a manufacturer and distributor of high-quality beverage-dispensing products in Chicago, needed to install an affordable temperature-monitoring and testing solution for its employees during the COVID-19 pandemic. Healthper provided the company with two temperature terminals, installed at entry doors, and enrolled Chill Passion employees in Healthper's Return to Work program. Facial recognition and identification was powered by the Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services Face API, which trained Healthper's AI model, and the system was deployed on secure Azure infrastructure. Return to Work slashed screening time per employee from 45 seconds to two seconds and increased employee attendance by 100 percent in four weeks.

title: Unilever puts metadata in one big basket thanks to CadDo and Microsoft technologies
executive_summary: Unilever is one of the world’s largest fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) businesses, owning more than 400 famous brands that are sold around the world. Given the scale and complexity of its operations and metadata, Unilever identified a need to better understand its Cost to Serve. CadDo Calculate was implemented to address Unilever's needs rapidly and effectively. Using an end-to-end Microsoft stack, including Microsoft Azure, SQL Server, and Power BI, meant all components connected effortlessly and data flowed from raw source data into robust end-user reports. The project was a clear success in terms of its original scope, as CadDo Calculate is now live in Unilever’s largest markets covering over 20 percent of the global business.
products: Azure, Power BI

title: DWP delights users while simplifying IT administration
executive_summary: The Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) is the largest UK Government department. Its 90,000 employees actively serve 25 million British citizens and around £200 billion of taxpayers’ money flows through the department every year.  Over such vast operations, even small changes and improvements can have a huge impact in terms of efficiency and cost savings.
products: Microsoft Teams, Windows Autopilot, Surface Book, Surface Pro

title: Manufacturer tracks food storage temperatures with Azure, helps reduce global food waste
executive_summary: Headquartered in Denmark, Danfoss manufactures products for heating and cooling appliances such as radiators and freezers. The company wanted to expand its offerings to software as a service (SaaS) solutions and use its decades of domain expertise to help its food retail customers become more efficient. Danfoss developed Alsense Food Retail, a cloud-based solution built on Microsoft Azure Event Hubs that grocery stores use to monitor temperatures with sensors. Customers can tightly control energy efficiency across grocery chains, leading to an estimated 30 percent decrease in their energy costs and a 40 percent reduction in food waste.
products: Azure, Azure Databricks, Azure Event Hubs, Azure SQL Database, Power BI

title: Mitsui began using Security Copilot to streamline operations of the zero-trust security system protecting its network
executive_summary: Amidst a shortage of highly skilled security specialists, Mitsui & Co. has been focusing on leveraging generative AI to enhance the efficiency of its security operations in countering increasing cyberattacks. Thus, when Microsoft announced its Security Copilot EAP in March 2024, Mitsui immediately decided to participate.
products: Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Security Copilot, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Purview, Microsoft Sentinel, OneDrive for Business, Outlook

title: How Publix Employees Federal Credit Union strengthened its disaster recovery strategy with Azure Local
executive_summary: Facing increasingly severe hurricanes, aging infrastructure, and rising costs, Publix Employees Federal Credit Union needed to modernize its disaster recovery strategy, simplify operations, and future-proof its IT environment.
products: Azure Migrate, Azure Local, Azure Site Recovery, Azure Arc, SharePoint, Azure Files

title: Rehoboth empowers greater human connection in disability care with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: As Rehoboth Christian Ministries grew, paper-based scheduling, payroll, and reporting overwhelmed staff. Time spent on admin took time away from what mattered most: supporting people with developmental disabilities.

title: AUDI AG deploys secure, scalable AI assistant in two weeks with Azure data, apps, and AI
executive_summary: Facing rising employee demand for faster access to information, AUDI AG needed a smarter way to deliver answers—without increasing support overhead or compromising security.

title: Visterra uses KAISPE Purchase Requisition and the Microsoft Power Platform to automate procurement and boost productivity by 40 percent
executive_summary: Visterra Inc., a clinical stage biotechnology company, wanted to replace cumbersome manual processes with automation for day-to-day procurement and service requisitions. Stephen Torra, Director Enterprise Systems, Visterra, engaged KAISPE LLC, a Microsoft partner that provides efficient solutions and services to enterprise customers. In the initial discovery phase, Torra realized KAISPE possessed the experience and technology to rapidly solve his problems. With minor customizations, KAISPE deployed its Purchase Requisition solution, built on the Microsoft Power Platform, in just three days, resulting in a 40-percent increase in employee productivity.

title: Children’s hospital makes every moment count with help from Dynamics 365 Customer Insights
executive_summary: Annae Barney Gorman, a philanthropist and community activist, lived her life in “the relentless pursuit of optimal health for every child.” What she started back in 1919 as a small health services center for residents of North Dayton, Ohio, has evolved into one of only 31 freestanding children’s hospitals in the United States today. More than 400 physicians, 1,000 nurses, and 2,000 staff are at the heart of Dayton Children’s Hospital’s vision of reinventing the path to children's health for families throughout the region and beyond. The hospital’s employees believe that each moment counts in how they interact with their patients, families, and each other. There were more than 384,000 visits in 2019, and all of them were key moments in unique patient journeys that are now better understood with the help of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Insights.

title: Switch from analog to Teams telephony brings major gains
executive_summary: In the search for a more flexible telephony solution, Fernfachhochschule Schweiz turned to sipcall, who quickly impressed with its extensive experience in Voice over Internet and an attractive price model. Working together, they rapidly converted the entire communication system of FFHS from analog telephony to an Internet-based solution for MS Teams. The new solution has not only given FFHS the desired flexibility, but has also made it possible to significantly reduce costs while maintaining the same stable connection quality. The employees are enthusiastic and see great added value through the changeover. The new solution with Teams offers so many advantages that no one wants to return to analog telephony.
products: Microsoft Teams

title: Keventer Agro business divisions bind together seamlessly with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Headquartered in Kolkata, Keventer Agro Limited is in the food processing business and offers products across food categories such as packaged food, dairy products, and fresh products. With both franchise and own brands across 90 SKUs, the company has pan-India operations.

title: Eshgro helps innovative accounting firm Lansigt with future-proof platform
executive_summary: Accounting firm Lansigt is dependent on two things: personnel and technology. It has therefore always been a conscious decision for it to have its own IT department. Over time, however, the firm has grown considerably and technological developments are accelerating, making it increasingly complex to keep IT management in-house. When it was time for a new IT infrastructure in 2020, the decision was made to outsource IT. Key objectives were security, optimal performance and a modern workplace that could also handle the firm's legacy applications. Eshgro's Smarter Workplace emerged from the selection process as the optimal and most innovative solution.
products: Azure, Azure Virtual Desktop, Microsoft 365

title: Wellness Forever cuts time to data availability from days to minutes leveraging Azure services
executive_summary: Established in 2008, Wellness Forever Medicare Limited (Wellness Forever) is a retail pharmacy chain with more than 300 stores across Maharashtra, Goa and Karnataka, employing 4,500 people. The business is currently making strides in the omnichannel space.

title: Kensington Mortgages slashes mortgage performance modeling HPC runtimes from 20 hours to 25 minutes with Azure Batch service
executive_summary: Kensington Mortgages doesn’t fit the average mold for lenders when it comes to home loans. Many lenders focus on simple income and record of employment profiles to determine lending criteria for new customers. Instead of penalizing loan applicants who don’t meet all the traditional criteria, Kensington considers more complex income circumstances that mainstream lenders don’t typically accommodate.
products: Azure Batch, Azure HPC, Azure Virtual Machines

title: Eshgro helps innovative accounting firm Lansigt with future-proof platform
executive_summary: Accounting firm Lansigt is dependent on two things: personnel and technology. It has therefore always been a conscious decision for it to have its own IT department. title: Wellness Forever cuts time to data availability from days to minutes leveraging Azure services
executive_summary: Established in 2008, Wellness Forever Medicare Limited (Wellness Forever) is a retail pharmacy chain with more than 300 stores across Maharashtra, Goa and Karnataka, employing 4,500 people. The business is currently making strides in the omnichannel space.

title: Bahrain Public Transport Company (BPTC) increases transport usage at competitive costs
executive_summary: Bahrain Public Transport Company (BPTC) needs to keep operational costs down and at the same increase public transport usage. In early 2018, the public transport usage was decreasing–attributed to two factors: punctuality and reliability. The adoption of Microsoft Navision for Finance and HR, Microsoft 365 suite of applications for collaboration, of PowerBI for reporting and general productivity measurement and migrating their infrastructure to Azure Cloud allowed BPTC to achieve better services, higher transport usage rates, data security and 30% cost savings while delivering increased punctuality and reliability to its customers.

executive_summary: The Spanish civil engineering firm Ferrovial has a strong legacy in construction and infrastructure, but its legacy web applications were holding back the IT department. The company wanted to adopt a modern browser with compatibility for those key Internet Explorer-based apps, which they found in Microsoft Edge. Diligent preparation by Ferrovial’s Workplace team and support from Microsoft FastTrack led to a successful deployment, an intuitive user experience on a single browser, and a smooth transition to using modern business apps.

title: DavidShield kept teams conected and productive throughout the pandemic thanks to Office 365
executive_summary: DavidShield Group is a leader in the Travel Insurance industry and was able to keep teams connected and productive throughout the pandemic, securing information thanks to Office 365, including Teams and OneDrive, for better collaboration and cost control.
products: Microsoft Teams, OneDrive for Business, Microsoft Entra ID

title: Trail Blazer Tours leverages Microsoft Azure to drive operational efficiency
executive_summary: Trail Blazer Tours India Pvt. Ltd (TBi) is a part of the Katgara group, a travel and tourism industry pioneer. TBi is one of the most trusted destination management companies in India having footprints in 9 offices across India and 9 international offices across globe.
customer: Trail Blazer Tours India Pvt. Ltd
products: Azure

title: Dell Technologies supports innovation and boosts knowledge sharing in a hybrid world with Microsoft Viva
executive_summary: When Bruce Sánchez, Global Lead for Sales Learning and Development Technology at Dell Technologies, thinks about  team members learning new information or skills—like cloud solutions or negotiating—he knows it’s often in response to a tactical obstacle. “In the modern world, we seek and learn in the moment of need,” he says, referring to the range of options available to curious minds, from search engines to instructional videos. “We recognize that our sales team members are no different. They want to find the information they need, when they need it, no matter where they are.”

title: Digicel Group's Infrastructure Transformation led to the standardization of processes, increased stability and recoverability with Azure
executive_summary: The Digicel Group implemented an Azure Digital solution, along with their partner Maureen Data Systems, and is now completing the most extensive Azure deployment in the Caribbean. This move is part of the company's Infrastructure Transformation to support increased business agility and cost control, augmenting their Digital journey. This, paired with the benefits of avoiding system outages and focusing on increasing scalability and stability, were key influencers in pursuing this change.
products: Azure, Azure Cloud Services

title: Kodak Alaris enhances ERP resilience with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: As part of a brand that’s more than 130 years old and synonymous with imaging, Kodak Alaris combines the latest innovations in imaging science, artificial intelligence, and advanced process automation to help deliver digital transformation and smart business solutions to customers around the world. Their advanced, patented intellectual property combines breakthrough technologies and human know-how to unlock the power of images and information. They enable businesses to run faster and governments to run smarter by turning data into powerful, actionable insights, and they provide consumers with innovative solutions to preserve and enjoy their most cherished memories.
products: Dynamics 365 Finance, Dynamics 365 Sales

title: Qode Health Solutions secures COVID-19 vaccination records with the ledger feature in Azure SQL Database
executive_summary: Qode Health Solutions is a South African company working to bring about a healthcare revolution. Seeking a way to verify patient data updates during the COVID-19 pandemic, Qode initially created its own custom blockchain. After the proof of concept highlighted system maintenance issues, Qode instead tested the ledger feature in Microsoft Azure SQL Database. The ability to track updates securely and efficiently with familiar technology helped Qode give its clients access to highly trusted data in near real-time.

title: Godrej Industries leverages Microsoft services to modernize cybersecurity in the hybrid normal
executive_summary: Godrej Industries is the holding company of the Indian multinational conglomerate Godrej Group, with significant interests in consumer goods, real estate, agriculture, chemicals and financial services. It comprises of four business divisions - Godrej Chemicals, Godrej Agrovet, Godrej Consumer Products and Godrej Properties. When the pandemic-induced nation-wide lockdown was announced in 2020, Godrej Industries moved its entire workforce to remote work under the cloud security infrastructure powered by Microsoft.

title: Snow Peak fully utilizes Azure and Microsoft 365! A close look at the aims of their digital strategies for enhancing user experience values
executive_summary: Snow Peak, a developer, manufacturer, and marketer of high-end outdoor products centered on auto-camping products, is working to strengthen connections with users through the use of digital technologies in order to realize its social mission of restoring humanity by connecting people to nature and people to people. They are leveraging Microsoft Azure to build up a data platform for collecting and utilizing digital data and linking core systems and community apps to improve the value of user experience. In some cases, increasing the customer loyalty resulted in a 10-fold increase in purchase price per unit. We asked them about the aims of their digital strategies, the roles played by Azure, and their vision for the future.

executive_summary: Snow Peak, a developer, manufacturer, and marketer of high-end outdoor products centered on auto-camping products, is working to strengthen connections with users through the use of digital technologies in order to realize its social mission of restoring humanity by connecting people to nature and people to people.
