title: Dreaming big: how the Philippines is using Microsoft Reading Progress to build confidence and enhance future ready skills in a global economy
executive_summary: It is no secret among educators across the Philippines that students need confidence to feel comfortable speaking and participating in a classroom setting. Speaking in a second language can be all that much more difficult for students who are worried about judgement from their peers or teachers. To help, the educators and students across the Philippines highlight the power of Reading Progress to bolster the confidence of learners who were previously hesitant to participate in class conversations and to help them with their future careers.

title: TIBCO preserves personal banking in the digital world by using Azure
executive_summary: The challenge for ABN AMRO was a desire to use cloud technology to improve the customer experience, but the company wanted the personal part of banking to be preserved, digitally. Together, the combined capabilities of Azure and TIBCO Cloud Integration are helping ABN AMRO build modern applications and quickly respond to rapidly changing business needs. Banking transactions are now swifter and smoother. Customers receive credit cards in a couple of days, a process that used to take weeks. They can bank from their mobile devices anytime, anywhere. Loan processing is faster and smarter than ever, increasing company efficiency and improving client management.
products: Azure

title: Steward Health Care protects patient data in an evolving cyber pandemic through Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: Steward Health Care approaches the challenges of protecting its dispersed IT landscape with the same dedication that its clinicians apply to patient well-being. Noting the evolving threat landscape, the company evaluated security solution providers and cybersecurity partners. It allied with BlueVoyant and chose a comprehensive Microsoft security environment to cover its full range of security needs. The “better together” ecosystem of BlueVoyant and Microsoft enhanced its ability to adapt to the cyber pandemic—the surge in malicious attacks during the COVID-19 pandemic. The partnership succeeded, elevating security and bringing peace of mind to its security teams.
products: Azure Lighthouse, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Defender XDR, Microsoft Purview Information Protection, Microsoft Sentinel

title: University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign graduates 350,000 identities to cloud in 48 hours
executive_summary: In an identity management landscape where change and challenge are the only constants, the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign (U. of I.) Technology Services team manages user identities with a “people-centric” approach. Its recent Microsoft Azure Active Directory migration of 350,000 identities took one short, drama-free weekend. The university’s team offers advice and lessons learned for other organizations.
products: Microsoft Entra ID

title: Politecnico di Milano delivers actionable workforce sentiment insights with Microsoft Graph Data Connect
executive_summary: At the Department of Electronics Information and Bioengineering of Politecnico di Milano, a solution that delivers objective, granular data concerning employee sentiment at scale is in development. With Microsoft Graph Data Connect, Leonardo Di Perna, Data Analytics Manager at Politecnico di Milano began experimenting with a system that reveals de-identified collaboration and communication data from Microsoft 365 and maps it to easily digestible Power BI dashboards. Early industry participants from the banking, manufacturing, and service sectors have lauded the tool’s utility. These insights could soon either bolster or supplant employee surveys as the industry solution for detecting human sentiment.

title: Dentsu builds Azure-supported analytics platform to modernize data across the organization
executive_summary: Dentsu is a marketing and advertising network dedicated to brand partnership that delivers meaningful progress and growth through unique and innovative media campaigns and bespoke data-driven solutions. The global organization spans more than 145 markets with 65,000 employees, serving 11,000 clients.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Intelligent Data Platform, Microsoft Entra ID, Excel, Power BI

title: Vodafone Fiji gains scale, reliability, and ease of innovation by migrating its payment platform to Azure
executive_summary: Vodafone Fiji customers send and receive money and make purchases and payments through its M-PAiSA payment platform. Hoping to gain greater scale, resilience, innovation, and compliance, and to shed maintenance efforts and costs related to its aging hardware, the company migrated its on-premises platform to Microsoft Azure. With help from partner Onsys Technologies, Vodafone Fiji’s platform is now architected with a host of Azure infrastructure services. These have helped position the company to work more efficiently, easily scale for peak demand, and more easily develop and implement new features for continuous improvement.
products: Azure, Azure App Service, Azure Application Gateway, Azure Backup, Azure Blueprints, Azure ExpressRoute, Azure Load Balancer, Azure Monitor, Azure Virtual Machines, Windows Server

title: Tigera uses Azure capabilities to deliver active security for cloud-native apps
executive_summary: To ensure security of Kubernetes applications from external and internal threats, companies look to Tigera’s Calico Open-Source Solution, available in the Azure Marketplace. As the industry leader in container and Kubernetes security and observability, Tigera invented Calico, a networking and security solution for containers, virtual machines, and native host-based workloads. As an independent software vendor (ISV), Tigera works hand in hand with Microsoft to build, innovate, market, and sell the best solutions on Azure for any emerging customer demand.

title: Isuzu Motors Limited drives workstyle innovation at new headquarters with Microsoft Teams Phone and 130 Microsoft Teams Rooms
executive_summary: For over 100 years, Isuzu Motors Limited has been creating prosperous and satisfying global lifestyles with commercial vehicles for transporting goods and the diesel engines that power them. In May 2022, the company relocated its head office to Yokohama Gate Tower to drive dynamic and diverse workstyles, using Microsoft Teams Phone and Microsoft Teams Rooms as a platform for the initiative. The new headquarters forgoes a PBX, instead using company-supplied notebook PCs and headsets for internal and external connection and 130 Teams Rooms for effortless remote meetings. This setup delivers greater convenience than conventional business phones and slashes deployment and expansion costs. Employees who visit factories or work from home can now communicate efficiently. While the new environment is currently limited to the new head office and some affiliates, Isuzu Motors Limited has expansion plans for other offices.
products: Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Teams Rooms, Microsoft Teams Phone

title: Shueisha Builds Data Analysis Platform on Azure to Assess "Power of Works"! Aiming for Further Data Utilization Through On-Site Leadership
executive_summary: Shueisha, a general publisher celebrating its 100th anniversary in 2026, has built a data analysis platform to collect and analyze a variety of internal and external data. The publishing industry is expanding its domain from sales of paper magazines and comic books to content-centered businesses such as animation, movies, and events amid increasing digitalization and media franchising. In such an environment, Shueisha needed a data analysis platform to assess the "power of works." We asked about Shueisha's efforts to promote "site-centric" data utilization using Azure Synapse Analytics, Microsoft Power BI, and Microsoft Purview.
products: Azure, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Synapse Analytics, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Purview, Power BI

title: Hilti future-proofs its IT environment using RISE with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: As a premier supplier for the construction industry, Hilti has dedicated itself to making construction better. As the construction industry increasingly moves towards digitalization, the company recognized a great benefit in transforming its IT environment and moving its on-premises SAP landscape to the cloud, including its business-critical enterprise resource planning application. In less than a year, Hilti accelerated its continuous innovation roadmap for the future by migrating to RISE with SAP on Azure, reinforcing its product quality, innovative spirit, and direct customer relationships. By moving its SAP landscape to Microsoft Azure, Hilti enabled its IT team to move any remaining server infrastructure, including Linux and Windows workloads, to the Microsoft cloud and close down its on-premises datacenter, increasing resilience, minimizing downtime, and preparing for more rapid growth.
products: Azure, Azure Firewall, Azure Storage, SAP on Azure

title: Kindeva combines four ERP systems into one using Dynamics 365 and remote collaboration
executive_summary: Kindeva Drug Delivery (Kindeva), formerly 3M Drug Delivery Systems, is a growing contract development and manufacturing organization (CDMO) focused on autoinjector, inhalation, transdermal, and intradermal technologies. The company makes everything from nebulizers and inhalers to microneedle-based delivery devices and drug-in adhesive patches. In early 2020, Kindeva began the process of becoming a standalone company and needed a way to extricate its data from 3M and move it into a new enterprise resource planning (ERP) system with the capability to scale.
products: Azure SQL Database, Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Finance, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams

title: Versar unifies its global data tracking and reporting thanks to Xoriant’s expertise and Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: Versar is a program management company delivering world-class technical and management support to governments and companies around the world. The firm focuses operations in the engineering and construction management, environmental services, and professional services segments and needed to automate its data capturing, processing, and reporting processes. Xoriant used its deep data and engineering expertise to build a solution using Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics pipelines and Power BI to fulfill Versar's reporting needs.
products: Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

title: Aexa enters a new frontier of communication with the Microsoft HoloLens
executive_summary: Aexa Aerospace produces creative solutions for training and operational support using mixed reality, augmented reality, and virtual reality. The company worked with Microsoft to create a solution using holographic teleportation where 3D models of people are virtually reconstructed as a three-dimensional figure elsewhere in real time. Aexa is developing the Microsoft HoloLens and the Aexa Holowizard© solutions in the health, energy, defense, and aerospace sectors, so that remote subject matters experts like surgeons can be “in the room” and provide better communication and support. Using the solution, Aexa CEO Fernando De La Peña Llaca and his team became the first humans to use holographic teleportation from Earth into space.

title: INPEX Migrates AVEVA PI System to Azure for Enhanced Data Analytics Promoting Sustainable Energy Development
executive_summary: INPEX, known for enabling sustainability for the energy industry, has migrated its IoT data management software, AVEVA™ PI System™, from on-premise servers to Microsoft Azure. The company's system operations have not only been streamlined with the move to a cloud-based IoT platform, but also allows a variety of possibilities. These include data visualization, business insights, and in-house app development through integration with Microsoft 365 E5. Azure is now empowering the company’s drive for its digital transformation strategy.
products: Azure, Azure ExpressRoute, Microsoft 365 E5, Power Automate, Power BI

title: PLDT pioneers AI-powered customer care with WIZ.AI voice AI solution on Azure
executive_summary: The Philippines’ largest telecommunications provider PLDT became the first company in the telco industry to expand its existing suite of customer service channels with a voice artificial intelligence solution. PLDT deployed the Talkbot Pro, a product of Microsoft partner WIZ.AI, via a contract with PLDT’s ICT subsidiary, ePLDT, to assist the collections team in delivering hyper-personalized customer experiences. The solution resides securely on ePLDT’s Azure Stack Hub, which ensures data compliance and sovereignty. As a result, the company has had a boost in efficiency, increased collections revenue, and streamlined back-end operations.

title: Bossard fastens its future to innovations in the cloud with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The Bossard Group (SWX: BOSN) is a leading global provider of industrial fastening and assembly technology solutions and services. Founded in Zug, Switzerland in 1831, today the Bossard Group has 2,925 employees at 82 locations in 32 countries offering more than 1 million items. Companies from local businesses to multinationals count on Bossard’s expertise to increase their productivity. The Bossard Group generated CHF 1,153.8 million in sales in FY2022.

title: Arraya Solutions cuts costs by 50% with Data-Driven's CloudMonitor, built on Microsoft products
executive_summary: Arraya Solutions, a managed service provider for Microsoft Azure, was looking for ways to enhance its internal systems so it could share these strategies with its clients. Working with Microsoft partner Data-Driven, Arraya Solutions installed CloudMonitor into its Azure tenancy. CloudMonitor furnished cost analytics via Microsoft Power BI, ultimately allowing Arraya Solutions to achieve cost savings of 50 percent. Arraya Solutions then extended this approach to its clients, spotlighting trends, recommendations, and additional meta details about their Azure resources, resulting in an average cost reduction of 15 percent to 20 percent.
products: Azure, Microsoft Teams, Power BI

title: Al Babtain Group enhances security, analytics, and productivity with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Al Babtain Group, a leading Kuwaiti conglomerate, ventured into a digital transformation. Their aim? To supercharge efficiency and spark innovation across their expansive array of sectors. With Microsoft 365 E5 and Azure, it elevated its security from rudimentary to robust, scoring an impressive 80 Microsoft Secure Score. With an integrated, scalable environment that includes Dynamics 365 and Power Platform, AI Babtain Group has streamlined workflows, empowered employees while enabling quick and informed decision-making.

title: E.ON turns to Windows 365 to deliver a scalable, reliable, and modern cloud solution for flexible work
executive_summary: E.ON, one of Europe’s largest energy companies, boasts some 48 million international customers. As part of its drive to reduce on-premises infrastructure, E.ON chose Windows 365 to replace an existing on-premises virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) solution that was difficult to scale and costly to maintain. By introducing Windows 365, E.ON empowered more employees to work from anywhere. The business simplified management with Microsoft Intune and supports Windows 11 on all Cloud PCs for a harmonized environment. E.ON will also evaluate Windows 365 Frontline to extend Cloud PC offerings to its call center workers.

title: Unbanked no more: CWallet empowers migrant workers to access financial services with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: For migrant workers in Qatar, accessing financial services can be hugely challenging. That’s where CWallet comes in—”We want to foster inclusivity and bring full financial services to an underserved community and to microbusinesses,” shares Co-founder and CEO of CWallet Michael Javier. With Microsoft Azure, the company has built a secure fintech platform that is trusted among its customers and set up for strong business continuity.

title: Info-Tech offers speedy, cost-friendly HR system on Microsoft Azure, leading to 10x growth in customer base
executive_summary: Info-Tech Systems helps businesses transform their human resources (HR) operations. Finding it hard to maintain an on-premises HR management system (HRMS), the company migrated its application to the cloud using Microsoft Azure for efficiency and scalability. This strategic move helps Info-Tech deploy software 97% faster and save 50% on maintenance costs. Customers now enjoy reduced downtime, enhanced security, and instant access to HR services. As a result, Info-Tech saw a 10x increase in its customer base and a 90% rise in customer retention.

title: IT democratization: VW AG rolls out Power Platform throughout the Group to structure data, increase process speed, and cut costs
executive_summary: Volkswagen AG has set a course for transformation: the Group plans to become a software-oriented mobility provider by 2030. In pursuit of this goal, the Integrity & Legal Affairs (ILA) corporate division set about replacing its multiple stand-alone solutions with an integrated IT solution based on Microsoft Power Platform. This established a Group-wide IT platform—one that has the potential to massively cut costs.
products: Power Apps

title: Finance in the fast lane: AHAM Capital digitizes operations with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: In a transformative journey, AHAM Capital, one of Malaysia's top asset managers, has boldly embraced digitization by shifting its operations to the Microsoft Azure cloud. This strategic pivot has expedited customer onboarding, transactions, and enhanced customer experiences. The company has digitized 75% of customer transactions and seen a drastic increase in data accuracy. With the right foundation for scalability and flexibility, AHAM Capital is set to form new partnerships with digital players and reach new markets.
products: Azure, Azure API Management, Azure Compute Gallery, Microsoft 365, Microsoft 365 Enterprise

title: BBK moves from past to future, reshaping its home décor retail business with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Polish company BBK S.A. helps to create elegant, functional interiors through its selection of home décor and textile products under the home&you and Essex brands. Due to new strategic directions and digital disruptions, BBK prioritized investments in modern technologies, focusing on cloud-based solutions. One of the first choices made was Microsoft Dynamics 365. The move streamlined operations across 130+ stores and ensured business continuity for BBK. The result: a company set towards a culture where innovation thrives and every member contributes to BBK’s success.

title: Business law firm Fidal designs a new future of work with 2,000 new Surface Laptops
executive_summary: Fidal is France’s largest independent business law firm, with more than 2,300 global employees. To help support more flexible, highly secure work, Fidal chose to deploy Surface Laptops (4 and 5) across the business, 2,000 devices in total. Today, employees are working more productively, securely, and flexibly from anywhere.

title: Memphis-Shelby County Schools drive educational excellence with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: Managing the twenty-third-largest school district in the United States is a massive undertaking that presents diverse challenges. For the team responsible for the 110,000 students across 214 campuses that make up Memphis-Shelby County Schools (MSCS), technology plays a vital role in the effort to keep everything running smoothly. However, with the rapidly changing pace of work inside the world of schools and academics, the need for new tools can rapidly outpace available solutions. To address the need for novel, custom tools without the requirement of costly and lengthy new adoptions, MSCS recently began looking for a high return on investment solution tailored to its diverse data gathering and reporting needs and leveraged Microsoft Power Apps data acquisition and reporting for leaders and staff across the organization, using Microsoft Power Automate.
products: Azure SQL, Power Apps, Power Automate, Dataverse, Power BI, Power Pages

title: Siemens Healthineers China expedites product time to market with Microsoft Dev Box
executive_summary: Siemens Healthineers China develops new image applications for online systems to help doctors with remote consulting for patients. Developers were using local workstations to develop and test for multiple platforms, but just setting up each platform could take days—time better spent on development and testing. Healthineers began piloting Microsoft Dev Box in 2023. It enabled them to prebuild multiple bespoke dev and test environments in the cloud, enabling developers worldwide to collaborate and complete projects faster.

title: Accenture upgrades the experience for over 700,000 employees with Windows 11 Enterprise and Intune
executive_summary: Accenture, a leading global professional services company specializing in digital, cloud, and security services, is a force in the industry for good reason. With a history of scaling Microsoft technology across its 738,000 employee-strong organization, it continuously seeks to modernize its workplace and employee experience while offering the highest performing technology across all levels of its business.

title: Inclusion is essential: Elbe-Werkstätten optimizes its processes based on low-code with Microsoft Power Apps
executive_summary: Elbe-Werkstätten GmbH employs more than 3,000 people with disabilities. At over 50 locations in the Hamburg area, the company offers attractive, short-commute jobs in everything from hospitality to landscaping to its own IT department—all with the best possible levels of support and integration. Managing such a large, decentralized organization calls for a unified approach to communication, collaboration, and administration across all locations. Now, in collaboration with partner CGI, Elbe-Werkstätten is moving away from paper-based processes and establishing a new IT infrastructure. Here, too, the goal is to maximize employee inclusion. Underpinning this endeavor are Microsoft’s cloud solutions Azure Logic Apps, Power Apps, and Power Platform.
products: Azure Logic Apps, Microsoft Teams, Power Apps

title: From weeks to days, hours to seconds: PIC automates work processes to save time with Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: In the petrochemical industry, staying ahead means leveraging cutting-edge technology. Petrochemical Industries Company (PIC) has done just that, transforming its operations with Copilot for Microsoft 365. From drafting emails to generating complex documents in minutes, Copilot has not only enhanced productivity and data security but also fostered a more professional communication style across the company.

title: Khansaheb Civil Engineering enhances fieldwork efficiency and digital security with Microsoft 365 E3
executive_summary: Khansaheb Civil Engineering has played a pivotal role in the development of the United Arab Emirates for the past 89 years. As the company grew, it accrued inefficiencies, such as data spread across 300 on-premises servers, conflicting domain policies, and outdated systems that complicated remote access and collaboration. To streamline its technology infrastructure, Khansaheb Civil Engineering adopted Microsoft 365 E3. The shift improved online security through advanced threat protection and identity management, used SharePoint to store data, and Teams to enhance remote collaboration. The result—streamlined operations, reduced costs, and improved cybersecurity. Employees can now work seamlessly on-site with fewer safety risks and operational costs, and higher overall productivity.

title: Vitalant reliably gets life-saving blood donations to patients with the help of Surface devices
executive_summary: Vitalant collects and distributes donated blood and blood products to help save patients’ lives across the US. To gain efficiencies that will make their operations even more reliable, Vitalant upgraded its laptops to Surface Devices. Enabling employees to securely work on the go helps the nonprofit to consistently work with volunteers, hospitals, and community organizations to maintain the critical blood supply.

title: Achieving One Fujitsu with Red Hat Enterprise Linux on Azure for Enhanced Security and Operational Efficiency
executive_summary: As Fujitsu Limited fulfills its digital transformation, it’s adopting a new One Fujitsu model. This initiative aims to build trust in society and realize a more sustainable world through innovation by working with customers undergoing a sustainability transformation.

title: Dynamics 365 is key to MSI’s global impact on reproductive healthcare
executive_summary: MSI chose Dynamics 365 Customer Service and Customer Voice to leverage each point of client contact and optimize customer relationship management to provide the highest levels of continuous care. MSI’s implementation has driven increased collaboration and efficiency with more accurate and more timely data, and a higher quality of care for its clients.
products: Power Apps, Dynamics 365 Customer Voice, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Sales, Power BI

title: McKnight Foundation accelerates its mission and supports community partners with Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: The Minnesota-based McKnight Foundation supports projects that promote justice, racial equity, the arts, and economic abundance locally and around the world. In line with its culture of innovation, it wanted to experiment with AI to improve internal operations.

title: Microsoft Azure, Power Platform, and more: Microsoft Skilling helps ZF achieve company-wide IT transformation
executive_summary: ZF Friedrichshafen (ZF) is a global technology company that produces mobility systems for cars, commercial vehicles, and industrial engineering. It is also in the middle of a comprehensive IT transformation. At locations around the world, lots of digital applications have been migrated from local datacenters to the cloud. To make this transition easier on its employees, ZF is offering basic training through Microsoft Skilling—standardized worldwide, available anytime, and managed centrally. Microsoft Skilling also serves as the basis for ZF to offer additional, customized training.
products: Azure

title: Ready to work the same day: Onboarding externals at Instone Real Estate with Windows 365 Cloud PC
executive_summary: At a time when living space is in short supply, property developers like Instone Real Estate are doing their part to develop lots and create new homes. The company designs everything from apartment buildings to entire urban neighborhoods. To make all this happen, Instone relies on external employees, who provide their expertise for limited periods. Constantly having to onboard new people involves providing them with the appropriate hardware. To optimize this time-consuming and resource-heavy process, Instone uses Windows 365 Cloud PC.

title: Employees at Principal Financial Group use Microsoft Viva Goals to drive strategic alignment and enable business growth
executive_summary: Principal was successfully tracking ongoing corporate strategy within its multiple lines of business, but mapping goals across the entire company created challenges. Aligning to an enterprise-wide strategic vision was necessary for future company growth. Viva Goals integration with Microsoft 365 apps allowed the company to incorporate the product into daily workflows. Using a Microsoft 365 E3 license, the company deployed Viva Goals in a phased rollout to align priorities. The company's check-in Pulse Survey reported employee sentiment as a positive 4% increase from five months earlier.

title: Lerøy Seafood Group uses Power Platform to improve reporting and reduce costs by millions of dollars
executive_summary: The Lerøy Seafood Group is the third largest producer of salmon and trout in the world. As part of a digitization strategy to improve data sharing and streamline operations, the company purchased over 4,000 Premium Power Apps licenses. Together with an automated Center of Excellence to improve governance and development quality, makers at Lerøy have leveraged the premium capabilities of Power Platform to develop an exciting wave of new enterprise applications, with just one solution saving millions annually in operational costs.

title: Dynamics 365 is key to MSI’s global impact on reproductive healthcare
executive_summary: MSI chose Dynamics 365 Customer Service and Customer Voice to leverage each point of client contact and optimize customer relationship management to provide the highest levels of continuous care. MSI’s implementation has driven increased collaboration and efficiency with more accurate and more timely data, and a higher quality of care for its clients.

title: McKnight Foundation accelerates its mission and supports community partners with Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: The Minnesota-based McKnight Foundation supports projects that promote justice, racial equity, the arts, and economic abundance locally and around the world. In line with its culture of innovation, it wanted to experiment with AI to improve internal operations.

title: Lightning protection is personal safety: DEHN optimizes sales with Dynamics 365 Sales
executive_summary: DEHN faces challenges in construction projects: long durations, frequent plan changes, and many contacts. The sales team must identify these evolving needs and provide the appropriate lightning protection solutions.
products: Dynamics 365 Sales

title: Insight boosts efficiency and security while driving future growth with Surface, Windows 11, and Copilot
executive_summary: Insight wanted to improve productivity by streamlining processes and onboarding. Stronger security and privacy measures were needed to avoid potential vulnerabilities. Scalable solutions were needed to improve delivery quality, accuracy, and speed.
products: Surface Laptop, Windows 11, Surface, Surface Pro, Microsoft Teams, Windows Hello, Microsoft Viva Engage

title: BISA Seguros saved $23,000 annually and improved teamwork with Microsoft Teams Phone
executive_summary: BISA Seguros needed to replace its legacy telephony systems, overhaul the network architecture, and train its staff to move from analog to digital communication, unifying all communications in one collaborative platform.
products: Microsoft Teams Phone, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Teams Rooms

title: LTIMindtree empowers security teams with the speed and scale of AI using Microsoft Copilot for Security
executive_summary: LTIMindtree faced challenges with swift incident responses in the evolving cybersecurity landscape. The ongoing battle against cyber threats diverted time and effort from developing innovative solutions, leading to additional work efforts.
products: Dynamics 365 Commerce, Dynamics 365 Finance, Microsoft Teams

title: Mercedes-Benz R&D creates 'container-driven cars' powered by Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: “Container-driven cars” is the name jokingly proposed by the Connected Cars Platform team at Mercedes-Benz Research and Development (R&D). The concept refers to a microservices-based architecture that relies on containers to fetch and push app updates at the scale of the Internet of Things (IoT). But connected cars are no joke. The software that assists drivers and automates tasks requires precision engineering. Using cloud-native services on Azure, the R&D team freed developers from the limitations of a hardware-driven release cycle, where software updates could happen only once or twice a year. Today developers create new versions as fast as they want and ship new solutions to market in just three months, thanks to a mix of agile tools and managed services on Azure for Kubernetes, APIs, and databases.

title: Microsoft pivots to digital selling with Dynamics 365 to reach more customers
executive_summary: Microsoft has flipped the traditional sales model over the past few years, from inside sales teams supporting field sales teams to those inside teams now outnumbering their field counterparts. Today, more than 2,500 digital sellers serve customers from eight sales centers around the world. As more customers move to digital buying, the volume of leads generated has grown exponentially. To keep up, Microsoft Digital Sales turned to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales and Sales Insights to scale for increased demand, engage customers remotely, and increase seller productivity.
products: Dynamics 365 AI, Dynamics 365 Sales, Microsoft Relationship Sales, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Microsoft Teams

title: University aces fast transition to Azure Virtual Desktop to keep people safe, data secure
executive_summary: When Keiser University had to temporarily close 21 campuses because of COVID-19, it didn’t have the luxury of time. What it did have was an innovative, forward-thinking IT team that had already looked into Azure Virtual Desktop for classroom use. With less than five business days to create the infrastructure that would support 3,800 people working from home, the Keiser IT team needed a highly secure, easily deployed technology. They rolled out Azure Virtual Desktop without incident, saving the day for students, faculty, and staff. Using Microsoft security solutions, they’ve provided the environment the university needs to safeguard sensitive information remotely and help reimagine academia in the cloud.

title: Siemens Healthineers delivers services to customers’ on-premises machines with Azure Arc
executive_summary: Siemens Healthineers delivers digital services to cloud-connected customers through the teamplay digital health platform, a software platform it developed and manages in Microsoft Azure. By using Azure Arc, Siemens Healthineers can manage and set governance rules for clients’ scanners and other hospital machines remotely, while still keeping critical customer data in the on-premises machines. Siemens Healthineers can also use teamplay to provide near real-time software updates to on-premises equipment and provision it with a variety of new services and capabilities developed by its software partners.

title: Chobani grows a culture of innovation, fast business development by moving to SAP on Azure
executive_summary: Food maker Chobani grew quickly and needed an IT environment that could keep up with future growth and changes. The company chose to implement SAP S/4HANA and other SAP applications on Microsoft Azure. With assistance from its current support partner Khoj Information Technology, Chobani continues to enhance a high-availability environment using the latest technologies like SUSE Pacemaker Clusters and Azure Site Recovery. The company now has a unified environment, better uptime, and instant scaling—all which will help the company operate more smoothly and analyze data to make fast, innovative business decisions.

title: The key to business agility at Swiss Re is greater efficiency—and a Cloud Center of Excellence
executive_summary: Swiss Re’s strategic alliance with Microsoft has dual goals: creating entirely new digital markets as well as a new cloud-based operating platform to host them. The global reinsurer sees Microsoft providing far more than great technology: helping to drive innovation, creating new business models, and fostering a new mindset and cultural shift away from centralized command-and-control and toward central standards with business-side autonomy.

title: Alpega Group is improving sustainability in the transport industry with a container solution managed by Microsoft and Red Hat
executive_summary: Leading global logistics software company, Alpega Group, helps coordinate the transportation of freight in 80 countries. Working with 80,000 carriers and 200,000 members, it is a huge and complex operation that relies on the company’s Transport Management System (TMS). So, when the company decided to implement a new container management system built on Microsoft Azure Red Hat OpenShift, it meant changing the infrastructure that underpins the entire business. That change has facilitated greater agility, flexibility, and stability for Alpega’s Smart Booking system, allowing the company to respond to demand and scale its operations accordingly. This transformation is helping Alpega to optimize freight transportation and create a more sustainability within the industry.

title: Scaling secure enclave environments with Signal and Azure confidential computing
executive_summary: Signal is a free, open-source, private messaging application designed to protect the privacy of messages and user data. The nonprofit organization had employed Microsoft Azure confidential computing as one of its cloud solutions, using secure enclaves to host back-end services. When the app soared to a top position in app stores across the world in 2021, Signal quickly scaled up its confidential computing workloads on Azure, taking advantage of the platform’s high availability, reliability, and support during the massive growth.
products: Azure

title: Lumen’s strategic leap: How Copilot is redefining productivity and employee engagement
executive_summary: Lumen Technologies is redefining customer success and sales processes through the strategic use of AI-powered Microsoft Copilot, enhancing productivity, sales, and customer service in the global communications sector. This transition is part of Lumen’s shift from traditional telecom services to a technology-driven, innovative, and efficient enterprise. Copilot supports Lumen’s operations by automating routine tasks and significantly reducing the workload on employees so they can focus on higher-value activities. Key leaders advocate for the role Copilot can play in increasing productivity without expanding the workforce while fostering a culture that values work-life balance. This initiative has not only strengthened Lumen’s competitive edge but has also redefined the inclusion of technology in corporate strategies.

title: Organica Water optimizes wastewater treatment processes while driving sustainability with Azure and Power BI
executive_summary: Organica facilities appear far more like beautiful botanical gardens than wastewater treatment plants. By enabling customers around the world to build and operate space- and energy-efficient biological water treatment facilities, Organica Water is helping address the challenge of urban water scarcity. With more than 120 treatment plants, it’s important to have an efficient way to remotely monitor and actively manage water quality, Organica turned to Microsoft Azure and Power BI for a solution. Today, the bio-centric company is better equipped to ensure only the purest water is made available for re-use, while advancing in their sustainability goals by reducing travel, manual work and energy use.

title: Dynamics 365 improves collaboration and user experience at global bank, HSBC
executive_summary: “The pace is fast in terms of trying to keep up with the latest technologies, but also to keep up with our competitors,” emphasises Harsha Goodlad, CIO Frontline Effectiveness, Marketing & Sustainability, Wholesale Banking, at HSBC.

title: Coca-Cola Bottling Shqipëria unifies operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Coca-Cola Bottling Shqipëria (CCBS) is the only official bottling partner in Albania, part of the Coca-Cola system. The company runs a complex business, serving thousands of points of sale and delivery locations with a range of refreshing drinks. Needing to move past manual processes and lengthy reporting cycles, CCBS chose to implement Dynamics 365 Finance and Supply Chain Management for its flexibility and ease of integration. Now, the company and its partners enjoy streamlined daily operations, as deeper, real-time connectivity between business areas helps bring people closer together.
products: Azure, Dynamics 365 Finance, Power BI

title: QAED, School Education Department, Government of Punjab, supports remote training and collaboration with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Quaid-e-Azam Academy for Educational Development (QAED), under the School Education department, Government of Punjab, is a premier ISO certified teacher training institution that takes the lead in implementing the Single National Curriculum for Primary to Higher secondary schools. Backed by the Government, the Pakistan-based organization empowers 368,000 private and public teachers with future skills, preparing them for the new framework via Microsoft Teams. The tool helps QAED train more teachers faster and differentiate classes, which has improved the quality of instruction while reducing on-site training expenditures.

executive_summary: Alan, Mr. Turing’s software-as-a-service product, uses cognitive intelligence to understand documents that were written by humans for humans—and then use that knowledge to help humans immediately find the information they need. Alan’s digital “memory” contains about 1 million pages of information, which Alan uses to answer some 2,000 questions per day.

title: Sulava keeps its employees connected and its audience engaged with Microsoft Teams Premium
executive_summary: With Teams Premium, Sulava is taking advantage of capabilities like intelligent recap, real-time collaboration, advanced security, and branding to expand the reach and security of its meetings.

title: Government Savings Bank digitalizes operations to serve customers better with Power Apps
executive_summary: Government Savings Bank aims to build a sustainable economy by eliminating poverty and reducing inequality in Thailand. To reach this goal, the bank looked into digital transformation to improve its financial services and serve Thai people’s needs. It sought Microsoft Power Apps and Power Platform’s capabilities to establish a digital branch for customers as well as optimize internal hiring, reporting, and data collection processing. As a result, operations have become agile, increasing customer and employee satisfaction.

title: South African Board of Jewish Education’s digital transformation journey in partnership with Buzzbotics, and Microsoft
executive_summary: King David Schools, under the auspices of the South African Board of Jewish Education (SABJE) are a network of Jewish schools in Johannesburg offering PrePrimary through to High School education across five campuses in Johannesburg. King David Schools currently has 3300 students and 300 educators in our family of schools.

title: An education and training tool that utilizes MR and digital twin technologies to improve engineer skills to ensure expressway safety
executive_summary: The expressway network of Japan has been constantly expanded since the 1960s and its total road length is currently over 10,000km. On the other hand, more than half of the expressway network has been used for over 30 years and aging of structures such as road surfaces, bridges, and tunnels has emerged as a social issue. The dwindling number of expressway maintenance and management engineers in line with the decline in the productive population is also one of the significant challenges.

title: Domino’s Pizza: Ensuring customer satisfaction with data-driven demand planning in Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Domino’s Pizza UK & Ireland Ltd. is squarely focused on its mission to deliver a better future through food people love while creating positive opportunities for its colleagues and the communities it serves. To create exceptional customer experiences and deliver the right product to the right store at the right time, expert inventory planners had been predicting demand using hundreds of spreadsheets. Domino’s optimized its forecasting by tapping into Microsoft Dynamics 365 with demand planning capabilities and the game-changing capabilities of AI, automation, and analytics.
products: Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Finance

title: Financial services leader Hargreaves Lansdown adopts Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Teams Premium to drive productivity and improve customer experiences
executive_summary: Hargreaves Lansdown, a leading UK financial services company, has deployed Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Teams Premium to increase employee productivity and enhance client service. Within months, the new tools have delivered quantifiable benefits: financial advisors expect to complete client documentation 4 times faster, employees save an estimated 2 to 3 hours per week, and 96 percent find Microsoft 365 Copilot useful in simplifying daily tasks.

title: Accenture transforms its infrastructure using RISE with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: To continue to extend its cutting-edge solution and service offerings, Accenture needed to enhance its infrastructure and unify operations to support more simplified and accelerated digital transformation for current and future customers. The company chose RISE with SAP on Microsoft Azure as a comprehensive solution to enhance security, interoperability, and innovation and to simplify infrastructure management. By using RISE with SAP on Azure, Accenture strengthened its infrastructure and improved integration of financial data, reporting capabilities, and transaction processing across multiple lines of business and regions—all of which is critical for regulatory compliance and operational resilience. With this foundation, Accenture is poised to revolutionize its business with AI, starting with the financial advisor application, an AI-driven tool supporting the company’s financial services.

title: LS ELECTRIC uses data to optimize power consumption with Sight Machine and Microsoft Cloud for Manufacturing
executive_summary: LS ELECTRIC, in collaboration with Sight Machine and Microsoft, is revolutionizing manufacturing sustainability and productivity through data optimization. By standardizing unstructured data, LS ELECTRIC gleans detailed insights into energy consumption, leading to a 20% reduction in power use on some manufacturing lines and integrating systems for better decision-making. This partnership drives towards a future of sustainable manufacturing, leveraging Microsoft Cloud for Manufacturing and Microsoft Copilot to drive efficiency and competitive operation.

title: Chalhoub Group’s People Analytics team speeds reporting with Microsoft Fabric
executive_summary: Agility is a key advantage for companies in every industry, but it can be a business-defining edge for retail. Chalhoub Group, a regional luxury retailer headquartered in the United Arab Emirates, was looking to improve the HR approval process, removing the need for consolidating and accessing data from scattered platforms. Microsoft Fabric allowed Chalhoub Group’s HR function to modernize its data analytics and streamline its data sources into one platform, increasing agility, enhancing analytics, and accelerating processes.

title: Asahi Europe & International charts new paths in employee productivity with Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: N/A

title: Efficiency inside and out: EPAM streamlines communications for teams and clients with Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: EPAM, an early adopter of many cutting-edge technologies, decided to integrate artificial intelligence (AI) into its daily work. With operations in 55 countries and more than 50,000 employees, EPAM’s software engineering and business consulting services require accuracy, speed, and superb collaboration and communication. Copilot for Microsoft 365 lends an impartial, thorough, efficient hand. After ensuring more productivity in-house, EPAM positioned itself to guide clients through their own AI journeys, all while maintaining stringent data security.

title: Vestas moves to Azure high-performance computing for reliability, performance, and scalability
executive_summary: With more than 40 years of experience in wind energy and wind turbines installed in 88 countries, Vestas strives to be the global leader in sustainable energy solutions. The company requires vast amounts of computing power to perform turbine simulations that ensure the proper configuration and placement of turbines and wind farms to maximize energy output and prolong equipment life. Vestas’s on-premises supercomputer couldn’t keep up with an extensive simulation queue, resulting in business delays. By moving to Microsoft Azure and Azure high-performance computing, Vestas has improved reliability and capacity while reducing maintenance overhead and costs. This is opening new product and service opportunities while helping ensure a greener future for the planet.

title: Seair Exim Solutions delivers data at lightning speed with Microsoft Fabric Real-Time Analytics
executive_summary: Seair Exim Solutions provides export-import trade data to thousands of customers globally. When its specialized data platform, Eximpedia, started slowing down with the increasing volume of data it handled, Seair knew it needed to take action. The company teamed up with Mandelbulb Technologies to migrate its back-end system onto Microsoft Fabric. The move increased data ingestion speed by 90% and added more advanced search and visualization features, creating an even more robust solution that provides fast and reliable insights into the shipping industry.

title: University of Sharjah leaps ahead into AI-enhanced IT security with Microsoft Sentinel, Azure, and Defender for Cloud
executive_summary: UAE’s University of Sharjah is blazing the TechEd trail, keeping sensitive research projects, student records, and online classes highly secure while also saving on manpower and system downtime. In a game-changing cybersecurity move, the University transitioned from a cumbersome manual platform to Microsoft Sentinel. When correlated with Defender and Azure, it covered 70 percent of threat vectors overnight and automated 20 percent of security use cases within 48 manhours. With AI-driven defense against thousands of daily alerts, the University has swiftly moved from complexity to confidence, handling 80 percent of security operations with a standard system administrator.

title: mBank strengthens cloud capability through upskilling with Microsoft Learn
executive_summary: mBank, one of Poland’s most innovative banks, is preparing to move its applications to the cloud. To make the most of the migration, the bank has also begun upskilling employees in this area and implementing a comprehensive learning program with Microsoft. With over 40 percent of IT personnel having benefited from the courses, the employees can strengthen their cloud capabilities. “Now that our team knows cloud technologies inside out, we can make sure that everything goes according to the plan,” says Adam Ksit, IT Deputy Director at mBank.

title: Södra plants a seed for climate neutrality with Microsoft Sustainability Manager
executive_summary: International forest industry group Södra has set itself ambitious sustainability goals. A collection of more than 50,000 family foresters in southern Sweden with an encompassing range of products, the association estimates that its positive climate impact is roughly equal to one-fifth of Sweden’s emissions. Södra became the industry giant it is today through its forward-thinking, innovative approach. The association’s intent focus on sustainability—not just for its industry or even its nation, but the planet—led it to its current drive to collect and interpret climate impact data for every part of the value chain. That’s why Södra is setting the pace for sustainability in its industry with Microsoft Sustainability Manager, a solution within Microsoft Cloud for Sustainability.

title: Manulife puts customers first and drives innovation using Microsoft cloud solutions
executive_summary: Manulife is on a journey to becoming a digital, customer-centric leader, and therefore it understands the value of the cloud in achieving its goal within financial services. Manulife chose Microsoft Azure as one of its cloud platforms, migrating and modernizing its business-critical applications to improve agility, scalability, risk management, and cost-efficiency and to accelerate the support of new business models. The company makes smart use of cloud capabilities like Azure and Microsoft Teams to build digital experiences and help its employees and customers work together and stay connected from anywhere. This capability proved to be an essential part of the company’s COVID-19 response.

title: DHS South Australia leverages Dynamics 365 to support vulnerable community members
executive_summary: The Department of Human Services South Australia needed to digitise its infrastructure to support the management of high-risk domestic violence cases. Reliance on paper-based methods and COVID-19 restrictions hindered timely support for victims.

title: Sensei consolidates solutions, automates workflows, and improves security with Microsoft 365 and Copilot
executive_summary: Sensei is a wellbeing retreat company that wanted to consolidate and integrate several third-party software tools while embracing secure use of generative AI.

title: additiv provides scalable and personalized financial solutions with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: additiv needed a scalable cloud solution to provide banks, insurers, and consumer brands around the globe with efficient, innovative services.

title: Visual Comfort & Co. gains critical supply chain visibility with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: A series of mergers and acquisitions left Visual Comfort & Co. with fragmented product and customer data. A complex supply chain featuring overseas manufacturing and shipping made it hard for sales staff to know when products would be available.

title: Research nonprofit RTI International improves the human condition with Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: The independent research institute RTI International enables clients to create evidence-based public policy and data-backed best practices in the realms of social science, engineering, international development, and laboratory sciences. The nonprofit adopted Microsoft 365 Copilot to empower staff to gain productivity wherever possible. RTI anticipates that greater efficiency will allow staff to focus on their areas of expertise, delivering even better science-backed solutions for clients.

title: Belgotex unifies sales and manufacturing operations with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Belgotex, a South African carpet manufacturer with global operations, faced inefficiencies due to outdated and disparate systems. Critical data was scattered and departments were disconnected, hindering informed decision-making.

title: Solistica transforms the collaboration and security environment of more than 7,000 employees with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Its growing expansion and unification of six companies in seven countries in Latin America indicated Solistica’s need to standardize and unify its collaboration system for more than 7,000 employees, choosing Microsoft 365 as the base platform. Quickly and remotely, the Mexican company adopted a multitude of productivity tools while transforming its security environment.

title: Marks & Spencer speeds up insights with Azure Synapse Analytics
executive_summary: Marks & Spencer (M&S) is a leading British retailer bringing high-quality food, clothing, and homeware to 32 million customers around the world, with more than 1,400 stores across 57 countries. When its aging platform couldn’t keep pace with increasing demand, M&S decided to build a new data platform around Microsoft Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Databricks, and Azure Synapse Analytics.

title: Dai-ichi Life Việt Nam thúc đẩy áp dụng công nghệ mới để nâng cao năng suất thông qua các giải pháp của Microsoft
executive_summary: Dai-ichi Life, a leading life insurance provider in Vietnam, saw digital transformation as the answer to the changing demands of customers, who require fast, convenient, high-quality, and easy-to-use services. By implementing Microsoft 365 and Azure, Dai-ichi Life achieved increased operational efficiency and enhanced security. The company's new technologies reached a 20 percent adoption rate, streamlining processes and improving customer satisfaction in the process.

title: ODE Yalıtım enters a new era with its Dynamics 365 upgrade across all business units
executive_summary: A major name in insulation materials industry with large scale investments and innovative R&D and exports of more than 4,000 products to 6 continents, ODE Yalıtım enjoys the benefits of the Dynamics 365 upgrade undertaken in a very short time during the pandemics. Dynamics 365 offers the company the chance to ensure operations are efficient, up to speed and streamlined.

title: DenizBank supports data scientists with its pioneering Data Warehouse Project
executive_summary: Since its foundation in 1997, DenizBank has invested heavily in technology, R&D, and innovation. The bank, which had founded Türkiye's first Digital Generation Banking Department in 2012, was multiple times acclaimed as the "World's Most Innovative Bank" in the United States and Europe. Integrating all physical and digital touchpoints with the customer through a "phygital" strategy, the organization has blazed a new trail in Türkiye with Microsoft and its affiliate Intertech, which offers information technology services with finance industry-focused solutions. Denizbank launched a Private Cloud Project, paving the way for innovation in data science with the strength of Azure.

title: Doğuş Teknoloji opts for Azure Virtual Desktop for its increasing workforce needs
executive_summary: One of the leading information technology companies in Türkiye, Doğuş Teknoloji fosters its innovation culture with creative solutions. In response to the expansion in workforce numbers, the challenges brought about by the pandemic and sectoral needs, Doğuş Teknoloji chose Azure Virtual Desktop Infrastructure solutions. Discover how Azure Virtual Desktop brings agility to business processes with features such as remote access, productivity, improved compatibility, and simplified IT management offered in a medium of robust security.

title: Yapı Kredi bolsters bank security with Edge deployment and Microsoft partnership
executive_summary: Yapı Kredi, one of Türkiye's largest publicly traded banks, needed a new standard browser to deliver superior security and compliance in the heavily regulated Turkish banking industry, while also gaining upgraded speed, manageability, and compatibility. After collaborating with Microsoft to modify certain features, the bank deployed the modern Microsoft Edge to meet its needs and received great user feedback, in addition to improved security and performance.

title: With Microsoft Teams, Yapı Kredi fulfills its vision of secure remote work and robust collaboration
executive_summary: A well-established name in the banking sector, Yapı Kredi works with a vision focused on change and progress. Paying particular attention to innovation, open communication, and teamwork, the bank extended Microsoft Teams to its 16,000 employees to provide uninterrupted, secure communication and a modern collaboration experience for remote working.

title: Pegasus uses Microsoft Unified services to provide uninterrupted service
executive_summary: Pegasus, which is one of the major airlines of Europe with 600 flights every day while it's annual number of passengers reaching 30 million, uses Microsoft Unified Support & Maintenance service in order to reach best support services in the IT infrastructure with fast response times and resolutions in the shortest period of time.

title: Dynamics 365 powers system harmonization and growth for energy company St1 Nordic
executive_summary: After numerous acquisitions, St1 Nordic (St1), a leading producer of CO2 aware energy solutions, had four different ERP systems and disparate processes that required harmonization. The company choose Microsoft Dynamics 365 as the single ERP system for the entire organization. It implemented Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management to support sales order processing, delivery, and invoicing—and Dynamics 365 Finance to manage general ledger, accounts receivable and payable, fixed assets, and more. The new solution has helped St1 gain greater visibility into data, eliminate manual processes, improve productivity and increase cash flow.

title: From customer contact to accounting: Dynamics 365 Business Central helps RECARO Gaming manage data with ease
executive_summary: RECARO Gaming GmbH & Co. KG is an expert for high-quality gaming and eSport chairs. The former gaming start-up has now established itself internationally as a premium provider, which presents its corporate IT with certain challenges: getting each gaming chair to the customer involves different partners, systems, and interfaces, while the many process steps and the sheer amount of coordination required make for complex workflows. So, with a view to reducing tool discontinuities, increasing transparency in data and processes, and integrating new sales channels and markets, RECARO Gaming made Dynamics 365 Business Central the linchpin of its centralized ERP landscape.

title: GF Piping Systems tackles social and environmental challenges using Microsoft Azure services
executive_summary: Sustainability is at the heart of everything GF Piping Systems does. As the leading flow solutions provider, the organization has been giving leak-free piping to a range of end-market segments for many years. Recently, the organization realized it needed to reinvent its offering to expand its reach and better serve existing customers – so, it partnered with Microsoft to digitally transform its operations. Using cloud technology, it built a flexible, modular platform environment to help develop customized solutions that meet customers’ needs and help them to solve social and environmental challenges - ultimately enabling positive change for a better tomorrow.

title: AKOLogic and VGI bring efficiency and sustainability to agriculture with Microsoft
executive_summary: One of the main environmental concerns in agriculture is the fact that the sector is a leading contributor to the rise of CO2 levels in the atmosphere. Traditional crop production practices often rely on artificial chemicals that can harm the environment, cause land degradation, and damage ecosystems. But the State of Israel, a world leader in agriculture and water management, is committed to making the industry more sustainable. By collaborating with the Microsoft Israeli Development Center, Israeli organizations like AKOLogic and VGI are bringing technological innovation and sustainability to farming.

title: IPLAND helps top brands score in-store sales with Microsoft Azure AutoML
executive_summary: IPLAND helps major fast-moving consumer goods companies optimize their products’ on-shelf presence. Its Image Recognition (IR) service analyzes photos of store shelves, extracting and surfacing critical performance data to help fine-tune retail displays. When a rapidly growing customer base drove the company to find more scalable solutions, IPLAND updated its IR service to take advantage of Microsoft Azure Automated Machine Learning. This updated and refined solution has improved image recognition speed and data collection, creating a future-ready service that can scale up in a cost-effective manner.

title: Arrow Lift Boosts Efficiency and Collaboration with Microsoft Cloud Platform
executive_summary: Arrow Lift, a company that specializes in elevators, has recently adopted a unified Microsoft cloud platform provided by sa.global. This has resulted in internal teams being more connected than ever, with access to a single version of the truth. The company has also enjoyed a similar user interface across various functions such as marketing and sales, service delivery, and finance. The integration of Microsoft 365 has made it effortless for employees to adopt and eliminated the need for custom codes, making it easier for the IT team to manage. Overall, the changes have significantly reduced the workload and improved security for the IT team, leading to increased satisfaction.

title: Power transmission operator ELES gains agility with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Ensuring the lights stay on requires more than competence; it calls for innovation. ELES, guardian of Slovenia's electric power transmission, embodies this spirit. Yet, the company faced a challenge: an inflexible, outdated enterprise resource management (ERP) system. Enter Microsoft Dynamics 365—an evergreen, future-proof solution bringing ELES departments together, fostering efficiency and collaboration. By consolidating data from multiple sources, ELES can make informed decisions quickly. “Given any network or energy supply changes, we can swiftly adapt, maintaining our services,” says Tamara Slapar, Deputy Information and Communications Technology Director at ELES.

title: Macquarie Cloud Services protects Cafs’ sensitive data with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Cyber-attacks impact any industry at any given time. Potential data leaks lead to password changes, identity theft, and card cancellations. However, for some organizations, the stakes are even higher. There are a few reasons for this, including the perception that many lack the funding or skills to maintain and secure data. Organizations are struggling to keep up with the ever-evolving cybersecurity landscape.

title: dentsu optimizes collaborative workflows with Microsoft Teams Premium
executive_summary: Global creative media company dentsu reduces time spent on repetitive tasks and ensures its global employees get the most out of every meeting with Microsoft Teams Premium and Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365.

title: Air India harnesses AI for operational excellence with Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: With a remarkable 90-year history, Air India is not only the flag carrier of India, but a symbol of the country’s aviation excellence and technological prowess. At the heart of the airline’s vision is a transformative technological journey, most recently marked by the incorporation of Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365 into multiple departments. Notable is how Air India is weaving AI and Copilot into its operations with a custom-built plugin for Copilot in Microsoft Teams. This innovative step, a testament to Air India’s commitment to digital evolution, unlocks a new realm of operational insights. With the ability to converse with AI in Microsoft Teams, the Copilot plugin not only provides critical data on flight punctuality and operational hurdles, but also empowers proactive, collaborative decision making.

title: PayU GPO verifies customers faster with AU10TIX’s Azure-based solution
executive_summary: In financial services where milliseconds matter, PayU Global Payment Organization (GPO) took a decisive step to accelerate its customer onboarding. PayU provides payment solutions for over 450,000 merchants and counting. Hence, the need for a swift and error-proof identity verification workflow is high. That’s where AU10TIX came into play. The firm boosted PayU's Know-Your-Customer (KYC) process with its Microsoft Azure-based Identity Verification (IDV) solution. ID verification has been reduced to an average of six seconds, making the entire process more efficient and customer-friendly. The partnership also brought scalability, enabling PayU GPO to smoothly manage influxes of new customers in the most intense periods with Azure's flexible infrastructure.

title: Oklahoma State University engaged 90% of academic programs in more effective assessment practices with Nuventive and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Oklahoma State University (OSU), a land-grant university, administered an efficient assessment and reporting system using the Nuventive Improvement Platform built on Microsoft Azure. In previous years, the assessment process at OSU operated in isolation and assessment was viewed as more of a box to check than as a chance for improvement. With help from Microsoft partner Nuventive, OSU simplified assessment and created a space where faculty could use assessment data to identify gaps in student learning and create action plans to close the loop. Since deploying this solution, OSU has engaged 90% of academic programs in better assessment practices to help them troubleshoot and improve student learning with innovative solutions.

title: CPFL amplia repositório de dados em 1500% com projeto Mega Lake no Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Based on a strategic decision to make more data available at a faster pace, CPFL started the Mega Lake project using Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Power Platform tools. The project enabled the company to leverage its data-driven culture that promotes data democratization by relying on a single source of information. Now they are focused on improving their new platform using machine learning (ML) and AI.

title: Planted combines economic growth and environmental sustainability - with Microsoft Azure OpenAI
executive_summary: Planted is a young company that combines proprietary structuring and fermentation technologies to produce meat from plant proteins, focusing on delicious taste, meaty and juicy texture, while only using natural ingredients. Founded in July 2019 as a spin-off from ETH Zurich, the Swiss company now employs more than 200 people in Switzerland and several other countries (including Germany, Austria, Italy, France, UK and BeNeLux). Its meats targeting flexitarians can be found in various supermarkets as well as restaurants across Europe. The main production facility is located in Planted‘s Headquarter in Kemptthal near Zurich.

title: Fortune Brands Innovations unifies their brands under one portal with Microsoft Power Pages
executive_summary: N/A

title: Emirates Global Aluminium unlocks public and private cloud, industrial AI with Azure Local
executive_summary: In its mission to innovate aluminium to make modern life possible, Emirates Global Aluminium (EGA) needs sustainable, scalable computing infrastructure that its on-premises environment struggled to deliver.

title: Scandinavian Airlines reduces loyalty program fraud with Microsoft Azure Machine Learning
executive_summary: To derive meaningful business value from the wealth of data it generates every day, Scandinavian Airlines (SAS) uses Microsoft Azure Machine Learning to make predictive models to improve everyday operations and identify patterns in the company’s data. From reducing fresh food waste to cutting down on fraud in its EuroBonus loyalty program, SAS is harnessing the power of its data using Azure Machine Learning and its responsible machine learning capabilities, including model interpretability and explainability. These capabilities help data scientists understand models better, create transparency about their processes, build trust in machine learning solutions, and create better customer experiences.

title: Magic Bus provides professional development and life opportunities to young people in India with Microsoft Community Training
executive_summary: With Microsoft Community Training, Magic Bus can deliver interactive and scalable learning experiences to help young people out of poverty, access professional opportunities, and lead successful lives.

title: JERA realizes data-driven operation and maintenance by utilizing database of user technology and power-plant operation know-how with Azure
executive_summary: JERA Co., Inc. (hereafter JERA) is the largest energy company in Japan, supplying approximately 30% of the electricity generated domestically. With the mission of “providing cutting-edge solutions to the world’s energy issues,” JERA is engaged in the procurement of fuel, as well as the operation and maintenance of power plants for the stable supply of electricity both domestically and internationally.

title: Betriebsvereinbarungen und Verträge: Die Nagel-Group erleichtert mit Azure OpenAI Service die Informationssuche für die Belegschaft
executive_summary: For an international company, seamless operations hinge on ensuring that the entire workforce can quickly access the internal store of information and know-how. That’s why Nagel-Group now relies on NagelGPT. Employees can pose their questions—currently on the topics of works agreements and sales—at any time and receive an automated response that includes the appropriate reference documents. This saves time, creates efficiency and transparency, and leads to higher-quality answers overall.

title: Georgia Tech is accelerating the future of electric vehicles using Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Dr. Omar Asensio, an Associate Professor at Georgia Tech and Visiting Fellow at Harvard Business School, leverages Microsoft's Azure OpenAI Service to enhance the electric vehicle (EV) charging infrastructure. By analyzing global EV charging behavior data in 72 languages, Asensio's team uncovers insights crucial for policy development and infrastructure improvement. Their work addresses the key challenge of consumer confidence in public charging stations, a significant barrier to EV adoption. Utilizing AI, the team achieves rapid data classification and predictive modeling, highlighting the reliability of networked chargers over non-networked ones. This approach promises scalable, cost-effective solutions for improving EV infrastructure, contributing to environmental sustainability and equitable access to EV technology.
products: Azure AI Studio

executive_summary: N/A

executive_summary: ManpowerGroup’s Talent Solutions practice was in search of a solution for gathering and analyzing HR data to power its consulting practice, which was previously a time-consuming process that impeded workforce planning.
