It also means adapting to regulatory changes so they can stay compliant year after year. INVENT is a digital transformation partner for the financial services industry, providing consulting and software as a service (SaaS) solutions to help companies upgrade their technology stack. INVENT has taken advantage of multiple cloud platforms, including Microsoft Azure, to build a highly secure toolkit that is streamlined, scalable, and easy for financial advisors to use.

title: Passport 360 offers integrated end-to-end compliance automation on Azure to help Kumba Iron Ore streamline operations
executive_summary: Sustainable mining company Kumba Iron Ore produces high-grade iron ore for use in steelmaking around the world. Kumba needed to automate and consolidate its manual approach to onboarding and risk management across all its work sites. Passport 360 worked with Kumba to implement a Microsoft Azure-based solution, empowering Kumba to streamline operations and improve risk outcomes.

title: Sage Automotive increases efficiency and production using Mariner’s Spyglass Visual Inspection and Microsoft Azure to monitor defects
executive_summary: Sage Automotive Interiors, a longtime global manufacturer of high-performance automotive interior fabrics, needed to solve a quality problem with its material. Sage worked with Microsoft partner Mariner to deploy Spyglass Visual Inspection, an AI, IoT, and deep-learning solution that utilizes Microsoft Azure IoT Hub and other Azure services. Sage started with a proof of concept, and the digital transformation leader at the company was pleasantly surprised at how easy it was to build the first deep-learning model, then scale with Azure. Using Mariner’s Spyglass Visual Inspection product, Sage is now able to run its production lines faster, increasing efficiency and quality standards across the board.
products: Azure, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Container Registry, Azure IoT Edge, Azure IoT Hub, Azure Marketplace, Azure SQL Database, Azure Virtual Machines

title: Improving working life in the UK
executive_summary: The Advisory, Conciliation and Arbitration Service (ACAS) is an independent public body that receives funding from the UK government. It works with millions of employers and employees every year to improve workplace relationships.

title: Tunisian ‘Zitouna Bank’ enables effortless online banking with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Headquartered in Le Kram, Tunisia, Zitouna Bank offers a complete range of banking services, investment products, and financing solutions. To accelerate growth and meet rising customer expectations, the bank needed to upgrade its on-premises online banking infrastructure to a more flexible and scalable cloud-based solution. With the help of partner Satoripop, Zitouna Bank migrated to Microsoft Azure. The company can now offer a broad range of modern banking services to customers—all day, every day.

title: The food tech company reducing global food waste with cloud technology
executive_summary: LMK Group is a Nordic food tech company that delivers a large variety of meals directly to its customers’ doors. As part of its work, the company is on a pioneering mission to reduce global food waste and drive sustainability across the grocery retail sector. To do this, LMK has been using cloud technology to optimize its processes, provide customized options for its clients and ultimately become a fully data-driven company.
products: Azure API Management, Azure App Service

title: Polish environment fund joins forces with Microsoft to help citizens save energy and reduce air pollution
executive_summary: The National Fund for Environmental Protection and Water Management powers a greener future for Poland. Its environmental grant programs allow citizens to obtain funding for air pollution prevention and energy efficiency home improvements. To speed up the process, it developed an online application portal based on Azure. The entire grant submission and verification process has been considerably simplified.

title: Expedia Group takes off with OneDrive
executive_summary: Expedia Group opens the world to those with a wanderlust. The Seattle-based company gathers more than 20 travel-related online businesses under its brand, employing people all over the world. When Expedia Group sought to simplify costs and reduce license costs, yet improve collaboration, productivity, and security, it turned to Microsoft OneDrive, adding SharePoint sites for teams. With nearly half of its 25,000 employees seamlessly migrated to date, Expedia Group offers its employees a deluxe fare to a streamlined environment.
products: Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise, Microsoft 365 E5, Planner, Microsoft To Do, OneDrive for Business, Excel, PowerPoint, Word

title: ASI migrates to Microsoft Azure as the foundation for promo industry’s supply chain management platform ESP
executive_summary: Promotional products make up a $23.2 billion industry, and the Advertising Specialty Institute (ASI) serves a network of 25,000 suppliers and distributors of logoed products in 53 countries. ASI’s flagship product, the technology platform ESP®, manages the industry’s supply and marketing chain. Additionally, their servers host 15,000 websites for promo companies.
products: Azure, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

title: WestJet prend son envol grâce à une IA avancée qui utilise Azure Machine Learning pour offrir des services personnalisés aux invités
executive_summary: WestJet goes far beyond simply shuttling guests between destinations. The second-largest Canadian airline focuses on people, providing an outstanding experience for guests and employees alike. To better understand how the COVID-19 pandemic has impacted guest needs and their preferences, the company worked closely with Microsoft to develop an AI-based Guest Experience Solution that allows WestJet to gain better insights into guest preferences. Now, the airline adjusts its offerings based on what guests want for a memorable trip while maintaining stability for guests and the company during a disrupted time.

title: Atos selects Microsoft Azure cloud platform and RISE with SAP for greater flexibility
executive_summary: Atos recently decided to migrate all its internal information management resources to Microsoft Azure to harness the benefits of a more secure, robust, and agile solution. Moving from its on-premises infrastructure to a private cloud, Atos will have greater adaptability, scalability, and ease of integration in Azure.
products: Azure, SAP on Azure, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Sentinel, Power BI

title: Sensor-based sorting provider converts IoT data into sustainable solutions with ADX
executive_summary: Norway-based TOMRA is driving a more sustainable future with its sensor-based systems to scan and sort products and materials for the food, recycling, and mining industries. To increase workflow efficiency and perform quicker queries on massive data volumes, it transitioned from a monolithic SQL server infrastructure to Azure Data Explorer (ADX). With the new solution, TOMRA can process up to five billion data points per day, enabling more machines to identify and sort materials for recycling quickly and accurately.

title: University of Bath turbocharges academic research with Azure HPC + AI
executive_summary: At University of Bath, academic researchers work hard on difficult issues, from pharmaceutical development to astrophysics. While one team builds digital simulations of chemical reactions that will help reduce the time and cost of drug trials, another conducts blue-sky research to determine strategies for processing the literally cosmic volume of data that will come from future telescopes. Meanwhile, other teams may be working on climate change or public health.

title: Smart use of data: Schwäbisch Hall builds on data-driven business models based on Microsoft Azure Services
executive_summary: Auf diese Steine können Sie bauen, or You can build on these bricks, is a slogan associated across Germany with reliability. With these words, credit union Schwäbisch Hall promises not to lose sight of its target groups despite an ever-changing market and to constantly adapt its financing concepts and the way it approaches customers to the needs of the day. The construction financing specialist is strengthening this promise through its company-wide Smart Data & Analytics initiative based on Microsoft Azure. This has already enabled Schwäbisch Hall to start analyzing specific market segments under the strictest security and data protection conditions and is boosting productivity within the lending process.

title: Urban mobility of the future: Leipzig’s transport company expands its digital network with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Leipzig is currently Germany’s fastest growing city. In addition to affecting the housing and labor markets, this has an impact on the city’s public transport infrastructure. In 2019, the city’s transport company, Leipziger Verkehrsbetriebe (LVB), carried more than 150 million passengers—and that number is growing. Part of the company’s strategy for serving such vast numbers is to roll out new mobility offers that combine different modes of transport. The apps that underpin this kind of intermodal routing run on Microsoft Azure. LVB also relies on Microsoft solutions when tackling other challenges: to keep pace with demographic change, Microsoft HoloLens 2 is used in-house to aid the transfer of knowledge.

title: Microsoft helps Adif deploy its collaboration platform to more than 11,000 employees in less than a week
executive_summary: With the arrival of COVID-19, Adif accelerated its digitization process to enable its more than 11,000 employees, spread across the country, to continue working and guarantee the continuity of operations during the worst months of COVID. To meet the significant challenges of such a large transformation project, the company relied on four Microsoft Gold Partners: NTT Data (formerly everis), for initial consultancy and development of the “Espacio365” project; SEIDOR, which proposed the solutions deployed; Tokiota, to implement Azure Virtual Desktop and launch the Company Communicator app in Teams; and Capgemini, which developed the app for Conventional Network Project Management through Microsoft Power Apps. By launching this project, Adif has managed to unify different solutions that previously produced unwanted silos.
products: Azure, Azure Virtual Desktop, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, SharePoint

title: Distell chooses Azure Synapse Analytics to drive its data warehouse transformation
executive_summary: Nearly a century ago, in the mid-1920s, a group of grape farmers in South Africa began making wine together, eventually forming the first winery in South Africa, Stellenbosch Farmers’ Winery. In the autumn of 2000, Stellenbosch Farmers’ Winery merged with Distillers Corporation, becoming Distell. Distell is the largest producer of wine, spirits, cider, and ready-to-drinks in South Africa, and is headquartered in Stellenbosch, South Africa.
products: Azure Synapse Analytics

title: Juvare scales critical emergency management applications on Azure, boosts disaster response, resiliency
executive_summary: In the event of an emergency, every second counts. Mirroring that ethos, Juvare, one of the largest emergency management and response software providers globally, aims to maintain the same flexible and responsive posture as its core clients—government agencies, hospitals, universities, healthcare organizations, and emergency response operations across the world.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Database, Azure Site Recovery, Azure Key Vault

title: Wolverine Worldwide enhances business performance and employee experience using RISE with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: Footwear and apparel company Wolverine Worldwide always aims to stay one step ahead of the curve, whether it’s crafting compelling designs for its 13 diverse and iconic brands—including Merrell, Saucony, Sperry, and Sweaty Betty, sold in more than 170 countries and territories around the world—or enhancing the employee experience.

title: Carpetright modernizes for business growth with Azure VMware Solution
executive_summary: The pandemic and the store closures that came with it for significant periods accelerated the sense of urgency at Carpetright to build up capabilities and agility by modernizing its technology infrastructure. Carpetright ultimately selected Azure VMware Solution for hosting VMware virtual machine environments on Azure while it trained its team. Since adopting Azure VMware Solution, Carpetright now has a more modern and secure infrastructure to help the business grow both organically and through acquisitions.
products: Azure, Azure VMware Solution

title: Chevron powers its business future with SAP on Azure and the Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: Building on human ingenuity
products: Azure, Azure Backup, Azure Monitor, Azure NetApp Files, Azure Site Recovery, SAP on Azure, Microsoft Entra ID, Power BI

title: From data silos to holistic, analytical sales management and data-driven customer service: Power equipment manufacturer STIHL relies on Dynamics 365 in sales, marketing and service
executive_summary: "Every chainsaw is only as good as its service"—this quote by the company's founder Andreas Stihl inspired the philosophy on which the complete service structure of ANDREAS STIHL AG & Co. KG is based on. Over the last few years, the long-established company from the Swabian town of Waiblingen has expanded its portfolio to include digital products: Among others, the product portfolio includes digital products and solutions such as robotic mowers and the "STIHL connected" platform. To adapt established, decentralized sales- and service processes to the demands of the constantly evolving market, STIHL relies on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales and Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service.

title: More than 1,000 Sanitas employees are already taking advantage of the capabilities of Big Data through the DOC project
executive_summary: Sanitas is committed to the advantages of digital tools to improve the management of people's health and also to increase the efficiency of its employees' work. Since 2019, the company has been conducting research and development activities in the field of applications, aimed at optimizing its processes.

title: Equity at the center of decision-making: How Las Cruces Public Schools is maximizing education technology for all its students
executive_summary: With more than 24,000 students across 40 schools, Las Cruces Public Schools is the second largest school district in New Mexico. As was the case with so many districts, providing education devices and cloud-based device management for every student and educator presented many challenges—and in Las Cruces, that included figuring out how to navigate the remote delivery of learning for some students whose families had never owned a computer and had limited, if any, access to the internet at home. To get this done, and to provide an education that continued to advance and prepare students, the Las Cruces school district deployed over 25,000 Windows devices—easily managed and deployed with Microsoft Intune and to the great benefit of its students.

title: Nimble and Sherweb partner up for growth on the commercial marketplace
executive_summary: Nimble, a simple, smart CRM built for Microsoft 365, unifies information across contacts, email, and calendars into a powerful team relationship manager. Sherweb is an award-winning Gold Microsoft partner with more than 6500 partners, whose value-added cloud solutions help customers streamline operations. Working in partnership and scaling in tandem, Nimble and Sherweb joined together to sell through the commercial marketplace leveraging margin sharing—a new feature where independent software vendors (ISV) like Nimble can create a private offer for partners in the Cloud Solution Provider program and offer the CSP a margin as motivation to resell the ISV solution. It’s a winning integration all around.

title: Steelmet delivers efficient and agile infrastructure to Viohalco companies with Microsoft Azure Arc
executive_summary: Steelmet sought new digital capabilities to help the Viohalco companies’ laser-focus their operations and better navigate market and technological disruption. Steelmet placed efficiency front and center and transformed Viohalco companies’ digital architecture, governance, and management with Microsoft Azure Arc. With Azure Arc, Steelmet has unified Viohalco companies’ architecture, infrastructure management, and operations governance using a single pane of glass, and it uses the automation available in Azure Policy to improve the companies’ user security configuration.
products: Azure, Azure Arc, Azure Policy, Azure Virtual Machines

title: Aurukun Shire Council realizes return on investment in under three months with SurePact project and portfolio risk management and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: A small council in Far North Queensland, Australia, Aurukun Shire Council manually tracked millions of dollars in grants, projects, and contracts for the construction and maintenance of community infrastructure and the AUD$2.9 million Aurukun Airport Upgrade. The Council turned to SurePact, a Microsoft partner providing a comprehensive, cloud-based solution for government and corporate management of projects, portfolios, and risk. SurePact moved the Council from an unwieldy set of spreadsheets, emails, physical documents, and shared files to a Microsoft Azure-based solution that streamlined document management, secured access, increased transparency for audits, and mitigated risks while also reducing bottom-line project cost blowouts. Aurukun Shire Council uses SurePact to deliver infrastructure projects more efficiently and realized a return on its investment in under three months.

title: No kilometer too far: Digital transport management at Raiffeisen Waren GmbH with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: With 210 locations across Germany, Raiffeisen Waren GmbH is never far away from the action. Whether roof tiles, wall paint, or floor screed, the commercial enterprise delivers building materials directly to construction sites. And quindata GmbH—a subsidiary of Raiffeisen Waren GmbH—performs state-of-the-art transport management based on SAP S/4HANA to guarantee efficiency when planning the necessary delivery routes and logistics. The company uses a slightly adapted version of the standard SAP S/4 HANA transport management solution to link the transport data for all the various locations, simplifying the delivery process and preventing any disruption to construction projects. That way, no unnecessary kilometers are traveled and no time goes to waste.

title: Microsoft-first approach to security benefits financial experts LGL
executive_summary: Via a Microsoft-first approach to cybersecurity and compliance, the LGL Group identified an opportunity to enhance its cybersecurity posture, whilst at the same time rationalising its overall spend and simplifying the user experience. Softwerx, a leading Microsoft security practice in the UK, helped LGL both architect and deploy a unified XDR and SIEM security solution that incorporates Microsoft Azure, Azure Sentinel, Microsoft 365 apps, and the latest Microsoft 365 E3 security features. LGL now enjoys enhanced security, reduced costs, and a more-efficient user experience.

title: Voiceback Analytics and Azure propel Cricuru.com to winning growth and savings
executive_summary: Cricuru.com is an educational technology venture that imparts world-class instruction for cricket, a sport with hundreds of millions of enthusiasts in India and beyond. The website needed a solution that could deliver customised CRM communications based on artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) to their subscribers. Microsoft partner Voiceback Analytics used Azure Data Factory, Azure Machine Learning, and Power BI to create a platform that could simultaneously send multiple customised communications to their user base. Implementation of the solution increased conversions, subscriptions, and usage on www.cricuru.com.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory, Power BI, SQL Server, Azure Machine Learning

title: Metrie increases customer response times, overall agility with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: Metrie, a leading manufacturer and distributor of interior finishings for North America, needed to expand the capabilities of its SAP infrastructure. The problem was, the company’s existing cloud provider couldn’t cope with the new demand. Working with Qnovate, Metrie moved its SAP estate—core to almost every element of the business—to Microsoft Azure. The move not only granted the scalability required for future functionalities, but it gave the company back the control and security over its operations that aging cloud infrastructure had begun to erode.

title: AxFina finds speed and regulation with Azure migration
executive_summary: When central and eastern Europe focused asset and loan servicer AxFina Holding SA acquired Hungarian leasing company Lombard Lízing Zrt., it had just a few weeks to replace Lombard’s infrastructure, which had reached the end of its life cycle. With AxFina’s desire to innovate and scale and regulatory requirements looming, it turned to Hungarian IT company DIGITAL Kft. to help AxFina migrate the entirety of its IT applications to the cloud. Microsoft Azure became the ideal solution to help ensure that AxFina maintained security, regulatory compliance, and speed.

title: SpheraCloud and Azure help Shell pursue its Goal Zero ambition
executive_summary: Shell is committed to its Goal Zero ambition of “no harm and no leaks,” which feeds into broader initiatives like the U.N. Sustainable Development Goals. Shell turned to Sphera and its mobile-friendly, integrated ESG and risk management platform SpheraCloud—powered by Microsoft Azure—to improve the company's already robust safety performance metrics. By leveraging the additional capabilities, Shell has advanced its safety initiatives through a streamlined, intuitive event-management process that offers an efficient way to capture quality health, security, safety and environmental data to drive learnings and help prevent incidents.

title: GetGo Redefines the Consumer Experience in Convenience with Cooler Screens
executive_summary: GetGo, a food-first convenience store chain, has been bringing innovation to its stores for years, with an emphasis on technology to optimize the consumer experience. GetGo partnered with Cooler Screens to replace traditional cooler aisle doors with digital smart screens which seamlessly integrated into GetGo’s existing high-traffic beverage area. Cooler Screens technology and contextually relevant retail media and merchandising resulted in an improved consumer experience, same store sales lift and operational improvements for GetGo.

title: noon payments drives seamless, instantly scalable online transactions with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Middle East-based noon payments offers a complete payments solution: quick onboarding, feature-filled checkout, and speedy integrations across the world’s major e-commerce platforms and shopping carts. Looking for a rapidly scalable solution that could minimize costs and streamline the DevOps process, the company chose Microsoft Azure. Thanks to millisecond response times and single-click cloud deployment, noon payments is making online transactions more responsive for online shoppers in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates and beyond.

title: Saudi Arabia's Sakani program speeds up customer service with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Sakani, a program under the National Housing Company (NHC) of Saudi Arabia, is a real estate initiative designed to support and enable Saudi citizens to own their home. Sakani is transforming its online services to improve the experience and satisfaction of Saudi citizens. Its new Customer Relationship Management (CRM) platform aims to reduce the time taken to resolve Sakani’s customer service inquiries. Powered by Dynamics 365 Customer Service and Sales, the platform enabled ticket resolution in three hours, from a previous average of 15 days.
products: Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Sales, Power Apps

title: Franz Morat Group gears up for the future with Azure Stack HCI powered by Intel technologies
executive_summary: Gears truly do make the world go round. Without ever knowing it, we’ve all probably used products that in some way depend on the high-precision gears and drive systems produced by Franz Morat Group, a multinational manufacturer headquartered in Eisenbach, Germany. The company anticipates its customers’ needs for ever-more refined designs, backing more than a century of gear production with new innovations, including its high-precision metal gears, and pioneering plastic injection-molded parts along with complete custom-designed drive units for a multitude of industries.

title: Silk breaks data gravity, launching customers to the cloud with Azure Virtual Machines
executive_summary: Silk’s platform brings the cloud to customers by letting them continue to use the same systems they’ve been working with—in some cases, for decades—while also enabling the migration of ancillary applications to the cloud. Silk’s solution deploys significant amounts of compute. A single Silk platform instance running in a single zone will have from 27 to 105 VMs and from 200 to 2,000 calls depending on the amount of performance and capacity required. Silk is making the impossible possible for its customers. Not only is it delivering higher performance, robust reliability, and the agility of the cloud, but it’s getting customers there quickly and easily.

title: Digital strategy for growth: Hagedorn revamps IT infrastructure with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Hagedorn Group is an industry leader in the demolition and remediation of industrial facilities and buildings. In recent years, it has transformed itself into an all-around service provider by acquiring companies from related business fields such as waste disposal. The integration of these subsidiaries into the Group has driven rapid workforce growth and provided a wealth of new data. To meet these challenges, Hagedorn decided to move to Microsoft Azure. Microsoft’s software-as-a-service solutions are now making IT support easier than ever, and a modern data warehouse has helped the company derive new insights from existing data. With the assistance of Bechtle, a member of the Microsoft Partner Network, Hagedorn has radically transformed its IT infrastructure, setting an inspiring example for other medium-sized enterprises.

title: Making sense of the shoebox: How H&R Block uses Azure AI to transform tax returns
executive_summary: A new job. A change in relationship status. A move across the country. H&R Block understands that tax returns are personal—a diary of your year’s most impactful events. When the organization’s 21 million clients rely on the tax professionals at H&R Block, providing individualized support for each client’s unique needs is paramount. And whether clients come in with a shoebox full of tax forms or file online, H&R Block is using Microsoft technology to transform the tax filing experience. With AI-powered services like Azure Form Recognizer and Azure Cognitive Search, H&R Block tax professionals can spend more time building meaningful, personalized client experiences—and helping each client get the most out of their tax return.

title: Equinor targets data efficiency and a low-carbon future with Microsoft Azure Data Manager for Energy
executive_summary: Global energy firm Equinor is committed to a sustainable, low-carbon future, and the company realizes that effective use of data is essential to achieving its goals. To break down corporate data siloes and provide employees with all the information they need to make effective decisions, Equinor chose to implement Microsoft Azure Data Manager for Energy aligned with the energy industry’s OSDU™ Technical Standard. Equinor is already realizing efficiencies in data collection and storage that can help streamline operations to extract hydrocarbons more efficiently and pave the way for increased investment in renewable energy.

title: Michigan Office of Children’s Ombudsman streamlines case management and improves compliance using i-Sight on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The State of Michigan Office of Children’s Ombudsman helps protect and improve the lives of children by investigating complaints regarding Michigan’s child welfare system and by recommending changes to law, policy, and practice. It needed a better case management system to fulfil its mission to bring greater accountability to Michigan’s child welfare system. Adopting i-Sight case management on Microsoft Azure for US Government has improved efficiency, productivity, and security, empowering the agency to better manage cases from beginning to end.

title: Swiss ITP helps e-mobility provider create a smart, uniform IT environment
executive_summary: Swiss E-Mobility Group (Schweiz) AG (SEMG) sells its products in Switzerland and throughout the DACH region. New brands are constantly being added to its portfolio. The acquisition of e-bike retailer m-way presented SEMG with a huge challenge. A complex branch operation with its own data center needed to be integrated as intelligently as possible. The objective was to establish a uniform, smart IT environment for the entire Group. With the support of Microsoft partner Swiss IT Professional AG, all systems and servers were migrated to the Azure cloud. The new environment is fully scalable, cost-effective to operate, and provides the ideal conditions for flexible growth. With Azure Kubernetes Services, it was also possible to create an omnichannel platform covering all channels. This offers customers a comprehensive overview and an optimized shopping experience.

title: Blue Valley School District reimagines learning inside and outside the classroom with Azure Lab Services
executive_summary: With a mission to reimagine learning and change the world, Blue Valley School District in Overland Park, Kansas, has inspired generations of students in their most formative years. The district applies technology in innovative ways to offer new and exciting educational opportunities, including advanced computing classes, to more students in its elementary, middle, and high schools at a fast pace.

title: Rabobank streamlines and personalizes customer support with AI powered virtual agents
executive_summary: Rabobank, a multinational banking institution headquartered in the Netherlands, has a long history of cooperation, innovation, and people-centered solutions. As part of its mission to grow a better world together, Rabobank aspires to “conversational banking,” which prioritizes friendly, efficient customer service on demand. Reconstructing its virtual agent solution with Microsoft Power Virtual Agents allowed Rabobank to simplify operations, reduce costs, and create a better, more cohesive experience for customers.

title: O.C. Tanner uses Microsoft Viva Goals to align on objectives and key results and create “unity in focus”
executive_summary: O.C. Tanner began as a manufacturing company and pioneer of the employee recognition industry. For almost a century, the company has helped enterprise clients, which include American Airlines, Bayer, and Taco Bell, develop workplace cultures that empower people to thrive at work.

title: How UH is transforming men’s healthcare and finding 90% time savings with tech-assisted personalization using Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: At University Hospitals (UH), a 30,000-employee health system based in Cleveland, Ohio, a dedicated group of medical professionals is transforming the way men engage in healthcare with a technology-assisted concierge service. UH Cutler Center for Men is piloting a personalized approach to men’s healthcare, centered on health concierges called “Joes.” UH Cutler Center for Men used Microsoft products to develop specialized tools for its health concierges, helping them proactively engage with program members. UH leadership hopes that this combination of technology and personalized care can save lives and close the healthcare gender gap through consistent preventative care, leading to earlier diagnoses and treatment of health conditions.
products: Azure, Azure AI Services, Microsoft Entra ID, Power Apps

title: Swedbank migrates big data platform to Azure Cloud for enhanced security and scalability
executive_summary: Swedbank is a multinational bank with a 200-year history. Recently, the company took the bold decision to migrate its big data platform to the cloud in search of greater scalability and security. With Azure Databricks functioning at the core of this solution, the successful migration has brought the bank a wealth of benefits. From reduced time-to-market and cost savings to significant improvements in its ability to detect fraud – it has set the bank and its 7.7 million customers on course for a more secure future.

title: Repsol inspires a multinational community of citizen developers with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: Spanish multi-energy company Repsol is on a mission to empower its employees with the help of technology. As part of this goal, the organization has partnered with Microsoft and Kabel to create the Do It Yourself program – an initiative aimed at encouraging citizen development across its global workforce. Rolled out just 18 months ago, the project has already found outstanding success at Repsol, helping to build a new community of innovation-driven citizen developers and save millions in costs.

title: Mbanq uses Temenos Banking Cloud to offer cost-effective, scalable fintech solutions at speed
executive_summary: Fast-growing fintech Mbanq worked with Microsoft partner Temenos to enhance and accelerate the growth of its business with composable banking using Microsoft Azure. Mbanq works with credit unions, banks, and nonfinancial institutions globally. The company wanted to develop a SaaS solution that could deliver seamless fintech services at scale while meeting regulatory and compliance requirements. By collaborating with Temenos and building a secure, scalable SaaS solution on Azure, Mbanq revitalized its services, facilitating smoother transitioning, faster deployments, and seamless integration for its clients.

title: Jefferson Health modernizes as it migrates on-premises Epic environment to Azure
executive_summary: With a mission of improving lives by reimagining health, education, and research, Jefferson Health is modernizing its technology infrastructure to scale and support faster innovation. The multi-state nonprofit network of hospitals and research facilities is migrating its on-premises Epic® electronic health record (EHR) system to Microsoft Azure.

title: NTNU helps K-12 students master English faster with innovative learning platform powered by Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: We spoke with Dr. Hao-Jan Howard Chen, Professor, Department of English at National Taiwan Normal University (NTNU) about his vision for Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service and the university’s collaboration with the Taiwan Ministry of Education on an English-language learning platform. This is an overview of that conversation, summarized in part by Azure OpenAI Service.

title: Autoliv China transforms manufacturing processes and training deployment with Mixed Reality and Digital Twin platform
executive_summary: What does it mean to be truly data-driven in the automotive manufacturing industry? What if there was no longer a wall between business and operational insights—a world where Information Technology (IT) and Operations Technology (OT) came together to synthesize manufacturing, physical, and operational data for enhanced efficiencies and resource consumption on the shop floor?
products: Azure, Dynamics 365 Remote Assist

title: Bodibasixs optimizes production with Power BI, resulting in 25% revenue
executive_summary: Bodibasixs, a Malaysian manufacturing company of personal care and beauty products, is committed to customer satisfaction by providing innovative items and timely deliveries. Faced with data silos that hindered decision-making processes, Bodibasixs partnered with SRKK to implement Power BI for faster data collection and analytics. With different dashboards that provided reliable data quickly, Bodibasixs increased monthly revenue by 25 percent while optimizing labor costs and the size of its workforce.
products: Power BI

title: Dominican Republic repels cyberattacks with help from Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The Dominican Republic's National Cybersecurity Center (Centro Nacional de Ciberseguridad, CNCS) adopted a variety of Microsoft solutions to monitor, analyze, and manage cyber threat cases across the country.
products: Dynamics 365, Azure Data Explorer, Microsoft Sentinel, Azure, Azure Data Factory

title: Serving customers 78% faster: VOCALLS’ voicebots supercharge call handing with Azure OpenAI
executive_summary: VOCALLS, a Prague and London-based pioneer, is reshaping customer service with its AI-powered voicebots. Relying on Microsoft Azure AI technologies, VOCALLS automates over 50 million interactions per year. Its happy customer, Estafeta, has seen myriad benefits: a 78% reduction in average handling time aside from a 120% increase in answered calls. Today, Estafeta’s customers receive immediate support instead of a 10-minute wait, leading to stellar customer satisfaction scores.
products: Azure, Azure AI and Machine Learning, Azure AI Search, Azure AI Services, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Operator Call Protection, Azure Machine Learning

title: RIA innovates its Bürokratt solution, in collaboration with Microsoft, to run on cloud services like Azure
executive_summary: The Information System Authority of Estonia (RIA) coordinates the development, safe implementation, and administration of the state IT infrastructure in Estonia. To make it easier for the country's citizens to access information and services from various government bodies, the organization developed an open-source communication assistant named Bürokratt that securely connects state institutions. Based on a jointly developed Distributed Message Rooms (DMR) solution, citizens will be able to access vital government services in a matter of seconds as opposed to days. And in the spirit of open government, the code base of Bürokratt Assistant and the DMR are available in GitHub to be used by governmental groups and partners who wish to replicate the solution.

title: Washington State Department of Labor & Industries drives cultural shift and achieves measurable cost savings with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: N/A

products: Azure, Azure Cloud Services, Azure VMware Solution

title: HARTING reduces design time from weeks to minutes with Siemens and Azure AI
executive_summary: HARTING needed a simpler way for customers to find and design the right product among more than 27,000 options, as traditional processes were time-consuming and required technical expertise.

title: Microsoft Dynamics 365 offers Educating Students Together (EST) a beacon of hope in technological growth
executive_summary: The EST organization's reliance on a singular, outdated forum hindered their ability to efficiently manage student records and attract funding.

title: Temasek Polytechnic saves 20,000+ man-hours annually by empowering citizen developers with Power Platform
executive_summary: Temasek Polytechnic sought to enhance administrative efficiency, streamline operations, and equip staff and students with digital skills while reducing dependency on IT resources.
products: Power BI, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Power Platform, Power Apps, Microsoft Copilot Studio

title: Transforming banking with data analytics: Members 1st Federal Credit Union reduces model run time by 89% with 3Cloud and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Members 1st Federal Credit Union (Members 1st) was eager to use its vast data footprint to offer its members a more personalized experience and inform business decision-making with a data analytics solution.

title: Leading engineering firm Amey keeps employees safer with SharePoint agents
executive_summary: For Amey, a leading provider of engineering, operations, and decarbonization solutions across the United Kingdom, finding accurate answers quickly is imperative to keeping their frontline safe.

title: NexJ Health scales innovation and impact by leveraging Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: NexJ Health needed to cut cloud costs, simplify deployments, and scale efficiently, driving their move to Microsoft Azure’s modern, scalable platform.

title: Digital transformation in DevOps is a “game-changer”
executive_summary: As a global leader in providing technology and services to utilities, Itron, Inc., is dedicated to the resourceful use of energy and water. For years, its R&D groups, which are located in different regions around the world, had relative autonomy to focus on maintaining and improving their specific technologies. But when Itron envisioned employing a DevOps model to support managed services delivered via the Microsoft Azure cloud, that autonomy impeded success. Disparate islands of development using different platforms and tools affected productivity, costs, quality, security, and visibility, not to mention time-to-market. After careful evaluation, Itron chose Azure as its global delivery platform and deployed Azure DevOps. Even before it has fully migrated all its developers, Itron credits Azure DevOps with reducing its release cycles from several months to weeks. Licensing costs have been cut by at least 25 percent.

title: Shell invests in safety with Azure, AI, and machine vision to better protect customers and service champions
executive_summary: In the energy industry, Shell manages everything from wells to retail gas stations—44,000 of them. The company works hard to ensure the safety of service champions and customers at its retail sites. Shell is piloting a new cloud-based, deep learning solution built on Microsoft Azure. The solution uses closed-circuit camera footage and Internet of Things technology to automatically identify safety hazards and alert service champions so they can quickly respond and eliminate potential problems.

title: Digital for all: Onesait Platform uses Red Hat on Azure to streamline and democratize digital transformation
executive_summary: To help customers keep pace with digital transformation, Madrid-based Minsait, an Indra company and leading digital transformation consultancy and information technologies firm, uses Red Hat OpenShift container technology on Microsoft Azure to support its Onesait Platform, a powerful and scalable development platform for IoT, AI, and other digital solutions. With the agility of container technology, the high functionality and global scalability in Azure, and enterprise-grade support from Microsoft and Red Hat, Minsait has built a multiservice platform that it can use to create new business models and help any organization establish a roadmap to digital success.

title: E-commerce leader migrates to SQL Server and Azure SQL Database, boosts product performance, opens markets
executive_summary: Since establishing itself as a pioneer in e-commerce, Intershop has never looked back—building up a global customer base and seizing the opportunities of the cloud. But supporting its software with database solutions sometimes led to complex and expensive licensing, over-provisioning instead of flexible scale, and fewer cloud benefits for its customers. Dedicated to offering its customers the best options, Intershop migrated to Microsoft SQL Server and Microsoft Azure SQL Database. Customers are already reporting dramatic leaps in performance, and Intershop has made its e-commerce services even more attractive across new markets.

title: HARTING reduces design time from weeks to minutes with Siemens and Azure AI
executive_summary: HARTING needed a simpler way for customers to find and design the right product among more than 27,000 options, as traditional processes were time-consuming and required technical expertise.
