executive_summary: Members 1st Federal Credit Union (Members 1st) was eager to use its vast data footprint to offer its members a more personalized experience and inform business decision-making with a data analytics solution.

title: Eclosia moves to the cloud with Dynamics 365 Finance, boosting stability for its 25 businesses
executive_summary: Eclosia, a diversified company with 25 businesses, faced performance and scalability issues with its on-premises infrastructure, impacting daily operations.

title: Holland America Line sees signs of more informed purchasing with Copilot Studio agent
executive_summary: Holland America Line wanted to provide even faster, more personalized support for customers—without driving up contact center volumes or running a traditional chatbot.

title: Neo4j expanded reach 6x through the Microsoft marketplace
executive_summary: Expanding its operations to connect with more potential customers required significant resources, and seeking a more streamlined path to global reach, Neo4j turned to the Microsoft marketplace.
products: Microsoft commercial marketplace

title: Van Wijnen tackles Dutch housing crisis with factory powered by Azure
executive_summary: With more than 100 years’ experience building sustainable and affordable homes in the Netherlands, Van Wijnen is ideally positioned to respond to the country’s housing crisis, which is among the worst in Europe.

title: Zones soars from servers to the sky with Dynamics 365 cloud transformation
executive_summary: Zones needed to support scalable growth across different geographies and enhance efficiency while modernizing its core systems and ensuring consistent customer experiences worldwide.

title: Weights & Biases and Microsoft Azure partner to power AI Innovation
executive_summary: Weights & Biases needed scalable, integrated cloud infrastructure to support growing AI workloads across industries—which required seamless deployment, fine-tuning, and experimentation capabilities delivered through Microsoft Azure.
products: Azure OpenAI Service, Azure AI Foundry, Azure

title: Powerserv Technologies boosts morale, productivity with AnnounceBot on Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Dedicated to developing dynamic software solutions with a people-first approach, Powerserv Technologies prioritizes innovation and emphasizes employee wellbeing. With 200 employees worldwide, the company needed to bridge the gap between office and remote workers and foster team bonding.
products: Microsoft Teams

title: DWF boosts productivity and client experience with Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: DWF understands generative AI will transform knowledge work. It wants to lead in AI in law and professional services.
products: Azure AI Services, Windows 11, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Purview, Microsoft Teams, Outlook, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Surface, Microsoft 365 Copilot

title: University of Oslo builds GPT-based chat for higher education in 9 weeks with Azure
executive_summary: With increasing student and staff demand for access to AI tools like ChatGPT, the University of Oslo (UiO) decided to create its own highly secure GPT chat.
products: Azure OpenAI Service, Azure, Azure AI Foundry

title: NOS empowers developer collaboration and innovation on GitHub
executive_summary: For six years, NOS has undergone a technological and cultural transformation, driving a dramatic expansion of coding practices across the business. But this increased isolated source control systems, preventing collaboration and code reuse.

title: Trade Ledger innovates with AI to revolutionise commercial banking using Azure OpenAI
executive_summary: Born in the cloud, Trade Ledger is revolutionising the way commercial banks operate.
products: Power BI, Azure OpenAI Service, Dynamics 365, Azure, Microsoft Copilot, Microsoft Teams, Azure DevOps, GitHub Copilot

title: A move to Azure speeds AI innovation for Recordsure
executive_summary: Recordsure develops AI-powered RegTech solutions for clients in the financial services, regulated industries and public sector.
products: Azure Key Vault, Azure Kubernetes Service, Power BI, Microsoft Entra ID, Azure OpenAI Service, Azure, Azure DevOps, Azure AI Search, Azure AI Speech, Azure Blob Storage

title: Camp management software provider accelerates performance at lower cost with Azure SQL Database serverless
executive_summary: CampBrain provides a gateway to fun for millions of campers. Based in Toronto, Canada, the software company offers a system to run camp registration, fee collection, and other administrative tasks. The small company serves a diverse clientele subject to dramatic and unpredictable usage spikes. All kinds of camps run on CampBrain—from traditional day and overnight summer camps to special needs, plus conference centers. It found a spike-proof, budget-friendly solution in Microsoft Azure SQL Database, using the serverless compute tier to optimize price performance and simplify management. While camp managers and parents enjoy uninterrupted service, CampBrain appreciates the savings—the company projects compute cost savings of 60 percent.

title: Greek flour milling company Loulis Mills boosts performance and saves costs with cloud-based critical system
executive_summary: Founded in the 18th century, family-run Loulis Mills has become one of Greece’s largest food companies. Supplying flour products to more than 10 countries, it needed to digitize its processes to provide better value to its customers. With the help of Microsoft partner TEKA Systems, Loulis Mills’ adoption of SAP S/4HANA on Azure has given it the secure and cost-efficient infrastructure needed to standardize operations and speed up processes, enhancing its quality control and delivery time.

title: Rentschler Biopharma SE introduces expandable datacenter based on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The life science sector is growing rapidly, and biopharmaceuticals are becoming more and more important—especially in the treatment of rare conditions. Rentschler Biopharma SE is a pioneer, both in the sector and in digitalization. Its employees have already been using solutions such as Microsoft 365 and Dynamics 365 to collaborate for many years. Now, its customers also stand to benefit from digital options. Rentschler Biopharma and Microsoft partner INFOMOTION have developed a cloud-based datacenter built around Microsoft Azure. Customers now have quick, affordable, flexible, and highly secure access to selected product information that they require for quality assurance purposes. The datacenter solution can also be expanded as needed.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Storage, Dynamics 365, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Entra ID

title: Fermax: Opening new doors for customers through IoT technology
executive_summary: One of the world’s leading door entry systems manufacturers, Fermax has always had a strong history in innovation. The company has developed a new Wi-Fi–enabled product through Microsoft Azure IoT technology, and for the first time it is able to see valuable insights around how customers are using its products. This helps Fermax not only improve their user experience, but also offer a range of value-added services directly to the customer.

title: Nespresso France brews exceptional customer experiences with Dynamics 365 Customer Service
executive_summary: Nespresso France faced increasing technical challenges and high customer expectations, requiring a more efficient customer service system.

title: Seegene leads the way toward ‘a world free from all diseases' with Azure AI
executive_summary: Seegene is collaborating with Microsoft to build a technology-sharing initiative as part of its corporate vision to create “a world free from all diseases." In the process, Seegene is leveraging Azure AI to automate foundational research processes and accelerating genomic analysis with Azure HPC, driving innovation across its entire R&D workflow.
products: Azure, Azure HPC, Azure OpenAI, Azure AI Search

title: Disparti Law Group uses Microsoft 365 and Copilot to serve clients faster
executive_summary: Disparti Law Group, one of the largest personal injury law firms in Chicago, needed to upgrade outdated on-premises infrastructure and inefficient ways of working, all in an effort to bring its commitment to helping clients into a new era.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft 365 Copilot, SharePoint

title: Crediclub migrates 95% of its infrastructure to Microsoft Azure, reduces latency by 90%
executive_summary: Crediclub's growth required a more agile infrastructure, with lower latency, lower operating cost and compliance with local regulations.

title: SKEMA Business School is transforming education with Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: SKEMA Business School aims to transform higher education by integrating AI.
products: Microsoft 365 Copilot, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Defender

title: ZEISS accelerates cloud-first development on Azure and streamlines order processing
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: Dutch Food producer, Aviko, creates a high-availability cloud setup to support 24-hour operations
executive_summary: As one of Europe’s leading producers of potato products, Aviko needs to maintain an efficient production line, from farm to factory to shipping around the world. To further optimize operations, Aviko implemented a new SAP Extended Warehouse Management (SAP EWM) system to remotely automate its cold storage warehouses. As a data-driven solution, the SAP EWM calculates the optimum way to store products and also communicates orders to over 30 automated robots, cutting the downtime between deliveries. This level of digital transformation required an entirely new IT infrastructure and a high-availability setup that could only be achieved by migrating to the cloud.

title: AIA Hong Kong & Macau connects customers to a world of secure and trusted digital experiences using Microsoft Azure Active Directory B2C
executive_summary: Smooth, seamless, reliable, and secure are critical features for a superior customer experience in today’s demanding digital landscape. Across the board in insurance and all businesses, accelerated digital transformation in the last 12 months is driving an unprecedented urgency to provide an all-digital service. But the challenge AIA Hong Kong & Macau faced when the business opened itself and its customers to a new world of digital opportunity, was the huge responsibility to ensure this world could be trusted and secure.
products: Azure, Azure SQL Database, Microsoft Entra ID

title: FortisAlberta prioritizes worker safety on Power Platform, boosting productivity and earning key tech award
executive_summary: FortisAlberta delivers safe and reliable electricity service to more than a half-million residential, farm, and business customers across central and southern Alberta, Canada. Operating in 240 communities across 124,000 kilometers (7,700 miles) of power lines, FortisAlberta’s team comprises more than 1,100 employees, including 350 first-line workers who need to be kept safe from preventable injuries.

title: Standard Bank of South Africa was well-positioned to transition to work from home using Microsoft identity and access management
executive_summary: The cybersecurity team at Standard Bank of South Africa thrives on pioneering security work. Based in Johannesburg, South Africa, the bank has a strong presence across 20 countries in Africa. It adopted Azure Active Directory and Microsoft Intune, now part of Microsoft Endpoint Manager, to manage and monitor user access. This helped Standard Bank transition smoothly to a 75 percent work-from-home workforce. It also earned a Microsoft Secure Score of 82 percent, which is 43 percent higher than similar organizations’ average.

title: A1: Creating a digital space for collaboration
executive_summary: When the pandemic hit in early 2020, many saw the interruption to face-to-face working as an impediment to collaboration. This wasn’t the case for Austrian telecommunications giant A1, which took a different approach to remote working. They saw it as an opportunity to reimagine the workplace, using the switch to digital communication tools to enhance teamwork and co-operation across the entire organisation. Relying solely on the Microsoft environment, they embarked on perhaps the greatest test of their new way of working – a virtual festival focussed on the topic of collaboration and co-creation.

title: Ardent Mills uses Microsoft Power Platform to enable a paperless state of the art mill
executive_summary: Ardent Mills is a premier flour-milling and ingredient company that cultivates the future of plant-based solutions to help their customers and communities thrive. They are committed to transforming how the world is nourished. They operate in more than 40 locations and specialize in flour, quinoa, pulses, and organic & gluten-free products to drive emerging nutrition and innovation across plant-based ingredients. Their holistic portfolio empowers the company to meet the complex needs of customers today while focusing on the growing needs of tomorrow’s consumer. Deeply rooted in communities throughout North America, Ardent Mills operates in the United States, including Puerto Rico, and Canada, with company headquarters in Denver, Colorado. They employ more than 100 certified millers and support thousands of local jobs that contribute billions of dollars to local economies – helping people, customers, and families everywhere flourish. Ardent Mills is also committed to corporate social responsibility, the quality of life and health for economy, and practice environmental sustainability across their four focus areas – Agriculture, Transportation & Logistics, Procurement, and Operations.

title: Siemens Healthineers uses Anomaly Detector to identify anomalies in X-ray tube production
executive_summary: With a huge number of installed systems worldwide, Siemens Healthineers is one of the biggest manufacturers of X-ray tube assemblies used for medical applications. To detect and respond to anomalies within the production process as early as possible, Siemens Healthineers is developing AI-based solutions for analyzing vast amounts of production data. One specific application involves monitoring the performance of liquid metal bearings by screening multivariate time series for anomalies. To streamline the processes, Siemens Healthineers follows the MLOps methodology. Siemens Healthineers partnered with Microsoft to rapidly build a prototype on Azure, including services for IoT connectivity, data storage, and machine learning lifecycle management. Siemens Healthineers applied Anomaly Detector—a multivariate anomaly detector capability within Microsoft Azure—within the use-case scenario. Anomaly Detector not only uses a state-of-the-art machine learning model architecture, but also provides explanations about the algorithm’s conclusions.

title: Zeti is driving towards cleaner air and a healthier planet with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: UK-based Zeti is a startup with a huge ambition: it aims to revolutionise transport finance for good. By connecting fleet operators with institutional financiers through its proprietary FinTech platform, Zeti supports the transition to no-carbon and ultra-low carbon vehicles in a simple and affordable way with pay-per-mile vehicle finance. Since its founding, Zeti has helped its customers to avoid nearly 8,000kgs of nitrous oxide into the atmosphere and the avoidance of nearly three million kilograms of carbon using the Azure platform - Azure API Management.

title: BWT Alpine F1 Team turns big data into faster track times with data science platform built on Azure and Azure NetApp Files
executive_summary: It goes without saying that things move quickly in the world of technology. Not as quickly, though, as in the world of Formula 1 racing, where every team is dedicated to the quickest lap times and helping their driver cross the line first. So, it comes as no surprise that BWT Alpine F1 Team would look for the fastest technology to help drive success on the track, since IT, too, must play its part in that team effort.
products: Azure, Azure Batch, Azure ExpressRoute, Azure NetApp Files, Azure Virtual Machines

title: Campari Group improves security, access for its 1,000+ third-party contractors worldwide through Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: Campari Group, the world’s sixth-largest spirits player with a portfolio of more than 50 brands, including Aperol, Appleton Estate, Campari, SKYY, Wild Turkey, and Grand Marnier, always strives to strike an operational balance between access and security. Headquartered in Italy, with 22 plants and in-market companies in 23 countries, Campari Group maintains an environment open enough to provide necessary access for valued third-party contractors, yet secure enough to minimize risks and stave off threats. Campari Group manages to do exactly that with Microsoft Azure Virtual Desktop and the Microsoft Cloud.

title: Elvia builds a highly secure DevOps platform with Azure infrastructure and network security services
executive_summary: Norwegian energy utility Elvia maintains a power grid network that spans more than 41,000 miles and serves more than 2 million customers. The company set out to build a secure, cloud-first DevOps platform that could meet Norway’s data residency and compliance requirements and scale to perform in a hybrid and multicloud environment. Elvia needed resilient, flexible components to deliver automated services that would help, not hinder, the company’s development of innovative grid network technology. Elvia realized its goal by enhancing its in-house development and data integration capabilities. Using Microsoft Azure DDoS Protection, Azure Web Application Firewall, Azure Bastion, Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), and Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) to help build and secure a development platform named Atlas.

title: Acotel: transforming routers from simple ‘black boxes’ to data gold mines and services platforms
executive_summary: The Internet of Things is transforming the telecommunications sector, allowing operators to gain insights into customer behavior and provide better, more innovative services based on them. Leading ICT Cloud company Acotel is committed to making this potential a reality in both the Italian and international telecoms markets. Using Microsoft Azure IoT, the company has developed a highly scalable edge-to-cloud solution that “mines” and processes data on traditional household routers. By providing that data to operators, it gives them an unparalleled understanding of their customer base and the perceived state of their services – all without introducing additional devices in the customer’s environment. This extraordinary solution, which stands right at the intersection between IoT technology and the telecoms sector, is already being used across over three million routers from different vendors in Italy – with plans to expand it to other countries already in the pipeline.

title: Moroccan deep-sea fishing company streamlines operations with SAP on Azure Server
executive_summary: Morocco-based deep-sea fishing company CNFC Group has worked for more than 30 years in the North Atlantic, exporting gourmet seafood across Europe and Asia. The company needed a digital upgrade to create a more flexible, agile, and scalable IT landscape. Microsoft partner CBI deployed SAP HANA on the Azure server. The platform has enabled CNFC to streamline operations, simplify financial management and ensure clear traceability on products from inventory to sales.

title: Modern communication as it should be: fast and flexible with Teams
executive_summary: The Swiss Gymnastics Federation had a traditional IT infrastructure with email traffic and an on-premise server at its center. But the significant pressure of digitization demanded new, flexible solutions. A restructuring of the system was undertaken in collaboration with novaCapta. A new system for communication and data transfer was designed with Microsoft Teams at its center. The novaWorxx solution from novaCapta facilitated further customization and expansion. Conscious change management, supported by both sides, contributed significantly to the success of the project. Key users from the various departments ensured that this was not just an IT project, but one in which all stakeholders were consulted and involved. They are the multipliers who will continue to enthusiastically support the changes internally in the future.
products: Planner, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft To Do, OneNote, SharePoint

title: Signly adopts Microsoft Azure removing communication barriers for Deaf people using sign language
executive_summary: For profoundly Deaf people in the UK, British Sign Language (BSL) is usually their first or preferred language. The capital ‘D’ is not a typing error – it is used to denote the pride that people have in their deafness. BSL has its own grammar and sentence structure and is not a signed equivalent of English. For many Deaf people in the UK, English is a second or third language. Content in written English can present a barrier. This is why Signly created their ground-breaking technology.

title: MYPINPAD secures its growth plans with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: “MYPINPAD was born in the cloud,” explains CEO Barry Levett. The innovative fin-tech business, based in Cardiff, UK, was founded in 2012 with the ambition of revolutionising mobile payments. Today, MYPINPAD’s PCI-certified fintech platform is used in 26 countries. It enables payments to be shifted from traditional, hardware-based systems to everyday, off-the-shelf mobile devices.

title: Banking on speed and performance: Why Banqsoft is upgrading to SQL Server 2022
executive_summary: Banqsoft is a Nordic-based market leader offering software solutions for asset finance, digital banking, and credit management. Combining cutting-edge technology with industry expertise, the company helps its customers stay competitive in an increasingly digital financial landscape.
products: Azure, Windows Hello, Microsoft Intune

title: UST unifies essential applications on Microsoft Teams to empower 33,000 employees to achieve more
executive_summary: UST is a global digital transformation solutions provider. Staying true to its mantra – Digital is our DNA - UST has enabled the world’s best companies to make a real impact through transformation. Powered by technology, inspired by people and led by purpose, UST partners with its clients from design to operations to embed innovation and agility. With more than 33,000 employees in over 25 geographies, it leverages the power of technology to engineer a better future and make a positive impact on billions of lives.

title: Polish fin-tech company mElements develops country’s first cloud-native payment gateway with Azure
executive_summary: mElements, a Polish provider of API banking and e-commerce solutions, introduced the country’s first payment gateway built purely on the public cloud. The solution, called Paynow, combines Microsoft Azure with Dynamics 365 to deliver a delightful digital shopping experience to e-commerce merchants and buyers. Built on highly scalable cloud infrastructure, Paynow offers top-level SLAs and uptimes in a rapidly growing market. The payment platform saw quick growing adoption in its first two years and currently serves more than 10,000 merchants around the country in various e-commerce business models.

title: Making a Play for Equity: How DeKalb County School District Has Embraced the Girls Who Game Program
executive_summary: DeKalb County School District is the third largest school district in the state of Georgia, with an enrollment of more than 93,000 students across 138 schools and centers. The district is supported by 20,000 teachers and staff who commit to providing a phenomenal educational experience to the diverse student population who represent more than 148 nations with 170 languages spoken. District administrators know first-hand that successful initiatives require collaboration among partners—motivation to action and dedication to equity. One such initiative is the Girls Who Game program that has taken off “like a wildfire” through the DeKalb County School District.

title: Microsoft reaches out to new markets with Microsoft Sales Copilot
executive_summary: As Microsoft works to build tech awareness and availability worldwide, the company’s business-to-business (B2B) sales team, the Microsoft Customer and Partner Solutions Group (MCAPS), uses the Dynamics 365 Sales platform to build relationships with clients and guide them to the best possible products and optimal usage. Looking to simplify workflows, improve the employee experience, and provide critical user insight, MCAPS started using Microsoft Sales Copilot ahead of its release to customers. Using Sales Copilot, MCAPS has seamlessly connected Dynamics 365 Sales and Microsoft 365 productivity tools while reducing the number of applications employees have to use at once. This is helping MCAPS speed up time to action and support the Sales Copilot product team, validating the ways the product can address workflow and data-flow problems for both internal employees and customers.

title: Microsoft modernizes its datacenter leasing cycle with Power Platform
executive_summary: The Lease Acquisition team at Microsoft manages a complex multi-billion-dollar leased datacenter portfolio. Initially, the team heavily relied on manual processes and tools, to interact with the Lease providers and maintained critical data across various Microsoft Office documents and SharePoint. As the business grew, the Lease team realized a pressing need to streamline and centralize its data for stakeholder visibility, transparency, and better accountability and reporting of the datacenter leasing process as well as enablement to manage assets effectively. The team required digitization of several processes to automate routine tasks and provide a secure user interface for Lease providers.

title: How Microsoft Dynamics 365 is helping Securitas to transform operations and make the world a safer place
executive_summary: Swedish security services provider Securitas is committed to keeping millions of people and organizations around the world safe by combining people with technology. As part of this mission, Securitas has rolled out a CRM platform that relies on Dynamics 365 to better support its sales teams, get greater insights via sales and customer data and foster greater transparency and collaboration across its client teams.

title: A bid for sustainability: ASCORP amplifies offers for green energy projects with Power Apps
executive_summary: ASCORP, a green energy trailblazer in Romania, faced challenges managing and standardizing its green energy projects’ bidding process. Driven by a vision of sustainability, ASCORP sought a solution to streamline its operations. Collaborating with Pepas Cloud, ASCORP developed an innovative app called Deep Quotes, on Power Apps. The solution helped ASCORP enhance its efficiency and improve collaboration by cutting down the time it takes to create an offer from 2-4 hours to five minutes.

title: CitiusTech leverages Microsoft Teams for a more engaged and productive workforce
executive_summary: CitiusTech Healthcare Technology Private Limited (CitiusTech) provides a range of technology solutions and services to healthcare and life sciences companies, to help them navigate an increasingly digitally driven industry. It provides offerings across consulting, engineering, healthcare solutions, products, analytics, and AI, to enable organizations in the healthcare sector to reinvent themselves, deliver better outcomes, and have a positive impact on patients. The company partners with healthcare and life sciences organizations across the world, accelerating digital innovation and driving business transformation. Boasting an impressive track record of over 130 satisfied clients and more than 5,000 successful deployments, CitiusTech is at the forefront of powering the future of healthcare by facilitating the industry's digital transformation journey.

title: Automotive Quality Control leader HOLLEN grows business, boosts security with Microsoft 365 Business Premium
executive_summary: When automotive manufacturers and suppliers need to ensure that their products adhere to a high standard of excellence, HOLLEN technicians arrive onsite to deliver quality control services. “We provide everything from simple visual control to highly complex quality control solutions,” explains Branislav Krampl, Director of Information and Communications Technology, Internal Processes Optimalization and Marketing at HOLLEN s.r.o. HOLLEN has already experienced remarkable growth since its origins as a small, family-run business in 2001. The company expanded from a single location in a family home in Slovakia―where business meetings were held in the living room―to multiple locations, and it now operates in four countries across 14 sites. From the beginning, HOLLEN focused on quality, flexibility, and well-trained people, with a goal to be the best in the market.

title: Dynamics 365 gives SanMar a modern design
executive_summary: SanMar is the nation’s premier supplier of wholesale imprintable apparel, bags, and caps. The Seattle stalwart sells a wide variety of branded and private label categories, as well as blank garments and accessories, through its distributor customers to large corporations like Starbucks and the Seattle Seahawks, small businesses, and community-based events.

title: Unisys adopts Microsoft Teams to streamline calling and collaboration, saving $1 million
executive_summary: Global technology solutions company Unisys prioritizes the ideas and opinions of its associates. “The first thing I noticed when I joined Unisys was how people-oriented the culture is,” says Dave Hamshaw, Senior Consultant for Digital Workplace Solutions at Unisys. “If you have a problem, there’s always someone you can call.” Until recently, however, those calls happened on a variety of disparate technology platforms, including point solutions such as Microsoft Teams and point solutions such as Zoom. When an annual employee survey revealed that associates found using multiple applications to be inefficient—switching between two platforms to share documents and participate in video meetings was eating up valuable time—Hamshaw and his team were tasked with finding a solution. “Getting people onto a unified platform for highly secure communication was key,” he says. “That’s why we chose to consolidate on Microsoft Teams.”

title: Trimble partners with Microsoft to take on construction’s biggest challenges
executive_summary: In thinking about our future world, few numbers are as mind-boggling as the amount of construction needed to support it. In order to keep up with Global Economic Forum’s urban population projections, we’ll need to construct the equivalent of 2.8 new New York Cities, every month, from now until 2050. It’s difficult to comprehend a task this monumental. And even more humbling once you consider the historic labor shortages squeezing the construction industry and ambitious net zero targets that put immense pressure on an industry that is responsible for more than a third of global CO2 emissions.

title: Bp powers greater innovations with a modular data mesh design on Azure
executive_summary: Global energy giant bp is transforming into an integrated multi-source energy provider. To speed innovations in support of this initiative, the company is working to democratize data ownership, enhance and streamline data sharing, and optimize the flexibility of its platform by leveraging the Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform for a new multicloud modular data mesh architecture.

title: BPW Aftermarket Group drives enterprise standardization with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The BPW Aftermarket Group (BPW AMG) is the commercial vehicle (CV) spare parts network of the BPW Group. More than 1,500 employees at 170 branches throughout Europe ensure the reliable and fast supply of spare parts for trucks and trailers across the continent. BPW AMG supports CV shops and vehicle operators to repair and maintain vehicles quickly, safely, and efficiently, and at the same time in keeping with their values. In other words, BPW ensures that shops have the right number of the right spare parts for the right vehicles at the right time.

title: Thomas Concrete Group drives the cutting edge of sustainable concrete with Internet-of-Things solutions from Microsoft
executive_summary: Thomas Concrete Group broke new ground with its IoT sustainable concrete offering with Microsoft solutions. The group aims to lead the construction industry’s reduction of its carbon footprint by using data to provide insight into its concrete. By offering embedded concrete sensors connected to algorithms developed in house and developing new concrete mixes using sustainable binders, Thomas Concrete Group delivers the cutting edge of concrete technology. The group put its data on Microsoft Azure and used other Microsoft solutions to develop and deploy a new IoT service. Now, it is easier for Thomas Concrete Group clients to reduce their carbon footprint while delivering projects faster and reducing waste.

title: Children 1st protects families across Scotland with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Children 1st offers whole-family support across Scotland to ensure children are safe, secure, and loved. The nonprofit needed to update its CRM so frontline workers can better record and use up-to-date information. With Dynamics 365, Children 1st tracks current cases, empowers frontline staff to spend more time building relationships with families, and measures impact to communicate with supporters.

title: Hokkoku Bank uses Microsoft Teams and Microsoft 365 to build a digital organization that focuses on customers first
executive_summary: Hokkoku Bank, a regional Japanese bank with an 80-year history, has a mission to not only serve customers but to help build the future of the region where it operates. Key to this journey is the decision to accelerate the pace of business by using Microsoft Teams and Microsoft 365. To date, the bank has replaced email communication with a more agile, real-time alternative: Teams chat. Also using Teams, the organization has broken down information silos and empowered employees with the ability to communicate directly with colleagues across all levels of the business. The bank also uses modern tools and flexible ways of working to increase employee satisfaction and attract new talent.

title: Low-Code: a tool for employee commitment
executive_summary: Developing high-performance business applications with little code is the promise of "Low-Code", an approach that makes it easier for everyone to handle technology. Zoom in on IKEA France's approach, which relies on Power Platform technology to engage and develop its talents.

title: Windows 11 Pro lets the music play on
executive_summary: Based in New South Wales, TMRW Music Group is one of Australia’s leading independent music and entertainment groups, covering recordings, publishing, and live events in the field of electronic music. The company runs music events and festivals, manages venues, and books over 2,000 gigs a year. They represent major Australian electronic artists like PNAU, Fisher, and Hot Dub Time Machine, as well as some of the world’s leading music brands, including Ministry of Sound.

title: Intralox boosts customer service effectiveness with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Intralox, a subsidiary of Laitram Corporation, provides highly specialized and innovative conveyance technologies and services that enhance food safety, power e-commerce, and solve material handling challenges for food processing, industrial manufacturing, and logistics industries worldwide. The industry leader in complex conveyance systems, Intralox focuses on continual improvement to meet the evolving needs of its customers.

title: DTCC finds innovative use for Viva Insights, supporting diversity and inclusion initiatives with data-driven insights
executive_summary: For 50 years, Depository Trust & Clearing Corporation (DTCC) has been at the forefront of bringing increased safety and security to global financial markets. Recognizing that employees are the firm’s greatest asset in delivering on this mission, DTCC remains focused on continuing to enhance how it supports and advances its global team while fostering an environment where everyone can do their best work, all underpinned by a robust commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI).

title: Murdoch’s unifies retail operations and POS with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Murdoch’s Ranch & Home Supply has met the needs of farmers and ranchers, do-it-yourselfers, and outdoor enthusiasts since opening its first store in Bozeman, Montana, in 1994. Today, more than 2000 Murdoch’s employees sell over 300,000 products in 40 stores via two distribution centers throughout the west and on its e-commerce site. Murdoch’s friendly, knowledgeable service staff help customers discover its breadth of products to find everything from fence posts and animal feed to toys, tools, and tack.
products: Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Commerce, Dynamics 365 Finance

title: Petrobras achieves cloud-only strategy, managing thousands of devices remotely, with Microsoft Intune
executive_summary: When Petrobras’ administrative employees were forced out of shared spaces and into their home offices in March 2020, the multinational oil and gas company acted quickly to implement highly secure infrastructure to enable remote work. After it developed a return-to-work model, it kept policies in place to support employees’ ability to work remotely part time. It’s no simple feat for Petrobras to manage 82,000 company computers, 6,000 corporate mobile devices, and 30,000 personal devices linked to Intune mobile application management, but its new Microsoft tools make it easy.

title: Presidio builds a unified solution on Microsoft Project for the web to streamline its project management
executive_summary: Presidio is a Global Digital Services and Solutions Provider that has more than 150 project managers on staff guiding thousands of projects for multiple clients. The management team worked with a patchwork of processes and tools, which made collaboration difficult and reduced visibility into the status of the company’s projects. Looking to create a central platform to enable the delivery of client outcomes efficiently, the Presidio team built the Presidio Project Portal on top of Microsoft Project for the web with Power Apps, Power BI, and Microsoft Teams integration. This tool gives project managers an easy way to drive projects and provides a central location for all relevant data, improving visibility and collaboration.

title: Power Apps helps NTT DATA Business Solutions bring speedy relief to earthquake victims
executive_summary: In February 2023, a massive earthquake struck central and southern Türkiye, creating widespread damage to an area about the size of Germany. More than 50,000 people were killed and the UN estimates that 1.5 million were left homeless—in the middle of winter. Within two weeks, NTT DATA Business Solutions Türkiye used Microsoft Power Apps to create an internal fundraising platform, OneHeart Solidarity, for the benefit of their affected employees and their families. Around 40 percent of employees donated, raising more than €100,000 for their colleagues and families.

title: SA Power Networks makes rooftop solar smarter
executive_summary: SA Power Networks has invested to provide increased network hosting capacity for rooftop solar. A significant share of renewables on its electricity distribution network comes from excess solar energy exported into the power grid from customers’ rooftop solar panels. To dynamically manage the volume of exports, in addition to avoiding waste or damage to the system at peak generation times, the utility developed the Flexible Exports solution, using Azure IoT for monitoring. In a trial of Flexible Exports, the average customer more than doubled their exported energy. Data collected over the internet from participant households also provides the utility with better network visibility at street level to help improve performance and safety.

title: Royal Automobile Club of Western Australia modernizes to drive auto club member service with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Royal Automobile Club of Western Australia (RAC) is a membership organization based in Western Australia, with 2,000 employees serving more than 1.2 million members. As a purpose-led organization without shareholders, RAC is focused on influencing positive change to improve life for all Western Australians. RAC also offers a number of services including Roadside Assistance, Insurance, Travel, Tourism, Finance, Auto Services, Batteries, Tyres, and Security.

title: Quantium Technology creates robust private equity management platform, scaling up internationally with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Quantium Technology is transforming private market operations with its modern and comprehensive software suite for fund/portfolio management, and investor relationship management. The firm was founded with the distinct vision to scale internally and position itself as the system of choice for forward-looking, 21st century professional fund managers. As the company enhanced its global scalability, Microsoft stood out as the preferred technology partner. In just five months, Quantium migrated to Azure's state-of-the-art platform, empowering its clients to focus on quality analysis while significantly minimizing manual tasks.

title: HB Antwerp's game-changing move: A transparent transformation of diamonds with Azure Confidential Ledger
executive_summary: Belgian company HB Antwerp is redefining how natural diamonds are sourced, crafted, and sold. Supply chains for natural resources are often complex and opaque, but the company is on a mission to give miners and governments complete insight into the post-production retail value of their resources. To gain this insight, HB Antwerp turned to Microsoft and its Dynamics 365 Finance, Dynamics 365 Project Operations, and Azure solutions, using ledger technologies to record immutable data points across the diamond’s journey, ensuring sustainability and visibility every step of the way. Now HB Antwerp can predict its profit more accurately, reduce errors, increase communication, and ensure maximum value for everyone involved. Miners and governments reap the financial benefits and consumers can see how their diamond purchases contribute to transforming Botswana’s economy and the lives of its citizens.

title: KPMG Netherlands streamlines enterprise integration platforms through Azure Integration Services
executive_summary: KPMG Netherlands is the Dutch firm of the KPMG global organization of independent professional services firms, providing advisory and audit services. The company uses multiple pieces of software from different vendors, but the lack of a central API system for application integration requests meant redundant work, slower onboarding, and system inaccuracies. The KPMG Netherlands IT team used Azure Integration Services to build a comprehensive integration platform with Azure API Management and Azure Logic Apps orchestration to ensure that all its services connected in the same manner, resulting in a clearer workflow and modifiable future-proofed interface. Processes that previously took days to run are now available nearly immediately.

title: Centrica develops over 800 business solutions with Power Platform
executive_summary: Centrica is a leading energy services and solutions provider and the UK’s biggest retailer of zero carbon electricity. The company’s use of Power Platform has grown from 300 apps in 2019 to over 800 business solutions today - from simple productivity solutions to advanced, enterprise-wide solutions. A Center of Excellence helps maintain governance and supports almost 330 makers and 15,000 users across the company. Total savings from Power Platform development is estimated at $4.4 million over four years compared to other development options.

title: LALIGA makes real-time data the heart of every match with Surface Pro
executive_summary: LALIGA, a sports association based in Madrid and comprising 42 football clubs, chose Surface Pro to achieve maximum benefit from its sophisticated player analysis data. The clubs needed powerful hardware to bring the system directly to the sidelines of matches and practices and chose Surface Pro 9. Now, every LALIGA club has real-time access to data that informs decisions to protect the health of players. This has the potential to improve outcomes for teams and the association overall.
products: Surface Pro

title: With Dynamics 365 Sales, Glencore Technology increases workflow efficiencies by 50%
executive_summary: Glencore Technology, a subsidiary of Glencore PLC, one of the world’s largest, globally diversified natural resource companies, needed to upgrade its sales solution. The previous solution struggled with poor customer engagement tracking in addition to reporting—and lacked integration capabilities. They sought to increase lead generation, simplify contact management, and improve internal reporting, while providing greater value to clients in the sales process. After piloting Microsoft Power BI, they discovered Dynamics 365 Sales and Customer Insights and chose a Microsoft solution. As a result, they increased workflow efficiencies and data quality, and improved customer experiences across the sales cycle.

title: House of HR enhances security across its diverse organization with the Microsoft 365 E5 bundle
executive_summary: House of HR is a pan-European company specializing in Human Resources services including staffing, consultancy and recruitment. Headquartered in Belgium, it has around 5,000 employees located in over 800 branches. The company has an aggressive growth policy that includes the widespread acquisition of small to mid-sized organizations, which however retain a high degree of autonomy. Ensuring an excellent standard of security for all parts of the organization – and the data of the millions of candidates they process each year – is a challenge that the team has addressed with several Microsoft solutions such as the Microsoft 365 E5 bundle. Including security solutions Microsoft Defender, Microsoft Purview and Microsoft Sentinel, the new stack has successfully raised security KPIs and maturity levels across the entire company.

title: Fujitsu unifies global platform with DXP Cloud, enhancing operations and balancing security with convenience through Unified Support
executive_summary: Fujitsu Limited is building and operating DXP Cloud, a global in-house IT cloud platform, to strengthen security governance. The globally integrated platform provides a cloud environment with security implemented in a speedy manner to realize both safety and security, as well as convenience.
products: Azure, Azure DevOps

title: McCormick brings employees and information together with Viva Connections
executive_summary: McCormick is known as a global leader in flavor. The company’s range of brands and products are enjoyed by millions of consumers around the world every day. Integral to the organization’s ongoing success is the 13,500-strong team behind these household and restaurant favorites, and finding ways to connect, inform, and engage with them is a key component of the company’s growth strategy. However, one of the tools to help with this—the company’s intranet—lacked modern functionality. In response, McCormick built a new employee portal with Microsoft Viva Connections. MKC Connect offers vibrant multimedia assets that are accessible to all employees through mobile-first technology, and its content management system enables updates to be made quickly and efficiently. Feedback has been excellent so far, and the real-time analytics in Viva Connections demonstrate the site’s growing popularity. McCormick has exciting plans to add new personalized functionality and content, giving the company a solid foundation for future growth in this key area of employee engagement.

title: Tagme digitizes the on-premises journey of restaurants with support from Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: N/A
products: Azure

title: The Stour Academy Trust uses Reading Progress and Reading Coach to inspire a love of reading and support students with reading difficulties
executive_summary: The Stour Academy Trust is a multi-academy trust serving the county of Kent in Southeast England. The staff and faculty work diligently to create a pedagogical model that focuses on student voice, choice, and collaboration. As part of this model, the Trust was interested in testing two powerful Microsoft education tools—Reading Progress and Reading Coach—to boost literacy and help all readers succeed.
products: Microsoft 365 A5, Reading Coach, Reading Progress

title: Dynamics 365 brings customer-centricity to the next level at MSC
executive_summary: MSC Mediterranean Shipping Company (MSC), headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland, is a global leader in transportation and logistics, privately owned and founded in 1970 by Gianluigi Aponte. The company has evolved from a one-vessel operation into a globally respected business with an 800-vessel fleet and more than 200,000 staff providing timely delivery of goods and services to customers of all industries and sizes. MSC’s shipping line sails on more than 300 trade routes from 520 ports. With access to an integrated network of road, rail, air, and sea transport resources which stretches across the globe, the company prides itself on delivering global service with local knowledge.
products: Dynamics 365 Customer Service

title: Kubota Corporation develops engines faster with high-performance computing on Azure
executive_summary: The Kubota Corporation Engine Engineering Department faced a workload surge as it developed a new concept engine, resulting in long waiting times for calculations on its on-premises environment. The department needed a solution that gave it maximum computing power and kept costs low. It decided to adopt Azure and build a cloud high-performance computing system. It achieved favorable results in computation time, business agility, cost optimization, and more. Compared to the on-premises system, Kubota sliced computation time significantly.
products: Azure, Azure HPC

title: Agappe transforms operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Agappe Diagnostics Ltd (Agappe) was founded in 1995 with the vision of becoming the premier partner in diagnostics and contributing to the welfare of mankind. The company has since established itself as a rapidly expanding In-Vitro Diagnostic (IVD) company. It focuses on the research, design, and production of clinical chemistry, immunochemistry, immunology, and haematology reagents and equipment. Additionally, the company provides point of care testing solutions to deliver high-quality and affordable diagnostics to customers.
products: Dynamics 365 Finance

title: Microsoft Security implements Microsoft Entra ID Governance and saves over $1.5 million per year
executive_summary: The Digital Security and Resilience team at Microsoft handles identities and access management for the majority of all Microsoft-owned tenants. Previously, the team managed identities and access with SailPoint IIQ, a legacy solution that was becoming difficult to maintain and expensive, costing over $1.5 million per year. The team switched to Microsoft Entra ID Governance, gaining a cloud-native approach and automated tooling, cutting costs, and scaling to over 200,000 entities in just six months.
products: Microsoft Entra ID Governance

title: Schneider Electric charges into the future with Microsoft Copilot for Sales
executive_summary: Schneider Electric’s global sales teams must engage with several tedious, manual tasks and toggle between multiple screens and apps if they want good data quality in their Salesforce CRM, taking time away from core selling activities.
products: Microsoft Teams, Outlook

title: Carlsberg Group increases cloud efficiency with FinOps and Azure solutions
executive_summary: Carlsberg migrated its IT infrastructure to the Azure cloud in 2018 very quickly, to minimize any system downtime that would affect production. It began its FinOps journey to gain visibility into costs and to right size resources.
products: Cost Management, Azure, SQL Server, Windows, Azure Advisor, Azure Policy

title: Carvajal Technology and Services structures its marketing with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The Colombian company chose Microsoft solutions to get a 360° view of the customer. By implementing Dynamics 365 and Power BI, it was able to predict, project and make decisions based on specific information when it needed it.

title: Dynamics 365 Customer Service modernizes Latin America's oldest Chamber of Commerce
executive_summary: With its digital opening, the Santo Domingo Chamber of Commerce and Production achieves greater stability from a single platform by using Dynamic 365 Customer Service as a CRM, reaching 14,000 monthly registration transactions and allowing users to access the institution's services and requests from any location.

title: Financiera Juriscoop grew 45% leveraging Microsoft technologies
executive_summary: The Colombian finance company chose Dynamics 365 to support its business strategy, putting the customer at the center of the experience.
products: Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Sales, Power BI

title: U.S. Venture gains efficiencies and insights with Dynamics 365 and Microsoft 365 Copilot for Finance
executive_summary: U.S. AutoForce pays thousands of invoices per day and 50% of orders are for same day delivery. Its legacy supply chain and warehouse management tools could no longer reliably perform at this volume and the finance team was stretched due to manual accounting processes.
products: Power BI, Microsoft 365 Copilot for Finance, Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management, Dynamics 365 Finance, Power Automate

title: Onslow County Schools drives secure education by providing technology access using Microsoft Intune
executive_summary: Onslow County Schools (Onslow) wanted to give students access to important software but didn’t want to grant students and teachers administrative access. The district needed to balance security and access to provide the best education possible.

title: The Ottawa Hospital hosts its mission-critical disaster recovery systems on Microsoft Azure, cuts backup costs in half
executive_summary: The Ottawa Hospital is one of Canada’s foremost health sciences centers, providing world-class care to 1.2 million people. Comprising three major campuses and 20 other satellite locations, it manages millions of patient records. During the process of moving to a new electronic health records system, the hospital looked at alternatives to on-premises hosting that ensured hosting was kept in Canada. Moving its data to Microsoft Azure, the hospital reduced its disaster recovery costs by 50 percent.
products: Azure Site Recovery, Azure Storage, Azure Virtual Machines

title: MVP Health Care uses Dynamics 365 to personalize member support, promote healthy communities
executive_summary: To improve the quality of care while lowering costs for its members, MVP Health Care works to provide seamless coordination by monitoring and managing members with programs designed to capture early diagnoses, prevent complications, and drive better patient results. Fully understanding members’ needs, however, was challenged by a customer relationship management environment that was pieced together from multiple siloed data sources and technologies. With Microsoft Dynamics 365, MVP Health Care has built a comprehensive, centralized, fully interoperable member-engagement platform with a single view into the heartbeat of every member.
products: Azure, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Sales, Microsoft 365, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, Surface Hub, Surface Studio

title: Suite Hub streamlines bookings and increases conversions with Dynamics 365 Sales and Power Apps
executive_summary: Suite Hub makes it easy to source, compare, and book serviced accommodations for business travelers anywhere in the world. To best present corporate bookers with accommodation options that perfectly match their needs, Suite Hub uses Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales and Power Pages. Suite Hub continues to make enhancements to its platform to centralize data, increase data security, and help bookers and providers interact seamlessly. By unifying its interface and adding Power Automate flows with low-code development, Suite Hub increased the efficiency of its booking process, leading to a 30 percent boost in booking conversions.
products: Dynamics 365 Sales, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power Pages

title: Co-op moves its multi-century mission forward with a data warehouse built on Azure Synapse Analytics
executive_summary: Since 1844, the Co-op’s mission has been to help its communities thrive. The group does this today by providing food, insurance, legal services, funeral care, and more to members and customers across the United Kingdom. When the Co-op’s siloed, on-premises data solution could no longer keep up with its needs, the team evaluated leading cloud solutions and chose Microsoft Azure and Azure Synapse Analytics for its modern data warehouse solution. Now, the Co-op is unlocking insights and new use cases to empower communities today—and far into the future.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics

title: Sonata builds a unifying data platform for Alltech with Microsoft Fabric
executive_summary: To better align its business processes with its global sustainability goals, Alltech continually looks for ways to be more efficient. Because it is a global organization, travel is a significant portion of Alltech’s expenses, and the company wanted to better understand its travel strategy and spend.
products: Azure, Microsoft Fabric, Power BI

title: Regional health insurer improves security and experience, simplifies monitoring with Microsoft security solutions
executive_summary: MVP Health Care is a nationally recognized regional health plan with strong values of quality and integrity. The company’s emphasis on member confidentiality and cybersecurity makes it easy to see why it has won numerous awards for quality, service, and customer satisfaction. When the company divested from numerous overlapping, redundant security licenses, it turned to Microsoft integrated security solutions for a simpler, more proactive and easily managed security posture.

title: Britax Römer creates a unified e-commerce solution to help get car seats in more hands and protect children
executive_summary: Britax Römer prides itself on producing some of the world’s safest and most comfortable child mobility solutions, including car seats and strollers. In Europe, the company works with a wide range of retail customers who increasingly expect comprehensive, real-time digital selling solutions. To provide more robust experiences and discoverability for retailers and streamline the customer’s buying journey, Britax Römer is deploying the AI-powered business-to-business (B2B) e-commerce capabilities in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Commerce. With all product and customer journey information in a single location and the ability to provide experiences for both traditional and emerging channels, Britax Römer retailer partners can focus on delivering exceptional service to consumers and get more car seats into the hands of parents to help protect more children on the road every day.
products: Dynamics 365 Commerce

title: Varde Municipality has significantly increased its security and compliance by implementing microsoft 365 E5.
executive_summary:
The threat from cybercriminals has never been greater. And the new challenges require that security and compliance are thought through from the start. Therefore, the Microsoft 365 E5 license has given Varde Municipality a range of security tools. In Varde Municipality, the cloud-based digital solution with Microsoft 365 E5 provides employees and users with a secure framework to work under while ensuring that public security and infrastructure requirements are pre-thought in and continuously updated. Varde has thus got a solution that brings everything together on a platform, ensures compliance with GDPR and strengthens IT security.

In this video, you can hear more about Varde Municipality view and experiences using Microsoft 365 E5.

title: Slovenské elektrárne supercharges weather predictions with Azure and Power BI analytics
executive_summary: Slovenské elektrárne (SEAS) is the biggest electricity provider in Slovakia, producing two-thirds of the country’s power—95 percent of which is generated without CO2 emissions mainly due to nuclear power plants. To stay on top of the electricity market, the company had relied on manual forecasting to predict how much electricity would be generated based on weather changes. However, SEAS needed a more efficient and cost-effective system to stay ahead. The energy provider implemented a machine learning solution comprised of Azure Synapse Analytics and Azure Databricks, which has saved the company around €100,000 and cut down forecasting time from two hours to 15 minutes.

title: BeeKeeperAI speeds healthcare AI development with Azure confidential computing and Intel SGX
executive_summary: Access to healthcare data is critical for clinical AI development, but availability is hampered by lengthy contracting and medical ethics reviews to ensure data security, typically through data anonymization tools. BeeKeeperAI uses Microsoft Azure confidential computing to create secure data enclaves built on Intel Software Guard Extensions. Within these, encrypted AI computes against an encrypted dataset in the data steward’s HIPAA-compliant cloud environment. BeeKeeperAI’s Zero Trust platform now dramatically accelerates the healthcare AI development process by enabling sightless computing on secure, quality healthcare data compared to traditional methods.
products: Azure

title: Evolving with speed with Microsoft Trusted Cloud
executive_summary: Investec partners with private, institutional, and corporate clients, offering international banking, investment, and wealth management services. The Investec journey sets it apart — from a small finance company founded in South Africa in 1974 to an international organisation with listings on the London and Johannesburg Stock Exchanges. One of the world’s most inspiring leaders Nelson Mandela described Investec as “a company which stands head and shoulders above its peers — not merely because of its phenomenal growth or its sound management of assets, but because it is a trendsetter.”

title: Edumundo relies on Microsoft Azure for app modernization and innovation at scale
executive_summary: Edumundo provides education technology serving over 100,000 students at 300+ universities globally. They needed a strong cloud partner that could help them modernize both the backend and the customer experience of their products. By migrating to Azure IaaS services and modernizing their platform to run on Azure App Service, they can now deliver innovative experiences to meet customers' needs by introducing features faster and helping educators deliver more engaging learning experiences that are scalable and reliable.

title: LambdaTest builds HyperExecute, a secure, scalable testing platform that is 70% faster with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: LambdaTest is a continuous quality testing cloud platform that helps developers and testers ship code faster. Over one million users across over 130 countries and leading enterprises rely on LambdaTest for their testing needs. Founded in 2017, LambdaTest is headquartered in San Francisco, CA, with over 300 employees working across India, USA, UK, Philippines and UAE.

title: How Lake Washington School District uses Search coach to achieve digital literacy
executive_summary: In an age when information can be accessed on any screen the problem for educators is often less about making up for lack of information, but instead managing the excess therein. One might assume that the current crop of students – digital natives born in a world awash with information and the tools to find it – would naturally have more skill when it came to searching, but it turns out this is rarely the case. After all, not all information measures up to the standards of accuracy and objectivity crucial for real learning.
products: Microsoft 365 A5, Microsoft Teams, Reading Progress, Search Coach, Windows 11

title: Nedbank brings 28,600 employees closer together with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Nedbank, a South African bank spread across three continents, strives to become a great digital place to work at. “Our vision is to enable our staff to work from anywhere, anytime, on any device,” says Asokan Moodley, Executive Head of End User and Communication Experience at Nedbank. To integrate staff conference calls into daily work, Nedbank deployed Microsoft Teams Phone and Teams Rooms throughout its organization. This brought more efficiency and collaboration while saving time and cost, leading to faster service and increased customer satisfaction.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Teams Rooms, Microsoft Teams Phone

title: How the Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform enables Ahold Delhaize to drive value across its brand ecosystem
executive_summary: As one of the world’s largest food retail groups, Ahold Delhaize is devoted to improving the lives of its customers using technology. To do this, the company has embarked on a digital transformation journey that centers around boosting its loyalty and personalization programs. Powered by the Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform, Ahold Delhaize’s solution is helping to provide more personalized services to the millions of people in its customer base. All while allowing it to be more environmentally conscious and to make more of its data.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, Intelligent Data Platform, Power BI

title: Piraeus Bank builds on collective strengths, unites hybrid teams with Viva Connections
executive_summary: Piraeus Bank makes thousands of employees connected and empowered from the first 'hello.' The bank builds on the collective strengths of every team member by expanding Microsoft Teams with Viva Connections. The employee experience hub helps strengthen company culture and foster connections among employees, where everyone can feel included. Employees can now make the most of their workday, no matter where they are.

title: Northern Tool + Equipment achieves faster delivery by transforming its supply chain infrastructure
executive_summary: Northern Tool + Equipment is a manufacturing and omnichannel retail business with 130 stores across the United States. Hampered by a fragmented supply chain infrastructure, the company wanted to offer faster delivery and more precise delivery dates for a better customer experience. The company is rolling out the intelligent order management capabilities from Microsoft to provide a frictionless experience that guarantees faster, more reliable delivery times, so its customers get the tools and supplies they need when they need them.
products: Dynamics 365

title: Santam uses Microsoft Dynamics 365 Field Service to streamline risk surveying
executive_summary: Leading insurer Santam has harnessed Microsoft Dynamics 365 Field Service to streamline and speed up the risk surveying process, to help the group manage risk more efficiently and improve service to policy holders.
products: Dynamics 365 Field Service, Power Apps

title: A Greek MSP leads the way by empowering employees with Azure skills
executive_summary: Office Line is one of the leading cloud Managed Services Provider in Greece, Cyprus, and Malta, and a star Microsoft partner for 20 years. It empowers companies by helping them migrate to the cloud. In an effort to accelerate the Azure migration process, Office Line turned to Microsoft’s training and skilling initiatives to raise operational capacity and equip its employees with the necessary skills and knowledge. Today, Office Line is one of few organizations in the world to receive seven Advanced Specializations on Microsoft Cloud. These specialized skills are helping the company grow by 40 percent every year.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365

title: Bethesda Health Care puts patients first with new Bethesda Clinic and Cloud for Healthcare
executive_summary: With the opening of its new Cockburn Clinic, Bethesda Health Care is bringing high-quality mental health services to an underserved section of Perth, Western Australia. To meet its goal of keeping patients healthy at home, Bethesda has built a new patient administration system based on Microsoft Cloud for Healthcare with the help of Microsoft Cloud Partner Program member Velrada. The new system will ensure continuity of care across multiple providers and give patients on-demand access to all information about their care journey. Bethesda expects the new system will improve patient outcomes, increase collaboration between clinical staff, and make the organization more flexible and receptive to the public’s changing expectations for healthcare delivery, while also helping ensure business success.

title: Qlik helps organizations realize the power of analytics and AI with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: With more than 25 years in data and advanced analytics, Qlik helps enterprises move faster, work smarter, and lead the way forward with end-to-end solutions for getting value out of data. Qlik Cloud Data Integration expands the availability of data within Microsoft Azure, leveraging real-time data integration solutions that ingest from practically any source, on-premises or in the cloud, including complex business-critical data sources like SAP and mainframe.

title: Fifty thousand nature shots in two days: The Bavarian Forest National Park is simplifying its wildlife monitoring with Microsoft Azure and AI
executive_summary: It’s a picture of biodiversity: 14,000 species living on more than 25,000 hectares. To safeguard this diversity for the future, camera traps are used to continuously monitor wildlife populations in the Bavarian Forest National Park, central Europe’s oldest and largest forest preserve. The traps capture some 1,000 images a day of anything that moves, such as animals and plants. The images are then analyzed and categorized for research purposes and population surveys. Previously a very time-consuming task involving manual sorting, the same volume of data can now be processed in just two days—thanks to MegaDetector, Microsoft Azure, and automatic categorization by artificial intelligence. As a result, insights are gained faster, paving the way for even more species conservation.
products: Azure, Azure Virtual Machines

title: Coles accelerates from monthly to weekly application deployments with Azure
executive_summary: To create an outstanding e-commerce experience that digitizes and modernizes shopping for customers on every channel, leading Australian supermarket brand Coles sought a partner to help streamline development processes and efficiently integrate updates and feedback. Whether customers are in-store, online, or engaged in a hybrid experience with their mobile app, Coles is committed to creating and delivering a consistently great experience, backed by data and insights. As they continue to expand their e-commerce capabilities, they leverage Microsoft solutions to empower their development and engineering teams.
products: Azure, Azure API Management, Azure App Service, Azure Cosmos DB

title: Novo Nordisk accelerates life-changing research using Azure DevOps and GitHub
executive_summary: Novo Nordisk scientists and engineers work at the frontiers of discovery to defeat serious chronic diseases. The researchers frequently collaborate with external teams. For every new Novo Nordisk partner, the IT team had to provide new environments and access. Events at home, frustration with the course material, a first romance gone bad, and more can alter the mood of the students and their ability to connect with the material and each other. This social and emotional landscape has always been a part of the reality of learning, but its importance elevated in the wake of the disruptions of the last few years, and the anxieties it left behind in students. Not needing to build and manage its own dedicated backup infrastructure has led to cost and time savings like 95 percent faster Microsoft 365 backups, an AUD20,000 reduction in annual licensing costs, and AUD50,000 less in upfront costs with Metallic. It’s also given Dialog an opportunity to grow its business and envision a seamless and highly securely future in the cloud.

title: PepsiCo uses Azure Machine Learning to identify consumer shopping trends and produce store-level actionable insights

To move to a more machine learning, predictive analytics approach, the company deployed Microsoft Azure Machine Learning to gain actionable insights from its vast repositories of data, and PepsiCo has started using it for select markets in the United States. As the company learns from this pilot test and the models, its goal is to expand more broadly to other sectors and markets. In the pilot, PepsiCo field associates received daily lists of priorities for each store they visit, so they can better predict the snacks that individual stores need to stock to better meet the shopping needs of consumers. The data scientists generating the lists use the machine learning operations capabilities in Azure Machine Learning to streamline the process of developing and working with the models that inform those priorities. As a result, early signs estimate a shift of 4,300 days of work a year from routine tasks to value-added activities.

Now, the lawyers and investment bankers who coordinate sales can reduce redaction times by up to 80 percent, helping to move deals forward faster and support successful outcomes.

This helps the MHP eliminate human error, lower costs, and boost profits. With more computing efficiency on the cloud, calculations take 15 minutes instead of two weeks, saving the company USD200,000 every year.

And since corporate growth now goes hand in hand with data growth, Bionorica is relying on another powerful active ingredient—a smart data platform based on Microsoft Azure.

title: University of Pécs enables text and speech processing in Hungarian, builds the BERT-large model with just 1,000 euro with Azure
executive_summary: Everyone prefers to use their mother tongue when communicating with chat agents and other automated services. However, for languages like Hungarian—spoken by only 15 million people—the market size will often be viewed as too small for large companies to create software, tools or applications that can process Hungarian text as input. Recognizing this need, the Applied Data Science and Artificial Intelligence team from University of Pécs decided to step up. Using Microsoft AI Solutions and ONNX Runtime solutions, it built and trained its own BERT-large model in native Hungarian in under 200 hours and total build cost of 1,000 euro.

The combination of the mammoth infrastructure that Microsoft provides, along with its acclaimed R&D, global presence, and industry-leading security and privacy standards, made Azure the cloud of choice for Mahindra, and the company turned to Parablu to deploy BluVault, its Azure-powered data backup and recovery solution.

It has also boosted data access security and helped to save 30 percent of the infrastructure budget.

title: Impact Observatory revolutionizes automated mapping speed and detail with Azure HPC + AI

To be distinct from existing LULC maps, Impact Observatory’s model needed to be more accurate in near real time. To accomplish this goal and meet its technology objectives, Impact Observatory turned to Microsoft Azure and Microsoft AI for Earth, sharing a passion for combining technology and sustainability. The company now routinely makes maps faster than satellites can collect images, which is a testament to the processing speed and scale of what is now the highest-resolution global map ever publicly released.

A chasm of difference lies between the hand-painted parchment maps once created with paper surveyor’s notes and today’s vibrant digital maps. Technology makes the magic for the maps we access on mobile devices and in-vehicle navigation systems—real-time, dynamic depictions that we’ve come to trust and rely on while on the move.
products: Azure, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Databricks, Azure HDInsight

title: TomTom maps out a path to fast innovation with Linux on Azure
executive_summary: How does the processing and the data that go into creating those maps and coordinating the stream of events—road closures, traffic accidents, and other key information—culminate in the glowing screen in front of you? Amsterdam-based TomTom pioneered many of the inventions that underpin the location technology in the maps and other tools that get us where we need to go. Its engineers appreciate Linux, a powerful open-source operating system, and use it to support their development of complex software. TomTom moved to the Microsoft Azure platform to gain the benefits of cloud computing: scalability and availability along with flexible cost models to maximize cost-effectiveness. The company found it fast and easy to shift its Linux workloads from its on-premises infrastructure to Azure. TomTom is freer than ever to set the pace for innovation, and leading innovation means leading in market sha

executive_summary: Some of the greatest ideas were born in humble garages. Airplanes, rock-and-roll, and that longest of longshots, the personal computer, all ignited full-on revolutions. So, Mate Rimac felt in good company when he set out to design and build the world’s most powerful and advanced electric vehicle in his own garage in Croatia. He knew plenty of doubters—people who told him it would be impossible to create a brand-new car company in a country with such a small automotive industry—but Rimac wanted to revolutionize the industry from the ground up, so he knew it didn’t matter where he started.
products: Azure CycleCloud, Azure HPC, Azure Virtual Machines

Through the campus-wide cloud migration and the launch of the Technology and Data Institute for the community, UNCG has become a model for what North Carolina academic institutions and communities can accomplish together through technology.

title: ÖBB gains greater scale and state-of-the-art security measures by moving ticket sales to the Azure cloud platform

With results like these, ÖBB knows that being a leading mobility company means not only ensuring the trains run on time, but that they’re filled with contented passengers.

title: International Organization for Migration better able to support migrants in crisis with help from cloud-based solutions
