IOM soon realized that it needed strategic partners to achieve its goal, and after careful planning and risk mitigation, the agency chose Microsoft Azure as its cloud platform. Before IOM’s cloud implementation, it wasn’t possible to follow individual migrants in terms of travel, health, and protection support. With cloud computing, however, IOM will soon have far more personal insights and even be able to interact with and directly support migrants.

To provide companies in Chungbuk Province with new, trending services while addressing data sovereignty and latency, the technopark wanted to run various clusters in both on-premises data centers and public clouds. It moved to the Azure hybrid cloud and used Azure Arc to further secure and govern infrastructure and apps anywhere.

Clinicians and providers rely on the electronic health records (EHR) system for a holistic view of patient health so they can provide high-quality care. When St. Luke’s embarked on a cloud transformation and migrated its EHR system to Microsoft Azure, it needed a way to ensure robust, flexible performance of its Clarity databases in the cloud.

title: Identifying and eliminating time drains: Biotech pioneer Biogen streamlines processes with Power Platform
executive_summary: Biogen is committed to helping people with neurological disorders. The biotech company conducts innovative, scientific research in the field of neurology with the aim of defeating devastating diseases such as multiple sclerosis, Alzheimer’s, Parkinson’s, and spinal muscular atrophy. To make sure employees can give customers their full attention without being distracted by internal procedural issues, Biogen relies on Microsoft Power Platform—a tool capable of simplifying all kinds of processes both today and in the future.

products: Azure Cache for Redis, Azure Storage

title: Innovative Cloud9 player-training solution builds, runs, and stores on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Not to be overshadowed by Batch, Azure Blob Storage supports very rapid rates of access to those huge amounts of unstructured video and related data, making it the perfect choice to service VRT processing tasks and the corresponding variety of video and image types. Cloud9 has found itself at the leading-edge when it comes to using technology to help keep its teams ahead of the competition. And it’s working; the team has won four straight VCT Game Changers events.
products: Azure, Azure Batch, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Virtual Machines

title: Globally recognized golf manufacturer TaylorMade revolutionizes legal processes with Microsoft Syntex
executive_summary: TaylorMade’s legal team traditionally spent endless hours manually managing content as it arrived in Outlook. When they received trademark or patent information in their inboxes, legal team members would move the individual documents to their hierarchical system of Outlook folders. This tedious process was inefficient and prone to human error, pushing the company away from its innovation mission. From translating documents in Mandarin and Japanese to creating new ways of searching for and annotating information, the teams at TaylorMade are eager to scale AI across the company’s processes.

title: SynerAI develops solution using AI and NLP to generate insights by analyzing over two billion data points and scales seamlessly on Azure
executive_summary: Language AI company SynerAI built a new kind of news analysis product by using AI and natural language processing (NLP) on Microsoft Azure to generate insights from thousands of daily articles and reports. The company’s team of 30 needed infrastructure that could scale on demand and provide customers with reliable access to its analytical feeds. SynerAI used a suite of Microsoft services to develop and launch its first user-facing product in just seven months. Meanwhile, the company made its data processing and storage scalable on Azure so that it could serve customers regardless of their size or need. SynerAI plans to continue using Microsoft technology to power its pipeline of innovation.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Entra ID, Azure Key Vault, Azure Machine Learning

title: Fiserv uses Microsoft Azure to simplify payment operations and reduce costs for its financial institution clients
executive_summary: Global financial services company Fiserv wanted to help its financial institution clients modernize and transform their payment processing infrastructure. As part of its continual product enhancement, Fiserv extended its Enterprise Payments Platform solution to the cloud on Microsoft Azure. The resulting solution provides modern real-time payment processing, simplifying payment operations and reducing costs for financial institutions. Enterprise Payments Platform also delivers data insights, so banks can provide their clients with visibility into their financial health.
products: Azure

title: Huabao Group increases competitiveness across its enterprise with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: To efficiently support upstream and downstream business transactions in real time, Huabao Group needed to establish an integrated industrial chain management system that could enhance the competitiveness of its entire industrial chain. With the help of SAP on Azure, Huabao Group successfully realized the first full closed-loop operation of its headquarters and 21 subordinate enterprises, which is a solid step for the company to transform from informatization to digitization.

title: Orkla uses Microsoft Teams Connect shared channels to drive business forward by tapping into outside experts and collaborating across their 300 brands and 90 business units
executive_summary: For David Konrad Abramowski Aurtande, Lead Employee Engagement & Hybrid Work at Orkla, his job at Orkla gives him the chance to support heritage brands that hold special importance for consumers in Scandinavia, the Baltics, and around Europe. “I work for the company that creates a lot of the foods I fondly remember eating as a child and that my children now eat,” he says. With 90 different business units and 300 distinct brands—for everything from licorice to ketchup to toothpaste—Orkla supplies branded consumer goods to 100 countries and operates in 22. It’s a big, dispersed enterprise and growing all the time.

title: NHS makes data more discoverable using Azure Cognitive Search to save clinician’s time
executive_summary: “This problem is not unique to our Trust,” states Jonathon Artingstall, Associate Director Information & Performance at Cambridgeshire and Peterborough NHS Foundation Trust. “We’ve taken lots of data in all shapes and formats from different systems and put it into a cloud storage solution so it can be used today. Who knows what lies in those 23 years of data? Now we have the capability to explore that.”

title: NHS Supply Chain boosts productivity with Microsoft Surface devices
executive_summary: “Knowing what I know now, if we hadn’t made the choice we did, I would have been gutted,” says Chris Gundel, IT Operations Manager at NHS Supply Chain. “The Microsoft Surface devices are a phenomenal product.”

title: Future-focused Dutch water utility counters climate change with smart use of data on Azure
executive_summary: Dutch water utility PWN streams 106 billion liters of pure, high-quality water to a million and a half citizens in North Holland. The utility monitors and maintains the health of the dunes that act as a natural filtration mechanism for 25 percent of the water, but that complicates service delivery. And running both the business side of the utility and the systems to monitor water quality requires enormous data stores. PWN found one answer for both issues: moving its SAP estate from an expiring cloud hosting provider to Microsoft Azure to meet PWN’s complex business needs. With all the data on one platform, the utility can better manage its assets, communicate with customers, predict climate change effects, and help protect against them.

title: Tecnicas Reunidas cuts costs and builds a highly secure digital energy future with Azure Arc
executive_summary: Global engineering and energy innovator Tecnicas Reunidas needed to improve its security posture and increase efficiencies across its expanding footprint of both on-premises and cloud environments. The company adopted Microsoft Azure Arc, along with Microsoft Security solutions, to help its IT team to unify its deployments and establish central control over the company’s hybrid infrastructure and apps. Tecnicas Reunidas enhanced its security posture while saving costs, gaining data analytics, and forging new paths for innovation and efficiency as part of its efforts to achieve net zero carbon emissions.

title: How the Portuguese healthcare sector is upskilling its workforce to provide better care using Microsoft Teams and Power Platform
executive_summary: The Portuguese healthcare sector is going through a huge phase of digital transformation. The past three years have forced it to change the way it works and operates, accelerating its transition to the cloud and the introduction of collaborative tools within its key processes and everyday tasks. In support of this shift, the Portuguese Ministry of Health has launched a six-month digital skilling initiative that aims at helping the four primary care institutions in the country to gain greater confidence around these solutions. Ultimately fostering greater collaboration and helping them to deliver better care.

title: Enterritorio, a national company promoting territorial development in Colombia, strengthens its entire operations with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: In addition to generating contracts and paying for construction and salaries to more than 15 thousand people associated with the work, the industrial and commercial company of the Colombian State managed – through Dynamics 365 – to streamline the complex processes of its operations, which consist of making disbursements and settlements of different taxes in each municipality of the country.

title: Fife Council modernizes infrastructure, reduces virtualization datacenter footprint by more than 80 percent with Azure Stack HCI
executive_summary: As one of Scotland’s largest municipal governments, Fife Council knows how to deliver what its citizens need. The council dependably and efficiently provides essential services like garbage collection, street lighting, public housing, and education to more than 370,000 residents. With that kind of mandate, Fife Council makes smart use of technology to keep its service levels high and costs low.
products: Azure Arc, Azure Monitor, Azure Site Recovery, Azure Stack HCI, Azure Virtual Desktop, Microsoft Sentinel, Windows Server

title: PETRONAS drives quality decision-making with fast, easy access to intelligent data hub built on Azure
executive_summary: The dynamic Malaysian energy group, PETRONAS, has produced and delivered responsible and sustainable energy solutions globally since 1974. With more than 300 subsidiaries and operations in over 100 countries, PETRONAS has amassed an extensive wealth of data across its integrated value chain since its incorporation, making data a key business asset to drive strategic value. In 2020, PETRONAS embarked on its data transformation journey with the objective of making data available and accessible to everyone at the company through the Enterprise Data Hub (EDH), a unified enterprise platform supported by Microsoft Azure at the core. This platform has empowered employees with accelerated knowledge extraction and enabled enterprise analytics at scale, supporting PETRONAS’ ambition of becoming a data-driven organization.
products: Azure, Azure AI Search, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

title: Securing consumers' rights: ANPC eliminates bureaucracy and boosts efficiency with Azure
executive_summary: In its commitment to empower consumers, Romania's National Authority for Consumer Protection (ANPC) embarked on a transformative journey to digitize its operations. Tasked with transitioning its workforce to paperless workflows, ANPC implemented the intuitive Azure-powered app, Regista. This innovative solution revamped document and workflow management, saving two work hours daily and up to US$4,000 annually while delivering enhanced services to consumers.

title: Setagaya City’s agile DX promotion: Restructuring administrative services with Support for Mission Critical
executive_summary: Tokyo's Setagaya City is the most populous of Tokyo's 23 wards (approximately 918,000*) and the second largest (approximately 58㎢*). The city is blessed with a good access to the city center via multiple train lines, and while there are bustling commercial areas such as Shimokitazawa and Futakotamagawa, there are also many quiet residential areas, green spaces, and parks. (*As of January 2024)

title: Voices of the future: CTI's journey in AI-powered language education
executive_summary: The Chinese Testing International Company Limited (CTI), established in 2007, specializes in international Chinese language education and test services, with HSK as its flagship brand. CTI has over 1,000 certified teachers and focuses on a learner-centered approach. Since 2021, CTI has partnered with Microsoft Research Asia and Microsoft Azure AI Speech, establishing 1,330 test centers in 162 countries, serving over 50 million learners. They aim to integrate AI with Chinese language education, developing advanced tools like facial recognition and intelligent assessment. Using Azure AI Speech Services, CTI created the Learn Pronunciation to HSK application, providing instant pronunciation feedback to learners. This collaboration has resulted in a mobile Chinese pronunciation learning classroom, enhancing educational experiences with consistent and accurate evaluations.

title: A secure and compliant version of ChatGPT: Otto Group builds its own in-house AI solution using Azure OpenAI
executive_summary: Efficient knowledge management is crucial for the success of any company—no matter whether the goal is to develop new products or provide the information necessary to ensure good customer service. In the past, Otto Group relied on a number of different tools such as FAQ documents or wikis to get the job done. But now, this global retail company and service provider is putting AI into overdrive: ogGPT (Otto Group GPT)—an in-house solution based on Azure OpenAI Service—currently has 26,000 employee users, who are exploring where the tool can accelerate and simplify day-to-day operations and internal processes.
products: Azure AI Search, Azure Operator Call Protection, Microsoft Entra Verified ID, PowerPoint

title: City of Lokeren uses Microsoft Security to drive operational efficiency and optimization
executive_summary: The City of Lokeren is a Belgian municipality tasked with providing essential services to the 50,000 people who live there. The city has invested in a modernization project aimed at creating a flexible and modern workplace for its employees to thrive in as they focus on providing these essential services. Centered around Microsoft’s cloud and security solutions, the project has radically transformed working habits and culture at the municipality. It is also playing a crucial role in the City’s wider goal: to provide more and better services for its growing community.

title: Clinical staff at ULSTMAD have more time, less stress with Azure API Management
executive_summary: Clinical staff at Unidade Local de Saúde de Trás-os-Montes e Alto Douro (ULSTMAD) had frequent technical problems while accessing hospital records, and many suffered burnout from spending so much time using unwieldy software.

title: City of Redmond marks municipal milestones with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The City of Redmond needed to upgrade to a modern system with automations that streamlined operations and enhanced financial visibility.
products: Power BI, Dynamics 365 Finance

title: Germany's Educational Foundation Freiburg prepares students for the future with generative AI
executive_summary: When generative AI burst onto the scene, Germany's Educational Foundation Freiburg needed a secure, compliant environment for teachers and students to ethically engage with AI.
products: Azure OpenAI Service, Surface, Azure AI Content Safety, Azure AI Search, Azure AI Foundry

title: DTEK’s YASNO boosts customer service with Microsoft Azure OpenAI, reducing inquiry handling time by 22%
executive_summary: Due to increased customer support requests, DTEK's YASNO company needed to streamline contact center data processing to improve inquiry handling efficiency.
products: Azure OpenAI Service, Azure AI Search

title: Japan’s first cloud core banking system by BIPROGY with Support for Mission Critical
executive_summary: BIPROGY, a loyal user of mission-critical support programs for operating, maintaining, and supporting BankVision, embarked on enabling cloud services for their core banking system that requires advanced dedicated support programs for stable operations.

title: SOCAR Türkiye strengthens security with Microsoft Intune and Microsoft 365 E5
executive_summary: SOCAR Türkiye managed a complex security operation involving multiple sites and thousands of devices. The existing setup incurred high operational costs due to the maintenance of on-premises hardware.
products: Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Edge, Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Purview, Microsoft Teams, Outlook, Microsoft Defender for Office 365, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Microsoft Defender for Identity, Microsoft Entra ID Protection

title: New Zealand’s Public Trust drives deeper customer connections and employee efficiency with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Public Trust faced an aging contact center solution and limited customer view, hindering effective communication and customer management.
products: Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Power BI, Dynamics 365 Contact Center, Power Apps, Microsoft 365 Copilot for Service

title: Zenya embraces Azure OpenAI Service to revolutionize healthcare with smart quality management software
executive_summary: Zenya’s modular platform, powered by Microsoft Azure, streamlines healthcare operations, enhances efficiency, and improves patient care.

title: Long View innovates with foresight choosing Dynamics 365 for operational excellence
executive_summary: Long View's aging ERP system caused security risks, hindered performance, and fragmented workflows, leading to operational inefficiencies and poor data quality.

title: McGees Property secures its future after ransomware attack with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: McGees Property, one of Australia’s largest privately owned commercial real estate agencies were hit by a ransomware attack on their 40th anniversary in 2022. Staff were locked out of their files for more than 4 weeks, working from personal emails and still trying to keep as many deals going as possible.

title: Fellowmind drives growth and efficiency with integrated Dynamics 365 solution
executive_summary: Fellowmind Denmark faced fragmented systems and complex processes post-merger, leading to inefficiencies in project management, resource allocation, and financial reporting.
products: Microsoft Fabric, AppSource, Dynamics 365 Project Operations, Dynamics 365 Finance, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Sales

title: Municipality of Breda empowers employees to thrive, embracing innovation and rapid tech evolution with Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: As civil servants face heavy workloads limiting them from utilizing their talents, and the tight labor market might lead to staffing shortages, the Municipality of Breda needed to find ways to complete work with fewer people and ensure job satisfaction.

executive_summary: Long View's aging ERP system caused security risks, hindered performance, and fragmented workflows, leading to operational inefficiencies and poor data quality.

title: Global transport and logistics company goes digital to transform its operations
executive_summary: Based in Copenhagen, A.P. Moller - Maersk is an integrated transport and logistics company with multiple brands, and a global leader in container shipping and ports. The company is partnering with Microsoft Enterprise Services on its digital transformation journey, moving five regional datacenters to Microsoft Azure to improve performance and reduce its operational risk. Maersk recently selected Microsoft as its preferred cloud partner as it works to transform its operations, bolster its customer service, and generate new revenue streams.
products: Azure

title: How Edsby uses the Microsoft Cloud to transform K-12 school districts with a comprehensive learning and analytics platform
executive_summary: Millions of students, teachers, and parents rely on learning applications. But for all their popularity (and varying levels of success), ad hoc, fragmented ecosystems of mobile applications and online software consistently provoke questions and concerns at school districts.

title: Mine operator increases sustainability with Microsoft Azure video analytics
executive_summary: Minsur operates one of the largest tin mines in the Western Hemisphere, found in Puno, Peru. To make the visual control process in its San Rafael mine safer and more effective, the company created an intelligent solution that combines Microsoft Azure video analytics and Azure Cognitive Services.

executive_summary: "The Maritime and Coastguard Agency (MCA) provides a 24-hour maritime search and rescue service around the UK coast and implements the government's maritime safety policy. It has a team of 1,050 staff and 3,500 volunteers responsible for almost 8,000 miles of coast.

title: Story Collection: Explore the ways BP uses Azure across the company
executive_summary: More than an energy company, BP is a technology company. Whether using AI for operational advances like predictive maintenance or gaining meaningful business insights from data, BP stays at the leading edge of technology to drive business success and meet corporate goals for safety and sustainability.

title: NEL are using Advanced Analytics to enable their customers to improve patient outcomes
executive_summary: NEL support over 43 London clinical groups with a range of support services. From hospitals through to primary care GPs they cover a population of 16 million people, and manage more than £10bn of NHS contracts.  For their customers, a key part of the NEL service comes from their Data Insights team who use data and analytics to drive improvements in the health of local populations.

title: Confidently moving to the Cloud with Microsoft Unified Support
executive_summary: With the mission to help every person achieve their potential through access to world-class education, training, apprenticeships and care, the Department for Education (DfE) oversees 20,000 schools in England.

title: Brisa strengthens its communication with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Brisa, the leader of the Turkish tire industry, has transferred its business processes to Microsoft Teams to strengthen its communication, eliminate security risks, and gain speed.

title: National rail company on track to augment customer service and safety with Azure
executive_summary: National Railway Company of Belgium (SNCB) carries 253.4 million passengers a year and strives to provide safe, punctual service to all of them. To enhance the travel experience and address the impending opening of the market to competition, SNCB has adopted a cloud-first strategy for IT and chosen Microsoft Azure as its trusted platform. The company is moving the majority of its 750 applications to Azure and developing new, cloud-based services that provide passengers with more accurate information and make work easier and more efficient for employees.

title: Acterys combined with Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Power BI delivers financial analytics and consolidation for 30 Worms Safety group companies
executive_summary: Worms Safety is a leading global alliance of specialists in safety and quality management. Following the company’s introduction of a new Xero financial management system, Worms Safety turned to Acterys to automate the consolidation for 30 group companies. Acterys, which specializes in planning and analytics, integrated Azure SQL Server and Power BI to improve management reporting with interactive dashboard capabilities. The new solution enabled Worms Safety to completely avoid 10 days of effort and cost previously spent on manual spreadsheet maintenance in addition to significantly improved analysis and reporting options.

title: Learn how Embassy, a leading real estate developer, made the leap to the cloud with Parablu and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Parablu, a Microsoft ISV partner headquartered in Santa Clara, California, provides secure data management solutions. The Parablu solution - BluVault for endpoints - addressed Embassy’s specific requirements for moving to the cloud infrastructure. BluVault allowed Embassy to work through its strategy for ensuring safe backup of data residing on employees’ laptops by leveraging Microsoft Azure enterprise cloud compute instances. Parablu also helped Embassy achieve its goal of using Microsoft OneDrive storage as a backup repository, rather than invest in additional storage.

executive_summary: National Railway Company of Belgium (SNCB) carries 253.4 million passengers a year and strives to provide safe, punctual service to all of them.
