Parablu also helped Embassy achieve its goal of using Microsoft OneDrive storage as a backup repository, rather than invest in additional storage.

title: American Council of the Blind scales up with accessible technology
executive_summary: American Council of the Blind is driven to support and advocate for all people who are blind or visually impaired. Yet its technology infrastructure held the nonprofit back. As part of its strategic plan, American Council of the Blind invested in Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Office 365. With more reliable and secure technology, it advances its mission and serves more people.

title: AFFIN Group increased agility with the Möbius open banking solution on Azure
executive_summary: AFFIN Group, a leading Malaysian financial institution, saw an opportunity to modernise its core banking system to support future growth and innovation.

title: Ballard Spahr saves $2 million in unplanned losses and cuts research time 60% with Neudesic and Azure OpenAI
executive_summary: National law firm Ballard Spahr wanted to streamline preparation of research-intensive proposals and reduce nonbillable hours with the power of AI.

title: Talan drives value by integrating Microsoft 365 Copilot into daily work
executive_summary: As a technology company, Talan viewed AI as a business priority to increase internal productivity and advise its clients on AI adoption.

title: IFS boosts analytics, insights, and data access 325% with Fabric
executive_summary: IFS faced high costs and complexity from a fragmented data architecture with multiple reporting tools and overlapping services.

title: Virgin Money modernises banking with Microsoft Copilot Studio
executive_summary: Virgin Money, one of the UK’s largest retail banks, wanted to transform its customer experience by making every interaction faster, easier and more efficient.

title: Microsoft Azure helps business harness the power of AI for social impact
executive_summary: The partnership of Social Tech Trust and Microsoft for Startups seeks to realise some of the opportunities presented by using AI to solve some of the world’s biggest challenges. Kathy Marcham, Portfolio Manager Social Tech Trust, explains: “We created a programme that enables these purposeful founders to not only create world-class technology but to also develop their commercial skills and their social business acumen.”

title: Zooniverse’s move to Azure enhances citizen science
executive_summary: Zooniverse is the world’s largest platform for people-powered research. In 2020, based on a desire to do more with Microsoft from a research perspective, the development team at Zooniverse moved its platform from Amazon Web Services (AWS) to Microsoft Azure. The Zooniverse platform is now more cohesive, with more consistent performance and less downtime. Less time is required for day-to-day operational tasks and new code can be deployed much more quickly, leaving the development team with more time to support new feature development and additional platform improvements.

title: Phihong scales out its fast-growing operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Phihong has been making the environment greener for 50 years with its world-class energy solutions including power adaptors, power over ethernet, electronic vehicle chargers, and worksite radio for various industries. Still growing, Phihong needs innovative technology solutions that can help to meet its strong demand growth and help the company deliver on its promise of excellent customer service. Phihong is moving to Microsoft 365, Power BI and Microsoft Dynamic 365 to gain actionable, AI-powered predictive insights into its operations and customers services capabilities across multiple data sources. This is preparing the company for the future, with a flexible and resilient operational process that can expand and adapt as the business grows and responds to changes in the global marketplace.

title: ACI Worldwide reimagines convenience for bank customers—reduces onboarding time from weeks to minutes
executive_summary: When ACI investigated how to create greater value for its customers, it identified two possibilities: faster creation of the infrastructure needed by merchants who need their software to transmit transactions to financial institutions—often a matter of weeks—and providing rich customer intelligence for valuable opportunity insight. The far-ranging benefits of the cloud over on-premise datacenters, along with the ability to use highly efficient open-source solutions like Linux on Azure, sealed the deal for ACI. By freeing organizations to focus their expertise and energies on developing added-value payment features and functions on top of standardizing related operational and security capabilities, Azure dramatically accelerates time to market.

title: Metro South Health embraces Azure VMware Solution to enable agility and responsiveness to health service needs
executive_summary: Metro South Health, a major provider of high-quality public health services, education, and research in the Brisbane Southside delivers integrated care to more than 23 percent of the Queensland, Australia, population. Metro South Health operates five major hospitals with more than 17,000 dedicated clinicians, administrators, and other healthcare professionals who serve patients in a large geographical area across several communities in and around Brisbane; it is also Australia’s largest digital health service. With the goal of improving the integration of hardware-based IT infrastructure within the overall healthcare ecosystem, Metro South Health wants to improve the way its services leverage this technology to engage with people in its communities.

title: World-Leading Football League, LaLiga, Leads Decision Making with Power BI
executive_summary: The largest sport in the world, football, has an estimated 240 million players, and a global fandom size in the billions. Around the world, people are coming together every day to play the sport and root on their favourite football clubs.

title: Chemours partners with Open Systems, modernizing cybersecurity to mitigate threats
executive_summary: As a global chemistry leader, The Chemours Company helps drive innovation at a molecular level. The company produces many of the products that are critical to modern living, and its mission is to make the world more colorful, capable, and cleaner.

title: Lenskart transforms the way it eyes data using Power BI
executive_summary: A direct-to-consumer omnichannel retailer, Lenskart, is one of the fastest-growing e-commerce-led eyewear retail chains in the world. It has over 1,100 stores in India and a growing presence in East Asia, Southeast Asia, the Middle East, and the US.

title: Bringing Blind Veterans UK together with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: “On 1 September 1997, I woke up in bed catapulted into a world of complete darkness. I was absolutely terrified,” says Billy Baxter. Billy was a soldier in the Royal Horse Artillery, but contracted a virus in Bosnia that robbed him of his eyesight. When he woke up that morning, his life changed completely. He soon became detached, isolated, and depressed. The army had been his whole life. But then he got in touch with Blind Veterans UK, a charity with centres in Sussex and North Wales that supports anyone who has served in the UK Armed Forces and who is now living with significant sight loss. Their support, rehabilitation and training helped Billy turn a corner. He knew he wasn’t alone anymore and that he could finally talk to people who understood what he was going through.

title: Lumen advances 5G technology with a simplified, holistic cybersecurity mindset
executive_summary: Technology company Lumen wanted to balance the business need to access data with the legal need to ensure that access is appropriate. It needed to overcome the challenges of protecting and managing its data while migrating to the cloud, grappling with disparate long-standing systems, and lacking a cohesive identity and security solution. Lumen selected Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), part of Microsoft Entra, along with a suite of other Microsoft Security solutions to address identity and compliance in a complementary way. Now, the company has ease of use, transparency, and automation in how it protects and manages its data.

title: Exxaro unites on-premises and cloud infrastructure into a single monitoring solution with Azure Arc
executive_summary: Since 2017, Exxaro Resources has been on an ambitious transformation journey. In addition to upgrading its IT infrastructure, the South African company has built a sustainable growth impact strategy that lays out the company’s aim to “transition from a coal base to a minerals and renewable energy solutions business that will thrive in a low-carbon future.” It credits its successes in part to a strategic, well-managed, and digital-first approach to innovation and operations, which most recently included refreshing its Wi-Fi, LTE, and internet-based networks and moving an initial set of datacenters to Microsoft Azure to unlock the power of the cloud.

title: A move to Windows containers helps Relativity boost reliability and security while lowering costs
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: Creating a better digital experience for members: Nationwide Building Society chooses Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: As the world’s largest building society, Nationwide Building Society often leans on technology to help support and deliver financial services to its more than 16 million members across the United Kingdom. Twenty-five years ago, it established one of the first internet banks in the United Kingdom, mailing out compact discs to members and delivering services on dial-up connections. Today, Nationwide Building Society offers mortgages, loans, personal and business accounts, investments, home insurance and protection, credit cards, and other banking services through a variety of branch, digital, and multichannel mediums, including the web and mobile apps, for the benefit of its members and their communities.

title: Driving experience excellence with SAP on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: McLaren Automotive creates some of the most breathtaking performance road sports cars in the world from its McLaren Production Centre in Woking, UK. The iconic motor racing brand rolled out its first supercar, the McLaren MP4-12C, in 2011. In June 2022, McLaren launches the Artura, the next-generation hybrid supercar with a new high-performance Hybrid powertrain and a beautiful, aerodynamic new design for sublime agility and engagement.

title: Solocal uses Azure Virtual Desktop to virtualize its sales teams’ working environment
executive_summary: Solocal is a premier digital partner for local companies in France, from small or medium-sized businesses to large companies with extensive networks. It aims to vitalize local life, striving every day to unveil the full potential of all companies by connecting them to their customers through its innovative digital services. With a turnover of 428 million euros in 2021, Solocal advises more than 304,000 companies across France and supports them in boosting their activity through digital services. Whether it be digital advertising, marketing, or website creation, the sales teams run the show in terms of offering advice and expertise to the group's various clients. At the end of 2019, Solocal made the decision to move these vital teams to a virtual workspace so they could enjoy an increasingly modern and agile working environment. The group's Infrastructure and Operations Department and Technical Department set about testing this setup, unaware that just a few weeks later COVID-19 would force them to ramp up their efforts.

title: Bringing Blind Veterans UK together with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: “On 1 September 1997, I woke up in bed catapulted into a world of complete darkness. I was absolutely terrified,” says Billy Baxter. Billy was a soldier in the Royal Horse Artillery, but contracted a virus in Bosnia that robbed him of his eyesight. When he woke up that morning, his life changed completely. He soon became detached, isolated, and depressed. The army had been his whole life. But then he got in touch with Blind Veterans UK, a charity with centres in Sussex and North Wales that supports anyone who has served in the UK Armed Forces and who is now living with significant sight loss. Their support, rehabilitation and training helped Billy turn a corner. He knew he wasn’t alone anymore and that he could finally talk to people who understood what he was going through.

title: Lumen advances 5G technology with a simplified, holistic cybersecurity mindset
executive_summary: Technology company Lumen wanted to balance the business need to access data with the legal need to ensure that access is appropriate. It needed to overcome the challenges of protecting and managing its data while migrating to the cloud, grappling with disparate long-standing systems, and lacking a cohesive identity and security solution. Lumen selected Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), part of Microsoft Entra, along with a suite of other Microsoft Security solutions to address identity and compliance in a complementary way. Now, the company has ease of use, transparency, and automation in how it protects and manages its data.

title: Liebherr-Components and Reycom deliver end to end RISE Security with Microsoft Defender for IoT for Linux and Windows IoT
executive_summary: A time of profound technological advances calls for equally innovative strategies to support that change. Liebherr-Components answered that challenge by joining forces with Reycom AG, a global player in the TV, smart living, and Internet of Things (IoT) sectors. Together, they provide a ready-to-use, highly secure, end-to-end IoT solution, RISE (Reycom Industrial Secure Edge platform), to external customers. The partners needed an IoT security solution to support their innovation, and they found it in Microsoft Defender for IoT and Device Update for Azure IoT Hub. The synergy between the companies points to a promising new era in connected IoT solutions for a smarter, safer world.

title: Precision Engineering for Critical Component Design with Teamcenter on Azure
executive_summary: As a global multinational based in Japan with 5 core business segments, EKK (Eagle Industry Co., Ltd.) Group provides precision-machined products for major companies in automotive and construction, semiconductor, marine and aerospace industries. These cover specialized mechanical seals, valves and bellows for transport equipment, including automobiles, ships and aircraft, and also rotary machinery, most notably pumps and compressors.

title: Engage Squared fosters sustainable growth and purpose-driven digital engagement with Viva Goals
executive_summary: The modern digital workplace is here, and there’s plenty of uncharted territory and challenges for intrepid trailblazers to navigate. Engage Squared, a consulting firm specializing in modern workplace solutions, built its reputation by venturing boldly into this increasingly vast domain. The company embraced the new era, creating a sought-after blueprint for fostering sustainable growth, cultivating an award-winning workplace culture, and increasing employee engagement and satisfaction. By specializing in the digital workplace and leading-edge employee experience solutions like Microsoft 365, Engage Squared helps its customers navigate the complexities and opportunities this new era presents through lived experiences and set a course for better business outcomes in this rapidly evolving landscape.

title: More intelligent banking and innovative customer engagement for Goals101 with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Goals101 is on a mission to make banking personalized, automated, and delightful. It is a Transaction Behavioral Intelligence (TBI) company that accelerates business growth for banks using Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML).

title: Clarity and Connection: How Microsoft uses Viva Goals to drive organization-wide impact
executive_summary: This article is part of a series that describes how Microsoft Viva is being developed and deployed at Microsoft. In this seventh installment, we build on chapter six to share how Microsoft deployed Viva Goals programmatically to unify OKR use on a single platform, improve visibility of organization and team-wide goals, and maximize the benefits of this approach to business planning and execution.

title: Koppert seeds transformation with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: For more than 50 years, the mission of Koppert has been to make agriculture and horticulture healthier, safer, more productive, and more sustainable, working in partnership with nature. Founded in 1967 by grower and visionary Jan Koppert, the company has helped farmers and growers around the world maximize yields while reducing their environmental impact. Koppert advocates using natural enemies to combat pests, bumblebees for pollination, and microbials and biostimulants that naturally strengthen and protect crops. Because Koppert products are alive, it is paramount that customers receive their products in peak condition.

title: Manulife makes work easier, better, faster with existing cloud-led investments and Workday for Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Global financial services and insurance provider Manulife Financial Corporation’s cloud-led digital roadmap challenged teams to develop new capabilities for fast and efficient work using its existing technology stack to reduce tasks and interactions that interrupt the flow of work. The company focused on embedding more agile digital workspaces that do more while maximizing the value of its investment in the Microsoft Cloud, and it integrated Workday for Microsoft Teams to create a more seamless experience. Now, more than 38,000 global colleagues can quickly and easily find the right information at the right time and perform self-service Workday tasks within the flow of Teams.

title: SSP unifies its hybrid infrastructure with Azure Stack HCI and saves more than 100,000 kilowatt hours
executive_summary: A few years ago, SSP augmented its on-premises infrastructure with some key cloud-based workloads through Azure, hybridizing its environment. While the company enjoyed the benefits of a hybrid environment, it lacked the ability to move select services and workloads between its on-premises and cloud environments. With reliably stronger performance, SSP’s digital infrastructure is positioned to meet whatever challenges or opportunities the business might face next.

title: Qore cracks the code to cost-effective, high-efficiency core banking by going cloud-native
executive_summary: Qore is working to make technology more accessible for all financial institutions across Africa. Co-founder Mudiaga Umukoro knew that the key to increasing the efficiency of Qore’s first-of-its-kind shared services banking platform while keeping costs low was to go cloud-native. Today, over 50 percent of Nigerian financial institutions in the Other Financial Institutions (OFIs) category use Qore' BankOne for its critical banking functions.

title: Kantar Group’s Media business accelerates insights, goes cloud-native with Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: Infrabel: connecting its workforce to connect a country with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Belgian railway infrastructure management company Infrabel is responsible for keeping the country connected. That begins with its employees. Starting in 2018, Infrabel underwent a culture-shifting transformation, moving from its old communications system to Microsoft Teams to enable better efficiency, flexibility, and connectivity between its employees in the hybrid work environment. To help its employees adapt to the change, the company underwent several training programs, ultimately resulting in a better-connected office community, a more flexible work environment, and a solid platform for a digitalized future.

title: Volpara Health elevates breast cancer prevention, guards sensitive data with connected Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: Volpara Health is more than a company—it’s a collection of passionate, mission-driven people who are working to save more families from cancer through software that assesses cancer risk and AI-driven image analysis. Volpara’s product suite uses the Microsoft Azure IoT platform as a key building block that enables rapid deployment and reliable operation at scale. Volpara chose Microsoft Security, including Microsoft Defender for IoT and Microsoft Sentinel, to protect Volpara assets and facilitate effective security for Azure IoT solutions at customer sites around the world.

title: CTT - Correios de Portugal migrates to Azure to immediately reduce costs by 15 percent and increase flexibility
executive_summary: Since its inception in 1520, CTT - Correios de Portugal has moved with the pace of change to keep the people of Portugal connected in an ever-changing world. That spirit of innovation is alive and well today. As postal services face challenges globally, CTT continues to reinvent itself to remain a trusted service provider for its customers. However, years of growth had saddled the company with a costly patchwork of on-premises digital systems that were a challenge to manage and an obstacle to the development and deployment of new services. To overcome these impediments, CTT undertook a cloud-first strategy and set out to migrate its workloads to Microsoft Azure.

title: Engineered Advisory deploys Springworks Trivia for Microsoft Teams to boost team building and employee engagement
executive_summary: Engineered Tax Services is a professional services organization dedicated to helping businesses succeed in the accounting space and supporting clients’ financial goals by offering tax mitigation and wealth-building strategies. The company needed a fun team engagement app that was integrated with Microsoft Teams and would engage its fully remote team. Enter Springworks: a human resources technology company whose Trivia app for Teams helped Engineered Tax Services’ Cost Segregation team achieve a community engagement rate of 57 percent.

title: Johnson Controls uses Microsoft Teams to construct a network of digital champions who drive business goals
executive_summary: Johnson Controls (JCI) is a leader in the world of smart buildings with more than 100,000 employees working to shape the future of sustainable, intelligent spaces. Given how the company made its name with leading-edge building technology, it’s not surprising that increasing its workforce’s digital skills is one of JCI’s key goals.

title: Top security for every work step: IT security solution based on Microsoft 365 detects and reports threats at VAF in five minutes flat
executive_summary: To produce special systems and machines for the automotive industry, medium-sized company VAF relies on connectivity and digital processes. A wide range of interfaces are needed to ensure that everything runs smoothly. With cybercrime on the rise, these need to be protected. In the past, the family-owned company from Bopfingen, Germany employed numerous third-party tools for this purpose. This led to a high degree of fragmentation instead of a uniform platform—rather than enabling a proactive overview of the level of security, it required maximum administrative effort. Today, VAF—together with its partner abtis—has taken a big step forward in cybersecurity with Modern Secure Workplace, a managed service based on Microsoft 365 E5.

title: Meliá Hotels International creates a cohesive culture across properties with Microsoft Viva and Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Today, employees expect workplace technology that reflects the simplicity of the technology they use at home, including intuitive user interfaces and simple sign-on procedures. With Teams, Fuster and her colleagues saw a way to bring employees a modern technology experience at work, while still maintaining the strong security that is vital for a global business. Through Viva Connections, Meliá has reimagined how its employees receive information about the business and made it easier for all of them to find manuals, HR information, and other company resources.

title: ABN AMRO Bank optimizes financial crime detection with Azure Data Explorer
executive_summary: "Banking for better, for generations to come"—this mission drives ABN AMRO Bank, a Netherlands-based financial institution committed to vigilance against financial crime. With financial crime on the rise, the bank realized that it needed a new approach to handle its vast transactional data. Embracing technology, it employed Microsoft's Power BI and Azure Synapse Analytics to increase efficiency. The major improvement, however, came with the bank’s use of Azure Data Explorer (ADX). With ADX, ABN AMRO revamped its due diligence process by increasing its speed in and capacity for handling billions of transactions.
products: Azure Data Explorer, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

title: Hilo helps Quebecers optimize energy use by predicting demand at peak times with Azure Data Explorer
executive_summary: Hilo is a Quebecois smart building initiative to optimize energy consumption during peak demand periods. At its core lies a solution that collects millions of data points from hundreds of thousands of IoT devices every minute to help customers reduce power demand and save costs on electricity bills. The collected big data streams into Azure Data Explorer (ADX) service, where it is analyzed and visualized on custom dashboards. They provide real-time insights into energy levels and trends, allowing Hilo to realize its mission at any scale reliably, and at a fraction of the cost compared to the previous analytical service.
products: Azure, Azure Data Explorer, Azure Event Hubs, Azure IoT Hub, Azure Stream Analytics

title: A look at Proterial's data governance—building a data analytics platform with Azure Synapse Analytics and Power BI
executive_summary: Proterial, Ltd. began reforming its business operations through a digital transformation (DX) initiative in FY2021. As part of this initiative, the company launched a project in August 2021 to establish a data lake platform to enable the visualization of management information by consolidating business data scattered across the company, while promoting the development of data governance. Microsoft's data analytics solutions, including Azure Synapse Analytics and Microsoft Power BI, were selected to help realize the data lake concept.
products: Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

title: Mazars in Indonesia increases administrative efficiency by 20% and boosts compliance with Checklist and Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Mazars in Indonesia, an audit, tax, and advisory firm, faced the challenge of managing recurring tasks and strict deadlines in its accounting and tax services. To avoid penalties and customer dissatisfaction, it needed an integrated system to streamline workflows and track task progression in real time, while ensuring consistency and compliance across the organization. Checklist, a powerful tool designed to work within Microsoft Teams, provided the solution. With Checklist, Mazars achieved improved collaboration, streamlined communication, and enhanced task monitoring. The result was increased operational efficiency, reduced administrative effort and cost, and a surge in customer satisfaction.

title: The Northern Alberta Institute of Technology modernizes PeopleSoft in Microsoft Azure, improving resiliency and performance
executive_summary: The Northern Alberta Institute of Technology (NAIT) is a polytechnic institute in Alberta, Canada. In late 2019, it decided to modernize its Oracle PeopleSoft business application suite to improve the user experience and reduce system outages at peak times. The institute had previously moved its public website to Microsoft Azure, and its IT team brought in Microsoft to migrate PeopleSoft to the cloud. NAIT moved from a feasibility study to full deployment in about 18 months, reducing downtime and freeing IT personnel to work on strategic business goals. The migration transformed the dynamic between senior leadership and the IT team, as both could now focus on enhancing the higher education experience through technological innovation.

title: BSi modernizes delivery proof with KPoD digital signatures and Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance, reducing errors by 80 percent
executive_summary: In the convoluted and competitive landscape of the steel distribution industry, BSi Steel, one of South Africa's leading steel distributors, faced a formidable obstacle in maintaining a precise and up-to-date record of truck deliveries to its valued customers. BSi's truck drivers relied on manual paperwork to obtain customer signatures, which served as proof of delivery. However, this outdated and inefficient process led to several challenges, including errors in data entry, time-consuming administrative tasks, and increased operational costs. To overcome these obstacles and enhance its delivery process, BSi Steel implemented KAISPE’s digital signature capture solution, KPoD, that works in tandem with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance. The result has been a streamlined delivery process, an 80 percent reduction in errors, and an overall improvement in the efficiency of BSi’s supply chain management system.

title: Infosys powers digital transformation of sales with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Infosys embarked on a digital sales transformation journey to be a live enterprise with agility built into the core to stay ahead of the game. With the primary objective of transforming sales experience across the entire sales cycle, it identified specific interventions across every touch point where sales operate, from lead generation to order booking, by creating a data and insight-driven ecosystem.
products: Dynamics 365, Microsoft Teams, Outlook, Power Apps, Power BI

title: ​​Arvato optimizes warehouse operations, deploys new environments within minutes using SAP on Azure​
executive_summary: Logistics provider Arvato uses interconnected Microsoft solutions, and it wants to expand to the cloud with some edge computing to maximize warehouse operations. With its latest project, Arvato sought to migrate and optimize its critical SAP systems, including its SAP S/4HANA environment. Working toward being cloud-first, the company deployed as many Microsoft resources as possible, including Azure ExpressRoute and Azure NetApp Files, to help protect against system failures or forced rollbacks in advance of its accelerated SAP on Azure go-live. With the SAP on Azure migration complete, Arvato has greatly sped up maintenance and patching time and reduced and consolidated dozens of domains. Now, it can better support clients throughout their supply chain journeys.

title: Cranfield University deploys Elastic SIEM on Azure to protect vital IT infrastructure and support revenue opportunities
executive_summary: Cranfield University, a postgraduate university focusing on science, engineering, design, technology, and management, uses large volumes of data from different sources for research and needs to keep its security infrastructure compliant with business partner requirements. Seeking to accelerate compliance with partners, Cranfield turned to Elastic Cloud powered by Microsoft Azure, enabling the university to analyze data, automate processes, and protect systems across the enterprise.

title: NC Fusion expands youth marketing outreach, taught kids leadership and life skills with Dynamics 365 Customer Insights
executive_summary: N/A

title: Gardens Alive grows with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Gardens Alive is a major multi-channel retail supplier of gardening products in the United States and Canada, producing and delivering millions of plants, seeds, trees, and bulbs every year. Headquartered in Lawrenceburg, Indiana, the company runs distribution centers, greenhouses, warehouses, production, and drop ship locations in Ohio, Michigan, and California. It sells directly to customers on marketplaces such as Home Depot, Amazon, Lowes, and Walmart and offers product lines with puzzles, games, and home decor.

title: Adobe leverages Microsoft Azure to streamline the customer experience, harnessing the power of connected cloud services.
executive_summary: N/A

title: Nottingham Trent University modernizes support with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Nottingham Trent University has been educating students from across the UK and around the world since 1843. With more than 40,000 students on six campuses, NTU is a forward-looking institution committed to providing an inclusive environment with state-of-the-art, environmentally sustainable facilities, preparing graduates to lead and succeed in their chosen professions.

title: Klöckner Pentaplast enables innovation and productivity for a global workforce with Windows 11 Pro
executive_summary: Klöckner Pentaplast (kp) is deploying Windows 11 Pro for all employees and the entire device fleet in a fast-paced process. The operating system aligns with the company’s sustainability practices and offers team members many new and enhanced capabilities that help them get excited about using technology and achieve more in their jobs. Because it now takes just a few seconds instead of up to 90 minutes to update a laptop or desktop, IT managers can focus their talents on accelerating innovation and making technology users’ lives easier. Critically for kp, Windows 11 Pro comes with advanced, highly manageable security capabilities to help safeguard intellectual property and digital assets. AI enablement and frequent, painless updates make Windows 11 Pro an outstanding technology foundation on which kp can build its future.

title: ScottMadden unlocks monthly savings, increased security with Microsoft Teams Phone
executive_summary: ScottMadden, a management-consulting firm based in Raleigh, NC, recently completed a 100 percent shift from on-premises to the cloud, driven by the savings, security, and manageability of Converged Communications. That shift included replacing its existing phone system with Teams Phone, saving the firm $90,000 per year and introducing many other benefits including easy deployment and management, security, and seamless integration with other communications and productivity tools.

title: PZ Cussons boosts deployment speed by 60 percent thanks to Casper365 SharePoint management, ‘an absolute game-changer’
executive_summary: PZ Cussons is a British multinational manufacturer of consumer goods and healthcare products, offering well-known brands such as Imperial Leather, Original Source, and St. Tropez.

title: Northrop & Johnson sails to exponential growth with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The superyacht business—where Northrop & Johnson is the world’s leading brokerage—is about making dreams come true and catering to a small group of high-value clients worldwide. The company embraced digital transformation, keeping it at the top of its field. Deploying Microsoft Dynamics 365 customer experience suite of marketing, lead, and opportunity management tools has led to a 250% increase in charter bookings. The average close rate in year-over-year brokerage sales grew 20% and 23% in 2021 and 2022, respectively.

title: One World Strong helps survivors heal together through an app built with Microsoft Viva Engage
executive_summary: One World Strong needed a way to quickly spin up digital communities in the wake of mass casualty events such as bombings and terrorist attacks. The nonprofit has built an app that leverages Viva Engage to connect survivors and families in a secure, trustworthy environment and in dozens of supported languages. Through technology, these communities are healing and supporting one another.

title: Customers travel smart with Apollo and Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Part of the European travel leader DERTOUR Group, Apollo is among the Nordic region's leading tour operators planning, booking, and arranging vacation and business trips for more than one million travelers annually. Whether it’s a relaxing beach holiday or an exciting city stay, Apollo’s network of tour operators, hotel brands, destination agencies, and business travel experts pair unparalleled service with expert knowledge to land its customers the trips of their dreams.

title: Repower accelerates innovation at its e-mobility brand, PLUG’N ROLL, with Dynamics 365, saving time and costs.
executive_summary: N/A

title: LifeLabs® brings care closer to home with Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
executive_summary: As Canada's largest provider of laboratory testing and management services, LifeLabs has been serving the healthcare needs of Canadians for more than 50 years. LifeLabs performs 112 million diagnostic, naturopathic, and genetic tests for more than 20 million customers annually. More than 6,500 LifeLabs employees at more than 380 Patient Service Centers (PSCs) put customers first in everything they do, earning a 90% satisfaction score. With LifeLabs MyVisit™ personalized mobile lab services powered by Microsoft Dynamics 365 Field Service and Power Platform, customers can get their tests done at a time and location that fits their schedules, and then get their results online for the ultimate in convenience.
products: Dynamics 365 Field Service

title: Dynacare uses Microsoft Surface devices to optimize total cost of ownership, enhancing operational efficiency and value in just four months
executive_summary: Dynacare, a provider of diagnostic testing and lab services with more than 170 locations in Canada, used Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Surface devices to improve efficiency for employees, enhance provider experiences, and empower its organization with innovative technology that would help it grow moving forward. Dynacare saw an opportunity to help providers and patients address health concerns more quickly by collecting, locating, and sharing test results faster. It deployed Surface devices so that employees could create simpler, more accessible records and share them more effectively. Now, providers get results more quickly, and the company has improved its total cost of ownership with the use of enduring, reliable, and effective devices.

title: NEC's digital employee IDs with facial recognition and decentralized ID launch for 20k employees in Japan using Microsoft Entra Verified ID
executive_summary: NEC Corporation (hereafter NEC) has developed and deployed a digital employee ID system that combines their own face recognition technologies and the Microsoft verifiable credentials solution,. This digital employee ID system is a completely cardless smartphone application that stores various information and enables users to manage information to their preference. Furthermore, the use of facial recognition enables this system to be used in a variety of ways that combine convenience and security. Going forward, this system will create services based on the experience and know-how gained through practical application within the company, under the “Client Zero” approach of NEC. Microsoft Entra Verified ID has been used for this digital employee ID system.

title: Landscape Structures reimagines productivity with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Landscape Structures sought a fully integrated solution that could keep pace with its growth while streamlining and automating processes between sales, manufacturing, and finance.
products: Dynamics 365 Sales, Dynamics 365 Finance

title: Kurt J. Lesker Company modernizes business operations with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: A dated Microsoft AX ERP was aging past support, slowed operations, kept Human Resources separate, and didn’t provide a Sales support tool. The company’s growth highlighted the need to modernize and integrate its business software solution.
products: Microsoft Entra ID, Dynamics 365 Human Resources, Dynamics 365 Sales, Microsoft Teams, Outlook, Dynamics 365 Project Operations, Azure Data Lake Storage, Dataverse, Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management, Dynamics 365 Finance

title: CATA Center for Astrophysics simultaneously connects more than 300 schools over 4,300 kilometers with the help of Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: In observance of Astronomy Day, the Chilean Centro de Astrofísica (Center for Astrophysics) developed a collaborative activity through Microsoft Teams to measure the planet's radius alongside students across the country.
products: Power Apps, Microsoft Teams

title: SERTECPET implements Dynamics 365 for Supply Chain Management to optimize processes and promote sustainability
executive_summary: The Ecuadorian company manages its digital transformation hand in hand with its corporate mission, honoring its commitment to innovation and sustainability.

title: Salvation Army New Zealand battles poverty "anywhere and everywhere” using Surface devices
executive_summary: The Salvation Army New Zealand works to eliminate poverty across New Zealand, Fiji, Tonga, and Samoa Territory. Yet an increased demand for services coupled with financial constraints encouraged the nonprofit to do more with less. It worked with a partner to provision and deploy Surface devices so staff can anywhere in the field. Surface devices are helping the Salvation Army New Zealand meet client needs securely and on budget.

title: Children’s Hospital of Philadelphia enhances fundraising efforts with Moore, a Microsoft partner, and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Children's Hospital of Philadelphia (CHOP) partners with Moore, a Microsoft partner, to enhance fundraising efforts through a novel constituent identity solution developed using Microsoft Azure. This collaboration has led to an 85% increase in response rate and a 25% boost in gift size, significantly accelerating the major giving process. The secure and scalable Azure platform ensures data privacy while enabling CHOP to forge deeper, data-driven constituent relationships, ultimately leading to safer children everywhere.

title: Mercantil Andina achieves remote efficiency with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: The insurance company Mercantil Andina successfully deployed Microsoft Teams in just three months and optimized the remote work experience for its more than 600 employees at 43 offices in Argentina. By collaborating with Prisma Technology Solutions, the company exceeded its initial goals and enabled 90% of its users to adopt Office 365 in an agile manner.
customer: La Mercantil Andina Compañía de Seguros
products: Microsoft Teams

title: Sandvik Coromant delivers ultimate customer service with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Part of global industrial engineering group Sandvik, Sandvik Coromant is a company at the forefront of manufacturing tools, machining solutions and expertise that drive industry standards and innovations demanded by the field of metalworking. Founded in Sandviken, Sweden in 1942, the company’s solutions enhance productivity, profitability, and sustainability for multiple manufacturing industries.

title: Anadolu Efes speeds up threat detection and response using Microsoft Defender and Sentinel
executive_summary: Anadolu Efes, one of the top 10 largest brewers in the world operating in over 180 countries, faced increasing complexity in managing a mix of on-premises and cloud cybersecurity solutions. This hindered its ability to address emerging cybersecurity threats efficiently.

title: Malabar Gold and Diamonds unifies data, systems, and teams with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Different business units at Malabar Gold had different legacy systems to manage their processes. These disparate systems were becoming increasingly inefficient and costly to manage and could not keep up with business demands.

title: MetLife reduces automated development security operations tests and builds to under an hour with Azure DevOps
executive_summary: MetLife’s Asia development teams wanted to implement industry best practices for development security operations across the extensive insurance enterprise. Their goal was clear: to enhance the security, efficiency, and quality of their software development cycle.
products: Azure Marketplace, Azure, Azure DevOps, Azure Boards, Azure Pipelines, Azure Repos

title: Grand & Toy honors legacy of excellence with future-proof innovations and Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Grand & Toy embarked on a digital transformation to replace disparate and aging systems with a single source of truth for sales, sales operations, customer care, and marketing teams.
products: Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Customer Insights, Dynamics 365 Sales

title: Alder Hey Children’s Hospital use Microsoft technology to improve surgical procedures.
executive_summary: One of the largest children’s hospitals in the UK plans to use Microsoft technology to help doctors work together and improve surgical procedures.
products: HoloLens, Surface Hub

title: Rockwell Automation brings visibility, new capabilities to sellers with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Fortune 500 company Rockwell Automation, Inc., (NYSE: ROK) provides industrial automation and digital transformation solutions to global customers across industries. As business grew and customer needs became more complex, Rockwell Automation needed a more comprehensive solution to manage sales and build strong customer relationships. The company adopted Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales, Power Apps, and Power BI to simplify and standardize tools for its global salesforce. Now sellers are empowered to connect with subject matter experts, streamline processes, and quickly provide the right information to customers to build relationships.

title: Alder Hey Children’s Hospital use Microsoft technology to improve surgical procedures.
executive_summary: One of the largest children’s hospitals in the UK plans to use Microsoft technology to help doctors work together and improve surgical procedures.

title: Rockwell Automation brings visibility, new capabilities to sellers with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Fortune 500 company Rockwell Automation, Inc., (NYSE: ROK) provides industrial automation and digital transformation solutions to global customers across industries. As business grew and customer needs became more complex, Rockwell Automation needed a more comprehensive solution to manage sales and build strong customer relationships. The company adopted Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales, Power Apps, and Power BI to simplify and standardize tools for its global salesforce. Now sellers are empowered to connect with subject matter experts, streamline processes, and quickly provide the right information to customers to build relationships.

title: How CRV is using cloud technology to deliver better lives for farmers and cows
executive_summary: Netherlands-based cooperative CRV is a global leader in cattle improvement. With the motto “better cows, better life,” the company helps farmers make sure that their cows feed the global population in a healthy and sustainable way. While in the process of migrating to the cloud, the company recently adopted Azure Red Hat OpenShift, a container solution jointly managed and engineered by Microsoft and Red Hat. The technology frees up CRV’s developers to focus on creating new digital innovations for their farmers.

title: HCA Healthcare secures its endpoints to ensure highest quality patient care
executive_summary: HCA Healthcare believes security is essential to providing a positive patient experience. They want the patient experience to focus on getting well and staying well, not worrying about whether their personal health information is safe. The average person may not consider a security team a critical part of patient care, but Jason Barnett, Chief Information Security Officer at HCA Healthcare, says his team considers themselves healthcare workers first; they are just not at the bedside. They enable quality care by securing and protecting the very devices and systems their caregivers rely on daily with Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.

title: Heineken partners with Microsoft to become the best-connected brewer
executive_summary: “Heineken wants to become the best-connected brewer and actually that's based on our history. We have strong connections with our consumers and have known them for 157 years,” says Ronald den Elzen, CEO, Heineken.
products: Azure, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Sales

title: BlackRock uses Azure to strengthen Aladdin, its investment management platform
executive_summary: BlackRock helps support the financial futures of investors, governments, and businesses around the world. To facilitate the next chapter of growth and innovation for BlackRock and its Aladdin technology clients, BlackRock is moving its Aladdin investment platform to Microsoft Azure. With this migration, the company can deliver new products faster, help more people and companies in more geographies, and do more—outside of the constraints of an on-premises infrastructure.

title: Daimler looks to optimize supply chain processes and reduce downtime with Microsoft Supply Chain Platform
executive_summary: Daimler Truck North America (DTNA) is the leading commercial vehicle manufacturer in the U.S., with a portfolio of distinctive brands like Freightliner and Western Star Trucks. With data coming from trucks, in-house ERP and supply chain systems, and suppliers, the company wanted to bring this together to gain actionable insights and optimize operations on the production floor as well as across the supply chain. To meet customer and dealer demand and promise accurate delivery dates, DTNA needed early visibility into potential time constraints. With Microsoft Supply Chain Platform, DTNA can break down siloes by inviting suppliers to share real-time supply chain data. This matches against demand signals and help uncover potential supply shortages, and increase collaboration with suppliers and production team to mitigate constraints and deliver on customer promise.

title: Kuwait University introduces the highest level of remote education with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: Kuwait University is the only governmental university in its country, with 40,000 students and 1,600 faculty members. The university has built a unified, remote learning environment adopting Microsoft 365, Azure, and Surface devices. Through this change, Kuwait University enhanced the educational experience for all, gained valuable data, and improved communication between students and professors.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams

title: Greggs keeps the morning coffee ritual safe and easy with Azure Active Directory External Identities
executive_summary: When the global COVID-19 pandemic disrupted the flow of traffic to food sellers everywhere, Greggs found a solution to support its post-lockdown return to serving customers. The British food-to-go chain envisioned a safe, contact-free “Click + Collect” pickup method, and it needed a solution that could scale to the volumes expected from the more than 2,200 Greggs stores. Happily, Greggs found a satisfying option with Microsoft Azure Active Directory External Identities—a business-to-customer identity as a service it uses across its full range of digital services.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Entra External ID, Microsoft Entra ID

title: General Motors reimagines the dev tool chain and onboarding experience with cloud-based developer services from Microsoft
executive_summary: General Motors (GM) has a great history of significant innovations that benefit customers and positively impact society. In the past, software was behind the scenes at GM—but not anymore. The software-first mindset at GM drives faster innovation cycles and takes the customer experience to new levels while enabling more efficient operations. To increase productivity and unlock new ideas and solutions, GM felt the challenge of getting developers up to speed on new assignments faster and more efficiently. GM collaborated with Microsoft to help achieve its goals to speed up innovation, test and learn, and create agile environments, all while working within the company’s protocols and requirements.

title: ELTRAK Group secures business continuity with Microsoft Security
executive_summary: ELTRAK Greece is the exclusive distributor for Caterpillar in Greece. To serve its customers better, the company transitioned to cloud solutions to improve productivity and management. ELTRAK Greece collaborated with Microsoft partner Office Line to use Microsoft Security, reducing its endpoint security maintenance effort by 75 percent and ensuring business continuity in its new environment. The move also helped the company achieve the ISO 27001 certification, an essential standard for information security management systems (ISMS) and their requirements.

title: Reed innovates with Microsoft Surface & Teams Phone to improve working life
executive_summary: “Through the journey with Microsoft, we have taken huge steps in terms of modernising our technology,” says Henry Lee, Head of Digital Workplace at Reed.

title: Alfa Beta introduces a fresh way to communicate with stores using the Microsoft Teams platform
executive_summary: In the past, store managers received information through emails that they accessed via PC’s in a store office. Accessing the information took managers away from the shop floor, and there was no simple way to confirm with support offices once a task had been completed. Because many Alfa Beta employees were already familiar with the Microsoft 365 platform, the move to Teams for collaboration was simple and intuitive. The new process is helping save time for managers and support office workers alike: Alfa Beta has tracked a 10% reduction in the time store managers spend looking for information.
products: Azure, Azure Arc, Power BI

title: Helping Ingeus build actionable insights with Microsoft Power BI
executive_summary: Covid-19 caused havoc in the jobs market, as employees were made redundant, struggled with health issues, and disconnected from the working world. In the first quarter of 2022, there were almost 280,000 fewer people in employment in the UK compared to before the pandemic, with another 370,000 economically inactive - meaning they are not actively seeking work.

executive_summary: General Motors (GM) has a great history of significant innovations that benefit customers and positively impact society. executive_summary: ELTRAK Greece is the exclusive distributor for Caterpillar in Greece. ELTRAK Greece collaborated with Microsoft partner Office Line to use Microsoft Security, reducing its endpoint security maintenance effort by 75 percent and ensuring business continuity in its new environment. The move also helped the company achieve the ISO 27001 certification, an essential standard for information security management systems (ISMS) and their requirements.

title: Upskilling employees paid off: MCS Group transformed operations with Power Platform
executive_summary: MCS Group, one of Mongolia's largest conglomerates, needed to swiftly respond to the technological needs of its 10,000 employees, but had limited IT resources. By embracing Microsoft Power Platform, it significantly reduced development time and costs. To foster innovation, it launched a group-wide Microsoft Power Apps and Power BI training program. Application development became so popular within the group that an internal app store was built, empowering employees to create business solutions that boost efficiency and make their lives better.

title: More power, less downtime: Fincantieri leverages ADX for turbogenerators’ predictive maintenance
executive_summary: Fincantieri, a global leader in shipbuilding and mechanical component design, wanted to shift from traditional reactive maintenance of turbogenerators to predictive maintenance with real-time remote monitoring. Using Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Azure Data Explorer (ADX), Fincantieri was able to do just that. Proactive monitoring enabled the company to postpone interventions by 25 percent and manage the storage of spare parts more effectively. The result is greater reliability and reduced downtimes for turbogenerators.

title: Deutsche Bank moves modern work to the credit side of the ledger with Microsoft Teams Phone
executive_summary: Deutsche Bank prides itself on providing a modern workplace for its global employee base. In the strictly regulated financial field, business communications from client-facing staff must meet stringent security requirements—requirements that vary from region to region. The bank needed a communications tool set that could stay compliant with constantly evolving international regulations and strengthen the trust the Deutsche Bank brand evokes. And it wanted to keep its employees competitive and client-focused with a highly secure, compliant framework that would support streamlined collaboration and connection across the planet. Deutsche Bank found its answer to all those needs by rolling out Microsoft Teams Phone, consolidating all its communication channels into a single app, Microsoft Teams.

title: Avanade puts people first, accelerates sales productivity with Microsoft Copilot for Sales
executive_summary: Avanade, a leading Microsoft solutions provider, soars on the strength of its accomplished consultants. The results it achieves for clients begin with highly trained sellers who keep Avanade’s project pipeline flowing. But as its client base and sales support technologies proliferate, the high-touch field of professional services selling is growing increasingly complex. Using the AI-infused Copilot for Sales and Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales, Avanade reduces workload for sellers with a range of time-saving features, helping them create and update contact records, summarize email threads, pull related data together, and improve email responsiveness. Even in the early stages of implementing Copilot for Sales, Avanade sellers are showing clients that they are top of mind while saving time and working more productively than ever before. The early adoption of Copilot for Sales is part of Avanade’s overall ambition and transformation to ready people, processes, and platforms and responsibly innovate and work with AI.
products: Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Sales, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Copilot for Dynamics 365, Microsoft Copilot for Sales, Outlook

title: Mastery Logistics Systems develops an innovative, cloud-based transportation management system with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Mastery Logistics Systems (Mastery), a leader in logistics technology, has built an innovative, cloud-based TMS that has brought new capabilities and opportunities to logistics organizations. Mastery was founded with a vision to improve the process of moving goods across the globe by solving for complexity and automating manual processes for enterprise carriers, logistics service providers, and large shippers. The company required a scalable and adaptable solution to solve industry-specific challenges. By developing a solution with Microsoft Azure, Mastery has brought imaginative solutions to life, expanded its workforce from 50 to 1,000 staff, and now offers its clients enhanced productivity and visibility—all in one platform.
products: Azure, GitHub

title: MagicOrange optimises SPAR's cost management with Azure
executive_summary: MagicOrange, an IT Financial Management and FinOps software as a service company, empowers businesses to make more informed business decisions which ultimately enhances profitability. MagicOrange is hosted on Azure and leverages Power BI. One of MagicOrange’s client is major retailer SPAR South Africa. SPAR's immediate financial discrepancies are being addressed with four transformative models deployed on the MagicOrange platform: VPN actuals, VPN Current Recoveries, Azure Cloud Model, and a general ledger actuals vs budget model. These models will help SPAR achieve more comprehensive cost recovery and budgeting, leveraging detailed insights into SPAR’s expenditures.
products: Azure, Azure Marketplace, Power BI

title: Conagra’s commitment to its shop floor workers starts with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: For more than a century, Conagra Brands has created an array of beloved food brands, from iconic brands like Birds Eye, Slim Jim, Vlasic, and Duncan Hines to new favorites, such as Angie’s BOOMCHICKAPOP and Gardein. With frontline workers at the heart of its mission, and by fusing culinary know-how with data-driven insights, Conagra is on a journey to modernize its shop floor operations with Microsoft Teams and Surface Hub devices. With real-time communication and data sharing, Conagra is empowering its workforce while staying competitive in the Consumer Packaged Goods industry.

title: OPAP invests in AI to simplify digital workstreams and boost employee efficiency with Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: OPAP, Greece's leading gaming company, was one of the first companies globally to integrate Microsoft Copilot to transform its daily workflows. With Copilot's introduction, OPAP aims to save time and automate routine tasks, as well as make meetings more actionable, efficient, and quick.

executive_summary: OPAP, Greece's leading gaming company, was one of the first companies globally to integrate Microsoft Copilot to transform its daily workflows. title: Broadcast media leader Globo saves over 10% per year on PC and Mac management with Microsoft Intune
executive_summary: Globo, a leading Latin American broadcast media brand, used to have another solution to manage the company’s 1,500 Macs besides Microsoft tools that always have been used to manage more than 13.000 PCs. The situation has created a scenario of decentralized management and additional costs. Today, Globo uses Microsoft Intune for security and management of Macs and PCs, and Windows Autopilot to automatically deploy Windows devices. The move helped Globo save more than five percent per year on its device management budget by unifying the solution and improving the employee experience.
customer: Organizacoes Globo Rede Globo de Televisao
products: Azure Logic Apps, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager, Microsoft Intune, Windows Autopilot

title: NSCA boosts website revenue with migration from on-premises solution to Azure Cloud
executive_summary: The National Strength and Conditioning Association (NSCA) earns an estimated 90% of revenue through their website, including certifications. Every three years, the organization holds a recertification event that sends tens of thousands of visitors to the site. An existing on-premises solution was unable to handle the traffic increase, causing customer dissatisfaction and revenue loss. The NSCA migrated to an Azure-based cloud solution and reported 100% uptime during the 2023 recertification period.

title: SLC Agrícola transforms its management and development system with the support of Azure, already targeting the future
executive_summary: A leading international agribusiness company began its digital transformation by implementing a new enterprise management system with Microsoft Azure. It leveraged infrastructure resources and a digital development pipeline – both processes already implemented. The next step was to invest in services and data engineering to accelerate analytical processes, collaboration, and security capabilities, which enabled a whole new reality: farm on cloud.

Using Microsoft Azure and Azure IoT technologies, PCL created the mobile-ready Job Site InsightsTM application to provide a single-pane view into all aspects of construction. Retail media is a mechanism for gaining new advertisement revenue by delivering advertisements tailored to buying behaviors through the CDP analysis of offline data possessed by retailers, such as ID-POS data, as well as various types of online data collected from EC sites and smartphone applications. AdInte provides a platform for building and operating retail media and has a leading track record of retail media support in Japan especially for large distribution companies. AdInte migrated all systems, including the DWH platform for building CDP, to Microsoft Azure. We interviewed people of AdInte about the effect of the migration of the DWH platform, one of the essential items of AdInte's business.

title: La Pontezuela launches transformation of olive oil business in two hours with Tipsa OliTEC suite for Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: Since 1974, La Pontezuela has manufactured Spanish extra virgin olive oil and offered an innovative approach for consumers to experience olive oil culture through quality gastronomy and leisure in Toledo, Spain. Seeking guidance for business modernization, La Pontezuela’s board of directors engaged Tipsa S.L., a Microsoft gold partner with decades of experience in automating food and beverage production. Tipsa quickly assessed La Pontezuela’s requirements and presented a cloud-based solution built on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central and powered by industry-specific apps. Today, La Pontezuela benefits from an accurate digital ecosystem that streamlines internal collaboration, simplifies production processes, eases online transactions through an e-commerce platform connected to CRM, and uses intuitive, real-time data analysis to make decisions with confidence, all built on Microsoft technologies.

title: System infrastructures for data analysis were innovated with Azure Kubernetes Service! What is the “consolidation” at the level of customer experience aimed by Eltes?

Eltes provides solutions including monitoring of web media such as SNS (risk monitoring) and consultation related to risk measures for responding to digital risks that is constantly being sophisticated. Eltes is also recently involved in security business, as well as supports DX of local governments.

executive_summary: CURRAX leverages digitization to uniquely provide one-stop shopping on customized drive technology solutions as a partner to Siemens and Flender. The company, started in 2008, believes digitization drives the future—from a product and process standpoint, and from how to effectively run its business.

title: Bartek transforms business operations from paper to digital through Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Bartek is the world’s largest producer of malic and fumaric acid—two key ingredients for many foods, beverages, and industrial applications. With demand increasing, the company sought to expand to reliably meet the needs of the well-known brands and customers who depend on its product. Bartek needed a technology solution that would transform business operations, maximize sales productivity, and automate business processes. The company worked with Microsoft to implement Dynamics 365 Business Central and Power Apps to unify back- and front-end operations.
products: Dynamics 365 Business Central, Power Apps, Power BI

title: ComAp drives global collaboration and innovation for improved sustainability with the Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: ComAp is a world leader in intelligent control solutions for decentralized energy resources. With more than 500 employees spread across 13 global locations and a network of more than 70 distributors, Czech Republic–based ComAp supplies energy control systems to customers worldwide.

Its management board is committed to constant technological innovation applied to production and distribution processes for its ciders, carbonated juices, liqueurs, vinegars, and other apple- and grape-based beverages. Today, its sales portfolio boasts more than 150 high quality products, and customers in countries across five continents request tailor-made products as well.

executive_summary: Established in 1961, one of Türkiye's largest energy companies, in the transition to remote and flexible working model accelerated during the pandemic period, offered the platform called AR-WE to its employees, using Microsoft Virtual Desktop and Azure components. In this way, Aygaz employees can continue to work independently of the place they are in and the device they use.
products: Azure, Azure Virtual Desktop, Dynamics 365 Business Central, Dynamics 365 Commerce

title: Palo Alto Networks secures customer successes with the Microsoft commercial marketplace
executive_summary: Palo Alto Networks is a global cybersecurity leader, helping customers of all sizes and complexities advance securely through trusted intelligence, automation, and flexibility with comprehensive security offerings spanning cloud, network, and operational security. With cloud security as one of the three main pillars of its business, Palo Alto Networks is turning to Microsoft commercial marketplace as a central procurement vehicle that takes the friction out of the complex B2B buying process.
