title: Rowan University faculty boost instruction time by up to 50% with reliable Microsoft Azure architecture
executive_summary: Rowan University (Rowan), a rapidly expanding public university in New Jersey, modernized its IT infrastructure and adopted a cloud-smart strategy that showcases how colleges and universities can boost accessibility, affordability, reliability, and security. As Rowan embraces a cloud-based architecture with Microsoft Azure, the university is providing seamless IT services to students and faculty alike. Some professors estimate that they have up to 50% more time for instruction due to improved infrastructure. Rowan sees its collaboration with Microsoft as a long-term partnership, and the university plans to expand its IT solutions to include emerging technologies like AI.

title: Del Monte Foods improves system uptime by 99.99%, saves 57% on infrastructure, and reduces security risk by 50% with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: Del Monte Foods Inc. (Del Monte), a large food producer and distributor, embarked on a digital transformation to optimize its infrastructure and improve its security posture. Constrained by its previous cloud infrastructure, which was costly and complex, Del Monte faced high maintenance costs, limited scalability, performance bottlenecks, and challenges deploying continuous security improvements. To realize the benefits of the cloud while enhancing security, the company migrated its primary business operations system to Microsoft Azure and implemented the Microsoft Defender security stack. Since adopting Microsoft solutions, Del Monte has reduced infrastructure costs, increased system uptime by 99.99%, and reduced security risks by 50%.

title: SdNcenter and Ascensia deliver online diabetes support globally with Azure
executive_summary: Diabetes care is stepping into the future, and SdNcenter is leading the charge alongside partner Ascensia. By developing GlucoContro.online together with a leading diabetes care company, SdNcenter has given healthcare providers online updates on blood sugar levels, exercise, and diet of people with diabetes. This rich data is empowering health professionals to provide data-backed and life-altering recommendations. Ascensia’s world-leading diabetes portfolio and SdNcenter's scalable digital solution, powered by Microsoft Azure, has created a seamless, interconnected healthcare ecosystem within the market serving over 150 million people with diabetes.

title: Gluwa uses blockchain to help investors fund loans to the unbanked
executive_summary: Gluwa with Creditcoin are bringing banking to emerging, underserved markets with a reliable, scalable cloud solution built on Microsoft Azure.

title: Michelin drives success for its small businesses with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: A key tenet of Michelin’s growth strategy is focused on mergers and acquisitions. While its corporate enterprise resource planning system (ERP) is perfect for central operations, it offers features that small or medium-sized businesses (SMBs) don’t need and exceeds the IT budget for those entities. Michelin found the solution with Dynamics 365 Business Central, sophisticated enough for SMBs but simple and affordable to install and maintain. The company brings its commercial agencies outside of Europe and some subsidiaries on board efficiently, with deployment taking less than half the time of its enterprise ERP.

title: Rajah & Tann paves the way for AI in the legal industry with Crayon and Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: As one of Singapore’s largest law firms, Rajah & Tann is a leader in innovation, pioneering the adoption and implementation of emerging technologies that continue to shape and reshape legal workflows. With an esteemed reputation and operations stretching across 10 countries, the firm found itself under mounting pressure to oversee a growing number of cases, while delivering at the same speed and level of quality for which they are known.

title: HYPE makes finance easier with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: HYPE promises customers a streamlined, simplified, and personalized banking app and needed a cloud-based CRM to optimize the value of its data to enhance its customer journeys.

title: Baptist Health saves 4,400 hours annually with Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: App login times at Baptist Health could be up to 3 minutes each, and for some apps, clinicians had to load roaming profiles on each device during a shift. Manual software installations and configurations were time-consuming.

title: USA TODAY taps into Azure Text-to-Speech to naturally read premium articles aloud
executive_summary: As USA TODAY celebrates its 40-year anniversary this year, the product team is expanding its subscriber experiences with voice. USA TODAY app subscribers can listen to premium articles with “Hear This Story”, powered by Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services Text-to-Speech. The road to this feature launching on USA TODAY started with the Gannett product team exploring different competitive AI solutions including Azure. For the end user, the team required natural synthesis of news and sports articles, in addition to the ability to handle obscure names and towns, a common challenge found in broadcast media.

title: Laerdal Medical Uses Azure AI Text to Speech to Create Immersive Training Experience
executive_summary: Laerdal Medical is a world-leading healthcare provider of CPR (cardiopulmonary resuscitation) manikins and other lifesaving technology, medical training, and resources. The company is investing in artificial intelligence and machine learning, including Azure Text to Speech, to help save 1 million lives every year by 2030. Laerdal's 3D virtual training simulator for healthcare students and providers uses Azure AI Text to Speech to provide an immersive experience that simulates the real-life interactions between patients and providers.

title: HelloTalk: The world's largest language exchange platform empowers language learners with Azure AI
executive_summary: HelloTalk is the world's largest language exchange app, founded in 2012. The app connects language learners based on their native language and the language they want to learn, allowing them to practice and exchange language, culture and more. With support for over 160 languages and users from over 200 countries, HelloTalk is a truly global platform that provides a diverse and inclusive community for language learners.

title: Solutions you can bank on: Recording Insights for the financial sector—ASC Technologies offers regulation-compliant documentation in Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Investment consultations are recorded as a matter of course, as stipulated by finance laws and policy regulations such as MiFID II in Europe, the FCA rules in the UK, and the Dodd-Frank Act in the US. This means that around the world, millions of consultation recordings have to be stored, secured, and analyzed in compliance with legal provisions—otherwise, financial institutions could receive hefty fines or even lose their banking license. For online consultations that take place on Microsoft Teams, ASC Technologies AG developed its Recording Insights digital solution. Where once only spot checks were possible, an artificial intelligence (AI) named the Compliance Policy Engine makes it possible to evaluate 100 percent of recordings, simplifying compliance with legal requirements. As an expert in compliance recording for highly regulated sectors, ASC relies on Azure Cognitive Services and integration into the Microsoft Cloud for Financial Services.

title: CIPIO.ai taps into the power of generative AI to deliver authentic, community driven UGC at scale using Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: CIPIO.ai believes the future of commerce lies in the power of a brand’s community. With a mission to help companies connect with their communities of customers, fans, followers, and beyond to drive authentic user-generated content (UGC), CIPIO.ai chose to work with Microsoft and use Azure OpenAI Services to tap into the power of generative AI. CIPIO.ai’s UGC Solution empowers brands to discover content and content creators, authentically engage with their communities, activate and collaborate with the community, execute new content, pay content creators, and analyze the impact of its brand community at scale. Customer feedback shows CIPIO.ai driven UGC outperforms other branded content, supporting authentic content for brands to use in their paid advertising campaigns, social media marketing, and at every stage of a buyer’s journey.

title: Radish Cooperative réduit le gaspillage alimentaire, améliore le service à la clientèle et les affaires pour les restaurants avec Azure
executive_summary: Montreal-based Radish Cooperative’s founders saw a food delivery market dominated by large digital platforms and formed a startup that offered affordable prices without sacrificing quality. They took a cooperative approach to ensure that Radish put its restaurants, couriers, and customers first. Joining the Microsoft for Startups Founders Hub, they developed a cloud-native, vertically integrated digital platform built on Microsoft Azure services. By hiring, training, and paying couriers appropriately, incentivizing restaurants as shareholders and decision-makers, and using data analytics and cloud-native tools, the cooperative and its members are thriving. Radish also offers integrated marketing, HR, and ordering services to its members to spur business and reduce food waste.

title: Project Gutenberg brings free audiobooks to the global community with AI-generated book narration
executive_summary: The oldest digital library and a leading distributor of free eBooks, Project Gutenberg wanted to make its collection more accessible to a broader community of members, including people who have visual impairments and those around the world who might not have access to traditional libraries. To achieve this goal, the organization collaborated with Microsoft on an AI-driven solution to create audiobooks at scale, creating nearly 5,000 new audio books.

title: Swedish tooling solutions company upgrades decade-old architecture to Azure, analyzes data with Power BI
executive_summary: Sandvik Coromant is one of the world’s leading suppliers of tools, tooling solutions, and know-how for the metal working industry. The Swedish company has extensive investments in research and development, creates unique innovations, and sets new productivity standards together with customers—including the world’s major automotive, aerospace, and energy industries.

title: Datadog enhances AI application monitoring with Microsoft
executive_summary: Organizations are adapting cutting-edge technology to support their growing customer base. With AI at the forefront, there are more innovative ways to build, use, and monitor AI-based applications to scale their businesses. Once these apps are built, organizations depend on the AI solution to continuously run smoothly so that they can optimize costs and find new ways to help customers. However, these applications demand routine maintenance to perform business-critical tasks, which can take time away from focusing on the customer’s needs. One organization created an integration with Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service to solve this problem to alleviate mundane work processes, like performance monitoring and compute optimization, to focus on product development that drives the future forward.

title: Quality knows no limits: FRÄNKISCHE Industrial Pipes automates pipe production processes with Azure IoT
executive_summary: More and more, industrial companies expect their suppliers to provide a window into production. Gathering and sharing real-time information is becoming a standard part of requests for quotations and thus a success factor for suppliers. The answer lies in connected factories. One company showing how this works is FRÄNKISCHE Industrial Pipes. This SME makes pipes, accessories, and system components for the construction, civil engineering, automotive, and manufacturing industries. And it is investing in connected production with the help of Azure IoT. During production, FRÄNKISCHE Industrial Pipes continuously collects data on which machines, tools, or even workstations have processed a particular raw material or component—including quality assurance purposes. This has led to quicker detection of production errors and a further leap in quality.

title: AGMC introduces Azure-powered Pulses.ai solution to locate cars in seconds
executive_summary: AGMC, the exclusive BMW Group importer for Dubai, Sharjah, and the Northern Emirates has hundreds of cars coming in and out of their facilities on a daily basis. The company faced the challenge of efficiently locating and moving vehicles at its largest service center. Together with Pulses.ai, AGMC created the Sphere 360 solution—an artificial intelligence-driven recognition solution built on Microsoft Azure. It has since transformed its logistics and operations. Today employees are no longer wasting time looking for cars, and customers are happier because of the reduced waiting times.

title: Intesa Sanpaolo improves real estate and facilities operations, reduces carbon footprint with Azure
executive_summary: As part of its commitment to sustainability, Intesa Sanpaolo Group, Italy’s leading banking group, embarked on a project to improve its real estate operations and facility management and cut waste. Intesa Sanpaolo created a dedicated internal team and collaborated with Microsoft and Microsoft Partner Network member ICONICS to use data to proactively identify faults, improve comfort, and reduce energy use in its buildings to significantly reduce the company’s environmental footprint.

title: Emaar partners with Microsoft to deliver a five-star loyalty experience using Azure Cognitive Services
executive_summary: Each year, the Dubai Mall draws more than 80 million visitors through its doors. To enrich their shopping experience, the world's most-visited lifestyle destination offers a unique rewards program based on advanced technology. A dedicated mobile app provides customers with a wealth of information on the mall’s 1,500 stores at their fingertips. Customers can also earn points on their purchases and redeem them against luxury shopping, travel, and leisure experiences across Dubai. The loyalty program based on submitted receipts uses Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services that have achieved 92 percent reading accuracy.

title: Mixed reality helps GE Healthcare train engineers to service complex equipment
executive_summary: GE Healthcare manufactures many of its most complex medical equipment, such as CT and MRI scanners, in China. The maintenance of these sophisticated equipment requires that service engineers undergo an intensive training and certification process. Working with Microsoft MRPP partner Adjacentech Corporation, GE Healthcare developed a mixed-reality training system that uses HoloLens 2 to improve training efficiency and expedite knowledge retention.

title: Progressive harnesses fusion development using Power Virtual Agents to build “Cloudie”
executive_summary: Progressive Mutual Insurance Company was founded in 1937 in Ohio by two lawyers with ambitions of adding innovation to the auto insurance business. Today, innovation, collaboration, and culture are key at the 50,000-plus-employee enterprise. When several cloud teams at the business sought a solution to get internal customers, especially those without IT resources, quick answers to cloud-related queries, two professional developers used Power Virtual Agents and fusion development to quickly create the Cloudie chatbot. That work spurred other teams to create their own intelligent conversation chatbots using the no-code application.

title: Harvey makes lawyers more efficient with Azure AI infrastructure
executive_summary: In an industry traditionally underserved by digital innovation, the founders at Harvey are delivering professional-class AI to lawyers around the world.

title: Transact Campus boosts data security with Azure Web Application Firewall
executive_summary: Transact Campus offers a mobile-centric technology ecosystem for educational institutions in the US. It was using a third-party web application firewall to protect its products. However, high costs, a variety of bugs, lackluster performance, and limited scalability led the company to explore other options. The company selected Azure Web Application Firewall on Azure Application Gateway, boosting customer data security, reliability, and scalability while reducing costs.

title: H&R Block simplifies tax preparation with a powerful AI tax assistant, built using Azure AI
executive_summary: H&R Block wanted to give online tax filers a better experience. The trusted tax preparation company envisioned using generative AI to create an easy, seamless process that answers filers’ tax questions, maintains safeguards to ensure accuracy, and minimizes the time to file. Valuing Microsoft’s leadership in security and AI and the longstanding collaboration between the two companies, H&R Block selected Azure AI Foundry and Azure OpenAI Service to build a new solution on the H&R Block platform to provide real-time, reliable tax filing assistance. AI Tax Assist combines nearly 70 years of trusted tax expertise with the latest advancements in AI technology from Microsoft Azure OpenAI to streamline and simplify the tax preparation process for millions of H&R Block clients.

title: Goodwill of Orange County grows revenue, employs more people with e-commerce app using Azure AI services
executive_summary: To expand the pool of people ShopGoodwill.com can employ, and to grow revenue used for its mission, Goodwill of Orange County developed an AI-powered app. The solution uses Azure AI capabilities to identify an item of clothing and extract information from photos of labels; it then creates a listing description using generative AI. The app means more people—including those with developmental, intellectual, and physical disabilities—will be able to work in unfilled e-commerce positions, and more clothing will avoid the landfill.

title: Visma develops new code up to 50 percent faster with GitHub Copilot and Azure DevOps
executive_summary: Software development can be a time-consuming and labor-intensive process. Coders at Visma, a software company headquartered in Oslo, have to conquer a wide array of challenges as they develop and test software for a diverse collection of customer organizations. The company recently adopted GitHub Copilot, Microsoft Azure DevOps, and Microsoft Visual Studio. Soon thereafter, employees began developing new code as much as 50 percent faster, which has contributed to increased customer retention, faster time to market, and increased revenue.

title: Fractal builds innovative retail and consumer goods solutions with Microsoft’s AI offerings including Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Retail companies today need to maximize investments while sifting through an ever-growing mountain of customer data. Fractal creates AI-powered solutions to help retailers solve problems across functional areas, from supply chain management to manufacturing to marketing. Microsoft infrastructure provides the foundational building blocks, giving Fractal the tools to create dependable solutions quickly and keep retail customers ahead of the AI game.

title: Transformação digital promove expansão da Aegea, aprimorando comunicação, segurança e uma nova realidade para a análise de dados no Azure
executive_summary: With two processes running in parallel, one focused on infrastructure and the other on data analysis, Aegea, a private sanitation company in Brazil, has achieved a robust platform for its employees to communicate securely while working remotely, as well as a sophisticated architecture for data analysis that reaches out to different areas. This environment supported the company's expansion, democratized data and fostered a data-driven culture – all project objectives.

title: Syensqo.AI leverages Azure OpenAI Service to develop SyGPT chatbot in record time
executive_summary: N/A

title: Zurich Insurance Group shapes the future of underwriting with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: With customers describing their needs in images, emails, and reports using their local language, Zurich Insurance Group recognized the challenge to translate unstructured data into a rules-based environment.

title: NTT DATA Business Solutions improves SAP code translation and generation with Azure
executive_summary: NTT DATA Business Solutions wanted to make it faster and easier for its internal and customers’ developers to integrate SAP with other key systems and processes. This included streamlining the time-consuming manual translation of specifications.

title: Zimmer Biomet uses novel Azure-based AI model to predict individual patient gait speed recovery outcomes after joint replacement surgery
executive_summary: Zimmer Biomet, a medical technology company with more than 90 years of experience, is leading responsible AI for healthcare with customized algorithms that predict patient gait speed recovery after hip and knee replacement surgeries. The company’s WalkAI™ technology, backed by its broader AI framework, allows patients and clinicians to monitor individual recoveries from knee or hip replacement surgery using data from the mymobility® patient engagement app. By building a robust internal AI solution based on Microsoft Azure, Zimmer Biomet has revolutionized its business and laid the groundwork for future AI-assisted products and services that empower clinicians and patients to stay informed before and after surgery.

title: How Gunnebo is keeping customers around the world safe using GPT-4 on Azure
executive_summary: Gunnebo is a global leader of security solutions headquartered in Sweden and on a mission to provide its customers with the safest devices possible. As part of this commitment, the company recently established Gunnebo Safe Storage Innovation Hub in Italy centered around researching new technologies and innovative ideas for its products. It has then established a partnership with Microsoft and embarked on a ground-breaking AI journey that’s led to the adoption of Azure OpenAI Service and its latest GPT-4 model. Currently in use to simplify, speed up and automate log analysis, the technology is already transforming operations at the company and driving efficiencies across the board.

title: Intertech transforms DevOps with Microsoft's GitHub Copilot: unlocking developer productivity
executive_summary: Intertech, the powerhouse behind DenizBank's IT operations, once grappled with a landscape of frequent interruptions. But with GitHub Copilot in their toolkit, Intertech experienced an astonishing transformation. Developers were no longer interrupted and context switching became a thing of the past. Pairing Copilot with Azure OpenAI Service, Intertech team surged in coding accuracy, enhanced team collaboration, elevated software quality, and meticulous documentation. What's more, daily emails were slashed by an impressive 50%.

title: Sasfin Bank enhances legal team with Azure-based, AI-powered Contract Corridor solution
executive_summary: Sasfin Bank Limited's Group Legal team, headed by Howard Brown, embarked on a transformation journey to enhance the bank’s legal operations. Taking document management head-on, Sasfin Bank’s legal team found a game-changing solution in Legal Interact's Contract Corridor. Built on Microsoft Azure, the platform doesn't just centralize 20,000 documents; it also uses artificial intelligence (AI) to analyze contract clauses, making post-signature management a breeze. Questions like 'What does this confidentiality clause mean?' are instantly answered, while Power BI dashboards provide real-time snapshots, moving from guesswork into data-driven decision-making.

title: Các trợ lý ảo của Trusting Social tạo đột phá trong trải nghiệm dịch vụ ngành tài chính ngân hàng
executive_summary: For over a decade, Trusting Social has championed the deployment of cutting-edge data science for financial inclusion. It enables banks to lend to the underserved, working with over 130 financial institutions across Asia. To this end, Trusting Social has built a suite of products ranging from credit insights using alt-data, efficient eKYC solutions tailored to Asian markets, and seamless digital journeys to acquire consumers. Generative AI introduced a novel opportunity to the company: enabling personalized banking for mass-market consumers. By integrating Azure services, the company launched Agent Foundry, a generative AI platform of autonomous AI-driven agents. With it, Trusting Social clients are changing how banks function and transforming their customer’s banking experience.

title: Over 5 million consumers and 50 banks get closer with IndiaLends platform, powered by Azure and Microsoft AI
executive_summary: As the customer base started growing, so did the stress on the code base and complexity of the platform infrastructure. The majority of the team’s time was being spent on the maintenance and upkeep of the infrastructure, instead of scaling to meet market demand. IndiaLends collaborated with Microsoft to accelerate its transformation, and took advantage of a host of services on Microsoft Azure. The processing time for transactions has gone down by 40 percent alongside a heightened efficiency among the developers by 75 percent. Accurate recommendations have led to faster checkouts and significantly reduced internal processing time by 50 percent.

title: La NBA utilise Microsoft Azure pour créer du nouveau contenu qui renforce l'engagement des fans
executive_summary: With nearly 10 billion interactions a day across its various delivery channels, the NBA is a big hit with fans, and the league doesn’t take that excitement for granted. The NBA is rolling out a new direct-to-consumer platform built on Microsoft Azure to deliver meaningful, personalized content to fans that caters to their individual preferences. NBA CourtOptix, one fan experience enhancement, uses Azure AI capabilities to turn billions of data points into insightful metrics about players and games to further engage fans. With Azure, the league is well positioned for even more exciting and revolutionary developments in the future.

title: Aichi Board Upgrades Education with 12,000 Surface Pro AI PCs & Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: Almost five years have passed since the launch of the GIGA School initiative. With the upcoming replacement of devices for teachers, selecting devices that can last until the next cycle was necessary.

title: baseVISION AG optimizes the use of AI with Microsoft Copilot and Microsoft Purview
executive_summary: baseVISION wanted to put the company’s growing use of AI on a secure footing. It wanted to maintain central control and ensure efficient design to combine data protection with productivity.

title: Teijin ‘cloudifies’ its RFID-based management inventory system, streamlining hospital operations and optimizing medical costs with Azure
executive_summary: Recopick is an IC tag–based RFID management system from the Smart Sensing Business Development Project of Teijin. This solution is used in many areas, including book management at libraries, work-in-process management at factories, inventory management at retailers, and supplies management at hospitals. In April 2019, Teijin released a cloud version of Recopick, using Microsoft Azure as its cloud platform. The first user was Kitano Hospital, a large medical research institute with 699 beds and 1,500 employees. Deploying Recopick together with the SPD service (hospital logistics management service) of Konishi Medical Instruments optimized internal logistics and visualized the use and inventory status of supplies. The hospital also expects the solution to facilitate management accounting in the future.

title: Law firm Bradley readies for a win: higher performance, efficiency with Azure Stack HCI
executive_summary: Prominent American law firm Bradley adopted a hybrid infrastructure in 2016 to reduce licensing costs, increase performance, and heighten security for its workloads. Now, the firm anticipates further simplifying management and boosting performance with the newest development in hyperconverged infrastructure (HCI): Microsoft Azure Stack HCI. Delivered as an Azure service, it offers Bradley a simplified way to manage its hybrid estate while also increasing performance and security.

title: Schindler: elevating the cities of the future
executive_summary: Every day, all over the world, more than 1.5 billion people use Schindler’s elevators, escalators and moving walkways. Now, the Swiss company has ambitions to play a key role in creating the seamless, smart and sustainable cities of the future. From office buildings, to airports, to shopping centers, Schindler is unleashing new data-driven innovations that will transform its services and offer more connected experiences for its customers.

title: Microsoft Viva and Microsoft Power Platform drive communications innovation at rebranded credit union
executive_summary: connectFirst Credit Union needed to consolidate four regional brands under one rebranded umbrella organization. It faced challenges from existing on-premises technologies, separate processes and procedures, and a fragmented communications infrastructure. With the help of its partner, the credit union adopted Microsoft Viva to help bring the consolidated organization together with universal access to company news, archived information, and role-related resources. Incorporating embedded canvas and model-driven apps, created using Microsoft Power Apps, within Microsoft Viva added to an overall boost in efficiency. It also helped underpin a roadmap for future communications and collaboration innovation for related branch and corporate business processes such as mortgage renewals, expense submissions, fraud reporting, and education reimbursements.

title: Malaysia’s research and technology firm saves millions with in-house app development capability
executive_summary: Owned by the Malaysian Government, SIRIM is Malaysia’s industrial research and technology organization. SIRIM’s vision is to be the best partner for innovation, which meant enhancing its internal processes and discovering innovative ways to serve industries better. SIRIM is one of the first cloud-based government-owned companies in Malaysia. “We automated many business processes and workflows, and we continue to transform our internal processes with Microsoft products,” said Tengku Intan, Chief Digital & Information Officer at SIRIM.

title: Streamlining automotive lending on a global scale with defi SOLUTIONS
executive_summary: In the automotive lending industry, defi SOLUTIONS represents a trusted brand for software that empowers rapid and accurate loan origination. In an industry where the difference between business gained or lost is measured in seconds, defi SOLUTIONS is consistently looking for ways to support speed, scalability, and a global reach that could eventually evolve into a “buy from the couch” model of shopping, credit approval, and purchase. To better serve their customers, defi turned to Microsoft Azure to help them in their transformation to a cloud-native operation.

title: Signant Health keeps COVID-19 clinical trials moving securely with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Signant Health provides the technology solutions that enable pharmaceutical companies to run clinical trials for developing new drugs and testing existing ones for new uses. When COVID-19 hit, Signant not only had to move its 2,000 employees to remote work, but it also had to be ready to scale operations to support clinical trials of critical therapeutic drugs and newly developed vaccines to fight COVID-19.

title: DC Water implements Microsoft Azure and PowerApps to cut costs, streamline processes, and better support customers
executive_summary: Spurred by the pandemic, DC Water continued to migrate most of its applications and workforce systems to the cloud as the agency adjusted to working remotely while fulfilling utility customer requests. The agency now runs nearly 100% of its apps and IT systems in the cloud, minimizing the need for paper tracking, in-person interaction, and multiple inflexible technology systems. Customers are able to interact with staff remotely, and employees are performing job duties by relying on technology. With proper support and collaboration, DC Water is projecting budget savings as a result of the digital transformation.

title: Telstra eyes monitoring and securing its hybrid cloud with Azure Arc
executive_summary: Australia’s leading telecommunications company, Telstra has been expanding into the technology sector for at least a decade. As part of a modernization project, the company is considering consolidating its internal cloud environments and expanding its use of the public cloud. When Microsoft Azure Arc, with its ability to extend the Azure control plane to on-premises and edge computing applications, became available for testing, Telstra recognized the opportunity to create a single pane of glass for its servers, Kubernetes clusters, and databases.

title: AGC gains scalability by migrating complex SAP environment to Azure with the help of KochaSoft
executive_summary: The AGC Group, a major global glass manufacturer, wanted to transition from on-premises hardware to infrastructure on Microsoft Azure, which would improve cost efficiency and provide scalability benefits. AGC’s presence in Europe and Japan meant its migration to the cloud needed to be handled with the utmost care. When AGC evaluated Azure partners that would help with an on-time, on-budget infrastructure build, KochaSoft stood out. KochaSoft migrated AGC’s datacenters and conducted a wide range of related work, improving security and outfitting AGC for an even stronger market position.

title: Romanian university in central Transylvania makes student-lecturer collaboration easier with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: Established in 1945, the University of Medicine, Pharmacy, Science, and Technology of Târgu Mureș (UMFST) is one of the most dynamic comprehensive universities in Romania. UMFST’s forward-looking leadership team had already begun its digital transformation, but COVID-19 accelerated the process. The university quickly shifted to online learning through Microsoft 365. Along the way, UMSFT reduced thesis submission times, sped up academic feedback by more than 75 percent, streamlined graduation certificate issuance, and unified financial aid processing.

title: Oregon State University advances its research capabilities with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Oregon State University (OSU), in Corvallis and founded in 1868, is Oregon’s largest university. As a public land-grant university, conducting scientific research is part of OSU's mission. However, the school’s new information and technology officer found it unacceptable that the university could not engage in health care research requiring HIPAA-level security standards because its previous cloud service didn’t meet security requirements. To address this challenge, the school chose to migrate its data to Microsoft Azure. As a result, the university now has reliable, compliant, and more secure data management that has positioned the school for additional research opportunities.

title: Smart Qatar meets the needs of citizens, businesses, and visitors with digital services built on Azure
executive_summary: The State of Qatar has a thriving economy based primarily on oil and natural gas, but the country is increasingly diversifying into information and communication technologies and building a knowledge-based society. Qatar has developed an open, integrated, and extendable platform of national services built on Microsoft Azure to support citizens, residents, businesses, and visitors. The TASMU Platform is helping make the country a better place to live, from health management to national food security, while also boosting its non-oil gross domestic product by 2 percent.

title: Nursing Organization Uses Microsoft Cloud and Database Technology to Increase Nursing Mobility Nationwide
executive_summary: In a world that needs nurses more than ever, the National Council of State Boards of Nursing (NCSBN) champions regulatory solutions to borderless healthcare delivery, agile regulatory systems, and nurses practicing to the full scope of their education, experience, and expertise. Its dedication to innovation and modernization in pursuit of enhanced public protection informed the decision to migrate its applications and databases to Microsoft Azure for greater scalability, security, and manageability. As a result, it’s now easier than ever for nurses, healthcare organizations, and regulators to share the latest information, enable cross-border collaboration, and work toward better healthcare for all.

title: La Mobilière connects the dots—and the people—seamlessly with Microsoft Azure Peering Service
executive_summary: When Swiss homeowners face floods or other natural disasters, they know they can rely on la Mobilière to be on the scene right away. In a country where insurance and banking are prominent industries, la Mobilière stands out. The oldest private insurance company in Switzerland, Bern-based la Mobilière stretches beyond policies and payouts. It’s committed to preserving the environment, supporting infrastructure improvements, caring for green spaces, and many other forward-looking initiatives. Just as la Mobilière strives to help conserve and strengthen the planet for future generations, it continually improves the performance of its information systems to ready the company for the challenges of the future. One of the first customers of Microsoft’s latest cloud datacenter regions in Switzerland, la Mobilière recently adopted Microsoft Azure Peering Service is crucial to that program.

title: Azure helps Avanade build retail solutions to change the world
executive_summary: Learn how the Avanade Intelligent Store framework, built on Microsoft Azure, brings added value to store employees and allows stores to better engage with their customers—all while delivering the retail experiences that customers want.

title: Valmont Coatings redefines customer service and operations efficiency with Azure
executive_summary: Valmont Coatings realized its on-premises job shop system for tracking customers and customer orders was holding back improvements in efficiency and customer satisfaction. Existing systems were different for customers and employees, which also made it hard to share information and track projects. To address these issues, Valmont replaced its entire on-premises business systems with Azure cloud-based services that provide a consistent experience for customers and employees. The new system has improved security, visibility, tracking, reporting, and flexibility and also streamlines production processes. This has led to measurable increases in customer satisfaction while providing a foundation for future growth.

title: RapidDeploy drives innovation in public safety with cloud-native mapping and analytics using Azure for US Government and Power BI
executive_summary: When RapidDeploy brought its cloud-native emergency response platform to the United States, it met initial resistance from public safety officials who doubted its ability to meet their standards for security, reliability, and uptime. Responding to the demands of the market, RapidDeploy partnered with Microsoft to build its platform with high availability and cybersecurity in mind.

title: Engineering firm CDG boosts data accuracy and reporting with Aptude and Microsoft
executive_summary: Engineering firm CDG, Inc., had relied on manual processes for storing its financial data and project information. To generate monthly reports for analysis, the firm was also manually downloading data to an Excel spreadsheet. These processes were error-prone and of limited use. CDG turned to IT consulting and development company Aptude, which helped the firm modernize its data storage and project management and improve its reporting by implementing a Microsoft Azure SQL-driven approach, supplemented by the reporting capabilities of Power BI.

title: P97 drives into the future with Azure
executive_summary: P97 delivered a secure and reliable mobility services platform by using Microsoft Azure. The company, which facilitates payments and connected commerce for some of the largest convenience retailers across the globe, needed a platform that could scale across Asia-Pacific, Europe, the Americas, and Canada. It also needed its platform to provide security and controls for its clients. So P97 used IaaS and PaaS on Azure to deliver its offering without having to develop the platform. It also used Microsoft services for identity management, compliance, and geolocation. Now P97 can provide mobile payments and integrated site connectivity at 99.9 percent uptime year-round.

title: Bain & Company builds new intellectual property management platform using Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Bain & Company (Bain) built an intellectual property management platform on Microsoft, streamlining information access and increasing employee satisfaction. The global consulting company’s legacy knowledge system could not keep up with modern demands, so Bain decided to migrate to the cloud. The Bain team also wanted to build a modular, API-based platform that could grow at business speed. Using Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365, Bain developed Iris, a custom web user interface that combines search functions and content management and provides security controls that facilitate wider employee access. Now the company’s knowledge specialists and consultants can find information quickly and with high accuracy.

title: Harnessing a more secure, feature-rich ecosystem for the future of healthcare
executive_summary: TMC Life Sciences Berhad’s use of Microsoft 365 brought much-needed integration to its group-wide operations. In creating a robust platform for staff and stakeholders to communicate and collaborate, the company also enlarged its ecosystem and gained newfound confidence through faster and more secure workflows. As it adopts SAP on Azure, TMC Life Sciences looks forward to the next leg in its journey towards becoming pan-Asia’s preferred healthcare system of choice.

title: How Field & Concept switched to Azure Cloud with About IT’s expertise
executive_summary: The Field & Concept agency has offered its clients innovative marketing solutions since 1989. The company needed to adapt its IT system to the current era. To meet data protection and remote working requirements, it needed a system that was simple, flexible and ultra-secure. To implement this transition, Field & Concept was able to call on its longstanding partner, About IT, to propose a suitable solution. The IT company opted for an Azure cloud system, implemented gradually to avoid disrupting the agency’s business operations.
products: Azure, Azure Migrate, Azure Virtual Desktop

title: A Revolutionary Ecommerce Platform with Azure at the Foundation
executive_summary: At IRP Commerce, the goal isn’t to find new ways to generate revenue for the company — it’s to keep uncovering innovative ways to solve solutions for its customers. It’s why, according to Chief Commercial Officer, Philip Macartney, IRP Commerce has built an ecommerce platform that goes beyond just giving merchants a place to sell their products. Instead, the IRP Commerce platform is a data rich solution that equips merchants with the insights and support they need to optimize revenue generation every step of the way. At IRP Commerce, the goal isn’t to find new ways to generate revenue for the company — it’s to keep uncovering innovative ways to solve solutions for its customers. It’s why, according to Chief Commercial Officer, Philip Macartney, IRP Commerce has built an ecommerce platform that goes beyond just giving merchants a place to sell their products. Instead, the IRP Commerce platform is a data rich solution that equips merchants with the insights and support they need to optimize revenue generation every step of the way.
products: Azure

title: PMG: Building an Integrated, Cloud-Focused Approach with Microsoft
executive_summary: As a leader in the Swiss financial services space, PMG Investment Solutions AG knew that if they wanted to stay ahead of the curve, they needed to adopt a cloud-first model. Their on-premises systems and a lacking ability to enable remote work meant that their tech stack was lagging behind best practices. As such, they needed to replace this with scalable, safe, and reliable infrastructure – and they wanted Microsoft solutions at the heart of it. That’s where Weibel/IT came in.

title: Crayon boosts speed, accuracy of healthcare auditing process using Azure Machine Learning and PyTorch
executive_summary: Healthcare providers need to be able to verify that they’re maintaining the highest operating safety and efficacy standards. Those standards are set by a national accreditation organization whose surveyors, often healthcare professionals themselves, regularly visit facilities and document situations that might need to be corrected or brought back in line with the latest rules and policies. That assessment and accreditation process generates a huge amount of data, and even the most experienced surveyors struggle to keep ahead of the ongoing development of thousands of policy rules that might be relevant in any particular scenario. Vaagan and his team took on the task of fixing the issue by building a machine learning solution that could ingest text from those reports and return a top ten list of the latest associated rules with unprecedented accuracy. They used Azure technology, development tools, and services to bring that solution to fruition. Crayon customers report clear time savings with the new healthcare solution. Just as important, the solution provides consistent responses that aren’t subject to the vagaries of individual interpretation or potentially out-of-date data.

title: Wimbledon High School teachers harness the power of Firefly in Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Rachel Evans, Director of Digital Learning and Innovation at Wimbledon High School (WHS) in London, was clear that she didn't want technology to lead teaching and learning, but rather to enable teachers to use the best tools available to meet their goals. WHS needed to support the real-time business of learning, whilst at the same time simplifying storage of and access to learning materials. By leveraging Microsoft tools alongside Firefly, WHS teachers are better able to innovate in the classroom whilst ensuring consistency of experience for their students across all learning spaces.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive for Business, OneNote

title: ResultsCX quickly creates highly secure call center capabilities, lowers costs with Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: For ResultsCX, a business process outsourcing (BPO) company, keeping up with shifting customer expectations means acting with agility. ResultsCX provides call-center technology and staffing services for brands in nine key verticals, including top-level telecoms, major healthcare providers, big insurance companies, and online retailers. It supports many Fortune 500 companies, handling more than 71 million customer service calls a year, managing automated support bots, and analyzing data.

title: Covenant Technology creates 3D CAD/CAM secure enclave with Azure Virtual Desktop in Azure Government
executive_summary: Covenant Technology recognized the need to provide scalable, highly secure cloud-based virtual desktops to customers who needed to quickly move to the cloud and support remote workers. Covenant Technology turned to Microsoft Azure Virtual Desktop to rapidly build customers a reliable, virtual secure enclave that employees access from any location. Because the virtual desktops run multi-session Windows 10 on Azure NV-series instances with NVIDIA GPUs, employees have the flexibility to connect to a highly secure virtual desktop using nearly any endpoint device and 3D peripherals to run their engineering software.

title: Carhartt gears up for growth with Azure VMware Solution
executive_summary: Since sewing its first bib overalls for railroad workers in 1889, Carhartt has built a reputation as an American apparel icon. The privately owned company operates manufacturing, distribution, and wholesale organizations, along with retail stores, and employs more than 5,300 associates worldwide.

title: JM Family enhances analytics and streamlines customer delivery with Azure Arc
executive_summary: To deliver on its goals of citizen IT and agile development, JM Family began a digital transformation two years ago with the launch of the Microsoft Azure cloud platform. As the next step of its digital transformation, JM Family needed to create a business case for modernizing its analytics capabilities onto Azure. On Avanade’s recommendation, JM Family used Azure Arc to perform a significant amount of the data collection that the company needed to produce the business case. “By embracing Azure Arc, we completed the project successfully and created our roadmap, and now we’re working with individual business units on their migration strategies and which technologies to focus on first,” says Soto.

title: Millennium bcp enhances visibility and agility through Azure Arc to deliver smarter banking solutions
executive_summary: Millennium bcp has a bold vision, innovative practices, and a relentless focus on delivering customer value. Millennium bcp is Portugal’s largest private-sector bank, with 1,334 branches serving more than 6 million customers around the world. The key to its vision and success has been continued investment in the latest technologies. The bank was among the first in its market to introduce ATMs and alternative payment methods, and one of the first to deploy early online services like transactional websites and an online financial marketplace.

title: CSU College of Business modernizes and simplifies IT, builds digital future with Azure Stack HCI
executive_summary: As the current system reached end of life, they decided to migrate many of the school’s on-premises environments to a simplified, end-to-end HCI platform that could support workloads from storage to virtualization. As CSU had already built most of its infrastructure on Microsoft solutions, moving to Azure Stack HCI—an Azure Arc-enabled operating system delivered as an Azure service—represented an opportunity to consolidate the entire infrastructure into a single ecosystem. By switching to Azure Stack HCI, CSU’s College of Business has improved the performance of its SQL and file servers, printing systems, and remote desktop services and significantly reduced the volume of support tickets generated by users.
customer: Colorado State University College of Business
products: Azure, Azure Backup, Azure DevTest Labs, Azure Files, Azure Lab Services, Azure SQL Edge, Azure Stack HCI

title: Bahrain’s Information and eGovernment authority moves over 20,000 employees to cloud with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: The Information & eGovernment Authority (iGA) of the Kingdom of Bahrain is the central authority that operates and manages IT applications for the Government. Since its mission is to innovate public services for citizens through digital transformation, the iGA needed a strategy to accelerate the process. Through its Cloud First policy, the entity created a new productivity environment based on Microsoft 365 and Dynamics 365. As a result, the governmental entities are now securely connected, while more than 100,000 working hours are saved each week by employees working in the cloud.
customer: Information & eGovernment Authority, Kingdom of Bahrain
products: Azure, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Power BI

title: Bayer accelerates drug research through data analysis in Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Hundreds of millions of people are in desperate need of new or more effective treatments for everything from cancer to autoimmune diseases to rare conditions. But pharmaceutical research takes time: according to the vfa, the association of research-based pharmaceutical companies in Germany, it takes 13 long years for a new drug to reach the German market. Analyzing data collected during clinical trials plays a key role in this. To get help to people in need sooner, the life science company Bayer collaborated with Microsoft to develop ALYCE, a data engineering and data science platform. Using artificial intelligence and machine learning, ALYCE helps Bayer evaluate data from clinical trials faster and more efficiently. Complying with all relevant regulations, this high-performance, scalable data analysis is based on Microsoft Azure.

title: The Municipalities of Sotenäs, Munkedal and Lysekil revolutionize citizen services in Sweden with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: The Swedish public sector is fast waking up to the innovative power of cloud technology. Among its loudest promoters is SML-IT, an organization established by The Municipalities of Sotenäs, Munkedal and Lysekil to provide IT services to their communities. Over the past decade, SML-IT has embarked on an extraordinary digital transformation journey that has led it to create simple apps that bring much needed automation and optimization to municipal processes.

title: Coşkunöz Metal Form develops applications for business processes with Microsoft Power App
executive_summary: Coşkunöz Metal Form, one of Türkiye's largest companies in the automotive sector, is developing their own applications with Microsoft Power Apps to digitalize their business processes. Barış Karaadak, the General Manager of Coşkunöz Metal Form, stated that they have implemented more than 110 projects in their digitalization journey, with 46 of them using Microsoft Power Platform and providing significant benefits.

Pursuing a well-architected strategy, the University set up redundant versions of key data warehouses in Azure and now takes advantage of Azure availability zones to safeguard against outages, stay operational during maintenance and improvements, and help ensure resilience and reliability. Additionally, the University is realizing greater agility, faster response time to business needs, and reduced costs by continuing to pursue Azure-backed solutions.

Using Microsoft Synapse for analytical power, Databricks for predictive power and a BI dashboard to visualize and understand that data, Jumbo not only improved customer experience, but also started turning its millions of customers into loyal fans.

Contrails heighten the effect of global warming, accounting for almost two-thirds of the entire climate impact of aviation. Now, Satavia, a UK start-up based in Cambridge, hopes to eliminate 60% of aviation’s climate impact through its innovative AI-powered tech solution.

A core part of its animation process is the compute-intensive act of rendering, which finalizes and compresses each of its frames, and is managed by dedicated on-premises servers operating at near capacity. Rodeo FX uses Microsoft Azure HPC + AI and Azure HPC Cache to extend the value of its on-premises asset by gaining added compute and scale during high-demand periods so it can get its productions through rendering on time.

They decided to employ Microsoft’s full-managed service “Azure VMware Solution (AVS)” as one of the transfer destination options, since they would be using multiple cloud services under the multi-cloud strategy.

With Microsoft 365 E5 Security, the Group also implemented a Zero Trust security framework and is now further advancing toward cybersecurity hygiene that continuously maintains the health of the IT environment.

The company offers a no-cost credit solution that enables small businesses to overcome short-term liquidity shortage and continue business as usual. Buyers are obliged to pay only after goods are received physically and get an additional 14-day interest-free credit. Sellers are able to eliminate risks and overheads of collection, unblock capital and boost sales

title: DataPlatform with Microsoft Synapse and Databricks
executive_summary: Logisfashion, logistics operator specialized in the textile and fashion sector, started in 2012 the migration of all its data to the Microsoft Synapse cloud, concluding the project in 2017 with the creation of its Warehouse Management System LogisCore.

title: Ace Hardware International expands to global markets, onboarding franchises faster with Azure
executive_summary: To conduct leading-edge and highly accurate forecasting, it’s also essential that Climavision quickly and efficiently extracts maximum value from its data. The Azure HPC + AI platform provides the infrastructure and orchestration that Climavision’s resource-intensive workloads need. With the help of its Azure infrastructure, Climavision can now move as quickly as the weather changes.

title: Sigma Loyalty Group transforms business through future-proof infrastructure
executive_summary: Sigma Loyalty Group provides enhancement services and solutions across industries. As a provider of identity and information protection services, Sigma’s business has been in high demand and on a growth trajectory, but its inability to seamlessly scale and cost-effectively maintain its infrastructure and ecosystem slowed them down. Sigma needed to modernize its services, from on-premises servers to the cloud and from traditional applications to web apps. Azure-fueled digital transformation helped Sigma Group increase availability, improve infrastructure security and improve overall business performance.

title: ESPN Edge finds a winning digital game plan in an evolving media landscape with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Leading multinational, multimedia sports entertainment brand ESPN developed creative solutions on Microsoft Azure to remain at the forefront of changing broadcast trends. ESPN wanted to continue to position itself as an innovative company to separate itself from competitors. ESPN worked with Microsoft, Accenture, and Verizon to launch the ESPN Edge Innovation Center, which brings together technology, consulting, connectivity, and hardware to develop new ways of experiencing sports. ESPN has already seen more than a 50 percent reduction in closed-captioning costs, and it expects significant cost savings across many other areas in the years to come.

title: Traditional Romanian bank builds a more flexible, agile, and responsive business environment with the cloud
executive_summary: Headquartered in Bucharest, Romania, CEC Bank is the oldest financial institution in the country. The bank has successfully reinvented itself more than once to keep up with the times, and is now one of the most recognized in the market. Most recently, the company overcame age-old legal bureaucratic processes and, with its partner’s help, New Business Dimensions, adopted Azure Cloud to streamline and optimize its internal communication, collaboration, connectivity, and reporting. Now, CEC Bank is ready to expand its business with shorter time-to-market and easy-to-access new services for customers.

title: Seewo Technology expands a new educational model with Azure
executive_summary: Founded in 2008, Guangzhou Shirui Electronics Co.,Ltd belongs to CVTE, a world-renowned intelligent interactive solution provider with display and control technology at its core. The company’s headquarters are in Guangzhou Science City, China, with marketing services all over the world. Seewo is the independent brand of Seewo Technology in the field of education. Created in 2009, it’s the pioneer in the domestic interactive smart tablet category. The company has been the market share champion of China’s interactive intelligent tablet industry for 10 consecutive years from 2012 to 2021 and is the industry benchmark enterprise.

title: Wichita Public Schools empowers 60,000 students and staff by creating virtual classrooms and hybrid work capabilities on Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Wichita Public Schools, serving nearly 50,000 students and almost 10,000 teachers and staff, initiated an online communications platform using Microsoft Teams, making virtual classrooms, remote work capabilities, and in-network communications possible. Its IT staff had to move quickly after COVID-19 made in-person school and work unavailable at its 94 public schools and special program sites. Coordination with its existing UC infrastructure was also required. Wichita Public Schools’ relationship with Microsoft partner NEC, the school district’s PSTN provider, expedited seamless connection to Microsoft Teams without interruption, preparing the district for the future of remote work communication and online education.

title: Virtusa improves productivity by 25% while reducing costs by 10% with Microsoft Azure Arc
executive_summary: Founded in 1996 and headquartered in Massachusetts, Virtusa helps businesses move faster toward their digital future by combining deep industry expertise with frictionless technology. It enables clients to implement end-to-end digital   transformation initiatives with the pace and passion of a startup and at scale. With a robust partner ecosystem, including various fintech and insurtech startup collaborations, it empowers clients to change, disrupt, and unlock new value. The company has a worldwide footprint, with offices and delivery centers in the Americas, Asia, Europe, and the Middle East.

title: Achieving more with less: PayCraft's migration to Microsoft Azure pays off
executive_summary: PayCraft Solutions Private Limited (PayCraft) is a leading solution provider for banks and public transport operators. It was founded in 2013 in India with the vision to enhance urban mobility convenience. With its common mobility card solutions, it delivers open loop transport solutions that integrate technologies for banking and transportation. It works with the world’s leading payment systems, banks, transport operators, and device manufacturers to facilitate a multi-party digital ecosystem.

title: Sime Darby Property takes operations to a new level by moving to the Azure cloud
executive_summary: Leading Malaysian property developer Sime Darby Property is working to multiply value for people, businesses, economies and the planet via its thriving asset portfolio. The company embarked on a group-wide digital transformation in 2020 to become a more agile, data-driven organization. The first step was migrating all its on-premises servers to the Azure cloud. Since then, Sime Darby Property has reduced its IT spending, empowered employees to be more productive, and transformed customer experience by leveraging the cloud.

title: Windows 11 Pro fuels growth and breakthrough technology at Techspace
executive_summary: Techspace anticipates greatly expanding its business of providing workspaces and technology infrastructures to fast-growing technology companies. The Techspace finance team uses Microsoft Power BI to provide executives with the data-fueled intelligence that allows them to make the right decisions as they create the future of the company. Since finance team members started using Dell laptops running on Windows 11 Pro, they find it much easier to capture and visualize the data they need, which in turn helps the company forge ahead. Instead of static reports, they provide insight through an interactive dashboard. Windows 11 Pro with Power BI running natively will play a key role as Techspace expands to additional sites, recruits employees, and empowers the existing team.

title: SaaS provider, RevenueWell keeps focus on business growth with flexible, low-maintenance Azure SQL Database Hyperscale
executive_summary: N/A

title: Duke Energy develops pioneering methane-emissions monitoring platform on Microsoft Azure with Accenture and Avanade
executive_summary: Duke Energy, one of the largest US energy-holding companies, set an ambitious goal for its natural gas utility business, planning to achieve net-zero methane emissions by 2030 for its own operations. Reaching that goal requires going beyond current industry practices, which utilize calculations to estimate methane emissions and periodic physical inspections to detect and monitor potential leaks. Seeking more accurate detection methods, Duke Energy worked with Accenture, Avanade—a joint venture between Accenture and Microsoft—and Microsoft to tap the deep technological expertise needed to achieve its goal. Together, they developed a first-of-its-kind methane emissions monitoring and remediation solution on Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Dynamics 365 that significantly improves leak surveys, emission calculations, and leak remediation.

title: Sage improves retention 30% with employee listening powered by Viva Glint and Viva Insights
executive_summary: Sharon Oley, Customer Services Director at Sage, oversees 500 colleagues who maintain the great customer support that the payroll, HR, and finance software provider has become known for. “We’re very focused on giving the customer great access and a great experience,” she says. Key to that standout customer experience is a frontline workforce of engaged employees who buy into Sage’s people-focused, supportive workplace culture. For a global business operating in a hybrid world, however, keeping a finger on the pulse of organizational culture can be a challenge. “We use Microsoft Viva Glint and Viva Insights to gain real-time insights into how employees are feeling and workplace behaviors,” says Oley. “We understand the importance of listening to employees.”

title: SAP SE Brings Design Thinking to Hybrid Work with MS Teams and Mural
executive_summary: SAP SE is a German multinational software company based in Walldorf, Baden-Württemberg. As one of the world’s leading producers of business management software, SAP develops solutions that facilitate effective data processing and information flow across organizations. Operating in 130 countries with 105,000 employees worldwide, SAP relies on innovative, flexible, and inclusive tools and processes that foster collaboration and design thinking. Even before the pandemic, SAP's global workforce meant distributed teams needed to collaborate effectively and lead customer engagements across regions. At the Walldorf location, that meant meeting rooms with whiteboards were always fully booked. ""In Walldorf, we have a strong collaboration culture, and we needed a better and more hybrid-friendly approach to meetings.""” says Dana B., product owner Microsoft Teams at SAP.

title: GAC IT Team saves 1,000+ hours after global cloud migration
executive_summary: Shipping and logistics pioneer Gulf Agency Company (GAC) operates out of 300 offices around the globe. To keep up with the challenges of the 21st century it needed to build a more efficient work ecosystem. GAC’s Chief Information Officer Martin Wallgren and his team migrated the group’s on-premises data centers to the cloud and built an integrated data platform—Pegasus. By doing so, they created a platform that puts GAC in a position to offer better, quicker services to customers, which sets it apart from its competitors.

title: Citizen developers find creative ways to help Shell run safer, smarter and more efficiently with Power Platform
executive_summary: Shell launched its citizen-development initiative four years ago in a program called DIY (Do IT Yourself) with Power Platform. Two years ago, the company established a dedicated center of excellence within the digital engineering function to “empower every employee to digitize work processes to improve productivity, increase agility and create more value for customers.” Today, DIY is driving previously unimagined efficiencies, empowering workers to accelerate the company’s digital transformation.

title: BeeKeeperAI partners with Microsoft Azure to advance patient care with AI
executive_summary: Artificial intelligence, machine learning, and large language models typically use de-identified data for development. Although there are many de-identified and anonymized datasets available that confer some knowledge to models, this type of data preparation has been shown to strip out essential information, introduce biases, and result in a homogenized data set that lacks the precision required for personalized treatment. Utilizing Microsoft Azure confidential computing, BeeKeeperAI® is enabling privacy-enhancing computing on real-world, personally identifiable information (PII) and protected health information (PHI) across the lifecycle of model development to deployment, thereby significantly shortening the time from bench to bedside.

title: Brabant Water delivers refreshing improvements with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Brabant Water, established in 2002 from the merger of two smaller water utility companies, has a reputation for excellent water quality and reliability of service. One of 10 water utility companies in the Netherlands, the company provides drinking water to 2.6 million people in the province of North Brabant. The company is responsible for collecting water from natural sources, guarding its safety, building and maintenance of networks, and installation of meters, valves etc. to homes and businesses in its municipality.

title: Thanks to Microsoft Azure, Alstom can provide its customers with high-performance, secure and scalable digital services
executive_summary: In a world where the decarbonization of industries is at the heart of public policy, the development of ever more sustainable means of transportation appears to be one of the key responses to this major challenge. Provided we make it attractive and we continually reduce the energy consumption associated with its activity, which is inherently more sustainable.

title: NeighborWorks America tackles the housing crisis with Azure
executive_summary: NeighborWorks America tackles the housing crisis across the U.S. by supporting nearly 250 local nonprofits. Its outdated on-prem hardware caused regular system outages, limiting partner organizations' important work. The nonprofit needed to transition to the cloud in mere months to coincide with a headquarters move.

title: AXA chooses Azure to offer next-generation digital services and transform its customers' healthcare journey
executive_summary: To meet the ever-evolving customer expectations, AXA, one of the world's leading insurers, has leveraged the power of Azure technology and the expertise of Microsoft and Healthanea to develop value-added services that integrate digital and physical healthcare journeys, while offering patients proactive support, from the detection of their first symptoms through to their medical treatment. The result is a platform, which connects hospitals, pharmaceuticals, heath tech solutions, insurers and more to provide patients with improved and frictionless access to healthcare.

title: Lexmark’s Azure-based IoT Solution for Connected Products helps manufacturers move from selling products to delivering advanced services
executive_summary: Lexmark, a global imaging and IoT solutions leader, grew its Microsoft-based IoT solution into an offering for other manufacturers. An effective IoT solution can transform how manufacturers go to market, but moving beyond “pilot mode” to gain the full benefits of IoT can be challenging. Lexmark, which had accomplished its own digital transformation with an IoT solution based on Microsoft Azure, quickly realized that other connected-device manufacturers would benefit from the same technology. It developed the Lexmark IoT Solution for Connected Products, providing a fast path to business outcomes. Now, as both the developer and the first user, Lexmark is delivering capabilities to meet real-world business needs.

title: Using Advanced Analytics to automate processes and prevent failures: A data platform for Clearstream based on Azure
executive_summary: Every day, Clearstream carries out more than 250,000 settlement transactions, while holding more than 300,000 nationally and internationally traded bonds, securities, shares, and investment funds in custody. That’s another way of saying that this subsidiary and central securities depository of Deutsche Börse Group carries a great deal of responsibility. In a strictly regulated industry, the company carries out its processes promptly, accurately, transparently, and securely. In the past, Clearstream used an on-premises data platform for this purpose. Today, data is made available from a central source with the help of Microsoft Azure. This ensures more efficient processes and speeds up the development of new services.

title: Quotient Ventures turns to Microsoft 365 Business Premium for productivity, collaboration, device management, and data security in a single solution
executive_summary: Mumbai-based Tilt Brand Solutions, part of Quotient Ventures, offers brand and communications services to a wide range of clients. In 2022, the young company reached an inflection point in its growth trajectory and needed to standardize ways of working, collaborating, and communicating securely. With an IT team of two, the company also needed to ensure that the solution could be managed primarily by a few users. Quotient Ventures chose Microsoft 365 Business Premium as its IT solution and hasn’t looked back. In addition to reducing costs by 40% while increasing productivity, Tilt Brand Solutions reports other, unexpected benefits, particularly in the area of security.
