products: Azure API Management, Azure Firewall, Azure, Microsoft Defender, Azure Resource Manager, Azure Application Gateway, Azure Web Application Firewall, Microsoft Defender for Cloud, Microsoft Sentinel, Azure Security

title: LTIMindtree merges 85K endpoints seamlessly with Microsoft Intune
executive_summary: The merger of Mindtree and Larsen & Toubro Infotech, a technology manufacturing and services company, created the need for a flexible solution that would manage endpoints, patches, and vulnerabilities while seamlessly integrating effortlessly with the company's IT environment.
products: Microsoft Intune, Windows 11, Windows Autopilot, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Intune Enterprise Application Management

title: Innovation Federal Credit Union improves member experience and contact center productivity with Dynamics 365 Contact Center
executive_summary: Innovation Federal Credit Union faced challenges with multiple systems for customer and loan data, lack of task automation, manual compliance processes, and slow loan approvals, hindering efficiency and customer service.

title: Latino Economic Development Center helps communities thrive through Microsoft technology
executive_summary: The Latino Economic Development Center (LEDC) began its digital transformation during the pandemic. As time goes on, the nonprofit needed to provide its business and financial services to a growing number of entrepreneurs and individuals, securely.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Outlook, Planner, Microsoft Defender for Office 365, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Intune, SharePoint, Bookings

title: WinWire collaborates with Microsoft Azure to lead the revolution of AI transformation
executive_summary: WinWire’s clients needed AI transformation and modernization. WinWire used Microsoft Azure to build AI-driven platforms, migrate infrastructures, and boost business agility.

title: Zurich Germany: Disrupting the insurance industry with Microsoft AI
executive_summary: Zurich Germany is part of the worldwide operating Zurich Insurance Group. It is among the leading insurers in Germany with a wide range of property and life insurance products. To stay competitive and mitigate risk, analyzing customer data has always been at the center of Zurich Germany's operation. But in 2020, Chief Data Officer of Zurich Germany, Dr Michael Zimmer, took things to a new level by introducing Al technology with Microsoft — giving the business not just a more accurate way to calculate premiums, but to optimize business processes across the entire customer journey.

title: Elkjøp creates a superior customer experience with Azure Kubernetes Service
executive_summary: As the biggest electronics retailer in the Nordics, Elkjøp has never had trouble attracting customers into its stores. But with so much focus on the shop floor, Elkjøp’s IT systems had been left in the dark, using outdated e-commerce and point of sale (POS) platforms that hadn’t been upgraded for the future. The Next Generation Retail project aimed to change all that, with an overhaul of every Elkjøp system to modernize functionality and move all its core business into the cloud—a revolutionary shift for this retailer that also helped it navigate the social-distancing challenges of 2020.

title: Longtime innovator SKF unveils the factory of the future on Azure hybrid cloud
executive_summary: For more than a century, Swedish industrial giant SKF Group has been producing bearings, seals, and other solutions and services for global manufacturers. Already an industry leader, the company is now turning heads to the way it does business. One of the key growth enablers for the company is to digitalize the full value chain to make SKF easier to do business with and to enable SKF to make more intelligent decisions in its own operations. Digitalizing operations will power that shift to data-driven manufacturing, and to support this transformation, SKF partnered with Microsoft to deploy a hybrid cloud solution.
products: Microsoft Teams, Office

title: Albertsons and Microsoft Partner on Cloud Adoption to enable Digital Transformation
executive_summary: The Albertsons Companies family of brands engaged Microsoft Industry Solutions to help migrate Albertsons’ on-premises data center to Microsoft Azure. As COVID-19 began spreading across the country, online orders skyrocketed 240 percent in a matter of months, accelerating Albertsons’s modernization plans. To squelch competitive pressures, the need to operate and innovate faster was clear. Reducing costs while leveraging inherent Azure capabilities such as scalability, flexibility, resiliency, and agility will enable Albertsons to quickly pivot based on market demand. In the third quarter of Fiscal 2020 alone, Albertsons reported an increase of 12.3 percent in Identical Sales Growth and an astounding 225 percent rise in digital sales.

title: Unleashing the value of instrumentation data
executive_summary: Malvern Panalytical is a global business that designs, develops and commercialises analytical instruments for materials analysis across a wide range of industries and applications.

title: Leaping into a much better world
executive_summary: New College Lanarkshire is one of the largest colleges in Scotland. It operates across Lanarkshire and East Dunbartonshire with campuses in Cumbernauld, Motherwell, Coatbridge, Kirkintilloch, Hamilton and Broadwood.
products: Azure, Azure Machine Learning

title: Belgian railway operator, Infrabel, drives up data management with Azure Data Explorer
executive_summary: Formed in 2005, Infrabel is responsible for creating and maintaining Belgium’s railway network. Needing more scalable, flexible and effective log management capabilities to efficiently manage its vast rail infrastructure, the company chose Azure Data Explorer to replace its on-premises solution. Today, Infrabel benefits from seamless data ingestion, rapid scaling, easy visualization, and high availability. Travelers also feel the difference as they enjoy safer, more efficient journeys across Belgium’s rail network.

title: Barracuda scales in-text search with Azure Data Explorer
executive_summary: Offering a leading range of enterprise-grade cybersecurity solutions, Barracuda is dedicated to simplifying digital defense for its global customer base. Needing a way to enable seamless in-text search across its Cloud-to-Cloud Backup service, it chose Azure Data Explorer. Today, Barracuda is benefitting from its investment, onboarding thousands of customers in the first few months of its new platform deployment. It’s also tapping into a cost-efficient way to run text search on its protected data and is positioned to scale and support continued growth.

title: Van Havermaet scales up innovation to deliver superior accounting advice with Azure Stack HCI
executive_summary: Trust is everything for Van Havermaet. The Belgium-based multidisciplinary accounting firm has been a trusted, dependable partner to its clients for the past 80 years, reliably advising and guiding them through accounting, tax, legal, and HR issues. Maintaining that ironclad dependability, however, increasingly requires the digital innovation and scale necessary to meet clients where they are and the foresight to lead them where they need to be. So, when Van Havermaet decided to take a cloud-first approach to improve innovation for itself and its clients, it found its own trusted partner in Microsoft Azure Stack HCI.
products: Azure Arc, Azure Databricks, Azure Stack HCI

title: Engineering goes cloud-native: Driving competitiveness and agility with simulations in the cloud
executive_summary:
Engineering companies must constantly reinvent themselves in the global and dynamic market environment—most recently reinforced by the trend toward sustainability and positioning in the field of e-mobility. This puts high pressure on the research and development (R&D) departments, which have to realize ever faster innovation cycles and develop and test new products for a wide range of challenging operating conditions.

Computer-aided engineering (CAE) and numerical simulations accelerate this product development process: with these tools, engineers can, for example, predict the optimal configuration for cooling an electric motor or optimize gearboxes in terms of losses and longevity. Dive uses a cloud-native simulation environment to take the complexity out of this process and offers a modern Software as a Service (SaaS) package—all based on Microsoft Azure.

title: Full transparency: Systrion develops a Product Information Hub for the consumer goods and food industries based on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Allergens, nutritional values, ingredients: consumers are casting an increasingly critical eye over what’s in their food, while also choosing more and more vegetarian and vegan products. A wide range of information, known as product master data, is needed to describe a food product. To ensure customers have access to this information, food manufacturers have generally had to enter the data separately for each individual product, as well as for each different retailer or e-commerce platform selling that product – a laborious task that was prone to error. Systrion AG takes a different approach with its Product Information Hub, which allows manufacturers to share product master data efficiently and accurately, all around the world. This state-of-the-art and scalable Software as a Service (SaaS) is based on Microsoft Azure.

title: Greggs serves up ease of management and modern security in a complex hybrid landscape with Azure Arc
executive_summary: The millions of Britons stopping by a neighborhood Greggs outlet for a tasty breakfast or lunch on the go probably never give a thought to the modern technologies behind the scenes at the bakery chain.
products: Azure, Azure Arc

title: Confluent delivers enhanced data privacy, opens new opportunities with Azure Private Link
executive_summary: For many organizations, operationalizing data at this level would require significant infrastructure expansion, but Confluent does that work for them by delivering a fully managed, cloud data-in-motion software as a service (SaaS) platform, built on Apache Kafka and more securely and optimally accessed with Microsoft Azure Private Link. To provide the value of cloud-backed, real-time data for risk-averse customers, particularly those in highly regulated industries or with other increased security requirements, Confluent uses Azure Private Link to help maintain the privacy and integrity of any customer’s digital network. It chose Private Link to help minimize the complexity of connecting virtual networks in the public cloud and simplify highly secure connectivity for all types of customers.
products: Azure, Azure Private Link, Azure Virtual Machines

title: CAE, Staffordshire University extend virtual patient simulations, drive better healthcare education with Azure
executive_summary: Simulation technology manufacturer CAE Healthcare is well known for its intelligent patient manikins, which mimic a real-life medical patient’s conditions, ailments, and responses to procedures. Despite the benefits of physical manikins, a new era of remote learning calls for an updated approach to healthcare education where groups can gather around a manikin without being in the same room. To meet this challenge and evolve its manikins and training services for a world after COVID-19, CAE Healthcare now offers virtual patient simulation with CAE Maestro Evolve. Through Microsoft Azure IoT Hub and Azure Functions, the new platform offers rich data insights and feedback on users’ performance to help identify priority growth areas and promote self-learning. Using CAE Maestro Evolve has helped CAE Healthcare customers like Staffordshire University push healthcare curriculum forward, allowing students, aspiring healthcare professionals, and instructors to learn and teach from anywhere, driving better patient outcomes.

title: Digitally connecting children with special needs to healthcare
executive_summary: During the COVID-19 lockdown in Sri Lanka, the MJF Charitable Foundation (MJFCF) needed an innovative solution to digitally connect their Multidisciplinary Team with children with special needs. MillenniumIT ESP's Microsoft Azure-based remote patient-management platform HealthVision powers the disABILITY app, designed in collaboration with MJFCF. The app enables the foundation to provide expert teletherapy and educational services to differently abled children and their caretakers. The app has the potential to reach the 17 million people worldwide with cerebral palsy (CP), as well as others with Down syndrome and other developmental disorders.
products: Azure

title: How the cloud is helping prevent CO2 emissions: Techem relies on Azure IoT for its measuring technology
executive_summary: Approximately 8.7 million metric tons of CO2—that’s how much Techem customers avoid producing every year by using the company’s devices and services. To continuously improve the energy efficiency of buildings, Techem relies in particular on connectivity and regular data collection. This is because furnishing customers with the required level of transparency and an awareness of their own energy consumption hinges on having a solid data corpus. Techum uses a variety of tools to evaluate this data, including the Azure cloud, Azure Data Explorer, and Azure IoT Hub.

title: Planzer migrates 200 servers to Microsoft Azure, saving time, space, and money
executive_summary: Planzer, one of the largest transportation and logistics companies in Switzerland, was operating outdated on-premises hardware. When the company decided that this costly system needed an upgrade, it turned to its Microsoft partners and the Azure platform. From the beginning of data collection to the last migrated server, Planzer moved 200 servers to Azure in about seven months.

title: ‘So much at stake’: National Forest Foundation heads to the cloud to grow its forest restoration mission
executive_summary: The National Forest Foundation is a nonprofit that works to preserve and protect wildlife habitat and forestry across the 193 million acres of the National Forest System. As the needs of the forests grow, so do the needs of the Foundation – requiring new technology solutions that are scalable, collaborative, and more efficient. Watch to learn more about how Microsoft Cloud for Nonprofit enables the National Forest Foundation to track donor dollars, quantify the impact of their work, and further its mission of environmental restoration and conservation.
products: Microsoft Graph, Planner, Microsoft Stream, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft To Do, Microsoft 365, OneNote, Power BI

title: Deutsche Börse Group manages complex data volumes with Azure cloud-native platform
executive_summary: As an innovative market infrastructure provider, Deutsche Börse Group deals with a large amount of reference data. To reduce complexity and redundancies in hosting this data, the company was looking for a partner that could help to manage this requirement. Deutsche Börse Group turned to Azure due to the Azure platform’s state-of-the-art data services, focus on security and regulatory compliance, seamless collaboration and guidance from Microsoft teams and Microsoft’s holistic enterprise scale ecosystem for all data management. Since the introduction of the Azure cloud-native data platform, Deutsche Börse Group experiences a faster time to market, with a minimal delay, SLA-backed storing and processing of large data assets as well as higher business continuity and reliance through their Azure-based infrastructure.

title: DEKRA is transforming its cloud and relying completely on Microsoft Azure and the Cloud Adoption Framework
executive_summary: In early 2020, DEKRA, an expert organization with a worldwide mission, took a critical look at its global IT. Based on the findings, it decided to centralize its IT and adopt a hybrid strategy to standardize it. For cloud services, it turned to Microsoft Azure. DEKRA operates primarily in sensitive and regulated markets, so with the support of Microsoft Consulting Services and members of the Microsoft Partner Network, it created a governance structure based on the Cloud Adoption Framework (CAF) and put it in place for a secure digital transformation.

title: Royal Bank of Canada speeds innovation on-premises with DBaaS based on Azure Arc-enabled data services
executive_summary: In the highly regulated and competitive world of financial services, Canada’s largest bank, Royal Bank of Canada (RBC), takes a rigorous approach to technology. A thoughtful mix of public cloud, private cloud, and on-premises resources allows the bank to consistently deliver innovative digital experiences and to earn their clients’ trust. However, Azure hybrid cloud solutions have given RBC a new way to think about its operational and data landscape. Azure Arc–enabled data services are powering a faster app pipeline and helping RBC to deliver on a long-desired IT promise—on-premises database as a service (DBaaS).
products: Azure Arc, Azure Machine Learning

title: Bahia Principe Hotels & Resorts deploys analytical system with AI models
executive_summary: Bahia Principe Hotels & Resorts collaborated with Luce Innovative Technologies to implement artificial intelligence (AI) models for classifying potential customers via site navigation data and predicting the probability of turning those users into buyers. Based on Microsoft Azure and Power BI, the implementation enabled the creation of an infrastructure capable of supporting the training of the AI models through analysis of large volumes of data. The obtained data is made available within optimal response times to maximize user experience while also increasing efficiency in marketing campaigns.
products: Azure App Service, Azure Web Application Firewall, Power BI

title: Kinetica drives digital transformation through data with Azure as a service
executive_summary: Even though organizations that use IoT are generating vast quantities of data, making sense of it remains a hurdle. That’s where Kinetica excels. The analytics database company provides services for analyzing massive amounts of temporal and geospatial data. By providing Kinetica as a service on Microsoft Azure, the company no longer has to worry about scarce talent and resources and can instead focus on performing some of the most complex IoT use cases in the world—from telecommunications to Santa Claus.

title: Support Black Charities bridges data silos to serve better with GiveLife365
executive_summary: Support Black Charities (SBC), a Canadian incorporated nonprofit based in Ontario, is trusteed by CAMDA Sports Foundation Canada and holds an official federal charitable status. Dedicated to uplifting of the black community globally, SBC connects black community-based organizations with supporters in the black community and allies. With operations spread across three different systems, SBC's old process for managing membership was manual, tedious, and time-consuming. SBC worked with GiveLife365 to address data silos and enable the nonprofit through a more consistent, responsive, and efficient approach to constituent communications.
products: Azure, Power Apps, Power BI

title: Blue Cube Travel's migration to Azure transports its business to new places
executive_summary: Blue Cube Travel, a corporate travel-management company based in the United Kingdom, had been relying on custom-designed analytics tools to deliver value to their customers. But Blue Cube Travel’s legacy technology wasn’t positioning them for a bright future. In response, Northdoor Plc worked closely with the company to migrate their legacy on-premises systems to Microsoft Azure. Northdoor implemented a carefully planned strategy that addressed the travel company’s critical requirements. The work involved migration from local servers, security enhancements, and upgrades of Blue Cube’s servers, networking, and phone system.
products: Azure

title: relayr optimizes elevator maintenance with Azure Machine Learning and IoT
executive_summary: Elevators today are able to transport passengers and loads at speeds of 60 or even over 70 km/h—and they cover longer daily distances than many cars. This makes thorough maintenance essential, but that involves a lot of time, effort, and expense. This is where remote monitoring and predictive maintenance, i.e., the use of artificial intelligence (AI) to help determine the future need for maintenance, come into play. Hardly any other market segment benefits as much from these technologies as the operation and servicing of elevators. relayr, a subsidiary of Munich Re, draws on Microsoft Azure services for its remote monitoring solution for elevators. The cloud architecture provides relayr with a blueprint for solutions in all kinds of projects.
products: Azure, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Event Hubs, Azure IoT Hub, Azure Stream Analytics, Power BI, Azure Machine Learning

title: Machine translation speaks Volkswagen – in 60 languages
executive_summary: The Volkswagen Group serves customers worldwide and delivers a vast range of documents in over 60 languages. Up to two billion words and documents must be translated within the Volkswagen Group every year, and the volume is rising. New communication streams and new demands regarding translation turnaround times meant that existing translation systems needed to be enhanced and expanded. Volkswagen turned to Azure AI, which offers a faster, more precise, and more cost-effective solution, with more advanced learning capabilities.

title: Singapore tech company leverages Azure to bring swift digital solutions
executive_summary: CumulusPro develops business applications to help companies accelerate digital transformation that optimizes business efficiency while reducing costs and time to market. The company decided to be cloud-native from the start and built its business process management platform—Straatos—entirely on Microsoft Azure. Today, CumulusPro offers agility, availability, and security to customers around the globe by leveraging its strategic partnership with Microsoft.

title: USC Shoah Foundation taps Azure Blob Storage to help preserve its archive in perpetuity
executive_summary: Few organizations do work as vital and important for humanity as USC Shoah Foundation – The Institute for Visual History and Education (USC Shoah Foundation). The Institute was established in 1994 by filmmaker Steven Spielberg, after his experiences directing his acclaimed film Schindler’s List. As Holocaust survivors visited Spielberg on set, he recognized the necessity and urgency of recording as many firsthand survivor accounts as possible. The organization quickly set up offices around the world and, over several years, conducted as many as 12,000 interviews a year, amassing a total of 52,000 testimonies for its original collection, which has since expanded to more than 55,000.
customer: USC Shoah Foundation – The Institute for Visual History and Education
products: Azure, Azure Monitor, Azure Storage

title: Chevron’s Supply Chain Cloud Transformation
executive_summary: The immediate priority of the SCDF project was to replace the existing legacy on-premise data platform with an equivalent data platform deployed in Microsoft Azure. The Publicis Sapient Product & Data Engineering team partnered with Chevron CSCM to build a new Platform as a Service (PaaS) solution in Azure to deliver on this vision. The new platform was deployed in production using Microsoft Project to coordinate the ‘cutover’, a carefully sequenced set of steps to ensure that the project is deployed simultaneously with all data publishers and consumers reconnecting to the new platform.

title: Startup Trelent speeds source code documentation by 4x with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Trelent uses cutting-edge AI algorithms to provide intelligent source code documentation for its clients. Although the company is relatively new, Trelent has found its audience: high-growth startup and enterprise tech companies that need quality documentation to onboard new engineers. To scale its solution and accommodate the data security and residency needs of enterprise customers around the globe, Trelent chose to migrate its solution to Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service. After a smooth transition, Trelent has seen promising returns, including significant improvement in response time thanks to distributed regions in Azure.
products: Azure, Azure AI Services, Azure Operator Call Protection

title: Munich Re gains speed and performance with SAP on Azure to drive innovation
executive_summary: Serious expertise and sound decision making are required to thrive in the insurance industry, as Germany-based Munich Re can attest. Over its 140-year history, the company has secured and maintained its position as a world-leading provider of reinsurance, primary insurance, and risk-related solutions because of its unmatched ability to assess risk and its rock-solid financial standing. Staying ahead of the competition requires more than just expertise, though. What makes Munich Re really stand out is its capacity to continuously innovate, such as pursuing emerging markets like digital risk, renewable energy, and space exploration, or taking a leadership role in the transformation of the insurance industry. To enhance its ability to innovatively respond to emerging business requirements and pivot, develop, and deliver solutions more rapidly, Munich Re migrated its SAP environment to the Microsoft Cloud. It’s now leading from the inside out with SAP on Azure.

title: Email cybersecurity specialist SMX boosts cost savings and security while improving customer experience with Azure
executive_summary: As the saying goes, reputation is everything—it takes a long time to build and only a short time to lose. This is particularly apt for email cybersecurity provider SMX, given the ever-increasing frequency and sophistication of email cybersecurity threats. When you’re scanning and delivering millions of emails a month, reliability, reputation, and long-term usage and buildup of reputable IP addresses are vital core assets enabling business success.

title: South London Partnership innovates with Azure & the IoT to protect and better serve its residents
executive_summary: The South London Partnership (SLP) is a sub-regional collaboration of five London boroughs: Croydon, Kingston upon Thames, Merton, Richmond upon Thames and Sutton. With a combined population of 1.2 million people, the borough is home to 60,000 active businesses and supports 500,000 jobs.

title: Ernie Green raises security scores in identity management, Azure, and Office 365 by 30% with a new data foundation implemented by Core BTS
executive_summary: Ernie Green Industries (Ernie Green) broke down data silos by migrating to Microsoft Azure. The Tier 1 automotive supplier, which has a 40-year history of collaboration with prominent auto manufacturers, wanted to remain competitive in the new data-driven market. The company’s siloed and aging data infrastructure made it difficult for decision makers to get a high-level view of company operations and work efficiently. So Ernie Green launched a digital transformation on Azure with support from Microsoft partner Core BTS and migrated datacenter infrastructure across nine locations to a single cloud solution. Now company data is accessible and secure, and employees have cut monthly financial closing processes from a few weeks to a few hours.
products: Azure, Azure Backup, Azure IoT Hub, Azure Monitor, Azure Site Recovery, Microsoft 365, OneDrive for Business, Microsoft Entra ID, SQL Server, SharePoint

title: Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission uses Microsoft Azure to preserve the state for future generations
executive_summary: In 2019, the Florida state legislature passed HB-5301, also known as the “cloud bill,” mandating that state agencies migrate from on-premises data centers to the cloud for their network infrastructure and telecom communication needs. This meant that the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission (FWC) would need to find a cloud partner that could help them modernize while also meeting the information technology needs of an important state entity. With Microsoft Azure providing a platform that enabled them to build scalable websites and web workloads, and drive innovation for existing and future apps, as well as being Criminal Justice Information Services (CJIS)-compliant, Microsoft was the right choice.
customer: Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission
products: Azure

title: Wibmo strengthens security posture with Zero Trust powered by Microsoft
executive_summary: Wibmo is a full-stack PayTech company delivering state-of-the-art solutions to make digital payments simple, secure, and fast. It is an industry leader in emerging markets and offers solutions for mobile payments, fraud and risk management, prepaid services, and a host of merchant and acquiring services. Wibmo holds PCI DSS, PCI-3DS, PCI-SSLC, ISO 27001, ISO 27701, GDPR, and SOC 2 certifications for security and privacy. Founded in Cupertino, CA, in 1999 and a subsidiary of PayU, Wibmo has strategic partnerships with over 160+ banks across 30+ countries. Furthermore, it is the largest authentication service provider in India, which is one of the world's leading digital payment markets.
products: Microsoft 365 E5

title: Mexico’s Supreme Court of Justice of the Nation provides the public with digital access to the court’s historical documents with the help of Azure
executive_summary: Mexico's Supreme Court, the Supreme Court of Justice of the Nation (SCJN), digitized millions of physical files and built a legal search engine for the public using language models created with artificial intelligence and Azure cognitive services.
customer: Supreme Court of Justice of the Nation
products: Azure, Azure AI Services, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Databricks, Azure Machine Learning

title: The State of New Mexico builds a secure, modernized IT foundation for 76 government agencies using Microsoft 365
executive_summary: The Department of Information Technology (DoIT) for the State of New Mexico worked alongside 76 state agencies to standardize its software and collaborative abilities by going all in on Microsoft 365. Recognizing a need to support cross-agency collaboration and modernize its infrastructure, DoIT kicked off a statewide digital transformation. In less than four months, DoIT onboarded 20,000 employees to Microsoft 365, streamlining user management and strengthening state agencies’ security postures. With a common IT framework, the State of New Mexico now provides equitable access to modern solutions for its employees so that they can deliver critical public services more efficiently.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Entra, Microsoft Entra ID Governance, Microsoft Defender, SharePoint

title: Nottinghamshire County Council strikes the right balance of governance and innovation with Microsoft Teams Phone
executive_summary: Nottinghamshire County Council consolidated its telephony contracts and infrastructure into a single solution and chose to migrate to Microsoft Teams, working closely with the FastTrack team and leveraging its Unified Support contract. Governance and efficiency have improved. Teams Phone and Teams Rooms are facilitating true hybrid working. The council is now well-placed to pursue further innovation and digitalisation.

title: Alabama Appellate Courts System transforms and modernizes judicial operations with Azure
executive_summary: On a mission to become one of the most modern courts in the nation, the Alabama Appellate Courts System (AACS) needed to digitize justice systems to accelerate secure and transparent proceedings. AACS is in the process of migrating many of its on-premises operations to a more secure cloud environment on Microsoft Azure. With this unified solution, justices, employees, and 6,000 outside attorneys benefit from remote access, more efficient operations, and improved security.
products: Azure, Microsoft Entra, Microsoft Entra ID Governance, Microsoft Sentinel, Microsoft Defender

title: The State of Alaska innovates to make digital government services more resilient and accessible by migrating to Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The State of Alaska completed the initial phase of a large-scale migration, expanding access to digital services for constituents. Alaska overcame legacy on-premises infrastructure by contracting with Microsoft to enhance modernization, security, and workforce development. This catalyzed the state’s rapid digital transformation and migration to Microsoft Azure. Alaska actioned a “migrate and modernize” pattern that has empowered its teams to focus on high-value efforts, not costly hardware replacement and service remediation. After migrating 700 applications and one-third of its infrastructure in just three months, Alaska is facilitating innovation and expanding access to secure government services—all while optimizing costs.

title: Maldives streamlines governance and boosts sustainability via Microsoft 365
executive_summary: In the sun-drenched Maldives, a nation of over 1000 islands, technology is a lifeline that brings communities together. Three years ago, the Ministry of Environment, Climate Change, and Technology wanted to ensure that each island was seamlessly connected to the government and its array of services. Collaborating with a long-time ally Microsoft, the Ministry unified all government entities onto one digital platform. This brought enhanced security, cost savings, and real-time collaboration among 20,000 public servants. Digitization has also strengthened the government’s ties to the public, building trust.
customer: Ministry of Environment, Climate Change, and Technology
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams

title: PwC delivers the human-led tech-powered future of auditing with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) is a leader in the professional services sector and it’s a long-time technology innovator. With Next Generation Audit, PwC aims to usher in a new era of audit that is human-led, tech-powered, and data-driven. PwC is exploring how the generative AI capabilities from Azure OpenAI Service running on Azure global infrastructure can support a vision that includes: increased audit efficiency and transparency; reduction of unnecessary audit burden on clients; and enhanced data acquisition and utilization. PwC has a focus on relevant data regulations and compliance protocols, as well as robust data security supported by Microsoft.

title: Unum Group builds custom AI application to search 1.3 terabytes of data with 95% accuracy using Microsoft Azure generative AI solutions
executive_summary: Unum Group, an international provider of workplace benefits and services, is using Microsoft Azure solutions to support its mission of helping the working world thrive. The company sought to modernize the manual, time-consuming process of retrieving policy information for inquiries within AskUnum, its client support center. Using Azure OpenAI Service and other Azure offerings, Unum Group developed an AI-powered solution to streamline retrieval. The solution reduced response times to four to five seconds, significantly improving the client experience team’s efficiency and client satisfaction. Unum Group’s collaboration with Microsoft exemplifies its commitment to delivering modern, reliable services, setting the stage for future innovation.
products: Azure, Azure AI Search, Azure AI Studio, Microsoft 365, Word

title: Teranet saves millions moving to Azure and Azure Red Hat OpenShift
executive_summary: Teranet, a land titles and statutory registry services company, wanted to increase agility, scalability, and its technological capabilities by embracing a full digital transformation over a straightforward technology upgrade.
products: Azure, Azure Red Hat OpenShift

title: PTC improves operational efficiency with migration to Azure Database for PostgreSQL
industry: At scale software, data and platforms
executive_summary: To continue improvements in performance and scalability, better optimize database sizing and costs, and position itself for advanced innovation, PTC needed better standardization and control over its deployment automation.
products: Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure Database Migration Service, Azure, Microsoft Defender, Azure Database for PostgreSQL, Azure Monitor, Linux Virtual Machines

title: Enate leverages Azure OpenAI to transform operations for enterprises
executive_summary: Enate needed to help enterprises operationalise AI effectively, ensuring scalability, agility, and data security for enterprise workflows.
products: Azure OpenAI Service, Azure

title: Pegasus Airlines transforms bookings and services with Azure OpenAI, doubling customer satisfaction scores
executive_summary: Pegasus Airlines aimed to upskill its employees and discover ways AI could streamline operations and make travel more attainable for everyone.
products: Azure OpenAI Service, Azure AI Services

title: JLL transforms real estate with Azure AI Services, delivering a year’s worth of insights in a week
executive_summary: Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL) helps its clients manage, lease, and invest in real estate. JLL’s business intelligence solutions varied in scale and applicability, resulting in inconsistent client experiences and dependence on costly data processes.

title: Aon improves customer data security by leveraging Azure SQL Managed Instance with Microsoft Entra
executive_summary: Aon saw an opportunity to modernize secure access for its most important Microsoft SQL Server database. By moving to Microsoft Azure, Aon streamlined and automated how services accounts are authenticated and allowed access to its data.
products: Azure Key Vault, Azure Kubernetes Service, Microsoft Entra, Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Managed Instance

title: Bucher Municipal develops an AI chatbot based on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Old documentation that wasn’t available in digital form often seriously delayed processes. Bucher Municipal needed a solution to quickly make maintenance data available for various vehicle models.

title: TalkTalk Group dials in digital transformation with Dynamics 365 Finance
executive_summary: TalkTalk Group replaced its aging Microsoft Dynamics AX 2012 system with Dynamics 365 Finance to address fragmented systems, outdated processes, and drive efficiencies and cost savings while improving controls to meet UK government requirements.

title: Miami Dade College boosts student pass rates by 15% with Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: Miami Dade College (MDC) aimed to transform education by enhancing student engagement, improving faculty efficiency and equipping students with workforce-ready skills to succeed in an increasingly AI-driven world.

title: Global Objects is revolutionizing how we experience the world with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Global Objects creates photoreal images by scanning real world landscapes and objects across the globe. This work requires a cloud provider with 1) robust computing power and storage with global reach and 2) exceptional scalability.
products: Azure, Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Virtual Network

title: Skylark Group serves up better dining experiences with generative AI and Azure OpenAI
executive_summary: The Skylark Group embraces IT initiatives, including cat-shaped robot waiters, to enhance its restaurants. However, having also lost valuable customer contact opportunities, it turned to generative AI to complement human workers.
products: Azure AI Content Safety, Azure API Management, Azure App Service, Azure Application Gateway, Azure Functions, Azure Monitor, Azure Synapse Analytics, Microsoft Entra ID, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure OpenAI Service

title: LlamaIndex partners with Microsoft Azure to power the future of AI-forward data solutions
executive_summary: LlamaIndex needed a secure way to connect enterprise data to LLMs and chose Azure OpenAI for privacy, seamless integration, and scalability.
products: Azure OpenAI Service, Azure AI Search, Azure Managed Identity Services, Azure

title: Brisbane Catholic Education boosts agency and efficiency with Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: To combat staff workload, Brisbane Catholic Education piloted Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat while a 13+ preview pushed student learning further.
products: Microsoft 365 Copilot Chat, Microsoft 365 Copilot

title: AvePoint enhances hiring, cutting production time up to 66% and more with Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: AvePoint sought to enhance productivity, streamline operations and improve customer support efficiency while maintaining the highest standards of security and governance.

title: Aditya Birla Capital brings down generative AI operating costs by 40% with Azure
executive_summary: Financial services provider Aditya Birla Capital has a massive market presence with more than 40 million customers, nine business lines, and multiple business functions. It wanted to streamline the business and deliver a more connected customer experience using generative AI.
products: Microsoft Entra External ID, Dynamics 365 Fraud Protection

title: Fujitsu is revolutionizing sales efficiency with Azure AI Agent Service
executive_summary: Fujitsu evaluated Azure AI Agent Service to automate sales proposal creation.
products: Azure AI Search, Azure AI Foundry

title: Cognition developed an AI engineer that transforms enterprise software with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Cognition needed a scalable, enterprise-ready platform to support its AI software engineer and enable integration with developer tools and go-to-market support for large customers like Visma.
products: Azure, GitHub Copilot, Microsoft commercial marketplace

title: Navigate BioPharma streamlines drug development with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Navigate BioPharma, a Novartis subsidiary, uses Dynamics 365 Project Operations and Sales to streamline drug development and clinical trials, integrating LabVantage LIMS and SharePoint for better efficiency and visibility.
products: Dynamics 365 Project Operations, Dynamics 365 Sales, Power BI, SharePoint, Azure, Azure Service Bus

title: Capita empowers its employees to innovate using Copilot Agents
executive_summary: As a tech-driven leader in its industry, Capita is exploring AI to enhance its internal operations, employee experience, and to create better outcomes for clients.

title: Elanco enhances its security posture and reduces response times by approximately 50% using Security Copilot and Defender Experts for XDR
executive_summary: Elanco wanted to streamline its architecture and improve the reliability and efficiency of the technology foundation for its crucial in-house drug discovery work.
products: Azure, Microsoft Defender for Cloud, Microsoft 365, Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Sentinel, Microsoft Security Copilot, Azure OpenAI, Microsoft Purview Information Protection

title: Democratizing robotics: How KUKA is making automation accessible with Azure and AI
executive_summary: KUKA wanted to reduce the complexity and time required for programming their robots to address a growing skills gap and accelerate project timelines.

title: HSL improves code security and provides better services to its customers with GitHub Advanced Security for Azure DevOps
executive_summary: HSL runs regional transport in the Helsinki area, accounting for about 60% of public transport journeys in Finland. Most of its revenue comes from ticket sales via its HSL app, yet among geopolitical pressures and growing threats, the company recently realized it needed better security for it.

title: TeamSystem drives business transformation with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: As TeamSystem continued to scale across Italy and internationally, it needed to streamline business processes and enhance automation to improve efficiency, drive innovation, and achieve a higher return on investment.
products: Microsoft Power Platform, Power Apps, Microsoft Copilot Studio

title: Connecting with 500 million passionate fans worldwide
executive_summary: With 500 million fans worldwide, the Real Madrid Football Club is among the world’s top sports franchises. But with just a small fraction of those fans in Spain, it needed a way to connect with them—wherever they are in the world—and support their club passion. To accomplish that goal, Real Madrid engaged a Microsoft Services team for help in envisioning, developing, and deploying a global digital sports platform that was built using a wide range of Microsoft cloud services. It takes advantage of the global footprint of Microsoft cloud services to consistently deliver the very best fan experience anywhere in the world. Real Madrid can now engage one-on-one with fans, implement targeted promotional campaigns, and use data to track and analyze fan behaviors, among many other capabilities. Today, club officials report digital revenue growth of 30 percent and could not be more positive about the club’s digital future.

title: The Allscripts prescription for agility: lift and shift to the cloud
executive_summary: Allscripts is a leading healthcare software manufacturer, serving physician practices, hospitals, health plans, and Big Pharma. To transform its applications frequently and host them securely and reliably, Allscripts has started to use Microsoft Azure. In just three weeks, the company lifted and shifted dozens of acquired applications running on 1,000 virtual machines to Azure. Allscripts also develops software in Azure and realizes dramatic time-to-market gains and savings by using the Azure platform as a service offering.

title: Nordic insurer guarantees DevOps quality with cloud-based monitoring and governance
executive_summary: If Insurance is a leading Northern European property and casualty policy provider with nearly three dozen DevOps teams. The company found that its centralized monitoring group was struggling to keep up with the needs of all its development groups, so If started delivering Monitoring as a Service with Microsoft Azure Monitor. Combined with other tools like Azure Security Center, If now has a robust, developer-friendly solution for monitoring and governing its cloud and on-premises systems.

title: Sharing the stories of a human rights museum around the world with Microsoft Azure Stack HCI solutions
executive_summary: The Canadian Museum for Human Rights works to engage people all over the world in the human rights conversation, promoting respect and dialogue through education and its thought-provoking installations. To make its content available to people globally, the Winnipeg, Manitoba, institution offers a rich media storytelling experience online. It also optimizes its onsite installations with interactive digital experiences. The museum uses a hybrid hyperconverged infrastructure (HCI) with Microsoft Azure Stack HCI solutions to establish the wholly software-defined datacenter it envisioned for maximum security and efficiency.

title: Forever 21 moves to Microsoft Azure, registers record-breaking holiday revenues
executive_summary: Keeping up with fast fashion is never easy. But at Forever 21, organizing 200 new items a day and conducting online and in-store sales in more than 50 countries bring some unique challenges. To modernize its infrastructure and deal more easily with peaks in demand, the retailer turned to Microsoft Azure. Before long, Forever 21 was using new levels of scalability to break revenue records over the 2018 holiday season.
products: Azure, Azure Virtual Machines, SQL Server, Windows Server

title: Cognition developed an AI engineer that transforms enterprise software with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Cognition needed a scalable, enterprise-ready platform to support its AI software engineer and enable integration with developer tools and go-to-market support for large customers like Visma.
