To modernize its infrastructure and deal more easily with peaks in demand, the retailer turned to Microsoft Azure. Before long, Forever 21 was using new levels of scalability to break revenue records over the 2018 holiday season.

title: Icertis automates scaling, reduces costs by 70%, meets customer demand around the clock
executive_summary: Icertis solves the hardest contract management problems for some of the world’s biggest organizations. But difficult-to-predict daily spikes in customer workload demand made it complex, expensive, and time-consuming to scale its database estate using a custom-built solution. By moving to the Microsoft Azure SQL Database serverless compute tier, Icertis can now rely on automatic, near-instant rescaling of database compute resources to immediately accommodate its customers’ changing and often unpredictable workload patterns. In making the move, the company cut its database costs by nearly 70 percent.
products: Azure, Azure SQL Database

title: PureFacts extracts financial insights in seconds and calculates fees more accurately with AI
executive_summary: PureFacts helps wealth management firms retain investors, manage risk, maintain compliance, and run operations better and faster with AI-powered solutions—empowering its customers to provide more personalized experiences for their investors at scale. The company built its “Insights as a Service” platform on Microsoft Azure. It uses machine learning to reduce client attrition, extract financial insights in seconds, and catch 80 percent of fee billing data anomalies with 90 percent accuracy.

title: Provincial government goes digital to spark proactive civic engagement
executive_summary: Gauteng is among the smallest but most densely populated South African provinces, yet its government is spearheading digital innovation both within the state and internationally. Overseeing 13 departments, the institution serves more than 10 million citizens each day. To provide them with easier access and higher quality of civic services, the Gauteng Provincial Government (GPG) has embarked on a digital transformation journey, working with Microsoft and a local technology partner, building an online citizen platform based on Azure PaaS, Dynamics 365 CE, and Office 365.

title: ENGIE brings AI to renewable energy platform, helps decarbonize energy production with Azure
executive_summary: Renewable energy assets connected by the Internet of Things (IoT)—such as wind turbines and solar arrays—create huge amounts of useful data on everything from performance and output to maintenance issues. But processing and making sense of all this data requires serious performance and scalability. When power provider ENGIE modernized its Darwin operational performance software with Microsoft Azure Time Series Insights and Azure IoT Edge, it delivered AI-driven analytics and scalable data management capabilities to optimize power generation and asset management, helping to decarbonize its global energy production.

title: Oman Data Park helps customers meet data regulations, cuts its operating costs by 52 percent, and attracts 10 percent more customers by implementing Azure Stack Hub
executive_summary: As a premier datacenter provider in Oman and one of the largest, Oman Data Park needed a way to provide cloud services to companies while helping them adhere to the country’s data sovereignty regulation. By implementing Microsoft Azure Stack Hub, the managed services provider not only achieved its primary goals, but also opened entirely new markets for its business. In six months, the company expanded its customer base by 10 percent and cut operating costs in half. Oman Data Park also reduced deployment time by 75 percent.
products: Azure, Azure Stack

title: Video streaming company boosts critical decision-making insights with Azure Stack Edge
executive_summary: Haivision provides the video streaming technology that customers in public safety, disaster relief, defense, and professional sports use for real-time situational awareness. The company uses AI to process real-time video in the cloud, but customers in remote locations often have bandwidth constraints that limit image quality and reduce the insights created by AI in the cloud. Haivision decided to use Microsoft Azure Stack Edge to bring cloud technologies to the edge of the virtual and physical worlds. Now, it can give customers everywhere fast, reliable access to the intelligence they need to make critical decisions.

title: 3M manufacturing plant uses data analytics to increase efficiency and cost savings with Azure SQL Edge
executive_summary: 3M produces more than 60,000 products in its Safety and Industrial, Transportation and Electronics, Healthcare, and Consumer Business Groups. At one of its US manufacturing plants, the 3M Corporate Research Lab partnered with the local 3M Manufacturing team and identified an opportunity to predict anomalies and then use those insights to reduce manufacturing downtime. They proposed integrating data streams from two production lines, correlating them, and then running analytics and machine learning locally. Because the data came from two systems that arrive at different times, and because the plant’s network connectivity was limited, the team determined that building a custom module with Microsoft Azure SQL Edge deployed through Microsoft Azure IoT Edge would give the performance, management, and security needed. With this new edge capability deployed, the resulting faster and more streamlined processes will allow 3M to identify a manufacturing line’s problems in advance, thus providing both operational efficiency and cost savings benefits.

title: Nederlandse Spoorwegen makes commuting by bike more reliable with Azure Machine Learning
executive_summary: As the Netherland’s biggest national provider of railway services, Nederlandse Spoorwegen’s mission is to make the entire country accessible by public transport, while making commutes more sustainable and improving the wellbeing of its customers. Running a reliable service is crucial to achieving this.

title: OKCFD transforms operations with Power Apps, achieving 40% reduction in manual tasks
executive_summary: OKCFD's legacy systems were causing delays in critical tasks, impacting their ability to respond swiftly to emergencies. Manual workflows for inspections, checks, and logging were inefficient and prone to errors. The department needed a unified, digital solution to streamline operations and enhance service delivery.

title: Shree Digvijay Cement leverages Microsoft Dynamics 365 to modernize its sales operations
executive_summary: Shree Digvijay Cement is a pioneer in cement manufacturing with a legacy of eight decades. It markets cement under the trade name ‘Kamal Cement’ in various districts across Gujarat and also exports its specialty cement to many countries in the world.
products: Dynamics 365

title: Zensar creates Brand Center for its workforce integrating Viva Connections with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Zensar Technologies Ltd is an Indian multinational software and services company. It has offices in 33 global locations and 10,000+ employees.

title: H&M Group strikes an effective balance of Power Platform development and security
executive_summary: H&M Group is a Swedish multinational clothing-retail company with more than 5,000 stores in 78 countries and more than 53 online markets. A growing community of citizen developers has created thousands of Power Platform solutions across the company. To support development and maintain security and governance, H&M Group set up a Center of Excellence (CoE) using the Microsoft Power Platform Center of Excellence Starter Kit.

title: St. Luke’s University Health Network prescribes proactive, unified protection with Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: St. Luke’s University Health Network practices data security the way it practices medicine—it constantly drives improvement with a future-oriented approach. Its growing network of hospitals and hundreds of St. Luke’s Physician Group practices might present a security challenge, but the St. Luke’s IT security team has a remedy ready. It uses Microsoft Security solutions for a unified strategy that reduces the vendor footprint, lowers costs, and continually sharpens data security.

title: Rabobank grows a safer global IT landscape with Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: With agricultural and food industry clients around the world, Rabobank has a widespread IT estate to protect. The bank’s mission of “Growing a better world together” hinges on a blend of innovation and strong ethical principles. For the Rabobank Cyber Defense Center, that means securing a vast and disparate hybrid, multicloud environment. Not content to merely keep up, Rabobank rolled out Microsoft Security solutions to implement proactive, effective security and compliance—all while optimizing cost and security team productivity.

title: Sustainable jeans and sneakers manufacturer chooses Microsoft 365 to stay one step ahead
executive_summary: When you wear a pair of 1083 jeans or sneakers, you know exactly where the fabric was dyed, where the seams were sewn, and where the shoelaces were made. The goal of 1083 is to create clothing that looks great and contributes to a circular economy, an approach that prioritizes recycling and reusing materials to combat waste, all while creating new jobs by supporting the textile industry close to home. “1083 is the distance between the two most distant cities in France,” explains Thomas Huriez, President of 1083. “Our mission is to manufacture jeans and sneakers at a distance of less than 1,083 kilometers from our customers.”

title: Morgan Sindall drives customer engagement across eight businesses with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Morgan Sindall Group PLC is a leading construction and regeneration company working across multiple sectors in the United Kingdom with a small operation based in Switzerland. At the heart of its operations is a focus on good customer service and putting the client first. To ensure it could continue to meet the needs of its customers, the company used Microsoft Dynamics 365 to create a centralized platform for customer service, sales, and field-service management. The company now has complete visibility into customer journeys, can resolve issues and develop solutions faster, and has improved employee efficiency and satisfaction with modern tools and automation.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Windows 10, Microsoft Intune, Windows Autopilot, Surface Laptop, Surface Pro, Surface Studio, Windows 11

title: A Saudi family-owned group with a diversified business presence unifying legacy ERP systems, empowering and leading digital transformation.
executive_summary: Established in 1958, Ali Zaid Al Quraishi and Brothers Company (AZAQ) is a 100% family-owned group in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. Today, the group is a large diversified organisation with a presence in various sectors and a strong footprint across the nation. AZAQ has helped many multi-nationals enter the market including Fiat, Chrysler, United Biscuits, Red Bull and Microsoft. AZAQ takes pride in its Saudi roots and continues to build strategic business partnerships to contribute towards the Saudi Vision 2030. Their cumulative experience spanning over decades has enabled the group to have first-hand knowledge and experience across a range of sectors

title: Supporting sales internationalization through migration of the CRM system environment to the cloud
executive_summary:
Swiss company Hawa is expanding its sliding door solutions business worldwide. To optimally support this growth, the company needed new IT solutions. In Microsoft Dynamics, a tool was found that can optimally assist the sales support team in its work. By having all information accessible through a single tool, agents can engage more effectively with customers.
In ORBIS, Hawa found a partner who could optimally support its changeover project, in particular the migration to the cloud. Actively involving all those affected and working together to develop a solution helped to ensure that the project was a resounding success for both sides.

title: Snoonu aims to become Qatar’s first unicorn. Microsoft Azure has been supporting them to achieve that goal
executive_summary: Snoonu, Qatar’s leading online food delivery app, harbours aspirations of becoming the first Qatari Super App and Unicorn. Snoonu’s exponential growth has thrown up challenges on the scalability and availability fronts. Their migration to Microsoft Azure solved these issues and even brought down operating costs. Today, they can scale horizontally and vertically using PaaS service of Azure.

title: Romanian bank upgrades employee experience with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Libra Internet Bank offers its customers one of Romania's most modern internet and mobile banking services. Even before the COVID-19 pandemic, the bank’s clients could already manage accounts without leaving their homes. However, at the beginning of the pandemic, Libra had yet to adjust effective remote working, aiming to expand communication between employees and to reach the next level of internal collaboration. To do this, the bank made online teamwork fully possible, by using Microsoft Teams and Microsoft 365. Within a month, nearly 1,000 employees had transitioned to the cloud. Now, they can all collaborate on the go, work on their mobiles, and have reduced email load.

title: T-Mobile uses RPA in Power Automate to integrate systems during Sprint merger
executive_summary: During its merger, T-Mobile needed to integrate its Orbit app with Sprint’s legacy back-end system. It was experiencing challenges that could not be solved with legacy APIs: data latency, time-consuming manual processes, and data entry errors. T-Mobile turned to the robotic process automation capabilities in Power Automate to help the two systems operate as one.

title: Avromed unifies data sources with Microsoft 365 and Azure
executive_summary: Avromed is Azerbaijan’s largest importer of pharmaceutical products, with headquarters in Baku. The company’s mission is to provide healthcare institutions and the population of Azerbaijan with high-quality essential pharmaceuticals. To scale up its distribution, Avromed needed to manage and process large amounts of data effectively. It built a new data ecosystem based on Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365 to centralize collaboration and communication while relying on secure cloud storage and analytics. The team now has greater visibility across the organization with live reporting and effective data management, helping it stock and deliver much-needed products to customers across the country.

title: RMIT future-proofs the university-to-student connection with Microsoft Entra Verified ID
executive_summary: Widely regarded as a technology leader in the education space, the Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology (RMIT University) furthers cutting-edge technology through its IT programs. Its Blockchain Innovation Hub, which teams up with leading technology partners to perform projects for clients, offers innovation for internal projects as well. When RMIT wanted to create a convenient, groundbreaking student-credentialing system to keep alumni connected for life, the Blockchain Innovation Hub and project stakeholders unanimously chose to use Microsoft Entra Verified ID. The result: a pilot program that ingeniously solves three key use cases with one technology.

title: Dynamics 365 delivers an intelligence-led, predictive approach to service and operations for Wessex Water
executive_summary: The incumbent CRM system was aging, slow and difficult to use. It didn’t give a joined-up view of the customer or the operational realities that might affect the customer’s use of the service. The business began looking for a better system that could replace the tired, legacy solution. The water company chose to switch to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service, including Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service Insights with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service Professional. The improved view of the customer and the ease of use are helping the Wessex Water team to enhance the service it delivers to customers.

title: Restaurant operator Cravia centralizes and streamlines operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Headquartered in Dubai, Cravia is one of the fastest growing food and beverage (F&B) organizations in the region. With different brands and chains in its portfolio, Cravia needed to centralize its business processes and operations on a single platform. It streamlined its financial records and achieved more supply chain efficiencies by implementing Microsoft Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management and Finance and Operations. Using Microsoft Power platform, Cravia also boosted its workflow efficiency and data visibility. With reduced manual processes, human error, and dependencies, the company now has more freedom to grow.

title: Combining advanced technology and high-quality foods to address food deserts in underserved communities
executive_summary: In the planned community of Trilith, Georgia, Microsoft is providing foundational technology that’s helping Nourish + Bloom Market expand the availability of high-quality foods in a previously underserved community. Through a unique combination of advanced technology and a focus on human connections, the company is creating a seamless shopping experience customers love.

title: Rx.Health supports 6 million patient encounters with Microsoft security, analytics, and automation
executive_summary: Rx.Health is a pioneer in the use of digital solutions to improve patient care and enhance health. With big ideas and a lean team, the company sought productivity-forward solutions that take care of security and compliance so it can focus on healthcare innovation. That combination of inventiveness and collaboration has led to the company’s expanded partnership with Yale New Haven Health. Supporting approximately 6 million patients and 55 million messages per year, Rx.Health knows its customer data is safeguarded by a wide range of Microsoft Azure solutions and supported by Power BI data visualization tools.

title: Apex Group optimizes costs, safeguards data, and unlocks value with Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: Dedicated to helping its clients make sound decisions and build financial security, Apex Group strives to support the communities it serves. To achieve this, Apex Group needs an advanced, reliable, high-performance IT structure that includes comprehensive network and data security. Apex Group now scales with Azure Virtual Machines, running as many as 500 virtual machines to meet peak loads or as few as 20 when demand declines.

title: Good cooperation: How Borealis enables new sites to work safely
executive_summary:
The Austrian chemical company Borealis, headquartered in Vienna, is the world's eighth largest producer of polyethylene and polypropylene.
After acquiring new sites worldwide, a lot of time had to be invested in the past to adapt the local infrastructures to Borealis' compliance standards. New corporate partners had to be brought on board as easily as possible and a secure working environment had to be created quickly. For this, remote work was relied on with the help of Microsoft's Azure Virtual Desktop, thus saving not only hardware but also time. Instead of waiting for a Borealis device to be delivered, partners now only need a laptop - and gain access to the Borealis network.

title: Relias enhances data-driven training and reporting for health organizations with Power BI and Azure Synapse
executive_summary: Serving more than 11,000 healthcare organizations across the United States, Relias helps its clients measurably improve patient outcomes and advance healthcare talent. Customers use Relias solutions to retain staff, elevate care quality, and reduce risk. As a data-driven organization, Relias relies on analytics to help clients reach their goals. But with data spanning across multiple sources and hundreds of tables, and acquired technology platforms that required consolidation, Relias needed a centralized solution. Using Microsoft Power BI and Azure Synapse Analytics, the organization built a platform that generates actionable insights for its clients, helping to deliver life-saving healthcare education with greater speed, efficiency, and effectiveness.

title: QIAGEN’s digital solutions based on Microsoft Azure lead to faster results in medical diagnostics
executive_summary: An accurate diagnosis is essential to determining the right treatment for a disease. QIAGEN GmbH develops technologies that allow healthcare practitioners to make faster, more precise, and more comprehensive diagnoses. To do this, the company relies not only on physical tests, but also on innovative, digital solutions developed in Microsoft Azure. Flexible and affordable, this cloud platform helps QIAGEN achieve its vision of making improvements in life possible—all over the world.

title: Azure migration helps TomTom achieve high availability
executive_summary: Based in Amsterdam, TomTom boasts a global team of over 4,500 that make the location technologies relied upon by hundreds of millions of drivers, businesses, and governments. Their mission is to solve the world’s mobility challenges, with innovative solutions to help to address climate change, and reduce road-related accidents.

title: SSP Group serves up transformational change with Microsoft SharePoint
executive_summary: When I arrived, I inherited a very fragmented architecture. We had 35 different systems in 35 different countries and a lot of those systems were reaching end of life,” explains Mark Smith, Chief Digital & Technology Officer at SSP Group. “We had to face into that technology obsolescence. We could continue with the old way of doing things or we could do something transformative.”

title: O2 offers holistic customer service with Microsoft Surface Pro
executive_summary: As one of the leading mobile service providers in Slovakia, O2 serves its customers efficiently and in new ways. Its store business experts, store consultants, and technicians leverage the laptop and tablet functions of the Surface Pro to assist customers wherever they are. O2 employees also use the Surface Pen for paperless contract signing, so they can instantly process transactions and archive documents. As a result, the staff has become faster and less reliant on paper, making the company more efficient and sustainable.

title: Kier Group builds the future by pivoting to the cloud with Azure VMware Solution
executive_summary: Over the past decade, Kier found itself growing significantly, both organically and through acquisitions. The result of this growth was a highly distributed IT environment with several datacenters, numerous systems and applications, and multiple networks. To continue using the most innovative building approaches and cutting-edge technologies, however, Kier needed to modernize its digital infrastructure by migrating to the cloud. The company got there and is now realizing the power of the cloud with Microsoft Azure VMware Solution. With Azure VMware Solution, Kier was also able to migrate out of its datacenter environments and into the cloud easily, rapidly, and in a highly safe fashion without having to change applications or IP addresses.

title: Expanding MSC's capabilities with SQL Server 2022
executive_summary: MSC Mediterranean Shipping Company SA is the largest global container ship operator in the world. To manage 730 vessels across 260+ routes calling at 520 ports they rely on solid IT services including SQL Server. With SQL Server 2022, they are expanding their capabilities around availability, performance and security to better support a truly worldwide operation.

title: Dutch Financial Services Company, Rabobank, Creates Global Data Platform with Azure Synapse Analytics and Power BI
executive_summary: Rabobank is a cooperative bank focused on serving clients ranging from consumers and retailers to global agriculture companies. Traditionally, each time there was a request for data, Rabobank’s data team would build a singular solution that couldn’t be reutilized for other needs or use cases. Rabobank is determined to change this process and create scalable data platforms ready for the development of new, user-friendly solutions that can be reused, optimized, and scaled. To meet these needs, the Global Data Platform (GDP) was created to build a single “platform of truth” and a place where users can work with data owners to quickly get access to data to build dynamic and scalable solutions. With GDP, Rabobank has been able to break down the walls of their siloed data and applications and make data significantly more accessible across the board. Singular data touch points—information factories-- have increased speed to insights tremendously; data that once took months or years to prioritize are now readily available.

title: Raise your organization's awareness of the importance of data
executive_summary: Executive Summary

title: Celli Group transforms the beverage industry with powerful IoT solution
executive_summary: Celli Group’s dispensing equipment helps global beverage companies satisfy millions of people around the world every day. But Celli Group knew its customers couldn’t see critical information at the point of sale, such as product quality, equipment health, and sales. Celli Group recognized the Internet of Things as an opportunity to transform their business model while giving customers more visibility and control over their assets. Partnering with Microsoft and PTC, Celli Group created IntelliDraught—a connected beverage distribution system that turns retrofittable and Celli Group equipment into smart devices that unlock insights where beverages are dispensed. The solution improves quality, sales, service, and inventory management for Celli Group’s customers.

title: Zurich Insurance Group gives its business units a modern, flexible customer engagement solution with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Zurich Insurance Group (Zurich) is a global insurer serving people and businesses in more than 200 countries and territories. The corporate center of the company at Zurich headquarters is responsible for adopting new tools and technology strategies and pushing them out to the various business units (BUs) and countries. With each BU operating differently based on the unique needs of its target market or country, many BUs looked to optimize processes to be able to handle more and more customer data across a centralized and flexible CRM system.

title: University of Texas Medical Branch scales daily antibody testing capacity by 67x using Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The prestigious medical research center at the University of Texas Medical Branch (UTMB) expanded its antibody testing capability to 67 times its previous rate after adopting tools from Microsoft Azure. The laboratory team faced an unprecedented demand for antibody analysis with COVID-19 but had limited testing capacity. Determined to meet patient needs and lead scientific advancement, UTMB turned to Azure to develop an automated system that could control robotic operations, analyze testing data, and instantly deliver results to patient portals. Its groundbreaking approach took UTMB from 15 to 1,000 tests per day, minimized human contact with hazardous test samples, and further positioned it as a leading medical research institution.

title: Dutch railway builds real-time crowdedness app with Azure Cosmos DB
executive_summary: Dutch railway operator Nederlandse Spoorwegen strives to provide fast, safe, and affordable train travel throughout the Netherlands. It discovered that customer satisfaction depends, among other things, on a train’s level of crowdedness and the ability of passengers to find a seat. Building on Microsoft Azure, Azure Cosmos DB, and several other Azure services, Nederlandse Spoorwegen developed an application that delivers real-time crowdedness indicators and travel disruption alerts. Customers have enthusiastically adopted the solution, which also has the potential to improve resource utilization.

title: Amrita University begins Zero Trust journey by protecting identities with Azure AD and other Microsoft enterprise solutions
executive_summary: If you think of humanity’s intellectual endeavors as some of its most valuable riches, you’d probably consider universities to be treasure houses. Their vast reserves of research materials and new ideas might hold the answers to some of the world’s pressing problems. This analogy illustrates why Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham, a leading Indian university, scrupulously manages identities. It trusts Azure Active Directory to verify that people who access its data are who they say they are. The university is also on the path to deploy Microsoft Defender suite to advance its security journey and pave the way to a Zero Trust infrastructure.

title: UK retailer, Marks and Spencer, uses Azure Synapse Analytics and Power BI to drive powerful insights
executive_summary: Marks and Spencer (M&S) is a UK-based retailer that delivers food, clothing, home and beauty goods to more than 30 million customers around the world each year. Founded in 1884, the retailer now has over 1,400 stores across 57 countries and 100+ websites. Over the years, M&S has been known for product innovation and swiftly adapting to the ever-changing demands of its customers, and more recently prides itself on customer-focused digital innovation, prioritizing collaboration and technology to better serve its customers as a leading omnichannel retailer.

title: Yusen Logistics boosts its IT power with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Founded in 1955, Yusen Logistics (China) Co., Ltd. focuses on international air freight, sea freight, contract logistics, and targeted supply chain solutions. It currently operates in more than 350 cities in 47 countries and regions, with more than 600 distribution centers and offices, and it has nearly 25,000 employees around the world. Yusen Logistics China’s business covers 22 ports and inland cities across the country with 77 logistics distribution points.

title: DataPlatform with Microsoft Synapse and Databricks
executive_summary: Executive Summary

title: Bulutistan extends Azure services to local cloud with Azure Arc–enabled SQL Managed Instance
executive_summary: As one of the fastest-growing technology companies in Türkiye, Bulutistan is helping to enable its customers’ digital transformation while keeping data within the country’s borders. Bulutistan is turning to Azure Arc to provide its customers with Azure services while keeping data on-premises in accordance with the country’s data sovereignty laws. A recent proof of concept and pilot test of Azure Arc–enabled SQL Managed Instance in September 2022 convinced Bulutistan that it could extend the Azure services and security that its customers need to accelerate the pace of innovation and do more with less.

title: Teams and AI chatbots work together to create a streamlined digital helpdesk by leveraging query data
executive_summary: The adoption of "chatbots" that can automatically respond to user queries is accelerating across all businesses. While operational efficiencies and cost reductions are expected, the true value of this tool goes beyond that. The Business Support Department of the Business Innovation Division at Nippon Telegraph and Telephone East Corporation (NTT East) began business processes to improve the quality of human responses and share knowledge by integrating Microsoft Teams and AI chatbots. The company is taking the first step toward an effective digital experience by digitizing the familiar help desk response.

title: Grundfos extends its culture of learning to every area of its business with Microsoft Viva Learning
executive_summary: Grundfos began in a moment of self-directed learning. Nearly 80 years ago, a Danish blacksmith named Poul Due Jensen created a new, more efficient irrigation pump in his basement and started the business that would become Grundfos, a heritage manufacturing company. To this day, the company maintains a culture of learning, even as it’s grown to 20,000 global employees and expanded the scope of its products and services.

title: Strauss Group gears up to revolutionize the food industry using Azure cloud-enabled data
executive_summary: Food and beverage manufacturer Strauss Group is working to make an impact on the world through food. Yoram Sadan, Vice President, Group Chief Information Officer and Digital Officer at Strauss Group, knew that investing in technology and cloud infrastructure was essential to take Strauss’s vision to the next level and connect its many offices across the globe. With Microsoft, Strauss didn’t just find a service provider, but rather a technology partner with a shared vision of the future.

title: EyeMail brings innovation to email marketing, grows 71 percent in two years with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Delivering an effective marketing message through email has always been challenging, but email remains a preferred channel to communicate with customers. EyeMail Inc. technology helps organizations overcome this challenge and build a connection with their customers through videos that automatically play in email messages. The videos increase engagement and deliver storytelling moments in the inbox. EyeMail’s patent-pending technology compresses high-quality 4K videos down to 15 kilobytes to deliver compelling video-in-email experiences, helping organizations bring their marketing messages to life.

title: With Microsoft Azure, Terragon helps businesses leverage insights and target customers with the right messages at the right time
executive_summary: Terragon, a pioneer in Africa's MarTech sector, is redefining how businesses engage their customers. Using artificial intelligence and mountains of data, companies can send consumers the right messages at the right time with AI-powered insights. Picture this: a Bank customer engaging with their favorite app (game, news, entertainment, sports etc.) attempts to make an in-app payment; Registering the customer’s action the Bank (through Terragon’s software) is able to engage that customer and help them instantly facilitate a seamless payment process with the least amount of friction (by identifying that customer, using their phone number as their ID across platforms in the cloud) thereby adding value to the consumer’s experience. Terragon’s move to Microsoft Azure improved its security posture and turbocharged Terragon’s operations, slashing deployment times from about six weeks to just a week. After the move, the company could deliver notifications to end-users in half the time.

title: End-to-end digitalization of the daily routine at UKBB - with Microsoft 365 E5
executive_summary: The challenges faced by University Children’s Hospital Basel (UKBB) are daunting indeed: Rising cost pressure and a general shortage of specialist labor in healthcare create an acute need for more efficient processes and simplified communication structures. In response to this situation, UKBB decided to implement a ground-breaking digitalization strategy – and chose Microsoft as its strategic partner. “Zero trust” is the fundamental principle behind the hospital’s approach to IT. Essentially, this means that every service–be it in device management, Azure services or collaboration–is implemented only after it has been tested and subjected to a rigorous security assessment. Adherence to this principle ensures that all solutions and methodologies always comply with the strictest security requirements. As a result, the solutions from Microsoft are enabling the comprehensive modernization of the workplace, improving internal communication, and freeing up more time for hospital staff to devote to their patients.

title: Dutch mental healthcare nonprofit, Reinier van Arkel, addresses long waitlists with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: As in many parts of the world, in the Netherlands an increasing demand for mental health services combined with insufficient numbers of caregivers leads to a lag in getting care. Mental health care nonprofit Reinier van Arkel is working to better meet the needs of clients with a new Microsoft Dynamics 365-based waitlist platform. The system automates and digitizes the client waitlist, from referral to beginning of treatment, so clients can get specialized support.

title: Sanlam improves user experience and productivity by empowering engineers with GitHub Copilot
executive_summary: “I feel five times more productive!” or “The quality of my work has improved even further”—these are all things that engineers at Sanlam have said about GitHub Copilot. Gone are the days of interrupting colleagues with quick questions, browsing online for code sample guidance, and sifting through documentation. Now, Sanlam’s engineers have a helpful virtual colleague in Copilot, which offers suggestions, code optimization, refactoring into modern languages and generation of unit test data sets on the go. Engineers have saved up to 30% of their time while also improving code quality. And for Sanlam, Africa’s largest non-banking financial services group, this isn’t just about faster coding; it’s about applying AI and modern engineering for continued value development, happier engineers, and turbo charging their transformation of the client and intermediary experience.

title: Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Limited implements modern customer-centric store operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: India’s first billion-dollar fashion powerhouse, Mumbai-based Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Limited (ABFRL), keeps trend-seekers throughout India and around the world looking their best. The company’s loyal customers can find everything from high-end luxury apparel to budget-conscious clothes for the whole family at ABFRL’s 3,900+ brand stores and the 33,500+ fashion retail outlets where its brands can be found.

title: Design for Leisure improves efficiency 30% with iGlobe solutions and Microsoft Planner
executive_summary: Design for Leisure sought a solution to enhance project management efficiency, streamline planning processes, and ensure alignment with deadlines.

title: Hellenic Bank transforms market analysis using Power BI, offering business customers unmatched insights
executive_summary: Hellenic Bank, a leading Cypriot financial institution, has changed the way companies think about business intelligence. Where businesses used to rely only on in-house sales numbers, Hellenic Bank worked to provide a wider view. Using Power BI, the bank designed their Commercial Intelligence tool which gathers and analyzes card transaction data in an anonymized and aggregated manner. Using the tool, Hellenic Bank’s business clients can uncover insights that go beyond their internal data boundaries, bringing a clearer picture of their evolving market shares, market trends, and consumer behavior, down to details like demographic groups and neighborhoods.

title: Hampton secures warehouse efficiency with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: For 30 years, Hampton Products International Corporation (Hampton) has provided reliable and innovative security solutions to home and commercial hardware product sellers. From its first weatherproof padlock design to today’s smart home, travel security, and cargo management solutions, Hampton has consistently upheld its reputation for innovation and quality—and its retail customers depend on it. An impressive lineup of trusted brands, outstanding service, and speed-to-market infrastructure make Hampton a leader in the security hardware and cargo management industry. Hampton distributes products to thousands of retail locations around the world.

title: Amadeus empowers its teams to focus their time and skills on value-added tasks with Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: As a company providing solutions to the tourism and hospitality industry, Amadeus operates in 190 countries. Created in 1987 by four European airlines, Amadeus has expanded its reach beyond flight booking, into a diverse range of travel solutions. Today, it is a leader when it comes to the technological solutions behind our travels.

title: Easy to maintain, quick to scale: ZEISS migrates SAP applications to the Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: SAP applications, such as Treasury and Risk Management, SAP ERP, SAP BW, or SAP HCM, are the very core of a company. For its SAP applications, ZEISS had opted for an on-premises setup—an outdated and thus less flexible solution that was difficult to operate and modernize. This led to lengthy and slow processes in IT, and the automation of recurring processes seemed virtually impossible. Then, in 2017, the company made a decision: it would migrate business-critical SAP applications to the Microsoft Cloud with the help of Azure. ZEISS now benefits from unlimited scalability, flexibility, automation, and high speed in application development and use.

title: Kantar optimizes internal customer app experience with Azure Integration Services
executive_summary: Kantar is a global leader in marketing data, analytics, and insights, helping shape top brands in more than 100 markets. Previously, Kantar’s internal apps were siloed by location. Data was shared by securely emailing spreadsheets. The company used Azure Integration Services to create the KantarHub. Now, employees can access internal apps and share data in one place, simplifying daily processes for HR, Legal, and Compliance activities while modernizing data security. There are about 150 integrations, with more planned.

title: Carlsberg secures 25,000 devices globally with GYTPOL Validator hosted on Azure cloud
executive_summary: Founded in 1847, Carlsberg Group is one of the world's leading brewers. Yet, it faced challenges in managing its hybrid cybersecurity infrastructure. To create a more robust security posture, Carlsberg partnered with the Israeli company GYTPOL to deploy the GYTPOL Validator, which discovers and remedies device misconfigurations swiftly without disrupting business operations. As a result, Carlsberg has gained robust security and the peace of mind to continue pursuing innovation.

title: Windows 11 Pro lets Calgary Sports focus on their fans
executive_summary: Founded in 1980, Calgary Sports and Entertainment Corporation is a professional sports and entertainment company based in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. The company owns and operates five franchises across hockey, football, and lacrosse: the NHL’s Calgary Flames, the WHL’s Calgary Hitmen, the NLL’s Calgary Roughnecks, the CFL’s Calgary Stampeders, and the AHL’s Calgary Wranglers. They also manage the Scotiabank Saddledome and McMahon Stadium; both venues attract large audiences for sporting events, concerts, and conventions.

title: Discover why ING banks on Windows 365 to improve management and performance for a remote workforce
executive_summary: ING is a leading global bank empowering people to stay a step ahead in life and in business by bringing mobile-led digital experiences to customers worldwide. To optimize operations ING replaced their on-premises virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) with Windows 365 Cloud PCs to meet the needs of employees wherever they work. The bank can easily manage Cloud PCs with its existing IT team and reduce costs by eliminating 1,200 servers, helping to facilitate ING’s pathway to net zero carbon emissions. Windows 365 is fast and simple to deploy, and remote employees appreciate seamless access and remote collaboration. The solution is improving agility and providing the bank with a model for a worldwide, cloud-powered future.

title: Muckleshoot Casino Resort wins big with improved visibility and collaboration from Microsoft Project for the web
executive_summary: The Muckleshoot Casino Resort, owned and operated by the Muckleshoot Indian Tribe, is the largest casino in Washington state. With over 3,500 gaming machines, table games, multiple onsite restaurants, and endless live entertainment, Muckleshoot Casino Resort is a one-stop shop for an exciting night out. Their upcoming hotel resort, set to open in early 2024, includes a collection of luxury rooms and suites, spa, fitness center, pool complex, and steakhouse restaurant. To better prioritize and manage all these exciting business initiatives, the casino adopted Microsoft Project for the web to simplify its user experience, gain insights into projects, and boost productivity within its project management teams.

title: ICG starts up and scales on day one with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Start-up construction firm Industrialized Construction Group (ICG) needed technology to support its five-person team and business operations from day one but had limited resources. ICG used Microsoft 365 to set up its entire operations, from budgeting in Excel to creating branded templates in Word and PowerPoint to managing emails in Outlook. Additionally, ICG used Power BI from day one to visualize data for its flagship product, Teams as a hybrid communication and file sharing hub with staff and customers, and Copilot to reduce writing time by more than half.

title: MSC unifies global operations and tracks millions of shipment data points with Azure
executive_summary: N/A

title: Södertälje kommun upgrades school device security with Microsoft Intune and Microsoft Entra
executive_summary: N/A

title: MISO undergoes a digital transformation with Microsoft Industry Solutions Delivery
executive_summary: MISO is a regional transmission operator thatneeded a new data platform to manage, hedge against, and respond to market risks and opportunities as well as meet future energy demand to manage uncertainty and long-term planning.

title: Farm Credit Canada empowers employees to streamline operations and advance the organization’s mission with Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: Farm Credit Canada (FCC), an agricultural and food lending corporation in Canada, sought to boost employee productivity, enhance customer service, and stay at the forefront of technology adoption in the sector.

title: Amref Health Africa predicts and prevents malnutrition in Kenya with AI
executive_summary: The global health nonprofit Amref Health Africa works to create lasting change across Africa, including nutrition projects in Kenya. Amref wanted a way to address malnutrition more proactively to stop this widespread condition and save lives.

title: ICG starts up and scales on day one with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Start-up construction firm Industrialized Construction Group (ICG) needed technology to support its five-person team and business operations from day one but had limited resources. ICG used Microsoft 365 to set up its entire operations, from budgeting in Excel to creating branded templates in Word and PowerPoint to managing emails in Outlook. Additionally, ICG used Power BI from day one to visualize data for its flagship product, Teams as a hybrid communication and file sharing hub with staff and customers, and Copilot to reduce writing time by more than half.

title: Tyler Technologies lays the foundation for its future with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Plano, Texas-based Tyler Technologies (Tyler) provides software solutions and digital infrastructure that help the public sector create smarter, safer, stronger communities. Tyler has more than 7,300 employees—45% of whom previously worked in the public sector—in 56 locations in the U.S., Canada, the Philippines, and India. The company’s clients include 44,000 installations in 13,000 locations, from local governments as large as the County of Los Angeles (population: 10 million) and as small as Loving County, Texas (population: 94), to state agencies, municipalities, and schools. Tyler solutions encompass public administration, courts and public safety, health and human services, and K-12 education. They include data and insights, civic experience, cybersecurity, enterprise resource planning (ERP), platform technologies, and productivity tools.

title: Michigan Air National Guard reduced training time from weeks to days with mixed reality and Microsoft Azure innovations
executive_summary: The Michigan Air National Guard (MI ANG) is preparing for US Air Force (USAF) Agile Combat Employment and Multi-Capable Airmen operations using mixed-reality solutions to support global agility. Its Kelly Johnson Joint All-Domain Innovation Center (KJJADIC) operationalizes innovation for USAF efforts at the National All-Domain Warfighting Center in Michigan, helping solve national security challenges. The KJJADIC also provides academic certification programs and practical experiences in creative problem-solving. In collaboration with Microsoft, MI ANG is incorporating mixed-reality technologies into its exercise and training teams, showing how innovative ideas and technology can securely enhance training, readiness, and efficiency.

title: North Wales Fire and Rescue Service work with Valto to achieve ‘Intranet Anywhere’ with Microsoft 365.
executive_summary: North Wales Fire and Rescue Service (NWFRS) relies on full-time and on-call staff at 44 stations to respond to thousands of incidents annually over an area covering 2,400 square miles. NWFRS chose Valto for professional assistance upgrading its on-premises information systems. Valto’s one-day scoping workshop for Microsoft 365, SharePoint, and Teams enabled NWFRS to rapidly start implementation. Using existing Microsoft 365 licenses, NWFRS deployed a secure intranet with remote access and self-service options.

title: Argentine agribusiness fyo brings Azure-driven innovation
executive_summary: Through Azure DevOps and agile methodology, fyo has developed the innovative "fyoDigital" platform which offers customers a new way to manage their businesses online. At the same time, the company has reduced the time it spends developing and operating software.

title: SHI elevates the employee and customer experience with a fast, smooth Windows 11 Pro deployment
executive_summary: SHI, the global technology solutions provider, deployed Windows 11 Pro for its entire workforce of 6,100 within three months, thereby readying its technology environment for more productive and rewarding user experiences. The company hopes to help its customers achieve the same success and is in the process of completing other, extremely efficient Windows 11 Pro migrations. AI will be key in SHI’s technology portfolio as it assists customers transform for the future on a Windows foundation.
products: Dynamics 365, Exchange Online, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Teams, SharePoint, Windows 11

title: The Tile Shop enhances security and agility with SAP on the Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: The Tile Shop is a large, growing US-based tile supplier. The company’s continuing expansion necessitates new, more advanced technological infrastructure and robust cybersecurity solutions. The Tile Shop recently transitioned from outdated, on-premises infrastructure to Microsoft 365 E5 and SAP on the Microsoft Cloud. Adopting Microsoft Sentinel, Defender for Cloud, and Intune, among others, the company has unified and strengthened its cybersecurity posture, saving hundreds of thousands of dollars in the process.

title: Promoting an unprecedented Osaka-Kansai Expo! The role of West Japan Railway Company in “Community ID Infrastructure” based on Azure AD B2C
executive_summary: In April 2023, West Japan Railway Company devised its strategic roadmap, drawing insights from the impact of COVID-19. The plan, titled “Medium-Term Management Plan 2025 - Taking on post-pandemic challenges,” centers on “developing diverse services via digital strategy.” As part of this effort, the Kansai MaaS Council was formed by seven railway companies, including West Japan Railway Company, that operate major routes in the Kansai region to promote Mobility as a Service (MaaS) in preparation for the 2025 World Exposition in Japan (Expo 2025 Osaka, Kansai, Japan). The council spearheads an unprecedented large-scale MaaS initiative, collaborating with over 60 transportation operators, encompassing bus and cab operators, and engaging a multitude of stakeholders from the business community, government, and tourism organizations. In September 2023, an application called "KANSAI MaaS" was released to provide seamless transportation options in the Kansai region. Its new membership-based infrastructure service "Mobility Auth Bridge," which supports the mobility and lifestyles of people and connects various services provided in the region uses the “Azure Active Directory B2C” service provided by Microsoft, an identity management solution for business-to-customer (B2C) scenarios.

title: Vinci Partners creates a secure digital collaboration environment based on Microsoft 365 tools
executive_summary: Vinci Partners, a benchmark in alternative investments in Brazil, works with several Microsoft tools, such as SharePoint, OneDrive, OneNote, Microsoft Teams, among others, that streamline communication, collaboration, and contract management through new employee training. In addition, the company implemented a layer of security that supports the operation and brought peace of mind to work during the pandemic.
products: Exchange Online, Microsoft 365 E3, Forms, Planner, OneDrive for Business, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Stream, OneNote

title: Xome increases productivity by 20% with migration to the Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: Online real estate marketplace Xome modernized its operations by consolidating multiple datacenters and cloud providers into one streamlined cloud solution with Microsoft Azure. Maintaining various physical datacenters was limiting the company’s potential to grow, so Xome decided to modernize by migrating to the cloud. After considering several cloud providers, the company chose Azure for its scalability and AI capabilities. By combining all its datacenters onto a single cloud platform, Xome cut costs, enhanced security, and saved the IT team’s time.

title: Usina Santa Adélia gains flexibility, robustness, and security with data center migration to Azure
executive_summary: The company found in the cloud the possibility of modernizing its technology infrastructure, drove application development, and, with the potential for integrations, also installed a platform that provided peace of mind for remote work during the pandemic, with simple usability. What was driven by security was gradually becoming a digital transformation by the possibilities generated by Azure.

title: Bankingly leverages financial inclusion with Microsoft Azure technologies
executive_summary: Built on Microsoft's cloud, Bankingly provides web services and mobile applications to microfinance institutions in rural Latin America with the goal of promoting digital inclusion.

title: CPFL implements robust Microsoft security solution and gains visibility and intelligence
executive_summary: For 109 years in the electrical industry, CPFL Energia was looking for a new SIEM tool to improve the level of monitoring, anticipate possible attacks on its online environment, which grew with remote working, and found response to its demands by combining the tools from Microsoft Sentinel and Azure Monitor Logs.

title: Alpha Inversiones brokerage firm in the Dominican Republic strengthens its business model with support from Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Building on Dynamics 365, the company has gained a 360° view of its business, improving its sales operations and customer relationships. It has also been able to automate different processes and comply with local securities superintendence regulations.

title: Cochez and CIA power their digital transformation by basing their infrastructure on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Through Aludra Cloud, Hypernova Labs' solution based on Microsoft Azure, Cochez y CIA deployed e-invoicing to streamline their sales processes.

title: Adobe uses global cloud to create, deliver, and manage better digital experiences
executive_summary: Adobe wanted to help its customers understand how people engage with the content created through the Adobe Creative Cloud, so it built the Adobe Experience Cloud to integrate data analytics with content, audience, and campaign management. By partnering with Microsoft to connect Experience Cloud with Microsoft Azure and Dynamics 365, Adobe can offer businesses a 360-degree customer view and the tools to create, deliver, and manage digital experiences—backed by a globally scalable cloud platform.

title: ABN AMRO delivers industry-specific functionality in the cloud faster
executive_summary: Dutch bank ABN AMRO turned to its partnership with Microsoft to help it develop a Cloud Center of Excellence (CCoE) with highly skilled and experienced staff. The bank used the CCoE to significantly accelerate its cloud journey, achieving industry-specific business value faster and more cost-effectively. It’s the latest fruit of a longstanding collaboration between ABN AMRO and Microsoft to make the bank’s journey to the cloud a success.

title: Dr. Martens “Joins the Revolution” with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Dr. Martens is an iconic British footwear brand, loved the world over for its signature style that unapologetically represents freedom, self-expression, and authenticity. Formed in 1947, Dr. Martens made headway as a wholesale business and now has more than 100 stores globally, with ambitious plans for retail and e-commerce growth. Recognizing the need to evolve to suit the needs of the twenty-first century consumer, the brand embarked on “Project Reboot: Join the Revolution” to replace all its legacy applications with Microsoft Dynamics 365.

title: Adobe uses global cloud to create, deliver, and manage better digital experiences
executive_summary: Adobe wanted to help its customers understand how people engage with the content created through the Adobe Creative Cloud, so it built the Adobe Experience Cloud to integrate data analytics with content, audience, and campaign management. By partnering with Microsoft to connect Experience Cloud with Microsoft Azure and Dynamics 365, Adobe can offer businesses a 360-degree customer view and the tools to create, deliver, and manage digital experiences—backed by a globally scalable cloud platform.

title: ABN AMRO delivers industry-specific functionality in the cloud faster
executive_summary: Dutch bank ABN AMRO turned to its partnership with Microsoft to help it develop a Cloud Center of Excellence (CCoE) with highly skilled and experienced staff. The bank used the CCoE to significantly accelerate its cloud journey, achieving industry-specific business value faster and more cost-effectively. It’s the latest fruit of a longstanding collaboration between ABN AMRO and Microsoft to make the bank’s journey to the cloud a success.

title: Dr. Martens “Joins the Revolution” with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Dr. Martens is an iconic British footwear brand, loved the world over for its signature style that unapologetically represents freedom, self-expression, and authenticity. Formed in 1947, Dr. Martens made headway as a wholesale business and now has more than 100 stores globally, with ambitious plans for retail and e-commerce growth. Recognizing the need to evolve to suit the needs of the twenty-first century consumer, the brand embarked on “Project Reboot: Join the Revolution” to replace all its legacy applications with Microsoft Dynamics 365.

title: Manulife migrates and modernizes essential valuation application using Azure services
executive_summary: The financial services industry does not often embrace major change, but to Manulife, a progressive approach to IT is essential to modern business success. Manulife’s digital transformation includes moving IT resources and applications to the Microsoft Azure cloud platform, including its valuation system. For the innovative valuation system transformation project, the company’s developers used Azure services to modernize the valuation application and streamline development processes with workflows and automation that speed up time to market and reduce costs.

title: Walgreens Boots Alliance moves a mountain of SAP assets to Azure in a key modernization move
executive_summary: With stores in every state and around the world, Walgreens Boots Alliance (WBA) is a giant in retail. It’s also the friendly neighborhood pharmacy on the frontlines of the pandemic response, dispensing lifesaving aid to 8 million people each day in stores and online. Even before its designation as an essential services provider, the company knew that it needed more flexibility across its global supply chain to serve its customers better and faster. A key step in the company’s digital transformation occurred when its massive SAP landscape—an estimated 100 terabytes (TB)—was migrated to Azure. It was the biggest SAP S/4HANA scale-out deployment on Azure to date.

title: Pet care leader turns monolithic app into a global distributed solution on Azure
executive_summary: Pets, like their owners, need specialized care from time to time, but the referral system used by one major network of pet care providers needed care itself. The medical records didn’t always follow the client, and often the records got duplicated in the process. VCA, one of the largest pet healthcare companies in the United States, wanted to streamline referrals across more than 800 of its veterinary hospitals. The company turned to Microsoft Gold Certified Partner CloudIQ Technologies, which created a cloud-native application on Microsoft Azure that solved the messy referrals problem.
products: .NET, Azure, Azure API Management, Azure Cache for Redis, Azure Container Registry, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Functions, Azure Monitor, Azure Pipelines, Azure SQL Database

title: Nonprofit digitally transforms to enable remote collaboration and respond to a community in crisis
executive_summary: The San Diego Workforce Partnership funds and delivers programs that empower job seekers to meet the current and future workforce needs of employers in San Diego County. When COVID-19 forced the Workforce Partnership to close its offices and headquarters, it became more difficult to serve the high volume of workers that the pandemic recently displaced. Using Microsoft Teams, a website chatbot built with Power Virtual Agents, and omnichannel capabilities within Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Workforce Partnership employees have been able to increase remote collaboration and engage with more people in need of support.
products: Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Copilot Studio

title: WTW raises certainty in an uncertain world with AI-driven Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: Customers from around the world rely on professional services organization WTW for its innovative risk strategies, insurance placement, HR consulting, and compensation and benefits planning. All of these services depend on enormous volumes of data that engender the clarity and perspective organizations need to make the best possible decisions in a world that guarantees only uncertainty. So, protecting client data and intellectual property are a WTW hallmark. Over the years, the company had built up a raft of unrelated, legacy security solutions that were increasingly difficult to maintain. Its vision for a more streamlined, productivity-first security posture called for a tightly coordinated tool set. WTW found what it needed with the full suite of Microsoft Security solutions, including Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Purview, and Azure. It’s excited to use the latest security innovation, AI-driven Microsoft Security Copilot.
products: Azure, Microsoft Copilot for Security, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Purview, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Retailer Sonae accelerates productivity and streamlines HR processes with Power Automate
executive_summary: Sonae is a multinational corporation headquartered in Porto, Portugal, with a diversified portfolio of companies spanning 62 countries. In a continuous focus on “improving life,” Sonae brands and companies are always looking to innovate, increase sustainability, and have a greater impact on a wider population. Sonae is leveraging Microsoft Power Automate as part of their digital transformation initiative to accelerate productivity, increase quality, and work-life enhancing solutions.
products: Microsoft 365, Excel, Power Apps, Power Automate, SharePoint

title: Dynamics solutions bring resilience for an international law firm
executive_summary: Fieldfisher is an international law firm headquartered in London. With 22 offices in eleven countries, it focuses on four key sectors: energy and natural resources, financial markets, technology and life sciences.

title: Singapore-based renewable energy company Sembcorp digitalizes to create synergetic employee experiences
executive_summary: As one of the largest energy players in Singapore, Sembcorp Industries (Sembcorp) has a balanced energy portfolio with substantial renewable energy capacity across the world. Sembcorp seeks to meet the rising global demand for sustainable solutions while ensuring a safe and flexible workspace during the COVID-19 pandemic. The company has set up its modern workplace by accelerating deployment and adoption of Microsoft 365, particularly Microsoft Teams, for connectivity and collaboration.

title: Leading investment group in the insurance and reinsurance fields gets ahead of business challenges using Microsoft Power Apps
executive_summary: Financial holding company Chedid Capital is a leading investment group in the insurance and reinsurance fields. The group operates across Europe, the Middle East, Africa and South Asia. To keep pace with its dynamic expansion, the company has built internal business applications to help streamline workflows using Microsoft Power Apps. A key example is a performance appraisal system that currently provides 600 employees in 15 global entities with transparency and consistency throughout the appraisal process. The same app has the potential to expand coverage to 1400 employees across 61 entities once all subsidiaries—including the recently acquired Ascoma group—are onboarded to the system. Another app for customer relationship management improves data visibility, leading to higher efficiency and performance of sales teams. The result is easier coordination and faster processing of data, which leads to greater productivity.

title: Minecraft empowers students to solve climate issues, builds skills for green careers
executive_summary: During the pandemic, educators and students at John Dewey High School in Brooklyn established a Minecraft Club to foster school community. Students participated in global Minecraft sustainability challenges that dovetailed with existing schoolwide efforts to protect the local environment. When the New York City Department of Education codified Minecraft in sustainability curricula, it prioritized student-directed learning—and started building career pathways in the future green economy.

title: Etihad Airways raises the bar for customer service with Power Virtual Agents
executive_summary: For years, Etihad Airways has capitalized on innovative solutions that help offer a seamless customer service experience that makes travel easier and more stress free. New and complex travel restrictions during the global pandemic created a surge in customer inquiries. The team developed a chatbot using Microsoft Power Virtual Agents to be able to respond to all of them. Etihad Airways has empowered its agents with sustainable, scalable tools that helped revamp its customer experience, and improve its net promoter score (NPS).

title: Digitalization of heat exchangers reduces the world's carbon emissions
executive_summary: The world’s energy demand will double by the year 2050. That is why we must make the most of the energy we already produce. The partnership with Microsoft enables Alfa Laval to optimize the energy efficiency in their customers' processes.

title: NatWest moves to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service resulting in £10m+ software savings
executive_summary: “At NatWest, we are responding to the needs of all of our customers in building a relationship bank in a digital world,” states Angela Byrne, COO Retail Bank at NatWest Group.

title: Ernst & Young LLP (EY) improves their employee experience with Microsoft Search
executive_summary: Employees at Ernst & Young LLP (EY), one of the largest professional services networks in the world, introduced Microsoft Search to help employees easily search for people, files, sites, and more. In parallel with a campaign to strengthen and update permissions on the company’s two million Microsoft SharePoint sites, the global firm rolled out user education campaigns to its employees to create the best search experience possible. Now, EY teams use work search to facilitate better collaboration among teams and higher productivity companywide.
products: Bing, Microsoft Edge, SharePoint

title: Zabka Group launches autonomous Nano stores powered by AiFi and Microsoft Cloud for Retail, gains high customer ratings
executive_summary: As the largest modern convenience store chain in Poland, Żabka Group has made it its mission to understand and anticipate the needs of its customers—providing products and services that make their lives easier. Now, the company is launching Nano stores offering autonomous, frictionless, unmanned retail experiences designed to deliver the ultimate in convenience to customers. Using AI-powered real-time computer vision technology from AiFi to track customer behavior and product selection, and Microsoft Cloud for Retail to support data centralization, analysis, and solution scalability, Żabka is creating personalized customer journeys that are receiving high customer satisfaction ratings. In addition, Żabka is increasing operational efficiencies, gaining more foot traffic, and passing on cost savings to its customers.

title: University of Debrecen delivers future-ready skills and knowledge with Microsoft
executive_summary: The University of Debrecen, one of the largest higher education institutions in Hungary, was looking to integrate more market-oriented, industry-relevant skills and certificates in its computer science programs. With the Microsoft Learn for Educators program (MSLE), the university introduced several courses in Azure technologies in its curricula and empowered its teachers and several dozen students to gain industry-recognized Microsoft Certifications for free, thereby enhancing their employability and university ranking.

title: TeamViewer Streamlines User Experience with Microsoft Edge WebView2 Tool Integration​
executive_summary: Striving for connection. TeamViewer provides remote access and remote control computer software that has already been installed over 2.5 billion times worldwide. Their goal is to enable remote connectivity and make the working environment much simpler for all.

title: Optical solutions pioneer ZEISS Group uses Microsoft Fabric to advance innovation with data analytics
executive_summary: ZEISS Group knew it could put its “mountains” of disparate data to better use. But the company needed a way to break free of its ever-increasing number of data silos so it could work from a single source of truth across all its data analytics workflows. With targeted technical goals including evolving its enterprise (Big) DATA Analytics platform (eVA, based on the Data Mesh principles) establishing end-to-end data lifecycle acceleration, and supporting business growth through AI innovation, ZEISS Group chose Microsoft Fabric on the Azure platform as its solution. With Fabric, ZEISS Group can connect and combine all its data sources without creating redundant data silos and without the need to invest in additional infrastructure. ZEISS Group feels eVA, supported by Microsoft Fabric on Azure, will provide the architecture and governance it needs for a secure and trusted data supply chain that can be shared effortlessly across a range of business units—allowing the company to focus on creating industry-leading optical solutions.
products: Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Synapse Analytics, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Fabric, Microsoft Purview, Power BI

title: Zabka Group launches autonomous Nano stores powered by AiFi and Microsoft Cloud for Retail, gains high customer ratings
executive_summary: As the largest modern convenience store chain in Poland, Żabka Group has made it its mission to understand and anticipate the needs of its customers—providing products and services that make their lives easier.
