executive_summary: Stora Enso owns 1.5 million hectares of forest—a natural resource too large for humans to manage alone. So the company needed a solution to automate as many processes as possible to drive improvements across the whole value chain.

title: EchoStar and Hughes save thousands of work hours, cut costs with Azure AI
executive_summary: Satellite giant EchoStar needed more efficient operations to deliver content to businesses and consumers globally. Its Hughes division wanted to increase employee efficiency and streamline daily business processes.

title: Clearing the air: How UBS is using Azure to shed more light on carbon emissions
executive_summary: UBS discovered that over one-third of its global energy usage came from power-intensive data centers, significantly impacting its carbon footprint. Traditional emissions tools lacked the detail needed for targeted improvements, prompting UBS to seek a precise, scalable solution to measure and optimize energy consumption.

title: Aker BP builds an AI-first future with Microsoft 365 Copilot and AI agents
executive_summary: As an independent oil and gas company, Aker BP is always searching for ways to become more efficient and gain a competitive edge in the industry. So, it embarked on an AI-powered transformation as an early adopter of Microsoft 365 Copilot technology.

title: Granollers General Hospital speeds up the assessment of stroke patients with Methinks AI on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Strokes are a major global health concern, affecting more than 12 million people every year. Every second matters when a stroke occurs, but only less than 50% of global hospitals have adequate technology in place to diagnose it effectively and promptly.

title: Arxus achieves simplicity in hybrid and multi-cloud environments with Azure Arc
executive_summary: As a leading provider of cloud solutions in Belgium, Arxus saw the market shifting from private to public cloud and wanted to become an early mover. But it didn’t have access to the economies of scale enjoyed by hyperscalers.

title: Pioneering insurance model automatically pays travelers for delayed flights
executive_summary: Based in Zurich, Switzerland, Swiss Re Group is a leading wholesale provider of reinsurance and insurance. The second-largest reinsurance company in the world, Swiss Re has offices in more than 25 countries and reported revenue of US$33 billion in 2016. To break away from traditional business models, the company created a digital platform based on Microsoft Azure and launched a pioneering micro-insurance service that automatically reimburses airline passengers for delayed flights. More innovative projects are underway as the company takes advantage of a DevOps workflow combined with Azure platform-as-a-service offerings.

title: Maersk uses cloud to spur development of containerized solutions built on Kubernetes
executive_summary: As part of its digital transformation efforts, shipping giant A.P. Moller - Maersk needed to streamline IT operations and optimize the value of its IT resources. Maersk adopted Microsoft Azure, migrated key workloads to the cloud, and modernized its open-source software, which included the adoption of Kubernetes on Azure. Maersk software engineers now spend less time on container software management and more time on innovation and value-added projects. The resulting business value is savings on resource costs, faster solution delivery time, and the ability to attract expert IT talent.

title: Cincinnati Children’s makes tough times easier with family-friendly mobile app
executive_summary: Cincinnati Children’s Hospital Medical Center is well known for the excellence of its care and its commitment to the well-being of the families it serves. To reduce strain for parents and make their lives easier, the hospital created the Caren mobile app using Microsoft Azure and Azure services. Parents turn to Caren for help navigating the hospital, to get answers to their questions, and to help them entertain their children. Using the app lets parents focus more on their families and less on stressful details.

title: LaLiga boosts fan engagement with multiple digital channels and conversational AI
executive_summary: The Madrid-based Spanish football (soccer) organization LaLiga has hundreds of millions of fans around the world. LaLiga fans are passionate about the game, and the league is passionate about making it as fun as possible for them. To do this, LaLiga developed a digital innovation platform based on Microsoft Azure. The league now creates websites and apps that help fans enjoy the game in new ways, including a voice-based personal digital assistant that helps fans learn more about players, teams, and the LaLiga fantasy league through conversational AI. With a robust digital experience for fans, LaLiga can quickly develop, deploy, and scale its innovations—continually elevating its brand identity.

title: TD Bank Group: Focused on making every customer experience legendary
executive_summary: There’s great customer service, and then there’s legendary customer service. With the goal of creating legendary experiences for more than 26 million customers, TD Bank Group (TD), one of North America’s largest banks, knows that keeping up with changes in customer expectations and anticipating their needs is critical. As part of its focus on staying close to customer needs, TD’s digital experience team is leveraging the company’s investment in Microsoft Azure to deepen relationships with its customers.

title: BP adopts hybrid cloud and moves applications and datacenter operations to Azure
executive_summary: BP is a global company with a network of international datacenters. To streamline operations and expedite application development and deployment, BP adopted a cloud-first strategy based on Microsoft Azure. The company is moving applications and on-premises IT infrastructure to Azure with a goal of eliminating datacenter management overhead. BP built a hybrid architecture to accommodate different locations’ regulatory and compliance requirements. BP has almost completely exited one mega datacenter, with plans to decommission more.

title: Top oil & gas firm Royal Dutch Shell, accelerates software development to fuel global energy production
executive_summary: The global population today is approximately 7.4 billion and is projected to reach 10 billion by 2050. Industrialization and population growth are closely intertwined, fueled by energy consumption that the US Energy Information Administration says will increase by 48 percent between 2012 and 2040. Although renewable energy sources are on the rise, fossil fuels will still account for more than 75 percent of the energy consumed worldwide.

title: Lowell improves customer interactions and delivers better client outcomes with Azure Cognitive Services
executive_summary: As one of the largest credit management services in Europe, Lowell wants credit to work better for everybody. So, it works hard to make every consumer interaction as painless as possible. But a complicated debt-collection framework in Norway kept the company’s highly trained credit counselors too busy with consumer inquiries, posing challenges for bringing in timely payments. Lowell turned to Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services to create an AI-enabled chatbot that now handles 40 percent of all inquiries—making it easier for service agents to deliver greater value to consumers and better outcomes for Lowell clients.

title: BBC innovates how it delivers trusted news and entertainment with Azure AI
executive_summary: As one of the world’s oldest and largest global news and entertainment broadcasters, the BBC has built its reputation by delivering high-quality journalism with integrity to global audiences. It was looking for a strong partner that could help it build its own custom-branded voice assistant—but it needed full control over the experience, the customer relationship, and its customers’ data. With Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services and Azure Bot Service, the BBC created an end-to-end, customized digital voice assistant that captures its brand identity and helps establish a new conversational relationship with its many audiences.

title: Tata Projects migrates 400 terabytes of data in record time with RISE with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: With five disparate enterprise resource planning systems and an increasing number of global ventures on the horizon, Tata Projects saw a need to centralize its data and streamline operations.

executive_summary: NFU Mutual is known for its local, personalized, high quality customer service but with thousands of customers, it was crucial that member data be consolidated from disparate systems into a single, centralized source of truth.

executive_summary: The Brock Foundation needed to transition to online education during the pandemic and create a digital platform to advance the nonprofit technologically.

executive_summary: Hero AI, a healthcare technology company, is addressing industry challenges by improving patient care and operational efficiency. The company aims to reduce patient wait times, shorten patient stays, and increase hospital capacity.

executive_summary: Marija Grujic, co-founder of Neuroblast, was diagnosed with multiple sclerosis after giving birth. She attended neurorehabilitation clinics but found them costly and the exercises repetitive and demotivating.

executive_summary: Puratos offers innovative products and ingredients for the bakery, patisserie, and chocolate sectors in 100 countries. executive_summary: Stanley Martin Homes' legacy ERP system was not scalable and required extensive customization, slowing down acquisitions and operational efficiency.

executive_summary: Cognata’s DriveMatrix needs a lot of compute power and cloud space to process and store vast amounts of data created with generative AI.

executive_summary: Mondra Global Limited is passionate about helping food retailers evaluate the environmental impact of the products they stock. However, it often took several weeks or months to compile a lifecycle assessment of just one product.

executive_summary: M&G wanted to enhance operational efficiency and reduce repetitive tasks.

executive_summary: Centro de la Familia, a US-based non-profit organization, needed a more efficient reporting system to streamline compliance and reporting to federal and state agencies.

Already at 500 million transactions a year, Clearent wanted a data solution that could meet its ever-increasing demand—and unite all its information in one place. The company now uses the Microsoft Azure SQL Database hyperscale service tier to scale automatically and almost infinitely. This supports developers and architects in their day-to-day work, provides the data consistency that guarantees concurrent access for tens of thousands of users, and generates faster insights for its own decision-makers—and its customers.

executive_summary: SAE breaks paradigms in Public Administration with the migration of its 3 Data Centers to Microsoft Azure public cloud. With the evolution of modernization and redesign, aligned to the National Digital Strategy, SAE aimed to guarantee the prompt attention to the needs, and to strengthen the service to the transferring; achieving an approximate 40% reduction in costs vs. the previous contract, and important benefits like the increase from 90% to 99.9% in the availability of its technological services.

Founded in 2004, the young company expertly wields cloud technology to track the overwhelming number of tax laws, regulations, and requirements around the globe for its multinational customers. Valued by its customers for the time and money that it saves them, Orbitax brought even more richness to the solution when it incorporated Microsoft Power BI Embedded. The resulting graphical reporting takes data insights far beyond traditional reporting for huge productivity savings—up to 75 percent.
products: Azure, Power BI Embedded, Power BI, Excel

title: This bank is mastering what it sees as the next market disrupter in global financial services
executive_summary: Internet and mobile apps, move over. The new industry disrupter is bot technology. Nedbank, one of the major banks in South Africa, is using a virtual call center solution, based on the Microsoft Bot Framework, that can understand the context of clients’ questions. It answers questions for which it is programmed at 10 percent of the cost of live agents. The bank envisions many other uses for the technology as part of a digital transformation intended to expand its competitive advantage.

executive_summary: The Care Quality Commission (CQC) is responsible for monitoring the quality of care providers across England. In the middle of its transformation into a data- and insights-driven care assurance model, CQC used Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Voice and Dynamics 365 Customer Service Enterprise to develop its Emergency Support Framework to support the United Kingdom’s COVID-19 response. In doing so, CQC is laying the foundation for a new regulatory platform and better health and social care for the English public.

It’s the founding value that enabled the company’s transformation from a small boutique in 1939 to a rapidly growing ambassador of premium Italian style for cosmopolitan men all over the world, with 190 stores in 38 countries. The latest example is the company’s adoption of fully automated supply chain replenishment, an innovation introduced in partnership with Evo Pricing. This artificial intelligence solution powered by Microsoft services enabled 4 percent like-for-like revenue growth, even while overall stock shrank by 12 percent, thanks to accelerated learning and greater local relevance.

executive_summary: Additiv is a leading catalyst for change in the financial services industry, helping the world’s biggest financial institutions capitalize on digitalization. Operating within a highly regulated industry means that Additiv must uphold the highest standards of security and compliance. When the company decided to move its infrastructure to Azure, it worked with FastTrack for Azure to ensure a seamless transition that would strictly adhere to compliance regulations across multiple locations. Now, Additiv can take advantage of more efficient operations to offer its clients innovative, flexible solutions that can easily scale and adapt to their specific needs, no matter where they’re located.
products: Azure Migrate

title: Growing an innovative energy partnership across Australia
executive_summary: AGL, one of Australia’s leading integrated energy companies, is rolling out an innovative energy partnership with the help of Microsoft Azure Data Explorer. By allowing customers across the country to give back to the grid through remote management of networked solar batteries, AGL has created an innovative virtual power plant (VPP) that improves grid reliability, putting downward pressure on energy prices and helping customers save on energy costs.

Central to this effort is the Sheila and Eric Samson Pavilion, where medical, dental, and nursing students engage in lectures, special speaking events, and cutting-edge education.

executive_summary: Dentsu Aegis Network is a global agency group that supports global clients, such as General Motors, P&G and Kraft Heinz, with media, creative and CRM agency services.  It helps its clients to speak to their customers in a personal way, boost creative optimisation and understand marketing effectiveness. Print advertising plays an important role in the marketing mix, but the print-buying and reconciliation process is quite complex and, necessarily, often paper-based. Reconciliation requires proof of publishing, which in turn relies on hundreds of thousands of paper tear sheets.

executive_summary: For the Azerbaijani Ministry of Education, connected, data-driven education is the future of learning. Using Microsoft Teams for Education and Microsoft Power BI, the Ministry and teachers are equipped with key educational content, insights, and statistics. This helps improve teaching methodologies over time, ensuring students stay engaged with lessons. Teams enables students to connect to personalized learning content seamlessly, making exceptional education possible in any location.
customer: Ministry of Education of the Republic of Azerbaijan

executive_summary: Properstar was looking for a solution to simplify the analysis of unstructured real estate data and create a dynamic, AI-powered filtering system that would provide more nuanced search results.

executive_summary: VSE struggled with fragmented systems, outdated platforms, and siloed teams, lacking a unified view of customer interactions and efficient processes. This led to operational inefficiencies and inconsistent customer experiences.

executive_summary: When Louisiana State Government consolidated IT for all its divisions and entities, it wanted observability across its entire estate, on-premises and in the cloud. It adopted Microsoft Azure Arc for maximum visibility, control, and efficiencies.

executive_summary: Technology services cooperative WSIPC faced challenges with its traditional approach to storage, including costly upgrades. Supporting more than 300 school districts and 10 terabytes’ worth of databases, it wanted to allocate storage more easily and cost effectively.

title: Emirates NBD simplifies ESG reporting with Microsoft Sustainability Manager, reducing effort by 75%
executive_summary: Emirates NBD Group, a financial institution operating across 13 countries, experienced complex and time-consuming emissions data collection processes, hindering its ability to make timely decisions related to sustainability.

executive_summary: Singapore’s Central Provident Fund Board (CPFB) aimed to better leverage data for decision making, policy formulation, and service delivery.

executive_summary: Rau Consultants, a personnel consultancy specializing in the food industry, needed to continue evolving in response to industry changes and be more efficient, all while maintaining the hands-on approach it is known for.

executive_summary: HERON Group, a leading energy group in Greece, faced operational challenges as its legacy customer relationship management (CRM) system couldn't support its growing customer base and complex multi-channel journeys.

executive_summary: New York Life sought a modern, scalable desktop solution that supports secure, flexible access for employees, agents and advisors, contractors and partners across a complex, fast-evolving hybrid work environment.
products: Windows 365, Microsoft Intune, Microsoft 365, Microsoft 365 Copilot, Microsoft Teams

title: Grant Thornton gives customers secure access to personalized finance insights with Azure Active Directory B2C and Power BI embedded analytics
executive_summary: Professional services firm Grant Thornton knew that finance insights from Microsoft Power BI could prove valuable to its customers. The question was how to give them secure access to its customer portal and also make sure those insights were tailored to a client’s sector and particular interests. The firm implemented Azure Active Directory B2C, part of Microsoft Entra, and wrote user policies that enabled it to offer that secure access. In the process, the firm gave employees beyond the IT team the ability to administer client access.

title: Emirates Group creates digital, accessible workplace for employees
executive_summary: Using technology to improve its processes is not new to Emirates Group. The group includes the largest airline and flag carrier of the United Arab Emirates (UAE) and one of the world’s largest air services providers, dnata. Having Microsoft as a trusted partner for years, Emirates decided to take the next step in their digitalization journey and focus on productivity, collaboration and communication capabilities for its employees. It used Microsoft 365, the Power Platform, and Azure and established a powerful and productive digital workplace.

title: Pheasey Park Farm Primary School brings learning to life with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Pheasey Park Farm Primary School in Great Barr, Birmingham, seeks to inspire its pupils to “believe and achieve”. Part of the Elston Hall Learning Trust group of schools, the school was recently selected by the UK Department for Education to be an EdTech demonstrator school.
products: Microsoft Teams, Surface Go

title: ABN AMRO embraces an Azure-first data strategy to drive better business decisions
executive_summary: ABN AMRO is the third-largest bank in the Netherlands, with 100 branch offices and more than 30,000 employees. Its mission statement, “Banking for better, for generations to come,” is embodied by the way it uses digital services and data to support customers during key life moments. When ABN AMRO needed a more efficient way to access and act upon data, it embraced a data mesh architecture on Microsoft Azure and Azure Data Lake Storage to unlock data insights and drive business decisions.

executive_summary: Patterson Companion Animal Health Division provides everything a veterinarian needs to run their business and help their furry and non-furry patients. This includes sourcing specially requested items, which was a manual and inconsistent process. The process ultimately led to SKU proliferation, dead stock, and inflated inventory levels. Microsoft Power Automate generates emails throughout the process, proactively providing status, helpful details, and final decision. Mapping the process highlighted opportunities for improvement that were addressed and automated. This has reduced the number of items being set up unnecessarily—saving time and ongoing maintenance.
products: Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI

title: Ensuring true sustainability in renewable energy production
executive_summary: SSE Renewables is a leading developer and operator of renewable energy across the UK and Ireland. With a portfolio of around 4GW of onshore wind, offshore wind and hydro, the company has a key role in helping the UK reach its sustainability and net zero carbon goals.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure SQL Database, Azure Storage, Power BI

title: MYTILINEOS makes the incoming invoices management process easier with Azure and Power Apps
executive_summary: MYTILINEOS is a leading global industrial and energy company, in constant pursuit of business innovation. In a recent collaboration with the Microsoft Digital Advisory Services team, the company reimagined its process of receiving and managing incoming invoices with Azure and Power Apps. The move is part of a broader digital transformation agenda. Saving considerable time and effort, the solution is not only accelerating processes, but helping all its employees appreciate first hand the efficiency and productivity gains with digital transformation.

title: Bolloré Transport & Logistics unlocks localized, customized solutions with Power Platform
executive_summary: Simply put, Bolloré Logistics (one of Bolloré Transport & Logistics’ four business units: Bolloré Logistics, Bolloré Ports, Bolloré Energy, and Bolloré Railways) is a “travel agency for goods.”

title: Ashok Leyland leverages Microsoft Teams for remote collaboration and business continuity
executive_summary: Founded in 1948, Ashok Leyland is an Indian multinational automotive manufacturer. The organization was looking for an effective remote collaboration platform and leveraged Microsoft Teams to ensure business continuity amid the pandemic.

title: Flexibility and freedom in a secure framework
executive_summary: With migration from on-premise to the cloud and device management via MS Intune, it was possible to rebuild the entire IT infrastructure at Rubble Master in a short period of time. Quite a lot has changed as a result. The data and infrastructure are more secure thanks to the cloud solution. Device management via MS Intune provides a secure framework for the use of mobile devices without restricting the freedom of employees too much. Various processes have been automated, significantly reducing the workload for IT. Collaboration with Axians is ongoing as there are further ideas and projects in the pipeline.

title: Peet’s Coffee meets market changes with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Peet’s Coffee, founded in California in 1966, prides itself on providing customers with the highest quality craft coffee and tea. You can stop by a Peet’s Coffee shop for a cup, or purchase Peet’s products in the supermarket and online—from whole beans to K-cups to capsules and more—to brew at home.

title: Innovative cloud technology consultancy LAB3 chooses Microsoft Security platform for itself and its customers
executive_summary: Trusted IT consultant and Microsoft Gold partner LAB3 specializes in cloud-forward IT solutions for enterprise and government clients. So it makes sense that its own infrastructure can serve as an example for customers looking for their own state of the art security and compliance solution. LAB3 chose technology from Microsoft Security, protecting its internal production and development networks with Microsoft Defender extended detection and response tools, and including orchestrated organization-wide security information and event management (SIEM) from Microsoft Sentinel.
products: Azure Monitor, Microsoft Purview Information Protection, Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Everseen and NVIDIA create seamless shopping experience that benefits the bottom line
executive_summary: Shrinkage, or inventory loss, is a major problem that large retailers and grocers deal with every day. According to the National Retail Federation (NRF), the retail industry is losing more than $61 billion a year in North America alone. And it’s only getting worse—more than 23 percent of retailers have seen their shrink rate increase from 1.8 to 2 percent. So, if you have a $20 billion grocery retailer, with the industry shrink rate average, the company’s US business would have lost more than $4 billion a year to theft and other related losses.

title: St. Luke’s delivers exceptional, scalable service for providers and patients with Epic on Azure
executive_summary: St. Luke’s University Health Network has gained a reputation for using innovative technology to deliver services to patients and streamline operational procedures for employees. After beginning a cloud transformation by moving IT resources to Microsoft Azure, St. Luke’s embarked on a migration of its critically important Epic healthcare system. Through careful planning and a phased approach, it has successfully migrated 20 of 20 Epic environments to Azure. St. Luke’s benefits from its new platform’s increased scalability and the agility to quickly respond to acquisitions, upgrades, and changes in the healthcare market.
products: Azure, Azure Backup, Azure ExpressRoute, Azure NetApp Files, Azure Storage

title: NextBillion AI enables seamless location data services with Azure
executive_summary: NextBillion AI (NextBillion) is an industry-leading spatial data and AI platform that helps enterprises build, scale, and manage their own mapping ecosystem. The company enables enterprises to tackle highly complex location problems with the help of tailored location and navigation technology solutions. It offers location tools and APIs such as last-mile delivery, telematics, logistics, transport, food delivery, automotive, and ride-hailing/ride-sharing.

title: Cooperative Bank of Epirus transforms the user experience with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: The Cooperative Bank of Epirus is leading the social and economic development of the Epirus region, thanks to the greater efficiency and increased security of its financial services. With the help of Microsoft 365 solutions, it empowers its employees to commit to the development of local businesses and the prosperity of financial services customers.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive for Business

title: CIFC adopts agile Azure platform for mission-critical credit services
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: RBL Bank ushers in the new normal of work; collaborates more on Teams than pre-pandemic levels
executive_summary: RBL Bank is one of India’s leading private sector banks with an expanding presence across the country. The bank offers specialized services under five business verticals, namely: Corporate & Institutional Banking, Commercial Banking, Branch & Business Banking, Retail Assets and Treasury and Financial Markets Operations. It currently services over 10.66 million customers through a network of 500 branches; 1,424 business correspondent branches (of which 274 are banking outlets) and 407 ATMs spread across 28 Indian states and union territories. RBL Bank is listed on both NSE and BSE.
products: Microsoft 365 Enterprise, Power BI

title: Avans University of Applied Sciences turns learning into an interactive experience using Power Virtual Agents
executive_summary: Technology is transforming the education sector, increasingly helping teachers around the world to provide better, more interactive learning experiences. Dutch institution Avans Applied Science University is a prime example. Here, a law teacher (with no technical background) has recently created a simulation game designed to train students to handle a bankruptcy case as it would happen in real life. Built using Microsoft Power Platform, the game takes students through various steps of the case. All with the help of a chatbot created using Power Virtual Agents, which interacts with students and asks them legal questions.

title: Dah Chong Hong Electrical Appliance Division and Gilman gain speed, agility, security and readiness, Digital transform with Dynamics 365 ERP
executive_summary: Dah Chong Hong (DCH) Holdings knew that digital transformation was key to achieving its “One DCH” vision. DCH, an indirect wholly owned subsidiary of CITIC Limited, is an integrated trading and distribution company operating in Asia. Supported by an extensive logistics network, it is a leading distributor and dealer of motor vehicles in Greater China as well as a provider of a full range of associated services. DCH’s consumer business comprises the manufacture, retail and distribution of food, healthcare, electrical appliances, beauty and lifestyle products. It has over 16,500 staff and operations in 13 Asian markets. To position itself for future growth, meet the needs of its diverse business units and customer base, DCH chose Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations to serve as a base for the digitizing and streamlining operations across the group.

title: Tenable FEC transforms connectivity and collaboration with Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: Tenable Fire Engineering Consultancy (FEC) is a key player in the building industry, specializing in combining innovative fire engineering techniques with local codes and laws for optimized, cost-effective, and safe builds. With multiple locations and clients from across the globe, the company needed to create a secure and collaborative platform for smoother operations. Since deploying an Azure Virtual Desktop, employees can easily and securely access their desktops from anywhere, on any device.

title: Leading US hospice care provider creates centralized patient care coordination tool with Power Platform and Teams
executive_summary: VITAS Healthcare is a leading provider of hospice care in the United States, with operations in 14 states and the District of Columbia. Interdisciplinary teams—approximately 12,000 clinical and non-clinical professionals—work together to provide end-of-life care to more than 19,000 patients and their families every day. Using Microsoft Power Platform and Microsoft Teams, VITAS created a centralized digital patient care coordination platform to replace disparate paper-based workflows and improve patient care delivery.
products: Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI

title: Empowering staff to manage their wellbeing with Microsoft
executive_summary: AstraZeneca plc is a global, science-led biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines. The British-Swedish multinational pharmaceutical and biotechnology company is headquartered at the Cambridge Biomedical Campus in Cambridge, England and employs over 90,000 people worldwide. “At AstraZeneca our mission is to accelerate the delivery of life-changing medicines,” says Juliette White, VP Global SHE and Operations Sustainability at AstraZeneca. “So it’s no surprise that our priority is to ensure that our people feel healthy, safe and motivated”.

title: G&J Pepsi reflects on overcoming a ransomware attack, offers insights from the other side
executive_summary: G&J Pepsi-Cola Bottlers avoided both loss of data and ransom payment when a ransomware attack threatened the company in 2021. It refused to back down—and having avoided lasting harm, the company also resisted complacency. It used learnings from the experience to introduce a more proactive approach, deepen its existing processes, increase backup frequency, and more rigorously enforce policies. Microsoft Azure Backup is the solution that G&J Pepsi used to save the day, and it’s only one of the many Microsoft Security solutions that the company put in place. The value of its enhanced security posture: priceless.
products: Microsoft Teams

title: PwC builds multitenant enterprise decision support site with Power Pages
executive_summary: Big Four accounting firm PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) seized an opportunity to enhance service and build even more trust with its clients by migrating from its legacy client decision support system to an enterprise-grade, tech-enabled solution. The company chose to create a multitenant Microsoft Power Pages solution and was able to reimagine its data model by using Microsoft Dataverse with C# plugins to handle the business logic. In just six weeks, PwC successfully built the Cyber Technology Rationalizer site while gaining the benefits of low-code web development, including reducing costs and saving time. The team was able to reuse work done for the previous tool as code components in a Microsoft Power Apps component framework, which led to further time savings.
products: Azure, Dataverse, Power Apps, Power Pages

title: HELLENiQ ENERGY optimized its document signing process with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: Greece-based HELLENiQ ENERGY is one of Southeastern Europe’s leading energy groups, with a presence in six countries and activities spanning the energy value chain. To accelerate its digital transformation, the company needed to automate its vast Document Management processes. Together with Partner Team Candi, HELLENiQ ENERGY deployed a Microsoft Cloud-based system with DocuSign integration—shortening the document signing process from days to mere hours.

title: ABN AMRO migrates business-critical financial reporting to Azure for increased speed, flexibility, and control
executive_summary: As one of the Netherlands’ leading financial institutions, ABN AMRO knows how to make smart, data-driven decisions that maximize value and mitigate risk. The bank uses its expertise to deliver value to its customers, but it also applies its good sense to enhancing its own internal processes. As part of its crucial reporting requirements, the bank had a complicated workflow that depended on a host of on-premises systems, took a few days to complete, and was prone to delays. To gain greater flexibility and control over its reporting processes, ABN AMRO decided to migrate the workflow to the cloud, and it chose Microsoft Azure as its cloud infrastructure platform.
products: Azure, Azure ExpressRoute, Azure Monitor, Azure SQL Database, Azure Virtual Machines, Microsoft Sentinel

title: St. Luke’s delivers 360-degree patient view to access center agents with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: St. Luke’s University Health Network (St. Luke’s), which provides healthcare services in 300 locations across Pennsylvania and New Jersey, is undergoing a digital transformation by using Microsoft technology to enhance its access center experience. Tracking patient journeys across multiple calls and teams was an inefficient manual process for St. Luke’s employees. Now, St. Luke’s is modernizing this experience by connecting electronic health records from Epic to Microsoft Dynamics 365 and using other Microsoft tools to provide agents with better access to information. The organization aims to enhance access to its health network, improve patient satisfaction, and increase efficiency and engagement.
products: Azure, Microsoft Teams, Power BI

title: AVEVA gains greater visibility and enhanced management capabilities with Azure Arc
executive_summary: AVEVA develops and delivers digital tools that help companies work better, faster, and greener. Providing software solutions to industries as various and vital as the food and beverage industry, mining, manufacturing, chemicals, energy, and the utilities means that AVEVA’s IT environment needs to be as high performing and rock solid as possible. Accordingly, when the company determined it needed to better position itself for future growth by evolving from its on-premises environment to a cloud-first approach, it knew it needed a better way to centrally manage both infrastructures. AVEVA found the solution it needed with Microsoft Azure Arc.

title: Enabling safe, healthy & sustainable spaces with data-led innovative IoT platform
executive_summary: Morgan Sindall Property Services is a property maintenance provider with over 30 years of experience within the housing sector. The company provides planned and reactive maintenance to over 200,000 domestic properties.

title: Disrupting the industry: GitHub’s Copilot supercharged by insights from Microsoft Azure Data Explorer
executive_summary: When GitHub, the complete developer platform to build, scale, and deliver secure software, launched its AI tool for autocompleting code, it forever changed the way we write code. With over a million users and growing, Copilot needed a flexible, easily manageable real-time analytics service to make data-driven decisions. With Microsoft Azure Data Explorer (ADX), more than 500 GitHub employees can now run queries independently, securely, and quickly. “With faster access to insights, we can iterate and experiment faster and grow a multimillion-dollar business,” says Trevor Carnahan, Senior Director at GitHub.
products: Azure Data Explorer, Azure Functions, Power BI

title: GardaWorld helps unite, empower its globally distributed workforce with Microsoft Viva Connections
executive_summary: GardaWorld built a customized version of Microsoft Viva Connections and called it Teams-Connect, which is helping the security company reach a long-term goal to create a sense of engagement and inclusivity for its 120,000 or so frontline security officers at customer locations around the globe. Frontline security professionals can now receive company news, find information they need, provide feedback, and communicate among their teams using the new app, which deploys on their mobile phones and connects to the broader organization through GardaWorld’s Microsoft 365 communications and collaboration infrastructure.

title: SLB energizes collaboration across its global business with Teams and Teams Phone
executive_summary: When asked to describe the corporate culture at SLB, Sebastien Lehnherr, Chief Information Officer, doesn’t miss a beat. “Extremely, extremely innovative and collaborative,” he says. It’s no wonder the technology company prides itself on collaboration—the business has spent the last 90 years providing services to the energy industry, a truly global enterprise. “We operate in more than 120 countries around the world,” says Lehnherr. “Throughout our history, we have focused on growing our domain knowledge and driving innovation in the energy sector across all regions of the world.”
products: Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Teams Phone, Microsoft Viva, Power BI

title: Picanol Group finds flexibility and faster time to market with Azure Stack
executive_summary: The art of weaving tends to conjure up images of a slower, simpler time—of dedicated craftspeople using traditional techniques to make and trade textiles locally. But today, weaving is a thoroughly fast-paced and global business, with companies navigating shifting markets, using leading-edge technology, and scaling to meet worldwide demand. Picanol has been at the forefront of this business for the past 85 years. The Belgium-based weaving machine manufacturer delivers weaving technology to the textile industry and beyond. Additionally, Picanol Group offers engineered casting solutions within the company Proferro and the development and production of electronics at Psicontrol. To continue its tradition of transformation, the group launched its Factory 4.0 strategy and adopted the Azure Arc enabled infrastructure of Microsoft Azure Stack HCI to gain centralized management, flexibility, and faster time to market.

title: DealHub revolutionizes global sales engagement with Microsoft-powered CPQ
executive_summary: DealHub provides an all-in-one solution for managing companies' sales engagement touchpoints worldwide. Its cutting-edge configure, price, quote (CPQ) solution is powered by Microsoft Azure as the hosting service and operates within Microsoft Dynamics 365 for an intuitive user experience. By making the Microsoft-powered platform available on Azure Marketplace, DealHub offers businesses a comprehensive, easy-to-use solution that addresses multiple needs throughout the sales process while elevating digital customer experiences.
products: Azure, Azure Marketplace, Dynamics 365 Sales

title: Confiz Catalyzes SJS International's Digital Transformation with D365 Finance and Operations
executive_summary: SJS International, an eminent player in the beauty industry since 1998, offers a diverse range of cosmetics, personal care, and lingerie products across the globe, including popular brands like Rivaj and RIOS. With a huge network of 20,000+ stores, 5+ e-commerce platforms, and 65+ distributions for famous brands, SJS International is determined to pursue growth. However, their legacy system posed challenges, affecting financial visibility and supply chain operations. To address these issues, SJS International partnered with Confiz and implemented D365 Finance and Operations, to unlock its full potential and drive growth.

title: British Columbia’s Provincial Health Services Authority improves healthcare through better data access, insights with Azure
executive_summary: When Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA) began seeing the need to deliver faster, more comprehensive health insights to healthcare workers across British Columbia, it took action. Old, unstandardized requests were slowing data analysis and the sharing of insights. To standardize and speed data access, PHSA moved its healthcare analytics platform to Microsoft Azure, creating a readily accessible data analysis platform that is scalable and secure. Data requests that once took many months now take only days. Because of the sensitive nature of health data, PHSA has worked closely with Microsoft to make sure health data never leaves Canada and is kept highly secure.

title: Selfhelp delivers better health outcomes and reduces isolation for seniors with Azure Cloud Services
executive_summary: Selfhelp Community Services is an important social services provider in the New York area. In 2010, it created a pioneering online platform called enliveo to reach homebound seniors, offering access to a broad range of interactive programs. The platform started as a modest on-premises project, but in 2019, Selfhelp migrated the entire platform to the cloud with Microsoft Azure Cloud Services. Spurred into additional action by COVID-19, Selfhelp is using Azure to scale and expand its offerings, and enliveo is now available as a commercial service for other organizations.
products: Azure, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Cloud Services, Azure Disk Storage, Azure Monitor, Azure SQL Database, Azure Virtual Machines, Linux on Azure

title: The Church of Pentecost-UK serves communities, prepares for growth with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: The Church of Pentecost-UK's inconsistent mix of IT tools and infrastructure provided a barrier to collaboration and organizational growth. They turned to Microsoft 365 to work together on one platform. Staff and volunteers now communicate in one place, collect a single source of truth for data, and operate securely.

title: From “DX x Work Style Reform” to “DX x Data-Driven Management” - The current state of TIS’s “Internal DX” with Microsoft products.
executive_summary: TIS, part of the TIS INTEC Group, is developing its business into one of Japan’s IT leaders. As a business partner for over 3,000 companies in a wide variety of fields including finance, industry, government, and distribution services, the company delivers IT services to support their growth strategies. Today, is TIS leveraging industry knowledge and IT construction capabilities accumulated for over 50 years to support the DX (Digital Transformation) of society and companies, and is proactively developing its own DX as well.
products: Azure, Azure Synapse Analytics, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Entra ID, Power BI

title: From Vision to Reality: Expediting the Journey Towards 1 Million AEON Mobile App Members
executive_summary: AEON has become a popular department store in Hong Kong since its establishment in the city. In 2017, AEON embarked on its digital transformation journey with the launch of the AEON App and e-membership program. However, challenges remained in terms of functionality and user experience. To tackle these challenges, they utilized Microsoft Azure's scalability and security to revamp their app in 2022. As a result, they have experienced a significant 65% increase in their membership.

executive_summary: GardaWorld built a customized version of Microsoft Viva Connections and called it Teams-Connect, which is helping the security company reach a long-term goal to create a sense of engagement and inclusivity for its 120,000 or so frontline security officers at customer locations around the globe.
