title: Kantar Worldpanel Plus uses Azure Databricks to produce real-time shopper insights
executive_summary: Kantar’s new Worldpanel Plus service was planned to deliver insights about UK shopper behaviour. They opted for Microsoft Azure, running Azure Databricks and Azure Data Lake with additional Microsoft security and Power Platform tools. Worldpanel Plus launched in 2018. A large sample of shoppers now upload 100,000 receipts per day. This scalable solution enables Kantar to deliver UK shopper insights to the brands with which it works.
products: .NET, Azure, Azure App Service, Azure Data Studio, Azure Databricks, Azure Event Hubs, Azure Monitor, Azure Key Vault, Microsoft Sentinel, Power BI

title: TAS United protects caller data 24/7 with Azure-based Safetica data loss prevention
executive_summary: Come rain or shine, TAS United agents are there for their clients, handling customer calls around the clock. To ensure that sensitive caller information remains confidential, the company implemented Safetica's data loss prevention (DLP) solution, run on Microsoft Azure. It applies machine learning and automation features to detect and prevent data leaks and help TAS United meet strict compliance requirements. Delivered in the cloud, it eliminates the cost and hassle of maintaining physical servers while reducing the time spent on manual data monitoring by 41 percent.
products: Azure

title: UMS embraces more collaborative teaching with Microsoft 365 Education
executive_summary: Universiti Malaysia Sabah (UMS) is one of the leading higher education institutes in Malaysia. Staff and students were using apps and solutions ad hoc in conjunction with the university’s scattered legacy IT solutions. Seeking a more integrated technological approach, UMS deployed Microsoft 365 Education and transitioned to using Microsoft Outlook for email, Microsoft OneDrive data storage, and Microsoft Teams for communications. The move has helped the institute refocus its attention on student-centered learning.

title: Payoneer saves months in setting up call centers to offer speedy financial services using Cloud PC solution
executive_summary: For nearly 20 years, Payoneer has been a trailblazer in the global digital economy. The financial technology company empowers businesses with a platform to manage their financial transactions and funds, and to pay and get paid internationally in different currencies. Guy Winberg, the Global IT-Corp Group Manager, was looking for a more cost-effective and time-saving solution for deploying new and maintaining the company’s network of call centers. For this, Winberg and his team transitioned service agents to Windows 365 Cloud PCs, which enabled Payoneer to combine the power and security of the cloud with the versatility and simplicity of a PC.
products: Azure, Azure Virtual Desktop, Windows 365

title: Autotechnics relied on SoftwareOne in times of crisis
executive_summary: Autotechnics, one of the largest spare parts distributers in Ukraine, needed a more resilient infrastructure to keep their data accessible to customers, even during times of crisis.
products: Azure, Azure SQL Database, Azure Site Recovery

title: Se montrer sous son meilleur jour dans Microsoft Teams : L'Oréal et ModiFace introduisent le maquillage numérique dans les réunions
executive_summary: Jeff Houghton, Chief Executive Officer of ModiFace, describes his job as, “the coolest in the world.” At ModiFace, a company that creates augmented reality technology for the beauty industry, Houghton and his colleagues spend their days bringing futuristic technology to everyday situations. “I get to take something that’s so digital, so cutting-edge, and make that tangible for people,” says Houghton. In a sign of its commitment to creating exceptional digital experiences, global beauty company L'Oreal acquired Modiface, enabling it to bring world-class digital try-on capabilities to its customers. “ModiFace partners with more than 30 L’Oréal brands in more than 100 countries, and we work with over 50 retail partners. Our goal is to meet customers wherever they are,” says Houghton.
products: Microsoft 365 Enterprise, Microsoft Teams

title: BWT Alpine F1 Team creates a performant, data-driven culture with Power BI
executive_summary: In the world of Formula 1 racing, championships are decided by tenths of seconds, and teams must find any competitive edge they can. For BWT Alpine F1 Team, gaining a competitive advantage required adopting technology that could uncover opportunities their opponents might miss. The team knew key answers lay in their data, but disparate sources and manual entry errors made this data unreliable. Using Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management to track the supply chain for car parts and Power BI to analyze and visualize this data, BWT Alpine F1 Team was able to build a more unified data culture that promotes accuracy and transparency.

title: XContent lowers its customers’ cloud spend up to 32 percent with CloudMonitor
executive_summary: XContent Business Solutions is a trusted Microsoft Azure Cloud Service Provider, offering comprehensive solutions and technological innovations to address business challenges and foster growth. An evaluation of XContent’s cloud estate and those of its customers uncovered the need to understand and optimize resources to deliver unparalleled value to clients. By white labeling CloudMonitor as part of CloudSource, XContent achieved an all-encompassing perspective of the Azure framework, which in turn helped its customers to optimize their cloud spend, in some cases saving up to 32 percent.

title: Digitally ticked off: More safety and automated documentation of monitoring at BASF, thanks to digital checklists in Power Apps and Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Flammable, explosive, corrosive: wherever hazardous substances are processed, safety takes top priority to protect workers and the environment. As the world’s largest chemical company, BASF documents, monitors, and ensures the proper emptying of batches of chemicals—and detailed checklists are essential. This used to be a paper-based process, generating reams of completed lists that made it difficult to achieve transparency, both for the current emptying and filling job and for document checks. Today, BASF’s Xemium® plant uses a checklist app that is based on Power Platform and Microsoft Teams. The process is entirely paperless and supports automated document checks and audits.

title: Pazo improves operational efficiency for around 100 clients and 50,000 users with Microsoft
executive_summary: Pazo is a fast-growing, innovative technology company that offers an all-in-one, cost-effective operations-management platform for clients across a range of industries such as retail, facilities management, and mall management. Its innovative platform, also called Pazo, simplifies and automates workflows by delivering advanced automation, AI features, and complete visibility across processes and data.

title: ECS unlocks strategic advantage with generative AI in Power Platform
executive_summary: ECS, a leader in advanced technology, science, and engineering solutions, receives hundreds of performance ratings reports for its government contracts. To make it easier to manage and analyze these reports, the company developed an AI-driven document processing model using AI Builder in Power Automate.

title: Hellmann Worldwide Logistics improves lead generation and opportunity conversion by more than its target of 20 percent with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: With freight rates still sunk at pandemic levels, a global shipping giant needed to enable its sales and marketing functions to close more deals faster. Heavy drag from an outdated CRM system threatened to scuttle those efforts, but thirteen months later, the company is exceeding its targets with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales and Dynamics 365 Customer Insights.

title: EY enables video collaboration for its global workforce using Microsoft Stream
executive_summary: As a leader in Assurance, Advisory, Tax, Strategy and Transaction, the EY organization has a global footprint and a leading-edge vision for how all types of businesses can thrive, including its own. The company wanted to make videos a more prominent, dynamic part of how employees engage. “Our vision for videos is to boost retention, productivity, and innovation by helping drive engagement and more effective sharing of information among EY people,” explains Ed Chen, Enterprise Video Product Manager at EY Technology. In short, videos have the potential to bring a new dimension to how employees across the enterprise work, share knowledge, and excel on behalf of the business.

title: BWT Alpine F1 Team creates a performant, data-driven culture with Power BI
executive_summary: In the world of Formula 1 racing, championships are decided by tenths of seconds, and teams must find any competitive edge they can. For BWT Alpine F1 Team, gaining a competitive advantage required adopting technology that could uncover opportunities their opponents might miss. The team knew key answers lay in their data, but disparate sources and manual entry errors made this data unreliable. Using Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management to track the supply chain for car parts and Power BI to analyze and visualize this data, BWT Alpine F1 Team was able to build a more unified data culture that promotes accuracy and transparency.

title: Natuzzi uses Dynamics 365 to redefine the luxury furniture experience with a data-first approach
executive_summary: For more than 60 years, the Natuzzi name has been known for not just quality furniture, but beauty, craftsmanship, and comfort capable of enveloping the senses. The Natuzzi Group has grown from a manufacturer of sofas and armchairs to a globally hailed creator of exceptional luxury furniture that delivers a harmonious combination of design, function, aesthetics, and ethics.

title: Pfizer encourages employee well-being using Thrive Global for Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: As a global leader in the biopharmaceutical industry, Pfizer is in relentless pursuit of scientific breakthroughs and revolutionary medicines and vaccines that extend and significantly improve people’s lives.
products: Microsoft Teams

title: Korea Professional Sports Association Enhances Digital Transformation of Fan Culture through Flexible Data Management with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The Korea Professional Sports Association aims to elevate professional sports and foster a vibrant sporting environment. Their digital transformation leverages Dynamics 365 for real-time analysis and personalized fan engagement. Placing fans at the center drives increased satisfaction and loyalty, evident in notable sales results. Integrating various sports into a unified data environment promises to enhance fan experiences, nurturing a dynamic sports culture, supported by Dynamics 365's innovative capabilities.

title: Chemploy simplifies project invoicing time tracking in three months using Klynke Time Management time tracking integrated with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Dedicated to providing technical expertise for manufacturing, research, and development, Chemploy provides full-service chemical engineering for food, life sciences, and chemical industries in need of feasibility studies, process scale-up, and technical studies, as well as design and review of safety systems. Chemploy needed to upgrade its time-tracking and invoicing processes to enable better project management and address challenges with tracking hours, progress, and billing to deliver projects on time and within budget. The company found Klynke Time Management through Microsoft AppSource and determined the ease of transacting through the marketplace, combined with the solution’s efficient hourly booking on a project-specific basis and integration with Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Teams, perfectly aligned with Chemploy's commitment to deliver high-quality engineering solutions. Within three months of implementing Klynke Time Management, Chemploy increased the accuracy of its monthly accounts receivable reconciliation processes to almost 100 percent on the first attempt, drastically reducing invoice review time and increasing operational efficiency.

title: GraceKennedy uses Azure App Service to increase access to financial services through its GK ONE app in the Caribbean
executive_summary: The GraceKennedy Group (GraceKennedy), a conglomerate headquartered in Jamaica that offers food trading and financial services across several countries, used Microsoft Azure and Azure App Service to provide more efficient financial services to customers. Recently, GraceKennedy has focused on unifying its financial services and improving customer experiences with secure digital solutions. Working with Azure offerings, GraceKennedy created the GK ONE app to connect financial services—such as remittances, bill payments, banking, and insurance—in one easy-to-use space. Since its 2022 launch, the app has seen monthly double-digit percentage growth in transaction completion and has become the number one digital wallet for remittances in Jamaica.

title: NBA players are improving performance with AI on Azure AI infrastructure
executive_summary: The NBA Stats Team wanted to explore how AI could help them process data on all on-court players’ specific live body movements, analyzing things like speed, dunk height, number of passes and dribbles, and even injury risk, simultaneously. The team built a Microsoft Azure solution based on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) that can manage and process up to 16 gigabytes of raw data per game, not including RGB video signals—sometimes more if the game goes into overtime. The new solution is deployed and operational, and the data being collected is already helping the NBA better understand players’ strengths and weaknesses and improve their performance. The NBA aims to use Azure AI infrastructure to continue to build new learning models and support statistic overlays on viewer screens as they happen on-court.

title: CareStack redefines business outcomes for dentistry leveraging Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: CareStack is an end-to-end digital health platform in dentistry that connects dentists, payers, and patients seamlessly and provides them with intelligent tools to improve patient health outcomes and enhance operational efficiency for providers while reducing the total cost of care for payers. Their product philosophy is to do more features, build more intelligence, and handhold our customers at every step so that they get more time, control, and money.
products: Azure, Azure Developer Tools, Visual Studio

title: Beiersdorf has a clear view of its sustainability progress—thanks to Microsoft Azure, Power Platform, and a central data corpus
executive_summary: To set the company on a path that clearly benefits the environment and society, Beiersdorf launched its CARE BEYOND SKIN Sustainability Agenda, which features specific sustainability targets: achieve an absolute reduction of 30 percent in greenhouse gas emissions by 2025 along the entire value chain versus 2018 and make all packaging refillable, reusable, or recyclable by 2025. In order to make progress along this path transparent and measurable, precise KPIs are needed to obtain accurate data that reveals levers with maximum impact on these targets. Beiersdorf has therefore initiated a dedicated Sustainability Digitalization Program that uses a data analysis platform based on Microsoft Azure and Power Platform.

title: Datex debuts flexible supply chain software based on the Azure Stack and Azure Integration Services
executive_summary: Datex delivers mid-market and global third-party logistics providers a comprehensive range of warehouse management solutions that cater to their specific business process needs. To enhance scalability and dependability for fluctuating demands and expanding client requirements, Datex required an architectural redesign. Previously, fulfilling unique customer requirements involved time-intensive and costly solutioning. To address this, Datex developed Wavelength, an enterprise low-code application platform (LCAP), utilizing the Azure Stack and Azure Integration Services. This approach provided Datex with increased capability and adaptability, along with inherent scaling for various operational volumes.
products: Azure API Management, Azure Container Instances, Azure Event Grid, Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps, Azure Service Bus, Azure Stack, Power BI

title: Standard Bank of South Africa expands use of Power Platform to enterprise applications
executive_summary: Standard Bank, the largest bank in Africa, has developed over 1,500 Power Platform solutions for a variety of business needs, including enterprise applications for finance, operations, and HR. A Center of Excellence supports over 1,500 citizen developers across the bank’s global network. The bank is also looking to leverage the generative AI capabilities in Microsoft Copilot Studio and other Power Platform products.
products: Power Apps, Power Automate

title: Growing Dynamics 365 functionality is key for SiteOne’s green business
executive_summary: SiteOne Landscape Supply (NYSE: SITE) prides itself on being the green industry’s number one partner. With an annual revenue of more than $4 billion, over 7,000 vendors, and more than 150,000 unique items in inventory, it’s the largest distributor of wholesale landscaping, hardscaping, irrigation, lighting, nursery, and pest control products in the United States. In addition to more than 600 retail locations in the US and Canada, SiteOne has an e-commerce presence and ships or delivers directly to customer job sites. From urban gardens and residential landscaping to large-scale commercial development projects, SiteOne’s local experts understand regional and site-specific requirements and design aesthetics.
products: Dynamics 365

title: Automotive expert Eberspächer dismantles data silos: Dynamics 365 replaces old stand-alone solutions and creates transparency
executive_summary: Eberspächer has been producing particulate filters, acoustic systems, and heaters for cars for over 100 years. Today, the automotive supplier is active all around the world. As the company grew, so did its internal systems. The result was local isolated solutions, a lack of transparency, and data silos. Keeping pace with the times called for cross-location processes free of disruptions across all areas of the business. Eberspächer laid the foundations for this together with ORBIS SE, a member of the Microsoft Partner Network. Now, an integrated process platform based on Dynamics 365 offers transparent access to all customer information, more efficient customer contact, and real-time data retrieval.
products: Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Commerce, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Field Service, Dynamics 365 Remote Assist, Dynamics 365 Sales, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Copilot for Dynamics 365, Excel, Outlook

title: Godrej Consumer Products harnesses digital transformation with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Godrej Consumer Products Limited is a leading Indian multinational operating in personal and home care segments. It is part of over 125-year-old Godrej Group and has a legacy built on the values of trust, integrity, and respect. Godrej Consumer Products is a fast-growing, ambitious enterprise that is expanding its presence in emerging markets of Asia, Africa, and Latin America and bringing the goodness of health and beauty to consumers in these markets.
products: Azure, SAP on Azure, Power BI

title: MAIRE: Transforming the energy sector and an entire company culture with Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: MAIRE is a leading technology and engineering group that develops and implements innovative solutions to enable energy transition. The company’s thousands of engineers help build large installations and are also burdened with paperwork and other bureaucratic tasks. MAIRE decided to use Microsoft 365 Copilot to help automate and streamline routine and repetitive activities. In the first phase of adoption the organization was saving 800 working hours per month, and the saving has more than doubled since then and continues to grow. The team is also encouraging the widest possible uptake of the AI-powered app, using its 'Human in the Loop' portal, containing material related to Microsoft 365 Copilot and to its use cases.

title: CNH boosts customer loyalty with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: CNH Industrial (NYSE: CNHI) is a global leader in agriculture and construction equipment. It designs, produces, and sells machinery and services that help farmers and builders work sustainably. Founded in 1842 as the Racine Threshing Machine Works, today CNH Industrial (CNH) is a multinational company with 10 brands, including New Holland and CASE Construction Equipment, and more than 40,000 employees at 43 production facilities, 40 R&D centers, and 170 locations on five continents.
products: Dynamics 365 Finance, Dynamics 365 Sales

title: Dynamics 365 modernizes B3 Social's donation management, now directing efforts to volunteering
executive_summary: B3 Social, responsible for private social investment and volunteerism at B3, the Brazilian stock exchange, was able to customize a sales solution for social impact work, with a fully remote implementation and support from Nexer, a Microsoft partner company. The solution allowed for process automation, increasing the productivity of the operation, in addition to bringing a single database with simplified access, improving processes to fulfill the objective of contributing to the reduction of social inequalities in Brazil.

title: CSN deploys Company Communicator and reaches 35,000 users with its corporate communication using Microsoft 365
executive_summary: With a strategic partnership between CSN, Microsoft, and partners, following a Microsoft 365 implementation process, the Brazilian multinational was able to expand its licensing in terms of resources and number of users, and through Company Communicator, built CSNews, a new, customizable, user-friendly communication channel with constant monitoring and updates. The partnership is already looking towards the next step: expanding the solution with security features.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365 E3, Microsoft 365 F1, Microsoft Teams

title: Carlsberg saves time, improves employee experience with Windows 11 and Autopilot, boosts efficiency and security
executive_summary: Carlsberg is a brewer headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, dating back to 1847. Today, the business employs more than 31,000 people and oversees 140 brands in more than 125 markets globally. Carlsberg embraced Windows 11 Enterprise, Microsoft Intune, Windows 365, and Windows Autopilot to usher in a modernized, more flexible era of work at the company. Today, the business provides highly secure employee experiences, streamlined onboarding, and saves 30 minutes per device while provisioning.
products: Microsoft 365 Enterprise, Microsoft 365 Frontline Worker, Microsoft Intune, Windows Autopilot, Windows Hello, Windows 11, Windows 365

title: Manchester Met reduces up to 50% of its network footprint with Azure VMware Solution
executive_summary: Manchester Metropolitan University faced the imminent end of support for its on-premises VMware infrastructure. Because of the university’s existing licensing, Microsoft Azure VMware Solution stood out due to cost benefits and value-added services. The university moved 80% of its servers to Azure VMware Solution within eight months while also consolidating a datacenter from 25 to seven comms racks. It achieved a 43% reduction in essential servers and cut its on-premises footprint by up to half. Manchester Met’s IT staff embraced cloud concepts and report improved performance across migrated applications, databases, and servers. The university now prioritizes Azure-native solutions, marking a major shift in its approach to technology.

title: EY automates customer payment processing using Power Platform, saving 230,000 hours annually
executive_summary: As a leading professional services organization, EY works with more than 200,000 clients in 150 countries. The company used Power Platform to develop an application that automatically matches and clears incoming payments in SAP, resulting in an increase from 30% to 80% in automatically cleared payments and 95% matched payments. The estimated annual time savings for EY is 230,000 hours globally.
products: Power Apps, Dataverse, Power BI

title: Cosmo Energy Holdings gains ESG insights with Microsoft Cloud for Sustainability
executive_summary: With environmental, social, and governance reporting requirements changing all the time, Cosmo Energy Holdings needed a way to take its ESG reporting from siloed and inefficient to something more systemized, automated, and flexible.

title: Bank of Queensland evolves operations, delivers business value with Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: Bank of Queensland wanted to launch a digital modernization strategy to ensure agility and resilience, build and scale for the future, and support its customer-first approach to business.

title: Evergrowth accelerates sales growth with Microsoft Clipchamp
executive_summary: Evergrowth specializes in a Customer Intelligence platform that enables B2B sales team to operate AI-driven agents across the sales funnel. As a young company, it was focused on acquiring new customers and differentiating itself from competitors.

title: Retail consulting firm transforms project management using app created with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: R3 Retail Development is a family-owned project management consulting firm that now runs its business on Microsoft Power Platform. The company was able to fully automate its project management processes by using a combination of Microsoft Power Apps, Power Automate, and Common Data Service.

title: Revolutionising healthcare with Microsoft Teams and MedXnote
executive_summary: University Hospital Southampton NHS Foundation Trust (UHS) with 11,000 staff, providing services to  1.3 million people living in Southampton and south Hampshire. It also provides specialist services such as neurosciences, cardiac services and children's intensive care to more than 3 million people in central southern England and the Channel Islands.

title: Lockheed Martin builds for the next stage in human space exploration with Microsoft HoloLens 2
executive_summary: Lockheed realized it needed mixed reality to address the needs of the building process, and to help streamline instruction delivery and to empower accurate, efficient building processes. Lockheed Martin decided to use Microsoft HoloLens 2 to address these needs. With augmented reality, and the help of HoloLens, the company can focus less on the minutia of construction and error management and more on designing and empowering the next generation of deep space travel.
products: HoloLens

title: The Miami Dolphins give fans the information they want when they want it with Power Virtual Agents
executive_summary: The Miami Dolphins, well known for football, also own Hard Rock Stadium, which hosts a wide range of sports and entertainment events. With so much going on, the Dolphins need to handle a high volume of requests for information about events and facilities. To free its service agents from repeatedly answering routine questions, the organization used Microsoft Power Virtual Agents to build a chatbot that’s now available at all times on its web properties. Multi-authoring capabilities make it easy for subject matter experts to update the bot themselves so that visitors always get current, accurate information. So far, the bot has handled more than 40,000 conversations and has successfully resolved 97 percent of them, leaving the remainder to service agents, who now have more time to focus on delivering exceptional service and increasing ticket sales.

title: Motionlab creates personalized videos on Azure to engage shoppers and increase brand loyalty
executive_summary: Motionlab is a tech company based in the Czech Republic that also has a presence in the Western Europe, Middle East and East Asia. With a platform developed on the Azure cloud, the company enables brands and agencies to create personalized marketing videos. The platform offered Motionlab the scalability and data security it needed to service its clients well. The video creation platform is easily integrated with tools for emailing, messaging, as well as CRMs, allowing clients to craft videos based on real customer information and seamlessly deliver these to emails, mobiles, apps, etc. The results have led to high conversion rates and increased brand loyalty for its clients.

title: Inclusion Scotland shows that disabled people can do so much more with Microsoft
executive_summary: “Microsoft technology makes sure that disabled people do not feel they’re a burden,” says Raj Jeyaraj, Head of Operations at Inclusion Scotland.

title: BNY Mellon brings industry-leading technology innovation to wire payments system with Azure
executive_summary: BNY Mellon holds an important position in the global financial infrastructure that sees the bank process trillions of dollars in wire payments daily. For global markets and economies to operate in a resilient, orderly manner, they rely on BNY Mellon’s infrastructure. To ensure resiliency in the face of dramatic usage spikes like those the bank saw early in the COVID-19 pandemic, and to safeguard the trust of its customers, BNY Mellon has added cloud capabilities to its wire payments infrastructure with Microsoft Azure. The bank has been able to add this extra capacity without compromising the user experience, and BNY Mellon anticipates that the success of the deployment will spur further innovation and maintain the bank’s technology leadership position in the industry.
products: Azure

title: Dreaming of making great strides as a global blockchain game company, Wemade is enjoying solid success in the global market as well as Korea
executive_summary: Founded in 2000, Wemade is Korea’s leading game developer with recorded sales of KRW 561 billion, a 344% increase year-on-year, as well as an operating profit of KRW 326 billion for 2021. Wemade, loved by global fans for its great game services, is solidifying its status as a leading game company with the worldwide success of Mir 4, which was released in 2020.
products: Azure, Azure Cache for Redis, Azure Data Explorer, Azure SQL Database

title: Mada Center transforms education for persons with disabilities with Microsoft Education tools
executive_summary: Based in Qatar, the Mada Center optimizes technology to create digital accessibility for persons with disabilities. One of its main projects, the Mada Innovation Lab, showcases a model classroom in partnership with Microsoft. The creative space features Surface Go and Surface Pro devices combined with Microsoft 365 Education, Hacking STEM, and Minecraft Education programs. This state-of-the-art and fully inclusive classroom embraces assistive technology to create an equal and inclusive opportunity for all students to learn.

title: Taiwanese Leading Fastener Company Creates New Momentum Through Digital Transformation
executive_summary: Anchor Fasteners was founded in 1986. Anchor Fasteners’ digital transformation enables to deliver high quality fasteners and helps reduce downtime. The company takes advantage of Microsoft Azure IoT, Dynamics 365, AI and various data services to increase the overall OEE by 15%, the machine utilization rate by 12%, shorten the downtime by 17%, and improve the production efficiency and yield to win more orders.
products: Azure, Azure IoT Edge, Dynamics 365, Power Automate

title: IT solutions company keeps its business growing with up-skilling programs and Azure-based offerings
executive_summary: Established in 1993 in Zagreb, Croatia, Span is an IT solutions company that helps power up the global presence of businesses of all sizes around the world. Span supports its customers in their digital transformations, paving the way for a successful digital future. The company has built a strategic partnership with Microsoft over 30 years, enabling Span to help customers get the most out of digital technology and tools. Aside from offering Azure-based cloud and security services, Span also provides customers with 24/7 support and service management as well as employee up-skilling programs.

title: Minecraft supports equitable STEM education for Florida schools
executive_summary: Duval County Public Schools created a Minecraft Lab to help teachers from across the district learn how to use Minecraft: Education Edition through classroom field trips. As a result of this innovative program, the school district has trained educators in game-based learning and expanded its STEM programs, leading to deeper engagement and new career pathways for underserved students.

title: Senco Gold and Diamonds delivers a sparkling customer experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Senco Gold and Diamonds is one of India's oldest and most trusted jewelry brands with a legacy of more than 50 years. It is among the most prominent jewelry retail players in India's eastern and north region and has over 130 stores across the nation. The 50+ year old brand is blending handcrafted art and craftsmanship with technology and believes in leveraging the latest digital tech to stay ahead of the curve in jewelry and retail sector. It has an ever-growing consumer base and caters to their diverse demands through its omni-channel approach.
products: Dynamics 365 Commerce, Dynamics 365 Finance

title: From parking app to all-round mobility solution: Parkl drives sustainability with Azure
executive_summary: Parkl helps over 100,000 customers in Hungary quickly locate, find and pay for parking spaces, EV chargers, or other services through its mobile app. Having been supported by the Microsoft for Startups program from day one, Parkl decided to scale up its mobility solutions by migrating to Azure. The move enabled the company to connect 10 times more devices through the IoT Hub, enhancing service efficiency and user experience. With sustainability at its core, Parkl paves the way towards smart city initiatives and international expansion.

title: isLucid scales AI-powered digital meeting assistant for Microsoft Teams with Azure Marketplace
executive_summary: Lithuanian startup isLucid built an AI digital meeting assistant to help companies have more productive meeting outcomes.  After creating its first product for Microsoft Teams, isLucid grew its business by joining Microsoft for Startup programs, leveraging valuable expertise and resources. By introducing its app on Microsoft Azure Marketplace, isLucid gained customers from more than 40 countries in six months. The company has since helped people save up to 25 percent of time spent on meetings.
products: Azure, Azure Marketplace, Microsoft Teams

title: Metrikus innovates on Microsoft Azure to make buildings more efficient and sustainable
executive_summary: “We need to look at sustainability and we need to give people the data to make more informed decisions about their building,” says Michael Grant, COO & Co-Founder at Metrikus.

title: Komatsu Australia achieves end-to-end automation with Power Automate
executive_summary: Komatsu Australia is the Australian subsidiary of Komatsu, an industry-leading manufacturer of construction, forestry, and mining equipment.  When the parts department at Komatsu Australia struggled to manually process nearly 52,000 invoices annually, it used Power Automate and AI Builder to automate its invoice processing workflow. The solution was developed in just three weeks, saving over 300 labor-intensive manual entry hours for a single supplier alone. Because of this success, Komatsu Australia also launched their own citizen developer program, to inspire and empower employees to build their own business solutions. The program, which has begun with its first cohort since the pilot, is helping divisions and departments across Komatsu to innovate quickly and to streamline processes and improve efficiency through automation and digitisation.
products: Azure SQL Database, Azure Synapse Analytics, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Copilot Studio, Power Automate, SharePoint

title: Telefónica takes control of connectivity data for 10M+ home routers with an Azure IoT–based platform
executive_summary: For 99 years, Telefónica has thrived as a telecommunications provider by exploring the use of the latest technology to streamline business growth and satisfy customer demand. The company recently built a new service delivery and communications platform called Home Advanced Connectivity (HAC) that enables operations and customer services teams for the first time to have real-time, bidirectional data flows between customers’ in-home gateway devices and the Telefónica cloud at scale. Developed on the Microsoft Azure IoT platform, HAC simplifies and enhances connectivity management by overcoming technical barriers previously posed by third-party agents that were required to run on the routers. Today, 4.5 million devices process 6.5 billion messages per day, with plans to easily scale to 20 million devices in the next few years. The solution has streamlined device management across this huge install base and enabled new opportunities to rapidly develop and deliver new value-added services.

title: Rolls-Royce innovates with Power Platform to drive efficiencies
executive_summary: Rolls-Royce pioneers cutting-edge technologies in the areas of aerospace, defence and electrical and power systems. It has placed the transition to net zero at the heart of everything that it does and, as part of that, aims to deliver the cleanest, safest and most competitive solutions to our planet’s vital power needs.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI

title: Hi Rez Studios leverages Terraform and Azure to scale gaming platforms
executive_summary: Up through 2018, Hi-Rez Studios ran its core game platform on-premises and at co-location facilities. To achieve the scalability needed for Rogue Company, its latest game, Hi-Rez Studios moved its core platform to Azure Kubernetes Service and Azure SQL, using Kafka for messaging, HashiCorp Terraform for deployment, and GitHub for source control and collaboration. Since then, Hi-Rez Studios has adopted several additional Azure services, open-source solutions, and HashiCorp tools—giving the company a scalable DevOps environment that is benefiting both the company’s centralized back-end services team and its portfolio of game studios.

title: Vietnamese bank builds the country’s first cloud-native mobile banking app on Azure
executive_summary: Vietnam International Joint Stock Commercial Bank (VIB) has a decades-long track record of providing innovative, customer-centric service in Vietnam. The bank was one of the first one in the region to move to digital banking, and in 2021, worked with Microsoft to deploy a multi-cloud ecosystem (the first in Vietnam’s banking sector). An Azure cloud now hosts many VIB applications, including MyVIB 2.0, Vietnam’s first cloud-native mobile banking application.

title: Georgian Ministry of Education leverages remote admin control for school laptops with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: The Ministry of Education, Science, Culture, and Sport of Georgia continues to follow its mission to create a modern and innovative educational environment. However, the ministry needed administrative solutions to remotely manage students’ laptops better after creating virtual classes and game-based learning with Microsoft 365 tools. The institution optimized its IT by implementing Microsoft Intune, Windows Autopilot, and Windows 11. With the new tools, laptops can be connected, cleaned, and repaired remotely. Robust cybersecurity policies also enable to protect children’s personal data when they’re browsing online from home.

title: Senco Gold and Diamonds delivers a sparkling customer experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Senco Gold and Diamonds is one of India's oldest and most trusted jewelry brands with a legacy of more than 50 years. It is among the most prominent jewelry retail players in India's eastern and north region and has over 130 stores across the nation. The 50+ year old brand is blending handcrafted art and craftsmanship with technology and believes in leveraging the latest digital tech to stay ahead of the curve in jewelry and retail sector. It has an ever-growing consumer base and caters to their diverse demands through its omni-channel approach.

title: Telefónica takes control of connectivity data for 10M+ home routers with an Azure IoT–based platform
executive_summary: For 99 years, Telefónica has thrived as a telecommunications provider by exploring the use of the latest technology to streamline business growth and satisfy customer demand. The company recently built a new service delivery and communications platform called Home Advanced Connectivity (HAC) that enables operations and customer services teams for the first time to have real-time, bidirectional data flows between customers’ in-home gateway devices and the Telefónica cloud at scale. Developed on the Microsoft Azure IoT platform, HAC simplifies and enhances connectivity management by overcoming technical barriers previously posed by third-party agents that were required to run on the routers. Today, 4.5 million devices process 6.5 billion messages per day, with plans to easily scale to 20 million devices in the next few years. The solution has streamlined device management across this huge install base and enabled new opportunities to rapidly develop and deliver new value-added services.

title: PMC Hydraulics Group migrates to the cloud and transforms with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: PMC Hydraulics Group (PMC), with roots all the way back to 1957, is the leading Nordic provider of complete solutions in the PMC—Power, Motion, and Control—segment. The company designs, develops, builds, and markets everything from hydraulic components for lifting tables to complex, turnkey hydraulic systems for wind power and the offshore industry. The company has operations in Sweden, Finland, Denmark, Poland, Estonia, Latvia, China, and India, with sales around the world.

title: Quintet Private Bank drives trust and security across its customer base using Microsoft Sentinel and Microsoft 365 Defender (XDR)
executive_summary: As one of Europe’s leading wealth management institutions, Quintet Private Bank knows just how important data protection and cybersecurity are to establish trust amongst its customers. While devising a cloud strategy, the company saw an opportunity to build a future-proof SOC (Security Operations Center) powered by Microsoft Sentinel and Microsoft 365 Defender (XDR). Created in collaboration with partner NVISO and Microsoft, the platform has radically transformed the way Quintet approaches security – helping it to stay even more on top of its customers’ data and assets.

title: Sportisimo accelerates international growth with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Sportisimo, the leader among Czech sporting goods retailers, is expanding the number of customers within and beyond its national borders. In the past, opening a new branch abroad involved complex integration and alignment of disjointed software systems. Adopting Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance has cleared the way for a smooth expansion into other markets. With simplified technology stack, Sportisimo now needs only three to four months to expand to a new country from an ERP perspective, down from 14 months before.

title: Scottish Water uses Copilot for Microsoft 365 to eliminate mundane tasks and free up time for work that really matters
executive_summary: Water is the planet’s most precious resource. It is life. In Scotland, Scottish Water’s 4,500 people provide water and wastewater services to 2.6 million households. In addition to field operations and the treatment works themselves, digitalisation plays a big role at Scottish Water: it helps the company to analyse the water cycle and better understand water demand. This crucial work is often interrupted by tedious tasks that keep people from doing what they love most—delivering safe drinking water to Scotland’s homes and recycling waste water in ways that are good for the environment. Reducing mundane tasks to a minimum, and thus freeing up time for employees to work on the more meaningful tasks, makes for an even more motivated workforce. This is exactly what Scottish Water achieved when it implemented Copilot for Microsoft 365.

title: Dentsu drives creativity and growth for brands, supported by Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: With a storied 120-year history and 72,000 employees, dentsu is revered as one of the top creative media companies in the world, with a reputation for being innovation specialists as much as they are marketing and transformation experts. Dentsu’s agency teams are powered by data, tech, and generative AI. One of the big challenges dentsu clients face is demand for content on a growing number of channels, which means dentsu must keep its creativity ahead of this rapid pace of change to build experiences that resonate with its clients and drive brand engagement. Microsoft Copilot is revolutionizing creative workflows, supporting dentsu’s talent, and helping to rethink services. By reducing and removing tactical tasks, dentsu employees can focus on the strategic part of their work – collaborating creatively to build brands and engage consumers.
products: Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams

title: Visma: shaping the future of the software sector by innovating with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Visma is a leading European software provider based in Norway. The owner of more than 170 companies across the continent, Visma sees cloud technology as key to its success and that of its entire ecosystem. Over the past few years, it has been pushing for cloud adoption both at an internal level and across its wider network – encouraging all companies in its group to embrace the cloud they prefer, at their own terms. Microsoft Azure has been a pivotal part of this process. At Visma, it has formed part of a multi-cloud platform and beyond, and it’s getting selected by hundreds of other companies in the Visma group as primary cloud provider.
products: Azure, Azure SQL Database

title: The Domino's Difference: Uniting more than 100,000 frontline workers with Microsoft Teams and Viva Engage
executive_summary: Collaboration is a team sport at Domino’s Pizza Enterprises Limited (DPE), the largest master franchisee for the United States Domino’s Pizza brand in the world. The company’s culture revolves around the motto “sell more pizza, have more fun,” translating into a dynamic employee experience that encourages hard work, boldness, and ambitious goals while emphasizing connection with colleagues and celebrating victories together.
products: Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Viva, Microsoft Viva Engage

title: How Microsoft customer service and support agents become super agents with Copilot in Dynamics 365 Customer Service
executive_summary: Microsoft rolled out Microsoft Copilot in Dynamics 365 Customer Service to its customer service and support agents in 2023. Here, three support agents share their stories about how Copilot helps them be more productive, respond to customers with insight and empathy, and better balance their personal and professional lives.

title: Scottish Water uses Copilot for Microsoft 365 to eliminate mundane tasks and free up time for work that really matters
executive_summary: Water is the planet’s most precious resource. It is life. In Scotland, Scottish Water’s 4,500 people provide water and wastewater services to 2.6 million households. In addition to field operations and the treatment works themselves, digitalisation plays a big role at Scottish Water: it helps the company to analyse the water cycle and better understand water demand. This crucial work is often interrupted by tedious tasks that keep people from doing what they love most—delivering safe drinking water to Scotland’s homes and recycling waste water in ways that are good for the environment. Reducing mundane tasks to a minimum, and thus freeing up time for employees to work on the more meaningful tasks, makes for an even more motivated workforce. This is exactly what Scottish Water achieved when it implemented Copilot for Microsoft 365.

title: O2 Czech Republic boosts productivity and streamlines meetings with Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: O2 Czech Republic is leading the way in workplace productivity and communication dynamics. With its early adoption of Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365, O2 has seen a significant decrease in time spent on administrative tasks. Instead of manually drafting meeting summaries and action points, employees now use Copilot to automatically generate the information they need. The move has revolutionized how information is shared and has made automation a part of daily work at the telco giant.

title: Copilot for Microsoft 365: Saving time and money and enhancing wellbeing for Atos employees and customers
executive_summary: In its ongoing quest to shape what the digital future holds for its clients, Atos is fully committed to giving them the most innovative solutions and making their digital transformation smooth and seamless. Its biggest challenge in all of this is to optimize workplace processes in terms of both efficiency and cost optimization, all with the aim of driving employee engagement. A group of selected Atos employees was recently given the chance to try out Copilot for Microsoft 365 for themselves. And the verdict? The AI program demonstrated just how crucial it can be in everyday processes and quickly established itself as a key partner in employee wellbeing. With Copilot for Microsoft 365, trialing is believing.

title: Avocados From Mexico and Lantern automate processes using Microsoft Fabric to reduce weekly reporting time by up to 95%
executive_summary: Nonprofit marketing organization Avocados From Mexico (AFM), which works to drive demand for Mexican avocados in the United States, used Microsoft Fabric to centralize disparate data sources and create a single, trustworthy place where employees can access data for reporting and analytics. The group found it difficult to produce accurate, efficient reports due to fragmented data and manual processes. AFM worked with Lantern, a Microsoft partner and Microsoft-only consulting firm, to implement Fabric and create a secure, accessible source of truth. Now, employees can create reliable reports quickly, so leaders can make better data-driven decisions. AFM has significantly increased productivity and reduced costs by automating processes.

title: Globo empowers employees and automates all areas of the business with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: Globo has undergone a digital transformation, with the standardization of its communication and collaboration, as well as a broad use of low code solutions to automate various processes, going from human resources to other core areas of the company, such as entertainment and journalism. After empowerment journeys and a Hackathon that accelerated this process, the company created a Center of Excellence to handle the high volume of applications created by technology-empowered contributors.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, SharePoint

title: L’Oréal enhances beauty tech using Azure, delivers customers more personalized beauty experiences
executive_summary: L’Oréal’s aim is to be the leader in beauty tech, using advanced technology to bring more interactive, personalized beauty experiences to its diverse customer base. The Group also wanted to streamline its internal operations and data processing to facilitate empowered employee experiences, including better access to data to help it make the best creative and strategic decisions. L’Oréal decided to work with Microsoft Azure to help enhance its multicloud strategy. With Azure, the company has extended cloud capabilities when it comes to infrastructure as a service, and also platform as a service and AI, setting the stage for continued innovation. In addition, the beauty giant is using SAP on Azure to help streamline its manufacturing, supply chain, sales and distribution, and finance capabilities, accelerating market responsiveness to emerging beauty trends. Azure is also supporting innovative customer experiences, like virtual try-ons and personalized skincare assessments.

title: ESW embraces innovation and more efficient coding with GitHub Copilot
executive_summary: Based in Dublin, Ireland, ESW unlocks cross-border ecommerce success for the world’s best-loved brands. It provides localized checkouts that boost conversion rates, solutions that simplify complex logistics, duties and taxes, and a dedicated client-partner approach that provides data-driven strategies to ensure profitable growth.  As part of its work, the company is looking to empower more than 150 of its developers with AI. After a two-stage trial period, the organization deployed GitHub Copilot, and successfully promoted its adoption through a training program.

title: Investec yields high productivity returns with Microsoft Copilot for Sales
executive_summary: From its founding in Johannesburg in 1974 as a small finance company to the international bank and wealth manager it is today, Investec has always believed that strong partnerships and understanding are essential to creating enduring worth for its clients. With 8,500 employees in 40 cities on 5 continents, Investec’s offerings include private banking and bespoke investment management services for high-net-worth individuals, business banking, foreign exchange and risk management, and import and logistics solutions for entrepreneurs and corporations, and cash, investment, and foreign exchange management for financial advisors, attorneys, accountants, and other intermediaries.
products: Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Sales, Microsoft Copilot for Sales, Microsoft Teams, Outlook

title: Okuma stays on the forefront of technology with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Okuma knows that “maximizing productivity is the name of the game” for their customers, and is committed to continually investing in technologies, solutions, and services to help its customers succeed. Okuma provides automation solutions and cutting-edge machine tools and technologies to help its customers grow and thrive. Much of the same can be said about Microsoft and Dynamics 365—cutting edge solutions to unify data, streamline processes, and automate tasks made Dynamics 365 the natural partner for Okuma’s digital transformation.

title: Empowering excellence: Sonepar leverages Microsoft Dynamics 365 to offer the best omnichannel experience
executive_summary: How to ensure a swift, impactful digital transition towards omnichannel processes when a firm is implanted in 40 countries? This is the challenge faced by Sonepar. This independent, family-owned company specializes in Business to Business (B2B) distribution of electrical products, solutions and related services. Founded in 1969, Sonepar is the global leader in the market.
products: Azure Cloud Services, Dynamics 365 Customer Insights - Data, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Sales

title: Banco Pichincha integrates Microsoft Power Platform as part of the transformation of its business culture
executive_summary: Banco Pichincha began the path to digitization seeking to improve processes in different areas of the business in line with its cultural transformation. With the implementation of nearly 50 different Power Apps, the Peruvian bank achieved a return on its IT investment of 285%, thus reducing the average amount of employee time spent on routine tasks by more than 2,000 hours.
