title: DENSO deploys Microsoft 365 accounts for 22,000 factory employees in workstyle reform
executive_summary: On-site employees faced challenges such as ‘disconnection from internal information,’ ‘increased workload due to paper-based tasks,’ and ‘decline in employee engagement’.

title: VIVID provides a better customer experience with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: VIVID began a digitalisation programme in 2022 with the goal of improving customer services and creating a new digital channel for customers.

title: Enova boosts cybersecurity with Microsoft 365 and Azure, lowering costs and enhancing operational efficiency
executive_summary: Enova, an energy and facilities management provider, struggled with a fragmented cybersecurity landscape, having to rely on up to a dozen solutions. It lacked a holistic view through single pane of glass.

title: The Global FoodBanking Network improves food access with Sustainability Manager
executive_summary: The Global FoodBanking Network needed reliable emissions data to scale operations and attract donors, but manual reporting was time-consuming and resource intensive.

title: Singing River helps clinicians streamline workflows with Dragon
executive_summary: Singing River needed to upgrade its legacy speech recognition system to access enhanced functionality, simplify application deployment and management, and help clinicians work more efficiently and effectively.
products: Azure

title: NFL Players Association scores a win with smart data plays
executive_summary: The National Football League Players Association (NFLPA) constantly looks for ways to better serve its members—current and former NFL players—during and after their football careers. With a new player management system built on Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Azure, the NFLPA can quickly mine player data to find licensing and marketing opportunities for more players. By using these cloud platforms, the NFLPA can quickly scale its systems and reduce capital and maintenance costs, freeing staff to develop new member services.
products: Azure, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Sales

title: H&R Block delivers scalable, multichannel tax preparation services with Microsoft SQL Server 2017
executive_summary: The tax industry has changed a lot recently, and H&R Block made plans to stay ahead of the changes, providing seamless multichannel experiences and unifying its disparate data sources to better serve its customers. By moving its various workloads to Microsoft SQL Server 2017 and Microsoft Azure and using Azure data services, the tax provider has been able to enhance service delivery, scale to meet its peaks in demand, and accelerate innovation.

title: Toyota manufacturing group uses Dynamics 365 mixed reality to boost operational efficiency and scalability
executive_summary: Toyota Motor North America (TMNA) has tens of thousands of team members producing more than a million vehicles each year in the United States, Canada, and Mexico. Ensuring that all team members know how to assemble the latest models requires a robust training program that includes substantial onboarding and classroom guidance in a setting where trainees can learn without interrupting production processes. To make training more efficient, repeatable, and effective, TMNA is using Microsoft Dynamics 365 Guides and Dynamics 365 Remote Assist on Microsoft HoloLens 2. Trainers can quickly and easily create, update, and deliver content to multiple trainees at the same time, and the company can track their progress to identify opportunities to optimize training. When real-time expert support is needed, team members can also quickly connect with a remote expert using Dynamics 365 Remote Assist, which enables 3D annotations right in their real-world work environment. Finally, TMNA took advantage of mixed reality layout capabilities to accurately plan the installation of new equipment on the busy factory floor.
products: Dynamics 365 Guides, Dynamics 365 Remote Assist, HoloLens, Power BI

title: Digital health provider creates a scalable unification platform for healthcare and life science with Azure-based technology
executive_summary: When a group of visionary clinicians and technologists came together to solve multiple healthcare issues—scalability, security, and increased access to care—they created an original and highly effective digital health solution. Transitioning from startup to growth, Rx.Health turned to Microsoft Azure as the foundational platform for its digital health unification solution. With the potential to help more patients on a more granular level at an unprecedented scale and with the possibility for health systems to save $1 million per service line, the company is charting a winning course.

title: Clean Energy Fuels runs greener, boosts efficiency with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Commercial heavy- and medium-duty trucks, waste collection vehicles, and public transportation all run on renewable natural gas from Clean Energy—a sustainable, carbon-neutral fuel. Clean Energy innovates constantly, using cutting-edge solutions for every facet of its operations. It trusts Microsoft Dynamics 365 to support its growth and its mission. Clean Energy added Microsoft Dynamics 365 Remote Assist and HoloLens to close the loop on information, from back office to the pump, accelerating productivity and cutting down on company travel.
products: Azure, Azure Data Lake Analytics, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure IoT Central, Azure IoT Edge, Azure Internet of Things, Dynamics 365 Field Service, Dynamics 365 Finance, Dynamics 365 Guides, Dynamics 365 Remote Assist

title: Serving Syrian IDPs and refugees with the help of cloud technology
executive_summary: Aided by a technology grant from Microsoft, Türkiye-based NGO Assistance Coordination Unit (ACU) is empowering humanitarian organizations across Syria to better serve those in crisis – by providing timely, mission-critical data. Using the power of Azure, Power BI and Office 365 Enterprise ACU’s “Early Warning Alert and Response Network” (EWARN) and “Information Management Unit” (IMU) are moving ever closer to real-time crisis monitoring and information management, helping better serve Syria’s most vulnerable.

title: Conde de Benalúa transforms harvests with Tipsa and Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central, cutting finance processes from days to minutes
executive_summary: Founded in 1954, Conde de Benalúa is a Spanish cooperative whose members produce extra virgin olive oil. Its 50 employees manage the 1500-member annual harvest of 34 million kilograms of olives that are pressed, packaged, and shipped around the world. In 2015, the board of directors decided to modernize operations and chose Tipsa, a Microsoft gold partner with extensive experience in automating food and beverage production. Tipsa guided Conde de Benalúa through a migration of accounting processes onto a solution that combined apps built on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central and Microsoft Power BI. Conde de Benalúa gained a synchronized, end-to-end solution that provides real-time visual data, enabling faster responses to partners and customers.

title: Water care business optimizes team productivity to generate higher revenue with Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: Based in Prague, Aquashield Europe is a startup spin-off coming from Philips that designs, manufactures, and sells water purification solutions. Led by its vision to be the vanguard for providing technology that provides higher quality usable water, the company looked for an integrated enterprise resource planning (ERP) system to focus on developing great products and services. Using Dynamics 365 Business Central, Aquashield Europe can now manage its finance, purchasing, warehouse management, and sales with only small team catering to hundreds of clients in Europe.
products: Dynamics 365 Business Central, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Power BI

title: Mektebim Koleji facilitated the remote learning via Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Mektebim College adopted Teams to enhance an integrated training platform for its students allowing remote learning during the Pandemic, continuing exams in accordance with the academic calendar and finding an opportunity to work more effectively from anywhere in terms of location with also financial benefits in terms of cost saving. Mektebim Eğitim Kurumları Mektebim is an educational institution that offers its students the opportunity to become a world citizen with the Integrated Education Model and Innovative Education Programs by including the requirements of Industry 4.0 in the education system.

title: Kinara Capital achieves anywhere accounting with Dynamics 365 Finance
executive_summary: Envisioning a financially inclusive world where every entrepreneur has equal access to capital, Kinara Capital offers fast and flexible loans without collateral to small business entrepreneurs in India. Over the last 11 years, the NBFC, has focused on addressing the credit gap in the micro-small-medium-enterprise (MSME) sector.
products: Dynamics 365 Finance

title: The Contingent—Mobilizing communities to transform the child welfare system with Microsoft Cloud for Nonprofit
executive_summary: Opening doors to children in need is not new to The Contingent. An Oregon-based organization, The Contingent is a venture nonprofit that recognized the power of mobilized communities early. Their success in mobilizing Oregonians to support the state's foster care system led the state to entrust them with foster family recruitment for the entire state. To transform the child welfare system, The Contingent bet on the Microsoft cloud platform four years ago. This was not just a bet on technology but a new mindset for strategic community engagements leading to trusted relationships and better placement for children. These superpowers are now expanding nationwide.

title: Business Central allows Canvas Worldwide to mitigate its financial exposure
executive_summary: Migrating from its on-premises finance system to Business Central provided all the benefits of the Microsoft cloud including reduced costs, regular upgrades, better security, and reduced risks. VetaTek integrated it tightly with the media buying system from Mediaocean and tailored it to meet the unique needs of its finance team. A “Sequential Liability” process was created to streamline the timing of cash receipts and the sequence of payments to vendors. A cash flow report in Power BI providing timely and accurate understanding of its liability to vendors. This helped Canvas to greatly mitigate its financial exposure.
products: Dynamics 365 Business Central, Power BI

title: Axon offers technology boost for public safety with in-car Automated License Plate Recognition on Azure
executive_summary: Axon, a technology leader in public safety, developed AI technology to add cutting-edge license plate recognition capabilities to its in-car camera products, which now can identify plates for vehicles of interest and provide law enforcement with proactive notifications and alerts. Axon AI scientists and engineers chose Microsoft Azure infrastructure as a scalable, cost-efficient, and feature-rich environment where they can develop and test AI models. With Azure compute, storage, and PyTorch and machine learning resources, Axon can easily take advantage of the latest software and hardware technology to develop best-in-class AI solutions for its customers.

title: Poloplast reimagines forecasting with demand planning in Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management
executive_summary: Austrian pipe manufacturer Poloplast was among the first Microsoft customers to participate in the preview of the new demand planning feature for Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management. Built on the Power Platform, Demand planning empowers everyone to take a low-code approach to demand modeling and provides an intuitive user experience for reporting and analysis. Today, the business has made the forecasting process more user-friendly and collaborative, extended its outlook from three months to one and a half years, and reduced storage costs significantly due to more precise purchasing.

title: King Price Insurance refines operations using Alula Technologies’ Life Policy Administration System powered by Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: In less than a decade, King Price Insurance has disrupted the South African short-term insurance landscape by offering decreasing premiums and is looking to do the same in the life insurance space. Committed to meeting customers’ expectations, it wanted to further enhance efficiency and customer experience. It recently acquired Stangen, a life insurance provider and long-term user of Alula Technologies’ Life Policy Administration System (Exergy). Realizing the benefits of cloud, King Price Insurance chose to continue the partnership with Alula Technologies and use the Alula Life Policy Administration System built on Microsoft Azure, to modernize policy administration, claims, billing, underwriting, and more. The results are a set of digital portals that let staff and customers handle transactions efficiently and securely, while enabling continuous opportunities for the insurer through digital solutions.

title: STERNET brings visibility, collaboration, and speed with Dynamics 365 Sales
executive_summary: STERNET, a Polish distributor and factory service of electric drives and industrial automation, decided to modernize its customer relationship management (CRM) and take advantage of the cloud. It partnered with OneDynamics to implement Dynamics 365 Sales. For STERNET, it was crucial to identify a global-standard solution that would evolve alongside the company and serve as a wellspring of inspiration.

title: Mining leader South32 builds an SAP cloud future by boosting data efficiency and performance with Azure
executive_summary: When global mining and metals company South32 demerged from BHP in 2015, it inherited a complex enterprise software environment with consolidation and efficiency challenges facing its large, business-critical SAP estate. The legacy on-premises datacenter did not perform to standard, resulting in outages to the business at critical times of the year. Together with Microsoft, SAP, and infrastructure partner TCS, South32 set a goal of transitioning its more than 100 terabyte data landscape into a fit-for-purpose enterprise resource planning (ERP) system. This was achieved through an SAP on Microsoft Azure transformation, including storage on 20 E-series Azure virtual machines equipped with Azure Premium SSD. South32 seamlessly completed phase one of its SAP migration to Azure, achieving consolidation and simplification of its estate. It also reduced its database size by two-thirds while benefitting from streamlined resourcing and noticeable performance gains.

title: Call2Recycle expands battery recycling programs using Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
executive_summary: Call2Recycle operates the largest battery recycling program in the United States and Canada. To better serve a rapidly changing battery market and streamline operations, the organization turned to Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Power Platform. An integrated system saves approximately $25,000 in annual fees. A Power Pages site helps manage an e-bike battery recycle program with over 2,000 retailers. Together, these solutions are helping to drive even larger and more complex programs, including battery recycling for the electric vehicle (EV) market.
products: Azure Functions, Dynamics 365 Business Central, Power Automate, Power BI, Power Pages

title: Kurita Water Industries adopts Microsoft Entra Permissions Management to visualize and control permission risks for optimal cloud security
executive_summary: N/A

title: Docusign transforms agreement management with Azure
executive_summary: Docusign needed to overcome the limitations of its current systems, scale operations, and automate processes. By implementing AI-driven agreement lifecycle management, it sought to serve its global customer base more efficiently.

title: Operation Smile bridges the gap in access to care with Azure OpenAI and Fabric
executive_summary: To serve its global patients, Operation Smile needed better support for translation and localized data input, faster ways to identify and classify cleft conditions, and a replacement for manual data analysis in spreadsheets.

title: BRF transforms data, democratizes AI to improve business outcomes with Azure Machine Learning
executive_summary: Based in Brazil, BRF helps create a better future by producing high-quality food. As the company became more data driven, it wanted to use AI to better predict manufacturing efficiencies and make sophisticated sales recommendations to its customers. BRF launched a Center of Excellence in advanced analytics, which spearheaded the adoption of Microsoft Azure Machine Learning with its machine learning operations and automated machine learning capabilities. Business users from across the company access the models and the results to make decisions that improve profitability, agility, efficiency, and customer satisfaction.

title: Bentley Systems creates breakthrough framework, drastically speeds up AI development with Azure Machine Learning
executive_summary: Software innovator Bentley Systems offers a broad portfolio of solutions to help the organizations that design, build, and operate the world’s infrastructure assets. The company uses machine learning in its flagship product to read disparate paper-based asset data and transform it into consolidated digital data. To speed up and formalize this process, Bentley created a machine learning operations framework using Microsoft Azure Machine Learning and PyTorch. Developers’ speed and job satisfaction have shot up since they began using this stable, reproducible framework, which easily gets their code into the cloud, accelerating delivery by three to five times and significantly increasing efficiency.
products: Azure, Azure Machine Learning

title: Ai Otsuka with the next-generation AI artist "HUMANOID DJ"! Avex/NAKED and Microsoft opening up new grounds in entertainment
executive_summary: Application of AI technology has been spreading to the entertainment industry. Avex, one of the leading entertainment companies in Japan, and the creative company NAKED, INC. (NAKED) have come together to develop the “HUMANOID DJ”, which incorporates AI technology. HUMANOID DJ is a project in which the AI DJ “LUCY” analyzes audience emotions and connects to equipment, data, and networks to transform itself and spatial aspects to create music that can be experienced only in that place and time. It is a project that gives birth to a new “musical experience” that transcends genres and generations. At the closing session of “Microsoft Japan Digital Days”, held in 2021 by Microsoft Japan, a special live performance was held by the artist Ai Otsuka and the HUMANOID DJ, highlighting the technology’s capabilities.
products: Azure, Azure AI Services, Azure App Service, Azure IoT Hub

title: Cyient leverages Microsoft Azure to increase efficiency
executive_summary: Cyient is a leading consulting-led, industry-centric, Technology Solutions company that specializes in engineering, design, IT and data analytics with a core focus on areas of total electronics manufacturing solutions in diverse fields of telecommunications, defense and aerospace applications. Cyient has a diversified base of over 300 customers, including 29 fortune 500 companies across multiple industries and geographies.
products: Azure, Azure AI and Machine Learning, Azure AI Document Intelligence, Azure AI Language, Azure Data Factory, Azure Machine Learning, Azure Storage

title: Daikin Adopts Azure Machine Learning for Internal Competition to Develop Digital Personnel at In-house College (DICT) for Next-gen Business
executive_summary: Daikin Industries, a world-renowned air conditioner manufacturer, has been promoting digital transformation (DX) in its strategic management plan called “FUSION25” for fiscal years 2021 to 2025. Personnel with specialized knowledge are essential to realize DX. In 2017, Daikin established the “Daikin Information and Communications Technology College (DICT),” a unique in-house personnel development organization that provides new employees with two years of intensive training in digital technology. The program is already yielding tangible results, such as the progress of IT utilization initiatives in all business divisions. In 2021, a data analysis competition was held for new employees to accelerate the development of digital personnel. Microsoft is supporting Daikin's measures to promote DX and develop digital personnel in terms of knowledge, technology, and people.
products: Azure, Azure Machine Learning

title: Aves prepares students for the challenges of tomorrow using Microsoft Education tools and Surface devices
executive_summary: Educational organization Aves has been championing innovation across its network of schools since its very early days. As part of this mission, the Dutch organization has been on a decade-long digital transformation program aimed at making digital literacy a core pillar of its curriculum. Started with an initial adoption of Surface devices and software, the initiative has since expanded to implement a new cloud-based platform allowing teachers to create unique, tailored curricula and more. All with the aim of helping prepare students for the digital challenges of tomorrow.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Reading Progress, SharePoint

title: ElliQ by Intuition Robotics gains an extra layer of empathy with Azure Text to Speech
executive_summary: Intuition Robotics is on a mission to help older adults live happier, healthier, and more connected lives. Its AI-powered companion robot, ElliQ, engages its users with activities and conversations and encourages them to stay mentally and physically sharp. The original voice of ElliQ was flat, monotonous, and could not convey the range of emotions needed to help users feel comfortable, stay interested, and build trust with their new digital companion. After a comprehensive search of different voices, Intuition Robotics selected the prebuilt Azure Text to Speech voice ‘Sara,’ which has improved ElliQ’s intonation, inflexion, and ultimately enhanced both empathy and overall sound quality.
products: Azure AI Services

title: Thread creates game-changing solution for IT service providers with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: For IT technicians, logging time entries and summarizing customer interactions are critical to profitability and quality assurance but consume valuable time and resources that could be spent helping customers. These tasks can also lead to service request response delays, creating a disconnect between customers and service desks.

title: Nota strengthens local news—and American democracy—with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Nota believes that a robust local news industry is essential to the proper functioning of democracy. Unfortunately, local news in the United States faces increasing competition from media conglomerates and many small newsrooms have closed, turning large parts of the country into “news deserts” with no local coverage. To help the remaining organizations compete more effectively and continue to bring important stories to their constituents, Nota has used Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service to build two AI-assisted tools—SUM and VID. These tools do a lot of the heavy lifting needed to optimize stories for distribution and turn written pieces into engaging videos that can produce up to 10 times as much revenue as written pieces. Early response from users has been extremely positive and Nota is attracting the attention of a wide range of news firms of all sizes.

title: KPMG transforms its global data analytics with Microsoft Fabric
executive_summary: As a global leader in audit, tax, and advisory services, KPMG faced a challenge: the need to manage and analyze data from a myriad of clients. KPMG chose to deploy Microsoft Fabric for data management and analytics to deliver enhanced insights to its clients. Together, KPMG and Microsoft will take advantage of the insights from KPMG’s deployment to help shared clients who are implementing Fabric solutions for similar use cases.
products: Azure Databricks, Azure AI Studio, Azure Service Fabric, Microsoft Fabric, Power BI

title: CARE leverages data and Azure AI to prepare for global emergencies
executive_summary: The development nonprofit CARE works around the world to fight poverty and promote equality, including by responding to crises. It is using AI to better understand emergency preparedness in its country offices so it can act without delay when lives are on the line. A solution built in Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service enables CARE to analyze open-ended survey responses to gauge emergency readiness, identify areas of improvement, and prepare for crises.

title: Microsoft Copilot sprawia, że podwójne skupienie się Nest Banku na innowacyjności i wydajności jest opłacalne
executive_summary: To empower the micro-entrepreneurs of Poland with robust banking services, Nest Bank decided to focus on both efficiency and innovation. It adopted Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365, freeing up the minds of its employees from administrative burdens and gaining a new level of efficiency in daily workflows. With Copilot, employees revolutionized how they prepare for, run, and follow up on meetings, as well as how quickly they develop new ideas.
products: Azure, Azure Databricks, Azure AI Studio, Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365

title: El IPN de México moderniza los servicios educativos, de colaboración y telecomunicación con soluciones de Microsoft
executive_summary: IPN, one of the largest universities in Latin America, delivers safe, quality education with Microsoft 365 and SharePoint collaboration tools. It also ran its admissions process 100% digitally, thanks to the online admissions exam for more than 110,000 applicants (more than 40,000 simultaneously), with the help of the artificial intelligence, machine learning, load balancing, and big data services of Microsoft Azure.

title: Auburn University empowers thousands of students, faculty, and staff to explore new ways of using AI with Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: Auburn University (Auburn), an R1 research institution in Alabama, embraced the evolving technological landscape that has come with the rise of AI by incorporating solutions like Microsoft Copilot into its mission-driven activities. Recognizing the growing use of AI by students and faculty, Auburn began integrating AI tools into its pedagogical and research practices to foster innovation and enhance technological knowledge across its stakeholders. Working with Microsoft, Auburn identified innovative approaches to promoting AI literacy, accessibility, and collaboration. The university aims to expand educational and economic opportunities for its entire academic community with AI-centric tools.
products: Microsoft Purview, Azure, Azure AI Studio

title: CapitaLand Investment enhances operations with data-driven AI models built using Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: CapitaLand Investment (CLI) is a leading global real asset manager with a strong foothold in Asia. It is also a frontrunner in leveraging technology and data to drive business outcomes. The Singapore-headquartered company shifted from on-premises data warehouses to a unified, Microsoft Azure-based data platform, with more than SGD1 million savings in operational costs. With the shift, CLI made real-time, centralised data available to its employees across more than 40 countries, driving informed decisions. Using Azure OpenAI Service, the company leveraged AI to build Cubby, its first AI hospitality chatbot for its lodging business, The Ascott Limited (Ascott). As a "travel buddy" to all guests, Cubby provides tailored travel insights. It has simplified internal processes, and the increased efficiency led to more than 10,000 man-days saved per year.
products: Azure, Azure AI Services, Azure Operator Call Protection

executive_summary: As a global leader in audit, tax, and advisory services, KPMG faced a challenge: the need to manage and analyze data from a myriad of clients. title: The National Football League Players Association and Xoriant use Azure AI Services to provide protection to players across 32 teams
executive_summary: The National Football League Players Association (NFLPA), which represents and protects professional football players, is creating ways to keep players safe during the offseason. With 32 teams practicing in two-hour sessions across nine weeks, the NFLPA found it challenging to review each session to ensure health and safety and prevent rule violations. It wanted a solution to help staff study video footage and address safety-related rule concerns more efficiently. With the help of Microsoft partner Xoriant and Microsoft technology, such as Azure AI Services and Azure App Service, the NFLPA is integrating AI into the video review process to reduce time studying footage by up to 73%, freeing up time for staff and increasing safety for players.

title: Syndigo accelerates digital commerce for its customers by more than 40% with Azure
executive_summary: Syndigo needed a scalable digital platform to help it manage and syndicate data, simplify infrastructure, and become the foundation for its cloud-native technology stack. The company had experience with Microsoft 365 and knew customers trusted Azure.
products: Azure Data Factory, Power BI, Azure, Microsoft 365, Linux on Azure, Azure AI Services, Azure Databricks, Microsoft Defender for Cloud, Microsoft Fabric, Microsoft Fabric

title: Transforming drug discovery: Novo Nordisk uses the power of AI and Azure with Microsoft Research
executive_summary: Developing high-quality medicine is a resource-intensive endeavor that requires collaboration across Novo Nordisk.  Novo Nordisk aimed to scale a pipeline of drug discovery, development, and data science capabilities with AI and machine learning.

title: Cradle drives 10x more visits to startup platform with Azure OpenAI chatbot
executive_summary: Malaysia is aiming to become a global top 20 startup ecosystem by 2030 but navigating the startup ecosystem is complicated since information is scattered across multiple stakeholders, agencies, and institutes.

title: Mia Labs secures generative AI innovations with Microsoft Defender for Cloud
executive_summary: Per the usual startup paradox, Mia Labs, Inc., had a big idea and a small budget. It needed sophisticated technology to produce and protect its conversational AI virtual assistant, Mia, and cutting-edge threat protection for its Azure infrastructure.

title: AnalogFolk uses facial recognition to test for the 'Marmite Gene'
executive_summary: “You either love it or hate it” is a phrase that’s been synonymous with Marmite since its creation. In 2017, the brand set out to discover the real reason why the sticky stuff has long divided the nation. The answer lay in science: it turns out its genetics that determine whether you’re born a lover, or a hater.
products: Azure AI Services

title: From months to days: Hellenic Cadastre speeds up land registry transactions with Azure OpenAI
executive_summary: Hellenic Cadastre, responsible for Greece's property records, faced delays and inefficiencies as property transactions required manual processing of paper documents, leaving some citizens waiting months or even years to legally own their property.
products: Power BI, Azure OpenAI Service

title: Michelin embraces AI with Azure OpenAI Service and Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: From the factory to the office, Michelin is seizing the potential of generative AI to continue to master its industrial challenges and boost the performance of its teams.

executive_summary: H&R Block wanted to build its first AI-assisted tax preparation solution for individual filers.

executive_summary: Minster Law was dissatisfied with the scalability and cost-efficiencies of their private cloud service.

executive_summary: Al Thuriah identified opportunities to enhance its Facilities Management operations, aiming to improve task tracking, automate processes, and provide greater visibility across its portfolio.
products: Dynamics 365 Field Service, Power Pages

title: Boliden builds a sustainable future for mining with automation, AI, and Azure
executive_summary: Swedish mining company Boliden produces the high-quality metals, including zinc and copper, needed to make modern life work. As part of a long-term goal to introduce more digitization and automation into its processes, Boliden used a wide range of Microsoft Azure resources—such as Azure Stack Edge, Azure IoT Edge, and Computer Vision (part of Azure Cognitive Services)—to monitor its mining sites around the clock. This has helped Boliden’s people refocus on the high-value, innovative work that drives more sustainable, environmentally friendly mining operations.

title: Global computer-based testing company ensures that credentialing exams are highly protected with Azure
executive_summary: Pearson VUE is the company that professional credentialing and licensing programs rely on to deliver the exams that certify nurses, doctors, IT practitioners seeking technology-specific credentials, and many other professionals around the world. Until early 2020, examinees flocked to Pearson VUE test centers around the world to sit for the exams that determine their future. But when the COVID-19 crisis surfaced, many test centers closed, and candidates had to take exams from home. That imposed enormous processing demands on the company. But it had begun a cloud migration and used Microsoft Azure technology to overcome its previous on-premises limitations.

title: Finnish Tax Administration builds citizens’ trust with a more secure cloud platform
executive_summary: The Finnish Tax Administration is a global leader in digital taxation, annually processing confidential data from 5.5 million citizens and 300,000 businesses. Security plays a fundamental role for the organization, so it is using Microsoft 365 E5 and Microsoft Cloud App Security to strengthen its cyber resilience, speed-up triage time, and better manage its risks.

title: Swiss Re accelerates Java app modernization using Azure Spring Apps
executive_summary: Technical Story
products: Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Database for PostgreSQL, Azure Monitor, Microsoft Entra ID, Azure Key Vault

title: SitePro accelerates green expansion using Azure Cache for Redis
executive_summary: SitePro disrupted the oil and gas industry when it launched a fresh take on digital oilfield automation based on IoT tech. The company’s innovative end-to-end approach automates everything from real-time data capture at the source to final payments and analysis. Adoption has been so high that at some points, the SitePro solution has controlled up to half of the fluid moving in the Permian Basin—the richest oil-producing area in the United States.

title: Studio gains 70 percent compute capacity with Azure Virtual Machine Scale Sets, HBv2 virtual machines
executive_summary: Jellyfish Pictures needed to enable secure remote access to immense computing power to render visual effects and animation sequences. The studio gained burst rendering on up to 90,000 processor cores in the cloud with Microsoft Azure Virtual Machine Scale Sets, HBv2 virtual machines, and Avere vFXT for Azure. It takes 80 percent off those rendering costs with Azure Spot Virtual Machines and uses an Azure ExpressRoute connection to minimize latency while more securely managing storage in one place, without replication.
products: Azure, Azure Blob Storage, Azure ExpressRoute, Azure HPC, Azure Virtual Machine Scale Sets

title: Slovakian company PosAm makes car parking easier with Azure-based mobile app
executive_summary: If you’re a driver, chances are you know the struggle of finding a parking lot in a crowded urban area. Slovakian software provider, PosAm, came up with a solution. The company's smart parking app, ParkDots, is used each day to optimize parking for more than 21,000 drivers. Connected to IoT sensors, it reduces the time it takes to park while helping parking operators manage occupancy and enforce fee collection. The app is hosted entirely in Microsoft Azure for easy workflow management, fast service deployment, and scalability.

title: Real estate investment trust Host Hotels transforms data into actionable business insights using Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Host Hotels & Resorts’ IT team faced the efficiency and cost-benefit challenges of an outdated datacenter running legacy software. The infrastructure needed constant maintenance to stay current with the latest security and compliance specifications for a publicly traded Fortune 500 company. The decision to switch to Microsoft Azure cloud services has been a gamechanger. The organization has achieved major gains in resiliency, security and compliance, in addition to remote work capability. And Host’s IT team has been freed up to contribute to the company’s bottom line by providing critical, real-time data that informs business decisions and keeps the organization ahead of its competition.
products: Azure, Azure App Service, Azure SQL Database, Azure Site Recovery, Microsoft 365

title: CEMEX moving SAP to Microsoft Azure and SUSE Linux for better availability, performance, and lower costs
executive_summary: To keep the world supplied with high-quality building materials, industry giant CEMEX relies on SAP applications to power day-to-day operations. The company’s datacenter is in Mexico, which sometimes caused application latency issues for international employees, while procuring on-premises hardware was time-consuming. By migrating its SAP landscape to Microsoft Azure and SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications, CEMEX has saved money, improved performance by 40 to 70 percent for migrated SAP applications, and increased IT flexibility with on-demand cloud services.

title: Reinsure globally, analyze locally: Munich Re relies on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: As a leading global provider of reinsurance, Munich Re needs to maintain a clear view of the risk situation and trends worldwide. As such, big data analyses on a grand scale are nothing new for the company. However, restrictive laws on data storage around the world were presenting challenges. At the same time, Munich Re was seeking to further increase its rate of innovation and operate in even closer proximity to its global customers by spreading its in-house analytics know-how more widely. This is why Munich Re moved its data analyses to the Microsoft Azure Cloud.

title: FintechOS powers low code digital financial services platform with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: FintechOS is on a mission to help banks, financial institutions, and insurers digitalize their operations and provide hyper-personalized customer experiences. To achieve this ambition, it uses the power of Microsoft Azure to give clients the ability to deliver cutting edge end-to-end digital products in weeks, rather than months. The FintechOS low-code digital creation platform leverages the latest technologies, including artificial intelligence (AI) and advanced data analytics. FintechOS clients can harness the power of its low code solutions to build the applications, experiences or journeys demanded by modern customers and bridging the gap between legacy and digital processes.
products: .NET, Azure, Azure AI Services, Azure API Management

title: Prosegur boosts security, eases management of servers at scale with Azure Arc
executive_summary: As a security company, Prosegur needs to ensure that its own infrastructure is highly secure so it can keep delivering reliable, leading-edge services to its customers. As the Spanish company grew rapidly and expanded globally, it turned to Microsoft Azure Arc and other security solutions to easily manage its hybrid, multicloud environment. Prosegur has already added 700 servers and plans to move a total of 5,000 servers. The company now has a single place to monitor and manage its infrastructure, which minimizes disparate tools, saves employees time, and decreases costs.

title: Knowledge shared is knowledge doubled: Tandemploy’s solutions ensure knowledge transfer among employees thanks to Azure Kubernetes Service
executive_summary: “Generation Streaming” wants to consume content when and how it wants: on demand, fast, and simple. It also wants the experience to be enjoyable. The same goes for learning processes. These days, the only way to achieve efficient knowledge transfer within a company is through tailored, engaging content, that puts the employee front and center. Tandemploy, a company based in Berlin, offers the ideal solution: software that allows each company to design its own “talent marketplace.” The technological basis for mentoring, finding experts, arranging lunch dates, and a whole lot more is provided by Microsoft Azure and Azure Kubernetes Service.
products: Azure, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Synapse Analytics, Microsoft Entra ID, Power BI

title: Efficient order processing based on Microsoft Azure with AI from Workist, a participant in the Microsoft for Startups program
executive_summary: Orders and confirmations, price inquiries and tax statements—the day-to-day manual processing of business documents is a time-consuming and often tedious affair. Ping. Yet another document appears in the email inbox asking to be processed, checked, and filed. As the inbox will not be empty before the working day ends, there is very little time to complete more meaningful tasks. This often results in frustrated employees. Workist is changing all this with automated, continuously learning order processing. The startup’s flagship product is based on Microsoft Azure with support from the Microsoft for Startups program.

title: Iberia Express explota el poder de los datos en su e-commerce con las últimas tecnologías en la nube de Microsoft
executive_summary: Iberia Express entered into the competitive low-cost airline market in 2012 with a vision of being a major player. Less than a decade on and the company has succeeded in its mission and grown significantly – thanks in no small part to the e-commerce platform the company built on Microsoft Azure. The airline has now developed that architecture further and is using the latest cloud technologies to provide more personalized and immediate experiences for its customers. It is helping to secure a loyal customer base and paving the way for an intelligence-driven future.

title: Air Canada atteint des sommets avec l’IA d’Azure Form Recognizer
executive_summary: In September 2021, Air Canada was tasked with verifying the COVID-19 vaccination status of thousands of worldwide employees in only two months. After realizing manual verification would be too costly and complex within the time constraint, Air Canada turned to its internal AI team for an automated solution. Working with Microsoft, the AI team used Form Recognizer, an Azure Applied AI service, to roll out a fully functional, accurate solution within weeks, meeting the government mandate on time and saving thousands of hours of manual work.

title: Transportation, driven by data: Transport for Greater Manchester keeps its millions of residents on the go
executive_summary: The citizens of Greater Manchester, UK, have a multitude of transit options when looking to get to their destination. Whether they choose tram, bus, rail, car, cycling, or walking, residents have access to an extensive transportation network to help them get where they need to go.

title: Azure で実現する次世代画像処理規格 ― HDMI を普及させた立役者、次の挑戦
executive_summary: Early on, Scenera recognized that the greatest limitation on the deployment of video cameras is rooted not in technology issues, but privacy concerns. title: Sanofi gains speed and agility with an Azure hybrid cloud strategy
executive_summary: Since its founding in 1973, Sanofi has relentlessly pushed the boundaries of medicine. With a mission to deliver life-saving medical treatments and vaccines to people everywhere, Sanofi relies on its cutting-edge science and manufacturing to make the impossible possible for millions of people around the world. When faced with the limitations of its on-premises infrastructure, Sanofi adopted a hybrid cloud strategy and chose Microsoft Azure as its cloud platform, gaining the speed, agility, and reliability necessary for innovation.

Simultaneously, it needs to conserve resources for overall storage optimization. Facing these challenges, and the prospect of even greater complexity down the road with expected data growth nearing 175 zettabytes by 2025, the Storage team looked to Azure Quantum.

Most importantly, its close working relationship with Microsoft has helped it to overcome cultural and technology barriers to transformation and bring its digital vision to life faster.

title: Green Wallet makes it easier to shop more sustainably
executive_summary: “Trying to shop ethically is really much more difficult than it needs to be,” Bashir Khairy, Founder & Chief Executive Officer at Green Wallet. “I realised this when I was trying to make my own life more sustainable – and that’s how Green Wallet was born. Green Wallet knows that by choosing to build its platform on Microsoft Azure, it will easily support the scaling up of the online marketplace across different geographies without the need for unnecessarily large maintenance or skills overheads. This is vital for an ambitious start-up like Green Wallet, that wants to change the way the world shops.

title: A scalable IT environment at Bossuyt Shop Interiors thanks to ConXioN
executive_summary: Bossuyt Shop Interiors develops inspiring interior concepts for artisan producers, so they can focus on their passion for creating. In recent years, Bossuyt has also been helping its customers explore the possibility of online sales with a digital sales platform. The progressive Belgian company has built its philosophy around making life easier for the client.

title: NOVA Chemicals builds resiliency and agility with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: NOVA Chemicals, a chemicals and plastic resins manufacturer headquartered in Calgary, Alberta, makes products used in food and electronics packaging, industrial materials, appliances, and consumer goods. With a focus on innovation and shaping a world where the plastic products vital to our health and happiness are better tomorrow than they are today, NOVA Chemicals prides itself on taking a responsible approach to the plastics manufacturing process and setting itself apart in the market with world-class products, best-in-class technical expertise, and exceptional customer service. To do all of that successfully, it needs resilient, highly secure technology that can keep up with its business needs and goals.

title: Elekta brings hope to more patients around the world with the promise of AI-powered radiation therapy
executive_summary: Radiotherapy innovator Elekta harnesses AI technologies to help further its mission to bring hope to more cancer patients in more places throughout the world. Elekta AI specialists use the agility and power of on-demand infrastructure and services from Microsoft Azure to develop solutions that help empower clinicians to provide the next generation of personalized cancer treatments with the potential to improve patient treatment. Resulting increases in efficiency and effectiveness will help drive down the disparity between the many who are in need and the relatively few who have access to first-rate radiotherapy treatment.

title: SparkCognition uses Microsoft Azure to drive the scale and performance of its AI industry solutions
executive_summary: AI company SparkCognition migrated its AI workloads to Microsoft Azure, accelerating deployments, improving efficiency, and enhancing customer satisfaction. To provide business insights that give organizations the ability to predict future outcomes, optimize processes, and prescribe next best actions, the company needed to tailor the delivery of its service for many of its enterprise customers to achieve faster deployments at scale. SparkCognition migrated to Azure to automate operational tasks and speed deployments by up to 20 percent. Through its use of Microsoft technology, SparkCognition has extended its ability to delight customers and enhance partner support.

title: Azure Compute unlocks faultless deployments with Azure Data Explorer enhanced with Machine Learning
executive_summary: Thousands of businesses rely on Microsoft Azure to host mission-critical apps quickly and seamlessly. To ensure flawless infrastructure for more than 200 Azure data centers globally, Microsoft engineers and data scientists leverage Gandalf, an internal machine learning service powered by Azure Data Explorer (ADX). This solution enables internal teams to deploy frequent and secure updates of Azure components while ensuring no interruptions to Azure’s customers. By processing huge volumes of data in near real time, ADX empowers developers and data scientists to work faster and innovate at speed.

title: Slovak Hydrometeorological Institute and SOFTEC ensure road safety with Azure
executive_summary: Harsh winter conditions in Slovakia endanger commuters and create road congestion every year. These issues were often addressed with reactive road maintenance that was costly and unsustainable. To find an alternative, the Slovak Hydrometeorological Institute (SHMÚ) partnered with IT company SOFTEC. The team began to gather more granular data with low-cost IoT meteorological stations, making forecasts for proactive road management while storing, processing and presenting the data with Microsoft Azure. The successful collaboration between public and private sectors has led to lowered road management costs and increased road safety for civilians.

title: Snam: Together with Microsoft, the integration between on-premises and the public cloud is effortless
executive_summary: As part of an ambitious digital transformation project, Snam has brought hundreds of virtual machines to the Microsoft Azure cloud platform in just a few months, and with no service interruptions. Thus, costs have been cut and gains have been made in scalability and flexibility, all in support of the company’s growth.

title: Bank of Canada invests in cloud, builds complementary staff upskilling with Microsoft Learn
executive_summary: Today’s Bank of Canada is a smart, agile, cloud-first organization. Adopting the latest cloud technologies to transform its central banking operations required a corresponding upskilling of staff. IT leadership has been working with Microsoft Learn to help empower employees of all specializations to take fullest advantage of a new cloud-first environment, and fulfill a mission to develop the next-generation digital Bank of Canada.

title: NYC Department of Environmental Protection taps Dynamics 365 for transformation initiative
executive_summary: Each day, the New York City Department of Environmental Protection (DEP) provides about one billion gallons of high-quality drinking water to nearly 10 million residents. Sourced from a watershed that extends more than 125 miles from the city, the water makes its way to homes and businesses from 19 reservoirs and 7,000 miles of water mains, tunnels, and aqueducts. DEP also manages wastewater with 14 in-city treatment plants.

title: Vietnam’s ICT leader FPT achieves operational excellence with real-time big data insights through Azure
executive_summary: FPT is the largest private Vietnamese ICT company, spanning 27 countries with ten subsidiaries and affiliates. It implemented Azure Big Data Analytics services to empower its global teams with timely insights, providing a 360-degree view of enterprise-wide data. With on-demand access to real-time business reports, management can now make decisions at the speed of their business. Additionally, a detailed picture of all company data makes employees more productive, enabling them to respond to business demands faster and more accurately.

title: Bank in Angola optimizes costs and unlocks value with Azure
executive_summary: Angolan bank Banco Millennium Atlântico (BMA) saw a need to adopt cloud solutions that would help it increase its speed and agility in serving its customers. “To drive the bank’s digital journey, we chose Microsoft Azure. Microsoft has many technological solutions under one roof in the form of Microsoft 365, which would help drive our digital strategy. We had confidence that it was the right solution to support our journey towards continuous modernization and move to cloud-based systems,” says Osvaldo Manuel, Cloud Specialist, BMA.

executive_summary: Manufacturing companies are relying more and more on automation to make their own production safer and more efficient. Ultramodern robots, such as those made by the automation specialist KUKA, autonomously perform dangerous process steps on the production line and thus relieve employees of the risk. As one of the world’s leading suppliers of intelligent automation solutions, KUKA is continuously enhancing its own automation technology with the in-house IT department providing and programming the complex applications that employees use on a daily basis. In North and South America, KUKA has now migrated much of its IT operations to the Azure cloud platform. This guarantees low latencies and rapid availability.

title: Oslo Agency for Health: weathering the pandemic storm with low-code technology
executive_summary: As the organization responsible for providing digital services to Oslo’s healthcare sector, the Oslo Agency for Health has one main goal: to empower care teams with best-in-class solutions. As long-term Microsoft users, the organization has been working to drive efficiencies across its operations by removing paper-based processes and adopting low-code technology. This strategy proved fundamental when the pandemic hit in 2020, allowing the agency to develop new solutions for contact tracing and vaccinations in a matter of days. Using Microsoft Power Platform, the agency has since been able to create more than 25 apps in support of the healthcare sector. All while helping to weather the crisis effectively in the shortest amount of time.

title: How Dr. Pfleger Arzneimittel is becoming a data-driven company: Sales analysis with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Dr. Pfleger is a German pharmaceuticals manufacturer with many well-known medical products and drugs in its portfolio, including its ipalat® throat lozenges and Neuralgin® pain tablets. Located in Bamberg, the medium-sized enterprise employs more than 370 people in production, development, and sales. In a rapidly changing market and given the rising importance of e-commerce, Dr. Pfleger relies on a data strategy that employs Microsoft solutions: Azure Synapse Analytics provides the basis for a modern data warehouse, where data from all areas of the company is consolidated and analyzed. Providing support on this path toward a data-driven future is Oraylis, a member of the Microsoft Partner Network.
products: Azure Synapse Analytics, Dynamics 365, Excel, Power BI

title: eClinical Solutions uses Dalikoo’s My Links to enhance intranet built with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: eClinical Solutions, a leading provider of clinical trial software solutions, created a new intranet to transform its employee experience by improving internal and human resources communication, employee collaboration, and knowledge sharing. The new intranet, eClinical Connect, is built natively in Microsoft 365 and enhanced with a leading solution from Microsoft partner Dalikoo, called My Links. Strategy, design, configuration, integration, and ongoing support was provided by sister company and Microsoft partner Velaku. eClinical Connect coupled with Dalikoo’s My Links app and user-centric design by Velaku have improved productivity, collaboration, visibility, and engagement across eClinical Solutions’ 400+ employees in North America, Europe, and India.

title: Conagra improves supply chain visibility and shop floor connectivity using integrated Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: Conagra Brands, one of North America’s leading branded food companies, digitized its supply chain and increased shop floor connectivity by using Microsoft solutions. The food production company was starting a multiyear digital transformation to improve forecasting when supply chain challenges impacted the packaged goods industry. Conagra optimized its tools and processes using Microsoft Azure and other Microsoft solutions to enhance monitoring and analytics, control costs, and facilitate collaboration. On Azure, Conagra increased operational output of goods by 30 percent and production capacity by 20 percent at one of its facilities while reducing manual work, improving order management, and providing an impactful employee experience.

title: Berlitz empowered 500,000 language learners using Azure AI Speech
executive_summary: Founded in 1878 by Maximilian Berlitz, Berlitz is a language education company that has been at the forefront of language learning for 145 years. In a departure from traditional grammar-based approaches, Berlitz pioneered the immersive method of language instruction, which is now considered the most effective way to learn a language. With over 100 physical locations across more than 70 countries, 7,000 employees, and an online presence, last year Berlitz taught over 500,000 people how to learn a new language. With Azure AI Speech, Berlitz offers a more personalized and effective learning experience for its diverse range of customers.

title: ​​Centro Hospitalar builds up resistance to threats, analyzes 48 million logs a day with Microsoft Security solutions​
executive_summary: When Centro Hospitalar de Trás-os-Montes e Alto Douro needed a way to protect sensitive, highly confidential patient data and applications in its hybrid environment, it chose Microsoft Security solutions. The hospital system’s future-forward strategy calls for a dynamic, cloud-based security approach that will stay on top of threats and position the organization for cloud migration. It now has a centralized view of security events with Microsoft Sentinel, increasing frontline defense with Azure Automation and Microsoft Defender for Cloud. With Azure Arc to extend Centro Hospitalar’s Azure platform protections to its on-premises assets, the hospital system considers its IT security vaccinations up to date.

title: Enhancing security and lowering costs in one go: arab national bank and Microsoft Security
executive_summary: As one of the largest banks in Saudi Arabia, The arab national bank (anb) strives to provide faster, simpler banking for commercial clients as well as consumers. The bank wanted to empower its employees to serve customers remotely through digitization, which required top-notch security. “We relied on a variety of third-party security solutions which required a lot of effort,” recounts Ala Asali, Chief Security Officer at anb. Now, with Microsoft Security as its overarching, tightly integrated security solution, anb has enhanced security operations, lowered costs, increased employee productivity with remote work and improved customer experience—with just one strategic move.

title: Dominican Republic Superintendency of Banks creates digital well-being for users as they progress their security project with Azure
executive_summary: After migrating to Azure and adopting Dynamics 365 to modernize its operations, the Dominican Republic's Superintendency of Banks seeks to make life easier for users with the implementation of a Zero Trust identity architecture that replaces that of the perimeter, thereby protecting applications and services with the cloud proxy. It also implemented Defender for Endpoint, for vulnerability care and management and Endpoint Manager for App controls.

title: Qatar’s Ministry of Communications and Information Technology boosts security and efficiency with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: On a mission to transform Qatar into the Gulf region’s digital hub, Qatar's Ministry of Communications and Information Technology (MCIT) embarked on a journey to digitize government operations with Microsoft Azure. With the shift, MCIT has not only enhanced the government’s data security and operational efficiency, but also achieved USD7.3 million in cost savings, putting Qatar on track to achieve its Vision 2030.

In order to streamline and speed up the process, the company developed its own AI assistant for booking operator, AlpiGPT. Quickly embraced by its staff at Group's Tour Operating division, the AI assistant is saving time and effort, while helping employees to expand Alpitour World’s knowledge base. The solution is also an essential element in improving the employee experience in the company, helping them to both retain current workers and attract valuable new talent in the future.

title: Almere's modern workplace delivers employee satisfaction, projects savings of $73,000 with Microsoft Surface Pro
executive_summary: The Municipality of Almere in the Netherlands is the country’s newest city, built on land reclaimed from the North Sea. It sought to create a modern workplace for its employees. executive_summary: Coldplay sought to create a global interactive fan experience for its “A Film For The Future” project. So Pixel Lab needed to develop a solution to spur fans to engage with content in a personalized way at scale, while protecting artistic integrity.

executive_summary: AI marketing and SEO platform Writesonic was increasing its user base and needed a stable, enterprise-ready AI-powered cloud platform that provided speed, reliability, and security.

executive_summary: ELSAN needed a solution to simplify patient journeys, reduce administrative burden, and support more personalized, efficient care at scale.

executive_summary: Adaptic thrives on lean management and efficiency and needed a reliable and adaptable platform to host its data and streamline processes to maximize growth and improve the employee experience.

title: World Vision Canada reimagines transparency and accountability with a Microsoft data ecosystem
executive_summary: Through emergency relief and long-term development, World Vision Canada advances the well-being of children in vulnerable areas across the globe. Siloed data in disparate systems and teams impeded the nonprofit's ability to communicate its impact.

title: Commercial Bank of Dubai boosts AI literacy and productivity with Microsoft 365 Copilot, saving 39,000 hours
executive_summary: Commercial Bank of Dubai (CBD) sought to empower its workforce with cutting edge AI-driven tools to enhance productivity, collaboration, and decision making as well as modernize workflows while enhancing employee experience.

executive_summary: As a broker at the forefront of technological innovation, Saxo Bank decided it would embrace AI to boost efficiencies, improve the client experience and target a growing segment of traders and investors.

title: American Airlines fuels operational efficiency with Microsoft Azure Communication Services
executive_summary: American Airlines wanted to centralize and upgrade day-of operational communications with its pilots, giving them more control over when and how the airline updates them on changing conditions such as weather and airport status.

title: SymphonyAI speeds app deployments, minimizes downtime with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: SymphonyAI needed a way to unify disparate data sources; enhance ROI for retail customers and industrial data operations, develop deploy-anywhere container-based AI architecture, and improve overall network performance.

title: Powering a new era of smart operations: How CATRION fuels growth with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: CATRION, a leading catering and hospitality provider, scaled operations without increasing costs.

title: Ageas revolutionizes sales training with a new Digital Coach, powered by Azure OpenAI
executive_summary: Ageas faced a shortage of experienced sales trainers, especially in Asia, and scaling classroom-based methods was a challenge. They wanted to boost soft skills development, improve sales agents’ performance, and give Ageas a competitive edge in talent acquisition.

title: Portuguese bank accelerates cloud adoption and digital transformation
executive_summary: Caixa Económica Montepio Geral (CEMG) has provided banking and other financial services throughout Portugal since 1844. To collaborate more easily across 323 branch locations and more than a dozen central offices, the bank decided to move its business process to Microsoft Office 365. To speed this change, the bank teamed with Microsoft Adoption Services and crafted an implementation strategy that turned employees from reluctant users into advocates for digital transformation. In addition to accelerating the adoption of new technologies and business processes, the bank expects to become more competitive by providing better and more seamless service across all locations.

title: Anheuser-Busch InBev brews up game-changing business solutions with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Anheuser-Busch InBev, headquartered in Leuven, Belgium, isn’t just a beverage company, it’s a technology company. From its Beer Garage in Silicon Valley to its Global Analytics Center in Bengaluru, India, the company known as AB InBev is pushing the innovation envelope. The company is using technology to drive commercial and operational growth and increase sustainability by moving its IT operations to the cloud, and it is gaining more significant insights into business operations by breaking down data silos and building a global analytics platform. AB InBev chose Microsoft Azure as the best platform to support these game-changing advances.

title: Komatsu achieves breakthrough performance gains and savings with Azure SQL Database Managed Instance
executive_summary: Komatsu builds and sells a lot of heavy equipment, but the company knows that it takes more than machines to be successful. Using data to gain a better understanding of its own business—and to help customers better understand theirs—is key to developing innovative services and leading its industry. By moving mainframe applications to Microsoft Azure SQL Database Managed Instance, Komatsu Australia is improving performance, reducing costs by half, and providing employees and customers with the data they need, when they need it.

title: Data science consultancy transforms the future of UK energy—and its own business—with Azure Machine Learning
executive_summary: Elastacloud, a London-based data science consultancy, wanted to combine AI, advanced analytics, and machine learning to promote more profitable low-carbon energy production in the United Kingdom. So, it used Microsoft Azure Machine Learning to build and run the Elastacloud Energy BSUoS Forecast service, an AI-powered web service that helps energy providers avoid incurring energy-balancing fees imposed by national energy authorities. Now providers can better predict energy prices and help create a smarter energy system, while Elastacloud transforms its business.

title: Family-owned Berryessa Gap Vineyards empowers its mobile workforce and enhances the customer experience with Microsoft 365 and Teams
executive_summary: Family-owned Berryessa Gap Vineyards has a small but passionate staff that is on the go between its three locations. The company’s reliance on paper messages, voicemails, and desk phone lines led to delays in returning customer and supplier calls.

title: The Craneware Group enhances healthcare insights with Oracle Database@Azure, optimizing data for better operational performance
executive_summary: The Craneware Group’s acquisition of a provider of complementary solutions created an opportunity to unify data across multiple clouds and enhance their ability to deliver actionable insights and greater value to customers.

title: How Legora is transforming the legal workspace using Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Legora is transforming the legal workspace using Azure OpenAI Service.

title: Encino Energy streamlines oil and gas operations with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: Encino Energy was looking for a more cost-effective development platform to streamline operations, including processes that weren’t addressed with off-the-shelf solutions.

title: Rolls-Royce saves millions in cost avoidance with Microsoft Cloud for Manufacturing
executive_summary: Rolls-Royce wanted to improve productivity and reduce costs across its design, build, and operate functions, as part of its digital transformation.

title: Digital efficiency in the warehouse: Nagel-Group relies on Microsoft Teams and Power Apps
executive_summary: Registering shipments, inspecting goods, and processing them – tasks like these were coordinated in different ways at Nagel-Group and handled manually through numerous instances. The result: information gaps and lengthy processes.

title: Nationwide Building Society: Maximizing value with the Microsoft commercial marketplace
executive_summary: Nationwide Building Society needed to optimize their cloud-based solutions, forecast budgets and mitigate risk. To help solve their challenges, Nationwide adopted the Microsoft commercial marketplace.

title: City of Jacksonville enhances accountability and transparency with Microsoft Power BI
executive_summary: City of Jacksonville aimed to increase transparency, improve operational efficiency, and enhance public trust by making real-time city data accessible to both officials and residents.

title: Amgen builds agent in 6 weeks with Copilot Studio to help accelerate R&D
executive_summary: Finding and sorting through thousands of pieces of digital resources, reports, and presentations has the potential to slow knowledge transfer for drug developers at Amgen.

title: MediaTek boosts on-device AI speed by 50% using Phi models from Microsoft
executive_summary: MediaTek needed to boost AI capabilities for on-device AI performance, delivering real-time functionality and high accuracy without relying on an internet connection.

title: Air India’s digital transformation takes flight with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Air India had inefficiently managed data centers with outdated hardware and software, posing cybersecurity risks. To address these issues, Air India transitioned to Microsoft Azure for its technological fit, security, and scalability.

title: Johor Corporation aligns divisions, data, and purpose in its digital growth strategy with Microsoft AI and Cloud
executive_summary: Johor Corporation (JCorp) set out to unify its core business segments, eliminate silos, and improve speed, visibility, and alignment across operations to support more cohesive and informed decision-making.

title: Kinems revolutionizes education with AI-powered, multisensory learning experiences on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Kinems, a company striving to expand inclusive education, needed technology to make multisensory learning experiences accessible to more students with diverse needs.

title: Air India elevates customer support while saving money with Azure AI, data, and apps
executive_summary: As part of a transformation intended to restore its status as a world-class airline with a strong Indian identity, Air India needed to upgrade the customer experience without increasing costs.

title: Howdens enables customers to increase efficiency with innovative tool in Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Howdens is developing digital tools to support their customers to conveniently access the information they need to increase efficiency.

title: XP Inc. transforms productivity with Microsoft 365 Copilot, saving over 9,000 hours
executive_summary: XP Inc. faced challenges in optimizing internal processes. The implementation of Microsoft 365 Copilot was seen as an opportunity to transform productivity and accessibility in the workplace.

title: Square Enix uses Azure OpenAI Service for AI-enhanced game development
executive_summary: Game developers were inundating Square Enix’s game engine department with daily questions on massively complex game engines, causing workloads to balloon. A generative AI chatbot to streamline game engine support and simplify questions was the solution.

title: Wipro modernizes the world’s oldest cosmetic brand—protects it from online fraud with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Wipro Consumer Care & Lighting makes less than 5 percent of its sales from e-commerce. After acquiring the world’s oldest cosmetic brand—Yardley of London—it sought a way to change that. But before it could launch a new e-commerce platform with confidence, it needed to have a fraud protection solution ready to scale with the brand’s anticipated growth. After testing Microsoft Dynamics 365 Fraud Protection on its live Yardley of London e-commerce site, Wipro now expects to reduce instances of online fraud by at least 80 percent.

title: Future-focused Dutch water utility counters climate change with smart use of data on Azure
executive_summary: Dutch water utility PWN streams 106 billion liters of pure, high-quality water to a million and a half citizens in North Holland. The utility monitors and maintains the health of the dunes that act as a natural filtration mechanism for 25 percent of the water, but that complicates service delivery. And running both the business side of the utility and the systems to monitor water quality requires enormous data stores. PWN found one answer for both issues: moving its SAP estate from an expiring cloud hosting provider to Microsoft Azure to meet PWN’s complex business needs. With all the data on one platform, the utility can better manage its assets, communicate with customers, predict climate change effects, and help protect against them.

title: Walgreens Boots Alliance delivers superior customer service with SAP solutions on Azure
executive_summary: Global pharmacy retail giant Walgreens Boots Alliance (WBA) is on a digital transformation journey that involves moving on-premises applications and IT resources in a heterogeneous Linux and Windows environment to the cloud. This includes the company’s massive 100-terabyte SAP landscape. WBA chose Microsoft Azure as its cloud platform, and after thorough planning with Microsoft and WBA’s implementation partners, the SAP migration to Azure went smoothly in less than a day. WBA now enjoys improved performance and data centralization that also helps the company provide better customer service.

title: Swisscom uses Azure to drive innovation, market leadership with multilingual voice assistant
executive_summary: Although voice assistants are increasingly common on our smart devices, Switzerland’s largest telco, Swisscom, wanted to create more engaging customer experiences by building a voice assistant that uniquely represents its brand. Using the Speech service, part of Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services, Swisscom has given its customers access to an intelligent, multilingual voice assistant, helping improve the customer experience and accelerate its own digital transformation.

title: Air India elevates customer support while saving money with Azure AI, data, and apps
executive_summary: As part of a transformation intended to restore its status as a world-class airline with a strong Indian identity, Air India needed to upgrade the customer experience without increasing costs.

executive_summary: Howdens is developing digital tools to support their customers to conveniently access the information they need to increase efficiency.
