executive_summary: Game developers were inundating Square Enix’s game engine department with daily questions on massively complex game engines, causing workloads to balloon. A generative AI chatbot to streamline game engine support and simplify questions was the solution.

title: Willmott Dixon builds a stronger business foundation by automating processes in Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Willmott Dixon faced challenges with outdated financial systems, leading to inefficiencies and manual processes. The company needed a new centralized core accounting solution to improve financial forecasting, cost control, and operational efficiency.

title: NTT Communications achieves a safe hybrid work environment with Microsoft Entra ID and Intune
executive_summary: The COVID-19 pandemic necessitated a safe hybrid work environment. Cyberattacks on internal servers occurred around the same time, triggering NTT Communications’ commitment to Zero Trust security.

title: yourtown empowers young people in need with better support through AI-powered capabilities
executive_summary: yourtown’s outdated and fragmented CRM systems, manual processes, and siloed data prevented the organization from effectively serving young people and their families.

title: GroupeActive and Microsoft reinvent sales proposals with Microsoft Copilot Studio
executive_summary: GroupeActive supports many self-employed people in their work, using key tools such as artificial intelligence.

title: Procter & Gamble cuts model deployment time up to 90% with Azure IoT Operations
executive_summary: Consumer goods leader P&G continually looks for ways to drive manufacturing efficiency and improve overall equipment effectiveness—a KPI encompassing availability, performance, and quality that’s tracked in P&G facilities around the world.

title: "Rewriting the rulebook on Student Record Systems at TEDI-London"
executive_summary: TEDI-London is a new higher education provider for future engineers, co-founded by Arizona State University, King's College London and UNSW Sydney. It will accept its first student cohort in September 2021, welcoming them to a newly built campus in London’s Canada Water. To enable this, the TEDI-London team worked with ANS Group and Microsoft to build a modern, end-to-end student record system from the ground up, using the power of Microsoft Dynamics 365 and the Microsoft Higher Education Accelerator. Choosing these tools enabled the TEDI-London team to create and deploy the solution they needed within nine months.

title: Aviation industry partner propels global growth with Microsoft Project
executive_summary: Ontic is a leading provider of legacy aerospace products across commercial and military markets, supporting more than 5,000 customers worldwide. To meet customer demands and support its growth strategy, Ontic needed to raise visibility of its global projects for adopting and transitioning products. It needed to better connect employees across teams and job roles to work collaboratively with a growth mindset. To achieve its goals of improving product line transitions and better managing its internal initiatives, the company needed a project management solution to unite the organization, promote transparency, and create business momentum. Wellingtone have supported the transformation with ongoing strategic PMO consultancy, plus custom-designed configuration of the Microsoft Project Platform, comprising of Project Online and Project for the web in a hybrid setup.

title: India’s leading food ordering and delivery platform, Swiggy, uses Power BI for a low-cost powerful data solution
executive_summary: Founded in 2014, Swiggy is India's leading hyperlocal food ordering and delivery platform. The company processes millions of customer orders each month while operating in 500+ cities with 120,000+ restaurants on its platform. One of the key goals for the organization is to build a data-driven culture by enabling democratization of insights throughout the organization. A robust BI platform was one of the first goals for Swiggy.

title: Aviation industry partner propels global growth with Microsoft Project
executive_summary: Ontic is a leading provider of legacy aerospace products across commercial and military markets, supporting more than 5,000 customers worldwide. To meet customer demands and support its growth strategy, Ontic needed to raise visibility of its global projects for adopting and transitioning products. It needed to better connect employees across teams and job roles to work collaboratively with a growth mindset. To achieve its goals of improving product line transitions and better managing its internal initiatives, the company needed a project management solution to unite the organization, promote transparency, and create business momentum. Wellingtone have supported the transformation with ongoing strategic PMO consultancy, plus custom-designed configuration of the Microsoft Project Platform, comprising of Project Online and Project for the web in a hybrid setup.

title: airBaltic's ground team gets off to a flying start with Microsoft Teams and Power Apps
executive_summary: Latvian airline airBaltic pairs a passion for aviation with customer service excellence and a drive for innovation. Establishing a new ground handling unit at Riga airport provided the carrier an opportunity to digitalize and streamline operations. Combining Power Apps with Teams, airBaltic’s business team developed vital tools that helped streamline work shift management, approvals, and reporting. Now, the ground crew can execute tasks via Microsoft Teams using mobile devices. The optimization has helped airBaltic save 1,000 printed report pages a month and reduced the time needed for data input from two days to 15 minutes.

title: iHeartMedia tops the charts with Azure AD and Microsoft Sentinel, creating simplicity at lower cost
executive_summary: iHeartMedia leads the pack in the “always-on" audio media world. In a space where security is non-negotiable and where employees need immediate and easy access every time—often to industry-specific, custom applications—delivering that balance can be challenging. But when iHeartMedia replaced its identity solution with Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) and deployed Microsoft Sentinel, it opened the door to a more streamlined user experience, dramatically lower licensing costs, greater visibility throughout its estate, and other benefits.

title: Energy leader innogy drives sustainability by simplifying photo voltaic system customization with Power Apps
executive_summary: innogy is one of the Czech Republic’s leading energy supply companies, providing around 1,7 million of customers with electricity, natural gas, and green energy solutions. Needing an easier way to create detailed proposals for custom home photo voltaic system, innogy turned to Microsoft Power Apps. Today, the energy leader can generate quotes and unique system designs 25 percent quicker. The solution also improved insight and enabled innogy to service more customers more effectively, helping thousands of homeowners switch to a sustainable, eco-friendly future.

title: Microsoft Project helps Dutch indoor climate system provider streamline its processes, increase overall business
executive_summary: Dutch company Climate for Life is in the business of residential heating, cooling, and ventilation systems it sells as a subscription model off the typical energy grid. With demand increasing, the business wanted to streamline processes, minimize manual tasks, and find a project management tool flexible enough to manage changes and tackle resource planning and scheduling. Today, Climate for Life is using Microsoft Project to help automate work and meet demand. The business is handling 25 percent more projects and onsite standstill days have decreased 20 percent, leading to 15 percent overall growth.

title: Rabobank balances the books: Optimal privacy and safety with Microsoft Purview Data Loss Prevention
executive_summary: Agility and dedication to its customers have served Rabobank well throughout its more than 125-year history. The bank’s global workforce supports food and agricultural producers around the world. Its small but successful security team relies on the most effective tooling available to help secure the bank’s assets across 42,000 endpoints. Rabobank turned to Microsoft Purview Data Loss Prevention to curtail inappropriate data sharing, regardless of the location of its employees or data. Best of all, Rabobank curbs data loss without deploying agents, providing a better experience for employees and more time for IT teams to focus on high-value activities.

title: Azerbaijani food conglomerate, Azersun Holding, revamps performance with Azure and M365
executive_summary: Azersun Holding, a food production, retail and farming conglomerate, is paving the way for other Azerbaijani companies in technology, innovation and excellence. As part of the country’s one of the biggest Azure digital migration projects, Azersun deployed Microsoft 365 tools across its operations to empower remote work, improve collaboration, and increase efficiency. The company also moved its retail POS systems to Azure and started running its 1,000 stores in the cloud. This resulted in the optimization of performance, cost efficiency, and resources.

title: Book a desk or call in sick in just 30 seconds: Campus IT at Hochschule Düsseldorf, University of Applied Sciences manages office occupancy with Power Platform
executive_summary: The employees of Campus IT at Hochschule Düsseldorf, University of Applied Sciences do not have permanent workstations. Instead, they use hot desking in conjunction with a clean desk policy. This method was instituted during the COVID-19 health crisis, but it became more time-consuming as employees returned to the office; managing desk assignments with an Excel list cost time and led to errors. Campus IT needed an automated, digital solution, and trainee Dan Stenmans delivered RABA—a room, attendance, and booking assistant based on Microsoft Power Platform.

title: SPAR NL readies for the future of retail with Azure Integration Services
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: Egyptian building pioneer revamps project budget management with Oracle on Azure IaaS
executive_summary: Alexandria Construction Company (ACC) is a pioneer in large-scale infrastructure and construction projects and a leading contributor to Egypt’s economy. The company began its digital transformation by deploying the region’s first Oracle on Azure IaaS project. The solution is currently in its pilot phase at Noor—a smart city project that will set the benchmark in Egypt’s developmental landscape. Despite being in the testing stage, ACC has already saved on capital costs and human resources since deployment.

title: Centrica reduces SharePoint site provisioning from five days to five minutes with self-service solution
executive_summary: Carl Smith, the Office 365 Service Owner for Centrica, is always looking for ways to “put himself out of a job”—at least those jobs that other employees could do for themselves. Finding ways to enable self-service lets his team focus on enhancing business operations. “We were getting a lot of last-minute requests for Microsoft SharePoint sites from different groups across the company,” Carl says. “With our strict security and corporate branding requirements across our many organizations, we were forced to follow a manual process and do it ourselves.” But when Centrica, a leading energy services and solutions company, deployed the Collaboration Area Request (CAR) solution from the Microsoft Customer Success team, Carl got his wish.

title: US LBM remodels its cybersecurity approach by centralizing IT with Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: Suppose your company routinely acquires businesses that vary in size and IT sophistication. Further suppose that preserving their brand identities, operating models, and community involvement is vital to your business ethic. How would you manage all that disparity while affording those companies operational independence, especially when they vary widely in size and IT budget? Building material supplier US LBM answered that question by centralizing its technology management and adding automation from Microsoft 365 Defender and Microsoft Sentinel. It provides new acquisitions with connected Microsoft Security solutions for proactive visibility and a degree of security that the company had never before achieved.

title: OECD: Pushing the Boundaries of Data Sharing to Shape Better Public Policy with Power BI and its SDMX Power BI Connector
executive_summary: The Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), one of the world's largest and most trusted sources of comparative socio-economic analysis, recently established the Microsoft Power BI business intelligence tool for data visualizations. At the heart of this adoption is the idea to provide accessible evidence to support decision-making for public policies promoting prosperity, equal opportunity and well-being. A step further has been taken to accelerate the exploitation of data for policy. Let’s take a look at the newly certified connection between Power BI and SDMX.

title: Specialty window manufacturer Zöllner runs business more effectively with Microsoft 365 Business Premium
executive_summary: Zöllner Fensterbau GmbH, a German window manufacturer with 90 employees, has spent 50 years perfecting the hands-on, traditional approach that sets the business apart. “At Zöllner, we design and build high-quality wood-aluminum windows,” explains Frank Severin, Head of Organization and Processes at Zöllner Fensterbau GmbH. Unlike many manufacturers in the market, Zöllner not only designs and builds, but installs its products. “We’re part of the customer journey from A to Z,” says Severin.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft 365 Business Premium, Microsoft Teams

title: Lexmark streamlines and transforms sales operations with Experlogix CPQ for Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales
executive_summary: For Lexmark, a global provider of printing and imaging technology, an integrated approach to sales and operations was a meticulous and methodical strategy the leadership team envisioned and implemented to ease the transition to remote work, increase efficiency, and ensure a sustainable path to digital transformation. Using Experlogix CPQ and Microsoft Dynamics 365, the company integrated its CRM and CPQ (Configure, Price, Quote) systems so the customer journey is visible and unequivocally supported, sales cycles compressed, and revenue accelerated. Lexmark also recorded an improvement in order accuracy, resulting in a 43 percent reduction in quote revisions along with seamless sales experience and streamlined reporting.

title: Santeon: Harmonizing healthcare data for better, more transparent patient outcomes with the Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform
executive_summary: Santeon is a learning system of seven hospitals with national coverage in The Netherlands and is the largest healthcare network in the country. The group’s ambitions to use data collectively to provide value-based healthcare (VBHC) was limited by different data governance systems in each hospital. The Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform was used to harmonize data and create the groundbreaking Health Intelligence Platform Santeon (HIPS). Data is now usable across the entire group, helping to empower patients and provide better health outcomes – providing a compelling example of how a large healthcare network can harmonize data on a national scale.

title: Solving Three Problems with SAP on Azure! Kao Achieves First Large-Scale Operation of ANF in Japan and Looks Ahead to Global Expansion
executive_summary: Kao, a leading Japanese manufacturer of consumer goods and chemicals, is working with its partner Accenture to fully integrate its global SAP systems. Kao has completed the migration of ECC 6.0 in Thailand and Singapore to S/4HANA by May 2022. The company plans to modernize all SAP systems in Asia, Europe, the US, and Japan, and to centralize codes and data globally that have been managed and operated independently in each country. As the cloud platform for the SAP system, “SAP on Azure” was chosen and the project is the first large-scale case in Japan to fully adopt Azure NetApp Files.

title: Welocalize boosts agile transformation and OKR adoption at global scale with Viva Goals
executive_summary: Welocalize is one of the largest full-service, multi-vertical language service providers worldwide. Its growing network of professionals delivers content translation, localization, and adaptation for more than 250 languages to meet regional, linguistic, cultural, technical, and machine-learning requirements worldwide.

title: Microsoft Excel performs with greater care, speed, and visibility with ADX
executive_summary: Every week, Microsoft releases new versions of Excel for the Web to millions of users. To ensure the quality of each update, the team needed a data analytics and exploration service. Using Microsoft’s Azure Data Explorer (ADX), also known as Kusto, the team started processing and analyzing logs, user feedback, and other data within seconds to instantly identify and fix issues to offer a seamless service.
products: Azure, Azure Data Explorer

title: Entain bets on SQL Server 2022 to boost growing gaming business
executive_summary: Entain is a leader in sports betting, gaming, and interactive entertainment. Through a cutting-edge technology platform, they provide exciting and safe gaming experiences to millions of customers across five continents. Customers expect to place wagers and receive payouts quickly and securely 24/7/365 across 33 languages and 42 currencies, no matter how many events are happening simultaneously.

title: Builder.ai pushes the boundaries of building software with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Builder.ai is the next generation app development platform for every business and idea on the planet. The platform combines AI with human intelligence to make software accessible for every business user, regardless of their background, technical knowledge or budget. The AI-powered platform builds software faster and cheaper than traditional methods, so all businesses can become cloud first and digital first.
products: Azure, Azure Front Door

title: MultiCare leads the way in healthcare data interoperability via a fully managed solution built with Microsoft and Microsoft partner 3Cloud
executive_summary: Growing healthcare organization MultiCare Health System teamed up with Microsoft and Microsoft partner 3Cloud to meet changing demands in health data access prompted by the use of fitness trackers and phones. MultiCare wanted a scalable, interoperable data exchange framework to connect providers, patients, and payers—key for success in population health and value-based care. It also required an adaptable solution. Working with Microsoft FHIR experts and partnering with 3Cloud, MultiCare built a unique, fully managed solution using Microsoft Azure. The results have surpassed expectations: in three months, MultiCare has seen a significant reduction in administrative burden with a $50 per-chart cost savings and a 65 percent reduction in labor.
products: Azure

title: Windows 11 Pro lets Broadway play a bigger role in the community
executive_summary: The Broadway League represents Broadway professionals. They also produce The Jimmy Awards, which celebrates teens in theater, while their Broadway Bridges program helps bring every public-school 10th grader to a Broadway show. Their goal is to get more of the community into Broadway, not more patches into PCs. So, Windows 11 Pro keeps their employees protected—and productive—with seamless updates that are 40% smaller to download.
products: Microsoft 365 Apps for business, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive for Business, Windows 11

title: Orange Unified School District enables 28,000 students to learn securely anywhere with Microsoft 365 A5
executive_summary: When Orange Unified School District (OUSD) needed to remotely deploy and manage thousands of new devices for students and staff, the school district chose Microsoft 365 Education A5 and Windows PCs. The solution enabled the small IT team and OUSD to rapidly deploy approximately 30,000 devices, simplify management, and streamline and strengthen security. Most importantly the transformation helps OUSD enrich its learning environment and prepare students for future success.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Intune, Windows Autopilot, Windows 11

Within eighteen months, Lynk & Co was able to ramp up a significant digital presence in Belgium, France, Germany, Italy, Netherlands, Spain, and Sweden, as well as opening social clubs designed to bring the company’s online brand to life through community focused events.

Working with its partners UnifiedCommunications.com, Logitech, NTT Data Group, HP | Poly, Yealink, and AudioCodes, the company adopted a value-added solution across Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Teams Phone, Operator Connect, and Teams Rooms. The migration to Dynamics 365 helped MAPEI simplify internal processes for its employees, provide more proactive service to customers, and simplify the delivery of new solutions—saving both time and money, and ensuring that its CRM system is future-ready.

With Dynamics 365 Business Central and Power Platform, employees created applications that accelerated business processes, allowing for a green transformation that both enhanced King Steel's sustainability performance, and also improved operational efficiencies and customer relations.

Today, Basys has achieved 90 percent first-call resolution – a rate they credit in part to the use of Teams. The company also boasts a positive customer sentiment NPS score of +70 and has saved costs by consolidating on Microsoft 365 E5 for security. Customer retention has also improved.

Habu’s flexible software solution supports a wide range of use cases, and it’s designed for both technical and nontechnical users. The company gained new opportunities to work with customers who require the highest degrees of data protection—opportunities that wouldn't be available without Azure confidential computing.

It’s helping the market to get better insights into the import and export of gas flows and filling degree of connected gas storages, but also to improve heat efficiency for the LNG Terminal (EemsEnergyTerminal) that the company recently built in the north of The Netherlands. All with a view to making the data platform play a central role in supporting the energy transition.

Success hinges on the ability to get everyone on the same page and working toward the same goal. However, without proper tools, this process can seem outdated, slow, and prone to error. There also exists a gap in the common understanding of requirements among stakeholders, especially as requirements evolve over time and changes need to be managed.

Hastings Direct increased performance by 1.6 times and now handles adjustments 4 and 5 times faster. It has seen a continual reduction in major incidents and positioned itself to take advantage of cloud-native capabilities and innovation opportunities.

executive_summary: Facing the challenge of increasing client demand and limited clinician resources, Medigold Health wanted to find ways to reduce administrative burdens on clinicians so they can focus more on patient care—and have better work-life balance.

With their complex relationships, partner-led operations, and compliance and regulatory mandates, they require purpose-built cloud solutions. This is where Intapp, a key global Microsoft partner, and its unique software as a service offering steps in. Since its inception more than 20 years ago, the company has been developing solutions for the specialized needs of these firms’ dealmakers, bankers, lawyers, accountants, and consultants.

executive_summary: Perplexity.AI is the creator of Perplexity Ask, a revolutionary AI-based conversational answer engine that combines large language models with a robust semantic search engine. As a typical startup—with a lean staff and a leaner budget—the company needed a platform for Perplexity Ask that would support fast time to market, serve as a force multiplier for that lean staff, scale to support millions of users, and deliver security and reliability at a cost-effective price. The company transitioned to a cloud-native ecosystem with Microsoft Azure four years ago, as part of its digital transformation. It has since built Senkron ROC, a Remote Operation Center that oversees 20 hydropower, wind, and solar plants 24/7. Through advanced AI analytics, Enerjisa Üretim can now monitor real-time performance, forecast production levels, and predict maintenance requirements. It also fortified operations with a specialized Security Operation Center, processing 3.3 million security events daily. All this translates to increased operational efficiency with well-timed preventive maintenance, and a safer, more secure future for sustainable energy management.

The process of identifying, collecting, and managing legal data plays a pivotal role in ensuring just and equitable outcomes that uphold the rule of law. But as data volumes and types continue to expand, organizations need faster, more efficient ways to review and produce the required information. Relativity creates AI-driven solutions to help customers organize data, discover the truth, and act on it. Its cloud solution, RelativityOne, underpins all aspects of e-discovery, in addition to intensive tasks like investigations, contract reviews, data breach responses, and many other legally—and ethically—impactful use cases.

By making customer and internal information and insights easily accessible, it has empowered its team to serve customers faster and make informed decisions. title: CCC Group bridges 800 global stores, saving 300,000 hours annually on operations with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Facing the challenging task of managing communications across 800 retail stores and 20 markets, CCC Group tackled it by adopting Microsoft Teams. By centralizing its communication and task management on Teams, the company enhanced internal dialogue, saving USD 500,000-worth of printing paper and 300,000 hours annually, freeing staff up for more responsive customer service. By expanding access to corporate insights, staff feedback, and Power BI reports, it enabled informed decision-making.

title: Shopping center pioneer ECE implements data warehouse with Microsoft Fabric
executive_summary: For 15 years, the ECE Group relied on its on-premises data warehouse. The old structures led to long processing times. Investments in new hardware and the operation and maintenance of the landscape resulted in high costs and effort.

title: Vermont Judiciary modernizes FBI background check interface to enhance public safety with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The Vermont Judiciary (VTJ) wanted to streamline a labor-intensive manual process for entering data into the US National Instant Criminal Background Check System (NICS), a crucial system that is used to determine the legality of firearm purchases.

title: Unifonic boosts productivity and accelerates customer engagement using Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: Unifonic faced challenges using fragmented tools that hindered internal collaboration. This disjointed approach also led to inefficiencies in auditing and reporting, impacting overall operational effectiveness.

title: D-ID enables 100x growth and scales its digital avatars globally with Azure AI Services
executive_summary: D-ID enables companies to use lifelike digital avatars for communication, training, support, and more. It needed a partner that offered enterprise-grade security, global scalability, and a shared commitment to ethical, responsible AI.

title: Professional services firm, Wipfli, uses Microsoft Azure to stay ahead of the competition
executive_summary: The accounting and consulting industry is incredibly competitive. Acquisitions are common, and the pressure to rapidly deliver innovative services drives competition. After a series of acquisitions, and with the impact of COVID-19 on remote work, Wipfli needed a cloud solution to consolidate its existing platforms and provide much-needed speed and agility to its client service and development teams. The large professional services provider chose Microsoft Azure.
products: Azure, Dynamics 365 Customer Insights - Data, Dynamics 365 Sales, Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, Power BI

title: Taking the high road to remote and hybrid learning at Davis School District
executive_summary: The Davis School District has recently adopted an approach they refer to as High Access, which includes everything from a one-to-one ratio of student to device, to school-specific applications designed to meet the needs of its curriculum and its students, to Microsoft Teams for collaboration. In pursuit of these objectives the technology leadership team at the district has, in the last two years, deployed more than 45,000 new Windows 10 devices, to accommodate the need for remote and hybrid learning.

title: Using AI to get vaccines to market faster
executive_summary: Phlexglobal is a leading technology and services organisation in the life sciences sector. It offers a suite of products to help life science and pharmaceutical companies manage their clinical and regulatory operations.

title: Siemens GBS: Artificial intelligence for the next generation of Shared Service Organization
executive_summary: At Siemens Global Business Services (GBS) it is all about the customers’ ambitions: Nearly 10,000 employees worldwide work every day on the implementation and optimization of Shared Services along the entire value chain of its customers’ businesses. For example, the digitalization of a company’s hiring or payment processes enables GBS to support each business need with red carpet service, tailored to foster the customer’s success. A strong ecosystem of partners further increases the customer value. Accordingly, GBS and Microsoft teamed up.

title: Upepo Technology is inline with Kenya’s vision 2030 providing solutions to the growing challenges encountered in the country’s water sector.
executive_summary: In April 2019, Upepo secured a Microsoft AI for Earth Grant which begun its journey to building its products and solutions through immediate access to IoT, Cloud Storage and Machine Learning (ML) tools. Upepo seeks to provide IoT solutions to 105 regulated water service providers (WSPs) and the estimated 5,200 community water projects across Kenya that serve an estimated 12.3 million households. The results of the pilot were successful and are set for commercial launch within 2021 with a scale up planned to 18 District Meter Areas, 90 Zones and 10,000 households.

title: Microsoft Investigator Fellow Dr. Travis Osterman uses Azure to support lung cancer treatment protocols
executive_summary: Travis Osterman, D.O., and his colleagues at Vanderbilt University Medical Center in Nashville are using the power of Microsoft Azure to support the development of new treatment protocols for lung cancer. Dr. Osterman focuses on applying clinical informatics methods across the cancer care continuum. Informatics—which includes the use of computational systems for data storage and retrieval—focuses on improving access to health information and protecting patient privacy. Dr. Osterman and his team are also the first research group at Vanderbilt University Medical Center to use a new enterprise data warehouse in Azure.

title: Edible Arrangements uses Azure Synapse Analytics to turn data into delicious treats
executive_summary: Best known for its gift bouquets made of juicy, fresh fruit, Edible Arrangements (Edible) started as a store front in East Haven, Connecticut, at the turn of the century. Now, Edible serves 100 million customers—50 million gift givers and 50 million gift recipients—around the world, having branched out from bouquets to other sweet and chocolatey gifts.
products: Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, Dynamics 365 Customer Insights - Data, Microsoft Purview, Power BI

title: Element innovates with Microsoft Azure to drive process improvements in service
executive_summary: Headquartered in London, UK, Element is a global business that provides specialist testing, inspection and certification services to a diverse range of businesses. With over 6,500 engaged experts working in more than 200 facilities in the Americas, Europe, Middle East, Africa, Asia and Australia, Element is one of the fastest growing companies in the global testing, inspection and certification sector. When the finance team in its shared services centre for the Americas was forced to work from home during the COVID-19 pandemic, it needed to digitalise its paper processes fast. The creativity of the team and its use of Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services delivered more than business as usual – it delivered significant efficiencies.

title: Cloud-based visualization of data serves science in the global fight against resistant pathogens based on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Where science meets digitalization: the Global Antimicrobial Resistance Research and Development Hub, or Global AMR R&D Hub, works with huge amounts of research data from all around the world. In its mission to combat resistance to antimicrobial medication, the Hub needed a way of transparently documenting how research funding is used and make this information available to the public. The solution came in the form of a dynamic dashboard based on Microsoft Azure and Power BI. It will help highlight the scientific fields that need further research funding.

title: eoStar and Atmosera boost efficiency via a tailored Azure environment
executive_summary: eoStar provides end-to-end solutions that enable a complete overview of customers' operations. eoStar is Coca-Cola North America's technology partner of choice for its North Star technology initiative. With Atmosera, the solution provider found a partner that could validate its overall infrastructure solution design and take over the primary management and monitoring of its Microsoft Azure environment. This enabled eoStar to focus its efforts on the operations of the application suite it was designing for Coca-Cola Bottling Africa (CCBA).

title: Azure Virtual Desktop helps Grant Thornton UK LLP solve business challenge
executive_summary: As a member firm of one of the world’s leading organizations providing accounting, auditing, and tax and financial advisory services, Grant Thornton delivers value to its customers every day. With a cloud-first strategy combined with Microsoft Azure Virtual Desktop, the United Kingdom–based firm went beyond borders and expectations—tapping into its global network of 58,000 workers and solving a business resourcing challenge.
products: Azure Virtual Desktop, Exchange Server, Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Entra ID, SharePoint

title: Englewood Health migrates to Azure, sees significant boost in app performance
executive_summary: Englewood Health and its more than 3,700 employees—including 1,100 physicians and other medical staff—provides world-class health services at 100-plus locations across New Jersey and New York. Its applications, scattered across more than 600 virtual machines (VMs), deal with a variety of business and healthcare activities—from human resource management (HRM) systems to virtual patient monitoring and diagnostic support, as well as healthcare-only apps that connect the clinical and operational sides. CloudIQ helped Englewood consolidate its fragmented IT architecture in Microsoft Azure to enhance productivity and optimize resources.
products: Azure

title: Leveraging the scalability of Microsoft Azure to help power vital research at the University of Leeds
executive_summary: University of Leeds is one of the prestigious Russell Group of universities and a leading UK research university. In 2014, it established the Leeds Institute for Data Analytics (LIDA) to facilitate multi-disciplinary research collaboration both across the university and with external research and commercial partners.

title: Intelligent enterprise hits top speed on Azure with Azure NetApp Files
executive_summary: Working with longtime partners Microsoft and NetApp, enterprise software company SAP is helping companies in a wide range of sizes and industries make better use of massive amounts of data. SAP customers generate 87 percent of total global commerce. Today, SAP HANA® applications and workloads can run on Microsoft Azure using Azure NetApp Files, a fully integrated storage service built on NetApp technology, accelerating growth and market position for both SAP and its customers. The solution gets data into the hands of decision-makers at the time, scale, and quality that the market demands.

title: Atkins leverages Microsoft Azure to help them to build more sustainably
executive_summary: “Sustainability is everything to Atkins and we rely on these tools in order for us to do this in the most efficient manner,” says John Weir, Associate Director at Atkins. Atkins delivers design, project management and engineering consultancy services. Because our lived environment is facing rapid change, Atkins is radically transforming the way infrastructure is designed, delivered and operated. Lesley Waud, Global, Design Transformation at Atkins, has been in the industry for 40 years. She says, “there’s never been a better time in terms of the difference that we can make for society.”

title: Zscaler Digital Experience helps millions of remote workers resolve productivity roadblocks in real time with Azure Data Explorer
executive_summary: Zscaler’s mission is helping companies around the world transform their network and security infrastructure—making work simpler, faster and more productive. To bring its newest employee experience monitoring service—the Zscaler Digital Experience (ZDX)—to life, the Zscaler team uses Azure Data Explorer as the analytics engine. Thanks to instant scalability, seamless product integrations with Zscaler’s global infrastructure and real-time data insights, Zscaler is now making a productive work-from-anywhere experience a reality for millions of users every year.

title: Microsoft Sentinel strengthens Salford Councils cyber security and reduces corporate risk
executive_summary: For many public sector organisations, cyber security tops the corporate risk register. Salford City Council is one of the ten metropolitan borough councils in Greater Manchester. It serves 220,000 residents. The diverse city region includes some of the most deprived wards in the country as well as being a high-tech hub that includes MediaCityUK, home to 250+ creative and digital businesses. As part of a wider programme to develop digital skills across the city region, Salford City Council has created a commercial security operations centre built on a public-sector-operated platform and Microsoft Sentinel. As well as protecting the council and its residents, the SOC services will be offered across the North West – and, eventually, beyond – to make public sector and enterprise more secure.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft 365 E5, Power Apps, Power Automate, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Memo Migrates Critical Call Center Systems To Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: When you’re providing call center support to critical business services, medical emergencies, healthcare professionals, pharmaceutical companies and alarm systems, any interruption to services can result in adverse outcomes for patients and often demanding customers. So as your company scales, how do you bring the IT systems alongside it without affecting customer service?

title: “Smart Spaces” simplifies facility management and desk sharing with Azure IoT
executive_summary: Real estate is expensive. For this reason, it must be used sensibly and managed efficiently. “Smart Spaces” by T-Systems MMS provides an intelligent basis to do so. This solution uses sensors to collect space usage data and combines it in such a way that it is then possible, for example, to optimize management of building systems, save energy, and allow employees to quickly find an available workstation. Azure services run in the background. They consolidate sensor data and provide information in real time while also enabling mapping and navigation within buildings.

title: Molecular Modelling Laboratory delivers drug formulation breakthroughs with Azure HPC + AI, AMD
executive_summary: MML deployed Azure HPC + AI resources on more than 18,000 Azure HBv2 VM cores for about 120 ASD use cases optimally configured for high-performance computing with efficient node-to-node interconnectivity, AMD EPYC™ processors, and NVIDIA InfiniBand-enabled SKUs. As a Microsoft Partner Network member, MML found its perfect match both in Azure and in AMD as an implementation vendor for MML’s critical high VM density. Above all, MML is proud that it has enhanced its core capabilities, particularly with respect to simulating ASD.
products: Azure, Azure HPC, Azure Virtual Machines

title: Kuwait’s Central Agency for Information Technology partners with Microsoft to spur digital transformation
executive_summary: Kuwait’s Central Agency for Information Technology (CAIT) was founded in 2006 to supervise the implementation of e-government plans and projects in collaboration with ministries and government entities across the gulf nation. Today, it works with Microsoft on an IT assessment initiative named Tamkeen. Focusing on cybersecurity, infrastructure, and application modernization, the project is laying the groundwork for a more integrated and secure future—both for Kuwait’s government entities and its citizens. Its key goal is to identify gaps in technology and empower entities to lead the coming waves of change.

title: Sustainability-focused Swedavia soars to the cloud with the Azure Migration and Modernization Program
executive_summary: In accordance with the government-mandated Swedish Public Procurement Act, Swedavia needed to find a different service provider and move its servers to a more dynamic and agile platform. In addition, after losing 90 percent of airport passengers during COVID-19 shutdowns, Swedavia had to take drastic measures to save its bottom line. With sustainability underscoring Swedavia’s vision, it wanted to find a technology company that aligned with its overall mission to create airports with fossil-free operations. Through the Microsoft Azure Migration and Modernization Program, Swedavia revised its landing zone, aligned its architecture and road map for business intelligence services, and found a savings of about 40 percent per server. And, with the Microsoft Emissions Impact Dashboard, Swedavia is finding measurable business impact with metrics that support its environmental and sustainability initiatives.

title: Taking genetic analysis to new heights with cloud technology
executive_summary: Geninus, a spin-off company from Samsung Genome Institute, specializes in medical genomic analysis. It is the first to commercialize next generation sequencing-based cancer panel in Korea. Besides its strong performance in the domestic market, Geninus now exports its technology to Japan, Vietnam, and Australia. The company leverages data analytics with the Microsoft Azure Cloud to develop new solutions. With the power of big data and artificial intelligence, Geninus looks to continue creating genomic technology that benefits all of humanity.

title: Gameloft removes language barriers, maximizes player collaboration with Translator, part of Azure Cognitive Services
executive_summary: People from every country and all languages play online games, but they need to communicate with each other to collaborate in strategy games. When Gameloft’s studio in Bulgaria launched March of Empires, providing players with accurate in-game message translation was essential. Gameloft turned to Translator, part of Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services, to translate more than 100 languages in real time so players can seamlessly chat, strategize, and banter with other players. The wildly popular game has built global friendships and seen 100 million installations since its debut.

title: “How may I help you?”: Parloa optimizes telephone customer service with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: “Please press 1 to find out more about our products. Press 2 if you have a question about your order.” Gone are the days of tedious customer support hotlines. Instead, the automated customer service solution used by Parloa customers opens a call with a simple question: “How may I help you?” It then responds intelligently to callers’ queries and concerns. This is all thanks to the technology: the speech-to-text feature provided by Microsoft Azure takes the quality of conversational AI used by Parloa’s phonebots to the next level.

title: Kahoot! implements Microsoft Dynamics together with inspirit365
executive_summary:
Kahoot! is a global learning platform company empowering everyone, including children, students, and employees, to unlock their full learning potential. With a growing global operation, Kahoot! needed a powerful ERP system. This is why they chose Microsoft Dynamics 365, provided by inspirit365.
Inspirit365 and Kahoot! worked closely together to define the scope and goals of the implementation project. We defined all processes that needed to be included and Dynamics 365 was configured and implemented in line with Kahoot!’s requirements. Kahoot! are now running their financial system on the Dynamics 365 platform.
With Dynamics 365, Kahoot! has an ERP system supporting daily business operations and facilitating standardization across finance operations in multiple jurisdictions.

title: Pioneering “robotic quarterback” uses Windows, Azure ecosystems to solve developer dilemmas—and cut a year off time to market
executive_summary: When sports robotics company Monarc wanted to create what it calls “the world’s first robotic quarterback,” it adopted the Windows and Microsoft Azure ecosystems to do so. Its product, called “the Seeker,” combines AI, the Internet of Things, programmability, and more to enable football players to practice a full playbook by themselves. Why Windows and Azure? Monarc brought the Seeker to market up to a year sooner than it could have with other operating system and development tools, plus it maintains greater choice and flexibility in evolving the product and even runs Linux containers on it. “With Windows, we’re not missing out on anything,” says a company cofounder.
products: Azure, Azure App Service, Azure Internet of Things, SQL Server

title: NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory better manages communication with space missions using Azure Quantum
executive_summary: For every NASA space mission, there is a team on the ground coordinating contact with spacecraft through the Deep Space Network (DSN), an array of huge radio antennas located in Spain, Australia, and the United States. As the number of active missions continues to grow and demand on the DSN increases, NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) sought the intensive computing resources necessary to better manage scheduling requests and access to the DSN antennas. JPL tapped into Microsoft Azure Quantum to adapt quantum-inspired optimization algorithms to a custom-fit solution for improving both scheduling and the overall flow of communication with the growing number of spacecraft unlocking new understandings of the universe.
products: Azure Quantum

title: Innovation Credit Union eyes massive digital growth and goes national with solution from VeriPark and Microsoft
executive_summary: The Chief Disruption Officer at Innovation Credit Union chose a transformational, cloud-first solution to the challenge of doubling the size of its business, simplifying members’ lives, and expanding to serve customers nationally. Innovation started by adopting the leading-edge retail banking customer experience suite from VeriPark. Building on Innovation’s existing investments in Microsoft Azure, Microsoft 365, and Microsoft Dynamics 365, the VeriPark solution provides a state-of-the-industry customer experience and a road map to the growth and scale that will drive Innovation’s success.

title: CIAT drives innovation and productivity for national tax agencies
executive_summary: The Inter-American Center of Tax Administrations (CIAT) provides technical assistance, studies, and training to strengthen the tax administrations of its 42 member countries. In addition to its established offerings, CIAT has a strategic intent to provide advanced technology products that helps strengthen government tax administrations around the world. As part of Microsoft’s investment program into industry, it develops accelerators that outline how agencies can adopt cloud technology to drive innovation. CIAT, with direct collaboration from Microsoft, deployed the Microsoft Public Finance accelerator in Costa Rica to help free the government’s tax administration by optimizing data collection, automating routine tasks, and using machine learning strategically allocate efforts where they are needed most.
products: Azure, Azure Synapse Analytics

title: Techint E&C Leverages Technology to Deploy Time to Market Solutions
executive_summary: The engineering and construction company decided to adopt Microsoft solutions to make tools available to internal staff and external vendors to streamline tasks and increase productivity.
products: Azure, Azure SQL Database, Azure Static Web Apps, Excel, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI

title: Kristiansund Kommune: Transforming the Norwegian public sector through the cloud
executive_summary: Kristiansund Kommune is a municipality located on the western coast of Norway. A small town of just 24,000 inhabitants, Kristiansund has big aspirations for its citizens and believes in using technology to empower future change. Over the past few years, this has meant migrating to the cloud and using it to develop ground-breaking solutions specifically designed for its community.
products: Azure AI Services, Azure App Service, Azure Load Balancer, Azure Logic Apps, Azure SQL Database, Microsoft Teams

title: University of Surrey adopts a data-driven approach to improving student satisfaction, powered by Microsoft 365 and Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Established by Royal Charter in the 1960s, the University of Surrey has worked for more than fifty years to harness the talents, creativity, and skills of its student body, in service to the broader community. It is a legacy that has earned the University recognition and awards, and one that attracts a student population of more than 16,000.
products: Power BI

title: FastTrack for Azure helps LifeBio to evolve and grow their product base
executive_summary: LifeBio is an age-tech company that builds technologies that bring people together—making it so that older people can share stories with the younger generation. Every single person has a story to tell, and everything we are building at LifeBio, we are using Azure Cognitive Services. Microsoft Azure cloud services is a core part of our product development and Microsoft FastTrack for Azure is an integral and instrumental program that helps LifeBio evolve and grow their product base.

title: Royal Mosa reduces carbon footprint and enhances performance with centralized, cloud-native management through Azure Arc–enabled Azure Stack HCI
executive_summary: Rooted on the banks of the River Meuse from which it derives its name, Royal Mosa has been steadily and sustainably connecting people, places, and natural resources in the production of beautifully made ceramic tiles for the past 140 years. Operating in the same location in Maastricht, Netherlands, in the heart of Europe, Mosa strives to work harmoniously with local resources and businesses to create a truly unique ceramic tile manufacturing facility.
products: Azure Arc, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Policy, Azure Stack HCI, Azure Virtual Desktop, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Defender XDR, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Giving students ownership with Reading Progress in the Milton Area School District
executive_summary: Few skills are as fundamental to a child’s success as reading. For decades, educators have assessed the reading progress of their students by having them read texts of varying difficulties aloud, in person, and then using those assessments to guide subsequent instruction. When schools shut their doors, those practices, and the learning that resulted from them, were disrupted in new and novel ways. For educators in the Milton Area School District, located in Central Pennsylvania, these challenges opened opportunities to explore and use technologies that improve literacy and fluency in their students. They turned to Microsoft Reading Progress, a program that uses artificial intelligence driven assessments to empower students to read, improve, and grow their skills—both on their own and with targeted aid from their teacher.
products: Microsoft 365 A5, Microsoft Teams, Windows 10, Reading Progress, Windows 11

title: Experience management platform Pisano uses Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Pisano, the experience management platform, delivers its cloud services to more than 60 customers in more than 20 countries. Moving its cloud services to Microsoft Azure a while ago, the company used Azure's tools to facilitate the transition.

title: The Victorian Department of Premier and Cabinet embraces digital transformation with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: The Victorian Department of Premier and Cabinet (DPC) supports the ministerial portfolios of the Premier, Deputy Premier, Treaty and First Peoples, Government Services, and Industrial Relations, as well as providing support to the Victorian Cabinet. Each year in Victoria, Australia, upward of 7,000 briefings and 15,000 correspondence matters, ranging from critical situations to new budget initiatives and changes to legislation, are created and managed across the Victorian Department of Premier and Cabinet. Through their implementation and adoption of the Automated Briefing and Correspondence (ABC) system, an Azure-hosted web application built on top of Microsoft 365, DPC has transformed what was once a time-intensive, completely paper-based briefing process into a highly scalable, digital system accessible by all members of the department through the fully integrated Microsoft Teams app.

title: CDHU builds a robust platform and raises the bar on its service through Microsoft technologies
executive_summary: With an implementation that started with Dynamics 365 centralizing the entire CRM process of the state agency focused on popular housing, CDHU was able to develop a channel that enhanced service, with centralized information and high traceability, all in the cloud, and gradually evolved with the implementation of Power Apps and Microsoft 365 tools.

title: TJSP becomes more accessible, digital, and productive using Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: The São Paulo Court of Justice (TJ-SP) initiated a cloud migration process with the implementation of Microsoft 365, which promoted greater ease in internal communication during the pandemic in a robust manner, in addition to hosting online hearings and classes from their schools, enhancing both. In addition, Microsoft Bookings was crucial to maintaining audience scheduling by avoiding crowds, and Azure Bot Service with Teams proved to be an asset in increasing the accessibility of the court.

title: The University of Sydney utilizes the power of Azure OpenAI to allow professors to create their own AI assistants
executive_summary: For over 170 years, the University of Sydney (UofS) has set the standard for excellence in research and teaching. The university decided to explore generative AI as part of their forward-focused mission, seeing it as an opportunity to enhance teaching practices, assessments, and internal processes. UofS, however, quickly realized they needed a secure AI solution that individual professors could customize and contextualize to their unique needs. In March 2023, UofS explored solutions that would offer faculty, staff, and students access to AI tools while maintaining control over their use, and—when no out of the box solution met the university’s needs—they developed their own custom solution.
products: Azure AI Search, Azure App Service, Azure AI Studio

title: The Civil Aviation Authority achieves a “perfect” migration from GOV.UK PaaS to Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The CAA ran its drone education and registration service on GOV.UK PaaS. When the UK Government announced it would decommission the platform, the CAA needed to move fast. It chose to migrate onto Microsoft Azure which was swift and hitch free, with the CAA succeeding in creating a templated approach which can be followed by other organisations. Today, the CAA enjoys efficiencies in skills, security, cost and ease of management. The tight integration with other Microsoft products, such as Dynamics 365, and the potential to use Azure Kubernetes will power further development.

title: Aberdeen City Council helps more vulnerable people by taking a platform approach with Dynamics 365 Customer Service
executive_summary: Aberdeen City Council, a governmental organization with nearly 8,000 employees in northeastern Scotland, is dedicated to the mission of providing citizens with the social care and resources they need to live safe and fulfilling lives. But the Council faced roadblocks to providing Aberdeen residents with this care. Social workers had to gather information on vulnerable citizens through a variety of methods, and workers struggled to assemble a clear picture of the overall needs of citizens as well as plan future care. The Council rolled out Dynamics 365 Customer Service to unify how it collected data and to provide data transparency to all workers, leading to faster service, a better understanding of citizen needs, and more than two million pounds saved annually on manual data collection.
products: Dynamics 365 Customer Service

title: Intermountain Health saves thousands of hours, improves patient care with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: To continue delivering high-quality healthcare, Intermountain Health wanted to connect AI, language models, and advanced algorithms to the cloud to make patient care and clinical caregiver support scalable, reliable, and transformative.

title: Kilimo leverages Azure AI solutions to help farmers lower water usage, benefiting the local watershed
executive_summary: Latin American tech company Kilimo is on a quest to help farmers reduce their water usage. It gathers and stores massive amounts of data to predict how much each farmer should irrigate and needed a cloud solution that could keep up while also ensuring the security of its corporate partners’ sensitive information.

title: UBS enhances in-house legal search using Azure AI Search and Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: UBS’s in-house legal team must find very specific information, like a clause or regulation, across a library of 26 million legal documents in multiple languages. The existing search system was inefficient, and UBS wanted a more effective solution.
products: Azure OpenAI Service, Azure AI Search

title: Maryvit School uses PowerSchool PowerBuddy built with Azure OpenAI to boost focus and efficiency
executive_summary: Maryvit School wanted to personalize learning, streamline teaching, and support Thailand’s “Anywhere Anytime” education policy. With limited time and resources, educators needed to balance lesson planning, administrative tasks, and student engagement.

title: Montgomery County revolutionizes constituent experiences with an AI chatbot powered by Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Montgomery County wanted to help its constituents more conveniently access important local information, but its existing AI chatbot, Monty, was limited in both scale and accessibility.
products: Azure OpenAI Service, Azure, Azure AI Search

title: IWG gains real-time insights and boosts fraud detection with Microsoft Fabric
executive_summary: IWG’s existing systems did not provide real-time insights into its marketing campaigns and sales channels, making it difficult to track leads, campaigns, and sales conversions. This hindered the company’s ability to make quick data-driven decisions.
products: Azure Event Hubs, Microsoft Power Platform, Power Apps, Azure Databricks, Microsoft Fabric, Power Automate

title: Civica safeguards critical services for citizens with Microsoft Defender for Cloud
executive_summary: Civica, a global GovTech champion, aims to strengthen security, enhance visibility, and streamline operations to safeguard critical public services delivered to citizens around the world.

title: Games Global saves over 22,000 hours per year with Microsoft Power Platform and Copilot Studio
executive_summary: Games Global wanted to streamline everyday operations by replacing manual processes with automation. Approvals, audits, and reporting relied on email chains and spreadsheets, slowing teams down and limiting efficiency.

title: Puritan Life increases revenue by almost 700% with distribution channel built on Azure
executive_summary: Puritan Life Insurance Company of America needed a new way to sell its multiyear guaranteed annuities, away from time-consuming agent pitches at the kitchen table. Its barriers? Education and access.
customer: Puritan Life Insurance Company of America
products: Azure, Azure Front Door, Microsoft Defender for Cloud, Azure Application Gateway

title: Globo's strategic adoption of Microsoft 365 Copilot is driving continuous innovation
executive_summary: Globo was looking for solutions to keep up with innovation and efficiency in a market that is constantly evolving – something that would increase employee productivity without compromising quality, which is essential in its creative and dynamic environment.

title: If P&C Insurance protects business-critical data with Microsoft 365 Backup
executive_summary: If P&C Insurance looked to boost operational resilience with a Microsoft-native backup solution that could improve recovery and support long-term protection.

title: OneDigital leverages Microsoft Azure to scale consulting power with AI Coworkers
executive_summary: OneDigital needed a faster, smarter way to gather personalized insights for client meetings, as manual research was time-consuming and risked underprepared, less impactful engagements.

title: ICG cuts proposal response time by 80% with Microsoft 365 Copilot
executive_summary: As a startup consulting firm, ICG needed to hit the ground running with administrative infrastructure that allowed it to generate revenue quickly.

title: UBS innovates on Azure by transforming its critical workloads from mainframe into cloud native solutions
executive_summary: At the heart of this enterprise-wide modernization effort lies the Electronic Archive (ELAR) system, the largest records management system of ex Credit Suisse. ELAR manages an immense dataset of nearly 2 petabytes in a Mainframe Db2 database.

title: How Giesen Group transformed winemaking with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: As operations expanded across markets and product lines, Giesen’s legacy systems struggled to keep pace. Manual processes, fragmented reporting, and an aging on-premises ERP made it difficult to match the agility required of a modern winery.

title: Make-A-Wish brings more joy, hope, and strength to children with critical illnesses through Microsoft technology
executive_summary: Make-A-Wish aims to provide a hope-sparking wish for every eligible child in the U.S. The nonprofit is streamlining its operations and leveraging its data to get closer to that ambitious goal.

title: healow evolves healthcare provider and patient engagement with Azure AI Foundry
executive_summary: healow manages more than 50 million patient communications for its customers. The reality today is that healthcare staff are overwhelmed and not able to provide patients the support they expect when they need it, while delivering quality care.

title: KDDI and Azure OpenAI Service cut middle office sales preparation work by 74 percent
executive_summary: KDDI is harnessing the power of generative AI to enhance its core 5G communication services and reinforce the power of connection. As part of these efforts, the company aimed to foster generative AI internally and streamline sales preparation work.

title: Indiana Pacers use Azure AI Foundry to create first live arena captioning service
executive_summary: The Pacers Sports & Entertainment (PS&E) technical team needed a custom, live-game captioning system that could deliver instantaneous captions to its deaf, hard-of-hearing, and non-English-speaking fans on arena screens and in its mobile app.

title: Husqvarna Group Boosts Operational Efficiency with Azure Adaptive Cloud
executive_summary: Husqvarna Group faced increasing pressure to modernize its fragmented global infrastructure, gain real-time operational insights, and improve efficiency across its supply chain to stay competitive in a rapidly evolving digital and manufacturing landscape.

title: Analytics SaaS firm speeds service with Azure SQL Database serverless computing

With greater flexibility and easy integrations in Azure, the company can now focus on creating flexible, cost-effective new services for its customers and partners.

executive_summary: In 2019, hydraulics expert HANSA-FLEX AG took on two major projects in an effort to adapt its IT structure to meet its organizational and customer needs. With 160,000 customers around the world, and 4,500 employees working in over 450 locations in more than 40 countries, HANSA-FLEX realized that its single, self-operated, local datacenter at its headquarters in Bremen was lopsided. Working with Microsoft Partner Network member, Arvato Systems, the company updated its SAP systems and database to SAP HANA, achieving the fastest cloud migration to-date. Today, the family owned business is one of Germany’s largest midsize companies using SAP on Microsoft Azure. It was the first time the company used Azure NetApp Files to run performance-intensive and latency-sensitive workloads in the cloud.
products: Azure, Azure NetApp Files, SAP on Azure

executive_summary: Upstream Applied Science Ltd. offers applied science and math consultancy services, specializing in computational fluid dynamics (CFD). Upstream wanted to assess the performance of several CFD models and contacted Drizti Inc. to investigate the use of high-performance computing (HPC) for this modeling. Drizti’s HPCBOX solution on Microsoft Azure delivers a cloud HPC platform that makes supercomputing as easy to use as a personal computer. With HPCBOX’s user-friendly and performance-enhancing toolset to access HPC on Azure, Upstream completed its turbulence model simulation in less than five days.

By using a customized ICONICS platform together with Microsoft Power BI, MacDonald-Miller saved the healthcare network $350,000 during the first 12 months.

executive_summary: Nestlé is the largest food and beverage company in the world. Like many global enterprises, fending off phishing campaigns across its massive footprint was a daily battle. After initial solutions left the company swimming in false positives, it built PhishScreener, a custom solution that uses Microsoft Azure DevOps and Azure Machine Learning to quickly uncover phishing before an employee clicks a malicious link. As a result, Nestlé has reduced false positives, sped up detection times, and increased its overall phishing coverage.

It chose to use Microsoft Azure to support its players with a low-latency, premium gameplay experience that matches its vibrant visual worlds.

So far, more than eight hundred thousand travelers have taken advantage of the mobile solution for a safe and seamless journey.

title: DIGITAL TRANSFORMATION WITH SPEED

Yes, you may lose something good, but you may also gain something great.” What makes the AfroCentric Health digital story such an amazing story is its quick ability to change, adapt, and flourish in a short period of time.

The results were immediate and impressive—KFC Pakistan significantly improved efficiencies and saw a sharp drop in wastages, continuing its legacy of growth.

The charity had no capacity or desire to build their own internal security team, so they took advantage of Softwerx’s 24/7 Managed Detection and Response (MDR) offering via the Softwerx Security Operations Centre (SOC). The three organizations launched an e-learning platform called DigiSkills, enabling youth to acquire in-demand digital and professional skills to become more employable. Based on Microsoft’s existing Community Training Platform, the solution provides five development pathways, ranging from project management to data analytics. The blended learning model was hosted in Nedbank’s facilities and delivered through nonprofit partner Afrika Tikkun.

Grupo Bimbo turned to Microsoft Azure IoT solutions to help the company transition from a large-scale bakery to a data-driven enterprise, starting with its US factories, Bimbo Bakeries USA. Rather than distancing people from the production process, it connects them more intimately than ever before with the power of data delivered through Azure IoT technology.

title: Cognito Abacus turns to Microsoft Teams to overcome online learning challenges
executive_summary: Cognito Abacus is an India-based educational group that focuses on enhancing cognitive skills in children aged 6 to 13 years. The company imparts both regular and online learning programs across India.

title: Business Development Bank of Canada filters Microsoft Exchange content with Connecting Software´s custom solution built in just two months
executive_summary: Business Development Bank of Canada (BDC) is a leading bank for Canadian entrepreneurs and provides small and medium-sized businesses with financing and advisory services. BDC’s investment arm, BDC Capital, engaged Connecting Software to provide a custom solution to protect information on Microsoft Exchange from exposure when integrated with third-party CRM and relationship intelligence platforms. Connecting Software customized its CB Exchange Server Sync to enable robust, unidirectional filtering for Exchange mailboxes and content. The customization was built and deployed in two months, providing an encrypted integration featuring rules-based filtering that powers BDC to better serve its customers.

title: Make-A-Wish® continues its mission of hope and embraces innovation with help from Surface devices
executive_summary: Renowned around the world for creating life-changing wishes for children with critical illnesses, Make-A-Wish had a bold new vision to digitally transform its operations. It needed to standardize its IT services and devices across geographically dispersed staff and volunteer teams, and portability and ease-of-use were paramount to maximizing productivity and streamlining operations. Make-A-Wish selected Microsoft Surface Laptop 4 to help transform how it restores hope and joy for wish kids and their families when they need it most.

title: Global energy leader safeguards its digital transformation with automated app governance
executive_summary: bp’s app access and governance processes were preventing the company from embracing a more proactive, continuous security posture for its growing technology footprint. Recognizing change was needed, bp worked with Microsoft to provide feedback on the automation capabilities of the app governance add-on for Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps. As a result, the energy company deployed several services to provide more robust app tracking, regulation, and monitoring capabilities. bp simplified how it defines and enforces app behaviors for thousands of third-party and line-of-business apps across its global enterprises for 90,000 users.

title: MoE and Microsoft Collaborate to Ensure Education Continuity in Saudi Arabia
executive_summary: Maintaining continuity in the education domain is not easy when the infrastructure needed for teaching and learning is inaccessible to teachers and students. The COVID-19 pandemic has only hampered this continuity, in addition to obstructing activity in every walk of life across the world. People experienced prolonged lockdowns in the first half of 2020 and restricted movements in the second half of the year, and, aside from a handful of organizations, most businesses in every sector worldwide temporarily halted their activities as a result of the pandemic. The Saudi Ministry of Education (MoE) was an exception — the virus did not deter the MoE's determination to impart K-12 education to students across Saudi Arabia.

title: UAE retailer Al Tannan brings efficiency and centralized data to its stores with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: For four decades, Al Tannan has brought joy and functionality to homes in the United Arab Emirates. To better manage its supply chain, enhance efficiency and leverage data for faster business decisions, Al Tannan turned to Microsoft Dynamics 365. The cloud-based, user-friendly system centralized all of Al Tannan’s 12 stores under one platform. After the migration, Al Tannan eliminated manual work and streamlined its processes, reducing inventory time for a store from 14 to 4 hours. The team also gained visibility with data, enabling employees to monitor and solve issues faster and improve customer experience.

title: Modernizing Microsoft 365 with a move to Windows containers on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: Edenred UAE is the UAE's largest salary processing provider serving more than 6,000 companies, 2 million employees, over 10 banks and 35 financial institutions
executive_summary: Edenred UAE is the UAE's largest salary processing provider serving more than 6,000 companies, 2 million employees, over 10 banks and 35 financial institutions. Operating out of Dubai since 2008, Edenred simplifies WPS and non-WPS payroll, improves the quality of life for employees and helps companies take care of their hardworking people - pay them on time, securely and without effort. Edenred believes everyone should have equal access to essential financial services, regardless of how much they earn. That’s why we created C3Pay for their unbanked or underbanked employees, a mobile app where employees can manage their money instantly and conveniently.

title: Hultafors Group Implements A Scalable CRM Solution To Support Sustainable Growth
executive_summary: Both organically and through acquisitions, Hultafors Group had entered a period of sustained growth and reached a point where they wanted to take their existing CRM solution to the next level to meet the demands of their expanding business. So they did what any forward-thinking company would do, they sought out a partnership to join them on their journey going forward. It seemed natural and logical to invest in a strong and collaborative partnership that could help the business further embed Dynamics 365, bringing all their sales teams into one unified system. That’s when they brought CRM-Konsulterna (CRMK) onboard.

title: LUKS: simplifying hospital processes with low-code technology
executive_summary: Luzerner Kantonsspital (LUKS) is one of the largest hospitals in Switzerland, as well as a leading digital innovator. A forerunner of virtual consultations and digital patient management systems, LUKS believes in using technology to simplify processes and empower its staff. As part of this mission, the hospital has been exploring low-code apps and how they can help optimize operations and drive efficiencies. Their benefits were particularly clear during the pandemic, when LUKS used Microsoft PowerApps to create a solution that helped staff triage patients eligible for a COVID-19 antibody therapy. Built in just a few days, the app has helped clinicians save time and treat hundreds of patients at a crucial time of need.

title: Deutsche Post engineers flexibility and scalability with Azure SQL Database Hyperscale
executive_summary: Deutsche Post DHL Group is one of the world’s largest logistics companies managing national and international deliveries, warehouses and more. Its Track and Trace Parcel System allows internal services to track parcel deliveries and provides information to customers on the front end. Originally using a costly on-premises solution, the company needed a more scalable database to meet increased traffic and prepare for the future. With Azure SQL Database Hyperscale, Deutsche Post has achieved scalability and flexibility, reduced downtime and response time for requests, and greatly increased their number of service updates per year.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams

title: NTT Communications adds insider risk management to enhance data security with Microsoft Purview
executive_summary: NTT Communications Corporation has long focused on updating its cybersecurity risk posture against external attacks. Based on an analysis of the evolving threat landscape, the company decided to take a new approach in protecting its information assets. NTT Communications is using Microsoft Purview to provide communication transparency and data protection so that it can quickly identify internal risks in its remote work environment. Additionally, the company has created a work environment that fosters productivity and collaboration while still giving IT security staff peace of mind by enabling them to investigate anomalies before critical incidents occur rather than excessively relying on past log events after the fact.

title: Fending off cyberattacks: NORMA Group uses Microsoft Defender and Azure Sentinel to safeguard its global data
