Within an international network of locations, partners, and customers, the Group is responsible for the security of the data stored on its systems. To perform this important function, NORMA Group established its own security operations center, staffed by experts who monitor and process security alerts and, in emergencies, defend against cyberattacks. To ensure they have everything they need to respond quickly and fend off attacks, NORMA Group uses Microsoft Defender and Azure Sentinel.

title: CWS International moves to the cloud, increasing agility and flexibility with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: From hygiene solutions in company washrooms to bed linens and uniforms at hospitals and beyond, many of the goods and services fundamental to facilities go largely unnoticed by the consumer. Companies like CWS provide not just these goods, but a holistic package of services to keep buildings running across the world.

title: Groupama Biztosító simplifies telephony, bringing 150 branch offices closer to customers with Teams Phone
executive_summary: As one of Hungary's biggest insurers, Groupama Biztosító draws together thousands of customers and agents across the country. To do that fast, seamlessly, and cost-effectively, it relies on Microsoft Teams Phone. The solution is part of the familiar Microsoft 365 suite and enables instant, high-quality audio and video communication anywhere. With these converged communication services, Groupama simplified communication and collaboration, achieving enterprise-level security and 70% cost savings on telephony. Now, 1,500 company agents can meaningfully work together wherever they are while customers get their requests resolved immediately via phone.

title: FirstGroup accelerates business, reduces emissions with the centralized visibility and management of Azure Arc and Azure Monitor
executive_summary: As one of the United Kingdom’s leading public transportation providers, FirstGroup knows how to make the trains, and busses, run on time. Its bus and rail operators speedily and reliably connect people, places, and communities across the United Kingdom because they never lose sight of the value of smart and efficient management. And that’s no small feat considering that the company moved more than 1.4 million passengers over the past year with a fleet of almost 9,000 vehicles.
products: Azure, Azure Arc, Azure Logic Apps, Azure Monitor, Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager

title: NTT Data spans a digital divide
executive_summary: In an increasingly digital world, access to technology and the internet facilitates a modern economy. In Peru, ancient geological features, like the Andean Mountains and Amazon jungle, impede building technology infrastructure, like a fiber optics network, contributing to a lag in internet penetration compared to other Latin American countries. With only 40 percent1 of the population connected to the internet, a majority of Peruvians cannot access essential public and educational services administered online—an issue magnified by the pandemic. At the corporate and government level, limited connectivity hinders progress. Telecom companies who can bridge the digital divide are at a pivotal moment. The industry is disrupted by growing inefficiency and complexity of traditional technology architectures. Moving operations to the cloud is imperative to generate more profit through fast delivery of high-quality, repeatable services to end customers at minimum cost.

title: Climavision analyzes more data to provide enhanced weather forecasting using Azure HPC + AI
executive_summary: We can’t stop talking about the weather. Is it because weather so profoundly affects how we live, work, and play but is itself so notoriously difficult to predict? No matter the reason, while we talk about the weather, Climavision is becoming increasingly accurate at predicting it. With a small but dedicated team of scientists and weather technology specialists, Climavision is bringing more data and smarter analysis to weather forecasting, and it’s delivering vital and timely information to industries like agriculture, transportation, insurance and risk, and renewable energy. The company is getting more accurate weather data to industries faster and earlier with its proprietary data collection network and digital infrastructure provided by Microsoft Azure high-performance computing (HPC) + AI.

title: DeliverHealth enables better healthcare outcomes with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: DeliverHealth is a healthcare software and services company that empowers healthcare providers for the future. They provide a set of interconnected solutions to improve customers’ capabilities and solve systemic issues.

title: HighRadius enhances security and productivity of a hybrid workforce with Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: HighRadius offers cloud-based autonomous software for the office of the CFO. It brings modern digital transformation capabilities in processes like order to cash, treasury, and record to report. More than 700 businesses trust HighRadius’ autonomous finance products to automate routine processes. These businesses leverage the data-driven platform that delivers intelligence and experience to make insightful decisions. The company is headquartered in Houston, Texas, USA and has offices in multiple locations.

The company has built a reputation domestically and internationally for the completion and successful operation of Lotte World Tower, the tallest building in Korea and the fifth tallest in the world. executive_summary: Full transparency for all data to create maximum plant efficiency: ZF Group applies this basic concept to ensure that all the steps in the manufacturing process work seamlessly together. To this end, the mobility and technology company uses its own Digital Manufacturing Platform (DMP) and follows a cloud strategy built on Microsoft Azure. Today, this data platform and its applications provide ZF with a consistent, data-driven overview of its manufacturing activities. As a result, the company can optimize work steps such as maintenance and repair, make better use of resources, and increase production flexibility. This marks the first step toward establishing a globally connected, digital manufacturing network.

title: Managing 10,000 renewable power plants with 20 employees instead of 60
executive_summary: The energy transition is in full swing: new technologies keep arriving on the market, renewables are becoming more and more important, and legal requirements are constantly being adapted. Energy companies such as EnBW Energie Baden-Württemberg AG have been adjusting to the increase in distributed power generation for several years. This makes it possible to collect green electricity from many small power plants operating on renewables, pool it, and make it available much more widely. To manage these processes, the company relies on its Virtual Power Plant solution—and on automation through Microsoft Azure. Some 20 employees are able to manage about 10,000 renewable power plants, ranging from companies both large and small with solar roofs to farmers with biogas facilities.

title: Greek gaming leader optimizes its financial operations with S/4HANA on Azure
executive_summary: OPAP is the leading gaming company in Greece and one of the most renowned in its industry internationally. It is a sector leader in embedding global Responsible Gaming principles in its operations and supports Greek society in practice through an extensive corporate responsibility program focusing on health, sports and employment.

title: Omnichannel engagement technologists build a better retail customer experience on Azure
executive_summary: Peapod Digital Labs (PDL) is the digital and commercial engine for the companies of retail grocery group Ahold Delhaize USA. PDL builds and operates technology for Ahold Delhaize USA that drives omnichannel solutions for local brands. A modernization effort is transforming PDL into a cloud-first operation, with development, operations, and a collection of on-premises databases migrated to Microsoft Azure Database for PostgreSQL. PDL chose its proprietary store-picking app as the first to be built and delivered on the transformed infrastructure. In-store associates use the app on tablets and mobile devices to select products and fulfill online shoppers’ orders. Development and delivery are faster in Azure, and the store-picking app is demonstrating productivity improvement, a 33 percent reduction in errors, high application availability, and a 50 percent reduction in training time for in-store pickers at more than 800 stores.

title: CHPK builds its dream hybrid cloud solution with Azure Stack HCI and Windows Server
executive_summary: If you own, build, or occupy property, CHPK Property and Construction Consultants is ready and equipped to help. The UK-based property and construction consultancy offers an innovative approach to multidisciplinary services such as building surveying, fire engineering, project management, and contract administration with the goal of improving the industry and protecting those within it. Using Microsoft Azure and hybrid cloud solutions like Azure Stack HCI and Azure Arc, CHPK is realizing its vision for the future and transforming into a confident, resilient, and cost-effective business, enabling employees to continue putting clients first.

title: Clipchamp teams stay in sync using Microsoft Loop to collaborate across apps for richer insights
executive_summary: The Clipchamp teams at Microsoft have a collective goal. “We want to help everyone tell their stories, no matter who they are or what their experience level is,” says Yolanda Van Kimmenade, Senior Product Designer for Clipchamp at Microsoft. This storytelling got easier with the decision to add Clipchamp, a video-editing tool, to Microsoft 365. Clipchamp team members are responsible for making Clipchamp both a user friendly and tightly connected part of the Microsoft 365 toolset. To accomplish this, Van Kimmenade and her colleagues need to collaborate effortlessly. Enter Microsoft Loop, a co-creation app that works across Microsoft 365 apps and provides dedicated workspaces where teams can stay in sync. “Adopting Microsoft Loop has made it faster and much easier to work together,” says Van Kimmenade. “The things we collaborate on in Loop workspaces become living documents that change over time as team members add to them. It’s a more dynamic and organized way of working.”
products: Microsoft 365 Enterprise, Microsoft Teams, Outlook

title: San Diego Theatres reduces event management time by over 50 percent with VenueArc and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: San Diego Theatres, a nonprofit organization that manages two of San Diego's iconic venues, faced challenges in automating its back-office operations and event management processes. It turned to VenueArc, Microsoft partner Al Rafay Consulting’s solution built on Microsoft Azure, Teams, Power Platform, and SharePoint Online, to solve these challenges. Thanks to VenueArc's cutting-edge technology and Microsoft's support, San Diego Theatres achieved greater efficiency, cost savings, and a superior event management experience, elevating its performances to new heights.

title: Windows 11 Pro lets SUSI&James transform business communication
executive_summary: SUSI&James’ goal is to transform business communication with AI. Their voice assistant can interact with customers and take action in a remarkably human way, hence the term “digital employees.” The company deploys machine learning, natural language processing, and deep learning to handle a range of communication-heavy tasks—and not just within the confines of an office. While test-driving a vehicle, for example, the driver can speak naturally to an Al-powered co-driver while focusing on the road ahead. The co-driver records driving maneuvers, captures abnormalities, and logs test data in real time, all while increasing driver safety.
products: Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Intune, Windows 11

title: Windows 11 Pro lets HUG HUB bring insurance into the digital age
executive_summary: London-based HUG HUB wants to transform insurance into a self-service, customer-friendly platform. The company uses Windows 11 Pro devices along with cloud services to keep their employees productive and protected. Layers of built-in security enable their remote developers to build great software while keeping their sensitive customer data and source code secure.

title: Renewi deploys Elastic Observability on Microsoft Azure to optimize performance of business-critical applications
executive_summary: Renewi is a leading waste-to-product company that focuses on extracting value from waste rather than disposing of it. The company wanted to improve its operational efficiency, customer service, and environmental impact by using data and analytics more effectively. Renewi chose Elastic, a leading platform for search-powered solutions, to help it achieve its goals. Elastic’s solutions are supported and enhanced by Microsoft Azure, which provides a reliable, scalable, and secure cloud infrastructure for Elastic deployments. With Elastic on Azure, Renewi gained real-time insights into its waste streams, optimized its routes and processes, and reduced its carbon footprint.
products: Azure

title: Košík.cz gains agility to expand to new markets and deliver customer satisfaction with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: With daily deliveries to about 6,000 customers, Košík.cz is one of the Czech Republic’s largest online food retailers. Operating at that scale requires serious IT support to ensure that deliveries are met and customers are happy. However, Košík.cz’s digital infrastructure was increasingly unable to meet its growing demand.
products: Azure, SAP on Azure

title: Power Apps as a bridge to SAP: Automated digital customer orders for WENKO field service
executive_summary: Founded in 1959, WENKO-WENSELAAR GmbH & Co. KG is one of the leading suppliers of innovative product solutions for bathroom, kitchen, laundry, and living with a range of over 5,000 articles. Around 500 new ones are added every year—from soap dispensers to dehumidifiers to stylish home accessories. Approximately half of these products are sold to DIY and furniture stores by the company’s field service reps. In the past, the reps would generate orders on paper or using a laptop. But now, the family-owned company uses automated processes via Power Platform and a scan app based on Power Apps. This avoids errors and shortens lead times.
products: Azure Application Insights, Excel, Power Apps

title: SA Power Networks reduces datacenter footprint by around 30 percent with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: SA Power Networks understands the urgency of preparing for the future. As the key distributor of electricity to most of South Australia and its population of 1.7 million people, the company builds, operates, and maintains the crucial distribution network. And it takes that responsibility seriously. Not only does SA Power Networks deliver power dependably, but it also aims to deliver power safely and sustainably while supporting the shift to a net–100 percent renewable energy system. To support the seismic shift happening in the energy sector, from fossil-fueled power to renewables like rooftop solar, the company needed to rebuild its digital infrastructure. SA Power Networks required agility, scale, and data integration capabilities to complement and drive the innovation of its power distribution strategy, and it found what it needed in SAP on Microsoft Azure.

title: Breville’s brewing in new markets at record pace with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Breville, the quintessential kitchen appliance brand known the world over, enhances people’s lives through exceptional coffee and culinary experiences at home. Founded in Australia in 1932, the iconic maker of internationally award-winning coffee machines and premium kitchen products is on a quest to inspire people to “Master Every Moment” through thoughtful design and brilliant innovation. Breville delivers their ever-expanding inventory to more than 70 countries, empowering people to prepare food and beverages more easily and impressively than they’d thought possible in their own homes.

title: PwC Switzerland: Increasing business value while staying compliant using the Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: For a long time, PwC Switzerland’s ambitions to move to the cloud were limited by strict Swiss regulations around data storage and sharing. But when Microsoft established two data centers on Swiss soil, it opened the door to the opportunities the cloud could offer. The company has since embarked on a cloud transformation journey that drives greater efficiency, enhances collaboration and is yielding new innovations every day. Using Microsoft Azure, Microsoft 365 and Power Platform, the multi-year cloud transformation program has paved the way to a cloud-native future.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365

title: Ridgelinez, internally practicing data-driven management, builds data utilization infrastructure by Azure and accelerates DX even further!
executive_summary: Established in 2020 as a comprehensive professional firm supporting corporate innovation, Ridgelinez built data utilization infrastructure and is accelerating internal DX practice. As the background for building the infrastructure, they have dealt with issues such as “generation of data silos” and “lack of interest accompanying obsolescence of data” when promoting an architecture fully implemented on cloud by utilizing SaaS and PaaS. How did Ridgelinez solve issues of data, which is essential for promoting DX? Here is the introduction of activities related to data-driven management at Ridgelinez and the role that Microsoft Azure has played there.
products: Azure, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps, Azure SQL Database, Azure Synapse Analytics, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Purview, Power BI

title: Arthur Health’s clinically integrated network using Microsoft Power Platform scales pilot program that reduced patient wait times by 80%
executive_summary: Arthur Health, a healthcare solutions company based in Canada, is reimagining traditionally compartmentalized models of care through a clinically integrated network approach. In 2019, Arthur Health teamed up with the Ontario Ministry of Health and Long-Term Care and University Health Network to scale a rapid-access clinic model of care for low-back pain. In a pilot, this led to sustained reduced wait times, better access to local care, and higher patient and provider satisfaction, so Arthur Health plans to expand it. Arthur Health used Microsoft partner Quisitive’s MazikCare platform and Microsoft technologies to develop a patient-centered solution that the company hopes will spark changes to primary and specialty care in Canada.
products: Dynamics 365

title: MGM in Macau uses Microsoft Teams to replace resource-heavy processes with faster, digital alternatives
executive_summary: MGM MACAU and MGM COTAI, two integrated hotel properties in the resort city of Macau, use Microsoft Teams to provide company news, customer service tips, information, and applications, all of which employees can access on personal devices from anywhere, helping them to work more efficiently and collaborate better. It’s just one example of the organization’s ongoing efforts to empower employees in all areas of the business with collaboration tools that match the fast-paced reality of the hospitality industry.
products: Microsoft Teams

title: University of Bath researchers test theories and release findings faster than before with Azure HPC
executive_summary: The University of Bath wanted to upgrade its infrastructure to be able to provide access to the latest technology, including the newest types of virtual machines as they’re released. It now uses Microsoft Azure high-performance computing to empower its academic community to produce cutting-edge research and enhance course curricula at a faster pace than previously possible. It addresses its storage, monitoring, and management needs with a suite of Azure services, helping its researchers, teachers, and students benefit from new efficiencies, reduced response time for faster research results, and more opportunities to collaborate with the greater academic community.

title: SVA leverages Azure Migrate and Modernize to help its clients
executive_summary: SVA is an owner-managed system house in Germany whose mission is to find the best possible IT solutions for its clients. SVA has been able to leverage the Microsoft Azure Migrate and Modernize with its clients, as it provides a great argument for taking that leap and starting to modernize its applications. SVA identifies well-matched deployment opportunities that decrease costs and increase efficiency and reliability for customers across finance, healthcare, and government industries.
products: Azure

title: Bank Credit Dnipro secures banking services for customers with Microsoft Azure amidst instability
executive_summary: Founded in 1993, Bank Credit Dnipro (BCD) is a leading Ukrainian financial institution committed to anticipating and answering the needs of tomorrow. When Ukraine faced external conflict in 2022, BCD rushed to preserve its infrastructure and banking services for customers. With the support of Microsoft and partner Kyivstar, the bank embarked on a rapid digital transformation powered by Microsoft Azure. The solution has enabled secure card processing for 65,000 cardholders and stable remote working possibilities. BCD now operates with a robust failover mechanism, bolstering financial security and ensuring business continuity.

title: More affordable, accelerated, simplified: Microsoft Teams Phone now makes it possible to reach Hannover Re employees worldwide
executive_summary: Communicate across borders in a consistent, efficient, and digital way while automating the costs of on- and offboarding and the set-up of new workstations: Hannover Re shows how to do all of that—and at the same time, get rid of more than 4,000 hardware telephones to reduce the associated operating and acquisition costs with digital solutions. The reinsurance company relies on Microsoft Teams, Teams Phone, and Operator Connect to modernize collaboration and communication between its employees at all locations worldwide and with its customers.

title: Rituals builds a foundation for future expansion with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Rituals creates body, beauty, and home products with a conscience. Inspired by ancient wisdom and modern wellness, the Netherlands-based company blends natural ingredients and biodegradable formulas with elegant design and innovative packaging. Since its founding in 2000, Rituals has been committed to ethical and sustainable business practices. Its cosmetics, scents, skincare, home accessories, and specialty apparel products—all ethically produced—can be found at one of the company’s 1,200 stores around the world, online channels like rituals.com and its associated mobile app, and through well-known retailers such as Ulta Beauty, QVC, and Saks Fifth Avenue. Customers also enjoy experiencing Rituals products at luxury hotels, major airports, and its flagship physical store, House of Rituals, in the center of historic Amsterdam. With a presence in more than 100 countries, Rituals is a global leader in sustainable and ethical beauty.
products: Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Synapse Analytics, Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Finance, Power Apps

title: Cielo speeds threat detection and response with Microsoft Defender XDR and Microsoft Sentinel
executive_summary: Cielo employs more than 6,000 professionals and brought in more than BRL10.6 billion in revenue in 2023 (USD2.19 billion). Like many other large companies, Cielo has, in years past, contracted a wide variety of companies to provide portions of its cybersecurity environment. The resulting solution was costly and overly complex. Adopting Microsoft Defender XDR, Microsoft Sentinel, Intune, and more, the company has since consolidated its security landscape in a way that reduces not just costs and complexity but threat response times as well.
products: Microsoft Copilot for Security, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Defender XDR, Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Purview, Microsoft Sentinel, Microsoft Defender

title: Ceibal streamlines delivery, puts 240,000 Windows devices into Uruguay's students', and teachers' hands
executive_summary: N/A
products: Microsoft Intune, Windows Autopilot, Windows 10, Windows 11

title: Danish Diabetes Association deepens member and volunteer support with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The Danish Diabetes Association serves 90,000 members, helping people with diabetes and their families live better lives. The nonprofit adopted Microsoft Dynamics 365 to better understand and serve its constituents in a cost-effective manner. The more efficient CRM enables the Danish Diabetes Association to provide its members and volunteers with more relevant information, and a payment integration helps cash flow so the organization can maximize funding for its programming.
products: Dynamics 365, Power Pages

title: Special Olympics International gets more athletes on the field with Microsoft Power Pages
executive_summary: Special Olympics International breaks down stigma by providing people with intellectual and developmental disabilities opportunities to lead—on and off the sports field. The global nonprofit developed accessible athlete and volunteer portals so participants can participate more easily and independently. The portals, created with Power Pages, also connect to Microsoft Dynamics 365 to enable Special Olympics to interact with supporters on a deeper level.

title: Camfil harmonizes processes with Dynamics 365 to bolster sustainability and profitability
executive_summary: Camfil has helped people breathe cleaner air for more than half a century. As a leading manufacturer of premium clean air filtration solutions, with more than 30 production facilities and nearly 6,000 employees, the Sweden-based company provides commercial and industrial systems for air filtration and air pollution control in more than 35 countries. Camfil’s mission is to protect people, processes, and the environment by designing, developing, and delivering solutions that combine clean air with energy efficiency in a sustainable and profitable way.

title: Keller Independent School District improves student experiences with Surface laptops and secures the organization using Microsoft 365 A5
executive_summary: Keller ISD is responsible for the education of over 34,000 students in cities and towns spread across 51 square miles of land just north of Fort Worth, Texas. The school district focuses on providing exceptional educational experiences in the classroom, across its facilities, and through support and guidance for students and staff alike. To further this goal, Keller ISD recently hired Matt Vrlenich as its new Chief Technology Officer. Upon taking the role, Vrlenich quickly identified his top priority: migrating 23,000 browser-based devices for its fifth through twelfth graders to Surface Laptops and Microsoft 365 A5, then utilizing the included cloud-management tools and Microsoft security to keep students learning and the organization compliant and safe.

title: Goodwill Industries of the Valleys battles poverty by empowering staff through technology
executive_summary: Goodwill Industries of the Valleys expands opportunity for 30,000 people in Virginia each year. To accelerate its mission to eliminate poverty, the nonprofit shifted fully to the cloud. Transitioning its virtual machines to the cloud is allowing Goodwill Industries of the Valleys to transform its headquarters into a revolutionary new community center. Further, the nonprofit has stepped up its security stance to protect its vital work from bad actors.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Sentinel, SharePoint

title: Laris Hotels unlocks legacy data with Power Automate
executive_summary: Laris Hotels Group is one of the largest hotel chains in Krakow, Poland, and wanted more timely access to booking data across its network. To replace a weekly manual process, the company used desktop robotic process automation (RPA) in Power Automate to pull data daily from a legacy system that did not offer an API. With faster access to fully customized data in Power BI, the company now has a clearer view of booking data, with average hotel occupancy increasing by approximately 15%.

title: Finastra delivers faster updates and performance using Azure Kubernetes Service with Windows containers
executive_summary: LaserPro document management software is key to the Finastra vision of delivering the future of banking. Migrating from an on-premises management system to a cloud-based infrastructure using Windows containers on Azure Kubernetes Service has significantly increased agility through biweekly updates and reduced support costs for both customers and developers.

title: Grupo Olarena project with Dynamics 365 stands out among the top 100 in Mexico in 2022
executive_summary: With the implementation of Microsoft's ERP, the Mexican hospitality company Grupo Olarena was able to automate task flows, integrate with suppliers, and improve its financial, accounting, and treasury operations. In addition, its ongoing commitment to innovation and optimization enabled it to simplify back-office management processes, increase accuracy, agility, and speed of information gathering. It also improved the results of various operations.

title: With Power Apps and Microsoft 365, Votorantim Center of Excellence empowers employees and increases feedback delivery by 288%
executive_summary: The Votorantim Center of Excellence has created a tool to elevate the potential of its feedback culture. The "Hi!" was born from the combination of multiple applications and over time, opportunities were realized to improve the user experience through the use of Microsoft Teams and visualization through Power BI dashboards, improving tool management and expanding the potential of its functionalities. The experience took a leap in quality and the initiative optimized costs and fulfilled its objective with simplified use.
products: Microsoft 365, Power Automate, Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, Power BI, SharePoint

title: Fresh Mark optimizes operations and improves performance with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Fresh Mark produces a wide range of Sugardale-branded cured, smoked, and specialty meats for some of the biggest grocery, food service, and restaurant chains in all 50 US states and more than 20 countries. The company remains family-owned and employs more than 2,500 people at four locations in northeast Ohio. From its founding a century ago, Fresh Mark has focused on transforming fresh, high-quality meats into everyone’s favorite morning bacon, holiday ham, daily sandwich, pepperoni for pizza toppings, and hot dogs for barbecues and baseball games. Its brines and seasonings, smoking techniques, meticulous attention to safe food handling, and rigorous testing set the company apart.

title: Milpark Education transforms student support with Dynamics 365 and Microsoft’s Digital Contact Center
executive_summary: Milpark Education, a South African higher education provider, faced operational challenges in student support. Its legacy systems created data silos, slowing down student interactions. In collaboration with Enterprisecloud, Milpark Education implemented Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service and the Digital Contact Centre within a short 3-month timeframe. This change, along with additional Dynamics 365 and Azure technologies, helped Milpark Education transform its Student Support via a new integrated digital platform. Equipped with greater visibility, Milpark Education has reduced resolution times by 50% and escalation times by over 30%. This frees its support staff to bring more value by focusing on conversations required for more complex cases.

title: All Pro improves efficiencies with Microsoft Power Pages and saves CAD $30,000 in ERP fees
executive_summary: All Pro Electrical was looking for a cost-effective right sized solution for various business needs, including submitting expenses, completing crucial safety forms, and managing leave requests. All Pro Electrical chose the Microsoft Power Platform and created an employee portal using Microsoft Power Pages and Microsoft Power Automate that has automated key functions, improved safety compliance, and significantly reduced manual administrative tasks. By developing a solution primarily in-house, the business saved CAD $30,000 in consulting fees and implemented a customized portal that was based on their business needs.
products: Azure Blob Storage, Power Apps, Dataverse, Power Automate, Power Pages

title: Aon Brazil CRS uses Power BI, lowers costs 8%, deployment time by 80% with Power Apps, Power Automate workflows
executive_summary: Aon exists to shape decisions for the better—to protect and enrich the lives of people around the world. Through actionable analytic insights, globally integrated Risk Capital and Human Capital expertise, and locally relevant solutions they provide clients in more than 120 countries and sovereignties with clarity and confidence to make better decisions. Starting in Brazil with their commercial risk solution (CRS) organization, the company sought to eliminate manual procedures for support requests in broking and claims processing operations with enterprise tooling and end-to-end, automated processing capabilities. With Microsoft Power Automate, Power Apps, and Power BI pipelines, Aon has realized automated processing operations end-to-end, improved data management and the company avoided 8% of the estimated budgeted costs.

title: KPMG transforms customer service, unlocks real-time insights using Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service
executive_summary: N/A
products: Azure, Dynamics 365 Customer Service

title: Kal Tire Latam makes way to the future with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: With Dynamics 365 for Finance & Operations and Power BI, Kal Tire Latin America has continued its operations in the context of COVID-19.
products: Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Finance, Power BI

title: Cielo speeds threat detection and response with Microsoft Defender XDR and Microsoft Sentinel
executive_summary: Cielo employs more than 6,000 professionals and brought in more than BRL10.6 billion in revenue in 2023 (USD2.19 billion). Like many other large companies, Cielo has, in years past, contracted a wide variety of companies to provide portions of its cybersecurity environment. The resulting solution was costly and overly complex. Adopting Microsoft Defender XDR, Microsoft Sentinel, Intune, and more, the company has since consolidated its security landscape in a way that reduces not just costs and complexity but threat response times as well.
