It has embraced digital transformation (DX), implementing digital construction and many other measures leveraging advanced technology. Microsoft Azure plays a critical role as the enterprise’s public cloud platform. After adopting Microsoft 365 in 2018, the company set Azure as its standard public cloud as part of its investment to create new value. This shift accelerated DX initiatives immensely. Azure is also the foundation for the data integration platform driving Daiwa House Industry’s DX initiatives, modernizing its core portal, and running mission-critical SAP S/4HANA systems. The company has also started using Azure OpenAI Service while continuing to implement DX initiatives and modernizing existing systems with Azure as its cloud standard.

title: Alstom intègre l’IA générative dans ses processus métiers avec Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Alstom, a worldwide leader in the railway sector, operates in more than sixty countries, providing rolling stock, signaling systems, and services for rail. The company is leading as well in digital services for rail and implemented Microsoft Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) to its in-house tool, with the goal of delivering its unprecedented backlog more efficiently: on time, on target, and on budget with a higher customer satisfaction.

title: Profisee eliminates data siloes within Microsoft Fabric
executive_summary: Data is a main component of any business. Enterprises rely on it to help customers gain insights across a variety of use cases.

title: Microsoft Fabric と Azure AI Studio で「FOODATA」に生成 AI 基盤を実装、データ分析のダッシュボードから「すぐに結論が得られる」サービスへの進化を目指す
executive_summary: In May 2023, ITOCHU Corporation (“ITOCHU”) launched a cross-company task force to promote the use of generative AI across all businesses. This included incorporating generative AI into FOODATA, a data analytics dashboard which the ITOCHU Food Company provides to customers. ITOCHU is using Azure OpenAI Service and Azure AI Studio to evolve its data analytics dashboard into a service that provides immediate recommendations by automatically creating evidence-based product proposals. The corporation has already forged more than 70 ideas for using generative AI and has begun developing a data integration platform to bring these ideas to fruition. Microsoft Fabric is a front-runner for this platform for its potential to leverage retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) in higher quality generative AI responses.

title: Lionbridge disrupts localization industry using Azure OpenAI Service and reduces turnaround times by up to 30%
executive_summary: Lionbridge Technologies, LLC (Lionbridge), a global translation and localization services provider, is using Microsoft Azure and Azure OpenAI Service to accelerate its delivery times and improve quality. Lionbridge seized the chance to work with open-AI technology rather than against it, improving agility and offering hyper-personalization with LLMs. Since launching its AI-enabled solutions, which use GPT-4 on Azure OpenAI Service, Lionbridge has reduced project turnaround times by up to 30%. In the process, the company is disrupting the localization industry and creating a host of new business opportunities.

title: Commercial Bank of Dubai: innovating a future proof banking platform with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Commercial Bank of Dubai (CBD) quadrupled its client base in the last four years, necessitating a future-proof banking platform. Using Microsoft Azure, CBD upgraded its application infrastructure, improving transaction security and speed. Individual customers can now open an account and start banking with CBD in about two minutes using its award-winning mobile banking platform. Additionally, CBD launched a new low-code Corporate Internet Banking platform that was built in-house, thus acquiring full control of digital differentiation, and enabling faster solution development and informed decisions.

title: Oncoclínicas cria portal web e aplicativo mobile para armazenar procedimentos clínicos e médicos com o Azure Cognitive Services
executive_summary: With the support of Dataside, a Microsoft partner, the nation's largest Oncology group was able to transform its entire data ecosystem with a web portal and mobile application that performs all image processing and storage with Azure support and the use of AI and Machine Learning tools.

title: 시민 개발자가 된 호텔리어, Power Platform 기반 스마트워크 문화 & 초자동화 업무 환경 구축
executive_summary: Lotte Hotels & Resorts, including Signiel, is the largest hotel and resort company in Korea that leads the country’s hotel and resort culture. As more and more domestic and international tourists are visiting, it welcomes guests with quality services and facilities as a global chain hotel. This is all thanks to countless employees' hard work. Lotte Hotels & Resorts has been creating a new work culture that allows them to work more efficiently and focus on the nature of the work by adopting Microsoft Power Platform for automation.

title: Xavier College begins a process of modernising its student information systems on Dynamics 365 and AI, unlocking powerful insights
executive_summary: Xavier College was grappling with disparate legacy systems and data fragmentation, which hindered staff from accessing information. As part of its digital transformation, the school has implemented Microsoft Dynamics 365 to consolidate data, streamline processes and enhance productivity. Dynamics 365 has allowed the school to simplify its architecture, fostering innovation and data-driven decision-making. Coupled with the school’s migration to an Azure cloud environment, Dynamics 365 allows the school to explore AI for automation and Power Platform for user-specific portals.

title: Qatar Charity shrinks IT maintenance costs by 40% and increases its call center efficiency thanks to Copilot AI and Netways
executive_summary: Qatar Charity, a renowned non-profit organization dedicated to humanitarian efforts worldwide, faced significant challenges with inefficient call center operations and fragmented data management systems.

title: Sony challenges automated driving by development of Sensor Fusion System using Azure.
executive_summary: Advancing automated driving systems requires improved accuracy in imaging and sensing technologies, along with extensive data processing. Currently, the on-premises infrastructure needs time and effort to manage large data and machine learning tasks.

title: Acentra Health boosts employee productivity with generative AI and Azure OpenAI Service, saving 11,000 nursing hours and nearly $800,000
executive_summary: Acentra Health, a US company offering healthcare solutions and services, is embracing generative AI technology and substantially saving time for its specially trained nurses.

title: Universitas Terbuka enhances distance learning for 100,000 students with Azure AI
executive_summary: Indonesia’s Universitas Terbuka (UT), with over 525,000 active students and growing, struggled to provide timely tutor support, risking student engagement, satisfaction, and retention.

title: Hevolus aims to revolutionize the immersive consumer experience using Azure AI
executive_summary: To achieve its mission to revolutionize immersive consumer experiences, Hevolus needed to build a SaaS platform capable of catalyzing its planned innovations, while staying highly responsive to customer needs and market opportunities.

title: legal-i is revolutionizing medical insurance claims management with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: legal-i was looking for a solution that would make the complex processing of unstructured data sets in the healthcare and insurance sector significantly faster and easier.

title: Buenos Aires City: How generative AI is revolutionizing the lives of millions with Azure OpenAI Services
executive_summary: The Government of the City of Buenos Aires faced a challenge in the management of multiple service channels and in the personalization of key services for residents and tourists.

title: Verne gains faster insights and future-proofs its pioneering urban autonomous mobility business with Microsoft Fabric
executive_summary: Verne, a company developing a new innovative concept of urban autonomous mobility, faced a complex data landscape. Different data sources and time-consuming reporting consumed valuable time and resources.

title: Insurance shoppers gain new service channel with artificial intelligence chatbot
executive_summary: Major auto insurance provider Progressive may be best known for Flo, its iconic spokesperson. The company wanted to take advantage of customers’ increasing use of mobile channels to interact with its brand. So Progressive used Microsoft Azure Bot Service and Cognitive Services to quickly and easily build the Flo Chatbot—currently available on Facebook Messenger—which answers customer questions, provides quotes, and even offers a bit of witty banter in Flo’s well-known style.

title: City of Hope uses Microsoft Azure and AI to rapidly onboard thousands of patients per year
executive_summary: Across the healthcare industry, doctors spend significant time—often during nonworking hours—reviewing patient documents to prepare for appointments. This extensive onboarding process limits the time doctors can interact with patients face-to-face.

title: OpenAI transforms AI model development with Azure Blob Storage
executive_summary: As the size and complexity of AI models grow, so do the requirements for storage, especially on throughput scale and reliability. For that reason, OpenAI, renowned for developing conversational AI products like ChatGPT, relies on Microsoft Azure Blob Storage and newly enhanced scaled accounts to underpin its vast data and training workflows.

title: Ramp saves 30K hours and automates 5M receipts monthly with Microsoft Azure AI Platform
executive_summary: Ramp aimed to eliminate manual finance workflows, reduce developer friction and scale fast, while maintaining speed, accuracy and security across its platform.

title: In the face of disruption, GEP powers global supply chain resilience with Azure
executive_summary: GEP is a global leader in procurement and supply chain management solutions. It uses Microsoft Azure to offer well-architected, cloud-native solutions that provide customers with a reliable, resilient, AI-powered supply chain management platform. GEP uses Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) and Azure availability zones to minimize the threat of downtime and maintain accurate information. GEP’s microservice-driven architecture and use of Azure Cognitive Services enhances the functionality and responsiveness of its platform to deliver a reliable, agile, user-friendly, and data-driven supply chain management solution.

title: Nebraska Department of Education generates actionable insights with Microsoft Azure to support equitable outcomes for students
executive_summary: The Nebraska Department of Education (NDE) has been a pioneer in the open-source movement around modern predictive student outcome platforms, in pursuit of its strategic mission to “lead and support the preparation of all Nebraskans for learning, earning, and living.” The NDE is using Microsoft Azure to modernize its data platforms, leveraging tools such as Synapse Analytics to better provide actionable insights, while transforming its Statewide Longitudinal Data System (SLDS) to promote equitable outcomes for all students.

title: NHS gets well-architected in response to the pandemic
executive_summary: Since 1948, the National Health Service (NHS) has represented health and wellness to British citizens across the isles. However, never in its 70-plus years has the NHS encountered such an unprecedented health threat as when COVID-19 reached its shores. In order to respond quickly and effectively to the overwhelming flood of healthcare needs, it became increasingly clear that the NHS needed a better, more responsive system architecture that could scale with the tsunami of demand and maintain expected performance levels. That’s why it turned to the Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework and the AlwaysOn architectural approach—to diagnose systemic issues with the NHS architecture and implement a better framework for increased security, performance, and operations.

title: New Zealand moves to a cloud-based identity solution for its 4.9 million residents
executive_summary: The New Zealand Department of Internal Affairs partnered with UNIFY Solutions to migrate the country’s RealMe identity service—more than 6 million sign-ins and authentications spanning 163 government services and 56 agencies—to Microsoft Azure Active Directory B2C, part of Microsoft Entra.

title: Power BI helps journalists investigate and share insightful, data-based news
executive_summary: Animal Politico is a pioneer in data journalism in Mexico and a valuable source of political news for 6 million readers each month. A funding and training collaboration among Microsoft, Knight Center for Journalism in the Americas, and Enlighten Designs helped Animal Politico discover ways that Power BI can sift through vast amounts of data to find stories hidden in the numbers. The Power BI interactive visualizations revealed the startling fact that nine girls between the ages of 12 and 17 are reported missing in Mexico every day. Adding the visualizations to the finished article helped engage and educate more than 11,000 of Animal Politico's readers.

title: Delhaize digitally transforms its store network with Hanshow using Azure
executive_summary: Belgian retailer Delhaize was facing an operational challenge to efficiently manage pricing systems in its growing network of stores. Despite having adopted a degree of digitalization through electronic shelf labels, local IT infrastructure left many gains in efficiency on the table through the need to still update pricing information store by store. Delhaize needed the ability to centrally manage its electronic shelf labels (ESL) and other IoT devices across its entire store network for faster and more consistent update and upgrades.

title: Mosaic Life Care scales portal, maximizes vaccine accessibility with Azure SQL Managed Instance
executive_summary: Many living in the United States were incredibly relieved when the COVID-19 vaccine became available—but finding an available dose could be tricky initially. Mosaic Life Care, a healthcare organization based in Missouri, didn’t want its on-premises environment to limit how many patients could register for shots. So, the organization moved its vaccine portal to Microsoft Azure SQL Managed Instance so that it could scale without worry. The IT team saved time and administrative hassle by no longer managing its infrastructure, and Mosaic quickly administered more than 60,000 doses.

title: F5 finds winning formula with the commercial marketplace
executive_summary: Application delivery and security provider F5 began selling in the commercial marketplace five years ago—nearly at the commercial marketplace’s inception. Since then, the company has continued to invest in building the cloud route to market and embrace selling through the marketplace as a key part of its sales strategy. Cloud marketplaces started as a simple directory of third-party apps, but now they have evolved to sophisticated distribution platforms with functionality for users to discover, procure, and deploy relevant applications. F5’s evolution in the commercial marketplace has helped customers simplify the deployment of their technology as well as unlock a sales channel that allows F5 to rapidly scale. This winning formula led the company to being named Microsoft 2021 Partner of the Year Award winner for the Commercial Marketplace.

title: Delivering improvements through a ‘cloud first’ strategy at London Borough of Waltham Forest
executive_summary: “There are good technical reasons for choosing Microsoft Azure – and it was the smallest jump for us technically – but, for me, it was how Microsoft had changed and what it was most focused on that was most important. We want choice and we want a partner who listens and is focused on what we need and on the people we support,” says Paul Neville, Director of Digital & ICT, London Borough of Waltham Forest.

title: For Procter & Gamble, data is at the heart of digital transformation
executive_summary: For more than 180 years, Procter & Gamble (P&G) has built a thriving business by challenging norms and delighting consumers. Its range of household products, from toothpaste and soap to paper towels and laundry detergent, can be found in millions of homes—in nearly every country on Earth.
products: Azure, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

title: Dow Inc. uses AI to create new products
executive_summary: Dow Inc., one of the three largest materials science companies in the world, is an American multinational corporation that delivers a broad range of science-based products and solutions. Dow is undergoing a digital transformation using the Microsoft Azure, Office 365, and Dynamics 365 clouds. By combining Dow’s decades of chemistry experience with Microsoft Azure AI and machine learning, the company is shortening the discovery process for developing new products from months of exploratory laboratory work to seconds, speeding time to value for both Dow and its customers. Looking ahead, the company plans to harness this same AI-driven process to predict the products customers will want before they want them.

title: Unforgettable virtual events with the MAKONIS streaming platform – based on Azure Media Services
executive_summary: Tightly packed music fans losing themselves to the beat of their favorite band. Conference attendees in huge halls hanging on the speakers’ every word. Colleagues standing around a whiteboard tweaking the corporate strategy. The COVID - 19 health crisis put a sudden stop to all of this. Looking to provide a solution here, MAKONIS developed the Streamboxy event platform in record time – based on Azure. An event solution that will remain relevant for a long time to come.

title: Government of South Australia enhances security, drives resiliency with Microsoft Unified Support
executive_summary: The Government of South Australia wanted to optimize its overall technology investment and offer better employee and citizen experiences, but its IT environment meant that some agencies lacked support. The state government developed a new centralization approach, and after entering into a two-year agreement for Microsoft Unified Support, it was able to unite its agencies under a single Microsoft 365 tenancy. It now receives expert guidance and tailored support, whenever needed, as it modernizes its capabilities and services. The Government of South Australia utilizes Unified Support to enhance its security posture, upskill staff, and rapidly deploy key Microsoft technologies to boost collaboration and efficiency to meet the needs of its agencies and serve its citizens.

title: Green Kite uses Power BI dashboard created by Bespoke for deeper insights
executive_summary: Green Kite is a professional inventory company that works with agents and landlords in the United Kingdom to carry out more than 10,000 detailed inventories per year. Their highly skilled team carry out numerous inventories, check-ins, midterm inspections, and checkouts on a daily basis, all for multiple agencies. Green Kite had been spending days manually consolidating data to create detailed reports on property inspections. By adopting Power BI, Bespoke.xyz were able to create custom dashboards to clearly display crucial, current data to employees in the field, saving hours per week that now can be spent on key improvement areas.

title: Mississippi Division of Medicaid leaps into modernized data access management
executive_summary: Ensuring the privacy of members’ personally identifiable information is a challenge in an environment where access needs by external parties change constantly. The Mississippi Division of Medicaid stays on top of that demand with adept use of technology. It modernized with Microsoft solutions, making full use of the access package capabilities in Microsoft Azure Active Directory Identity Governance—helping keep member information both safe and seamlessly available to those who need it to ensure the best possible health coverage.

title: Perrigo takes on the future with enhanced agility, flexibility, and scalability with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: A worldwide producer and supplier of consumer self-care products, Perrigo needs to track tens of thousands of SKUs and manage shipments all over the world. After significant growth through a series of acquisitions, Perrigo wanted to streamline its enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems. It identified finance as the most strategic place to begin. Perrigo’s long-standing relationship with Microsoft, dating back to its Microsoft 365 implementation, helped inform its decision to move its finance workloads to SAP on Azure and the Microsoft Cloud. Perrigo is setting itself up to take advantage of comprehensive security and compliance, intelligent insights from its numerous data sources, automation and innovation to accelerate transformation, and familiar productivity and collaboration tools to empower its employees.

title: Ally Financial applies the power of Azure Quantum to bring tomorrow’s solutions to today’s customers
executive_summary: Ally Financial fully believes in the power and potential of technology. Since its inception as a 100-percent digital financial institution, the Detroit, Michigan–based company has specialized in innovative digital banking experiences. Ally regularly pushes conventional boundaries on behalf of its corporate, commercial, and consumer customers. To that end, the company has decided to use Microsoft Azure Quantum resources, including new algorithms and future quantum hardware, to improve operations and tackle highly complex issues beyond the industry’s reach with traditional computing.

title: Thai lingerie company makes sense of production and sales data with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: With a market that extends beyond Thailand into the US, UK, and Europe, Thai lingerie company Sabina realized its need to continue streamlining its operations. The COVID-19 pandemic accelerated Sabina’s transformation journey, and led its people to embrace Microsoft Teams and Azure in their day-to-day activities. Thanks to some adjustments, meetings in Sabina are now shorter, leading to greater efficiencies. Data are also more organized and meaningful, resulting in more accurate forecasts for manufacturing and sales.

title: Businesses fight friendly fraud with Ethoca Consumer Clarity on Azure Cosmos DB
executive_summary: Friendly fraud occurs when a customer files a chargeback for a legitimate transaction and receives a refund from their bank. This kind of fraud presents a tremendous challenge for both payment card issuers and merchants. According to Rahul Deshpande, Chief Technology Officer for Ethoca, “Friendly fraud can account for as much as 70% of all credit card fraud, which is immense, and it costs the industry about $132 billion per year.” Ethoca, a MasterCard company, is helping businesses around the world fight friendly fraud with Ethoca Consumer Clarity™, a solution that provides rich merchant and purchase information to both cardholders and financial institutions, helping reduce purchase confusion. To accomplish this, Ethoca built its solution on Microsoft Azure, using Azure Cosmos DB to process 15 TB of data in real time. Since its launch, Consumer Clarity has processed thousands of digital receipts within seconds. Watch the video below to learn more about how Ethoca built Consumer Clarity on Azure.

title: On the fast track to environmental action: DKV Mobility draws on digital products to ensure efficient and sustainable supply chains and vehicle fleets
executive_summary: From Hamburg to Munich with two tons of freight; from Munich to Hamburg with nothing: it’s not uncommon for trucks to deliver goods to a destination and then drive the long way back empty. This is a waste of resources—despite the fact that most companies put cost efficiency and sustainability high on their agenda. However, change is happening in the logistics sector, and DKV Mobility is helping smooth the way: its customer account center DKV Cockpit allows logistics companies and corporate vehicle fleets to operate in a connected, efficient, and sustainable manner. The technology behind it: Microsoft Azure and Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).

title: The sky is the limit: Nürnberger Baugruppe migrates its data center to the cloud and relies on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Companies from all areas of value creation in the construction industry make up the Nürnberger Baugruppe, including builders, civil engineers, and property developers. There are also IT service providers, such as BRZ. Specializing in organization and construction informatics, this company operates a data center, provides construction ERP developed in-house as well as outsourcing services, and runs a training academy. In September 2019, BRZ took a strategic decision to use true cloud solutions for its ERP software with a view to providing key players in the construction business with optimum support during their digital transformation. As a result, BRZ migrated its own data center to the Microsoft Azure cloud platform. This was accompanied by the launch of BRZ 365—the company’s own cloud-native ERP platform for the construction industry.

title: Sage extends cloud-enabling solutions for partners using Azure Virtual Desktop alongside Azure Lighthouse
executive_summary: In 1981, accountant David Goldman started a development project to automate print estimating and basic accounting processes for his business. He soon realized that other companies could benefit too, and he formed the Sage Group to begin selling the software.

title: Microsoft Azure brings agility, resilience and sustainability benefits for Aster
executive_summary: Aster Group supplies a wide range of housing options in response to the housing crisis, working towards its vision of ensuring everyone has a home. The not-for-dividend business was established in 1990 and has £2 billion worth of assets. It plans to invest £2.5 billion to deliver 12,000 new homes by 2030. Aster reinvests profits from open market sale and shared ownership to support the development of affordable rented homes. It owns and maintains over 34,500 homes and employs more than 1,720 people.

title: New Zealand’s largest farming co-op drives cultural change via digital transformation
executive_summary: Farmlands Co-operative is a major player in New Zealand’s rural industry, with business units in retail, fuel, nutrition, and horticulture. In 2013, the co-operative’s two biggest regional operations merged into a single entity. However, two years later, the national company was still working in silos and used multiple systems. To break down this highly fragmented approach, Farmlands embarked on a three-year project, employing Microsoft Dynamics 365 to help the diverse business build a united digital culture.

title: Xelya creates scalable, highly secure modern hybrid environment with Azure Stack HCI
executive_summary: Xelya is an intelligent cloud solutions provider specializing in information telecommunications systems for small to medium-sized businesses, such as personal care service providers and law firms. Xelya aims to help its customers reduce the complexity of their daily operations with enterprise resource planning (ERP) software that works seamlessly with Office 365. To keep up with customer growth and rising demand for its software solutions among home health service providers, Xelya wanted to modernize its on-premises architecture to run its high-performance workloads and applications at scale without incurring high operational costs. The company migrated its existing Hyper-V solution built on storage area network architecture to Microsoft Azure Stack HCI to scale for demand, maximize peak performance, and extend its current environment to the cloud to optimize for growth.

title: Digital retail startup Cooler Screens scales 10X in 6 months with Microsoft technology and support
executive_summary: Fast-growing in-store retail media startup Cooler Screens transforms the retail experience by turning retail surfaces, such as cooler doors, into IoT-enabled digital smart screens, powered by an enterprise-scale merchandising and media platform on Azure. By building entirely on Microsoft Azure the company was able to scale seamlessly from 1,000 to 10,000 connected devices across 700+ stores in six months. Using the flexibility of cloud services, the company is streamlining its technology ecosystem to support its next round of explosive growth which will also include addressing other categories to help retailers manage their in-store retail media network on one Cooler Platform.

title: Fujitsu now scales in minutes, reduces upgrade costs with move to Azure
executive_summary: Leading information and technology full-services provider Fujitsu wanted to improve the scalability and efficiency of its online presence to advance its brand. To achieve this, it decided to migrate its online presence to Microsoft Azure from hosting in on-premises datacenters.

title: Porsche Holding standardizes business analyses in the cloud with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Porsche Holding Salzburg is a subsidiary of Volkswagen AG, and has a name that stands for innovation like few others in the automotive industry. It comes as no surprise, that this company began its cloud transformation early on – in 2017. But until recently, the efficiency gains that came with this step were realized primarily in software development. Now, taking business intelligence as an example, the company is seeing how cooperation between central IT and business units turns the public cloud into a driver of business innovation.

title: City of Saint John triumphs over ransomware attack with Bulletproof and Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: Even as the City of Saint John was working harder than ever to deliver service to its citizens during an unprecedented pandemic, it was targeted by a crippling ransomware attack. Thanks to its steely resolve and its strong relationship with Microsoft Partner Network member and security expert Bulletproof, the City rebuilt and came back stronger than ever before with a host of Microsoft Security solutions.

title: Mobility made digital: Prostheses and digital solutions from Ottobock with data analytics and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Movement is key to a healthy lifestyle—people who’ve had an amputation depend on the functionality of a prosthesis to restore their mobility. Orthopedic technology specialist Ottobock is perfecting its high-tech prostheses using intelligence from the cloud. With the Digital to Walk technology based on Azure together with modern teleprosthetics, the company has one clear goal: help people regain their mobility.

title: Betterment builds checking platform for previously underserved with Helix by Q2
executive_summary: When investment fintech Betterment needed a compliant, capable, secure, and robust way to host accounts in the cloud—and do so in a cost-effective way—it found it by using Q2’s Helix platform, which is backed by Microsoft Azure.

title: Fashable reimagines the future of fashion design with Azure Machine Learning and Pytorch
executive_summary: Portugal-based Fashable is here to revolutionize the fashion industry with AI. Unsustainable manufacturing, unsold inventories, and long production cycles are common issues in fashion. But according to Orlando Ribas Fernandes, Co-Founder and CEO of Fashable, they can all be solved with the help of technology. Using Azure Machine Learning, an enterprise-grade service for the end-to-end machine learning lifecycle, and PyTorch, an open-source machine learning framework, Fashable created an AI algorithm that can generate original clothing designs, helping fashion companies to meet customer demand, get to market faster, and reduce clothing waste.

title: Onslow Virtual Schools - MSC - Equity defined by connection: Onslow Virtual Schools delivers online learning excellence with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Onslow Virtual Schools (OVSS) includes an elementary and secondary school that serves students in the area around Jacksonville, North Carolina. For various reasons, students may choose a fully virtual setting and have the option to fully enroll in a 100% remote learning environment powered by Microsoft Education. From their home or location, they log into established class times, with their device cameras typically on, and instruction is reimagined in a world of virtual learning. Microsoft 365 tools and Microsoft Teams enable OVSS educators and students create connection amongst each other—to keep up and get ahead. It is an investment that has already paid dividends and has become a model for providing opportunities for equity and 21st century education.

title: Arizona Department of Education boosts backup capability, compliance, and data privacy on a tight budget with Azure BCDR
executive_summary: Working in IT for a government organization can sometimes be more challenging than a private enterprise because of intense budgetary pressures. These IT challenges at the Arizona Department of Education (ADE) fall squarely on the shoulders of Head of Production Services Edward Block and Infrastructure Manager Chris Henry, both of whom are wizards of scrappy, innovative thinking and doing more with less. ADE manages the state’s K-12 public education system, which with more than 1 million students and 51,000 teachers in 2,380 public schools is the fourteenth largest in the United States.

title: Waverton Investment Management boosts business resiliency and sustainability with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Wealth managers at Waverton Investment Management are experts in managing financial assets and investments to generate positive returns for their clients. But to best support clients of every size—from private individuals to large institutions and charities—the award-winning, UK-based company must itself make strategic investments to drive continuous innovation, regulatory compliance, and efficient performance. That’s why Waverton recently turned to Microsoft, choosing to upgrade its digital infrastructure and deploy technology that benefits its advisers, analysts, staff, and ultimately, high net-worth clients.

title: Atrium Underwriters ensures its future data estate with SQL Server 2022
executive_summary: While the financial services industry traditionally takes a conservative approach to new technology, London-based Atrium Underwriters considers it to be a key driver of its current success. “Whether it’s getting data, storing data, or analyzing data, technology helps us balance risk and create a profitable book of business,” explained Emma Walter, IT Delivery Manager at Atrium.

title: Viridor tears down silos and drives improvement with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: “The problems we face are so complex, we cannot afford to work in silos. We need to come together to think and deliver creatively,” states Edita Adamcikova, Head of ESG at Viridor. “We have a very ambitious strategy ‘to build a world where nothing goes to waste’ of which we are very proud. We now have the foundation, supported by technology, to deliver that and to be creative and innovative for the benefit of our company and our communities.”

title: SOLIDEO chooses Azure VMware Solution to meet the challenges of cybersecurity and the need for innovation
executive_summary: The challenges that the SOLIDEO is facing is dual: answering tangible risks that threaten the sustainability of its business and the integrity of its IT assets, while meeting future challenges that may arise. Initiated a year ago, the migration of its existing VMware architecture to the Azure cloud became a necessity to prevent any risk of cybersecurity and service interruptions. Let’s take a closer look at how Alfun, a Devoteam M Cloud team, Microsoft and VMware combined their expertise to provide SOLIDEO with an appropriate and sustainable response to its challenges and ensure that the teams' skills were upgraded.

title: Pension Protection Fund chooses Microsoft Azure to drive efficiency and innovation
executive_summary: “Doing the right thing is very important to the PPF. That’s something we’re very passionate about,” states Simon Liste, Chief Information Technology Officer at the Pension Protection Fund (PPF). “And, I’m very passionate about using technology and digital services for the greater good.”

title: SENCE adopts Azure Cloud and provides efficient service in employment subsidies
executive_summary: SENCE adopted Microsoft Cloud solutions in order to create a tool to meet the subsidy requests of more than three million citizens. Thanks to Azure, they were able to offer a stable and efficient solution.

title: OTELZ has achieved a 40% cost advantage with Microsoft Azure products
executive_summary: Established in 2013, OTELZ has become a notable success story by combining tourism and technology. 41% of OTELZ's customers are foreigners, and the company serves a wide range of customers in numerous languages and currencies. As a result, the technologies used behind the scenes have gained even more importance. By utilizing Microsoft's Azure products, OTELZ has achieved a 40% cost advantage.

title: Virgin Money makes customer service faster and easier with Power Virtual Agents
executive_summary: Virgin Money is a bank in the United Kingdom that seeks to reinvent the role banking plays in peoples’ lives. It prides itself on offering differentiated, digital-first services to customers. Virgin Money sought to improve the support options for customers by reducing the need to call in to the service line. Building on the strategic partnership between Virgin Money and Microsoft, the company used Power Virtual Agents to construct a chatbot that could easily handle common problems, resulting in many queries to the chatbot being resolved without the need for a live agent and over 195,000 interactions through the chatbot each month. Future improvements include AI implementations which will make the company’s chatbot more responsive and useful for customers.

title: CooperSurgical accelerates sales productivity during rapid global growth with unified CRM on Dynamics 365
executive_summary: CooperSurgical, a leading fertility company, adopted Microsoft Dynamics 365 as a unified CRM solution to deliver transparency during a time of rapid global growth. The company nearly doubled in size in two years, making it difficult to get an accurate overview of operations and opportunities. Many recent acquisitions were using their own CRM and ERP systems, and knowledge sharing was a time-consuming process. CooperSurgical decided to adopt Microsoft solutions globally to enhance forecasting, relationship management, and productivity. Now, the company is poised to bring healthcare products and services to patients more quickly than ever.

title: Ontario aids marginalized populations with cloud-based collaborative solution on Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: To help communities participating in multi-sectoral risk intervention models better engage with at-risk individuals and reduce reliance on police for a variety of nonviolent incidents, the Ontario Government developed its Risk-driven Tracking Database on Microsoft Dynamics 365. Under agreement with the Ministry of the Solicitor General, governmental and not-for-profit organizations across the province have access, free of charge, to the solution. They use it to help standardize the collection and analysis of de-identified risk-based information at the local and provincial level. The government is reducing reliance on police to address the root causes of diverse societal issues such as homelessness, drug overdose, and violence.

title: ​​City of Brampton enacts first-class security, reduces alert noise by 70 percent with Microsoft Security solutions and Difenda Shield​
executive_summary: The City of Brampton exemplifies how to resist modern-day cyberthreats with a scalable, “do more with less” defense strategy. It rolled out a coordinated set of Microsoft Security solutions, engaging Difenda, a Microsoft Intelligent Security Association member, for managed security services. Difenda deployed and optimized Microsoft Sentinel as the linchpin solution for overall infrastructure visibility, using it in concert with Microsoft Defender for Office 365 and other Defender solutions to provide sustainable security. The City of Brampton enjoys the benefits of data-driven decision-making and a proactive security posture, creating a safer digital environment for citizens while optimizing taxpayer dollars.

title: Modernizing the public sector: EKOME adopts the cloud for effective and secure work with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: From introducing investment incentives to improving media literacy, the National Centre of Audiovisual Media and Communication (EKOME) is a hub of Greece's audiovisual industry. Aspiring to champion the country’s digital transformation strategy, the institution turned to the General Secretariat of Information Systems for Public Administration (GSIS) to adopt Microsoft 365 E3. As a result, it has enabled staff mobility, and saved almost 10 hours weekly on administrative tasks. Its cloud strategy has also placed it in the world’s 10 percent most cyber-secure companies in the sector.

title: Brazilian court TRF1 transforms citizen service with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: With over 17,000 employees, The Federal Regional Court of the 1st Region (TRF1) makes up one of the largest courts in Brazil. Headquartered in Brasília, TRF1 has jurisdiction over the Federal District and 12 other Brazilian states. When the COVID-19 pandemic struck, ensuring Brazilian citizens had access to judicial services amid lockdowns and restrictions became critical. For TRF1, this meant a complete digital transformation and modernization of its internal systems, guaranteeing access, security, and privacy for citizens. In partnership with the Microsoft Brazil Customer Success Team, Studio 365 successfully supported the development and release of the TRF1 Virtual Support Desk, an online service platform for Microsoft Teams that provides safe virtual assistance to citizens. Since its launch in June 2021, the Virtual Support Desk has processed over 1.2 million citizen service requests and has been utilized by more than 3,000 service agents.

title: Azure Virtual Desktop is the last piece of full cloud migration, Future of educational field by “Digitalization of School Affairs”
executive_summary: Located in the eastern part of Ehime Prefecture, Saijo City is surrounded by Ishizuchi Mountains to the south and Seto Inland Sea to the north. While the city is a sightseeing district rich in nature called “City of Waterways”, it has one of the largest areas in Shikoku as an agricultural city/industrial city. Utilizing ICT and promoting the creation of “Smart City Saijo” where everyone can connect and live a safe/secure and prosperous life, the city is actively utilizing ICT especially in the field of education. It has been working on the cloud migration of education/school affairs/learning systems from a very early stage for a local government, adopted Microsoft Azure (hereinafter, “Azure”), and realized an environment with three separated tiers which do not impair convenience. As the next step based on these efforts, Saijo City Board of Education will start migrating the VDI environment operated on premise to the cloud. What was selected under these circumstances was “Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD)”, a virtual desktop service provided on Azure.

title: Energinet keeps the lights on with a digital platform built on Azure
executive_summary: Energinet is a Danish state-owned energy company responsible for managing the country’s energy infrastructure and ensuring a secure and stable supply of electricity and natural gas. As more wind and solar power were added to the grid, the organization wanted to improve operational efficiencies. Central to this optimization is the automation of operational processes through a digital solution. Energinet chose to embark on a digital transformation effort that included moving from its legacy solution and infrastructure, which was limited in capacity and the ability to update, to the digital drift planning (DDP) platform, a new digital operating system based on Microsoft Azure technology. Besides automating market-based balancing to manage supply and demand fluctuations, DDP also supports the utilization of critical infrastructure, further contributing to Denmark’s endeavors in renewable energy and sustainable business practices.

title: Telstra dials in elevated customer service with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, offering a full range of communications services throughout the nation and beyond. The company’s ongoing innovation keeps pace with surging technological progress, making for constantly evolving services and products. Telstra’s frontline staff and customer service agents require a vast technical knowledge base in the face of this increasing complexity. The company saw an opportunity to help them respond to customers more quickly and effectively with the support of generative AI. So it developed two cutting-edge generative AI tools based on Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service. Even early in rollout, the Ask Telstra and One Sentence Summary tools are delivering promising results, with 90 percent of employees using One Sentence Summary reporting time savings and increased effectiveness, resulting in 20 percent less follow-up contact. Eighty-four percent of customer service agents using the Ask Telstra solution agree that it has a positive impact on customer interactions.

title: Staffbase gains client trust, security, scalability with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Staffbase needed a suite of AI services that would provide its clients with highly secure and compliant access to generative AI capabilities without additional apps or subscriptions.

executive_summary: At Disaster Recovery Centers across the country, customers in need of support had to show up in person. In a disaster situation, this protocol created more stress in an already tense time, and didn't scale to meet the increased demand.

executive_summary: Sanoma, a major Finnish media company, wanted to provide more localized weather forecasts on its radio stations but found the cost of separate weather departments too high. executive_summary: TekSynap, a leading IT solutions provider for government and defense, faced rising pressure to manage massive datasets and support its teams’ productivity across mission-critical projects.

title: Mixed grill: Smithfield Foods runs its $15 billion pork business using a hybrid cloud
executive_summary: To trim the fat from its datacenter infrastructure, Smithfield Foods runs its $15 billion business in Microsoft Azure using a hybrid cloud model. With these insights and efficiencies, Smithfield has slashed datacenter costs by 60 percent, reduced new-application delivery from two months to one day, and bolstered network security.

executive_summary: Helping millions of patients benefit from better care? All in a day’s work for worldwide healthcare technology company Siemens Healthineers. Siemens Healthineers is leading the digitalization of healthcare with its Digital Ecosystem, which helps health providers and solution developers bring more value to the delivery of care, ultimately improving the quality of insights derived from healthcare data. Siemens Healthineers uses Microsoft Azure to make solutions more accessible, and it uses Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) and other tools for a fast, efficient, and competitive development pipeline.

executive_summary: Vapiano Restaurant, a global restaurant chain, serves up innovative dining experiences in order to differentiate itself from others in the market. Because it runs its business on the Microsoft Azure platform, Vapiano takes advantage of the inherent agility and extensibility of cloud computing to expand operations and raise the bar for the “fast-casual dining” experience everywhere.

title: Traceability and food safety innovator completes a seamless migration in two hours with Azure Database for PostgreSQL
executive_summary: HarvestMark creates technology solutions that food producers, government agencies, and retailers use to track quality and boost food safety. When its former cloud provider entered the food retail market, HarvestMark had to find an alternative that would eliminate its retail customers’ concerns about any possible conflict of interest. The food traceability pioneer found exactly what it needed with Microsoft Azure and Azure Database for PostgreSQL, and it conducted a seamless migration in a lightning-fast two hours, for a zero-impact transition for its customers. HarvestMark is seeing a 20 percent decrease in cloud hosting service costs.

title: Mining firm uses IoT and data science to cut downtime, reduce costs
executive_summary: Insight collaborated with Microsoft and Newcrest Mining Limited―an international mining company based in Australia―to develop an intelligent Internet of Things (IoT) solution, enabling the company to manage operations with greater insight, efficiency, and precision. By using an Azure IoT solution to collect data and push AI workloads to the edge, Newcrest optimizes operational performance and predictive maintenance—thereby reducing unplanned downtime and delivering quantifiable financial value.

title: Top Ukrainian pharma moves SAP to Azure to boost productivity and save costs
executive_summary: Founded in 1930, Darnitsa is one of Ukraine’s leading manufacturers of medical products with an ambition to expand globally. Committed to disrupting the pharmaceutical sector, the company engaged Microsoft partner Infopulse to design a holistic digital transformation strategy using Microsoft Office 365 as a core platform. Following the successful integration of company-wide collaboration tools, Darnitsa implemented a full-scale migration of SAP to Azure, leading to 60 percent infrastructure costs savings and boosted productivity across the company.

title: See how Microsoft Azure empowered Thomas Concrete Group to drive its industry into the modern era
executive_summary: Construction is big business, and Thomas Concrete Group is an independent, family-owned and forward-looking concrete producer in that industry. The company was established 1955 in Karlstad, Sweden and today operates in the United States, Germany, Poland, Sweden, and Norway. Thomas Concrete Group does not only provide customers with high quality concrete products but also services, that is key in Team Thomas’ position as the Concrete Specialists. These services also need to be available digitally to support customers throughout the different phases of a construction project. To stay competitive, company decided to adopt cloud-driven solutions that had yet to emerge in the more traditional construction industry.

title: Bühler Group enables intelligent manufacturing insights for a safer, greener tomorrow
executive_summary: For over 100 years, Switzerland-based multinational Bühler Group has been manufacturing industrial equipment and technology to automate the production of nutritional products. With market-leading positions in the pasta, chocolate, wheat, maize, rice, and milling segments, billions of people worldwide consume products the quality of which relies on the performance of Bühler solutions. Now, with the help of the Bühler Insights platform and Microsoft Azure Data Explorer, Bühler’s customers are finding new ways to optimize their operations, reducing waste and energy usage, while increasing output.

title: Australian Plant Phenomics Facility aims to solve global food shortages using automated image acquisition and analysis with Zegami on Azure
executive_summary: Research at the Australian Plant Phenomics Facility is leading to the development of new and improved crops, healthier food and more sustainable agricultural practices. To achieve these goals, APPF needed a way to quickly and efficiently analyze large amounts of image data from its experiments. Zegami offered a way to visualize trends in the growth of the plants and efficiently validate its automated image analysis data. Images are processed and transformed using a custom processing engine which runs on Azure Kubernetes Service. Keeping the data together with the processing engine on Azure provides rapid access and fast throughput. Using Zegami has delivered significant cost savings to APPF. With Zegami, a variety of subtle problems can be quickly identified and timely interventions made to correct them.

title: Invitalia streamlines procurement and distribution of vital medical supplies with Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management
executive_summary: Invitalia supervises economic development in Italy, and the government agency took on additional responsibilities during the COVID-19 crisis when the nation’s prime minister asked Invitalia to coordinate the purchase of vital medical equipment on the international market. Using Microsoft Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management, Invitalia easily tracked and managed hundreds of suppliers. It quickly identified suppliers with available personal protective equipment (PPE) and coordinated transportation into the country and then out to the more than 1,000 hospitals that needed PPE.

title: Transport for NSW uses Agile Analytics and Azure to harness the power of data and improve customer services across New South Wales
executive_summary: Transport for NSW is a state government enterprise responsible for delivering safe, integrated, and efficient transport systems to the people of New South Wales, Australia. Its Multi-Modal Performance Reporting Program harnesses the power of data to improve customer services and manage the performance of bus, ferry, light rail, and metro operators. With large volumes of data arriving every day, often in 10-second intervals, Transport needed a way to ingest, store, and analyze it. After extensive evaluation, Transport contacted Agile Analytics to implement its Data Insights offering powered by Microsoft Azure. Now after data is ingested and modeled, Power BI dashboards are created and shared with Transport operators, delivering full transparency into whether performance meets contractual obligations and identifying areas of improvement.

title: Commvault pleases customers by adding a new SaaS version to a strong repertoire with Azure services
executive_summary: Leading data management provider Commvault stays on top of industry trends to ensure that customers have the solution they need for any environment. When the company began architecting the cloud-based software as a service (SaaS) version of its ubiquitous Commvault solution, it naturally turned to Microsoft Azure—the cloud platform it uses for all its own internal systems. With Azure now underlying its new Metallic offering, 40,000 joint Microsoft and Commvault customers can better secure their most precious business asset: mission-critical data, either on-premises or in the cloud.

title: Brookfield sets a new standard for innovation in real estate with WillowTwin and Azure Digital Twins
executive_summary: Dedicated to creating “live, work, and play” ecosystems, Brookfield Properties is one of the world’s largest and most innovative commercial office landlords. Before building its state-of-the-art One Manhattan West (OMW) property, it recognized an opportunity to use a digital twin to lower costs, save energy, and offer differentiated experiences to its tenants. Microsoft and Willow were key partners in the Brookfield digital transformation journey. Together, they built a digital replica of OMW and all the systems within it, unlocking cost savings, energy optimizations, and value-added services today while laying the groundwork for a digital-first future.

title: Blue Yonder combines Exasol with Azure and Power BI to deliver retail analytics on billions of records daily
executive_summary: Blue Yonder modernizes the biggest retail supply chains in the world using the cloud, artificial intelligence, and machine learning. With more than 1 billion sales forecasts generated daily, Blue Yonder chose Exasol as its high-performance analytics database, running on Microsoft Azure, refreshing Microsoft Power BI dashboards every minute. Exasol’s analytics database, using Microsoft Power BI for visualization, enables Blue Yonder to provide predictive forecasting capabilities, resulting in maximum supply chain efficiency. With this combined solution, Blue Yonder’s customers determine the optimal stored quantity of products, ensuring shelves are filled and logistic costs are reduced.

executive_summary: Taylor Wimpey is on a mission to become the UK’s first digital housebuilder.

To avoid their platforms from reaching obsolescence and peaking their capacity limits due to high customer demand, alldata needed to act fast, and so it decided to expand and upgrade its existing infrastructure with secureguard's blazics 3100 hardware, a hyper-convergent solution based on Microsoft Azure Stack HCI.

Originally used primarily as personal fitness trackers, smartwatches are quickly gaining a foothold in the business world by offering crucial insight into employee and process efficiency. Using specialized sensors, antennas, and software, Nivy watches can calculate how long it takes an employee to perform a task, along with the distance they traveled—allowing businesses to make on-the-fly adjustments that streamline workflows. When Nivy Watch’s existing database struggled to keep up with increasing demands, it turned to Microsoft Azure Cosmos DB to gain the speed, scale, and simplicity the 10-person team needed to win customers and drive growth.
products: Azure Cosmos DB, Azure IoT Hub, Azure SQL Database, Power BI

Employees were using Internet Explorer alongside different versions of Chrome, often switching between browsers depending on what they were trying to achieve. The IT Application Delivery Services team decided to consolidate around a single browser solution. With Microsoft Edge, the team recognized the advantage of clearing up the misalignment of multiple browser types and versions, speeding workflows, and of course, improving security. The result: there’s no longer a need for users to jump between multiple browsers to accommodate different sites and apps, and there’s no fear about app-to-browser incompatibilities hindering the user experience.
products: Microsoft Edge

The process of requesting a quote online and progressing to a sale has been eased considerably – both for the customer and for the William Russell team.

executive_summary: HEINEKEN’s flagship product has never been just another beer. Not stopping at perfecting its signature brew, the company’s lofty goal is to become the best-connected brewer. HEINEKEN is meeting the challenge with a shift from fragmented, siloed, and costly operations to seamless digital interaction across the entire value chain. And to protect all of that, it adopted Microsoft Security solutions for the blend of security and agility it needs to keep its premier product on tap around the globe.
products: Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Aditya Birla Group conducted a global event virtually, demonstrating a unique use case for Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Aditya Birla Group is a Fortune 500 organization, with a workforce of over 140,000 employees belonging to 100 nationalities. With over seven decades of responsible business practices, its businesses have grown into global powerhouses in various sectors – metals, pulp and fibre, chemicals, textiles, carbon black, telecom, cement, financial services, fashion retail and renewable energy. The organization’s overseas operations span 36 countries in North and South America, Africa, Asia and Europe.

title: Terragon Group, thanks to Azure cloud, unleashed its full potential and scalability, helping its clients to increase their ROI by 900%.
executive_summary: Terragon Group is an African data and marketing technology firm focused on driving intelligent connections to consumers in Africa. Terragon uses its on-demand marketing cloud platform, attribution software, and deep analytics capability to enable intelligent, targeted omni-channel (SMS, USSD, email, WhatsApp, email, social) engagement between Brands (SMBs and Enterprises) to 350m+ “mobile-first” African consumers. In an on-premises environment, Terragon’s solution could only reach 10-20% of its potential. Using their platform on the Azure cloud unleashed its full potential and scalability, helping their clients to increase their ROI by 900%.

title: Ready for a hybrid future with Microsoft Surface devices
executive_summary: “I’ve had a Surface device for a long time,” says Kieron Nolan, VP of IT and Operations at Future Plc. “It looks like a premium device. It operates like a premium device. It is as robust as a premium device. Yet the cost of the device makes sense from a business point of view. They are really good devices and they look the part.”

title: Forward-thinking energy company embraces Power Platform to increase process efficiency while cutting costs
executive_summary: Equinor is an international energy company with more than 21,000 employees and present in 30 countries worldwide. To optimize existing complex business processes in support of its transition to a broad energy company, it established a Microsoft Power Platform Center for Enablement to nurture greater innovation through low-code development.

title: Piramal Capital & Housing Finance leverages Microsoft solutions to cut turnaround times of loans by 30%
executive_summary: Piramal Capital & Housing Finance Limited (PCHFL), a wholly owned subsidiary of Piramal Enterprises Limited, is a housing finance company engaged in retail and wholesale lending. In retail lending, PCHFL is one of the leading players that addresses the diverse financing needs of the under-served and unserved market in India.

title: AB InBev GCC Uses Azure Synapse Analytics and Power BI for E2E Automation and Increasing Efficiency
executive_summary: While AB InBev’s Command Center team was already using Power BI for all their visualization needs, they were sourcing data from numerous large excel files and the system was unable to handle high volumes of data. Since AB In-Bev was already using Power BI, choosing Azure Synapse to support their data platform made the most sense, as Synapse seamlessly integrates with Power BI and the rest of the Microsoft ecosystem. With an automated back end supported by Azure Synapse and Data visualization supported by Power BI, AB InBev has the powerful, competitive edge that empowers users to focus on decision making and react to the market even quicker.

title: Nordic leader in fire protection gears up for growth with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Firesafe was lacking in digital maturity and therefore also lacking in operational scalability. The first part of the digital transformation would need to include the standardization of processes and data. Recognizing that Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Power Platform are well-suited for an accelerated, agile approach—with the ability to incrementally move processes and teams onto the platform—Firesafe decided to move forward with Dynamics 365. Even though Firesafe has just begun their Dynamics 365 customer engagement journey, efficiency and other customer service benefits were immediately realized.

title: TM International Logistics leverages Azure to streamline business processes and gain real-time insights
executive_summary: Incorporated in 2002, TM International Logistics Limited (TMILL), a subsidiary of Tata Steel Limited, is an international logistics provider formed as a joint venture company of Tata Steel Limited, NYK Holding (Europe) BV, and IQ Martrade. Headquartered in Kolkata, TMILL offers a diverse portfolio of logistics services including railways, supply chain management (SCM), warehousing, port operations, ship agency, freight forwarding, custom house agency, inland logistics and shipping.

title: Aditya Birla Group conducted a global event virtually, demonstrating a unique use case for Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Aditya Birla Group is a Fortune 500 organization, with a workforce of over 140,000 employees belonging to 100 nationalities. With over seven decades of responsible business practices, its businesses have grown into global powerhouses in various sectors – metals, pulp and fibre, chemicals, textiles, carbon black, telecom, cement, financial services, fashion retail and renewable energy. The organization’s overseas operations span 36 countries in North and South America, Africa, Asia and Europe.

title: ABN AMRO: leaping into the future of the FSI sector with the Azure cloud
executive_summary: Dutch bank ABN AMRO is determined to embrace digitalization to improve its operations and provide better services for its customers. To do this, it has embarked on a digital transformation program – called Apollo – which includes adopting new technologies, moving applications to the cloud and embracing a new DevOps working culture. Crucial to achieving this has also been migrating its trading and treasury front-to-back-to-risk platform Murex MX.3 from on-premises to Microsoft Azure. All while shifting from Oracle Exadata to Oracle database on Azure NetApp Files. This is part of a key initiative that’s giving ABN AMRO greater flexibility, scalability and an improved time to market. The migration is helping ABN AMRO provide more stable, securer services – all while driving efficiencies and improving its working culture.

title: Piramal Enterprises drives efficiency and employee engagement with a communication app on Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Piramal Enterprises Limited (PEL) is one of India’s leading diversified companies, with a presence in financial services and pharmaceuticals. It is the flagship company of Piramal Group – an Indian multinational and diversified global business conglomerate. The group has presence across various sectors such as healthcare, life sciences, drug discovery, healthcare information management, financial services and real estate. It operates in more than 30 countries and has a brand presence in over 100 markets.

title: 100-Year-Old Retailer Canadian Tire Modernizes Data Platform with Azure Synapse Analytics and Power BI
executive_summary: Canadian Tire Corporation (CTC) is a group of companies that includes more than 1,700 retail and gasoline outlets across Canada. Its retail business is led by Canadian Tire, which was founded in 1922 and provides Canadians with products for life in Canada across its Living, Playing, Fixing, Automotive and Seasonal & Gardening divisions. With an increased focus on leveraging technology to improve retail experiences and better serve customers, CTC is looking to leverage near-real-time insights and prioritize data-driven decision-making. As a result, the organization decided to shift their data to the cloud. With Azure Synapse Analytics and Power BI, CTC has started to bring near real-time insights across their organization.

title: Husky Technologies’ remote-monitoring solution delivers real-time predictability and reduces operating costs
executive_summary: Since its start in Bolton, Ontario, Canada, in 1953, Husky Technologies™ has pioneered industry-leading injection molding technologies to meet the essential needs of the global consumer goods packaging and medical markets. The expertise and service commitment of Husky employees in more than 40 locations supports customers in more than 140 countries through a global network of manufacturing facilities and technical and monitoring centers. To provide a more proactive approach to customer service, Husky developed Advantage+Elite™, a proactive, predictive, transparent monitoring solution that comes standard on its beverage packaging and medical injection molding systems. Based on Azure IoT, this solution combines a deep historical database of service expertise with real-time data and advanced processing analytics to anticipate, recognize, and resolve potential production issues before they affect productivity or product quality. This approach reduces the need for emergency service calls and shortens their duration. Husky estimates that the solution saves customers an average of USD 4,000 to 6,000 per intervention.
products: .NET, Azure, Azure Data Explorer, Azure IoT Hub, Azure Synapse Analytics

title: Up onto the roof and into the Azure Cloud: Enpal powers the energy transition with photovoltaic systems
executive_summary: Solar panels on every roof in Germany—that’s Enpal’s vision for the future. To make it a reality, the company relies on closely linked processes throughout its business model. That requires a platform capable of covering all these processes—with maximum flexibility, at low cost, and with as little IT effort as possible. Enpal is then free to focus on what really matters: driving the energy transition forward with renewable energy. In doing so, the company uses various Microsoft Azure services.

title: ISV Success program helps Akouo bring to market a simultaneous interpretation solution for Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Founded in 2021 and based in the United Kingdom, Akouo’s solution provides universal and simultaneous multilingual interpretation for meetings directly within Microsoft Teams. Users simply add Akouo to their Teams meeting and participants select their preferred language. By tapping into the resources of the ISV Success program, Akouo has moved from development in October of 2021 to a transaction-ready solution that will soon be published on the commercial marketplace.
products: AppSource, Azure, Microsoft Teams

title: Customer Analytics develops high-performance system for seamless Data Routing and Aggregation (CADRA) from multiple systems using Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Customer Analytics is a software and services company that offers data analytics, business consulting, and software and IT infrastructure services to B2B businesses. It seeks to strike a balance between investments in digital technology and people as it builds robust, data-driven business solutions to empower its customers. For instance, the company uses a synergy of data, analytics, and technology to resolve business problems that often cannot be solved with out-of-the-box applications. Over the last two decades, Customer Analytics has grown from strength to strength, building expertise across domains, with proficiency in data science, analytics, IT services management, and emerging technology platforms. The company has offices in India and the US with a strength of over 500 team members.
products: Azure App Service, Azure Data Factory, Azure Database for MySQL, Azure Database for PostgreSQL, Azure Event Grid, Azure Service Bus, Azure Storage

title: Agilus and Credivera create a people-centric business by employing Microsoft Entra Verified ID
executive_summary: Agilus Work Solutions keeps its edge in the highly competitive recruiting world through its superb support for both clients and job seekers. It knew that the protracted professional credentials verification process was an obstacle to getting people on the job quickly. When Agilus partnered with Credivera to reinvent the process, the two companies turned to Microsoft Entra Verified ID to take the waiting out of a long onboarding process and put control over credentials back in the hands of job seekers. As a bonus, Agilus saves its clients and candidates weeks of delays, and everyone involved enjoys greater transparency.

title: Competitive Capabilities International transforms performance management and empowers collaboration with Teamflect and Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: With worldwide locations and global customers, Competitive Capabilities International (CCI) enables manufacturing and supply chain organizations to implement multi-site operational excellence, world-class practices, and enhanced performance through expert coaches and its digital continuous improvement system. CCI needed to replace an outdated system with a modern performance management solution integrated into Microsoft Teams, their communication and collaboration platform of choice, to further support high-performing teams. With engaging features, outstanding support, and native integration with the Teams ecosystem, Teamflect provided the flexibility, agility, clarity, and high standards that CCI requires. Teamflect enabled CCI to empower employees, make sure people are accountable, and create an amazing employee culture.

title: Building a Pathway to Success: Abraham Lincoln High School's Use of Microsoft Technology in Computer Science Education
executive_summary: Corissa Fontana began her career at Abraham Lincoln High School in Brooklyn, New York, as an English teacher. Nine years later, the school’s principal called her into the office, sat her down, and asked her to become the assistant principal of the math department. The abrupt shift in field wasn’t the challenging part, as Corissa had always been skilled at math. No, the challenge came from the fact that the role required her to spearhead a computer science program, from scratch, with nothing but a few iPad carts and some laptops from 2008, several of which were missing keys. Five years later, Abraham Lincoln High School is now a Microsoft showcase school.

title: Budimex streamlines internal processes and data collection with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: Polish construction group Budimex was struggling to collect data from various work sites across the country. To improve process efficiency and data visibility, Budimex built mobile applications using Power Apps. With a solution for employee task management, workload, and salary calculation, Budimex now takes 15 minutes instead of an hour to prepare monthly reports. Other apps for subcontractor machine workloads further reduced reporting times by more than 85 percent.
products: Microsoft 365, Power Apps

title: Tata Motors’ futuristic digital platform on Microsoft Teams drives performance management and more
executive_summary: Tata Motors Limited is a USD 37 billion organization that offers an extensive range of integrated and smart mobility solutions. The Indian multinational company –headquartered in Mumbai and part of the Tata Group – is a leading automobile manufacturer with a portfolio that includes a wide range of cars, utility vehicles, trucks, buses, and defense vehicles. The company aims to fulfil the aspirations of its customers with safer, smarter and greener mobility solutions.

title: BÜCHI’s customer-centric vision accelerates innovation using Azure Integration Services
executive_summary: For the past 80 years, BÜCHI Labortechnik AG has put quality laboratory technology solutions into the hands of the world's top researchers, scientists, and manufacturers. Always innovating, BÜCHI is changing its business approach from the inside out in a digital transformation that connects customers in new ways, streamlines processes, and drives profits. A new strategy requires new tools, and the company is upgrading and replacing dozens of legacy business systems—a sweeping modernization effort that also means reevaluating hundreds of integration points across global information and communications technology (ICT) platforms.

title: Microsoft Japan explored in “Microsoft Ignite” the possibilities of frontline operations utilizing the transceiver feature of Teams.
executive_summary: Microsoft Teams is widely used among office workers as a tool for web conferencing and chatting. Teams is currently offering a wide variety of features. Moreover, there have been movements in recent years to utilize those features not just for office work but also for frontline operations, such as factories, construction sites, stores, and product deliveries. In this context, the transceiver feature of Teams is drawing the industry's attention. At Microsoft's annual event, "Microsoft Ignite" in Tokyo, a new work style on-site was explored utilizing the transceiver feature of Teams. Here, the person in charge of this event shares how the event was managed behind the scenes.

title: WorkTrips.com reduces business trip bookings to a few clicks with Azure infrastructure
executive_summary: WorkTrips.com is a Polish company offering a modern platform that optimizes costs, automates processes, and provides care during business trips. To handle multiple requests at high speed and to simplify the flow of arranging business travel, it connects various Azure services via Azure Virtual Networking. Users get their trips booked on time, supervisors have less work, and companies benefit from the best offers. WorkTrips.com also benefits from simplified infrastructure maintenance and global data center availability, helping protect user data in sensitive locations.
products: Azure, Azure Application Insights, Azure Marketplace, Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Virtual Network, Dynamics 365, Microsoft Entra ID

title: Competitive Capabilities International transforms performance management and empowers collaboration with Teamflect and Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: With worldwide locations and global customers, Competitive Capabilities International (CCI) enables manufacturing and supply chain organizations to implement multi-site operational excellence, world-class practices, and enhanced performance through expert coaches and its digital continuous improvement system. CCI needed to replace an outdated system with a modern performance management solution integrated into Microsoft Teams, their communication and collaboration platform of choice, to further support high-performing teams. With engaging features, outstanding support, and native integration with the Teams ecosystem, Teamflect provided the flexibility, agility, clarity, and high standards that CCI requires. Teamflect enabled CCI to empower employees, make sure people are accountable, and create an amazing employee culture.

No, the challenge came from the fact that the role required her to spearhead a computer science program, from scratch, with nothing but a few iPad carts and some laptops from 2008, several of which were missing keys. executive_summary: Tata Motors Limited is a USD 37 billion organization that offers an extensive range of integrated and smart mobility solutions. The Indian multinational company –headquartered in Mumbai and part of the Tata Group – is a leading automobile manufacturer with a portfolio that includes a wide range of cars, utility vehicles, trucks, buses, and defense vehicles. The company aims to fulfil the aspirations of its customers with safer, smarter and greener mobility solutions.
