executive_summary: Orbital Witness is a legal tech company that is revolutionising the way property diligence is conducted by real estate professionals.

title: Conduent streamlines transaction processing, avoids hours of downtime with Oracle Database@Azure
executive_summary: IT services provider Conduent aimed to minimize operational complexities and service interruptions in its core Oracle environment. The company’s existing Oracle database solutions in the cloud lacked the scalability needed to support high-visibility clients and mission-critical solutions.

title: Nagase Brothers adopts Azure OpenAI Service for generative AI that could transform practical English learning
executive_summary: Japanese high schools are shifting their approach in English language education from input to output. However, teachers don’t have the time to correct the written work of students. When ChatGPT appeared in 2022, it provided a potential solution, and with the advent of GPT-4 in 2023, it reached a sufficient level of accuracy.

title: Delta Dental of California transforms claims processing with Azure Local, Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
executive_summary: Delta Dental of California needed to move off an aging operating system, shift its critical payor system to a containerized application, and build the foundation for a more efficient business. It wanted to explore the cloud but keep some data on-premises.

title: Vollers’s digital transformation: More efficiency thanks to Dynamics 365 Finance
executive_summary: Vollers operates as a goods logistics service provider in a volatile business environment. An outdated system and manual data management led to inefficiencies and increased operating costs. Thus, short-term, flexible action was virtually impossible.

title: Polish special needs school nurtures every child’s strengths with Office 365 Education tools
executive_summary: To ensure all students are given equal opportunities to succeed, Zespół Szkół Specjalnych (ZSS), a special needs school complex in Kowanówko, Poland, crafts inclusive, learner-oriented classes. In keeping with its mission, the school aims to enhance each student’s unique strengths, providing them with learning conditions under which they develop the confidence to thrive. To accommodate the different needs of its primary and secondary-level students—who experience varying degrees of emotional, intellectual, and physical disabilities—the school introduced a set of accessibility tools built into Office 365. From digital whiteboards to Stickers add-ons, each tool provides the best learning experience for each student.
products: Microsoft Teams, Whiteboard, OneNote

title: Romanian pneumatics company Bartrom bolsters resilience by moving its ERP system to Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: As a pneumatics and compressed air specialist, Bartrom provides services and mechanical devices to businesses across Romania. After a series of unpredictable power outages would stop its on-premises enterprise resource planning (ERP) system from running for days, the mid-size company decided to move it to the cloud. Looking for an affordable solution with built-in security and a strong backup and recovery plan, it chose to implement SAP Business One on Microsoft Azure. Not only has the solution proven to be highly secure and scalable, it also helped Bartrom cut down its overall costs.
products: .NET, Azure, Azure Backup, SAP on Azure, Exchange Online, Microsoft 365

title: Sri Lanka’s largest listed company harnesses data for simplicity, agility, and resilience
executive_summary: John Keells Holdings (JKH) operates across various sectors, from consumer goods to financial services, information technology to leisure, property development to transportation. The company’s diverse portfolio was unified into a single platform through Microsoft Azure. By consolidating the data from all its business units into one solution, JKH improved its service quality group-wide. The organization gained a deeper and more holistic understanding of its customers across different sectors and business units.

title: College of Southern Nevada masters cybersecurity and the cloud for 47,700 students and staff with Microsoft Azure and Open Systems MDR+
executive_summary: The College of Southern Nevada (CSN) is one of the ten largest community colleges in the United States, with over 45,000 students and nearly 2,700 faculty and staff spread across three campuses and ten learning centers. Needing to expand services and implement security monitoring, Mugunth Vaithylingam, CSN Chief Digital Experience Officer, turned to Open Systems, a six-time Microsoft Gold Partner, to guide CSN through a sudden spike in online learning and jump in cybersecurity threats. Open Systems helped CSN through an expansion of its Microsoft 365 licensing, including bundled features such as Azure Sentinel and Azure Active Directory, and deployed Open Systems’ Secure Access Secure Edge (SASE+) managed service and Managed Detection and Response (MDR+) threat containment service. CSN avoided spending hundreds of thousands of dollars of annual spending on building a security operations center, instead using Open Systems' managed services. CSN also reduced data center costs by migrating systems to Microsoft Azure.
products: Azure, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Microsoft Investigator Fellow Dr. Guillermo Sapiro at Duke University uses Azure for big data management
executive_summary: Dr. Guillermo Sapiro and his team at Duke University are putting the cloud computing technology of Microsoft Azure into action to democratize access to large amounts of private healthcare data, and to keep confidential information secure while it is being transferred, stored, and analyzed. Dr. Sapiro, James B. Duke Distinguished Professor of Electrical and Computer Engineering, is using Azure to support his innovative research related to computer vision and medical imaging. Azure has facilitated the ability of medical researchers to work with the massive amounts of patient data generated by Duke Health’s hospitals and affiliated physicians in Durham, North Carolina.

title: Microsoft Investigator Fellow Dr. Casey Frankenberger at Rush University uses the Azure cloud to deliver better healthcare outcomes
executive_summary: Researchers at Rush University Medical Center in Chicago are using the power of artificial intelligence and Microsoft Azure to facilitate the integration of genomic sequencing data into the electronic medical records of cancer patients, and to manage massive amounts of clinical data related to COVID-19. Dr. Casey Frankenberger, Chief Research Informatics Officer at Rush, relies on the flexible and feature-rich Azure platform for his research. Azure provides Dr. Frankenberger and his team with the level of scalability and data management they need to find new ways to improve patient treatment protocols and outcomes.

title: Gibson Brands streamlines its business and creates an immersive customer experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Gibson Brands, the world’s most iconic guitar brand, was already focused on growing its online presence when COVID-19 necessitated a shift in sales strategy. With the goals of simplifying internal processes and providing a more immersive experience for its customers, Gibson transitioned to the Microsoft Dynamics 365 platform. The decision to transform retail sales was motivated by a desire to meet its customers everywhere they are—whether through retail, direct sales, or a dealer network. Using Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Teams has led to a significant improvement in communications and cross-functional collaboration within the company. Gibson Brands has not only survived but thrived.

title: Providence creates chatbot to improve COVID-19 care and manage hospital resources
executive_summary: Providence, a healthcare system with 51 hospitals and more than 1,085 clinics, is headquartered in Renton, Washington, near the epicenter of the first major US COVID-19 outbreak. Providence used the existing Microsoft Azure Health Bot service and configured it to create an AI-based tool to triage patients and answer their questions specifically about COVID-19 symptoms, freeing providers to attend to the patients who needed it most. The Azure Health Bot with COVID-19 templates that Providence deployed has since been adopted by several thousand healthcare providers, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), NGOs, and international health authorities.
products: Azure, Azure AI Services

title: How Liberty University is fighting COVID-19 using Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: At Liberty University in Lynchburg, Virginia, a mechanical engineering team received a Microsoft AI for Health COVID-19 grant that provided access to Microsoft Azure Cloud, Microsoft High-Performance Computing (HPC) capabilities, and Microsoft AI for Health data science experts. The grant helped them study how a new respiratory therapy device can help COVID-19 patients and their caregivers.
products: Azure, Azure Virtual Machines

title: Powering vital research at the University of Leeds
executive_summary: University of Leeds is one of the prestigious Russell Group of universities and a leading UK research university. In 2014, it established the Leeds Institute for Data Analytics (LIDA) to facilitate multi-disciplinary research collaboration both across the university and with external research and commercial partners.

title: Nokia améliore son niveau de sécurité en gérant rigoureusement les données sensibles dans un service IA avec Azure Arc
executive_summary: Based in Finland, Nokia is a leading telecommunications company with operations around the world. One of the many valuable services it offers is a telco AI ecosystem called AI & Analytics, Virtualization, Automation (AVA) for its carriers to help optimize their networks and service delivery. Nokia created a successful proof of concept (POC) to validate an updated architecture using Microsoft Azure Arc. Now, Nokia is able to deploy, operate, and monitor the AVA applications running in the customer’s preferred cloud, while meeting the data regulatory needs for different countries.

title: Sensyne Health aids National Health Service in the COVID-19 struggle with Microsoft HPC and AI technologies
executive_summary: When the United Kingdom’s National Health Service envisioned an app that could read COVID-19 tests at scale with an accuracy and speed not possible by human readers, Sensyne Health answered the call. The app connects users to a web service that uses AI to deliver an Azure high-performance computing (HPC) solution that’s adeptly orchestrated with NVIDIA Triton Inference Server on graphics processing units. The result: the incredibly fast and accurate MagnifEye solution.

title: Amnis: Giving SMEs the financial tools to compete with Europe’s largest companies
executive_summary: For large businesses, traditional banks offer a range of competitive international payment and currency exchange options. But in 2015, Swiss payment service provider, Amnis, decided to give SMEs the same advantages – by creating a cloud-based WebApp that gave SME finance managers access to simple, low-fee monetary transfer tools. Six years later, Amnis is a big hit with SMEs in Switzerland, prompting the startup to set its eyes on expanding into Europe and beyond. An ambitious target that required a complete restructuring of Amnis’s IT infrastructure to meet its growing business demands.
products: Azure

title: Cdiscount launches a 360-degree marketplace solution based on Azure API Management
executive_summary: With its marketplace expertise and catalog of more than 13,000 international sellers, Cdiscount decided to offer its services to physical distributors, e-merchants, and sellers to enable them to grow their online business through a marketplace. To do this, Cdiscount identified the need to enhance its API platform in order to facilitate the onboarding of these new customers. So, Cdiscount selected Microsoft to support its API management and thus accelerate the company's transition into a new direction, helping it to become a marketplace solution provider through its new dedicated entity, Octopia.

title: The City of Zagreb facilitates kindergarten enrollment and management with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Home to more than one million people, the City of Zagreb prides itself on being one of Croatia’s most forward-thinking, socially responsible cities. As part of its commitment to a sustainable, inclusive future, the city recently embarked on a number of digitalization projects. Among them, reimagining the decentralized, on-premises infrastructure behind the city’s kindergartens. Thanks to its new Microsoft Azure-based system, enrolling children in kindergartens around the city is easier than ever, while budgeting and reporting are faster, simpler and more transparent.

title: Generating insights on 1 billion shoppers globally using dunnhumby Customer Data Science
executive_summary: Processing more than 18 billion retail data records every week from 1 billion shoppers globally, dunnhumby embarked on a journey to modernise their operational infrastructure migrating their customer insights and data products to Microsoft Azure, to deliver reliable, secure, fast, efficient, and joined up technology. Azure offered the security and efficiency needed to give dunnhumby colleagues the freedom and time to focus on what’s really important – customer data insights.

title: Technology drives BWT Alpine F1® Team beyond the track
executive_summary: Every time BWT Alpine F1 Team drivers Fernando Alonso and Esteban Ocon get behind the wheel, more than 200 sensors collect over 50 billion data points that help the technical staff improve aerodynamics, performance, and handling.
products: Azure

title: Best-Hall charts efficiency via quick implementation of a modern analytics solution with Islet’s Data Platform Kickstart and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Based in Finland, Best-Hall Oy specializes in designing and constructing hall buildings for logistics, warehousing, production-related industries, sporting activities, and other uses. Struggling with manual processes built on disconnected Microsoft Excel spreadsheets, Best-Hall needed to develop a modern solution for data utilization and take information management to a level that served the growing organization and its customers. Best-Hall engaged a data platform kickstart consultation with Islet Group Oy, which is an expert in combining organizations, technology, and people into successful analytics, and realized Islet was the right partner for the project. In six weeks, Islet implemented a technical solution including extensive visualization packages that met Best-Hall’s future needs and generated immediate business benefits for communication and customer responsiveness.
products: Azure, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

title: Solar panel manufacturer REC Group builds a solid foundation for future growth on Azure
executive_summary: REC Group offers high-efficient solar panels with a reliable long-term performance to provide people with clean and affordable solar power. To support its future growth and tremendous expansion plans, REC wanted to upgrade from SAP ERP Central Component (ECC) to S/4HANA and run it in Microsoft Azure with a solid Security and Disaster Recovery (DR) strategy. The company now generates reports and performs analytics much faster, leading to higher efficiency while minimizing operating costs. As ‘Solar’s Most Trusted’, it is now better equipped to make more informed business decisions and accelerate its customer centric service.
products: Azure

title: VECOZO adopts and implements the highly secure Azure platform for accelerated development
executive_summary: VECOZO was looking for a way to transition not only away from its traditional datacenters, but to a more holistic IT landscape. That was when conversations about moving full scale into Microsoft Azure began. New Azure services are released regularly, and existing Azure services are expanded with security features that contribute to safer and better services for organizations like VECOZO. This inherent dynamism adds to the security of the Azure platform as security services routinely change and their configurations are regularly updated.
products: Azure, Azure API Management, Azure DDoS Protection, Azure Firewall, Azure Web Application Firewall, Microsoft Entra ID

title: Standardizing MSC’s IT infrastructure in the cloud with Azure Disk Storage
executive_summary: To reduce management complexity and increase agility, MSC began migrating its on-premises infrastructure from a storage area network to the cloud in 2017. In 2019, the company began updating to SQL Server 2019 and the SQL Server Always On high availability and disaster recovery solution. By July 2020, MSC started beta testing Azure Disk Storage. With shared disks in Azure, MSC can avoid a large overhaul of its current code and architecture.

title: Unit4 reduces go to market by 50 percent and future-proofs business by transitioning to Azure
executive_summary: Unit4 provides user-friendly enterprise resource planning (ERP), human capital management (HCM), and financial planning and analysis (FP&A) systems for service organizations such as higher education institutions, nonprofits, and public service entities. Customers use Unit4 solutions to help their finance, HR, projects, procurement, and FP&A teams transform the way they work.
products: Azure, Azure App Service, Azure Disk Storage, Azure Migrate, Azure SQL Database, Azure Virtual Machines

title: Arxus ensures that Resengo's reservation system is permanently available
executive_summary: Resengo is a Belgian digital company that develops online reservation systems. Primary target groups are restaurants, saunas & wellness centers, and sports & recreation facilities. In recent years, Resengo has experienced significant growth. The company now has over three thousand customers and records 1.3 million online restaurant reservations each month. Across all sectors, this amounts to nearly 3 million reservations every month. Behind the scenes, Resengo often needs to move quickly. This has proven to be a problem in the past. Resengo's ambition is to eventually switch entirely to Microsoft Azure. Arxus has taken responsibility for the entire infrastructure component. This ensures that Resengo does not need to invest in machines or in infrastructure knowledge. At the same time, Arxus offers guarantees of availability, performance, and security that would not be immediately feasible for Resengo under its own management. It works much better and more efficiently for Resengo to fill the need for scalability via Arxus.
products: Azure

title: Microsoft Azure is the perfect fit for new HPC requirements at the University of Nottingham
executive_summary: Microsoft’s Azure Fast Track team have been fantastic. We were connected with specialist engineers who had expert knowledge, so we got answers very quickly on anything we needed to know,” says Adam Cox, IT Operations Engineer at the University of Nottingham. “I’d recommend any institution with a high-performance computing requirement speak with Microsoft’s Global Black Belts in HPC.

title: Global leader in kiwifruit marketing Zespri cultivates business transformation with RISE with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: David Scullin doesn’t like kiwifruit. He loves it. In fact, as Chief Digital Officer at Zespri, the world’s largest marketer of kiwifruit, he’s always ready to evangelize his favorite food. “Try the SunGold,” he says. “Very sweet. I eat two a day. They’re full of vitamin C and very good for you.”
products: Azure, SAP on Azure

title: A code for all occasions: Automotive supplier Plock runs quality assurance for microparts measuring just two by two millimeters based on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Automakers aren’t the only ones under considerable pressure to innovate. Companies all along the supply chain must also continuously optimize their processes and products if they want to remain competitive. Quality assurance can often present a challenge, especially when it comes to microparts produced by Tier 2 suppliers. When batch sizes stretch into the millions, generally only spot checks are made. This is why Plock, an SME that supplies the automotive industry, introduced a solution that allows each individual part to be digitally traced by attaching a miniature code that contains all the key quality information. This information is stored in Azure and can be called up and analyzed as needed.
products: Azure, Power BI

title: Ferring Pharmaceuticals analyzes data using Microsoft Azure services to unify its global CRM strategy
executive_summary: Ferring Pharmaceuticals connects subsidiaries in 65 countries to help people worldwide build families and improve their lives. Its stakeholders sought to transform customer-related processes and align strategic key performance indicators (KPIs) by pursuing digitization. To achieve this, the pharma company unified storage standards across all divisions and moved the customer relationship management (CRM) data to the Azure cloud. Now, Azure Synapse Analytics empowers teams across the global organization with efficient business workflows and instant data insights available via Power BI.
products: Azure, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

title: GWC changes the game by migrating to RISE with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: GWC is a powerhouse name in Qatar, with good reason. The company maintains a sweeping infrastructure that includes more than 3.84 million square meters of logistics infrastructure, nearly 1 million square meters of warehouses and distribution centers, and one of the largest transport fleets in the State of Qatar. Its rapid rise since its 2004 inception to being named one of the 30 most valuable companies in Qatar by Forbes Middle East was fueled by an innovative spirit and the drive to be first and most reliable. So although most people in Qatar know the company by the fresh greens and blues of the GWC logo on its trucks and buildings, GWC knows that the leverage to build a thriving business lies in the resilience and agility of its information technology.
products: Azure, Azure Arc, SAP on Azure, Power BI

title: CodeTwo and Microsoft 365 make a strong brand identity possible for CTOS
executive_summary: Custom Truck One Source (CTOS) started in 1996 with 15 employees as the first single-source provider of specialized truck and heavy equipment. Encouraged by its growth across North America, CTOS felt the need to standardize employees' email signatures and to strengthen brand identity in email correspondence. An internet search led them to Microsoft Partner of the Year CodeTwo and its CodeTwo Email Signatures for Office 365 solution in AppSource. The Azure-based app integrated automatically with CTOS’s Microsoft 365 environment, unifying all signatures in just a few hours and driving significant time and cost savings.

title: Brazilian state embraces explainable AI for a fair and sustainable tax environment
executive_summary: The state of Ceará in Brazil needed to improve the monitoring of tax compliance among its retail vendors to enable an equitable and economically sustainable tax environment. This effort required the collection and analysis of millions of digital sales receipts each day to uncover possible errors and tax avoidance. To address this, the state adopted the HMX Tax Intelligence System (TIS) solution, featuring proprietary use of AI to identify compliance issues and provide detailed explanations for efficient follow-up. TIS has generated a 7 percent annual increase in tax revenues over the past three years, compared with 1 percent growth where it has not been implemented.

title: bp advances net zero goals with the help of the Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform
executive_summary: Data is integral to bp’s purpose of reimagining energy for people and the planet, including the ability to access and share data across the company in a more safe, secure, and reliable way. Microsoft’s Intelligent Data Platform brings together data from multiple cloud and on-premises sources, with Azure Synapse, advanced analytics, and IoT services to accelerate production of data products and train AI and machine learning models at scale. These capabilities also help bp track and manage carbon emissions and support its ambition to become a net zero company by 2050 or sooner and help the world achieve a net zero status.
products: Azure, Azure Digital Twins, Intelligent Data Platform

title: Woolworths completes large-scale SAP cloud transformation, improving efficiency, flexibility, and speed to market
executive_summary: When major Australian retailer Woolworths Group migrated its business-critical SAP system to Microsoft Azure, the company knew it would be a big job—in fact, it would turn out to be one of the largest SAP cloud migrations undertaken in the Asia Pacific and Japan region.

title: FSA helps keep UK food supply safe with Microsoft Purview Records Management
executive_summary: The Food Standards Agency (FSA) fulfills the vital role of overseeing food safety in England, Northern Ireland, and Wales. Its onsite inspections and scientific tools needed backup—excellent records management to boost collaboration and security. Food safety is a timeless need, but the records management system used by the FSA was showing its age. The agency desired a more future-proof alternative to boost collaboration, productivity, and security. It found the solution it needed with Microsoft Purview Records Management.

title: Elastic provides enhanced security with Azure Private Link
executive_summary: As a leading platform for data analytics solutions, Elastic powers the search box for some of the largest brands in the world, provides observability across multiple services, and helps secure tens of thousands of devices. Customers ranging from startups to Fortune 500 companies are using Elastic’s Enterprise Search, Observability, and Security solutions. Elastic Cloud, its hosted and managed offering available via Microsoft Azure Marketplace, allows customers to securely search, analyze, and visualize their data, to keep mission-critical applications running smoothly, and to protect against cyber threats.

title: From tools supplier to digital service provider with Microsoft Azure: The Hoffmann Group is fine-tuning the future of the machining industry
executive_summary: Whenever anyone in the metalworking industry is drilling, milling, or cutting, they’re sure to be using a Hoffmann tool. Europe’s leading provider of machining, clamping, grinding, cutting, and measurement technology as well as hand tools has set its sights on one more goal for the future: becoming a partner for the digital transformation of small and medium-sized manufacturing companies. With this in mind, the Hoffmann Group has created a digital business model that relies on the infrastructure provided by Microsoft Azure. At the front end is the company’s Go Digital Store, where customers can access the digital solutions.
products: Azure, Azure IoT Edge, Azure IoT Hub, Azure Logic Apps

title: Engineering and professional services firm simplifies document tagging and discovery with Microsoft Syntex
executive_summary: Aurecon places high value on information—so much so that it implemented the Aurecon Project Information Management Standard (APIMS), which provides the framework for establishing a consistent information base across its organization. To maximize the efficiencies in APIMS, the Aurecon team sought an automated solution for assigning metadata, leading team members at the firm to Microsoft Syntex. With Microsoft Syntex, Aurecon is now able to more easily meet governance and compliance requirements. Instead of being a daunting, time-consuming task, it’s as straightforward as uploading a file to the firm’s SharePoint library and having the system add the relevant tags.

title: Singapore’s national healthtech agency, IHiS, empowers patients to take ownership of their health with Health Discovery+ on Azure
executive_summary: National healthtech agency Integrated Health Information Systems (IHiS) faced challenges during the COVID-19 pandemic, driving them to accelerate its information technology (IT) initiatives to address Singaporeans’ growing needs. As a step to future-proof public health care, it developed and deployed its in-house system known as Health Discovery Plus (HD+), which runs on the Microsoft Azure platform. With the implementation, IHiS empowered more patients to take ownership of their health using HD+, which supports different vital signs monitoring programs across various settings such as polyclinics, hospitals, and senior activity centres.

title: Metzum: helping big energy companies improve efficiency with data in Azure
executive_summary: Metzum is a technology company based in Bergen, Norway. A start-up of only 37 employees, the company provides large energy companies across Norway and Scandinavia with solutions for billing and ratings – something vital in the face of ever-changing regulations. Through its flagship product ‘Moment’, Metzum has ambitious plans to provide the most efficient service possible to its global customers. As part of this mission, the company recently underwent a mammoth digitalization project centered around switching customers to a cloud-native application from their legacy on-prem system by leveraging Azure SQL Database. The goal of the initiative has been to modernize its data estate and use Azure Kubernetes Service for application modernization. The business is already reaping the benefits as it now looks to expand its operations beyond the Nordics.

title: Isabel Group automates operations, takes efficiency to the next level with Azure data platform
executive_summary: Through a variety of multi-banking services, Belgium-based Isabel Group has provided a reliable link between the business world, fiduciaries, banks, software providers, and consumers since 1995. The organization’s original on-premises data platform lacked flexibility and was used only for BI purposes. Some tasks required manual operation and both employees and customers were limited in what they could accomplish. With a need to do more with its data, automate manual processes and add more complex ones, and also scale to accommodate growth and critical unstructured data, the company decided to reinvent its platform using Microsoft Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Databricks, and Power BI Premium. The expanded platform offers greater flexibility, supports unstructured data, and includes machine learning use cases, giving Isabel Group employees and customers the ability to do more with greater autonomy.
products: Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Databricks, Power BI, SQL Server

title: Extracting value from siloed healthcare data using federated learning with Azure Machine Learning
executive_summary: Sensitive information such as healthcare data is often siloed within health organization boundaries. This has posed a challenge to machine learning models used by the health and life sciences industry that require data for training purposes. To improve patient care and accelerate health industry progression, the Microsoft Health & Life Sciences AI group used a federated learning setup to train their biomedical natural language processing service, Text Analytics for Health, while preserving the trust boundaries of siloed data. The federated learning framework was built using Microsoft Azure Machine Learning and open-source technologies to help organizations analyze siloed data and build new applications without compromising data privacy.
products: Azure AI Services, Azure Machine Learning

title: Taoyuan Builds Smart City with Microsoft Hybrid Cloud
executive_summary: Taoyuan city is known as the gateway of Taiwan, connecting the country to the rest of world through Taoyuan International Airport. Located in northern Taiwan, it is also the center of country’s economy. As part of their multi-year Smart City initiative, Taoyuan City partnered with Microsoft to power Taiwan's first government hybrid cloud platform. With Azure Arc-enabled SQL Managed Instance and together with Synapse and Power BI, the city was able to deliver improved city services to their citizens and unlock the power of data.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Teams Rooms, Whiteboard, Power Apps, Microsoft Viva Connections, OneNote

title: Westpac embraces and encourages a culture of innovation with Power Platform
executive_summary: Westpac, Australia’s first bank and one of the largest banks in New Zealand, has a long history of innovating with technology to provide great customer service. Continuing in this tradition, Westpac was seeking an adaptable low-code platform that could support a broad range of user needs that was simple to configure. Since 2019, Westpac has been using Microsoft Power Platform to help streamline business operations, solve IT issues, and formally support its “citizen developers”—employees who build their own solutions to simplify processes. In under two years, citizen developers have built about 1,000 apps, which are used by 15,000 people, and IT is building in-house solutions faster with low-code tools than with traditional software development.

title: Hawaiʻi DOT improves meeting collaboration with Microsoft Teams and Surface Hub 2S
executive_summary: Hawaiʻi’s Department of Transportation (DOT) has adopted innovative technology to keep citizens safe during emergencies and to conduct efficient internal meetings. With more staff working remotely, the department found that managing communication was a significant challenge. The Hawaiʻi DOT chose Microsoft Surface Hub 2S to improve security and provide a meeting solution that is easier for everyone to use. Now, the department conducts fewer, more efficient meetings, maintains seamless communication with staff and managers, and is eyeing opportunities for further improvement.

title: Reflecting on emotions and their impact on engaged learning: Lessons from The Stour Academy Trust
executive_summary: The Stour Academy Trust is a multi-academy trust at the forefront of providing a 21st century education for children, which services the county of Kent in Southeast England. Stour Academy educators look toward Kent’s future vis-à-vis their students. The staff and faculty in charge work diligently to create a new pedagogical model that focuses on student voice, choice, and collaboration. To help bring this vision to life Stour Academy has embraced Microsoft 365 A5, Microsoft Teams, and Microsoft Reflect, a check-in app to enhance social emotional learning and facilitate education for students across a variety of backgrounds.
products: Microsoft 365 A5, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Reflect, Windows 11

title: Năvodari Town Hall builds on the power of Microsoft Azure to bring citizens together
executive_summary: Transparency, accessibility, responsiveness to citizen needs—these are the pillars of an open government. Năvodari’s Town Hall in Romania delivers them using the power of Regista, a Microsoft Azure-based cloud platform providing document management, registration services, tax payments, and management of public requests. As a result, Navodari’s citizens can seamlessly submit requests, track cases, and review regulations from their phone or computer. While they save hours on town hall visits, civil servants keep a close check on over 200,000 documents and work more efficiently.
products: Azure

title: Austrade improves CRM, supports Australian economic strategies with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The Australian Trade and Investment Commission (Austrade) promotes economic prosperity by connecting Australian businesses to the world. Its previous CRM (customer relationship management) system was outdated and slow, leading the company to search for a solution that could manage new business processes, more effectively unify data, and provide more accurate and complete views of customers. Austrade was impressed by the capabilities of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales as a CRM tool, as well as with its connectivity to Dynamics 365 Customer Insights and Marketing. This, along with price, speed, and interoperability with the Microsoft stack and Azure, made Dynamics 365 Sales the clear choice for Austrade.

title: Government of Albania recovers from cyberattack in three days, builds resilience with Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: When the Government of Albania faced a sophisticated nation-state attack, the Albanian National Agency for Information Society (AKSHI) responded quickly and decisively. In the face of a double-pronged assault - a decoy ransomware attack coupled with a "wiper" attack designed to destroy systems and data - AKSHI took swift action by isolating its infrastructure and shutting down critical systems to prevent damage.
products: Microsoft Sentinel

title: ICRON delivers up to 30% reduction in procurement costs, and you can take advantage of ICRON solutions on Microsoft Azure, today.
executive_summary: ICRON is a leading supply chain planning and optimization solutions company. ICRON enables the beauty and simplicity of optimized decision making to unleash the full potential of enterprises. ICRON’s solutions are successfully in use in FMCG, food and beverages, pharmaceuticals, chemicals, glass, high technology, and aerospace industries around the world.
products: Azure

title: Metso: fostering a culture of online inclusion and diversity using Microsoft Accessibility Tools and Microsoft Unified Support
executive_summary: Finnish manufacturing company Metso puts its people at the heart of all it does. As part of this mission, the company recently launched a series of Unified Support training courses that aim at driving awareness on Microsoft’s Accessibility tools and how they can make the workplace more inclusive – both online and offline.
products: Microsoft Teams, PowerPoint

title: Microsoft Teams: the Principality of Monaco enters a new collaborative dimension that's as secure as it is efficient
executive_summary: Known primarily for its elegance and postcard-perfect scenery, the Principality of Monaco is nonetheless a state in its own right, counting some 39,000 citizens. The Princely Government of Monaco is committed to providing high-performance services and infrastructures, for the benefit of quality of life, education, culture and the economy.

title: Information intelligence company, METIS, helps ships sail safe and smart using predictive AI
executive_summary: The maritime industry faces numerous challenges today, from increased environmental concerns to rising costs. Through an end-to-end assessment of a vessel's past, present, and future performance, METIS Cyberspace Technology helps shipping companies improve safety, minimize the environmental impact, and increase profitability. This is done using AI predictive analytics powered by Microsoft Azure coupled with a virtual support agent in Microsoft Teams.

title: Washington Metro Area Transit Authority’s six-month migration to Microsoft Azure drives culture change and better service
executive_summary: The Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority (WMATA) is the nation’s third-largest transit authority, serving Washington, DC, and adjacent areas of Maryland and Virginia. In mid-2022, it embarked on a transformative journey to modernize its digital infrastructure by migrating to the cloud. Maintaining a network of rail and bus services  with aging IT systems was contributing to high maintenance costs and service disruptions. Within six months, WMATA moved critical infrastructure operations, such as fare collection, to a more secure network on Microsoft Azure with help from Microsoft partner Presidio. WMATA’s digital transformation aims to deliver an excellent transit experience, and its business culture is embracing ongoing innovation.
products: Azure, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure VMware Solution, Power Apps, Power BI

title: Cornwall Council uses Microsoft Dynamics in its contact centre to optimise the citizen experience
executive_summary: Cornwall Council has an ambitious digital strategy that includes creating a single view of the citizen. To achieve this, the council has chosen to build its digital platform for the future using a combination of Microsoft technologies, including Dynamics 365, Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Power Platform. Having used Dynamics 365 Customer Insights to assure the validity of a “golden record”, Cornwall Council has now deployed Dynamics 365 Customer Service in its contact centre to advance both the employee and citizen experience.
products: Azure, Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Customer Insights - Data, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Microsoft Teams, Dataverse, Microsoft Copilot Studio

title: AFM elevates Romania's sustainability with Microsoft Azure-powered solar grant allocation
executive_summary: Romania’s Environment Fund Administration (AFM) is championing initiatives to reduce the nation's carbon footprint and encourage sustainability. One of these initiatives is its annual Green House Solar Panels Program, offering citizens funds to help set up solar panels in their homes. AFM teamed up with Romania’s Rural Investments Financing Agency (AFIR) to build an online platform based on Microsoft Azure, enabling the agency to meet the strong demand and surge of concurrent traffic when funding applications open. By the end of the last submission phase, close to 90,000 beneficiaries were able to successfully apply for a funding of 20,000 RON (4,000 EUR) each.

title: Te Tari Taiwhenua, Department of Internal Affairs, uses Dynamics 365 to simplify access to services for New Zealanders
executive_summary: DIA wanted to solve the problem of fragmented, siloed data to get a single customer view across all products and services, and it needed to address citizens’ expectations for digital services.
products: Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Azure, Power Pages, Power Automate

executive_summary: To meet consumers growing expectations for brands to offer a steady stream of immersive personal experiences, Coca Cola needed its AI-ready platform to support the execution of innovative global campaigns within weeks—not months.

title: CoreLogic completes migration to Power Automate and frees up over 50,000 hours of capacity
executive_summary: As a leading provider of property data and analytics in Australia and New Zealand, CoreLogic was looking for a more efficient Robotic Process Automation (RPA) platform to streamline operations.
products: Microsoft Power Platform, Power Automate

title: The Home Office streamlines and secures communications with Microsoft Teams Phone
executive_summary: The UK Home Office, a critical government department responsible for national security and public safety, aimed to modernise its communication systems and streamline workflows.

executive_summary: Bear Analytics pivoted from a traditional consulting firm for the event industry to a technology-powered company that offers event planners unprecedented insights through data collection and analysis.

executive_summary: To achieve its goal of becoming a home care platform provider, YAMASHITA needed seamless data infrastructure to support data democratization with more DX personnel, real-time market knowledge, and deeper customer insights.

executive_summary: BT Group has initiated pilots of Microsoft 365 Copilot in key business areas to assess how Copilot can support colleagues and boost productivity.

executive_summary: Bridgestone faced multiple challenges: inefficient paper-based systems on the factory floor and frontline workers who were isolated from its digital environment. It needed a secure but easily accessed, productivity-enhancing digital solution.
products: Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Intune, Microsoft 365 F5 Security

title: T-Mobile drives more effective customer conversations with Microsoft Power Apps and Copilot Studio
executive_summary: T-Mobile, one of the largest wireless networks in the United States, wanted a more efficient way to update frontline retail employees about promotional offers and other key sales information.

title: Telefônica Brasil enhances its AI-powered call center assistant with Azure
executive_summary: Telefônica Brasil wanted to adopt generative AI technology to optimize and scale its call centers to provide personalized service to its more than 115 million network users across Brazil.

title: Microsoft Cloud Sourcing Team reduces manual work with automated RFQs in Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The Cloud Sourcing Team faced a slow, inefficient, and manual RFQ process, leading to data integrity issues and an inability to keep up with a 200% yearly increase in volume.
products: Dynamics 365

title: Al-Balagh streamlines operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365, cutting approval times from 4 days to 4 hours
executive_summary: Al-Balagh’s reliance on manual processes and siloed systems created difficulties in budgeting, approvals, and project tracking. Teams faced delays due to time-consuming workflows, impacting decision making and productivity.

title: Shift Technology helps hundreds of insurers fight claims fraud using Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: For insurers, defending against claims fraud and sorting through vast amounts of documentation is costly and complex. Shift Technology wanted to strengthen its AI and machine learning to help insurers make intelligent decisions faster and easier.

title: Toastmasters improves the member experience and enables growth with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Toastmasters International runs a global network of public speaking clubs where members hone their skills and create community. The nonprofit needed a more efficient way to help people join, answer questions, and enable more member self-service.

title: Anthology drives efficiency and growth in educational technology with Dynamics 365 Finance
executive_summary: Anthology, formed from the merger of four leading EdTech companies, faced challenges with disconnected and outdated systems. The company needed to centralize operations and improve data quality to support its growth and acquisitions strategy.

executive_summary: Zurich Insurance Group's commercial insurance teams faced the challenge of switching between applications to update CRM data, risking data staleness.

title: Commerz Real improves investor and employee communications with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Commerz Real AG, the asset manager for Commerzbank Group, manages over 35 billion euros in tangible assets across 19 countries. They use Dynamics 365 to streamline event management and improve communications with investors and employees.

title: Club Med empowers customer experience with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Quickly won over by the potential of generative AI, Club Med launched an exploratory phase in 2023, before bringing its approach to fruition a year later.

title: More time for value creation: Roland Berger relies on AI agents and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Roland Berger develops innovative consulting services for its customers based on knowledge, data, and experience. In the fast-paced world of client work, this knowledge must be immediately available. However, the search for it took a lot of time.

title: Dar facilitates access to critical data via PARA Copilot utilizing Azure AI on PARA OS
executive_summary: Dar’s intelligent building portfolio management solution, PARA OS, is designed to use advanced data analytics to improve operational performance. While powerful, it requires guided onboarding for the less technically inclined or new users.

title: Carle Health boosts patient response to 87% with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Insights
executive_summary: Carle Health wanted to modernize patient engagement, reduce communication delays and improve care access while optimizing system-wide efficiency.

title: Barzel Properties doubles the number of properties managed with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: Barzel Properties' rapid expansion required integrating multiple properties with different CNPJs, as well as automating real estate management to ensure operational efficiency and tax compliance.

title: Paraná Banco enhances customer engagement by 55% with Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
executive_summary: Paraná Banco faced challenges with campaign management and the lack of autonomy on the previous platform, resulting in high operating costs and low efficiency. The institution was looking for a flexible and scalable solution to optimize the customer experience.
