title: Buckinghamshire Council’s use of Copilot to power improvement will inspire local government
executive_summary: N/A

title: Norwegian municipality Stavanger Kommune makes citizen services more efficient with the power of data and OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Stavanger Kommune is Norway’s fourth largest municipality, and consists of around 145,000 inhabitants, served by roughly 11,000 municipality staff. The organization has embraced digital technology, creating a data platform with the help of its partner, Bouvet, and Microsoft. It has also invested in AI and the Internet of Things knowledge and technology acquisition. Stavanger Kommune has used the technology and data to elevate the services it offers residents. Among its innovations is using AI to remove sensitive personal information from data submitted by citizens.

title: Emirates Global Aluminium cuts cost of manufacturing analytics AI by 86 percent with the introduction of Azure Local
executive_summary: Emirates Global Aluminium (EGA) is on a bold trajectory to become a digital lighthouse for the United Arab Emirates and the aluminum industry worldwide. To achieve this, the company is enhancing its world-class metal and mining value chain with a digital value chain centered around data and AI. The company drastically transformed its manufacturing operations by harnessing a triad of innovative Microsoft Azure technologies—Azure Stack HCI, Azure Arc, and Azure Kubernetes Service—as it established a game-changing digital manufacturing platform. The new platform reduces the cost of image and video analytics by 86 percent and decreases AI response times by a factor of 13. The seamless hybrid cloud architecture allows use cases to deploy several times a day to keep up with today’s business agility and helps EGA pursue more demanding use cases with its Industry 4.0 program than ever before.

title: Telefónica España's transformation with Microsoft Azure: Enhancing network performance through big data and AI
executive_summary: Telefónica faced challenges in optimizing network performance and reliability due to the vast amounts of data generated daily by their modern mobile network. Monitoring and analyzing this data posed significant logistical challenges.

title: Lumen unifies data, gains near real-time insights, saves 10,000 hours with Fabric
executive_summary: Lumen’s aging systems created data silos, duplication, and inconsistent metrics. Marketing and sales teams struggled with slow ingestion, manual processes, and limited visibility, hindering their ability to act quickly and make informed decisions.

title: Mews enhances platform security using Microsoft Sentinel and Azure OpenAI for rapid threat response
executive_summary: Mews needed powerful, real-time protection without adding friction to safeguard its global hospitality platform as well as customer and guest data, all while managing risks from its open integration model.

title: EY accelerates secure AI development using Microsoft Purview SDK
executive_summary: EY wanted to help clients adopt GenAI while mitigating data oversharing and loss. That required a way to embed data security, compliance, and governance directly into the custom applications the EY teams were building.
products: Microsoft Purview

title: Capacity pioneers next-gen enterprise search using Phi models from Microsoft
executive_summary: When Capacity sought to enhance its Answer Engine to better retrieve accurate, context-aware, and multilingual answers from organizational knowledge, it knew a shift to a generative AI–native architecture was crucial.

title: Apex Group improves user experience for employees and drives in-year cost savings by adopting Windows 365
executive_summary: Apex Group, a global financial services provider, needed a flexible, low-maintenance and high-performing virtual desktop infrastructure to meet its growth demands and optimize the integration of M&As. With a workforce spanning 112 offices and 50 countries, remote working needs were also crucial.

title: Worten saves 11,000 hours annually with Microsoft Azure OpenAI, revolutionizing information search in stores
executive_summary: Worten, a major consumer electronics retail chain, faced challenges in accessing and managing internal operational documents stored in SharePoint. This hindered quick searches for critical information in stores, leading to inefficiencies in customer service.

title: Syntek Information Systems Drives Development Productivity Innovation with GitHub Enterprise on Azure
executive_summary: Syntek Information Systems has adopted Microsoft GitHub Enterprise to build an AI-driven development environment and enhance developer productivity. In major IT projects such as constructing the D2C platform for Yuhan-Kimberly, the company leveraged GitHub Copilot to reduce code writing and debugging time by approximately 50 to 70%

title: American Cancer Society uses Azure DevOps to connect volunteers and reduce costs, helping save lives from cancer
executive_summary: The American Cancer Society counts on its volunteers, and its volunteers count on American Cancer Society mobile apps. To ease collaboration, accelerate development, organize processes, and reduce high database costs, the society’s IT team decided to adopt Microsoft Azure DevOps. The team drove its DevOps strategy by combining open-source technologies like .NET Core with Azure DevOps Services (previously called Microsoft Visual Studio Team Services), Visual Studio Tools for Xamarin, Azure App Service, and Azure Cosmos DB. In the first year after adopting DevOps, the American Cancer Society increased funds raised by 86 percent and reduced data storage deployment costs by a phenomenal 1,000 percent.

title: Adobe runs its vast open-source application portfolio in Azure
executive_summary: Once again, Adobe leads the way. After transitioning its well-known Creative Suite to a software as a service model (Adobe Creative Cloud), the company introduced Adobe Experience Cloud, a set of marketing, analytics, and advertising tools to help brands deliver amazing customer experiences. Adobe has made Microsoft Azure its preferred cloud platform to ensure that its growing portfolio of cloud offerings—most based on open-source software—runs fast, reliably, and more securely, giving customers an exceptional digital experience.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Storage, Azure Virtual Machines, Power BI

title: Community healthcare provider safeguards key system and cuts costs with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: With hospitals, labs, clinics, and hospices across greater Portland, Oregon, Legacy Health is on a mission to provide comprehensive community healthcare. Achieving this goal requires always-on access to the electronic medical record (EMR), but user error, system malfunction, and a tectonic fault running right through the heart of Portland all posed threats to availability. In response, the healthcare system moved disaster recovery for its EMR system to Microsoft Azure and the EMR system itself to a hybrid live environment—improving reliability and availability, reducing costs by 65 percent, and enhancing patient care.

title: Better forecasting, safer driving with Bosch
executive_summary: By combining road and weather expertise with rich vehicle data, Bosch attained real-time, granular insights by using Azure Data Explorer—improving driving safety, forecast accuracy, and increasing the availability of automated driving functions, in a way that was globally scalable.

title: TIM turns to Microsoft for an improved entertainment experience designed especially for viewers
executive_summary: Telecom Italia (TIM) is an Italian telecommunications company with more than 51,000 employees headquartered in Rome and Milan. To expand entertainment services, TIM uses Microsoft Azure for data analytics to support a deeper understanding of customers’ needs and wants, all while meeting the company’s high standards of security and confidentiality. With new insights in hand, TIM offers customers tailor-made products and services and makes smarter, more insightful business decisions.

title: CadDo and Microsoft products bring transparency to asset management company’s portfolio
executive_summary: A fund and asset management company in the Netherlands with over €50 billion in assets under management wanted absolute transparency across every investment. This meant the company needed to augment financial performance figures with the environmental, social, and governance (ESG) performance for each investment fund, as well as all underlying holdings. The CadDo solution was implemented to deliver this rapidly and effectively, embedding the client’s extensive ESG knowledge, priorities, and preferences into a codified rules-based system. Using an end-to-end Microsoft stack, including Azure, SQL Server 2019, and Power BI, meant everything just connected and data flowed effectively from the client’s raw source data into beautiful end-user reports. The project has been a clear success in terms of its original scope, as the CadDo solution is now a single and verifiable source of truth for ESG data and insights.

title: Brandt finds success using FormsPro mobile forms platform delivered with Microsoft technology
executive_summary: Brandt is a leading mechanical, electrical, and sheet metal specialty contractor with operations and services across Texas. Brandt selected OmniByte Technology’s FormsPro to enhance field operations, address specific use cases, solve workstream challenges in multiple divisions, reduce or avoid technical debt, integrate with business software and other technologies, and facilitate end-user adoption. FormsPro is deployed on-premises, leveraging Brandt’s preferred and easily supported Microsoft technologies, including Internet Information Services (IIS) and SQL Server 2016. Cloud deployments of FormsPro use Microsoft Azure services, including Azure Web Apps, Azure Cognitive Services, Azure App Service, and Azure SQL Database. Brandt now has 600 mobile users and 2,500 web FormsPro users, and since 2019, Brandt has increased revenue by $4.8 million, with a 44 percent increase in extra work authorizations and a 43 percent increase in the number of forms submitted.

title: BMI uses Azure to efficiently manage data at scale when distributing royalties to its affiliates
executive_summary: As a leading rights management organization, Broadcast Music, Inc. (BMI) facilitates licensing agreements on behalf of its affiliated copyright owners and an extensive customer base of music users. BMI’s success is defined by timely and fair royalty payments to its affiliates when their music is played publicly across multiple platforms and marketplaces. As the digital market expanded, BMI needed a scalable way to process growing volumes of data. The company adopted Microsoft Azure Databricks and the Hyperscale service tier of Azure SQL Database to ingest, process, and analyze the data for 1 trillion transactions a year. With improved scalability, reduced database costs, and increased automation, operational and technical teams now invest in other activities that will drive the future of the music business.
products: Azure, Azure AI Search, Azure Databricks, Azure SQL Database

title: Swiss company dacadoo opens digital door to a healthier future and a better world
executive_summary: Since its launch in 2015, the Health Score platform developed by Swiss company dacadoo has helped to transform the global life and health insurance industry. Using AI and machine learning technology, the company’s award-winning Health Score represents an individual’s health with a number between 0 and 1,000, allowing global insurance giants to give clients accurate and meaningful insights into their health and well-being. The success of their Health Score and the development of other digital products has increased the need for dacadoo to scale quickly to accommodate vast numbers of new users. By moving to the Microsoft Azure cloud platform, the company has been able to achieve this vision, while ensuring the security of its clients’ health data.

title: KONE fortifies trust with Microsoft Sentinel's enhanced threat detection
executive_summary: KONE plans to connect its entire global portfolio of elevators and escalators, unlocking benefits such as predictive maintenance, remote operations, and improved customer experience.

title: National Gallery Singapore’s new virtual guide lets visitors engage with art in new ways, powered by Azure OpenAI
executive_summary: National Gallery Singapore holds the largest collection of modern Southeast Asian art, along with a vast archive of rich art historical research. The Gallery wanted to deliver this wealth of information to its public visitors in an accessible, relatable, engaging way, at scale.

title: Avery Weigh-Tronix works with Sikich to expedite data entry and cut payment timelines by 97% with Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
executive_summary: For decades, Avery Weigh-Tronix’s national service team relied on handwritten service tracking and manual data entry into its legacy mainframe. This led to millions of annual keystrokes, frequent errors, and inflated payment timelines.

title: Médecins Sans Frontières UK unlocks insights to save lives with the Microsoft centralized data platform
executive_summary: Médecins Sans Frontières UK (MSF UK) responds to crises and chronic health issues worldwide with life-saving medical care. Yet disjointed, isolated data and time-consuming reporting processes hampered the humanitarian nonprofit's internal operations.

title: Nutanix Cloud Clusters (NC2) on Azure enable cloud-first strategy for Forestry and Land Scotland
executive_summary: When FLS took over management of public lands after the Scottish devolution process, the agency was left with an aging on-premises environment that badly needed modernization.

title: World Vision Germany uses Dynamics 365 to advance fundraising for children
executive_summary: World Vision Germany works to improve the lives of children worldwide. With no internal CRM, the nonprofit relied on vendors to send and track donor communications. They wanted a better and more individualized way to interact with supporters.

title: Voltas takes a digital leap with Microsoft Azure VMWare Solution
executive_summary: Voltas recognized the need for a future-ready technology strategy to achieve its goal of becoming a resilient, agile, and future-ready enterprise. Therefore, Voltas embarked on a cloud transformation journey to modernize its legacy systems.

title: Intertek-PSI lifts and shifts complex IBM Power workloads to Azure using Skytap
executive_summary: Quality and reliability are key to Intertek-PSI’s business ethos. The nationally recognized consulting, engineering, and testing firm found itself in a quandary when its service provider of many years discontinued support for IBM Power Systems because of escalating costs. Intertek-PSI needed to rapidly lift and shift its Power-based ERP and other critical business applications into the cloud with minimal downtime and without impacting users or increasing costs. Applying the same lens of quality and reliability, Intertek-PSI picked Skytap on Microsoft Azure and successfully migrated four logical partitions (LPARs), more than forty x86 virtual machines (VMs) and 29 terabytes of data in just three months. It did all this without impacting users or rewriting applications. The transition has been a success as the new cloud environment offers increased performance, reliability, and disaster recovery capabilities at the same or lower cost.

title: PwC simplifies data retrieval with intelligent bots built on Power Virtual Agents
executive_summary: PwC, a global network of professional services firms, wanted to offer its teams a more convenient way to search for needed content, like strategy presentations and client-related documents, across its repositories. Using Microsoft Power Virtual Agents and Bot Framework Composer, PwC gives even its non-technical team members the ability to easily interact with chatbots that automate the content searching process, improving the speed and accuracy of their results. These impacts will translate to potential benefits for PwC’s clients, as its team members can quickly offer up relevant information to their queries.

title: ChemTreat digitally transforms its manufacturing and service operations with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: ChemTreat, Inc. (ChemTreat) provides water and process treatment services to a wide range of industries. To keep pace with its own growth and increasing technological maturity in the markets it serves, ChemTreat adopted Microsoft Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management and Dynamics 365 Finance, using them to improve its processes, transform its operations, and modernize its supply chain management. With expert implementation support from partner Alithya and the FastTrack for Dynamics 365 team, ChemTreat realized enhanced data visibility and insights, improved inventory, manufacturing, and distribution processes, and now provides better, more intentional, and proactive customer service.

title: A dynamic platform for social housing
executive_summary: Clarion Housing Association is the UK’s largest housing association, serving more than 360,000 residents in more than 125,000 properties across the UK.

title: Walgreens empowers pharmacists with an intelligent prescription data platform on Azure
executive_summary: Walgreens processes hundreds of millions of prescription dispenses a year across nearly 9,000 stores, and each transaction has hundreds of associated data points. Using Microsoft Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, and other Azure resources, the company created an intelligent data platform that can quickly process data from prescription dispenses and create valuable insights within minutes, not only for pharmacists who are serving customers but also for operations and analytics teams across the company. This immediate access to rich transactional data and insights, whether generated 10 seconds ago or 10 years ago, changes the way that pharmacists and other decision makers use data and conduct business.

title: PwC uses Azure Synapse and Power BI to Help Clients Gain Valuable Insights
executive_summary: PwC is one of the world’s largest accounting firms. The company’s network spans 156 countries with over 250,000 employees who deliver Assurance, Advisory, and Tax services. PwC prides itself on their ingenuity and drive to stay on the forefront of technology. Vince Powell, a Partner at PwC, leads technology and analytics for the Deals, Insights, and Analytics team (DIA). The DIA team provides deep Financial, Operational, Forensic and Analytical services to clients across the full lifecycle of a business. The team, based in the UK, is part of a PwC Network of over 3,000 Financial, Forensics, Data and Analytics experts.

title: VuNet Systems leverages Azure to provide observability and AI-driven insights to customers
executive_summary: VuNet Systems (VuNet) has an integrated platform which uniquely combines Big Data, Domain-Centric ML Models and MLOps to accelerate digital transformation at organizations. Its AI-led business observability platform vuSmartMaps™, connects business, operations, and user experience at scale through an intelligent unified view of business journeys for digital enterprises.

title: University of Miami gains flexibility, disaster recovery resiliency with Azure VMware Solution
executive_summary: Founded in 1925 in South Florida, the University of Miami is a private research university with more than 17,000 students. To fortify its disaster recovery strategies, the university’s IT team turned to Microsoft Azure for a cloud-based approach for its key systems. Also faced with a looming hardware renewal for its remaining colocation centers, the school decided to deploy Microsoft Azure VMware Solution. As a result, the university realized six-figure cost savings, averted months of purchase order processing and supply chain delays, and it gained agility during the COVID-19 crisis.

title: Microsoft Surface for hybrid working spurs digital transformation
executive_summary: London Metropolitan University has a rich history with strong educational roots dating back to 1848. The University as we know it today was created in 2002 by the merging of London Guildhall University and the University of North London. Across its two London campuses, London Met delivers high-quality higher education to more than 9,000 students. Like many institutions during the pandemic, it responded quickly to enable business as usual through the early days. However, as it became clear that a ‘new normal’ of hybrid working and teaching was emerging, the university’s IT team sought to take a more strategic and transformational approach.

title: Adobe gets control plus flexibility in its development platform from the Azure Service Operator project
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: Transportation services provider digitizes operations with Power Platform and dramatically cuts costs
executive_summary: MV Transportation, Inc. is the largest privately owned passenger transportation contracting services firm in North America, serving more than 110 million passengers each year across the United States and Canada. With a team of nearly 20,000 transit professionals, MV provides paratransit, fixed-route bus, public and private shuttle, and student transportation for more than 200 customers. MV has been on a quest to transform as many paper-based processes as possible, and Power Platform has been a key driver for multiple digitization projects.

title: Vodafone employees achieve big productivity gains with Power Platform while maintaining high governance standards
executive_summary: Vodafone is a leading telecommunications company in Europe and Africa. As part of its strategy to streamline internal business processes, Vodafone has enabled Power Platform for all its employees and now has more than 1,000 solutions.
products: Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Defender XDR, Microsoft Purview, Microsoft Purview Data Loss Prevention, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Equitable Bank thwarts red team with comprehensive Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: Equitable Bank (EQB) takes its reputation as Canada’s Challenger Bank very seriously. Determined to outstrip its current place as the nation’s eighth-largest bank, the company zealously guards data security but also works hard to preserve the agility it needs to innovate quickly. When a Mandiant Red Team cybersecurity test revealed weaknesses in its security defenses, EQB took action. It replaced two security information and event management solutions with Microsoft Sentinel and deployed Microsoft 365 Defender solutions to cover endpoints, identities, and cloud apps. After experiencing startlingly improved results from its second test a year later, EQB knows it’s on the right track. Its Microsoft deployments—and its innovative spirit—continue.

title: Grupo Bimbo Transforms the Data Analysis of Commercial Areas with Microsoft Solutions
executive_summary: The global baking company adopted Power BI and Azure Synapse Services to drive a digital transformation in data analysis in the commercial area. With the implementation, business processes were improved and automated and the time of operational processes was reduced, as productivity increased significantly.
products: Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure SQL Database, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power Apps, Power BI

title: bp bolsters its threat resilience with Microsoft Defender for Office 365
executive_summary: bp’s ethical phishing program required manual effort. Its third-party solutions were not fully integrated with the company’s security and operations systems, making it challenging to manage attack simulation data efficiently. The energy company partnered with Microsoft to implement attack simulation training in Microsoft Defender for Office 365, using the solution to streamline bp’s ethical phishing capabilities and reduce its testing and reporting. Now, bp can send two automated attack simulations per month to around 75,000 employees, with most of the effort managed by one security engineering specialist.
products: Microsoft Defender XDR

title: Jaguar Land Rover creates better company continuity with Power Platform app-building
executive_summary: Jaguar Land Rover is a UK-based luxury automotive company with 38,000 employees, 600,000 vehicles produced annually, and £22.98 billion in annual revenue. The company has adopted Microsoft Power Platform to transform operations to improve safety, efficiency, and productivity—and to help drive down costs. Leading the way for the company is citizen developer and power user Gareth Crompton, Senior Digital Engineer in Human Resources at Jaguar Land Rover. Crompton has now built more than 160 apps, providing numerous benefits to the company—from managing workspace capacity and contract tracing during a pandemic to streamlining the work-hazard reporting process and more.
products: Microsoft Teams, Outlook, Power Apps, Power Automate, SharePoint

title: Atea drives B2B innovation with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Insights
executive_summary: Atea wanted to provide a level of innovation rarely seen in B2B ecommerce. The top priority has been to transform the digital buying experience from broad-based engagement to fine-tuned communications with the right message and with the right cadence, in order to build loyalty and maximize retention. Atea is now able to bring together data from multiple sources like contacts, accounts, account registration, and orders to create a unified profile of each business user.

title: Social services nonprofit Barnardo’s enhances client support through Microsoft technology
executive_summary: United Kingdom–based nonprofit Barnardo’s connects hundreds of thousands of families and children in need with valuable social services each year. To best make those connections, Barnardo’s must ensure that employees have the technology they need to work efficiently and accurately, and the organization also needs to show potential donors that its work has a concrete impact. By deploying Microsoft Cloud technologies and Microsoft Surface devices, Barnardo’s has helped employees be more effective in the field, and it has gained valuable reporting capabilities that have been essential in securing funding to meet the increased demand for services during COVID-19.

title: Hush Puppies partners with Confiz to Drive Operational Agility with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Hush Puppies-a global footwear brand-has been a market leader in comfort and innovation since 1958. Due to the recent paradigm shift in the retail landscape, Hush Puppies needed an efficient order fulfillment system for its e-commerce platform. To stay ahead of the competition and address the changing buyer preferences, Hush Puppies partnered with Confiz, a tech giant, to deploy D365 Finance and Operations to create an efficient omnichannel fulfillment network alongside financial transparency. Through this implementation, Hush Puppies was able to elevate its customer experience, reduce costs, and boost customer retention.

title: Putting IoT to work for a sustainable future
executive_summary: Priorities for facilities management have evolved, with increasing focus on environmental sustainability, energy efficiency, and occupant well-being. To meet sustainability demands and cost pressures, building operations need to be smarter, more energy efficient, carbon negative, and water positive. A way to achieve these goals is to use IoT-powered building management solutions. Such solutions provide perceptive insight into the health of buildings and their assets by collecting and analyzing captured sensor data and giving owners and operators visibility and control of their building systems. Two companies that strive to bring about sustainability through Microsoft Azure services and IoT technology are ICONICS and Microsoft.
products: Azure, Azure Internet of Things

title: Equitable Bank thwarts red team with comprehensive Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: Equitable Bank (EQB) takes its reputation as Canada’s Challenger Bank very seriously. Determined to outstrip its current place as the nation’s eighth-largest bank, the company zealously guards data security but also works hard to preserve the agility it needs to innovate quickly. When a Mandiant Red Team cybersecurity test revealed weaknesses in its security defenses, EQB took action. It replaced two security information and event management solutions with Microsoft Sentinel and deployed Microsoft 365 Defender solutions to cover endpoints, identities, and cloud apps. After experiencing startlingly improved results from its second test a year later, EQB knows it’s on the right track. Its Microsoft deployments—and its innovative spirit—continue.

title: Grupo Bimbo Transforms the Data Analysis of Commercial Areas with Microsoft Solutions
executive_summary: The global baking company adopted Power BI and Azure Synapse Services to drive a digital transformation in data analysis in the commercial area. With the implementation, business processes were improved and automated and the time of operational processes was reduced, as productivity increased significantly.

title: KUKA manages its robot fleets in real time with a software platform based on Azure IoT
executive_summary: Industrial robots work quickly, precisely, and almost around the clock in many fields, not just the automotive industry or electronics manufacturing. For their robot systems, automation specialist KUKA and its subsidiary Device Insight have developed the iiQoT software platform based on Microsoft Azure IoT. The platform provides important condition data in real time and enables remote monitoring of entire robot fleets. This allows efficient control of facility management, including fault monitoring and maintenance. An internal KUKA lighthouse project in the German city of Augsburg has shown that in one year of production, the platform saved 25 hours of machine downtime and administrative work.
products: Azure, Azure IoT Edge, Azure IoT Hub

title: Sapiens transforms the insurance and financial sectors and cuts time to market in half with Azure
executive_summary: Celebrating 40 years of innovation in the insurance and financial sectors, Sapiens blends its industry expertise with the latest technologies to create digitally driven software solutions for insurers of all sizes. As a world-renowned leader in insurtech, or the use of technology to drive innovation in the insurance industry, Sapiens is used to putting its customers first to help them adapt to evolving markets. Recently, Sapiens sought a solution of its own to refresh its core platform, strengthen its cloud foundation, and deliver services faster and more easily. Sapiens is now expanding and enhancing its business to continue supporting its customers, and it’s migrating to the cloud with Microsoft Azure services, including Azure Arc, Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), and Azure Private Link.

title: ABN AMRO meets customers anywhere for financial advice with Microsoft Teams and Azure Communication Services
executive_summary: When ABN AMRO set out to create one of the best video banking experiences in the industry, the goal was always to put customers first. “We have a strategy to be a personal bank in the digital age,” says Joeri Hartmans, Senior Product Owner of Video Banking and Interactive Voice Response at ABN AMRO. A key part of that vision is making video banking as simple, seamless, and secure as possible. “We want to make sure that customers can have digital advice wherever and whenever they want,” he says.
products: Azure Communication Services, Dynamics 365, Microsoft 365 Enterprise, Microsoft Teams

title: Payette secures and extends on-premises BCDR while preparing for a cost-effective cloud future with Azure
executive_summary: When Payette’s data was breached during a cyberattack, the company modernized by expanding to a hybrid environment with Microsoft Azure, while integrating and updating its use of Rubrik’s capabilities. Payette trusts in Azure and Rubrik to manage a comprehensive set of business continuity and disaster recovery (BCDR) capabilities to back up, protect, restore, and modernize the firm’s business-critical data. The results have been game-changing for Payette, and the firm is now seeking out new ways to increase its Azure footprint to create a flexible future in the cloud for future business innovation.

title: AMD enables exceptional flexibility and performance with high-performing Azure VMs, Azure NetApp Files
executive_summary: Take it from a company at the forefront of the industry—it’s an incredible time to be in the semiconductor business. Every day, engineers at AMD are hard at work inventing and improving the chipsets, data processors, and software applications that help form the computational backbone of a digital information economy measured in trillions of dollars’ worth of goods and systems. The leadership solutions from AMD impact the way people live, learn, and play. This level of customer-focused execution requires high-performance computing capacity for electronic design automation (EDA).
products: Azure, Azure CycleCloud, Azure HPC, Azure NetApp Files, Azure Virtual Machines

title: Investment innovator Vontobel triples compute capacity using elastic Azure high-performance computing
executive_summary: When COVID-19 emerged in early 2020, global financial markets were hit with unprecedented turmoil and disruption. Vontobel, a global investment firm with Swiss roots that specializes in wealth management, active asset management, and investment solutions, felt the effects acutely. Creating and managing some of the company’s most important financial products requires significant technology resources, and the company’s capabilities were put to the test during the turmoil.

title: Dashboard solutions from admins for admins: Dr. Oetker is continuously increasing the security of its IT infrastructure with Azure and Power BI
executive_summary: Keeping virus scanners up to date, updating operating systems to the latest version, encrypting all devices to prevent cyberattacks: to manage these tasks, companies establish extensive IT security and compliance guidelines, which need to be measured in terms of effectiveness and reviewed on a regular basis. For the IT organization at Dr. August Oetker Nahrungsmittel KG, this used to mean manually collecting security status data from multiple systems and spending two weeks sending reminders to update operating systems as well as security solutions and settings. Reducing the time it took to do this called for a comprehensive and integrated overview, plus automatic assignment, reminder, and cleanup processes. Today, it is done using aggregated data sources—local or from the Azure cloud—and central dashboards visualized using Power BI. This gives Dr. Oetker global transparency on the state of its IT landscape in a way that is user-friendly and organized according to target groups. As a result, the company can more easily keep this landscape up to date, thus increasing the security of its infrastructure.
products: Azure, Intelligent Data Platform, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Intune, Excel, Power BI, Windows 11

title: Teradata powers breakthrough innovation with Azure Data Lake and trusted AI and machine learning services
executive_summary: Global cloud analytics and data company Teradata wanted to complement its industry-leading, on-premises analytics platform with new cloud-first and cloud-native deployment options. Teradata VantageCloud and Teradata VantageCloud Lake build on Microsoft Azure compute, storage, and data services to provide customers with a highly performant, scalable, and cost-effective solution that they can run in the cloud, on-premises, or both. Customers get the latest data harmonization and trusted AI and machine learning capabilities scaled to their specific requirements, offering actionable insights and freeing each business to focus on driving more innovation, value, and performance.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory, Azure Disk Storage, Azure Virtual Machine Scale Sets, Azure Virtual Machines

title: Putting IoT to work for a sustainable future
executive_summary: Priorities for facilities management have evolved, with increasing focus on environmental sustainability, energy efficiency, and occupant well-being. To meet sustainability demands and cost pressures, building operations need to be smarter, more energy efficient, carbon negative, and water positive. A way to achieve these goals is to use IoT-powered building management solutions. Such solutions provide perceptive insight into the health of buildings and their assets by collecting and analyzing captured sensor data and giving owners and operators visibility and control of their building systems. Two companies that strive to bring about sustainability through Microsoft Azure services and IoT technology are ICONICS and Microsoft.

title: Sagra Technology offers business solutions at scale with Azure Marketplace
executive_summary: Sagra Technology creates IT solutions to help companies better manage sales, marketing, and analytics. The company wanted to expand access to its products, notably Power Translate, a tool for automatically translating Power BI reports within seconds. After introducing the solution on Azure Marketplace, Sagra Technology enabled companies from more than 50 countries to seamlessly access its solutions with simple procurement, payments and without time-consuming process of agreement signing. Sagra Technology’s customers, such as Westfalia Fruit, a global avocado production leader, can now make data-driven decisions and easily share corporate insights without language barriers.

title: Verofax bridges gap between brands and consumers with Martech tool on Azure
executive_summary: Verofax, a Martech solution company from the United Arab Emirates, specializes in transforming how brands connect and nurture direct engagement with customers with product twinning, create immersive experiences and virtual assets rewards direct-to-consumer. Verofax is built on Azure-powered technology to tag items and direct consumers into immersive digital experiences and offer virtual assets as rewards to boost customer long term value (CLTV). Fortune 500 beverage brands had applied the solution offering to give consumers a chance to win tickets to the FIFA World Cup by scanning the unique QR code on every product and having their purchase verified to access rewards. The frictionless interaction, led to over a million customers acquired, while lowering acquisition costs 20-fold and increasing conversion rates 50-fold vs under the cap or behind the label consumer promotions.

title: Understanding how forces act: Azure IoT helps fischer carry out continuous structural monitoring and thus enhance safety
executive_summary: From scaffold struts and concrete formworks to the jib and boom of a crane, many engineering structures are held together by bolts. Buildings and structures are subject to extreme forces that need to be monitored and documented to ensure that their functionality and load-bearing capacity is maintained. To this end, German start-up Connected Products—which forms part of fischerwerke GmbH & Co. KG—chose to base its Construction Monitoring solution on Azure IoT. Based in Baden-Württemberg, fischerwerke is a family-run SME that specializes in fixing and fastening technologies. The company prides itself on its ingenuity, offering products such as SensorAnchor and SensorDisc that improve the safety and service life of civil engineering structures by making construction monitoring more transparent and facilitating predictive maintenance.
products: Azure, Azure Event Hubs, Azure Internet of Things

title: CBRE strengthens every employees’ engagement and productivity with Microsoft Viva
executive_summary: Wendy Sherwood, Vice President of Corporate Communications at CBRE, has worked with the commercial real-estate services leader for 27 years. “I’ve had a front-row seat to the company’s growth and evolution over those years,” she says. She points to the shift in how CBRE’s global workforce of 115,000 employees stays connected, calling it a transformative change. “We have a mix of office-based, client-based, remote and mobile employees working across different business areas and locations,” says Sherwood. “And now we can reach many more of those employees and ensure they get the information they need from CBRE. It’s one of the most rewarding enhancements I’ve been involved with. Our adoption of Microsoft Viva played a huge part in what we achieved.”

title: Microsoft cloud powers digital transformation at Dabur
executive_summary: Dabur India Limited, with a rich history of 138 years in providing quality products and services, is the most reliable brand in India. It is the world's largest Ayurvedic and Natural Health Care corporation, earning revenue of more than INR 10,800 crore and having a market capitalization of roughly INR 100,000 crore. Dabur is the leading FMCG business in India, with nine distinct power brands that have their own unique identities. Dabur's growth plan is based on four crucial pillars: revamping Ayurveda, creating dominant power brands, expanding into rural areas, and promoting digital transformation.

title: Générale pour l’Enfant leverages Power Apps and new technologies for its business applications
executive_summary: Since 1987, the Générale Pour l’Enfant group’s objective has remained the same: to imagine and design children and toddlers’ clothing that is comfortable, playful, and high-quality. This ambitious approach shared by all employees makes this family-based business a major player in children's fashion through its three flagship brands: Sergent Major, Du Pareil Au Même, and Natalys.

title: Hilti empowers its diverse workforce with Workday for Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Hilti is a world leader in the design and manufacture of cutting-edge technologies, hardware, software, and services for the professional construction industry. With 32,000 employees in more than 120 countries, Hilti serves roughly 280,000 customer contacts each day developing products and solutions that drive productivity, safety, and sustainability in construction. With a diverse workforce spanning office-based, field-based, and operation environments, Hilti needed a solution to provide employees with a more simplified, flexible way to complete key tasks—no matter their location. Through the successful adoption of Workday for Microsoft Teams, employees can now quickly and easily request time off, share feedback, and check in and out without ever having to leave Teams. Not only does this save employees time, increase engagement, and improve productivity, but it also enables them to focus on their purpose of making construction better while delivering a better customer experience.

title: Swiss Re accelerates Java app modernization using Azure Spring Apps
executive_summary: For more than 150 years, Swiss Re, one of the world’s largest reinsurers, has used data to make the world more resilient. These days, the company uses Microsoft Azure to power a digital transformation that includes the modernization of business-critical financial systems. To speed up deployments and take advantage of the Azure ecosystem, developers traded their existing solutions for Azure platform as a service (PaaS).

By moving its orchestration and operation of remote condition monitoring applications to Microsoft Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) Edge Essentials, ABB has a single end-to-end Kubernetes solution that helps unify edge and cloud assets to streamline application development and simplify deployment and management. As a result, ABB only needs to create one version of applications that can run on Windows, Linux, and in the cloud. This significantly reduces development and deployment time and frees resources to create even more effective AI-driven data analysis solutions from all the rich data collected from large manufacturing operations. Reduced administration requirements also allow ABB to handle a rapidly expanding edge ecosystem with a shrinking number of available workers.
