executive_summary: "We aim to reduce food waste while also increasing sales." This seemingly contradictory goal was pursued through a demonstration experiment conducted in Oita and Fukuoka prefectures, focusing on reducing food waste through data collaboration across the supply chain.
products: Azure OpenAI Service, Azure Databases, Azure, Azure AI and Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, Azure Blob Storage

title: Victorinox – Transforming IT security with the Microsoft 365 E5 suite
executive_summary: Using tools from different vendors made IT security at Victorinox unnecessarily complex and expensive. The company needed a consolidated, forward-looking solution.
products: Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft 365 E3, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Defender, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Sentinel, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Microsoft Defender XDR, Microsoft 365 Copilot

title: National Zakat Foundation reaches Muslims in need 80% faster with Microsoft automation
executive_summary: National Zakat Foundation (NZF) is the UK's only nonprofit focused on collecting and distributing zakat (faithful donations) to the Muslim community. Amid the UK's cost of living crisis, NZF is finding efficiencies and scaling to meet increased need.

title: DEPT brings Sinterklaas to life for holiday retailer using Azure AI Foundry
executive_summary: DEPT, a global marketing and tech services company, wanted to help its retail client bol amplify its holiday presence in a unique way, using AI.

title: Uniper ties a complex data estate together with Azure Arc
executive_summary: As an energy company, Uniper operates in a constantly changing environment. Its international presence requires navigating a sea of regulatory and compliance requirements that call for a plethora of IT environments. When the company implemented Microsoft Azure Arc, it gained the tool it needed to control the uncontrollable—a unified management solution it uses to manage all its resources from a single interface. That visibility doesn’t just deliver efficiency and ease of use. It heightens security, too.

title: Government of Nunavut comes back stronger after ransomware attack with Microsoft security solutions
executive_summary: When a ransomware attack shut down computer systems at the Government of Nunavut, Canada’s largest and northernmost territory, the IT team responded with a well-coordinated strategy. But its isolation and the challenges of a harsh climate complicated technology environments, and the team wanted a coordinated toolset. It worked with Microsoft’s elite cybersecurity DART team to rebuild its network and 5,500 devices while also rolling out security solutions—including Microsoft Sentinel and Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps—all in just weeks during an Arctic winter.

title: Agility and growth through Azure Kubernetes Service: Userlane creates IT architecture to match its startup mentality
executive_summary: “Learning by doing” was yesterday. Today is about “learning and doing at the same time.” Userlane helps users navigate their way around software by offering them click paths. So instead of learning though how-to videos or training events, users are able to work with a given piece of software from the very first click, understand how it works more quickly, and use it more effectively. In this way, the startup is also paving the way for greater equality and participation in the digitalized world. And this can be in any sector—anytime one of its customers needs help with software, Userlane is by their side. The technology behind this commitment is Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).

title: Air Astana slashes reporting time and increases productivity with Microsoft Teams and Power Apps
executive_summary: Air Astana is the flag carrier of Kazakhstan and operates both domestic and international services across 64 routes in Eurasia. The company strives for the highest safety and customer service standards for both external and internal processes. To obtain timely financial reports, the company leveraged the power of Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics together with Microsoft Power BI. Now, reports are generated within seconds instead of hours, boosting the team’s productivity and efficiency.
products: Azure, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

title: Jane Goodall Institute uses AI to unlock research potential with MediaValet and Azure
executive_summary: For more than six decades, Dr. Jane Goodall and her research team have studied chimpanzees. In 1977, she founded the Jane Goodall Institute (JGI) to help understand and protect chimps and work with local people to restore and protect the shared environment around them. Digitizing field research materials took a lot of manual effort and time. In December 2020, JGI started collaborating with Microsoft and Microsoft Partner Network member MediaValet to aggregate, connect, and preserve multiple data sets spanning six decades of research. Now, JGI uses AI and MediaValet to automatically tag assets with specific metadata and make assets widely available to researchers.

title: Egis finds the right match between patients and effective treatments using Azure
executive_summary: Serving patients in 60 countries worldwide, Hungarian pharmaceutical company Egis Pharmaceuticals PLC offers effective, affordable treatments for a broad range of conditions. Seeking to develop more personalized treatment plans for people suffering from rheumatoid arthritis, a life-long disease whose multiple forms require varying treatments, it turned to Azure. Accelerating both the modelling and documentation processes, Egis now benefits from faster and more accurate insights, delivering better treatments to patients for a healthier tomorrow.

title: Meilleurs résultats de recherche et efficacité accrue pour Igloo Software grâce à Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Igloo Software embraces Microsoft Azure Cognitive Search to provide the most relevant human resources information possible to a global network of employees.

title: VEGAS Creative Software gives video makers natural-sounding voiceover using Azure Cognitive Services
executive_summary: People make videos for a lot of reasons, and VEGAS Creative Software offers something for them all. From home video amateurs to TikTok influencers to Oscar-winning pros, customers use VEGAS software to bring their content to life. VEGAS Creative Software adopted Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services, including Translator and text to speech functionality, to augment its popular VEGAS Pro application with advanced voice capabilities. It completed development in days, and now its customers quickly and easily add natural-sounding voiceover to their videos. Cognitive Services provides more than 270 prebuilt neural voices across 110 languages and variants, plus a range of different speaking styles. Video makers now save money and create higher-impact content faster, and VEGAS Pro is generating more value and attracting new customers.
products: Azure, Azure AI Services, Azure AI Translator

title: Mainova AG masters the fast-paced, data-driven world of energy trading—with Azure Kubernetes Service
executive_summary: Energy is traded as a commodity on the stock exchange. Whenever the market price of electricity, gas, or coal changes, energy providers have to adjust the price they sell at to the customer accordingly. The more quickly these dynamic market changes are taken into account, the more profitable the energy provider’s business—especially since the prices are fixed once a deal is done. In a bid to become more flexible and independent, Mainova AG is anchoring its energy trading and risk management system in Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).
products: Azure

title: MongoDB delivers highly secure, one-way access to its database services with Azure Private Link
executive_summary: MongoDB Atlas tries to provide as much flexibility as possible to customers, ensuring they achieve the security posture that they want. Private Link provides private connectivity from a virtual network to services on the Azure platform, customer-owned services, or Microsoft partner services. By adding Private Link to the array of connection options that MongoDB Atlas offers, the company has increased the flexibility and extensibility it can offer customers while also reinforcing its security-centric operating principles.

title: UAE's first digital bank Zand to launch unique cloud banking platform with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Poised to become the UAE’s first fully independent digital bank, Zand is preparing to launch retail and corporate services. With its innovative cloud banking platform based on Microsoft Azure, the financial services mover and shaker is reimagining effective, secure banking, and laying the foundations for regional and global growth.

title: Self-managing health and wellness with IN.S.P.I.RE., Pegasus One, and Azure
executive_summary: IN.S.P.I.RE. Global LLC wanted to create a health and wellness self-management platform. After exploring various options for back-end and AI tools from other vendors, the IN.S.P.I.RE. team turned to Pegasus One for help. Because the business was in an early startup phase, the partnership was critical to its success. The most challenging aspect of the work was supporting the transformation of an idea into a working platform quickly and affordably. Microsoft Azure services formed the core of the design, Azure Cognitive Services provided user engagement capabilities, and Azure Security Center was employed for critical security. Together, IN.S.P.I.RE. and Pegasus One built and launched the Vertie Total Health solution.

title: Azure cloud-native review sets stage for future-ready Codeit architecture
executive_summary: Because of its impressive growth, Digital Taxonomy—builder of the cutting edge, AI-powered Codeit platform—required a Microsoft Azure cloud-native architecture review of their solution to achieve their goals. Codeit is a tool for tagging and categorising unstructured data and is used by some of the world’s leading companies. Colibri Digital was approached to undertake this review and provide advice, designs, and implementation of solutions to ensure Digital Taxonomy were optimally positioned to meet their targets during the next phase over the next five years.

title: Corporate social responsibility for retail: A new spending habit
executive_summary: The Country of Curaçao is tackling its economic losses from the loss of tourism due to the COVID-19 pandemic by adopting the Azure-backed CSR plug-in. The integration of this CSR plug-in enables customer-directed merchant donations from Curaçao’s Caribbean shopping portal – www.tropicshopping.com. The Ministry of Economic Development of Curaçao sees this democratization of philanthropy as a critical element of its strategy to support local communities across the Caribbean as a core solution to address declines in revenue from tourism.
customer: Curaçao Industrial and International Trade Development Company (Curinde)
products: Azure

title: Association of Kenya lnsurers (AKI) goes digital with DIAS and Azure
executive_summary: The insurance industry Kenya was facing many challenges. The high cost of manual, paper-based operations had eroded profitability; reporting and documenting an automobile claim often took 10 to 12 days (Source: IRA TCF survey); and around 25% of the claims were fraudulent (Source: Deloitte Insurance Outlook report–East Africa). The Association of Kenya Insurers (AKI) partnered with SwiftAnt to digitalize insurance certificates and claims processes. To address these issues, SwiftAnt implemented its InsureTech solution Digital Insurance Apps powered by SwiftAnt (DIAS). DIAS is driven by a Microsoft suite of Azure Machine Learning, Azure Cognitive Services, AI, and blockchain. Claims can now be filed in just six minutes.

title: Siemens Gamesa fuels business growth and cultivates a data-driven mindset with Microsoft Industry Solutions
executive_summary: Microsoft Industry Solutions guided Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy through a digital and cultural transformation that included upskilling its people, changing its culture, and becoming more self-sufficient in managing new, technology-based business processes. It was a far cry from the narrower move to the cloud that the manufacturer first envisioned—but one it readily adopted when Microsoft showed Siemens Gamesa how the bolder initiative could not just support scalability, but fuel genuine business growth.
products: Azure, Azure Internet of Things

title: Tetra Pak enhances its industry advantage and sustainability goals with Azure IoT
executive_summary: Since inventing a ground-breaking way to package milk nearly 70 years ago, Tetra Pak has become a global leader in food processing and packaging. In 2020, the company sold more than 183 billion packages—that means 183 billion cartons of fresh milk, juice, and other foods were enjoyed all over the world thanks to Tetra Pak’s iconic packaging.
products: Azure, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Functions, Azure IoT Edge, Azure IoT Hub, Azure SQL Database, Azure Internet of Things, Power BI

title: Fairfax County creates transparency, efficiency, accountability with Dynamics 365 ’VFOIA‘ Tracker
executive_summary: Public requests come in many forms. However, those requests falling under the various Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) laws of local, state, and federal government arrive with the mandate of being regulated and requiring an answer “as quickly and in the most transparent way possible,” according to Amanda Kastl, Countywide FOIA Officer at Fairfax County, Virginia.
products: Dynamics 365 Business Central, Dynamics 365 Customer Service

title: iMocha uses Microsoft Azure Kubernetes Service to auto-scale its skills assessments platform
executive_summary: iMocha is a software company based in Pune, Maharashtra, with customers worldwide. Founded in 2015, iMocha’s Skills Assessment Platform became a go-to service for many IT companies to conduct virtual assessments and interviews. With customers in the US, Europe, and India, the business continues to grow at a steady pace and experienced increased demand for its flagship offering during COVID-19, when the recruitment processes migrated to the digital medium.

title: Greek Ministry of Migration and Asylum streamlines migration process with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: With around 100,000 asylum applicants each year, Greece’s government established a new Ministry of Migration and Asylum in 2020. Its aim was to streamline administrative backlogs and speed up procedures for migrants and asylum seekers. However, its legacy, on-premises technology was curbing effective internal collaboration. The Ministry, in collaboration with the Ministry of Digital Governance, opted to switch to Microsoft 365 to address these challenges. Thanks to swift adoption, staff can access critical documents and collaborate securely from anywhere, clarifying workflows for everyone and accelerating the entire migration process.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive for Business

title: Spica International streamlines workforce management with Azure-based app
executive_summary: Headquartered in Slovenia, Spica International provides user-friendly software solutions for workforce management to customers around the world. When the company needed to replace its on-premises app offering with a more scalable, flexible, and secure cloud solution, Spica chose Microsoft Azure for a better way forward. Today, its Azure-hosted Time&Space app is paving the way for clients to better manage workforces of all sizes, while enabling Spica to onboard tenfold the number of new clients each month.

title: Tangiblee delivers immersive shopping experiences for retailers with virtual try-on software built on Microsoft Azure technology
executive_summary: Tangiblee, an immersive shopping commerce provider, is using Microsoft Azure to change the way people shop online with a virtual try-on solution. Using Tangiblee, consumers can experience fashion, furnishings, and more from anywhere. Through an innovative approach that uses 2D images, retailers can deploy Tangiblee faster and at lower cost than competitive solutions, increasing conversion rates and reducing costly product returns.
products: Azure, Azure AI Services, Azure Machine Learning

title: Qatar's public transportation company drives better employee engagement and improves operations with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Founded in 2004 by the Qatar Government, Mowasalat is the country’s end-to-end transport service provider. Its mission is to connect the entire country safely and sustainably, being one of the central driving forces of Qatar’s National Vision 2030. To better maintain and operate its growing fleet, the organization needed to digitize for efficiency. It used Azure and Microsoft 365 to create scalable solutions that connect drivers and supervisors. As a result, Mowasalat now has live data visibility that enables fast decision making and a better understanding of the challenges its employees face in the field.

title: Dow breaks down data silos and accelerates digital manufacturing with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: Dow, a global materials science leader, provides innovative and sustainable solutions to market segments such as packaging, infrastructure, mobility, and consumer applications. The company wanted to aggregate and integrate siloed data so that it could drive decision-making across all levels of its business. Dow turned to Microsoft and its tools, capabilities, and expertise to build a highly scalable data ingestion and analytics system in the cloud. As a result, Dow helped employees access data in real time, reduced manufacturing and operational costs, and improved workflows.
products: Azure, Windows 10, Microsoft Intune, Power BI

title: NHVR enhancing safety for all road users
executive_summary: The National Heavy Vehicle Regulator (NHVR) is Australia's independent regulator for heavy vehicles with a gross vehicle mass greater than 4.5 tonnes. The NHVR collaborates with states and territories, industries, partner agencies, and local governments to drive sustainable improvements to safety, productivity, and efficiency across the Australian heavy vehicle road transport sector. COMtrac's Azure-driven platform for case, evidence, and digital brief management has enhanced NHVR's investigations, delivering increased transparency and consistency. This has improved efficiency in investigations and led to improved road safety.

title: COMtrac and Azure help environmental agency meet goals
executive_summary: The Department of Agriculture, Water and Environment (AWE) administers the Environmental Protection and Biodiversity Conservation Act 1999. AWE enhances Australia’s agriculture, environment, heritage, and water resources, reduces impacts on the environment, and facilitates economic development. “The COMtrac system has provided my team/branch with a central point to store information and intelligence of all allegations on environmental compliance and has streamlined our assessment and investigation process,” said Garry Hall, Director of Investigations / Environmental Crime.
products: Azure

title: County council works smarter, saves conversion time and cost with Azure VMware Solution
executive_summary: Nottinghamshire County Council is one of the largest county councils in the United Kingdom. Delivering services to about 800,000 people in the county, the Council faced a mammoth task when it began work on a central mandate to move 750 applications and data to the cloud. Despite far more than the usual migration wrinkles—a global pandemic and an IT department restructuring—Nottinghamshire County Council prevailed. It turned to Microsoft Azure VMware Solution to simplify and expedite its migration (now underway), saving time, both licensing and platform costs—and headaches. With the pilot project completed remotely under difficult circumstances, Nottinghamshire County Council has created a blueprint for completing a complex project with minimal issues.

title: Avianca’s cloud journey takes wing with Microsoft Azure VMware Solution
executive_summary: Well-known South American airline Avianca enjoys a reputation built on more than a century of superb service, safety, and punctuality in the travel industry. Much of the company’s success rests on its capacity not only for meeting the regulatory demands and unpredictability of the air travel market, but for continual innovation. As it pursues its cloud migration, Avianca gracefully aligns older systems with newer technology that it depends on to continue to deliver excellence as a carrier. It simplifies that lift with Microsoft Azure VMware Solution.

title: How MSO successfully digitalized with Azure
executive_summary: Created in 2007, the sports timing system company, MSO, needed to change its IT system to a solution perfectly suited to the company's business activities. They selected the Azure cloud as it has a subscription model that allows them to adapt their solution and its costs to their varying needs. The company enlisted the services of the digital innovation agency Apptitude to implement this new system and ensure a smooth transition between the original legacy system and the Azure cloud before handing over the reins to the Silicom Group. Thanks to the expertise of Apptitude and the Silicom Group, MSO will be able to benefit from a flexible and easy-to-access system for its teams and customers while also controlling its costs.
products: Azure, Azure Cloud Services

title: Kitchen Brains makes smart kitchens even smarter with Azure IoT Central
executive_summary: For the past 53 years, Kitchen Brains has been developing process control systems to ensure food quality and consistency, improve employee safety, increase guest satisfaction scores, and reduce food, labor, and training costs. Kitchen Brains recently introduced KBconnect, a platform based on Microsoft Azure IoT Central that seamlessly connects a range of IoT devices for quick service restaurant (QSR) chains and food service original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) to provide real-time data used to optimize operations. By providing a robust IoT backbone and ultimate scalability, Azure IoT Central reduced Kitchen Brains development time by an estimated 80 percent—from 12 to 2 months—and provides the ingredients for continuous enhancement to meet the specific needs of each QSR and OEM customer.

title: Derbyshire Constabulary's new, digital way of working with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Derbyshire Constabulary is one of the UK’s 43 regional police forces. With a staff of 3,500, the force covers an area of over 1,000 square miles with a population of just under one million. Like many UK police forces, Derbyshire Constabulary has engaged with the National Enabling Programmes to introduce a secure digital platform with national standards that enable new ways of working and collaborating with the ultimate goal of serving its communities in better ways and protecting the public. Analytics and digital collaboration based on Microsoft Azure, Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Teams are key elements of this programme. While Derbyshire Constabulary was forward-thinking in its adoption of these technologies, its teams were taken aback by the full extent of the potential use cases that evolved as their use of the digital tools progressed. Their learnings offer useful insights for other forces around the UK.
products: Microsoft 365, Forms, Planner, Microsoft Teams, Power BI

title: Global automotive distributor Inchcape achieves data-driven digitalization with Azure
executive_summary: Inchcape, an independent automotive distributor, markets and supplies vehicles from leading auto brands to consumers across the globe. To adapt to market disruptions, Inchcape realized it needed to embrace data-driven digitalization to make better business decisions. Working with Microsoft Partner Tiger Analytics Inc, the company put its ‘Accelerate’ digital transformation strategy into action. The result was a modern analytical architecture built on Azure that enables Inchcape to get real-time business intelligence. It helps Inchcape leverage data for predictive analytics in customer engagement, pricing optimization, and demand forecasting.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Microsoft Purview

title: Senseye strengthens customer confidence with Azure
executive_summary: Senseye produces AI-powered predictive maintenance software for the industrial sector, accelerating digital transformation. The United Kingdom–based firm helps Fortune 500 customers in the manufacturing, metals and mining, and automotive industries proactively maintain machinery, streamline costs, reduce downtime, and increase equipment life. The cloud-based solution is a simple way to apply predictive maintenance to thousands of machines across multiple sites at scale.
products: Azure, Azure Cache for Redis, Azure Static Web Apps

title: Johnson Controls takes a smart approach to building technologies with Microsoft Teams and Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: In 1885, long before anyone talked about carbon footprints or climate change, Warren Johnson launched a company to explore new ways to harness and conserve precious energy resources. He was ahead of his time when he invented the world's first electric thermostat. In doing so, he also launched a tradition of innovation – a tradition that inspires thousands of Johnson Controls employees today and continues to drive its success. The story of Johnson Controls started with innovation – and the company continues to lead the industry in the creation and adoption of advanced building solutions.

title: Cargolux Airlines International takes to the skies with business-critical Azure infrastructure
executive_summary: The business was evolving, customers were moving forward, and Cargolux needed to adapt and transform if its IT was to continue supporting business growth and help Cargolux maintain a leadership position in the air cargo industry. Cargolux chose Microsoft Azure to keep the lift and shift as simple and straightforward as possible. Cargolux now has a much more agile and adaptive IT environment, with a high degree of automation and programmatic control over platform resources.

title: Luminous accelerates integration, innovation, and efficiency through RISE with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: When it comes to innovation, Luminous is by no means in the dark. The manufacturer has been producing a wide range of cutting-edge products in the power backup, battery, home electrical, and solar spaces for the past 30 years by sticking closely to its mission of creating customer delight through innovation and passion.
products: Azure, Azure IoT Hub, SAP on Azure, Microsoft Teams, Power BI

title: Co-op cuts 2 years off its modernization plan with Datometry Hyper-Q and Microsoft Azure Synapse
executive_summary: United Kingdom-based food retailer Co-op, a large consumer co-operative, transitioned in 2020 from its longtime on-premises datacenter to a virtualized data warehouse using Datometry Hyper-Q and Microsoft Azure Synapse. Datometry Hyper-Q emulated Co-op's legacy data warehouse processes in the cloud, enabling Co-op's applications to interoperate with Azure Synapse. Co-op's modernization plan was expected to take more than three years, but Datometry and Azure Synapse shaved two years off the timeline. Co-op has already seen impressive benefits in processing speed and multimillion-pound cost savings.
products: Azure, Azure Marketplace, Azure Synapse Analytics

title: United Tractors melakukan transformasi ke dunia digital dengan menggunakan Azure Center untuk solusi SAP
executive_summary: United Tractors (UT) adalah distributor alat berat terbesar di Indonesia dan pemain utama di sektor pertambangan, konstruksi, serta energi. Setelah mengadopsi penggunaan aplikasi ERP sejak dini, UT memutuskan untuk mendorong pertumbuhan perusahaan lebih jauh  menggunakan teknologi cloud. Dengan mengacu pada Industri 4.0, perusahaan memigrasikan sistem SAP S/4HANA on-premise mereka ke Azure. Langkah ini memungkinkan UT untuk  menghasilkan insight dari data, serta meningkatkan kemampuan perencanaan atas persediaan barang, menyediakan solusi pemeliharaan prediktif dari alat berat, dan memungkinkan adanya layanan mandiri karyawan. Dengan penggunaan Microsoft 365, produktivitas serta kolaborasi di seluruh lini organisasi mengalami peningkatan.

title: Thanks to scalable IT, Elindus can continuously respond to changes in the energy market
executive_summary: EFFIX deals with everything ICT related, including the infrastructure, security and networking. Having migrated to the public cloud in Microsoft Azure, Elindus can now continuously respond to growth and developments in the energy market. Energy prices are calculated accurately to the hour to reflect changes in the energy market. This is also crucial to Elindus’s success.
products: Azure Migrate

title: Virtual inspections enhance security of the energy supply: E.ON inspects power lines with drones and artificial intelligence based on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Walk, climb, inspect, note, repair: this is the classic procedure for power line maintenance. Much of this work is done manually and requires a huge amount of effort; therefore, it was sensible to see whether it can be made more efficient and safer using digital solutions. To minimize risks while fulfilling its responsibility to supply households in Germany with electricity, E.ON sends up drones to take photos of power poles and lines. These photos are uploaded to Microsoft Azure and transferred to Grid Vision®, an AI-supported inspection tool supplied by eSmart Systems, which evaluates the images—thus making the maintenance process more efficient and safer.

title: Changing end-user behavior at scale: New BrainStorm platform relies on Azure Functions
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: Orange County Superior Court Modernizes Case Management Systems Data to Better Serve Community
executive_summary: The Orange County Superior Court (OCSC) unified data from its disparate case management systems to improve operational efficiency and effectiveness and introduce better data-driven decision making. For more than one hundred years, OCSC managed its case files manually, accumulating more than 70 million critical documents that required physical storage and transport. In 2018, OCSC unified its three disparate case managements systems into a singular data warehouse. With this unified solution, OCSC can leverage data to deliver solutions and explore new opportunities on Microsoft Azure to be a pioneer in modernizing court operations.
products: Azure, Power BI

title: Health First uses Azure Synapse Analytics to create a data management solution, improving refresh speeds by 75 percent
executive_summary: Health First, a fully integrated delivery network in Florida, created a data management solution by joining its existing data warehouse architecture with Azure Synapse Analytics. While collecting information from more than 60 applications, Health First faced challenges in scaling its on-premises data warehouse. Additionally, the health network wanted to explore AI, predictive analytics, and other innovative technologies while maintaining a high level of security for patient data. It deployed Azure Synapse Analytics to scale up its data integration and storage capabilities in a secure cloud system. By creating this system, Health First lowered costs, improved workload processing times, and offered better data access for providers.

title: Varroc Engineering steers high productivity with SAP on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Varroc Engineering Limited (Varroc) is a tier-1 automotive component manufacturer. It supplies exterior lighting systems, powertrains, electrical and electronics body and chassis parts worldwide to passenger car and motorcycle segments. Founded in 1990, the company is headquartered at Aurangabad in Maharashtra, India. With over 30 manufacturing facilities in India, four in the European Union (EU), and one each in Vietnam and China, along with two engineering centers in India and one in the EU, Varroc has a prominent worldwide presence.

title: Banner Health uses Microsoft Surface tablets to improve the telehealth experience for patients and providers
executive_summary: Banner Health, one of the largest nonprofit health systems in the United States, deployed Microsoft Surface Pro tablets to significantly expand telehealth services in hospitals and clinics. With the healthcare industry facing challenges, from staffing and resource management to evolving patient needs, the organization wanted to create a flexible, mobile telehealth system to improve efficiency. Banner Health used Surface Pro tablets to help its staff treat more patients and elevate the patient experience. Using Microsoft technology, Banner Health improved both the convenience and efficiency of healthcare while using its staff and resources more productively.

title: Municipality of Alkmaar migrates to Azure, improving IT operations and citizen experiences
executive_summary: As one of the largest municipalities in the Netherlands, the Municipality of Alkmaar supports its 115,000 citizens with impactful innovations. It has steadily introduced digital applications to connect and engage citizens but recently faced difficulty scaling and meeting timelines while relying on outdated hardware. In only three months, the municipality completed an expansive migration to Microsoft Azure to drive business continuity and overall agility. It also improved system performance, scalability, and security, making its digital offerings faster and more available to citizens than ever before.
products: Azure, Azure Backup, Azure Digital Twins, Azure Maps, Azure Site Recovery, Azure Virtual Machines, Microsoft 365, Power BI, Windows 365

title: Phillips Corporation modernizes service operations and increases revenue using Dynamics 365 Field Service
executive_summary: Phillips Corporation sells and services industrial machinery used in metalworking and industrial operations. The company chose to modernize its legacy on-premises Microsoft Dynamics solution by upgrading to the latest cloud capability of Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Dynamics 365 Field Service. The upgrade provides the company with real-time insights into the performance of the business, which has helped Phillips make process improvements and helped increase operational efficiency and accuracy of field resources. In addition, the company has experienced growth in new business ventures while maintaining its strong reputation of white glove customer service.
products: Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Customer Insights - Data, Dynamics 365 Field Service, Dynamics 365 Sales

title: Samhall sparks a digital awakening with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: For 40 years, Samhall AB has been positively impacting Swedish society by helping people with disabilities find gainful employment, transforming nearly 250,000 lives in the process. Recently, the company has undergone a transformation of its own. Using Microsoft Power Platform, Samhall automated its manual credit check process, saving employees time and effort and setting an example that has sent ripples across the company. It has created a culture of innovation, boosting Samhall’s pursuit to help the most disadvantaged in society to improve their lives.

title: Peel Region enhances productivity, collaboration, and security using Microsoft 365 and Security solutions
executive_summary: Peel Region went through a digital transformation that increased productivity while facilitating collaboration using Microsoft solutions. Peel Region depends on its employees to provide services to more than 1.5 million residents. Therefore, it wanted to improve experiences for both employees and residents by modernizing its technology. Employees were already using Microsoft 365 for various tasks, and the region realized that Microsoft 365, in addition to other Microsoft solutions, can make it easier for employees to collaborate remotely. Peel Region’s IT team also enhanced security, preventing 10,000 emails with viruses or malicious URLs over the course of 12 months.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Entra, Microsoft Entra Verified ID, Microsoft Sentinel, Microsoft Defender, Power BI, SharePoint, Surface Pro

title: Windstream uses Azure OpenAI Service to empower employees and transform business outcomes
executive_summary: In the fast-paced and ever-evolving landscape of telecommunications, staying ahead of the technological curve is essential for companies seeking to maintain a competitive edge. One such company that has embraced cutting-edge technologies to transform its business is Windstream, a leading telecommunications service provider of advanced network communications and technology solutions for consumers, small businesses, enterprise organizations, and carrier partners across the US. Windstream offers bundled services, including broadband, security solutions, voice, and digital TV to consumers.
products: Azure AI and Machine Learning, Azure AI Search, Azure Operator Call Protection

title: How Albert Heijn is using Azure OpenAI to reduce food waste and help its customers eat healthy
executive_summary: As the Netherlands’ leading supermarket chain, Albert Heijn wants to help its customers to live a healthier lifestyle while minimizing its environmental footprint. To do that, the company is investing in artificial intelligence. With support from Microsoft, it has embarked on a series of initiatives aimed at leveraging AI – and Generative AI in particular – to do everything from customer personalization to demand forecast and food waste projects. These efforts have radically transformed operations at Albert Heijn – further strengthening its role in the Dutch retail sector and making it easier for its customers to change their lifestyle.

title: Miral steps up concierge services using Azure OpenAI Service to offer 24/7 guidance for fantasy escapes
executive_summary: Miral crafts immersive experiences—with some of the most sought-after leisure, entertainment, and tourism activities in Abu Dhabi. But with a vast array of options for every taste—from thrilling rides at Ferrari World Yas Island, Abu Dhabi, to diverse dining and entertainment at Yas Bay Waterfront—Miral’s visitors have a lot of questions about where to start. Who better to guide them than the Majd Al ambassador—an AI concierge available 24/7, powered by Azure OpenAI Service? Tell Majd AI your preferences, needs, and goals, and it will lay out the perfect plan for your visits.
